Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: あ！
English: Oh!

Japanese:
ご…　ごめんなさい！
僕　急いでて…　だから…
English: S-Sorry! I wasn’t looking where... So...

Japanese:
こっちこそ　ごめん
大丈夫かい？
English:
No, I should be the one apologizing, myself. 
Are you okay?

Japanese:
あ…　本！
ごめんなさい！
高価そうな本なのに…
English:
Oh no, your book! I’m so sorry!
It looks so expensive too...

Japanese:
構わないよ
それより　ほら立って
English:
Do not fret about it!
First of all, stand up.

Japanese:
そんなに高価そうな本
キズでもついてたら　僕…
そうだ！　僕はルカ　ルカ・ミルダ
English:
I’m sorry... if that expensive book got scratched I...
Oh, right, sorry... I’m Ruca, Ruca Milda.

Japanese:
もしなにかあれば　僕の家を
訪ねてきてください
街の人に聞けば　きっとわかるから
English:
If you need something, just go to my house.
You can ask anyone in town where it is.

Japanese:
ルカ…　ミルダ？
ここは　王都レグヌム
そう　じゃあ　キミなのかな…
English:
Ruca... Milda? And this is the Royal 
Capital of Regnum... Perhaps it is you...?

Japanese:
ボクは　魂の救済者
ふたつの魂を　救うために
この世界へ　やってきた
English:
I am the Saviour of Souls. I have come to 
this world to free two souls in need of salvation.

Japanese:
もしかすると
キミは　世界の真実を
知らなければならない人なのかもしれない
English:
Perhaps, you are the one who needs to be
enlightened about this world’s true nature.

Japanese:
たとえ　それが　その身を
引き裂かれるほどの
真実であったとしてもね
English:
Even if the knowledge might end up 
tearing your beliefs apart.

Japanese:
楽しみにしているよ
真実を知ってなお　ボクの手を借りることなく
キミの魂が　救済されることを…　じゃあ
English:
I am looking forward to meeting you again. In due time, 
your beliefs will be challenged and you will seek my 
help. Then, I shall grant your soul salvation... Farewell.

Japanese:
魂の…　救済？　世界の真実？
それって　どういう…
あッ　ちょっと待って！
English:
My soul’s salvation...?
The world’s true nature?
What exactly... Hey, wait!

Japanese:
…ヘンな人だな
まあいいか
それより　裏の森に急ごう！
English:
What a strange person... Well, whatever!
First of all, I should hurry to the forest.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
え～と　エディたちのいる裏の森は
南へ　まっすぐだな
English:
Uhh, pretty sure Eddie and the others
are at the forest south of here.

Japanese:
早く行かないと
また　なにいわれるか　わかんないぞ
English:
I have to hurry or else they might
do something else to me again.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
異能者捕縛適応法…
異能者って　本当にいるんだな
English:
The Deviant Reformation Act... 
So Deviants do exist.

Japanese:
あ…　こうしちゃいられない
道具屋の前の屋台で
ホットドッグ　買わなきゃ！
English:
Oh, I shouldn’t waste time just standing around!
I have to buy some hotdogs at the stand in front
of the item shop!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
でさ　これから
どこへ　向かうつもりなの？
English: So, where are we going to next?

Japanese:
ここから　ずっと南の聖都ナーオス
そこに　どんな重い病気や　ケガでも
瞬時に治せる人が　いるんだって
English:
The Holy City of Naohs is just south of here.
I heard that there’s someone there who
can heal any kind of wound instantly.

Japanese:
そんな力を持ってるなんて
きっと　転生者なんじゃないかな
English:
With that kinda power,
I bet they’re a Reincarnator.

Japanese:
え…………
「きっと」？　「なんじゃないかな」？
「必ず」じゃないの？
English:
You “bet”...? So you’re not 
really sure about it?

Japanese:
しょーがないでしょ
他に　手がかりないんだから
じゃ　こう言ってあげる
English:
Do you think we have a choice?
That’s the only lead we have!
Fine, then how about this?

Japanese: 「絶対　その人は転生者よ！」　…たぶん
English: They’re “definitely” a Reincarnator... maybe.

Japanese:
とにかく　他に手がかりないしさ
万が一　仲間だったら　儲け物じゃない
English:
Anyways we don’t have any more clues,
and if, by any chance, they’re an ally then 
that’s a win for us!

Japanese:
「たぶん」？　「万が一」？
え～と　どんどん
確率が減ってるっぽいんだけど…
English:
“Maybe?” “by any chance?”
It seems less likely the way 
you say it so carelessly...

Japanese:
あんた　細かいこと気にしすぎ！
ほら　さっさと行くわよ
目的地は　とにかく南！　いいわね
English:
You’re worrying about it too much!
Let’s hurry up and go. Our next 
stop is south! Got that?

Japanese:
ふふふ　でも　なんだか楽しいな
前世の縁で　こんなにカワイイ
女の子と　知り合えるなんて
English:
Uncertainty aside, I think it’s kind of
nice that I managed to meet such
a pretty girl because of my past life.

Japanese:
それに…　この僕に
仲間がいるかもしれないなんて…
English: And there may be others too...!

Japanese:
なんだ　ルカ
ずいぶん嬉しそうだな　しかし
なんかヘンなことでも　考えているのか？
English:
What is it, Ruca? You look quite happy.
Were you thinking of something weird?

Japanese:
な…　なんでもないよ　言われただろ
目的地は　とにかく南！
ほら　行こう
English:
It-It’s nothing! Illia said so earlier, right?
Our current goal is south! Let’s go.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
ねえ　イリアぁ…　これから僕たち
なにをされるんだろ　想像しただけで
ほら　怖くて体が震えるんだ
English:
I wonder what they’re going to do to us? 
Just the thought of it makes me shiver.

Japanese:
バカねぇ
じゃあ　想像しなきゃいいじゃない
English: Dumbass, just stop thinking about it.

Japanese:
そりゃあ　口で言うのは　簡単だけどさ
イリアは平気なの？
怖くないの？
English:
That’s easier said than done.
How about you, aren’t you scared?

Japanese:
まあ　無事じゃ済まないかもとは
常々　思ってるけど
ここまでの状況は　予想外だったかな～
English:
Well, I’ve had some close calls up till now,
but to think that it’d come to this...

Japanese:
僕　無事じゃいられないなんて
考えもしなかったよ…
English:
You know, I never thought I’d 
be in danger up till now...

Japanese:
ねえ　あんた
ひょっとして　後悔してる？
あたしに　ついて来たこと
English: Say, do you regret coming with me?

Japanese:
そ…　そんな！！
僕は　ただ…
English: N-No! I’m just--

Japanese:
あ～　やっぱりいいや！
今は　なにも言わないで　ちょうだい
あんたの答え　聞くの怖いし…
English:
Stop, just... forget it. Don’t say anymore.
I-I’m scared of knowing what you’re 
gonna say...

Japanese:
あんたの怯えた目を見ると　こんな旅に
巻き込んじゃった　自分が許せなくなりそう
…だから　そんな顔　禁止ね
English:
Every time I see you look so scared, I start to 
hate myself for getting you involved in this.
that’s why... Please don’t make that expression.

Japanese: イリア　泣くか？
English: Illia, you gonna cry?

Japanese:
うん　わかったよ　イリア
大丈夫だよ！
きっと逃げ出す　機会はあるよ！
English:
Okay, Illia. I’m sure it’ll be alright!
We’ll get the chance to escape eventually!

Japanese:
あったりまえじゃない！
絶対　諦めたりするもんですか
English:
Ain’t that obvious! As if 
we’ll give up so easily!

Japanese:
ああ当然さ！　見てやがれ！
え…　え～っと　ジャ…　ジャマするヤツは
ぶっ飛ばしてやるぜッ！！
English:
Of course! Just wait and see! Uhh... 
A-Anyone who tries to get in our 
way will be blown away!

Japanese:
ん～　…そこまでムリしてくれなくて
別に　いいんだけど…
English:
Oh it’s fine. You don’t have to 
force yourself to act that way...

Japanese:
ちぇ…　元気づけようとすると
これだもんな　トホホ…
English:
Boo... After I tried so 
hard to cheer you up...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: あ…　あのぅ…
English: U-Uhmm...

Japanese:
ああ？　なんだぁ？
やろうってのか！？
English:
What’s up with you? 
You pickin’ a fight?

Japanese:
し…　しまった…
僕の苦手なタイプだ…
English:
Oh no... I’m bad with 
these types of people.

Japanese:
なんだよ
自分から　話しかけといて
ダンマリか　ああ？
English:
Hey, I’m talkin’ to you.
You a quiet type or somethin’?

Japanese:
は…　はい
すみません…
English: Y-Yes. Sorry...

Japanese:
オレの名は　スパーダ
スパーダ・ベルフォルマだ
English:
The name’s Spada.
Spada Belforma.

Japanese:
あ　あの…　僕　ルカです
ルカ・ミルダ…　と申します
English:
M-My name is Ruca,
Ruca Milda... sir.

Japanese:
あん？　ミルダってのは　聞き覚えあるな
ひょっとして　おまえイイトコの
ボンボンじゃねェ？
English:
I know that name.
Ain’t you some rich kid?

Japanese:
ああ　はい　割と
あ…　でも！
…今は　持ち合わせが…
English:
Relatively, yes... oh but I don’t 
have any money right now....

Japanese:
バ～カ　金取ったりなんかしねーよ！
ああ～　ビビらせちまって
悪かったな
English:
Idiot, I don’t want your money!
Sorry for scaring you.

Japanese:
ナメられると　いけねェから
初対面の野郎には　最初にガツンと
いっとく主義なんだ　オレ
English:
I don’t want to be looked down upon,
so it’s kind of a habit of mine to make
a strong first impression.

Japanese: は…　はぁ…
English: Oh...

Japanese:
…んで　話は変わるけど
あのコ　結構カワイイじゃん
おまえの彼女か？
English:
On that note, ain’t that girl cute?
She your girlfriend?

Japanese:
彼女ぉ！？
ち…　違います！
ただの友だ…　知人です
English:
My g-girlfriend!? Absolutely not, sir!
She’s just my frie-- acquaintance.

Japanese:
なんだよ　ヨソヨソしい言い方だな
知人ってことは　おまえ　それ
他人ってことじゃん
English:
What’s with that formal way of speaking?
Ain’t an acquaintance just the same as a stranger?

Japanese:
あ…　でも　そんなには他人でもなくて
え～…　そのぅ　でも彼女が僕を
どう思ってるのか　わかんないし…
English:
Well... not really a stranger, but well...
uhh... I don’t even know what she thinks of me...

Japanese:
なんだよ　ハッキリしねーヤツだな
でも　まいっか
English:
Yo, you gotta speak 
louder man... Well, whatever.

Japanese:
…で　ここに連れて来られたってことは
おまえも異能者なわけ？
English: So, since you’re here and all, you a Deviant?

Japanese: そ…　そういうことになりますね
English: So it seems...

Japanese:
オレはよぉ　街でケンカしちまってな
更生施設にでも　入れられるのかと
思ったら　異能者狩りだってよ
English:
You see, I got in a fight in town.
And when I thought I’d got caught by
the juvie, turns out it was the Deviant Hunt.

Japanese:
ああ…
ちょうど　あなたが乱闘騒ぎで
捕まるところを　街で見かけましたよ
English:
Oh...  I’ve seen you before! You were the one 
who got captured in town for fighting earlier.

Japanese:
へ？　マジで？
へへッ！！
どうよ　オレ強かったろ？
English:
Really?! How was I?
I looked strong, right?

Japanese:
いや～　連行されてるところしか
見てませんから　なんとも…
English: Well... I just saw you being dragged off, so...

Japanese:
ああ！？　なんでオレがザコどもを
豪快に　ぶっ飛ばすカッコイイとこ
ちゃんと　見てねーんだよっ！！
English:
Huh? Why weren’t you properly watching me
beat the crap out of those weaklings!?

Japanese: はひぃッ！！　す…　すみません…！！
English: Ahhh...! S-Sorry!

Japanese: …おまえ　いちいち怯えすぎ
English: You get scared by the littlest things, don’t you?

Japanese: は…　はぁ　すみません…
English: Sorry...

Japanese:
で　いちいち謝りすぎ！
オレには　敬語もいらねェよ！
English:
And you apologize for the littlest things!
You don’t have’ta speak so formally, man!

Japanese:
す…　すみませ…
じゃなくって　う…　うん！
よろしく　スパーダ…　さん
English:
Sorr-- I mean, sure!
I’m in your care, Spada... Sir.

Japanese:
さん付けもいらねェよ！
まあ　よろしく頼むわ
English:
Ain’t no need to call me “Sir” either!
Anyways, nice to meet you too.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: チトセ
English: Chitose

Japanese: 初めまして　こんにちは
English: Nice to meet you!

Japanese:
こんにちは
僕　ルカっていいます
English:
Nice to meet you, too! 
I’m called Ruca.

Japanese:
私はチトセ…
チトセ・チャルマ　よろしくね
ねえ　あなたも　やっぱり転生者なの？
English:
I’m Chitose, Chitose Cxarma.
Let’s get along well! Say, are 
you also Reincarnators?

Japanese:
うん　そう
えーっと　あなたも転生者？
English:
Yes, yes we are. Uhmm....
Are you also a Reincarnator?

Japanese:
もちろんよ！
ここには　前世の記憶を持つ転生者が
集められてるって　聞いてるわ
English:
Of course! I came here because I heard that 
this place has been gathering Reincarnators 
who remember things about their past life.

Japanese:
私　ずっと昔から　探している人がいてね
その人も　きっとどこかで　転生しているはず
そして私と　必ず巡り会う運命なの
English:
I’ve been looking for someone, you see.
I’m sure he was also reincarnated, and 
I believe that fate will reunite us once again.

Japanese: 探している人…？
English: So you’re looking for someone?

Japanese:
そう　だから　教団に入信するつもりなの
だって　教団には転生者が
たくさんいるんでしょ？
English:
Yes, it’s why I came here to join the Church.
You know that the Church has a lot of 
Reincarnators, right?

Japanese:
教団にいれば　いずれ必ず
会えると思うから…　あの人に…
English:
I’m sure that I’ll be able to reunite 
with him if I stay with them.

Japanese:
そうなんだ　でも不安じゃない？
教団って　最近よくわからないこと
やってるみたいだし
English:
Ohhh... But aren’t you worried?
It seems that the Church has been
doing some shady stuff recently.

Japanese:
…でも　前世の記憶を　みんなで
共有するのって　きっと楽しいと思うわ
あなたにもあるんでしょ？　前世の記憶
English:
Hmm... Still, wouldn’t it be fun if we shared our 
past memories with each other? You remember
your past memories, right?

Japanese:
う…　うん
あんまり　詳しくは
憶えてないんだけどね
English: Yes...  I don’t remember much though.

Japanese:
ねえ　ルカくん
あなたと　一緒に来た女の子
お友達なの？
English:
Say, Ruca, that girl... The one you 
came in with, is she your friend?

Japanese: まあ　そんなカンジかな
English: Yeah... something like that.

Japanese:
どうしてかな　私
あの子のこと
あんまり好きになれない…　かも
English:
I wonder why... For some reason,
I get the feeling that we won’t get along.

Japanese:
どうして？　自分勝手だし　気が強いし
僕の話　あんまり聞いてくれないけど
いい子だよ！　…たぶん
English:
Why? She might be selfish, stubborn, and 
she never even listens to what I say, but 
I’m sure she’s a nice person... Probably.

Japanese:
でも彼女　あなたにふさわしくないと思うの…
あ！　ごめんなさい　今のは忘れて！
余計な　お世話よね？
English:
Still, I don’t think she suits you...
Ahh! I’m sorry! Please forget that.
That was rude of me.

Japanese:
早く出られると　いいわね…
あなたは　いい人だから　ここを出ても
どこかで　また会えると嬉しいな
English:
I hope you can escape soon. After 
all, you’re a kind person. If you do 
escape, I hope we meet again.

Japanese:
うん…　そうだね
また会えると　いいね
English: Yes, I hope we meet again.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
もう落ち着きなさいよ
ジタバタしたって　始まらないでしょ
English:
Calm down, no need to 
start kicking up a fuss.

Japanese:
そっれにしても　運命ってのはあるもんね
イナンナ　アスラ　デュランダルの
３人が　こうも見事にそろうなんてさ
English:
Still, to think that destiny does exist.
To think that Inanna, Asura, and Durandal
would be together in a place like this.

Japanese:
あたし　やっぱりまだ
全然　思い出せてないんだけど
他にも　いずれ出会える人がいるのかしら
English:
I still don’t really remember much though,
I wonder if we’ll meet more people like us?

Japanese:
ほら　ルカ　運命ってのが　あるんだから
他の誰かと　出会うまで
あたしたち　死にゃしないわよ…　たぶん
English:
You know, Ruca? Since destiny’s brought us
all here together, I’m sure we’ll meet even more
people before we die... probably.

Japanese:
せっかく　元気づけてくれてるんだから
最後に「たぶん」って付けるの
止めてよ…
English: I was sort of feeling better until that last part.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
地獄の激戦区「西の戦場」ねえ
…上等じゃねーか
English:
“Hell’s Battlefield: The Western
Front” huh...? Bring it on!

Japanese: スパーダは　恐くないの？
English: Aren’t you afraid?

Japanese:
オレの前世を　誰だと思ってるんだよ
聖剣デュランダルだぜ
戦場を恐いと思ったことは　一度もねえよ
English:
Who do you think I was in my past life?
I was the “Sacred Sword Durandal”, y’know.
Fear’s never crossed my mind on a battlefield.

Japanese:
そんなことより問題は　おめェらだよ
ふたりとも　イメージ違いすぎだろ
どこがアスラと　イナンナなんだよ
English:
Most importantly, the problem is with you two.
You two are totally different from Asura and Innana.

Japanese:
それ　言わないでよ
自分が　一番わかってるんだから…
English:
No need to tell me that. I’m the 
one who knows that the most.

Japanese:
ああ　そう言やァさ…………
あ…　あのよ？
あの言葉な…
English:
Oh right... By the way... About 
wh-what you told me before...

Japanese: ん？　なに？
English: Hm? What is it?

Japanese:
「良き友として　永らく共に」って
あの言葉　オレは…　いやデュランダルは
心底　嬉しかったんだぜ　あのとき…
English:
“Wherever or whenever, as a friend, we’d 
walk together for all eternity.” At that time, 
hearing that, made me-- no, Durandal happy.

Japanese:
…………
う　うん
English: Y-Yes.

Japanese:
へへッ　転生しちまったとはいえ
おまえに　ちゃんと伝えられて
良かったぜ！
English:
Haha, even if this is already our next life,
I’m glad that I was finally able to tell you.

Japanese:
心配すんな　ルカ
おまえは　オレが守ってやる　必ずだ
English: Don’t worry, Ruca, I promise I’ll protect you.

Japanese: うん　ありがと
English: Thank you...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: さあ　ここからは戦場ね
English: From here on out, we’ll be on the battlefield.

Japanese:
美味いモノはなさそうだな　しかし
つまらなそうな場所だ
English:
Doesn’t seem like there is good 
food here. What a boring place.

Japanese:
僕　戦争なんてイヤだよ
なんで　僕が戦争なんか…
English: I don’t like war. Why do I have to go to--

Japanese:
おい　ビシッとしろォ！
さっきは　チトセ相手に
カッコつけてたじゃねェか
English:
Hey, man up! Weren’t you cool in 
front of Chitose earlier?

Japanese:
それはそれ　これはこれだよ
だって…　僕だって　女の子の前じゃ
少しは　いいカッコしたいもの
English:
That has nothing to do with this.
I just wanted to act cool in front
of her.

Japanese:
気持ちはわかるけどよ
ま…　とにかく自信持てよ
おまえは　あのアスラなんだからよ
English:
I know what you feel, but you gotta have
more confidence in yourself, man.
After all, you were Asura.

Japanese:
魔物相手に　立派に戦ってたんだろ？
おめェは　強ェえんだよッ！
せめて　そう思い込め！
English:
He’s a brave warrior who fought hoards of
monsters, right? You’re strong!
At least believe in yourself!

Japanese:
そ…　そうかな…　うん
そうだよね
僕はアスラ…　大丈夫大丈夫…
English:
Is th-that so...? Y-You’re right!
I’m Asura... I’ll be fine...

Japanese:
いざとなりゃ　おめェはオレが守る
忘れたか？　オレは何度も
おまえの窮地を　救ったろ？
English:
I’ll be here to save you if something happens.
Just like always.

Japanese:
ありがとう　スパーダ
…よし　僕　頑張るよ！
さあ　行こう！
English:
Thanks, Spada...
I’ll try my best!
Let’s go!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
…で　これから　どうするよ？
異能者捕縛適応法で　捕まった以上
家には　帰れないしな
English:
So what next? We can’t go back home
unless we risk getting caught by the 
Deviant Reformation Act.

Japanese:
その上　軍の脱走者だもんね
父さんと母さんには
迷惑かけられないし…
English:
And on top of that, we’re deserters.
I can’t go back, I’ll just end up
bothering my mom and dad...

Japanese:
じゃあ　当初の予定通り
聖都ナーオスに　向かいましょうよ
他に手がかりもないしさ
English:
Then how about we head to Naohs
like how we originally planned? 
It’s not like we have anywhere else to go.

Japanese:
ああ　ナーオスには
転生者がいるって　話らしいな
ここから　どういけばいいんだ？
English:
Oh... I heard there’s a Reincarnator in Naohs.
How are we going to get there though?

Japanese:
ここから南東の
峠を越えた先だと　思うけど…
English: I think it’s just past the pass in the southeast.

Japanese:
あらあら　さすがルカさんねぇ～
物知りで　いらっしゃること
English:
Oh my, oh my, as expected of Sir Ruca!
Mr. Walking Dictionary right here!

Japanese: イリア　いい加減にしろよ
English: Illia, cut it out.

Japanese:
…フーンだ
いーわよ　もう水に流したげる
English: Hmph! Fine, I’ll forgive you.

Japanese:
ルカ
イリアの優しさに感謝しろ　しかし
English:
Ruca, you better thank Illia
for her kindness!

Japanese: あ…　ありがとう
English: Th-thank you.

Japanese:
じゃ　ルカ　スパーダ
行きましょ
English: Let’s go, Ruca, Spada.
Sure...

Japanese:
ずっと憧れていたアスラは　僕だった
前世からの仲間にも　出会えた
でも　いいことばかりじゃない
English:
It turns out that I was Asura, someone I look 
up to. I also met allies from my past life. But 
everything’s not really sunshine and rainbows.

Japanese:
前世での敵は　今でも僕を恨んでるし
前世の記憶や　異能の力は　なんだか
悪いことみたいな　扱いになってるし…
English:
My enemies from my past life still hate me, 
and it seems that these past memories 
and powers are getting harder to handle...

Japanese:
こんなことになるなんて…　ハァ…
やっぱり　家に帰りたいかも…
English:
To think it would end up like this...
I just want to go home.

Japanese:
ルカッ！！　ボ～ッとしてないで
ほら　早くナーオスに行って
なんか美味しいもんでも　食べましょ！
English:
Ruca, stop daydreaming and let’s 
go get something to eat in Naohs!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
へえ
ここがレグヌム峠か…
English: Oh... So this is Regnum pass...

Japanese:
うん　ここを越えて
少し行くと　聖都ナーオスのはず
English:
Yeah, Naohs is just
a ways away after this.

Japanese:
ほら　ムダ話してないで
さっさと越えちゃいましょ
English:
Stop talking about pointless stuff.
Let’s hurry up and cross this.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
むむむ…　そろそろ
腹が減って　動けないんだな　しかし
English:
Coda can no longer move.
Hungry though...

Japanese:
ここからナーオスへは
確か南東へ　少し
English: I believe Naohs is southeast from here.

Japanese:
それじゃ
あとひと頑張りしますか
English: Guess we’ll just have to hang on a bit longer.

Japanese:
ほら　コーダ
南東へ　少しだってよ
さっさと　行こうぜ
English:
Come on, Coda, we’re almost there.
Let’s go.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: へぇ　ここがナーオスかぁ
English: So this is Naohs...

Japanese:
緑が豊かで　ノンビリしてる感じ
キレイなところねぇ
English:
What a beautiful place,
the greenery is so relaxing.

Japanese:
んで　イリア
この町の　どこに転生者がいるんだ？
English: So, Illia. Where’s the Reincarnator here?

Japanese:
さあ？
知らないけど？
English: Dunno.

Japanese:
ええ！？
知らないの！？
English: You don’t!?

Japanese:
ウワサを　聞いただけだもん
聖都ナーオスには
奇跡を起こす「聖女」がいるって
English:
I just heard about them from rumors.
That there’s a “saintess” who can
perform miracles in Naohs.

Japanese:
おいおい　ただのウワサで
ここまで　連れて来たってのか？
…軍を脱走してまで？
English:
So you brought us all the way here
just because of a rumor? We deserted 
the army just for this?

Japanese:
それに　奇跡を起こす「聖女」ってだけじゃ
転生者か　どうか
わかんないじゃないか…
English:
And we’re not even sure if this
“saintess” is actually a Reincarnator...

Japanese:
あ～　もう！　チクチクうるっさいわね！
ほらルカ　あんたが　なんか方法
考えなさいよ！　頭いいんでしょ！？
English:
Blah, blah, blah, blah, blah, shut up!
Ruca, you’re the smartass here,
think up a plan or something.

Japanese:
ええ！　そんなムチャな…　え～と…
他の街で　ウワサになるほど有名な人なら
みんなに聞けば　わかるんじゃない？
English:
Eh... That’s kind of... ugh. Well, if this person is 
famous around here, then wouldn’t everyone here 
know about them?

Japanese:
お　さっすが　お利口さん！
さくっと出てきた　プランにしては
悪くねえな
English:
Oh! As expected of our little sweetie Ruca!
Doesn’t seem like a bad plan!

Japanese:
んじゃ　ちょっと
町をブラついてみよーぜ！
English: Let’s go check out the city then.

Japanese: 賛成なんだな　しかし！
English: AGREED!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: お坊ちゃまねぇ
English: Young Master, huh?

Japanese: お坊ちゃまかぁ
English: Young Master...

Japanese:
うっせェな！
おまえらまで　その呼び方するの
止めろよ
English:
Shut up! Don’t you two think
it’s time to stop calling me that?

Japanese:
それにしても　久しぶりの再会って
感じだったね
あんたと　ハルトマンさん
English:
Still, your meeting with
Hartman felt like a reunion.

Japanese:
ああ…　四年ぐらい前に
じいは　引退したんだよ
もう歳だったからな
English:
Yeah, gramps retired due to 
old age four years ago.

Japanese:
なんたって　先々代の頃に
馬の世話係になって以来
ず～っと　オレん家にいたらしいしな
English:
He worked for my family as a stablehand
two generations ago. That said, he’s been
in the household for a looong time.

Japanese:
そんなに昔から　家にいてくれた人なら
あんた　立派になってあげないと
不義理っぽくない？
English:
Aren’t you being ungrateful, not letting him 
see you grow into a fine young man?
After that many years of servitude?

Japanese:
さっきの様子じゃ
親身になって　面倒みて
もらってたんでしょ？
English:
He was so considerate of our circumstances 
earlier that he let us stay in his home, y’know.

Japanese:
はッ…　そりゃそうさ
なにせ　オレを構ってくれたのは
ウチじゃあ　ハルトマンだけだからな
English:
Well... yeah... After all, Hartman was the only 
one who looked out for me back at my place.

Japanese:
なんたって　兄弟が多いから
領地も財産も継げない　末っ子の
オレなんて　放ったらかしなわけよ
English:
Being the youngest with a lot of brothers
and not much to my name, it just makes
sense that I was neglected.

Japanese:
ベルフォルマ家って
立派な騎士の家のはずなのに？
なにも　継げないなんて…
English:
So you won’t inherit anything?
Even though the Belforma is a
splendid household?

Japanese:
オレを含めて　７人兄弟だからな
末っ子のオレに　回ってくるもんなんて
な～んにも　ありゃしねえのさ
English:
Including me, there’s seven of us, y’see.
I’m pretty much a nobody there.

Japanese: はあ　なるほど…
English: Ohh...

Japanese:
じいだけが　立派な騎士にと
オレに　手をかけてくれたんだ
でもな　ある日突然　じいは倒れてよ
English:
Gramps was the only one who acknowledged me. 
He was the one who trained me so that I can be 
a fine knight. But one day... he suddenly collapsed.

Japanese:
それっきり　屋敷に戻って来なかったのさ
じいのいない家に帰っても
オレには意味ねえからな
English:
After that, he never returned to the mansion. Going 
back to a home without him... what’s the point?

Japanese:
だから　家を出たの？
ふ～ん…　なるほどね
English: So that’s why you left your home...

Japanese:
ハルトマンさんと
また　会えてよかったね
English: It’s good that you got to meet Mr. Hartman again!

Japanese:
…ナーオスで　暮らしてるなんて
全然　知らなかったよ
English: I had no idea that he was living in Naohs at all.

Japanese:
ハルトマンさん
今は　すごく元気そうね
English: Well, he seems pretty lively right now.

Japanese:
ああ…　もしかすっと　前に倒れたのは
オレが　余計な苦労かけさせてたのが
原因だったのかなぁ…
English:
I wonder if... I wonder if he 
collapsed because of me...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: アスラ
English: Asura

Japanese:
聖女が　連行されたナーオス基地は
南東にある　憂いの森を越えた先か
English:
We’ll be heading southeast past the Forest
of Sorrow towards the Naohs Base. That’s 
where the Saintess is.

Japanese: はぁ………
English: Sigh...

Japanese:
どうした　ルカ？
元気ないんだな　しかし
English: What’s wrong, Ruca?

Japanese:
ハルトマンさんと　スパーダ見てたらさ
父さんと母さんが　僕のこと
心配してるんじゃないかと　思ってね
English:
Seeing Hartman and Spada reunite made
me wonder whether my mom and dad are
worrying about me...

Japanese:
そりゃ　してんじゃない？
あんた　家出同然だったし
English: Of course they are. You ran away from home, after all.

Japanese:
そうだよね…
イリアは　家に
帰りたいとか　思わないの？
English:
I suppose I did... How about you, Illia?
Have you ever wanted to go back home?

Japanese:
思わない
あたしは　決めたの
帰らないって
English: Never. I’ve told myself that I’m never going back.

Japanese:
前世の記憶で　イヤな目に遭う
人生なんて　もうまっぴら！
「あたし」は「あたし」の人生を歩くの
English:
I won’t let anyone suffer coz of my past life!
I’m gonna walk “my” own path, myself!

Japanese:
他人に利用されるのも　捕まるのもイヤ
創世力だっけ？　マティウスより先に
それを手に入れるまで　絶対に諦めない
English:
I won’t let anyone use me either! The 
“Genesis?” Pah! I’ll never give up. 
We’ll get it before Mattheus does!

Japanese:
で…　でも　軍や教団相手に
ずっと　逃げ回るんだよ？
僕らじゃ　手に負えないと思わない？
English:
B-But we’ll end up getting chased by both 
the Army and the Church, you know?
Can we even handle it?

Japanese:
前世のことだって
出会うのは　敵ばっかりだし…
English:
And those we met that remembered our past lives
were all enemies...

Japanese:
じゃあ　あんたは家に帰ればいいじゃない
あたしは…　もう帰るに帰れない…
帰りたくても　帰れないんだから…
English:
Then why don’t you go home?
I... can’t go back... 
even if I want to, I-I... can’t.

Japanese:
あたし　あんたを巻き込んじゃったね
ごめんね　ホントごめん…
迷惑かけるつもりはなかった…　んだけど…
English:
Sorry, I’m really sorry I got you involved in this...
I didn’t intend to... trouble you like this...

Japanese:
なあ　ルカ
おまえの言う通りだよ
オレたちは　軍や教団を相手にしてんだぜ？
English:
It’s just as you said, Ruca. We’ll be 
running from the Army and the Church.

Japanese:
家に帰ったところで　どの道すぐにお縄さ
どうせ捕まるんだ　だったらよ
もうちょい　頑張ってみねェ？
English:
You’ll get captured even when you try to go
home anyway, so why don’t you just hang 
on a little longer?

Japanese:
やっぱり　帰ったら
捕まっちゃうのかな？
English:
So I’ll just end up being caught
even if I do go back, huh...?

Japanese:
まッ　間違いないね
身元はバレてんだ
実家は確実に　監視されてるだろうな
English:
No doubt about it. They know who we are,
after all. They must be monitoring our 
homes at this very moment.

Japanese:
スパーダの　お家の人は
心配してないの？
English: You’re not worried about your family, Spada?

Japanese:
いい厄介払いができたって　喜んでるさ
それに元々　親父や兄貴たちとは
折り合いが　悪いしな
English:
Nah, I bet they’re happy they finally got rid of 
me. Besides, I don’t really get along with my 
dad and my siblings.

Japanese:
でもルカ　帰りたいなら
おまえは　帰っていいんだぜ？
イリアのことは　オレにまかせとけ
English:
But y’know, Ruca? You’re fine to go
home if you want. Leave Illia to me.

Japanese:
ねえ　スパーダ…　「帰りたくない」って
だけじゃないでしょ？
どうして　僕たちと一緒に来てくれたの？
English:
It’s not just that though, right...?
Why did you come with us?

Japanese:
ハルトマンに　言ったろ
おまえたちふたりは
オレの友人だって
English: Like I said, “You two are my friends.”

Japanese:
ダチと　ツルむのに理由なんかねえよ
おまえたちと　一緒に行くのが
正しいと思ったから　来ただけさ
English:
I don’t need a reason. I just came with
you guys because I believe it’s the right
thing to do.

Japanese:
「正しき道を　正しく歩め」ってな
これは　ウチの士道訓五箇条だけどよ
English:
“Righteously tread the Path of Justice”
is one of my five codes of knighthood.

Japanese:
………
ごめんね　イリア
English: I’m sorry, Illia...

Japanese:
…ううん　あたしのほうこそ
…………
あんたも　元気でね
English: No, I’m sorry... Take care of yourself.

Japanese:
ち…　違うよ！
帰らないよ！
僕も　ふたりと一緒に行く
English:
Th-That’s wrong! I’m not gonna go back! 
I’ll go with you two.

Japanese:
…ホント？
ホントに　いいの？
English: Really...? Are you really okay with this?

Japanese:
僕　ただなんとなく　嬉しいってだけで
イリアとスパーダに
「ついて」きてた
English:
I was just happy that I was able to 
“tag along” with you two.

Japanese:
自分が　アスラだったこと
自分に　仲間ができたこと
ただ　それが嬉しくて　それだけで…
English:
That I was Asura, that I was able to 
make friends, the thought of it just 
makes me happy. But...

Japanese:
でも　これからは違う
僕は　ついていくんじゃない
ふたりと「一緒に行く」んだ
English:
From now on it’s different! I’m not 
just “tagging along” with you, I’m 
gonna walk “alongside” you guys.

Japanese:
…………バカね…
なに今ごろ　言ってるのよ
English: You idiot... What the hell are you saying?

Japanese:
お利口さんのクセに
あんたって　ホント　バカなヤツ
English:
You’re just a... goody two-shoes!
You’re... You’re really an idiot!

Japanese:
あんたなんて　おたんこルカよ
このおたんこルカ！
English:
You’re nothing but a dummy!
Ruca, you dummy!

Japanese:
バカ…？　おたんこ…　ルカ？
そういうの　言われ慣れてないから
ちょっと　ショックなんだけど
English:
Idiot...? Dummy...? I haven’t been called 
those before so I’m a bit shocked.

Japanese:
でも　もうバカでいいよ
こんな簡単なこと　気がつくのに
時間かけて　イリアまで悲しませて…
English:
But that’s fine. After all, I worried about something 
so simple and I even made you sad...

Japanese:
だから…　イリア
もう泣かないで？
English: That’s why... Illia, please don’t cry anymore?

Japanese:
泣いてなんかない！
ちょっと…　アレよ　目にゴミが
入っただけだもん！
English:
I’m not crying! These are just, y’know... 
sweat in my eyes, that’s all!

Japanese:
バカ　バカ！
このおたんこルカ！
さっさと行くわよ　おたんこルカ！
English: Idiot, idiot! You dummy! C’mon, let’s go, you dummy!

Japanese:
オッケー　オッケー
もう　なにも問題ねェな
English: Right then! All good here?

Japanese:
うん　心配かけてごめんね
スパーダ
English: Yup, sorry I made you worry, Spada.

Japanese:
いいってことよ
だいたいな　こうやって
同じ記憶を持つ３人が　集まったんだ
English:
It’s fine. Besides, this means that we’ve
managed to gather three people that we
share memories with.

Japanese:
オレは　きっと　これには
なにか　意味があると思ってるんだ
English:
You know, I think there’s some 
kind of meaning to this.

Japanese: ……なにか　意味が…？
English: Some kind of meaning...?

Japanese:
なぜ俺が　この世界に
今　このとき　この場所に！
なぜ　産まれ出でたのか！？
English:
Why am I in this world! Right now, 
at this time, at this place!
Why was I born!?

Japanese:
その意味は　なんなのか！？
その答えが！
まさしく…
English:
And what meaning does that reason hold?
The answer to that... is in...

Japanese:
それにな　こうなった以上は
最後まで　筋を通してもらうぜ
「一緒に来る」んだろ　おまえ？
English:
After this, you better see this through to the end. 
You’ll “walk alongside us”, right?

Japanese:
また途中で　ヘタれヌカしたときにゃあ
ただじゃ　済まさねぇ…
わかったな　ルカ？
English:
I won’t let you wuss out of this journey halfway.
You got that, Ruca?

Japanese:
………
わ…　わかったよッ！
English: O-Of course I do!

Japanese:
へへ　んじゃ　行こーぜ
まずは　南東だったな
English:
Now let’s go!
To the southeast.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
なななんだ　ここは　しかし！
ヘソがピリピリするんだな　しかし！
これは危険が　危ない証拠なんだな　しかし！
English:
Wh-wh-what is this p-p-place?!
My belly button is tingling though,
that means this place is dangerous!

Japanese:
あ…　憂いの森って…
もしかして　あの憂いの森か！
English:
When he said “Forest of Sorrow”...
could it be that “Forest of Sorrow?”

Japanese:
なによ　それ　同じこと
２回言っただけじゃない
English: What’s up with you? You just said it twice.

Japanese:
いや…　実は　ここで昔
兄貴の部隊が
全滅しかけたことがあるんだ
English:
No... To be honest, my brother’s unit
got annihilated here.

Japanese: ええ　全滅！？
English: Annihilated!?

Japanese:
この霧のせいで　慣れたヤツでも迷うんで
行方不明者が　多く出ることで
有名な場所なんだが…
English:
This place is famous for the number of people that
disappeared within it. Even the most experienced
person can get lost through this fog.

Japanese:
その上　ここだけ生態系が違うらしくて
普通に　戦ってちゃあ
勝てない敵も　出るらしい
English:
On top of that, I heard that the ecosystem and
monsters that come out here are alien to this world.

Japanese:
でも　ナーオス基地への道は
他にないんだよね
English:
But, there’s no alternate route 
we could take to the base...

Japanese:
…………行きましょう
きっと　３人ならなんとかなるわよ
English: Let’s get movin’. I’m sure we three can make do.

Japanese:
それに　軍が
全滅しかけるような場所だもの
追っ手だって　そうそう来ないだろうし
English:
And, even the Army can get annihilated in this 
place. They prolly won’t think about going 
anywhere near here.

Japanese:
だな
オレたちゃ　前進あるのみ！
さあ　行こうぜ　ルカ
English:
Damn right. We can only advance at this point.
Now, let’s go, Ruca.

Japanese:
…………
こういう展開は　予想してなかったなぁ
やっぱり　決心ニブるかも…　うう…
English:
Sigh... I did not expect this development.
My determination’s weakening...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: なによ　これ…
English: What the hell...

Japanese: 雰囲気が変わった…？
English: The atmosphere changed...?

Japanese:
これが　この森のカラクリってワケか
ルカ　気を抜かずに行こうぜ
English:
So this is the forest’s mechanism...
Try and keep close to us, Ruca.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
ナーオス基地は　ここから
南東なんだよね？
English:
Naohs’ Base is southeast 
from here, right?

Japanese:
道案内は　キミたちにまかせるよ
ここのことは　まだ不慣れでね
English:
I am still unfamiliar with this place, so I will
leave it to you guys to lead the way.

Japanese:
食うことなら
コーダにまかせるんだな　しかし
English: If it’s food you’re after though, then leave it to Coda!

Japanese:
じゃ…　じゃあ
女の扱いのことなら
このオレにま…
English: And you can leave the wom--

Japanese:
くだらないこと　言ってないで
さっさと行くわよ
English:
Stop saying dumb
things and let’s just go.

Japanese: せめて　最後まで言わせろよ…
English: At least let me finish what I was gonna say...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
ここがナーオス基地かぁ
なんだか
転生者研究所に　似てるよね？
English:
So this is the Naohs Base. It kinda
feels like the Reincarnator
Research Lab, right?

Japanese: 転生者…　研究所？
English: Reincarnator... Research Lab?

Japanese:
うん
僕たちみたいな　転生者を集める
王都軍の施設なんだ
English:
It’s a military institution that 
catches Reincarnators like us.

Japanese: ふ～ん　そう…
English: I see...

Japanese:
…ってことはよ
ここにも　転生者が捕まってる
可能性　高いよな
English:
In other words, there’s also a high chance of
encountering captured Reincarnators here...

Japanese:
そして　転生者を兵士に仕立てて
戦争させてるのよね
ホント　許せない…
English:
And these said Reincarnators are being trained
to become tools of war... I’ll never forgive this!

Japanese:
聖女アンジュを探して
早く　助け出そう！
English:
Let’s hurry and go look for the Saintess
and get her out of here!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ふぅ…
やっと出られたね
English: Phew... We finally managed to get out...

Japanese:
大丈夫　アンジュ
少し顔色　悪いみたいだけど
English:
Are you aight, Ange?
You look pale.

Japanese:
平気よ…
ずっと体を　動かしてなかったから
急に体を動かすと　ツラいみたい
English:
I am fine. I have just been unable to move for 
quite some time, so suddenly being made to run
has taken its toll on me.

Japanese:
じゃあ　ハルトマンの家で
休ませなきゃな
悪いけどナーオスまで　辛抱してくれよ
English:
Then, let’s take a rest at Hartman’s place. 
I’m sorry, so please hang on until then.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
…そういえば　アンジュって
この町じゃ　有名人だよね？
人に見られて平気？
English:
Now that you mention it, isn’t 
Ange famous here? Is it fine if 
we let people see her?

Japanese:
う～ん　そうね…
平気じゃないかも
English:
Good question...
It probably is not.

Japanese:
んじゃ
さっさとハルトマンの家に
かくまってもらいに　行こうぜ
English: Then, let’s hurry and hide at Gramp’s place.

Japanese:
そうと決まれば
早く　行きましょ…　ね？
お坊ちゃま！
English:
Now that it’s decided, let’s hurry up 
and go, Young Master!

Japanese:
……お坊ちゃま？
それは　どういう…
English:
Young Master...?
Exactly what are you--

Japanese:
な…　なんでもねえって！
…憶えてろよ　イリア！
English: Nothing...! I’ll remember this, Illia!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: ハルトマン
English: Hartman

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
…では　自己紹介も終わったところで
リカルドさん　私を誰の元に
連れて行こうとなさったのですか？
English:
Now that we have finished our self-introductions...
Sir Ricardo, who asked you to find me?

Japanese:
そうそう　それよ！
まずは　その話ね
English: Ahh! That’s right! Let’s talk about that first!

Japanese:
それを他人に漏らすのは　守秘義務違反
…と　言いたいところだが
まあ　いいだろう
English:
It would be an abuse of confidentiality
if I reveal my client’s information...
Is what I’d like to say... but so be it.

Japanese:
北の国テノスの貴族
「アルベール・グランディオーザ」という
男の元だ　知っているか？
English:
The person who asked me to find you is
a noble named Albert Grandiosa from the
Northern kingdom of Tenos. Do you know him?

Japanese:
アルベールさん…
いいえ　面識どころか
名前も　存じませんね
English:
Albert... No, even if he were an acquaintance,
the name does not ring a bell.

Japanese:
もしかして　お貴族さまに
密かに　見初められたんじゃない？
アンジュ　美人だもんね～
English:
Maybe he’s a noble that secretly fell in 
love with you? After all, you’re really pretty～

Japanese:
まさか…
私　テノスには　行ったこともないし
知り合いだっていないのよ
English:
Surely not... I have never been to Tenos before
nor do I know someone from that place...

Japanese:
…………
美人ってところは
否定しねえんだな…
English: Well, I won’t deny Ange being pretty though...

Japanese:
私の身柄を　確保したい理由は
一体なんなのかしら
English: I wonder why he wanted to have me rescued?

Japanese: 理由は転生者だから…　らしい
English:
Apparently, it’s because
you’re a Reincarnator.

Japanese:
じゃ…　じゃあ　なに！？
そのアルベールってのも
転生者を　探してるわけ？
English:
Th-Then what!? Is that Albert-guy
also looking for Reincarnators?

Japanese: マティウスと同じだ…
English: Just like Mattheus...

Japanese:
マティウス？
そいつは　何者なんだよ
English: Mattheus? Who is this “Mattheus” anyway?

Japanese:
教団の大主天らしいんだけど
そいつに　イリアの故郷が
襲われたんだ
English:
Apparently, they’re the head of the Church 
which attacked Illia’s hometown.

Japanese:
やっぱり　アルベールってヤツも
マティウスと同じで　創世力を
手に入れようとしてるのかな…
English:
Maybe Albert is also looking for the Genesis...?
Just like Mattheus is.

Japanese:
なるほど…　確かに
アルベール・グランディオーザの使者は
俺が転生者だとわかると　質問してきたな
English:
I see... I remember him asking me the same thing
when he learned that I was also a Reincarnator...

Japanese:
創世力を知ってるか？　…と
創世力とは　なんなのだ？
English:
Something along the lines of, “Do you know about
the Genesis?” What is this “Genesis” anyway?

Japanese:
ん～…　なんとなく
聞き覚えがある気は　すんだけどよォ
うまく思い出せねえ…
English: Hm... it sounds familiar but I can’t seem to recall...

Japanese:
僕も　確かに知っているんだ
でも…　よく思い出せない…
なんだか　気持ち悪いや
English:
I’m sure I knew about it in my past life but, I can’t 
recall it either... I have a bad feeling about this...

Japanese: そうか…
English: I see...

Japanese:
創世力か…
う……　アイタタタ…
English:
The Genesis... huh...? 
Ugh... ouch...

Japanese:
どうしたの　イリア？
大丈夫？
English:
Illia, are you alright? 
Is something the matter?

Japanese:
ん…
なんか　急に頭痛くなっちゃった
あ…　でも　もう平気
English:
I’m fine...  I just got a headache all of a sudden. 
Oh-- it’s gone now.

Japanese: 創世力！　そうよ！
English: Oh I know!

Japanese:
創世力は　天上界滅亡の原因！
大変！　止めないと！
English:
It is what caused Cielo’s destruction! 
This is horrible! We have to stop them!

Japanese:
創世力が…
天上界滅亡の原因…？
そう…　だったっけ？
English:
The Genesis... caused Cielo’s destruction...?
Was... that it?

Japanese:
そういや
そうだったような…
English: Actually... that might be it...?

Japanese: 俺は　まったく思い出せんな
English: I can’t remember.

Japanese:
…で　その創世力とやらが
天上界を　滅ぼした力だとして
それがなぜ　この地上にあるんだい？
English:
Then, if this so-called Genesis has 
the power to destroy Cielo...
Why is it in Terro?

Japanese:
創世力が　天上界を
滅ぼしたということは
元は　天上界にあったはずじゃないのかな
English:
If it is what caused Cielo’s destruction, then 
can we conclude that it was originally
in Cielo?

Japanese:
天上界が滅んだから
落っこちてきた…　とかかな？
う～ん…
English: Hmm... Maybe it fell when Cielo was destroyed...?

Japanese:
ふんぬぅ！　マティウスのヤツ！
そんなロクでもない物のために
あたしの村をッ！
English:
Grrrrrr! Are you telling me that Mattheus,
that witch, attacked my village for this!?

Japanese:
マティウスとアルベールが
創世力を　欲しがる理由か…
English:
So, Mattheus and Albert want
the Genesis for that reason...

Japanese:
単純に考えれば　兵器として
利用するためだろうな
English:
If you think about it logically, they 
might want to use it in the war.

Japanese:
よくわからないけど
創世力を　そいつらに渡しちゃ
ロクなことにならないよね？
English:
I don’t understand it that much yet but basically,
if we let them have the Genesis it will lead 
to something bad, right?

Japanese:
やっぱり創世力は　あたしたちが
手に入れるしかないのよ！
マティウスにもアルベールにも　渡さない！
English:
Then that means that we have to get to the 
Genesis first! I won’t let Albert nor Mattheus have it!

Japanese:
…創世力と　アルベールたちの目的については
これ以上詮索しても　ラチが明くまい
俺の知っておきたいことが　もうひとつある
English:
We might end up getting into more trouble than we 
can handle if we keep asking these questions. On 
that note, there’s something else I’d like to know.

Japanese:
コンウェイ・タウとか　言ったな
貴様　転生者でもないのに
なぜ天術が使える？
English:
You’re “Kongwei Tao”, correct? You claim to not be a 
Reincarnator, but how can you use Cielan Artes?

Japanese:
ボクの国では　珍しいことじゃないんだけど？
そもそも　ボクの技は
正確には　天術じゃないしね
English:
It is quite common from the place I am from, though? 
Technically, what I use are not Cielan Artes either.

Japanese:
それにルカくんたちにとっては　ボク
あなたより　よほど信用できる人間だと
思うんだけどな
English:
Besides, I believe Ruca and the others 
see me as more trustworthy than you are.

Japanese:
俺より信用できるだと…
どういう意味だ？
English:
“More trustworthy than I am?” 
What are you implying here?

Japanese: 金で転ぶ傭兵よりはっていう意味さ
English:
What I mean is that you are a mercenary 
that can be easily bought with money.
I beg your pardon?

Japanese:
ちょ…　ちょっと止めなさいよ
どうしたのよ　急に…
English:
H-Hold on a sec... What’s 
with this all of a sudden...

Japanese:
俺は　俺の雇い主のそばに
正体のよくわからん人物を
置きたくないだけだ
English:
I just don’t want to side with an 
employer with unclear goals.

Japanese:
…なら　その雇い主本人が許可します
ルカくんたちが　認める以上
コンウェイさんにも　同行してもらいます
English:
Then, that employer in question shall give her 
permission for Ruca and the others to observe 
you as well as let Kongwei accompany us.

Japanese: だってさ
English: As she says...

Japanese:
ふん………………
仕方あるまい
English: So be it...

Japanese:
ね！　この件に関しては　ここまで！
…で　明日からのことなんだけど
情報を集めに　王都に行ってみない？
English:
Right! That’s enough for tonight! So, about 
tomorrow, why don’t we try gathering information 
at the capital since we’re all short on leads?

Japanese:
え…　レグヌムに…？
う～ん…
English: At Regnum...? Uhmmm...

Japanese:
確かに　情報の多さだと
あそこが一番かもね
そうしましょうか
English:
Indeed. That would be a nice place
to start gathering information.

Japanese:
さあ　皆さま
お話し合いは　そのくらいにして
お食事の用意が　できましたよ
English:
Now, everyone, let us stop this conversation
for a moment as I serve dinner.

Japanese:
待ってたんだな　しかし！
コーダ　じじいとじじいの料理
大好きなんだな　しかし！
English:
Coda has been waiting for this though! 
Coda loves Gramps and Gramps’ cooking!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
今のイリアと　ルカを見てっとよ
やっぱ　恋人同士だったようには
全然　見えねーや
English:
Looking at Illia and Ruca now... 
I really can’t believe these two
were lovers.

Japanese:
はあ？　当ったり前でしょ
そんな昔の話
前世の話じゃないのよ
English:
Well, duh! That was ages ago! 
You’re talking about our past lives here.

Japanese:
ふふふ　アスラとイナンナの仲が
強烈だったから　ふたりを見てると
違和感が　すごいのよね
English:
Asura and Innana were quite close back then. 
Seeing these two now, it feels somewhat off-putting.

Japanese:
だよなぁ
ハッキリ言って　あのふたり
バカップルだったもんな
English:
Right? Putting it bluntly, those two were
like two idiot lovebirds.

Japanese:
なにそれ
どーいう意味よッ！
English: What the hell are you implying?!

Japanese:
時間さえあれば
イチャイチャしてたものね
人目も　はばからずに
English:
They were constantly flirting with each other, 
even in public.

Japanese:
なにせ　有名人だったからなぁ
公人初の　敵国同士カップルってな
English:
They were famous, too! The first couple 
from two warring kingdoms!

Japanese:
ねえねえ
ふたりの馴れ初めは？
English:
Speaking of which, how did 
you two end up together?

Japanese:
え～とぉ…
おなか　空かしたイリアが
僕のホットドッグを　食べちゃって…
English: Um... Illia was starving so she ate my hotdog...

Japanese:
違うわよ！
そっちの馴れ初めなんて　どうでもいいの！
アスラとイナンナのよ！
English:
No, not that! I do not care how you two met!
I meant Asura and Inanna!

Japanese:
えー？　あー…　うん…
実は　あんまり憶えてないのよねぇ
別に　照れてるとかいうわけじゃなくて
English:
Eh? Uh... hmm...? To tell you the truth, I don’t really 
remember. It’s not that I’m embarrassed about 
sharing it...

Japanese:
オレは　ちょっと覚えてるんだぜ
イナンナは　ラティオから
アスラのいるセンサスに　亡命しただろ？
English:
I’ll tell you what I know about it. So 
Inanna defected into Sensus, right?

Japanese:
亡命してきたときはよ
戦場の中を　ひとり悠々と
アスラの元へ　歩いてきたんだ
English:
She practically strolled out of the
battlefield and into Asura’s arms.

Japanese:
その立ち姿の　あまりの美しさに
戦場にいた敵味方の全員が　戦いも忘れて
ただ呆然と　見つめてたんだぜ
English:
The warriors were so entranced by her beauty
that they simply watched as she passed by.

Japanese:
亡命かぁ…　いったい
なにを思って　亡命なんかしたんだろう
ラティオで　なにかあったのかなぁ？
English:
Defected, huh? I wonder why she did that...?
Did something happen when she was in Ratio?

Japanese:
戦場で芽生えた恋…　かぁ
羨ましい限りね
English: Love born from the flames of war... How romantic～

Japanese:
でも　敵味方だったってことは　お互いのこと
よく知らずに　くっついたってことでしょ
ロクなことないと　思うけどなぁ
English:
But them being from two warring factions didn’t 
affect their relationship that much, right? 
That just sounds like trouble if you ask me.

Japanese:
うーん…
まあ　後で勘違いだったことに
気が付いたかもしれないわね
English:
Hm... Well, I am sure they eventually 
realized their mistakes.

Japanese: でしょ～？
English: Right～?

Japanese:
女どもはロマンも　へったくれもねェな
こりゃ　ルカがうまくいく目は
本気でねェかも…　やれやれ
English:
Man, these women are so unromantic. At 
this rate, Ruca might never have a chance 
in getting along with them. Sheesh...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
では　昨晩のイリア・アニーミの
提案通り　王都レグヌムに
向かうということで　構わんな？
English:
Then, as Illia Animi proposed last night,
we shall head to the capital of Regnum.
Is that fine with you all?

Japanese: ちょっと待って
English: Wait a sec.

Japanese:
うん？
なにか問題でもあるのか
イリア・アニーミ？
English:
Hm? Is something the 
matter, Illia Animi?

Japanese:
王都に向かうのは　いいんだけど
その呼び方　なんでフルネームで呼ぶわけ？
あたし　堅っ苦しいのはイヤなのよね
English:
Nothing’s wrong with heading to the capital, but 
why are you addressing me by my full name? 
I don’t really like uptight characters, you see...

Japanese:
傭兵とはいえ　軍に属していれば
珍しいことではないのだが…
English:
Well, it’s standard practice for the military,
and as a mercenary I’ve had to 
pick up on some of their customs.

Japanese:
あたしのことは　イリアでいいわ
みんなも　それでいいでしょ
English:
Just call me “Illia.” Everyone’s 
fine with that, right?

Japanese:
あんたも　それでいいでしょ
ね　ルカ？
English: Especially you, Ruca, got that?

Japanese: うん………
English: Yeah...

Japanese:
どうしたの　ルカくん？
元気ないみたいだけど
English:
Is something the matter, Ruca?
That sounded quite reserved...

Japanese:
ちょっと　実家の…
父さんと母さんの様子が
気になってさ
English:
Well, I was just worrying about
how my parents are faring...

Japanese: まあ　そりゃそうだろうな
English: That’s pretty normal.

Japanese:
…親に甘えるのは　ガキの特権だろう
遠慮はあるまい
なぜ　その特権を享受しない？
English:
Brats have the privilege of relying on their 
parents, so you don’t have to hold back.
Why don’t you take advantage of that?

Japanese:
それはほら　例の適応法ってヤツよ
あたしたち　一度軍に
捕まってるからさ
English:
Come on, you’ve heard about the 
Deviant Reformation Act. We were 
captured by them before y’see.

Japanese:
なるほど　気にはなっても
帰るに　帰れんというわけか
ならば　仕方ないな
English:
I see... So even if you wanted to go 
back, you can’t. Then, so be it.

Japanese:
ルカくん
ホントに　それで大丈夫？
English: Ruca, are you sure that is acceptable?

Japanese:
ごめん！　平気平気！
僕　人前で弱音を吐かないって
決めたのにね
English:
Sorry! Yes, I’m fine with it! I’ve decided 
not to whine in front of others anymore!

Japanese:
せっかく　アスラの力で
強くなったんだから
中身の強さも伴わなきゃ！　それに…
English:
I’ve finally become strong thanks to 
Asura’s power, that’s why I have to 
be emotionally strong too! Also...

Japanese: それに　なによ？
English: Also, what?

Japanese:
イリアは　まだ僕の力を
必要としてくれてるんだよね？
だったら　最後まで頑張るよ
English:
Illia, you still need my power, right? 
Then, I’ll try hard and see this ‘til the end.

Japanese: だな！　へへッ！
English: Damn right!

Japanese:
ふうん…
あんたって　割りと…　アレね
English: Wow, you’ve really... something...

Japanese: え？　なに？
English: Excuse me?

Japanese:
割りとマシかもねって　話よ
それじゃ　王都に向かいましょ！
English:
I mean, you’ve really grown.
All right, let’s head to Regnum!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
レグヌムへは
いったん　北へ向かってから　東ね
English: We’ll go north to Regnum, then east.

Japanese:
枢密院と教団の動きが　気になる
一刻も早く　レグヌムで
情報収集に　取り掛かろう
English:
I want to know more about what the Church and the
Council are planning. Let’s head to Regnum and
start gathering information immediately.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
…で　この街で情報収集って
具体的には　どうするつもり？
English:
So, now that we are here... are we
looking for anything specific?

Japanese:
決まってるじゃない
もちろん　転生者を探すのよ
English:
Isn’t that obvious? We’re gonna 
look for other Reincarnators.

Japanese:
でもさぁ　転生者はみんな
適応法で捕まって
街には　いないんじゃないの？
English:
Don’t you think that the army would’ve
captured them at this point?

Japanese:
隠れている人が
絶対にいるはずよ
English:
I’m sure there are some other Reincarnators 
hiding in the town.

Japanese:
どうやって　隠れている転生者を
いぶり出すつもりだ？
English: How exactly do you plan on luring them out?

Japanese:
それに　隠れている転生者が
私たちに　会ってくれるかしら？
English: Do you think that they would mind meeting us?

Japanese:
うぐぐ…　そ…　その解決策を
含めての　情報収集でしょ？
とにかく行きましょうよ！　ね！
English:
Ugh... I-I’m sure that’ll work out 
eventually... Anyways, time to get movin’!

Japanese: 行くって　どこへだよ？
English: To where exactly?

Japanese: どこか…　よ！
English: WHERE. EVER!

Japanese:
ほ～ら　また出たよ
イリアの　行き当たりばったりが…
English: Oh sheesh... Impulsive Illia at it again!

Japanese:
…だが　まあ　ここにいつまでも
突っ立っているわけには　いかんな
とにかく街を　散策してみよう
English:
Still, we can’t just stand around doing nothing.
Let’s just look around the city for now.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
どうかしたの
ルカくん？
English: What’s the matter, Ruca?

Japanese:
え？　あ～　いや
なんでもないよ
English: Hm...? Oh, it’s nothing. Don’t worry about it.

Japanese:
そう？
じゃあ　早く行きましょ
English: Is that so? Then, let us be off.

Japanese: う…　うん…
English: A-Alright...

Japanese:
父さん　母さん…
でも　イリアが必要としてくれる以上
僕は弱音を吐かないって　決めたんだ
English:
I’m sorry, Dad... I’m sorry, Mom... but I’ve decided 
not to be weak as long as Illia needs my help.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
父さん　母さん…
でも　イリアが必要としてくれる以上
僕は弱音を吐かないって　決めたんだ
English:
I’m sorry, Dad... I’m sorry, Mom... but I’ve decided 
not to be weak as long as Illia needs my help.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
ここだ　ここだ　この下
オレ　親の目から　逃れるために
こっそり隠れ場所を　作ってたんだ
English:
This is the place. Once used it so I’d have 
somewhere to hide from my parents when 
I ran away from home.

Japanese:
ちょっと　ちょっと！
この下って　マンホールの下？
下水道じゃないの！
English:
Wait a sec... by this place, you mean 
inside this manhole? Are you really telling 
us to hide in a damn sewer?

Japanese:
大丈夫だよ
この辺りは　ほとんど匂わねェからさ
たまに　ドブネズミが出るけどな
English:
It’s fine, it’s fine! It’s not as smelly as you would expect.
Huge rats come out once in a while though.

Japanese:
ドブネズミぃ！？
ちっとも
大丈夫じゃないじゃない！
English: Huge rats!? It’s so totally NOT FINE!

Japanese:
ま…　まあ　この際
贅沢は　言ってられないかな
English: M-My, what extravagance we have to look forward to.

Japanese:
アンジュ　ムリしてんの
モロバレだってば…
English: Ange, you’re really not fooling anyone.

Japanese:
フン　隠れ家としては
結構なもんだ
では　ここで落ち合うことにしよう
English:
Hm... This hiding place should do. Let’s 
meet up here if something happens.

Japanese:
皆　定期的に　ここに戻って
連絡を取り合うんだ
English:
I want everyone to check in periodically
and report your findings.

Japanese:
んじゃあ　情報収集は
二人一組で行こう
組み合わせは　コイントスで…　っと
English:
Then let’s pair up while we search.
Lemme flip a coin.

Japanese:
じゃ　オレとリカルドで
工業区を　回ってみる
English:
Right. Ricardo and I are gonna ask
around in the industrial district.

Japanese:
では　私とイリアは
商店街を回ってみるね
イリア　行きましょ
English:
Illia and I will take care of the 
shopping district. Shall we?

Japanese: …じゃあ　僕らは住宅区を　回ろうか
English: I guess that leaves the residential district to us...

Japanese:
了解
ここの地理は　キミの方が明るいからね
任せるよ
English:
Indeed. You are more familiar with 
this place, so I will leave it to you.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
ほらほら　見たって
結構　キレイやろ
English: Look, ain’t it purty?

Japanese:
へぇ　あの下水道の奥に
こんな場所があったなんてな
全然　気づかなかったぜ
English:
Whoa... I never realized that there was something
like this inside the sewer systems?

Japanese:
せっかくなら　下水道じゃなくて
ここに住めばいいのに
English: Why don’t you just live here instead of there?

Japanese:
あかん　あかん　ここら
水が冷たいさかい　寒すぎんねん
下水道は工場が　近いさかい暖かい
English:
Can’t. This place here can get mighty cold.
The sewer’s close ta the factory so it’s warm.

Japanese:
こんなとこで　ひと晩寝よったら
一発で　風邪ひいてまうわ
English: If ya sleep here ye’ll end up gettin’ a cold.

Japanese:
…………
生活の知恵と呼ぶには
悲しすぎるわね…
English:
Being forced to learn the hardships
of life at an early age...

Japanese:
姉ちゃん　そんな顔せんといてぇな
ウチ　あんなとこで暮らしとるけど
結構　幸せやねんで
English:
Sis, don’ make that face... We might be livin’ 
in that kinda place but at least we’re happy.

Japanese:
ほらほら　ウチをもっと幸せにするために
はよ　行かへん？
キノコは　もっと奥にあんねん
English:
If ya want us ta be more happy,
the mushroom’s jus’ further in.

Japanese:
そうだな　とっとと
この湿っぽいところから　出てぇぜ
English: Right on, let’s ditch this dump.

Japanese:
なんやろ　イヌの…　匂い…？
まさか　こんなとこに
イヌなんか　おるわけあらへんわ
English:
Hmm... Why’s it smell like dawg...? Can’t be, 
ain’t no dawg’s supposed ta be here.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
ふわぁ～
あるとこには　あるもんやなぁ
English: Whoa, this guy’s really well off...

Japanese:
この何十分の１でもええから
ウチにあったら　チビども１０００人
養うてやれんのになぁ
English:
Even a tenth of this place’s nuff
ta hold a thousand young’ns.

Japanese:
あの様子では　この屋敷内にも
私設の護衛を　雇っているだろうな
English:
That person might have also employed 
guards within the mansion.

Japanese:
そうだね
気をつけないと…
さあ早く　あの子たちを捜そう
English:
You’re right. We have to be careful...
Now, let’s hurry and look for Michelle
and Gaetano.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
じゃ　大聖堂の図書室　目指して
ナーオスへ出発！
English:
Now, let’s head straight to the 
Grand Cathedral’s library!

Japanese:
ナーオスなら　また　じじいの
手料理が　食べられるな！
楽しみなんだな　しかし！
English:
If we go to Naohs, we’ll get to eat Gramp’s
cooking again! Fun!

Japanese:
ほら　グズグズしてんと　行こうや
ただいまっちゅうて
帰れる日は　すぐ来るって
English:
Hey now, no more sulkin’ ‘bout, let’s git.
The day we get ta go home ain’t far off.

Japanese:
……うん
そうだね！　行こう！
English: You’re right... Let’s go!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: うっわ～　カビ臭ッ
English: Yikes, talk about musty.

Japanese:
ホントに　本ばっかだな
なんか　落ち着かねーぜ
English:
Ain’t nothing here but books!
Kinda gives me the creeps.

Japanese:
こぉら
ぜひ　かくれんぼしたなるなぁ
English: Kinda makes me wanna play hide an’ seek.

Japanese:
コーダも
かくれんぼしたくなるな　しかし！
するしかないな！　しかし！
English:
Coda wants to play hide and seek,
too! It’s the only thing to do!

Japanese:
はいはい　おしゃべりは　そこまで
みんな　聞いて
English:
Now, now, that is enough.
Everyone, listen up.

Japanese:
それじゃあ　手分けして調べましょ
まず地域別　年代別に
本を選び出すのが　最初の作業ね
English:
We need to divide up the labor.
We will be searching for relevant
texts by location and date.

Japanese:
それから　記憶の場がありそうな場所を
拾い上げて…
English:
And from that, we shall have to deduce plausible
places from where we can find Memory Springs--

Japanese:
なあ　アンジュ姉ちゃん
ウチ　字ぃ読まれへんねんけど
English: Hey... Sis Ange...? Ah can’t read, hear?

Japanese:
……あ　その手があったか
じゃあ　オレ　本読めねーんだけど
English:
(So that’s what you’re planning...!)
Hey, I can’t read books either.

Japanese:
……なに　サボろうとしてるのよ
じゃあ　ワタクシ　ナイフとフォークより
重たい物を持てませんの　おほほのほ
English:
What are you trying to skip work for...? 
Well then, I regret to inform you that I can’t 
lift anything heavier than a knife and a fork.

Japanese:
…はいはい
じゃあ　こうする
English: Fine, I get it... Then, let us do it like this.

Japanese:
スパーダくんは　ルカくんの助手
イリアとコーダは　私の助手
エルは　リカルドさんのお手伝い
English:
Spada will be helping Ruca, Illia and Coda will
be helping me, and Hermie will be helping out
Sir Ricardo.

Japanese: え～と　コンウェイさんは…
English: Um... and Kongwei will be...

Japanese:
ボクは　ルカくんたちを
手伝おうかな
English: I will be helping out Ruca.

Japanese:
では　それでお願いします
これで　みんなサボれないでしょ？
はい　みんな　調査開始よ
English:
Well then, I suppose that will stop everyone 
from slacking off. Let us begin!

Japanese: みんな
English: Everyone

Speakers:
0 [ルカ]
1 [イリア]
2 [スパーダ]
4 [リカルド]
5 [エルマーナ]
6 [コンウェイ]
7 [コーダ]
Japanese: はーい
English: Okay.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
じゃあ　みんな調査結果を
発表して
まずは　ルカくんチームから
English:
Now, everyone, please share what you have found. 
First, let us hear what team Ruca managed to discover.

Japanese:
西の国ガラムの　ケルム火山では
昔から独自に　鍛冶の神さまを
信奉してるみたいだね
English:
It seems that the God of the Forge has been 
worshipped around Garam’s Kelm Volcano for ages.

Japanese:
そうね　あそこは鉱山が中心の国だし
鍛冶職人が多いから　職業神として
独自の宗教観が　発展したのよ
English:
Indeed, since the mines in the area have attracted 
many smiths. The religion might have grown centered
around him as the god of the industry.

Japanese:
元は教団と同じ　宗教圏だったんだけどね
確か　そのケルム火山は
ガラムの聖地になっているはずよ
English:
Their belief system is quite similar to the 
Church’s. I seem to recall that Kelm
Volcano was sacred to them.

Japanese:
あと　東のアシハラって国だね
歴史が古くて　異文化みたいだから
記憶の場も　手付かずで残ってるかも
English:
There’s also Ashihara. Given their distinct, 
ancient culture, there might also be an 
undiscovered Memory Spring there.

Japanese:
行ってみる価値は　ありそうね
同じように文化の違う　南のガルポスや
北のテノスにも　行ってみないとね
English:
It sounds like it is worth looking into. Then, that means 
that we will also need to visit Galpos and Tenos, both 
of which have different cultures.

Japanese:
リカルドさんのチームからは
なにかありますか？
English: Sir Ricardo, Hermie, did you find anything?

Japanese: いや　なにも…
English: No, nothing...

Japanese:
そうですか
ところで　リカルドさん
ここの寝心地は　いかがでしたか？
English:
Is that so? By the way, Sir Ricardo,
did you sleep well?

Japanese:
………
暗くて静かだ
休息には　これ以上ない場所だな
English:
This place is dark and quiet... Almost 
as if it was made for napping.

Japanese:
あんなぁ　リカルドのおっちゃんなぁ
めっちゃでっかい
鼻ちょうちん　出来とってんで
English:
Ah was worried ya were gonna 
wake the dead with all that snorin’.

Japanese:
エルも　口元を
きちんと　お拭きなさい
よだれの跡　すごいから
English:
Hermie, you should really wipe
all that drool off your chin.

Japanese: 次に向かう場所が　決まったようね
English: We need to decide where to go next...

Japanese:
アシハラ　ガラム
ガルポス　テノスかぁ
世界中を　巡る旅になりそうだね
English:
Ashihara, Tenos, Garam, or Galpos?
Sounds like we’ll be going around the world...

Japanese:
でもよォ　今　戦争中だろ？
船でなきゃ　行けない場所は
どーすんだ？
English:
But, y’know... the whole world’s at war.
How are we gonna reach those place
without a ship?

Japanese:
俺が　なんとかしよう
多少なりとも　コネがある
English:
I’ll go do something about it. I should 
be able to pull some strings.

Japanese:
おうおう　随分やる気じゃねぇ？
たっぷり寝たおかげで
エネルギー満タンなんだな
English:
Whoa, whoa. You sure are fired up.
That must’ve been some power nap.

Japanese:
フン　ガキのおまえらには
船の手配は　できんだろう
俺は俺のできることを　やるのみだ
English:
As if you brats can get a ship on your own. 
I’m merely doing what I can.

Japanese:
調べ物は　苦手だもんねぇ
せいぜい船の手配で
ポイント稼いで　もらわないと
English:
Well you clearly can’t do any research,
so it’s the least you can do.

Japanese:
もう　イリアったら
そんなこと言わないの
ではリカルドさん　お願いできますか？
English:
Oh dear, that was rather uncalled for. Sir Ricardo, 
can you please arrange a boat for us?

Japanese:
ああ　行って来よう
港で待っている
English:
Yeah, I’ll be heading out now. 
I’ll wait for you guys at the harbor.

Japanese:
やれやれ　くたびれちまったぜ
んじゃあ　オレたちは…　そうだな
ハルトマンの家で　時間潰そうか
English:
Man, I’m beat. How about we go
wait at Hartman’s place?

Japanese:
おお！　じじいの家！
つまり　メシだな！　しかし！
English: Oh! Gramps’ place! That means food!

Japanese:
なんや？　メシ食わせてもらえんのん？
夢みたいなところやなぁ
そら　一回行っとかんと
English:
Really? He’ll let us eat there fer free?
Sounds like a dream～

Japanese:
挨拶しに行くだけだよ
今度は　長旅になりそうだからな
English:
We’re just gonna say goodbye. No way of knowin’
how long it’ll be before we’ll come this way again.

Japanese:
むー…
メシなしか　しかし！
ガッカリだな　しかし！
English: Aw... no meal... Coda’s sad...

Japanese:
じゃ　そうしようか
あんたが　お坊ちゃまって呼ばれてるとこ
ぜひ　エルに聞かせないとね
English:
Sounds like a good plan. We can’t let Hermie
leave without hearing him say “Young 
Master”, can we?

Japanese:
あ～
行きたくなくなってきた…
English: Now I’m having second thoughts...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: ハルトマン
English: Hartman

Japanese:
ああ　お坊ちゃま
いやいや　ご無事でなにより
ホッといたしました…
English:
My, it is the Young Master! I am beside 
myself with joy at your safe return...

Japanese:
なんだ？
なにか　心配する理由でもあるのか？
English: Somethin’ got you worried?

Japanese:
実は先日　この町に王都軍が参りましてな
よもや　鉢合わせしておられないかと
ヒヤヒヤしておったのです
English:
Just the other day, the Imperial Army came to 
this city. I feared that you might have run into them.

Japanese:
王都軍だって…
まさか　アンジュを捕まえに？
English: Imperial Army, you say... Were they after Ange?

Japanese:
いえ　そうは見えませんでした
兵士だけではなく
軍幹部の男が　ひとりおりましたし…
English:
No, that did not seem to be the case. A 
high-ranking officer seemed to be leading them...

Japanese:
確か　オズバルドとかいう男ですな
王都の式典に　出席しているのを
見かけた記憶が　ございます
English:
I believe his name was Oswald. I recall seeing him 
in some formal ceremonies while in Regnum.

Japanese:
オズバルドって　研究所にいた
あの太ったヤツよね
なにしに来たっての？
English:
Oswald was that fat-ass from the lab, right?
What did he come here for?

Japanese:
それとなく　見張っておりましたら
大聖堂からでしょうか
本を数冊抱えて　出て参りましたな
English:
I watched them from afar as they carried off
some books. I believe they came from the cathedral.

Japanese:
地下の図書室から？
でも出入り口は　隠されていたはず…
English:
From the secret library? The entrance 
should have been hidden...

Japanese:
教団関係者から　図書室の話を
聞いたのかしら…？
English:
Did they hear about the secret underground
room from someone related to the church?

Japanese:
とにかく
アンジュを　捕まえに来たんじゃ
なさそうだね
English: At least we know that they aren’t after Ange.

Japanese:
ねぇ　アンジュ
どんな本がなくなってたか
気がついた？
English: Ange, did you happen to notice any missing books?

Japanese:
いいえ　あの量の本だもの
目録と照らし合わせながら
調べたわけでもないし
English:
No, I did not. The library has so many books, it would 
be impossible to notice if some were missing.
It never had a catalogue either.

Japanese:
まあ　ともかく　お坊ちゃま方が
ご無事で　安心いたしました
さて　さっそく食事のご用意をいたしますか
English:
In any case. I am most pleased to see you all safe.
Now, shall I prepare you all a meal?

Japanese: 食べたいんだな　しかし！
English: Coda wants to eat though!

Japanese:
今日は　ここで
ゆっくりしたいもんやで　しかし
English: Let’s rest here fer a bit, hear!

Japanese:
ダメだっての
リカルドが手配した船に　乗るんだろ！
English:
I told you we’re not eating! We’re gonna
have to catch a boat ride soon, y’know!

Japanese:
悪い　ハルトマン
これから船旅で　長くなりそうなんだ
今日は　挨拶に寄っただけ
English:
Sorry Hartman, we got a boat to catch.
It’s gonna be a long trip, so we just
came to say goodbye.

Japanese:
左様でございましたか
わかりました
道中　お気をつけくださいませ
English:
Is that right?
I understand.
Please take care.

Japanese:
しゃあないなぁ
ほな　バイバイ　じーちゃん
今度また　ゆっくり寄らせてなぁ
English:
Can’t be helped.
Later gramps.
We’ll visit ya again!

Japanese: 腹が減ったぞ　しかし！
English: Coda’s hungry.

Japanese:
うるせぇ　だだこねてねェで
ほら　港へ行くぞ
English:
Shut up! I said we’re not coming here to eat!
C’mon, let’s go to the harbor.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
ふぅ…
ほら　陸に上がれば　大丈夫
English: Sigh... See, I feel better on land now!

Japanese:
ホントに　ここがアシハラかよ？
思ってたより　寂しい町だな
English:
Is this really Ashihara? It’s more 
desolate than what I expected.

Japanese:
この町は　年々水没しているからな
かつては　広大な版図を有した
海洋国だったのだが…
English:
Every year, more and more of this island 
sinks into the sea. Ashihara was once a 
vast empire, but this is all that’s left.

Japanese:
各地で起きてる　天変地異も
この町を見れば　その深刻さが
よくわかるわね
English:
Seeing this town has just made apparent
that the world is currently suffering through
the growing frequency of natural disasters...

Japanese:
なあなあ
はよ　町見て回らへん？
ウチ　楽しみやねん
English:
Hey, hey, how ’bout we wander ‘round town?
Ah can’t wait ta see what we’re goin’ ta find!

Japanese:
そーだ　そーだ
エルの言う通りだぞー　しかし
English: Right! Right! What Hermie said!

Japanese:
はいはい
それじゃ　行こうか
English: Aight, aight! Time to get movin’!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
さ…　さすが　外国だよね
レグヌムじゃ　見たことない
珍しいものばかりだ
English:
This certainly feels like a foreign country.
There’s a lot of unusual things here.

Japanese: そうね…
English: You’re right...

Japanese:
その…
あの…
えっと……　あのさ
English:
Um...
So...
Well...

Japanese:
もっと　色々見て回りたくない？
せっかくだし　き…　きっと
いい思い出になると思うよ
English:
Would you like to look around the city a bit more? 
Now that we’re here... I-I’m sure we’ll be able to 
make some good memories.

Japanese:
…………はぁ？
いい思い出って
あんた　なに考えてんの？
English:
Huh? “Good memories?”
What the hell are you on?

Japanese:
その…　なんと言うか…
君もデー…　いや　観光とか
したいんじゃないかなぁって…
English:
Well... I thought... Maybe we could enjoy
seeing the sights together or something...

Japanese:
なに言ってんの？
そんなに観光したきゃ
勝手に　すればいいじゃない
English: Excuse me? Here’s a better idea: go by yourself!

Japanese:
あたしも　勝手に情報収集するから
じゃあ　また後でね
おたんこルカ！
English:
I’ll just gather information on my own. 
See you later, dummy!

Japanese: あ…
English: Wait--!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: アスラ
English: Asura

Japanese: サクヤ
English: Sakuya

Japanese:
創世力…　で
ごさいますか？
English: The Genesis, my Lord?

Japanese:
そうだ
天上界の統一だけでは　俺の望みは果たせぬ
我が望みを叶えるためには　創世力が…
English:
That’s right. We won’t be able to unify
Cielo and Terro without it.

Japanese:
ああ…　アスラさまの悲願
なんとしても　叶えねばなりませぬ
English:
Understood. Lord Asura, I shall work to fulfill your
dearest wish, no matter what the cost.

Japanese:
このサクヤ　アスラさまがため
粉骨砕身する　所存
English:
I, Sakuya, pledge to give my all in 
service to you, my Lord.

Japanese:
我が身の一片まで　あなたの
覇道のため　お使いください
English:
Until this body of mine turns to dust, 
please use me as you see fit.

Japanese:
フ…　ありがたい言葉だがな
俺は献身や自己犠牲など　部下に望まん
English:
Hmph. I admire your dedication. However, I 
require no self-sacrifice from those who serve me.

Japanese:
ましてや　おまえのその美しい体
到底　無下には扱えぬよ
English:
I have no intention of treating 
a young girl as a tool.

Japanese:
アスラさまは　変わってしまわれた…
それも　あの女…
イナンナが来てから…
English:
Lord Asura has changed... Ever since 
that woman, Inanna, came here...

Japanese:
いや　なにも言うまい
言っては　アスラさまを困らせる…
私のこの想いは　深く沈めねば…
English:
No, I must not speak of this! It would trouble Lord 
Asura to hear... I must conceal this jealousy deep in 
my heart...

Japanese:
深く…　海よりも…　奈落よりも…
この世のどこよりも…　深く…
決して浮かばぬように…
English:
Deeper... Deeper than the sea... Deeper than hell...
Deeper than the deepest part of this world... Deeper...
So that it may never float to the surface...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
うっわ！　広っ！
ただのお墓でしょ　ここ？
なんで　こんなに広いのよ
English:
Sweet Terro! This place is big! It sure doesn’t
look like your ordinary tomb. Why is it so big?

Japanese:
王さまのお墓なら
大きくて　当たり前じゃないかな
English: Well, it is a King’s tomb...

Japanese:
そうね　権力者が　お墓を造るのは
自分の権力を　見せるための
示威行為だから
English:
Correct. Influential people often demonstrate their
power by building huge monuments like these.

Japanese:
もっとも　ここは神殿としての
意味合いも　兼ねているようだけど
English:
Although, I believe this place was constructed 
to serve as a temple as well.

Japanese:
なら　ここにも　また祭壇とともに
目当ての物…
記憶の場があるということか
English:
If that’s the case, then there might also be an altar
within here. Which means another Memory Spring.

Japanese:
その可能性は　高いと思います
天上界信仰の祭事を　執り行っていた
祭壇が　どこかに必ずあるはずです
English:
I think the possibility of that is quite high. The 
altar where they hold Cielan rituals should be 
somewhere in here.

Japanese:
もし　記憶の場があるとすれば
そのそばでしょうね
English:
And should there be a Memory Spring...
it would be placed near it.

Japanese:
あ～…　それにしても　ウチ
なんかちょっと　息苦しいわ
English: Y’all, don’ it feel kinda stuffy all of a sudden?

Japanese:
ここまで階段で　随分降りて来たからね
このあたりだと
もう海の底って感じかな
English:
Well, we have been going down these stairs for quite a 
while. I believe we are below sea level by now.

Japanese:
はぁ…　そんなん聞かされたら
余計　気が滅入るわ…
English: Hearing that’s kinda overwhelmingly depressin’.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
ルカ　あんた　まさか
チトセを　探してるの？
English:
Ruca, don’t tell me you’re looking 
for Chitose, are you?

Japanese:
い…　いやっ…
違うよ！
English: N-No... Not at all!

Japanese:
あ…　あのさ
なんだったんだろうね
ここの　記憶の場
English:
Say, I wonder what that Memory 
Spring showed us earlier...?

Japanese:
アスラとイナンナ
創世力について
モメてたみたいだけど…
English:
It looked like Asura and Inanna were
arguing about the Genesis.

Japanese:
……………
ごめん　ルカ
しばらく　話し掛けないで
English:
I’m sorry, Ruca, but... can you give me 
some space for now? Please...?

Japanese:
すぐに
気分切り替えられると　思うから
ちょっとだけ　時間をちょうだい…
English:
I’ll be fine in a bit. So please, can you 
please leave me alone for a sec?

Japanese:
…えーっとぉ！
これで　アシハラに来た
目的は　果たしたわけだけどよ…
English:
Um... We’ve finally managed to finish
our objective here in Ashihara, so...

Japanese:
ほな
なんか食べに　行こうやぁ
English: How ’bout we go get sumthin’ ta eat?

Japanese:
…っちゅうか
どっか　連れてってぇやぁ
なあなあなあ！
English: Treat me ta sumthin’ tasty, hear?

Japanese:
残念だが
のんびりしている時間はない
English:
Sorry to ruin the mood, but we don’t
have time to dilly-dally.

Japanese: ええ～　なんでぇなぁ
English: Awwwwwwwwwwwwww why not?

Japanese:
船の出港時間が　近いからだ
ほら　急ぐぞ
English:
It’s almost time for us to leave.
Let’s head out.

Japanese:
む～　メシなしか　しかし！
コーダも残念なんだな　しかし！
English: There’s no food? Coda’s disappointed though!

Japanese: メシなら　船でも食える
English: You can eat on the ship.

Japanese: …んで　次の目的地は？
English: So... where we going next?

Japanese:
南のガルポスは　遠い
そして北のテノスは　こちら方面からの
入港は　難しい情勢らしい
English:
Galpos is too far and it’s going to be hard to 
get to Tenos Harbor considering the war.

Japanese: そうなるとガラム　…ですね
English: Then that leaves us with Garam, right?

Japanese:
ああ　出港準備完了の汽笛だな
急がんと　しばらく
この国で　足止めを食うことになるぞ
English:
Well, that’s the signal that the ship’s ready 
for departure. Walk faster or else we’ll be 
leaving you behind.

Japanese:
なんだよッ！
マジで　時間ねーじゃん！
ほら　行こうぜ！
English:
Crap, there really isn’t enough time! 
C’mon, guys, let’s move!

Japanese:
ここから　ガラムへの乗船券は
問題なく　手に入るはずだ
港の船員に　話しかけるといい
English:
There wouldn’t be much trouble getting a ticket
to Garam from here. Just talk to the sailor at the port.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
そろそろ　船にも慣れてきたかな
今回は　船酔いもしなかったし
English:
I didn’t get seasick this time! I think I’m 
slowly getting used to riding ships.

Japanese:
ほんで
ここがガラムなん？
English: So we’re really at Garam?

Japanese:
いや　ここはガラム港
ガラムは　ここからまだ
カリュプス鉱山を　越えた先だ
English:
No. We’re at Garam Port. Garam is still
far from here. Just across Calypso Mine.

Japanese:
ええ～
まだ山道　越えなあかんのかいな
English:
Ehhh... Are we gonna be goin’ through
another mountain again?

Japanese:
ただの山道ではない
鉱山の坑道を利用した
トンネルだ
English:
Nothing like the one we’ve crossed before. We’ll be
going through the mountain via a mine shaft--
simply speaking, a tunnel.

Japanese:
トンネル？
トンネルって　なんやのん？
English: A “tunnel?” What’s a tunnel?

Japanese:
地下の通路
まあ　下水道みたいなもんだよ
English:
A passage beneath the ground. 
Something like the cave in Regnum.

Japanese:
ふ～ん
ほな　はよ行こか
English: Ohhh... Okay! Let’s get goin’ then!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
カリュプス鉱山は
ここから北東へ　少し行った先
そう遠くはないはずだ
English:
Calypso Mine should be northeast 
from here. It shouldn’t be far.

Japanese: じゃあ　行こうか
English: Alright, let’s go.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
は～ん　これがトンネルか
うん　確かに　ジメジメしとるとことか
ウチのねぐらに　よう似とるわ
English:
Oh... So this is a tunnel? It really is damp 
and humid like my place!

Japanese:
坑道では　地下水が
染み出してくるのが　常だからな
English:
The dampness is normal for tunnels. 
Groundwater tends to seep out of 
their walls, which gives that effect.

Japanese:
先を行くときは　気をつけてくれ
ここは　落盤が多いせいか
よく行方不明者が　出るそうだ
English:
Everyone, be careful. The chances of cave-ins 
happening here are high, and I’ve heard that 
people have disappeared here before.

Japanese:
そういえば　聞き分けのない子どもに
よく言うわね　カリュプス鉱山の亡霊の話
English:
Now that you mention it... I have heard people tell
naughty children about the Ghosts of Calypso Mine.

Japanese: 亡霊が悪い子を　連れて行くって
English: About how they come for naughty children～

Japanese:
エル～
言うこと　聞かない子は
連れてっちゃうぞぉ～
English:
Be careful, Hermie～ The Ghost loves taking
kids who do not listen to adults～

Japanese:
へへ
そんなん　ちっとも恐ないわ
English: Haha～ that don’ scare me!

Japanese:
ふん　子どもを躾けるための
よくある方便だ
English: I see... So it’s something used to instill manners.

Japanese:
………………
みんな　ほら後ろッ！
English: EVERYONE, BEHIND YOU!

Japanese:
…………
ら…　落盤の予兆かと思っただけだ
ほら　先を急ぐぞ！
English:
I-I just thought that there was going
to be a cave in! C’mon, let’s hurry!

Japanese:
…………？
ここは　ほんのわずかだけど…
いや　気のせいか…
English:
Hmm...? There is something off about this place...
perhaps it is just my imagination...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
あ～　息がつまりそうやったわ
空が見えるんは
ホンマ　ありがたいなぁ
English:
Ahh, that place was so cramped! 
Glad ta finally see the sky again!

Japanese:
下水道　暮らしが
このくらいで　なに言ってんだよ
English:
What do you mean cramped? 
Don’t you live in a sewer?

Japanese:
下水道なんて　住みとうて
住んどったんちゃうっちゅうねん
ウチかて　空が見える暮らしの方がええ
English:
Jus’ cause Ah live in a sewer don’ mean 
Ah wanna live in one, hear? Ah wanna live 
under the vast blue sky!

Japanese:
…ちゅうか　あそこは元々
兄ちゃんが作った　ねぐらやんか
人のこと下水道暮らしとか　言わんといて
English:
That said, weren’t ya the one originally livin’ in there?
Ah don’ think ya have the right ta tell anybody that.

Japanese:
ここから　北東に行けば
すぐガラムに　着くはずだ
English:
If we head northeast from here, 
we’ll soon be in Garam.

Japanese:
じゃあ　あと少し
頑張ろう
English: Then, let’s hang on a little longer.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
あのデッカイ山　なんや？
煙　吹いてんで
English:
What’s that huge mountain? There’s smoke 
comin’ out from it, look!

Japanese:
なに　エル
あんた　火山も知らないの？
English: You don’t know about volcanos, Hermie?

Japanese:
火山やったら　知ってるで
地下のマグマが　噴き出して
出来た山やろ？
English:
If it’s a volcano, then Ah know what it is! It’s a 
mountain where magma come out from under 
the ground, right?

Japanese:
なんだ　ちゃんと
知ってんじゃないのよ
English: Wait, so you do know!

Japanese:
来る途中の船ん中で　ルカ兄ちゃんに聞いてん
でも　見るんは初めてやねんもん
あれが火山か　なんやすごいなぁ
English:
Ruca Bro told me ‘bout it on the ship going here.
But it’s my first time seein’ one in real life.
So that’s a volcano? It looks mighty cool.

Japanese:
あのケルム火山は　古の時代から
頻繁に　火山活動を
繰り返していたらしい
English:
Apparently, Kelm’s Volcano has been
active since ancient times.

Japanese:
この近辺は　鉱物資源も豊富で　鉱物が
産出されるところには　鍛冶師も集まる
そんなわけで　ここは昔から職人の町だ
English:
The high mineral production in this area has 
attracted countless blacksmiths. Thus, this 
has been a city of craftsmen for ages.

Japanese:
そして　優秀な武具は
多くの武芸者も招く
このあたりは　修行地としても有名だ
English:
The superior quality of weapons in this town attracts
martial art practitioners. Thus also making it a
center of martial arts.

Japanese:
へえ　武芸者の修行地ねえ
そりゃ　ちょっと楽しみだな
English:
Ohhh! Martial arts practice, huh? Well, that
makes this place more interesting!

Japanese:
そのおかげで　火山が神格化されて
鍛冶神信仰が盛んで　特に鍛冶の神バルカンが
その対象になってるわ
English:
Thanks to this, the volcano is deified, and a religion
worshipping the God of the smiths boomed. 
Specifically, worship of the God of the Forge: Vulcan.

Japanese:
鍛冶の神…
バルカン…
English: The God of the Forge... Vulcan...

Japanese:
だから　記憶の場があるとすれば
あの火山…　ケルム火山の中ね
English:
So, if there is a Memory Spring,
then it should be within that volcano.

Japanese:
とにかく　町行こぉやぁ
ここって　なにが美味しいのん？
English:
How ’bout we go inta town first?
What’s their specialty here anyway?

Japanese:
美味しいものは　なんなのか！
エルの言葉は　いつも
人生の核心を突くな　しかし！
English:
“What’s their specialty here?” Hermie’s
words always strike at the core of life 
again though!

Japanese:
なにが　人生の核心だよ
おまえ　人じゃねえだろうが…
English:
What’s with that “core of life” thing?
You’re not even a human...

Japanese:
エルが　暴れださないうちに
少し町を歩こうか
English:
Let’s walk around town first before
Hermie starts attacking someone.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
ねえ　なんだか　町が騒がしくない？
どうしたんだろ？
English:
Hey, doesn’t this place kind of feel 
restless? I wonder why?

Japanese:
確かに　みんな　殺気立ってんな
…とはいえ　殺気の相手は
オレたちじゃあなさそうだけど…
English:
You’re right, everyone seems to be on the edge...
Though, I don’t think we’re the reason for that.

Japanese:
だったら　別にいいじゃない
さっさと　火山の入り口を
探しましょうよ
English:
Then ain’t that fine? Let’s hurry up
and look for the volcano’s entrance.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
ハスタか…　どうやらヤツめ
もう一度　死に目に遭わせる
必要があるようだな
English:
So Hasta’s here... Looks like I’ll have to
introduce him to Death once again...

Japanese:
また　アイツかぁ…
でも　ヘンだよな　オレ　あいつとは
初めて会った気　全然しねーんだよな
English:
Him again... It’s weird but, 
I feel like I’ve met him before...

Japanese:
そういえば　スパーダ
前にも　そんなこと言ってたよね
English: Oh right, I think you’ve mentioned that before.

Japanese:
なあなあ
そのハスタっちゅうんは
どんなヤツなん？
English: So... what kinda person is that Hasta fella anyway?

Japanese:
ううっ　アイツのネチッとした
しゃべり方　思い出しただけで
鳥肌が立つ！　うひぃ！
English:
Eughhhh just thinking about how he 
speaks gives me the creeps. YUCK!

Japanese:
ふ～ん
そら　よっぽどキモいヤツなんやなぁ
ほんで　どないするん？
English:
Ah see... so he’s that kinda creep. 
So? What’re we gonna do with him?

Japanese:
ねえ　こういうのはどうかしら？
ハスタを火山から　追い出すから
中に入る許可を　もらうの
English:
How about this? We shall volunteer to chase 
Hasta out from inside the volcano.

Japanese:
ほう？
確かにアイツと　対等に戦えるのは
俺たちぐらいしかいないだろうな
English:
It’s true that we’re the only ones
who can match him in battle.

Japanese: 望むところだ　腕が鳴るぜ！
English: Bring it on!

Japanese:
ま　中に入ってしまえば
こっちのものよね
最悪　アイツを放置しても…
English:
Well, we only need to get inside right? When
push comes to shove we just leave him alone...

Japanese:
うっわ　イリア姉ちゃん
それ　えげつなぁ～
…でも　ま　ええんちゃう？
English: Illia, that’s nasty... But, Ah guess that’s a’ight.

Japanese:
イリア　エル　そういう人の期待を
裏切るような発想は
慎みなさいね？
English: Illia, Hermie, betraying other people’s trust is sinful.

Japanese:
わかった！　わかった！
わかりましたーっと！
English:
Fine, fine, we get it! 
We understand!

Japanese:
…と　言いたいところだけど
案としては　アリね
English:
Is what I would like to say... but I do not see 
a reason not to.

Japanese: アリなのかよ…
English: So you’re fine with it...?

Japanese:
優先事項を　設けるだけよ
私たちの目的は　あくまで記憶の場
ハスタの捕縛は　そのついで
English:
It is all a matter of priorities. Our main goal is to 
reach the Memory Spring. Hasta comes after that.

Japanese:
誰も勝てない相手なんだから
私たちが　討ちもらしても
誰も　責めないと思うし…
English:
Regardless, he is someone that no ordinary person
can beat, so even if we cannot beat him, no one
will condemn us for it...

Japanese:
おわぁ　アンジュ姉ちゃんも
意外と　言うときは言うねんなぁ
English: Wow, Sis Ange, ya sure know what ta say...

Japanese:
さすが　海千山千の
教団関係者だけのことはある
English:
As expected of someone 
from the Church of Sly Foxes.

Japanese:
正直なだけじゃ
生きていけませんから
みんなも　それでいい？
English:
We cannot just live by only being honest,
after all. Is everyone fine with that?

Japanese:
あたしは　全然オッケー！
できることなら　あんなヤツとは
会いたくないもん！　絶対！
English:
I’m perfectly fine with that! I TOTALLY
don’t want to meet that guy again!

Japanese:
オレは　ヤツと戦いたい…
なんだかあいつは　この手で
倒さなきゃならねえ…　そう感じるんだ
English:
I... want to fight him... for some reason,
I have to defeat him with my own hands.

Japanese:
ヤツについては　俺にも
多少の責任がある　できれば倒したい
だがそれは　あくまで「ついで」だ
English:
The fact that he’s free is my responsibility.
So, if possible, I want to defeat him.
But, as you said, that’s a secondary goal.

Japanese:
ああ…
オレたちの目的は　記憶の場
わかってるさ
English: Right. Our mission this time is the Memory Spring.

Japanese:
じゃあ　火山の入り口の人に
話してみようよ
English: Then, let’s talk to the volcano’s gatekeeper.

As expected of the holy ground of blacksmiths...
it’s as if this place is a smithy itself.

Japanese:

English:
The god that blacksmiths revere...
The god of the Forge: Vulcan...

なんでもねーよ

ボクにとっては　常識だから

On the contrary, this knowledge is common sense in

なぜ　こんなことも知らないの？
English: That said, why do you not know about this?

Japanese:
答えられないでしょう？
知らないことになんて　理由はないから
English:
Well of course you don’t know. For what reason

the slightest inkling about?

Japanese:
ボクだって同じさ　理由なんてない
ボクにとって　当然のことを
当然のこととして　知っているだけだから
English:
It is also the same for me. I do not need a
reason to know. It is just natural for me to know.

Japanese:

行く？　帰る？
English:
So, what are you guys planning on doing?
Are you going to continue or not?

Japanese:
…コンウェイ
今回も　手を貸してもらえるの？
English: Kongwei, are you going to help us this time?

Japanese:
もちろん
キミたちと　出会ったときの
約束だからね
English:
Of course. I promised I would
ever since I met you guys.

Japanese:
…………じゃあ　行こう
少なくとも　行けるところまでは
行ってみようよ
English:
Then, let’s make our way through the
best that we can.

Japanese:
だな…　ずっと足止めなんて
ごめんだしな
English:
Damn right, ain’t no use twiddlin’ our thumbs here 
forever.

Japanese:
落盤のせいで　来たときと
道順が　違ってるようだから
気をつけて…
English:
Thanks to the cave-in, the path that we will have to 
take is going to be different, so do be careful...

Japanese: うへぇ～　蒸し暑い…

Japanese:

English: It’s a sound strategy.

On that note, I don’t think I can get used to this

Now, let’s head out.
