これは
どこぞで　嗅いだことのある
匂いやで…
English: Ah can smell it somewhere ‘round here...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
ジャングルに　果樹園荒らしを
退治しに行くのは　いいんだけどさ
English:
Going to the jungle to whoop that kid’s ass
is fine and all, but...

Japanese:
この町には　記憶の場に
関係ありそうなものは
ホントに　ないっぽいね
English:
It seems that this town doesn’t have
anything related to the Memory Spring.

Japanese:
図書室の文献には
この島にも　天上界との接点があったと
書かれてたんだけど…
English:
According to the book in the Church’s library,
this island was once in contact with Cielo...

Japanese:
人々の記憶から
忘れられているだけかもしれん
English:
It might’ve been a case of everyone forgetting as time 
went on.

Japanese:
あのイヌどもをとっつかまえて
シメ上げれば　なんかわかるかもな
English:
We might be able to learn something if we do catch 
those dogs.

Japanese:
そうそう　あいつら
とっつかまえて　シメ上げたら
果物も食べられるかもしれへんし！
English:
Right, right, when we capture ’em
they might also let us eat sum fruit!

Japanese:
はよ　北のジャングル
行こうや！
English: Let’s go ta the jungle already!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: はぁ～あ～…
English: Huh? Oh...

Japanese:
どうしたんだ　エル？
そんな　大きな溜息ついてよ
English: What’s up with that big sigh?

Japanese:
あんなぁ
シアンって　前世でも
孤独なヤツやったやろ？
English: Sian must’ve been lonely in his past life.

Japanese:
えと…
そうだったかな？
English: Was he?

Japanese:
誰も　近づけんようにして
ず～っとひとりで　創世力　守っとったんや
そら　寂しい人生やで
English:
Not lettin’ others approach, he protected the
Genesis alone. That’s such a sad life...

Japanese:
あ…　前世はイヌやから
犬生か…
English: Oh, his past life was as a dog so... it was a dog’s life.

Japanese:
そこにつけ込んで
マティウスのヤツは　あの子を
いいように　使ってるんでしょうね
English:
Mattheus must’ve been using that to take advantage 
of him.

Japanese:
そうだね　寂しさのあまり
マティウスを
頼っているんだろうけど…
English: That might be why he trusts her so much...

Japanese:
でもよ　オレたちからすりゃ
マティウスの　どこに
頼れる要素があるんだって　話だよな
English:
So why did he trust Mattheus, then? What part 
of him made him choose Mattheus over us?

Japanese:
それは　動物も守ると
あの子に　言ったからでしょうね
宗教家がよく使う　信者獲得の手よ
English:
Well, it is likely because Mattheus promised she 
would protect the animals. She is utilizing a technique
that religious leaders wield to gather believers.

Japanese: そういうものなの？
English: And that would be?

Japanese:
相手が　なにを求めているのか
キッチリと把握して…
English: Know what your target desires and tell them...

Japanese:
「信じていれば　手に入る」と言えば
ワラにも　すがりたい人の心には
よく染みるものよ
English:
“You shall obtain it if you believe.” 
Those desperate enough will be convinced.

Japanese:
なるほどな
弱ってるヤツに
うまく　つけ込むってことか…
English:
I see... basically just make use of
someone’s weakness to win them over...

Japanese:
信仰は　強要できないから
自発的に信じるように　うながすの
布教活動も　こう見えて大変なのよ
English:
Religious groups cannot use force in order to gain 
believers. Missionary work is not as easy 
as you may believe.

Japanese:
そんなにしてまで
信者を増やしたいの？
English:
Even with how difficult it is, why does
the Church still want to gather believers?

Japanese:
それは　単純だけど複雑な質問ね
見方によって　答えは
幾通りも　用意できるけど…
English:
That is a good question. There are many ways to 
answer it...

Japanese: 簡単に言うと？
English: In other words?

Japanese: 数は　力だからよ
English: Manpower.

Japanese:
戦争と同じだな
数が多ければ　金も優秀な人材も
手に入りやすくなる
English:
Just like in war. The more manpower you have,
the easier it is to hire skilled personnel.

Japanese:
あとは　信者の立場からすれば
同じ価値観の仲間が多いと
みんな　安心できるでしょ？
English:
To a believer, if they are among people that share 
their same values, would life not be less stressful?

Japanese:
なんか　そういう風に聞くと
人の心を悪どく　利用してるように
聞こえるよな…
English:
Looks like to me that they’re using 
people’s hearts for shady means...

Japanese:
あら　でも布教によって
一定の教育レベルも　守られるし
仲間が増えれば　助け合うこともできる
English:
When it comes to missionary work, a certain level 
of education must be observed, and having more 
allies makes it easier to support one another.

Japanese:
いいところだってあるのよ
要は　使い方次第ね
English:
It has contributed many benefits to society. 
It has only grown corrupt due to its misuse.

Japanese:
さて　次はテノスか…
早く　ガルポスの町へ
戻るとしよう
English: Next is Tenos. Let’s hurry back to town.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
…で　次のテノスへは
どうやって　行くんだ？
船で直接？
English: Then, how exactly are we going to get to Tenos? By ship?

Japanese:
いや　今の戦況から考えると
直接　船ではなく
マムートに上陸して　陸路だな
English:
We can’t go straight to Tenos by ship. Because
of the war, we’re going to have to go from Marmut.

Japanese:
テノス周辺は　海上封鎖されている
可能性がある　余計なトラブルに
巻き込まれたくはなかろう
English:
There’s a high chance that Tenos might’ve placed
blockades around its port. There’s no more need
for us to get into unnecessary trouble.

Japanese:
船が　手に入ったから
出港の時刻を　気にする必要ないよね
少し町を回ってから　行こうよ
English:
Since we already have a ship of our own.
There’s no more need for us to worry about
departure times. Let’s look around town for a bit.

Japanese:
ルカ兄ちゃん　話わかるや～ん
それ　さんせー！
ほな　行こか
English: Bro, ya say the best things! Agreed! Let’s go～

Japanese:
リカルドさん
どうかしました？
English: Sir Ricardo, is something the matter?

Japanese:
…いや　なんでもない
気にするな
さあ　行こう
English: No, nothing. Don’t worry about it. Let’s go.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
………この里では
転生者は　完全に疫病神扱いだね
English:
Everyone in this village seems to treat Reincarnators 
as some sort of plague...

Japanese:
キュキュたちも
ヤクビョウガミか？
English: Is QQ also plague?

Japanese:
ふたりは　関係ないのにね
巻き込んじゃって　ごめん
English:
You two don’t have anything to do with this...
I’m sorry we got you both involved.

Japanese:
それは　気にしないで
ボクたちは　自分の意志で
ここにいるんだから
English:
Do not fret. Ultimately, 
it was our decision to join you.

Japanese:
あーもう！　カンジ悪い！
絶対　こんな島
抜け出してやるんだからッ！
English:
UGH! I can’t take this anymore!
I’m definitely getting off this island!

Japanese:
にしても　あの野郎…
一体　いつから裏切るつもりだったんだ
English:
Still, that bastard... Since when was
he planning on betraying us?

Japanese: 最初からだよ
English: Ever since the beginning.

Japanese:
なに！？
じゃあ　おまえ　リカルドが
裏切ること　気づいてたのか！？
English:
Since the beginning? So you noticed
that Ricardo was planning on betraying us!?

Japanese:
うん
まあ　気づいてたっていうか
知ってたっていうか
English:
Rather than “noticing” it, 
I was aware of it from the very beginning.

Japanese: 知ってただぁ！？
English: You knew!?

Japanese:
よしなよ　スパーダ
そんなことより
これからどうするか　考えようよ
English:
Let it go, Spada. For now, we have to think
of what we’re going to do from now on...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
あーら
リカルドさん　ご機嫌いかが？
English: My, my, Sir Soldat. I take it you’re in good health?

Japanese:
てめェ…　勝負しに来たのか？
受けてやるぜ！
素手か？　それとも得物アリか？
English:
You bastard, have you come to challenge us?
Bring it! You wanna do this unarmed or no?

Japanese:
スパーダくん　乱暴はダメ
幽閉だけじゃ　済まなくなるでしょう
English: Spada, no violence. It might end up worse for us.

Japanese: なにか御用ですか　リカルドさん？
English: Can we help you, Mr. Ricardo?

Japanese:
…………
おまえたちの様子が　気になってな
English: I... was wondering how you guys are being treated.

Japanese:
おっちゃん　言いたないけど
様子が　気になるくらいやったら
端から　裏切らんといて欲しいわ
English:
Ah don’ know if this has occured to ya yet, old man,
but if yer so curious ‘bout how we’re doin’, then ya
shouldn’t have betrayed us in the first place.

Japanese:
ふ…
まったくだな
English:
Hm...
Indeed.

Japanese:
ねえ　リカルド
僕たちは　どれぐらいの間
ここにいないと　いけないの？
English:
Hey, Ricardo, how long do you 
think we’ll be here?

Japanese:
一応　罪人という扱いだからな
下手すれば　一生だろう
English:
You’re being detained here as criminals.
Worst-case scenario, you’ll be here for life.

Japanese: 一生！？
English: For life!?

Japanese: ざけんじゃねェよ！！
English: Are you freaking kidding me!?

Japanese:
…………
少し話をしよう
食事を　用意してある
English:
Hear me out for a bit.
But first, let me prepare you lunch.

Japanese:
腹が減っては　戦もできん
ほんなら　お呼ばれしとこか
English:
Can’t fight on an empty stomach.
It can’t be helped. Let’s git.

Japanese:
食い物のあるところ　ミュース族あり！
行かねばな　しかし！
English:
When it comes to food, 
a Muse does not decline though!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
よかったね　イリア
あんなところに　幽閉されなくてさ
English: Isn’t it nice that we won’t be forced to stay there, Illia?

Japanese:
まったくよ
あ～んな　なんの刺激もないところに
閉じ込められたら　退屈で死んじゃうわ
English:
Damn right. I’d die from boredom if
I was forced to stay in that dreary place.

Japanese: 退屈だと…　死んじゃうの？
English: You’ll die from boredom?

Japanese:
当ったり前じゃない！
人生　楽しまなくっちゃ！
楽しみのない人生なんて　墓場と同じよ
English:
Well, duh! You have to enjoy life! A life that
you don’t enjoy is the same thing as being dead.

Japanese:
えと…
じゃあ　この旅もイリアは楽しいの？
English: Then, are you also enjoying this journey?

Japanese: もちろんよ！
English: Of course I am.

Japanese:
教団に　村を追い出されたときは
絶望で　死んじゃいそうだった
English:
Ever since the Church chased me out of my village, 
I was so depressed that it felt like I was barely alive.

Japanese:
でも　絶対落ち込んだりしてちゃ
いけないって思ってたの
なにがあっても　楽しまなくっちゃって
English:
But, I told myself that I’ll never feel down again.
That I’ll enjoy whatever life throws at me.

Japanese:
たとえ教団に　追われる旅でも
行く先々で　美味しいものを食べて
いろんな人に出会って　楽しもうってね
English:
Even when we’re being chased by the Church,
I got to eat all sorts of foods and I got to meet 
all kinds of people.

Japanese:
だから　あたし
今だって　この旅　楽しんでるわよ
English: That’s why, I’m enjoying this journey.

Japanese:
イリアは　ホント
前向きだなぁ
そういうところ　見習わないと…
English:
You sure are optimistic, Illia.
I’ll have to learn from you...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
ねえ　スパーダ
リカルドのこと　まだ怒ってる？
English: Say, Spada, are you still mad about Ricardo?

Japanese: ああ
English: Oh, that

Japanese: …まあ　腹は立ってるかな
English: ... I guess I still am.

Japanese:
一緒に　旅していける？
やっぱり　一度裏切ったりされると
許せないものなの？
English:
Can he still come with us? So... just because he
betrayed us once means that you’ll never forgive him?

Japanese:
おいおい　ちょっと待てよ
ちげえよ　オレが怒ってるのは
そんなんじゃねェよ
English: Hey, hey, that’s not it.

Japanese: え…　じゃあ…
English: Then...?

Japanese:
オレが　おっさんに腹立ててんのはだ
オレたちに　兄貴のこと　なんも相談しねーで
ひとりで　うだうだやってたことだよ
English:
I’m mad at him because he never told us about his
brother at all. He just hung around, never even
bringing it up.

Japanese:
おっさんが　なに考えてたのか
知らねェけど　オレたちは仲間だろ？
なのに　ひと言の相談もなかった
English:
I have no idea what he was thinking at the time,
but aren’t we supposed to be allies? Like, he never 
asked any of us for advice.

Japanese: それが腹立つ　それだけだよ
English: That’s why I’m mad at him. Only that.

Japanese:
裏切りうんぬんの話なら
オレは　とっくの昔に許してるよ
English:
If it’s about his betrayal, then I’ve 
already forgiven him a long time ago.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
僕　思うんだ
アンジュは　立派だなって
English: I’ve been thinking that you’re a splendid person, Ange.

Japanese:
私が立派？
どうして？
English: Me, splendid? How so?

Japanese:
だって　アンジュだけは
ずっと　リカルドを信じるって
言い続けてたじゃないか
English:
After all, you were the only one who
believed Ricardo through it all.

Japanese:
ああ　そのことね
それは　ルカくんが
思ってるようなこととは　違うのよ
English: Oh that... That is not really the case...

Japanese: え…　どういうこと？
English: Why so?

Japanese:
私はね　ただズルいだけなの
リカルドさんのことを
心から　信じてたわけじゃないのよ
English:
You see, I am a dishonest person.
I never fully believed in Sir Ricardo.

Japanese:
ああ言っておかなければ
リカルドさんが　戻ってきてくれたとき
誰もあの人を　擁護できないでしょ？
English:
However, had I said that, would anyone have
stood by Sir Ricardo when he returned?

Japanese:
そうかもしれないけど…
じゃあ　信じてるフリをしてただけなの？
それは確かに　ちょっとズルいかも…
English:
That might be the case, but... If you were
just pretending to believe in him,
then that really is dishonest.

Japanese:
でも　あの人はちゃんと戻ってきた
私との契約を　守ってくれた
私が正しかったのは　ただの結果論だけどね
English:
But, he returned safely. He honored his contract.
Even though my “belief” was just a hunch.

Japanese:
正直に　自分の考えや気持ちを
口にすることだけが
常に　正しいとは限らない
English:
If you only speak honestly, 
you will not always reach the best outcome.

Japanese:
ルカくん　覚えておいて　ときには
自分を偽ってでも　正しいと思う行動を
選択しなければならないことも　あるのよ
English:
Ruca, take this to heart, there will be times when
you will have to deceive yourself but, in the end,
you will have to do what you think is right.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ヒュプノス
English: Hypnos

Japanese: タナトス
English: Thanatos

Japanese:
ねえ　リカルド
テノスのことなんだけど…
English:
Hey, Ricardo.
About Tenos...

Japanese:
なにか　聞きたいことでも
あるのか？
English: Is there something you’re curious about?

Japanese:
どうして
海上封鎖なんてしてるの？
English:
Why do you know about the blockades around
its harbor?

Japanese:
恐らく　テノスとガラムとの間で
同盟が成立したからだな
English: It’s because I knew about Garam and Tenos’ alliance.

Japanese:
ガラムとともに　レグヌムの戦域を
今より　拡大させ
レグヌムの戦力を　分散させるつもりだろう
English:
The battlefield between Garam and Regnum are
slowly expanding in order to slowly thin out
Regnum’s forces in the north.

Japanese: レグヌムは…
English: Is Regnum going to...

Japanese: 負けそうなの？
English: lose?

Japanese:
今すぐというわけではないが
楽観はできんだろう
なにせ　技術大国テノスが　相手だからな
English:
Not at the moment, but the future looks bleak. 
After all, we’re talking about the technological 
powerhouse of Tenos here.

Japanese:
確か　テノスは
石炭の産出で　有名だよね
だから　蒸気機関が発達してるのかな？
English:
If I recall correctly, Tenos is famous for its coal 
production, isn’t it? That’s why their development 
regarding steam engines is slowly growing.

Japanese:
ああ　機関車も　元々テノスの技術だった
それを　レグヌムと共同で
開発したことにして　鉄道を引っ張らせた
English:
Indeed, the steam locomotive once originated from 
Tenos and, with Regnum’s help, established a 
railroad between the two countries.

Japanese:
にもかかわらず　国境をまたぐテノスから
通行税をせしめようとしたことが
戦争の発端になった　…という話だな
English:
Nevertheless, the high fee needed to cross from
Tenos to Regnum is what caused the war in the 
first place.

Japanese:
ああ　いや…
戦争の原因など
今は　どうでもいい話だったな
English: Though, that sort of talk doesn’t matter anymore.

Japanese: そ…　そんなことないよ
English: Th-that’s not it...

Japanese: 興味深い話だったよ　うん
English: It was an interesting topic.

Japanese:
フ…　気を遣わせたか？
裏切り者の　俺の胸中を察して
わざわざ　話しかけてくれたのだろう？
English:
How considerate. You only talked to me because
you were curious why I betrayed everyone, didn’t you?

Japanese: え？　いや
English: Huh? No,

Japanese: そんなつもりじゃ…
English: that’s not what I--

Japanese:
ありがとう　ルカ
だが　おまえにだけは　わかって欲しい
English:
Thank you, Ruca. I just want you to understand that 
my brother,

Japanese: 兄タナトスは　本当に優しい男だったのだ
English: Thanatos, was really a kind person.

Japanese:
天を去るだと？
本気なのか　兄者…
English: Are you truly leaving Cielo, brother?

Japanese:
ああ…
オレは　もう奪うことに疲れた
そしてなにより　愛する者がいる
English:
I have grown tired of stealing. More so, I have 
someone I love.

Japanese: 愛する者だと…
English: Someone you love...

Japanese:
地上人の女をかッ！？
正気か　兄者！
English:
A human girl? 
Are you serious, brother!?

Japanese:
オレは　これから地上で暮らし
地上を守る
あの女のためだけに　生きる
English:
From this point on, I will protect Terro
now and forever. I’ll only live for her sake.

Japanese:
天上人としての誇りを
死神としての役目を
すべて捨ててしまうというのか　兄者！
English:
The pride of a Cielan... your duty as a reaper...
do you really intend to throw it all away!?

Japanese:
奪うよりも　守って生きていたい
おまえにも　わかるときが来る
必ず…
English:
I’d rather protect than steal. Eventually, there will 
come a time when you’ll understand what that 
means, too.

Japanese:
オレは　もう二度と天上界には
戻れないだろう
だが　弟よ…
English:
It’s most likely that I’ll never be able to
return to Cielo. But, dear brother...

Japanese:
もういい！　行け！
私は…　あなたを理解できん
だが　止めはしない…　さあ行け！
English:
Fine, go! I can no longer comprehend your intentions,
but I have no wish to stop you... Go!

Japanese:
すべてを　捨ててしまうだと？
クソ！　誇りと使命以外　我ら死神に
一体　なにがあるというんだ！？
English:
You’ll throw everything away? Damn it!
Other than pride and duty, what
else are we reapers here for!?

Japanese:
神の座と　天上界を捨てても
ひとりの女を選ぶ
English:
He casted aside his place in Cielo, throwing away his
divinity, in order to be with a Terran woman.

Japanese: 兄者はそういう　優しい男だったのだ…
English: That’s just how my brother is...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: エル　船酔いとか　大丈夫？
English: Hermie, are you okay? You’re not seasick?

Japanese:
ルカ兄ちゃんは　ウチの心配より
自分の心配しぃな
English:
Instead of worryin’ ‘bout me, 
ya should worry ‘bout yerself, Ruca Bro.

Japanese:
自分の心配？
どうして？
English: Why should I worry about myself?

Japanese:
ケルム火山で　大ケガしてから
なんか顔色悪い　気がすんねん
ちゃんと食べてる？　寝てる？
English:
Ever since ya got hurt in Kelm’s Volcano, 
your complexion has gotten worse. 
Are ya eatin’ well? Sleepin’?

Japanese:
僕なら　大丈夫だよ
ホント　エルは心配性だなぁ
English: I’m fine, I’m fine. You’re such a worrywart, Hermie.

Japanese:
…そうやなぁ
こういう　性格って
ヴリトラ譲りなんやろか
English: That’s right... maybe Ah got it from Vritra.

Japanese: ヴリトラは…
English: Vritra is...

Japanese: そうだね　すっごい心配性だったね
English: yeah, she was such a big worrywart.

Japanese: やっぱり　そのせいかなぁ
English: So that’s why...

Japanese:
ウチ自身が　みなしごやのに
なんで　他のみなしごの　面倒みてんの
…って　ずっと思ててん
English:
Ah was always wonderin why Ah cared so much 
’bout other orphans instead of mahself, 
even though Ah was also an orphan.

Japanese:
ホンマは　ウチも甘えたいのに
ヴリトラの影響なんかなぁ
English:
Honestly, Ah also wanna be spoiled. 
Maybe it’s cause of Vritra?

Japanese: 人に甘えられんのも　好きやねんなぁ
English: Not that Ah hate spoiling others, but...

Japanese:
今なら　甘える相手
いっぱい　いるよね
English: Now, there are lots of people that can spoil you.

Japanese:
ああ～　あかんあかん
イリア姉ちゃんと　ルカ兄ちゃんは
甘えられへんわ
English:
Oh... Not at all. Sis Illia an’ Ruca Bro 
don’ really spoil me that much.

Japanese:
イリア姉ちゃんは　大雑把過ぎるし
ルカ兄ちゃんは　甘え方知らんから
甘やかし方も　イマイチやし
English:
Sis Illia treats me too roughly and Ruca Bro 
don’ really know how ta spoil others. 
So Ah’m not really receivin’ a lotta love.

Japanese:
アンジュは　わかるけど
スパーダや　リカルドも
甘えやすいの？
English:
I can see that Ange fawns over you, 
but what about Spada and Ricardo?

Japanese:
スパーダ兄ちゃんは
兄貴肌やもん
女の子扱いはしてくれへんけどな
English:
Spada’s like an older bro. 
He don’ really know how ta treat girls.

Japanese:
リカルドのおっちゃんは　大人やからかな
なんか　距離感が絶妙やねん
つかず離れずって　カンジで
English:
And old man Ricardo’s like an adult. 
He has this air of mystery ‘round ‘em. 
He’s purty hard ta approach.

Japanese:
じゃあ　コンウェイと
キュキュさんは？
English: Then what about Kongwei and QQ?

Japanese:
あのふたりは　なんや
ウチらと距離置いてる　気ぃがすんなぁ
そやから　甘えられはせんで
English:
Those two, well... seem distant. 
Can’t really feel spoiled by ’em.

Japanese:
そうか…　そういうのピンと来ないや
僕やっぱり　人との付き合い方が
ヘタなのかなぁ…
English:
Oh... thinking of it that way, maybe I do 
suck at dealing with people.

Japanese:
そうやって　すぐヘコむところが
目ぇ離せへんようになって
心配になんねんな
English:
That’s why ah can’t help but worry 
whenever Ah take my eyes off ya.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
あ～　コーダは
ひと安心なんだな　しかし！
English: Coda’s relieved though!

Japanese:
あんなところに
閉じ込められるなんて
コーダは　まっぴらなんだな　しかし！
English: Coda does not like being shut in there though!

Japanese:
じゃあ　やっぱり　コーダは
リカルドのこと　怒ってるの？
English: Then, are you angry at Ricardo?

Japanese: 怒ってないぞ　しかし
English: Coda’s not mad though.

Japanese:
え…　でも　幽閉されるのは
イヤだったんじゃ…
English:
Huh? But, didn’t you say you didn’t 
want to be imprisoned...?

Japanese:
あの島は　キライだな　しかし
でも　リカルドは
メシ用意してくれたな　しかし
English:
Coda hates that island though.
But Ricardo gave us food though.

Japanese:
あんまり　うまいメシじゃなかったけどな
メシ用意してくれるヤツに
どうして怒るんだ　しかし？
English:
Even though it wasn’t really tasty. 
Why would you be mad at someone 
who gave you food though?

Japanese:
ああ…
食べ物が　もらえれば
なんだっていいんだね　君は…
English:
Oh... So you’re fine as long as 
they give you food, huh...

Japanese:
さあ　どんどん行くぞ　しかし！
世界中の食べ物が
コーダを待ってるんだな　しかし！
English:
Now, let’s charge! The world’s food is 
waiting for Coda though!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
ねえ　コンウェイは
どうして　グリゴリの里に
ついてきてくれたの？
English:
Kongwei, why did you come with us to 
the Grigori village?

Japanese:
天術を　封じられたわけじゃないんだし
コンウェイなら
いつだって　逃げだせたんじゃないの？
English:
It’s not like your Cielan artes are sealed. 
You could’ve ran away so easily.

Japanese:
ん～　ちょっと説明が難しいな
人は失って初めて　なにが大切だったのか
気づく生き物だから…　かな
English:
Hm... it is gonna be tricky to put into words... I think 
it is because man only realizes what’s dear to them 
when they have lost it.

Japanese:
それを　ボクは骨身に染みて知っている
だから　一度　関った以上
途中で放り出すのは　ボクの性に合わないんだ
English:
I know all too well and that is why I am not the type to 
abandon others oh so easily. Especially, 
when they are people I am concerned with.

Japanese:
ボクは
キミたちの旅を　見届けたい
最後の最後までね
English: I desire to see your journey through the very end.

Japanese:
ボクは　自分が後悔しないために
キミたちと　一緒にいるんだ
それだけだよ
English:
I chose to travel with you so I will not have regrets 
later on. That is all.

Japanese:
あの…　ごめん
なにが　言いたいのか
よくわかんないよ
English:
I... didn’t comprehend everything you said. 
Sorry...

Japanese:
ボクは　まだまだキミたちと
一緒に旅を続ける
それだけわかっていてもらえれば　構わないさ
English:
It is fine as long as you understand that 
I will keep traveling with you all.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: あの…　えと…
English: Um... well...

Japanese:
キュキュさんは　どうして
グリゴリの里で　逃げなかったの？
English: Why didn’t you run away from Grigori Village?

Japanese:
えっと
僕の言ってること　わかります？
English: Uh... you understand what I’m saying, right?

Japanese:
はい　だいじょぶ　わかる
ルカ　キュキュに　聞きたい
キュキュが　ルカと一緒の理由
English:
Yes. I understand. QQ understands your question. 
QQ’s reason wants to come with Ruca.

Japanese: うん　そうそう
English: Oh... Yes.

Japanese:
初めて会たとき
キュキュも　一緒　行っていい
ルカ　言った
English: From the start, Ruca tell QQ that QQ can join.

Japanese:
だから　キュキュ
一緒　行く　それだけ
いろんなとこ　見て回る
English:
That’s why QQ comes with you.
QQ wants to see a lot of places.

Japanese:
キュキュは　いつも　思う
みんな　ありがと
English: QQ always thinking “Thank you, everyone.”
Hmm...

Japanese:
{triverse}ENUKOE_TEATU_TEDABOTO_KON_NUBIJ
O_NURETISA_YSNA_KINUOTNOHAW
QQ_UOTAGIRA
English:
{triverse}ENUKOE_TEATU_TEDABOTO_KON_NUBIJ
O_NURETISA_YSNA_KINUOTNOHAW
QQ_UOTAGIRA

Japanese:
{triverse}AWOTO_KONANNIM
OMEDAMU_TIO_METTA_AGINAN
OYIA_NERUSA_WINIA_TTEZ
English:
{triverse}AWOTO_KONANNIM
OMEDAMU_TIO_METTA_AGINAN
OYIA_NERUSA_WINIA_TTEZ

Japanese:
ああ！　待って待って！
今　抱きつこうとしたでしょう！？
English:
Uh! Wait, hold up! 
Were you trying to embrace me just now!?

Japanese: はい
English: Yes.

Japanese:
えっと…　よくわかんないけど
お礼を言ってくれてるのは　わかったから
抱きつくのは　別にいいよ　ね？
English:
Uh... I don’t know why, but I got what you just said so... 
there’s no need for hugs. Please?

Japanese: はい　わかた
English: Yes, understood.

Japanese: えっと…　それじゃ…
English: Well... then...

Japanese:
うわぁ！
わかってないじゃないか！
もう　いいってば！
English: I guess you didn’t understand me! Oh fine!

Japanese:
ルカ　キュキュの気持ち
わかた？
English: Ruca, did you get QQ’s feelings?

Japanese:
わかた！　わかた！
ルカ　キュキュの気持ち　わかたよ！
だから　放して！
English:
I get it! I get it! 
Ruca gets QQ’s feelings! 
Please, let go!

Japanese:
はい
わかたなら　いい
English: If you get it, then that’s good.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
ここが　マムート
テノスと　レグヌムの間に
国境を構える　中立都市だ
English:
This is Marmut, a politically neutral town situated 
between the borders of Tenos and Regnum.

Japanese:
ここには　過去の領土問題から
どちらの国にも　属さないという
不文律があってな
English:
Because of past disputes, there’s an unwritten rule that 
this town remains independent of the two countries.

Japanese:
確か　商売が
盛んな町じゃなかったっけ？
English: If I recall correctly, wasn’t it a prosperous trading hub?

Japanese:
ああ　テノスとレグヌム　どちらにも
属さないおかげで　税金が安い
それが　商業の盛んな理由だな
English:
Correct. Because this town is independent from Tenos
and Regnum, the taxes imposed on business here are 
not as high which makes starting one here easier.

Japanese:
商売が盛んっちゅうことは
おいしいもんも　いろいろ
売っとるっちゅうことかいなぁ
English:
If this is a prosperous tradin’ hub, that means that there 
are tons of delicious foods ‘round here, right?

Japanese:
エルは　いつも
いいこと言うぞ！　しかし！
English: She’s always saying good stuff!

Japanese:
まあ食い物のことは　ともかく
補給はしておかねえとな
English:
By the way, we might as well stock up on 
supplies here.

Japanese:
ここから北は　過酷な戦場
少しでも物資は　豊富な方がいい
準備は　十分に済ませておけ
English:
Our next stop will be the battlefield north of here. 
Let’s make sure that we take our time preparing 
for the journey.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
この先　北西に向かえば　レムレース湿原
そこを越えれば　北の戦場だ
English:
Northwest of here is Lemures Marsh. 
Across from that will be the Northern battlefield.

Japanese: いよいよ　テノス領に入るのね
English: And beyond that is Tenos.

Japanese:
文献にあった　最後の手がかり
創世力について
なにか　思い出せるといいけど…
English:
Our last lead that we’ve gleaned from the library. 
I hope that we’ll remember at least something about 
the Genesis there...

Japanese:
なんとしても　オレたちの手で
創世力を　手に入れねーとな
English:
Because we need to obtain the Genesis, no matter 
what.

Japanese:
今回も　記憶の場があると
ええねんけどなぁ
English:
Would be nice if there were a Memory Spring there too, 
Ah hope.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
予想よりも　前線が
北に移動しているようだな
English:
The front lines seem to have moved a ways north 
from what I expected.

Japanese:
これなら　どこかに
補給できる場所があるかもしれん
English:
There might be a place that we can stop and 
replenish our supplies nearby.

Japanese: どういうこと？
English: What do you mean?

Japanese:
これだけ　町から前線が離れれば
町と前線をつなぐ
中継地点があるはずだ
English:
Once the battlefield is far enough from a town, 
a stopover is created in order to connect the two.

Japanese:
そこなら　うまくすれば物資が
手に入る可能性がある
探してみるといいだろう
English:
We might be able to replenish our supplies there. 
That is, if we can find it.

Japanese:
ここから　マムートに戻るなんて
まっぴら　ごめんだしな
できるなら　そのほうがいいぜ
English:
There’s no way we can go back to Marmut all over 
again. If possible, let’s do that.

Japanese:
じゃあ　めぼしい場所を見つけたら
寄ってみようか
English: Then, if we see something like that, let’s check it out.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
これは都合がいい
どうやら　レグヌムの補給中継地で
マムートの連中が　商いを始めたようだな
English:
How convenient. It seems that this stopover 
has been trading with Marmut.

Japanese:
じゃあ　必要なものを
見かけたら
買い足しておかなきゃね
English: Then, let’s buy what we need.

Japanese:
でも　軍服姿が
ちらほら…
English: Those uniformed soldiers...

Japanese:
そうだな
みんな　目立つようなマネは
くれぐれも　するなよ
English:
Good observation. 
Everyone, take care not to 
stand out too much.

Japanese:
「みんな」って　言うてるのに
なんで　ウチとコーダを見るねんな…
English:
Ya say “everyone”, but why are ya
lookin’ at us?

Japanese:
おとなししとったら
ええねんやろ
ホンマ　失礼やなぁ
English: Jus’ tell it ta us straight. Yer bein’ rude!

Japanese: 失礼なんだな　しかし！
English: You’re being rude, though!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
ここからが　いよいよ戦場だ
幸い最前線は　さらに北へ移動しているようだ
急いで　突っ切るとしよう
English:
From here on out is the battlefield. Fortunately, 
the frontlines are a ways north from here. 
Let’s hurry and cross this immediately.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
テノスの街は　ここから
北へ　まっすぐ向かった先だ
English: Tenos should be north from here.

Japanese:
いよいよですね
まずは街で　情報を集めましょう
English:
At last... We should hurry and gather
information in the city first.

Japanese:
アンジュ　気をつけろよ
テノスは　おまえを狙っていた
アルベールの　本拠地でもある
English:
Ange, remember to be careful. That man, Albert, 
who was after you is in Tenos. We might end up 
meeting him there.

Japanese: ああ　そうでしたね
English: Oh... indeed. Albert...

Japanese:
アルベール…
いったい　どういう人なのかしら…
English: I wonder, what sort of person is he...?

Japanese:
俺も仲介人を通じて　依頼を受けただけで
詳しくは　知らんのだ
English:
I only accepted his request through an intermediary,
so I have no idea who he really is.

Japanese:
確か　お貴族さまなんだろ？
だったら街で聞いてみりゃ　すぐわかるさ
English:
Pretty sure he’s a noble, right? We’ll know 
what kind of guy he is when we get there.

Japanese: とにかく　行ってみようぜ
English: C’mon let’s move.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ここが　テノスかぁ
話には　聞いてたけど
ずいぶん　寒い街だね
English:
So this is Tenos... I’ve heard about it before,
but it really is cold here!

Japanese: へ…　へ…　ヘッチン！！
English: A-A-Achoo...!!

Japanese:
寒い…
キュキュ　寒い　キライ
English:
Cold... 
QQ hate cold.

Japanese:
北の街だからね
南育ちの　あたしも　こたえるわ
English:
Well, it is the north. I can relate, 
since I was raised in the south.

Japanese:
上着の１枚でも
買っておくんだったぜ
English: I should’ve bought another coat on the way here.

Japanese: でも　活気のある街やな
English: It’s such a lively town!

Japanese: 食いもん　なにが美味しいんやろ
English: Ah wonder what delicious food is ‘round ‘ere?

Japanese:
この街は　蒸気機関技術の最先端
技術者が多いし　石炭堀りも盛んだ
活気があるのも　うなずける
English:
Naturally. This town houses state-of-the-art steam 
engine technology and numerous engineers. Not to 
mention, the large abundance of coal ores in the area.

Japanese:
景気のええ街やっちゅうことやね
そら　美味しいもんも
ありそうやなぁ
English:
So it’s a prosperous town! Ah bet there are some tasty 
foods waitin’ ta be eaten here!

Japanese: エルは　あいかわらず　いいこと言う！
English: Hermie always says the good things!

Japanese:
うまいメシは　なんだ？
さっさと教えろ　しかし！
English:
What’s the tasty food? 
Hurry up and tell me though!

Japanese:
寒い地方だから　体の温まる
シチューなんかが
郷土料理として　有名ね
English:
Local stews that will warm up your body are perfect for 
cold regions like this.

Japanese:
あと　エルには早いけど
お酒も　美味しいみたいよ
English:
And, although you are still a bit young for it, 
alcohol would be quite nice too.

Japanese:
さすが　アンジュ姉ちゃん
食いもんの知識は　豊富やな
食いしん坊　ナンバーワンや
English:
Ya really know a lot ‘bout cuisines! 
As expected of our number one glutton!

Japanese:
え？　そうかな
私は　エルが一番の食いしん坊だと
思うけど？
English:
Is that so? I was lead to believe that you 
were our number one glutton, are you not?

Japanese:
目立たないけど　実際のところは
アンジュが　一番じゃない？
English:
Excuse me, but I believe our number one glutton is
actually Ange, isn’t it?

Japanese:
キュキュ　知てる
アンジュ　食いしんぼ
English: QQ knows! Ange glutton!

Japanese: ああ　アンジュだ
English: Yep, it’s Ange.

Japanese: ………アンジュだな
English: Ange.

Japanese:
コーダ　ほれぼれ
アンジュの食欲だな　しかし
English: Coda admires Ange’s appetite though!

Japanese:
あはははは…　でも　ほら
昔から　言うじゃない？
「食に勝る　美徳はなし」って
English: Well, as they say... “Food is its own reward.”

Japanese:
昔からって…　知らないなぁ
そんなことを言った
偉い人でもいるの？
English:
I don’t think I’ve heard of that phrase before. 
Which distinguished person said that?

Japanese:
偉い人じゃないけど…
…私が　五年ぐらい前から
広めてるんだけど…　ダメ？
English:
Well, they are not really distinguished per-se... I may 
have been trying to popularize it for the past five years 
or so... does that count?

Japanese:
えーっと…　じゃあ
とにかく　情報を集めようか
English:
Uhh... At any rate, why don’t we just gather 
information for now?

Japanese:
遺跡とか　祭壇とか
記憶の場が　ありそうな
古くからの　信仰の跡をね
English:
Remember to keep an ear out for information 
regarding ruins, altars, or any old religious sites
that may contain a Memory Spring.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
なんやここ　暗ッ！
しかも　寒ッ！
風　ビュービューやん！！
English:
What’s with this place!? Dark! An’ cold! The 
wind’s practically howlin’ at us!

Japanese:
ここがホントに　信仰の対象？
そうは　見えないんだけど
English:
Is this place really sacred ground? 
It doesn’t seem that way but...

Japanese: なんだか　とっても物悲しい…
English: It feels... melancholic... for some reason...

Japanese:
昼間でも　光の差さない暗さと
寒さから　ここは「神待ちの園」と
呼ばれているみたいね
English:
This place is called the Celestial Garden. It earned that
name because, even durring the middle of the day, it is 
almost impossible for light to reach this place.

Japanese:
天上界からの恩恵を　待って待って
待ち焦がれて　造られた園…
English:
It is a place created after years of waiting for Cielo’s 
Blessing.

Japanese:
なあ　のんびりはしてらんねーぜ
アルベールとやらが
ここに　向かってんだからよ
English:
There’s no time for gawking at the sights. 
Albert might come here at any moment.

Japanese:
そうだね
先回りできるよう
急がなきゃ
English:
You’re right. We should hurry 
and go on ahead before they do.

恐らく　ふたりは街の奥にある
兵器工場だろう

Most likely, they’ll both be in the Arsenal further into 
the town.

Japanese:
そこが　軍の司令部を
兼ねているはずだ
ふたりのいる　可能性は高い

The Arsenal also functions as Tenos’ Military 
Headquarters, so it’s very likely that they’ll be there.

Japanese:

じゃ　さっそく行ってみようぜ！

ナーオスの兵器工場レベルの　技術を
独自に　持っているみたいだね
English:
It seems that this town has its own unique technology 
comparable with Naohs’ Reincarnator tech.

Japanese:
技術ったって　人を殺すための技術でしょ
そんなの　いくら持ってても
自慢にならないわよ
English:
By “technology” you mean “murder machines”, 
right? That’s nothing to be proud of.

Japanese:
うん
まあ　そうなんだけど…

Japanese:
そんな話をしてる場合じゃない
さあ　アンジュたちの元へ
急ごう
English:
This isn’t the place to have this kind of conversation. 
Let’s hurry to where Ange is.

俺たちの船の重みで
思うように　速度が出ないはずだ
English:
With the weight of our airship, this ship won’t 
be able to maintain the same acceleration.

Japanese:
ヤツらは
おそらく　艦橋にいる
急ぐぞ！
English: They are most likely on the bridge. Let’s hurry!

Japanese: ああ！
English: Yes!

Japanese: ……痛ッ！
English: Ow...

Japanese:
イリア！
どうしたの！？
English: Illia, are you okay?

Japanese:
あ…　ううん　なんでもない
治まってた頭痛が　ちょっと出ただけ
English:
Ow... it’s nothing. It’s just that 
my head started to ache a bit.

Japanese: もう平気　さあ行きましょ
English: I’m fine now, let’s get movin’.

Japanese:
ムリしちゃ　ダメだよ
ホントに　大丈夫？
English: Don’t push yourself. Are you sure you’re alright?

Japanese:
そう　言ってんでしょ！
ほら　さっさと行くわよ！
English:
Didn’t I say so just now? 
Come on, let’s go.

Japanese: う…　うん
English: Okay...

Japanese:
もしかして　あたし
マティウスに会うのを　恐がってる…？
それも　マティウスが恐いんじゃない
English:
Could it be that I was afraid of meeting Mattheus...? 
Not Mattheus herself.

Japanese:
マティウスに会うことで
なにかを　思い出そうとしてる
あたし自身が恐い…　どうして…？
English:
Why is it that I get scared at the thought of 
remembering something when meeting Mattheus?

Japanese:
あたしは
なにを　思い出そうとしているの？
マティウスの素顔に　関係あるの…？
English:
What am I trying to remember? Does it have 
something to do with Mattheus’ appearance?

このまま　南西へ飛べば　すぐだ
行くぞ　みんな！
English:
The Sky Castle’s just nearby. It should be
there soon as long as we fly northwest.
Let’s head out, everyone!

ここが　ウワサの天空城か…
English: So this is the rumoured Sky Castle.

Japanese:
来たことなんてないのに
なぜか懐かしく　感じる…
English:
I haven’t been here before but somehow, 
it feels kind of nostalgic...

Japanese:
確か　この城はアスラがラティオから
奪ったあと　センサスの砦として
使われてたんだよな
English:
If I recall correctly, this was once used as one of 
Sensus’ fortresses after Asura stole this from Ratio.

Japanese:
そんな思い出話は　後でいい
先を　急ぐぞ
English: You lot can reminisce later. Let’s go on.

Japanese:
そうよ　みんな…
マティウスなんかに
創世力は　渡しちゃダメ
English:
That is right. We must not allow Mattheus 
to obtain the Genesis.

Japanese: どうかしたの　イリア？
English: Is something the matter, Illia?

Japanese: あ…　ううん　なんでもない
English: Oh... nothing.

Japanese:
また少し　頭が痛くなっただけ
空気が　薄いせいかな
English:
My head started hurting for a bit. 
Maybe the air’s too thin?

Japanese:
ああ　そうだね
高いところは　空気が薄くて
頭が痛くなるって　言うもんね
English:
Yeah... I heard you can get headaches from being in 
high places because of that.

Japanese:
ムリしちゃ　ダメだよ
イリア？
English: You shouldn’t force yourself, Illia.

Japanese: わ…　わかってるわよ！
English: I-I know that!

Japanese: さあ　行こ！　おたんこルカ！
English: Let’s go, dummy.

Japanese: なし

Japanese: シアン
English: Sian

Japanese: イリア

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ

Japanese: ねえ…
English: Say...

Japanese:
なに　シアン？
あたしの家だから
勝手に　休んでていいのよ
English: What is it? It’s my house so feel free to rest there.

Japanese:
ホンマ　ルカ兄ちゃんを
助けてくれて　おーきにやで！
English: Thank ya fer savin’ Ruca Bro!

Japanese:
ちゅうことで　自分
もうアレな　ウチらの友達な
そやから　とりあえず体　治しときぃ
English:
That said, we’re friends now! 
That’s why ya should rest well.

Japanese:
ボ…　ボクだって　なんにも
できないわけじゃない
English: It’s not like I can’t do anything...

Japanese:
この村に　略奪に来る王都兵を
追い払うことぐらいできるよ
English:
The least I can do is chase out the Imperial Army 
when they come looting.

Japanese: シアン…
English: Sian...

Japanese:
だから　早く行けよッ！！
行けってば！
English: So don’t worry about me! Go!

Japanese:
ボクは　森の動物たちを守りたいんだ！
ボクだって　マティウスの好きに
させたくないんだ！
English:
I just want to protect the forest animals! 
I don’t want to let Mattheus do what she wants!

Japanese:
へへっ　シアン
あんたにも　甘え方っちゅうんを
叩き込んだらんと　あかんみたいやなぁ
English:
Sian, guess Ah’mma hafta teach ya ta depend on 
others properly.

Japanese:
帰ってきたら
じっくり　仕込んだるさかいな
楽しみにしとき！
English: Let’s start when Ah get back! Look forward ta that!

Japanese:
黎明の塔は
ここから　北東
魂の巡礼路カルディアを　越えた先よ
English:
The Tower of Dawn is northeast of here.
Just after the Soul’s Pilgrimage Chaldea.

Japanese:
そういや
飛行船は　使えないのか？
English: By the way, can we still use the airship?

Japanese: 稼働に　問題はない
English: It seems to be working fine.

Japanese:
ただ　黎明の塔へは高度が高すぎて
直接　乗り込むことはできんぞ
行けても　山のふもとまでだな
English:
Only problem is that the Tower of Dawn is too high to 
head directly towards it. The most it can do is take us 
to the foot of the mountain.

Japanese:
じゃあ　基本は歩きだね
さあ　行こう　みんな！
English:
So we’ll be walking from the foot, right? 
Let’s go, everyone!

English: None

Japanese:
ここを　越えれば
教団の本拠地　黎明の塔よ
English:
The Church’s headquarters should be just
after this place. The Tower of Dawn.

Japanese:
魂の巡礼路カルディアは　黎明の塔に
参拝する信者の　修行も兼ねてるって
聞いたことがあるわ
English:
I heard that the Soul’s Pilgrimage Chaldea
served as a way of training the believers
who plan to go to the Tower of Dawn.

Japanese:
うへぇ～
ほな　もしかして
結構　登んのキツいんちゃうん？
English:
So does this mean we’re not
supposed ta eat while we go up?

Japanese:
コーダは　コーダの村が近いので
よくここ　来たぞ　しかし！
毎年　何人か死ぬぞ　しかし！
English:
Coda’s village is nearby so Coda comes
here often! A lot of people die here every year!

Japanese:
おっかねえこと
さらっと　言ってんじゃねえよ
このネズミザル…
English: Don’t just say that so casually, you rat monkey...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
今の　なにか！？
すごい！
English: What was that!? Awesome!

Japanese:
おそらく　転生者を
動力源に使った　新兵器だわ
English:
Most likely a new weapon that uses 
Reincarnators as an energy source.

Japanese: 教団も独自に　開発していたのね…
English: So the church also developed their own weapon...

Japanese:
あんな中　突っ切って行かんと
あかんのんかいな
こらぁ　えらいこっちゃで
English:
Oh, brother... That doohickey cut 
through the middle of the battlefield.

Japanese:
マティウスに
創世力を　使わせちゃいけない
そのためなら　このくらい…
English:
This will be nothing compared to what will happen
if we let Mattheus gets her way.

Japanese: そうね　さあ行きましょう！
English: Damn right! Let’s get movin’!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: ハルトマン
English: Hartman

Japanese:
ほう…　左様でございましたか
それで　このナーオスまで…
大変でございましたなぁ
English:
I see... And to even reach Naohs...
It must have been quite terrible.

Japanese:
お坊ちゃまの　並外れた体力は
転生者であることが　理由でございましたか
はぁはぁ　なるほど…
English:
And to think that the Young Master’s extraordinary 
physical strength was because he was 
a Reincarnator... It makes sense.

Japanese:
な～んだ
異能者として　捕まるなど名家の恥だ！
…ってな具合に　怒鳴られるかと思ったぜ
English:
Whew, I thought you’d be furious because I let myself 
get caught as a Deviant and brought shame on the 
Belforma name.

Japanese:
じいは　もうベルフォルマ家に
仕える者ではありません
ただの老人で　ございますからな
English:
This old man is no longer part of that household. 
Now, I am nothing but a senior citizen.

Japanese:
ところで　その異能者…
転生者を　お探しでしたら
ひとつ　心当たりがございます
English:
On that note, I might have a lead about that De-- 
Reincarnator that you were looking for.

Japanese:
ホント？　ラッキー！
心当たりって　どんなどんな？
English:
Really?! Lucky us!
What kind of lead?

Japanese: 町の大聖堂は　ご覧になりましたか？
English: Have you seen the town’s Grand Cathedral?

Japanese:
一応　見たけど
だいぶ壊れてたようね
English:
Yeah, earlier.
It was smashed up.

Japanese:
あれは　聖女アンジュさまの
お力が原因なのです
English: That was because of the Saintess Ange’s power.

Japanese:
聖女アンジュのお力って…
じゃあ　聖女が大聖堂を　壊したの？
あんなにハデに？
English:
Saintess Ange’s “power?” 
So she was the one who destroyed the 
Grand Cathedral!?

Japanese:
ええ…　皆さま
「無恵」は　ご存知ですな？
English:
Indeed...
Are you perhaps aware of “The Fracture?”

Japanese:
教団が権威を失った
歴史的転換期を　指す言葉ですよね？
English:
I believe it was the point when the Church started to 
lose its authority.

Japanese:
元々　教団は地上人が　天の神々へ
許しを乞うために　創られたもの
English:
The Church was established to garner forgiveness 
from the Cielans.

Japanese:
我々　地上人のつぐないの心を
天に伝え　慈悲を受け取る役割を
務めておったのです
English:
It took on the role of a messenger who delivered our 
prayers to Cielo in exchange for the Cielan’s mercy.

Japanese:
その天から受けた慈悲が　奇跡…
天術って　呼ばれるものでしょう？
English:
And I believe that “mercy” is what brings forth miracles 
which are also known as “Cielan Artes”

Japanese:
そうです
しかし「無恵」以来　教団で奇跡を
見られることはなくなりました
English:
Correct!
But, ever since the Fracture, the Church has 
lost its ability to perform miracles.

Japanese:
でも　ウワサじゃ
「聖女」は　奇跡を起こすって…
English:
But the rumors say that the Saintess could 
perform miracles...

Japanese:
そう
「無恵」以来　数十年ぶりの奇跡を
聖女アンジュさまは　起こされたのです
English:
Yes. 
Decades after the Fracture, only the Saintess
was able to perform such wonders.

Japanese:
アンジュさまは
ただ祈るだけで　見えぬ眼も　立たぬ足も
どんな不治の病でさえも　治されました
English:
With only a prayer, Lady Ange was able to make the 
blind see, the crippled rise, and cure any illness, no 
matter how incurable.

Japanese:
それって　天術…
じゃあ　きっと聖女も
僕たちと同じ　転生者なんだ
English:
And that’s Cielan Artes... 
Then that must mean that the Saintess must’ve 
been a Reincarnator like us.

Japanese:
おかげで　ひと目　聖女さまに
お目通り願おうと　各地から
巡礼者が　大勢集まりましてな
English:
And so, people from all over the world made a 
pilgrimage to see the Saintess.

Japanese:
でもそれが　いけませんでした
巡礼者たちの寄進物を　目当てに
盗賊たちが現れ　大聖堂を襲ったのです
English:
The offerings the pilgrims brought caught unnecessary
attention and eventually, the cathedral was attacked.

Japanese:
と…　盗賊か　しかし！
それで　どうなったんだな　しかし！？
English:
B-Bandits! 
W-What happened next though!?

Japanese:
聖女さまが単身　盗賊に占拠された
大聖堂に向かうと…
突如　大聖堂は崩落したのです
English:
Alone, the Saintess headed towards the Cathedral 
and all of a sudden, it collapsed.

Japanese:
盗賊は　散り散りに逃げ去り
巡礼者も皆　無傷だったのですが
この件で　悪いウワサが流れましてな
English:
All of the bandits ran away and the pilgrims were 
unharmed, but afterwards some ill rumor began 
to spread.

Japanese:
ちょうど　異能者捕縛適応法が
施行された直後でも　ありまして
聖女さまは見せしめのように　連行されました
English:
In an instant, the Deviant Reformation Act
appeared and the Saintess was captured in 
order to set an example.

Japanese:
なによ！
誰も止める人いなかったってぇの？
English:
What the heck?! 
And no one tried to stop them?

Japanese:
異能者としての悪評が　巷に広まると
巡礼者たちは　手の平を返すように
聖女さまを　役人に差し出しておりましたな
English:
At that moment, Deviants already had a bad 
reputation. The pilgrims did not waste any time 
handing her over to authorities.

Japanese: チ…ッ　胸クソの悪い話だぜ…
English: Tch... that’s just disgusting...

Japanese:
その聖女は
どこへ連れて行かれたんですか？
English: Where was she taken?

Japanese:
役人の他に　軍人も来ておりましたから
ここから南東にある　憂いの森を越えた先の
ナーオス基地ではないでしょうか
English:
Perhaps, she might have been taken to the 
Naohs Base past the Forest of Sorrow since, 
aside from officials, the military also came.

Japanese:
ナーオス基地か…
よっし　わかった！
今日は休んで　明日さっそく向かおうぜ
English:
The Naohs Base, huh... 
Got it! Let’s rest here for the night 
and head off first light in the morning.

Japanese:
お坊ちゃま　聖女救出作戦でございますな
これぞ　騎士の本懐
ぜひ　ご活躍なさいませ
English:
Young Master, I assume that you intend to save the 
Saintess... I am pleased to see that your knightly spirit 
is still alive and well.

Japanese:
じいの説いた　騎士道を
お忘れなきよう
English:
Do you still remember what I taught you about 
the way of the knight?

Japanese:
ああ…
「心に剣を持ち　誰かの楯となれ」
「右手に規律を　左手に誇りを」
English:
Yeah. “Rest thine heart unto thy blade to become a 
shield for others. Upon thy right hand lay order and on 
thy left, pride.”

Japanese:
「己を殺し　永久の礎にせよ」
「正しき道を　正しく歩め」
「個よりも　全に仕えよ」
English:
“Slay thyself and be reborn as an exemplar of which 
the needs of others are foremost. As thou tread upon 
the path of the righteous.”

Japanese:
以上ベルフォルマ家　士道訓五箇条！
家の名は　忘れても
騎士の在り方は　忘れねーよ
English:
These are the Belforma’s Five Pillars of Chivalry! I may 
forget my own name but I’ll never forget the Knight’s 
path!

Japanese:
それでこそ
お坊ちゃまでございます！
English: As expected of the Young Master!

Japanese:
あ～…
コーダは　満腹で
そろそろ眠いんだな　しかし
English: *yawn* Coda’s so full that Coda has become sleepy.

Japanese:
かしこまりました
今　床の用意をいたしますゆえ
遠慮なく　お休みください
English: As you wish. Please have a good rest.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
これから
どうなるんだろう…
English:
I wonder what’s going to happen 
to us from now on...?

Japanese:
フンだ！
決まってんでしょ？
幽閉人生の幕開けよ！
English: Ain’t it obvious? We’ll live the rest of our lives here.

Japanese:
…僕　父さんの期待に
応えられないままなのかなぁ
家を　継いで欲しがってたのに…
English:
I’ll never get to respond to my father’s expectations... 
He wanted me to inherit the business...

Japanese:
おまえは　いいじゃん
オヤジさんに
目を掛けられてただけでもよ
English:
Ain’t that nice though? 
I’m only a nuisance to my dad.

Japanese:
スパーダくんの　ご実家は
騎士の名家なんでしょう？
親御さんの期待は　高くなかったの？
English:
You live in a military household, do you not, Spada? 
Would your father not have high expectations for you?

Japanese:
上に何人も　兄貴がいるからよ
継ぐべき　地位も領地も財産もねェんだ
ずーっと　放ったらかしだぜ
English:
I have a lot of older brothers after all. There’s no
more social status, land or fortune for me to inherit. 
I’m always neglected.

Japanese:
…じゃあ　ホントに
将来　騎士になれないの？
スパーダ　あんなに強いのに
English:
Then, you really won’t become a knight in the future? 
Even though you’re so strong?

Japanese:
まあ　騎士籍を手に入れるのは
難しいだろうな
English: Becoming a knight will be hard, but not impossible.

Japanese:
でも　自分に誇りが持てるような
誰かを守る仕事には　就きたかったかな
English: I always wanted to take pride in protecting someone.

Japanese:
スパーダは　そういうの
似合いそうだね
イリアは？
English:
That’s very much like you, Spada.
How about you, Illia?

Japanese:
あたしの村は　貧しい開拓村だから
学校もなくてね
English:
The village I grew up in is still slowly settling in,
so it doesn’t have a school yet.

Japanese:
だから　いずれ
村に学校を　作りたいなぁって…
English:
That’s why, someday, I’m gonna build a school in my 
village...

Japanese: そして　そこの校長になるのっ！
English: Then I’ll become its principal!

Japanese:
へっ　イリアが　学校の校長だって？
ガラじゃねーなぁ
English: You, becoming a principal? That’s so not you.

Japanese:
それ　めっちゃ勉強できな
あかんのとちゃうん？
イリア姉ちゃんが勉強？　マジで？
English:
Don’tcha have ta study a lot fer that?
Sis Illia studyin’? 
Really?

Japanese:
うっさいっての
これから　頑張りゃいいんでしょ！
これから！
English:
Oh shut it! I just have to try harder from now on! 
Starting now I’ll study more!

Japanese:
そうねぇ
でも　ルカなら　そこの教師に
雇ってあげても　いいかもね
English:
Oh! Maybe I’ll hire you as a teacher when the time 
comes, Ruca.

Japanese: いいね　それ
English: That’d be nice!

Japanese:
でも僕　ホントは
お医者さんに　なりたいんだ
English:
To be honest, I want to become 
a doctor...

Japanese:
わぁ　それええんちゃう？
ルカ兄ちゃんやったら
優しい　ええお医者になれるわぁ
English:
Oh! Ain’t that nice? Ah’m sure if yer tryin’ yer best
Ruca Bro, then ye’ll be a splendid doctor in no time!

Japanese:
家業を継いで　父さんと働くのも
イヤじゃないんだけどね
アンジュは？
English:
Well, I don’t really want to end up working with my dad 
in the family business. How about you, Ange?

Japanese:
私は…　そうね
田舎でノンビリと　教会住まいしたいな
English:
Me? Well, I would like to work at a 
church on the countryside.

Japanese:
食べ物の美味しい土地で
信者からのご喜捨で　質素に暮らしていくの
でもお祭りのときだけは　華やかに
English:
I would grow delicious foods from a plot of land,
give alms to believers, and just live plainly.
Except during festivals, of course.

Japanese:
あ…　あと温泉とか
名産のワインが　あったりすると
もうそれだけで　最高ね
English:
Oh... and perhaps relishing the local wine in a hot 
spring... That sounds almost like paradise.

Japanese:
アンジュって　現実主義だなぁ…
望めば　叶いそうじゃねえ？
English:
Ange, you really are a realist... 
If it’s you, you could totally pull it off.

Japanese:
みんな　夢があってええなぁ～
ウチ　将来のことなんて
なんも　思いつかへんわ
English:
Everybody has such nice dreams... Ah never even 
thought a bit about my future.

Japanese:
別にいいのよ
エルは　まだまだ子どもじゃないの
これから　見つければいいんだって
English:
That’s fine. You’re still a kid after all, Hermie. You’ll find 
it eventually.

Japanese:
ちゃうねん　ちゃうねん！
今なんか言うて　みんなに
ウチの夢　聞いて欲しいねん！
English: No! Ah want everybody ta listen ta my dream too!

Japanese:
じゃ　あたしの学校の生徒に
なりなさいな
English: Then, why don’t you enroll in my school?

Japanese:
あら　エルは　私の教会で
見習い修道女になれば　いいと思うわ
一緒に楽しく　ノンビリ過ごしましょうよ
English:
Dear, I believe it better if she becomes my apprentice. 
Let us spend our peaceful days in leisure.

Japanese:
ん～　どっちもええなぁ…
重要なんは　イリア姉ちゃんの学校で
給食は　出るんかっちゅうことやけどな
English:
Ohhh! Both are good. But the most important question 
is if Illia’s school is gonna serve lunches or not.

Japanese:
なあなあ　キュキュ姉ちゃんと
コンウェイの　おっちゃんは？
どうすんの？
English: Oh, how ’bout you, Sis QQ, Uncle Kongwei?

Japanese:
あのさ　ひとつ言って　おくけど
ボクはまだ　おっちゃんなんて
呼ばれるような　年齢じゃ…
English:
Uh... First of all, I am still not old enough to be called
an uncle.

なに　この豪邸…

こんな屋敷は　建てられねーだろうな
English:
There’s no way you can maintain this sort of
mansion through honest means...

風　匂い…　ああ…

This world’s sky... the wind...

Japanese:
キュキュ
彼らの前では…

Japanese: あう…

みんな　おかげ
ありがと　ありがと
English:
QQ happy! Thanks to everyone! Thank you! 
Thank you!

キュキュは　この国　たくさん見たい
キュキュ　みんな　気に入た
ずとずと　いっしょ行く
English:
QQ want see many things in this kingdom.
QQ want know about everyone. I want come

English: Everyone

Speakers:
0 [ルカ]
2 [アンジュ]
3 [リカルド]
4 [エルマーナ]
6 [コンウェイ]

Japanese:
なんで　オレを見るんだよ！
…わかってるよ
置いてけなんて　言わねーよ
English:
Why are you all looking at me!? I get it already! 
I’m not gonna say she can’t come anymore.

Japanese:
良かったですね　キュキュさん
スパーダくんも
一緒に来ていいって　言ってますよ
English:
Why, is that not the nicest thing, Ms. QQ? 
Spada said you can come with us.

Japanese:
ちょっと　得体が知れねーって
言っただけじゃねえかよ
English: I just said we don’t know what kind of person she is.

Japanese:
まあまあ　スパーダ兄ちゃんも
そんな　クサらんと…
English:
Oh come on, Spada Bro, ya don’ hafta be such

Japanese:
ふぅ…　それにしても　ここでは
一度に　いろんなことが　起こりすぎたせいか
めまいがしそうだな
English:
Sigh... Still, many things happened... 
I need a nap.

Japanese:
コンウェイ　ガルポス行きの
船の上ででも　まとめて説明してくれ
特に　彼女のことについてな
English:
Kongwei, you better explain it properly to us
on the way to Galpos. Especially about this girl.

Japanese: 了解
English: Understood

Japanese:
さあ　船に乗り遅れないように
みんな　ガラム港へ
急ごう
English:
Then let’s hurry to Garam harbor before we get left 
behind.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
ルカ…　イリア　エル　アンジュ
リカルド　あと　えと…
ヘンな帽子の…
English:
Ruca. Illia. Hermie. Ange. Ricardo. And... uhhh... 
Weird hat...

Japanese:
みんなの名前は
もう覚えた？
English: Have you memorized everyone’s name yet?

Japanese:
あ～　みんな　姿と名前違う
名前に意味ない
意味ない言葉　覚えるの難しい
English:
Everyone form and name wrong... Name no meaning. 
Word no meaning hard to remember.

Japanese:
ああ…　キミたちの民族は
容姿で　名前を決めるんだったね
まあ　おいおい　慣れるさ
English:
I see... Your race gives names depending on a

Japanese:

…キュキュに用事か？
English: What do you want with QQ?

Japanese:
ひとつ
確認しておきたくてね
English: I have one thing to ask.

Japanese:
…キミの生まれは
国境の　どっちだ？
English: Which border are you from?

Japanese: コッキョウ？
English: Border?

Japanese: 国を分ける境目のこと
English: The edge at where the kingdom is separated.
I see...

Japanese:
その質問は　聞きたくなかったわ
コンウェイにとっては
残念な方よ
English:
Had you not asked that question, 
I would’ve thought you were a deplorable man.

Japanese: じゃあ　キミの目的は…
English: Then your objective is...?

Japanese:
この国　見て回ること
それが　キュキュの国の役に立つ
English:
Tour this kingdom. That’s how QQ useful to her 
kingdom.

Japanese: コンウェイは？
English: Kongwei?

Japanese:
お察しのとおり
救われない魂の
最期の言葉を　聞くためさ
English:
As you have guessed, I am here to hear the 
unsaved soul’s last words.

Japanese:
ふたりだけで話す　良くない
みんなとこ　行く
English: Talk alone not good. I go to everyone.

English: None

English: Ruca

English: QQ

English: Um... well...

グリゴリの里で　逃げなかったの？
English: Why didn’t you run away from Grigori Village?

Japanese:
えっと
僕の言ってること　わかります？
English: Uh... you understand what I’m saying, right?

Japanese:
はい　だいじょぶ　わかる
ルカ　キュキュに　聞きたい
キュキュが　ルカと一緒の理由
English:
Yes. I understand. QQ understands your question. 
QQ’s reason wants to come with Ruca.

Japanese: うん　そうそう
English: Oh... Yes.

Japanese:
初めて会たとき
キュキュも　一緒　行っていい
ルカ　言った
English: From the start, Ruca tell QQ that QQ can join.

Japanese:
だから　キュキュ
一緒　行く　それだけ
いろんなとこ　見て回る
English:
That’s why QQ comes with you. QQ wants to see a

Japanese:
キュキュは　いつも　思う
みんな　ありがと
English: QQ always thinking “Thank you, everyone.”
Yeah～...

Japanese:
自分の言葉で　伝えておくね
キュキュは　本当に感謝してるの
ありがとう
English: I’ll say it in my words. I’m truly grateful. Thank you.

Japanese:
みんなのことは　なにがあっても
いつまでも絶対に
忘れないよ
English: I’ll never forget everyone, no matter what happens.

Japanese:
ああ！　待って待って！
今　抱きつこうとしたでしょう！？
English:
Uh! Wait, hold up! Are you trying to embrace me just 
now!?

Japanese: はい
English: Yes.

Japanese:
えっと…　よくわかんないけど
お礼を言ってくれてるのは　わかったから
抱きつくのは　別にいいよ　ね？
English:
Uh... I don’t know why, but I got what you just said so... 
there’s no need for hugs. Please?

Japanese: はい　わかた
English: Yes, understood.

Japanese: えっと…　それじゃ…
English: Well... then...

Japanese:
うわぁ！
わかってないじゃないか！
もう　いいってば！
English: I guess you didn’t understand me!  Oh fine!

Japanese:
ルカ　キュキュの気持ち
わかた？
English: Ruca, did you get QQ’s feelings?

Japanese:
わかた！　わかた！
ルカ　キュキュの気持ち　わかたよ！
だから　放して！
English:
I get it! I get it! 
Ruca gets QQ’s feelings! 
Please, let go!

Japanese:
はい
わかたなら　いい
English: If you get it, then that’s good.

English: None

English: Ruca

English: Spada

English: Hermana

イリアたちは　聞こえてること
知らないの！
English:
T-Then Illia and the others don’t know that we can
hear them?!

Japanese:
バッカ！　おまえ…
そんな大声…
English: You idiot! Don’t just shout...

Japanese:
ちょっと　ルカくん！
いるの！
English: Wait, Ruca are you there?

Japanese:
ええっ！！
なにやってんのよ　おたんこルカ！
男湯って　離れてるんじゃないの！
English:
Wait what are you doing here, you dummy! 
You telling me that the men’s bath 
isn’t in a separate building?

Japanese:
入り口は離れとるけど　湯船は　すぐ隣やで
しかも　中でつながってんねん
ウチ　潜って　探検してきた
English:
Ah checked an’ it seems like the entrances 
are separate but the bath ain’t.

Japanese:
ちょっと　ルカ！
早く　出て行きなさいよ！
出て行かないと　こうよ！
English: Ruca, you better be running outside! If you don’t...

Japanese:
ちょ…　なんで風呂に　銃持ち込んでんだ！
イリア　おまえ
オレたちを　殺す気か！
English:
Wait a second, why did you bring a gun to a bath!? 
Are you trying to kill us!?

Japanese:
お望みとあればね！
…って　スパーダもいたの！
あんたたち早く出てけって　言ってるでしょ！
English:
It’ll be my pleasure! Wait, Spada you were here too!? 
I told you all to get out, didn’t I!?

Japanese:
さっさと出て　さっさと寝なさい！
それとも　永遠に眠らせてあげようか！
English:
GET THE HELL OUT AND GO TO SLEEP!
OR ELSE I’M GONNA PUT YOU ALL TO
SLEEP FOREVER.

Japanese: うわあああああ！！
English: AAAAAAAAHHHHH

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
約束だったな
話を聞かせてもらおう
…彼女は　何者だ？
English:
As promised, I want you to tell me. 
Who exactly is she?

Japanese:
あの足さばき
まだ未熟だが
特別な戦闘訓練を　受けているぞ
English:
That footwork, although amateurish, tells me that she’s

Japanese:
やれやれ…
あなたの目は　ごまかせないな
そう　彼女は　あなたと同じ　軍人さ
English:
Oh dear, nothing gets past you, huh. 
That is correct, she is a soldier, the same as you.

Japanese:
まあ　軍人といえば
スパーダくんも　同じだけどね
English:
Well, I say soldier, but she is also 
quite similar to Spada.

Japanese:
でも彼女は　もっとあなたに近い
近代的戦闘訓練を　受けている
English: But her fighting style is more similar to yours.

Japanese:
それが　俺の雇い主にとって
不利益になる可能性は？
English: And the possibility of her harming my client...?

Japanese:
ない　それは断言するよ
ボクも彼女も　あなたたちの…
ルカくんの　旅のジャマはしない
English:
None. That I can assure. 
We do not intend to meddle in your-- 
Ruca’s journey.

Japanese:
それどころか　協力を惜しまない
ボクも彼女も　できれば
ルカくんの旅を　見届けることを望んでいる
English:
That said, we would still like to cooperate if we can. 
We just wish to see Ruca’s journey through to the end.

English: None

Maybe this was also caused by the one who laid

Japanese:
一人でこんなに

So you’re telling me that guy went here, ate all

Japanese: っと　とっととと！？

滑りやすくなっているようだな
気をつけろ
English:
It seems like stepping on these banana peels can

Japanese:
そういうことは
もっと早く　いってくれよ！
English: You should’ve told me earlier!

Japanese:
何事も身をもって
知るべきだと思ってな
English:
I figured that it would be better for you to know

Japanese:
バナナの皮も　大量にあれば
トラップにもなりえる
English:
Provided that you have a lot of them, you can make

Japanese:
つまり戦場で一瞬の油断が
命を落とす　ということだ
English:
What I’m saying is, negligence on the battlefield can

Japanese: それはなにか違う気が…

早く裏の森…　フルフィの森に行かなきゃ

そう落ち込むな
English:
At the very least it’s something we can use.
Nothing worth sulking about.

Japanese:
って　言われてもねぇ…
やっぱり　期待しちゃうじゃん？
English: Still... I got my hopes up, y’know.

Japanese: 現実はそう甘くない
English: Reality’s not that kind.

Japanese: そんなの　わかってますよーだ！
English:
I know that very veeeeery well, thanks for
the reminder!

Japanese:
まぁまぁ　イリア
今回はダメでも　次があるかもしれないし…
English:
Oh well, we might not find some now, but there’s
always a next time.

Japanese:
でもよ
宝箱って　そうそう流れてくるモンか？
English:
You really think that another treasure chest is gonna
wash ashore here again?

Japanese:
可能性はあると思うよ
町の様子を見ると　騒ぎになっていないしね
度々　流れ着いているんじゃないかな
English:
I think it is possible. After all, the town is not really
making a big fuss out of this chest, so it might be
a regular occurence.

Japanese: じゃあ…！
English: Then--!

Japanese: キュキュたち　またココ来る
English: We come here again.

Japanese: 待ってなさいよ　財宝ー！
English: Wait for me, MY treasure!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: 女の子
English: Little Girl

Japanese:
ねぇねぇ
なんでお姉ちゃんは傷がイッパイなの？
English: Hey, hey, why does the big sis have a lots of scars?

Japanese: あわわ……
English: Oh dear!

Japanese: この体の傷　キュキュの勲章
English: These scars are QQ’s medals.

Japanese: これは仲間　守たときの傷
English: This is scar QQ got from protecting allies.

Japanese: こっちは　敵の侵攻　防いだときの傷
English:
And this QQ got from when she defended hometown
from enemy attack.

Japanese: 女の子
English: Little Girl

Japanese: じゃあ　そのお腹の傷は？
English: What about those on your stomach?

Japanese: これは敵の将軍　倒したときの傷
English: This is from when QQ defeated enemy general.

Japanese:
{fixed}（キュキュさんの傷……
　ふれちゃまずいかと思ってたけど
　そうでもなさそうだ）
English:
... (I thought she didn’t want anyone to touch those
scars, but that doesn’t seem to be the case.)

Japanese: その足の傷にもなにかあるの？
English: What about that scar on your leg?

Japanese:
これは……
子どもとき　転んだ傷
English: This is... from when QQ fell as kid.

Japanese:
キュキュ　恥ずかしい
ルカ　イジワル
English:
It’s embarrassing.
You’re a meanie, Ruca.

Japanese: 女の子
English: Little Girl

Japanese:
お兄ちゃん
女の子はデリケートなのよ？
まったく　デリカシーがないんだから
English:
Big brother!
You gotta be more careful!
Girls can get easily hurt, you know?

Japanese: …………ご　ごめん
English: S-Sorry...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
なんなの　あいつ
自分から　声かけてきたってのに
あたしのこと忘れてるし
English:
What the heck’s up with that dude? He’s the one who 
tried flirting with me the first time and now he doesn’t 
remember me at all!

Japanese: 自分に都合の良い人なんやろなぁ
English: Whatta fickle fella.

Japanese: コンウェイ　大丈夫かな
English: Is Kongwei gonna be alright?

Japanese:
あいつなら大丈夫だろ
なにかされたところで　返り討ちにしてそうだし
English:
He’ll be fine, he’s Kongwei after all.
If that guy tries to do something to him he’ll be in a
whole world of trouble.

Japanese:
そうね
今は彼を待ちましょう
English: That is true, let us just wait here.

Japanese: みんな　お待たせ
English: I have returned.

Japanese: よかった　無事だったんだね
English: I’m glad you’re alright...

Japanese: あれ？　バーナードさんは…？
English: So what about Bernard?

Japanese:
ああ　用事を思い出したみたいで
急いで帰って行ったよ
それより　彼から　こんなのを貰ったんだ
English:
Ahh he just remembered that he had to do something
and hurried home.
By the way, he wanted to give us these gifts.

Japanese:
少し話しただけで
こんなにくれるなんて　親切な人だね
English:
He was quite a generous person, to have given us
such gifts just after talking to him for a bit.

Japanese: …本当に　話をしただけか？
English: Did you really just talk to him?

Japanese: ふふっ　もちろんだよ
English: Of course.

Japanese: それじゃあ　行こうか
English: Now, let us make haste.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ハスタ
English: Hasta

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: テメェ　こんなところで　なにしてやがる！
English: You bastard, what the hell are you doing here!?

Japanese:
ほっほー　クソ暑いのに
暑苦しい格好で　暑苦しい言葉を
吐くバカヤロウが　居ますなぁ
English:
Hohoh, a sweltering fella clothed in sweltering clothes
spitting swelteringly foul words appears in this
sweltering place!

Japanese:
ああ？
なにしてんだって　聞いてんだよ！
English:
Sweltering my ass, I’m asking you
what. the. hell. are. you. doing. here!?

Japanese:
見て　わからないのか？
海水浴をエンジョイしているところだゼ
English:
Are you blind?
Can’t you see that I’m here on a vacay?

Japanese: ンなコト聞いてねェ！
English: I don’t give a damn about your vacation, Hasta!

Japanese: …相変わらずだな　ハスタ
English: Sigh... You’re the same as always, Hasta.

Japanese:
おーっと　リカルド先生
先生も海水浴デスカ？　海水浴デスネ？
一緒に砂に埋まっちゃいましょう
English:
My, my, if it isn’t Professor Ricardo!
Are you on a vacay too?
Let’s go bury ourselves in the sand and swim later!

Japanese:
そのまま一人で埋まっていろ
なんなら　そこを永遠の寝床とするか？
今なら　花を手向けてやるぞ
English:
No thanks. Let’s just do this instead, you lie there and
go rest in peace, and if you do it now I’ll even throw in
a flower for you.

Japanese:
無抵抗の人間をやるってのか？
らしくないな　リカルド先生
English:
That’s so unlike you, professor.
The professor Ricardo I know won’t just shoot an
innocent person like me～

Japanese: 貴様が相手なら　話は別だ
English: It won’t matter if it’s an enemy like you.

Japanese:
なに？　オレ　ここで死ぬの？
それじゃ　ココは
「助けて～」とでも命乞いするのが筋か？
English:
Oh, is this where I’m supposed to die?
Did the director change his mind or something?
So... am I supposed to beg for mercy here?

Or would it be better if I shout “bring it” and get ready
to fight?
What do you think, little lady?

Japanese:
うっわ　話振ってきよった…
イリア姉ちゃん　答えなあかんで
English:
Oh no, he’s lookin’ at me...
Sis Illia, answer ’em fer me!

Japanese:
なんで　あたしなのよ
エル　任せたわ！
English:
Do I have to?
You go answer him, Hermie!

Japanese:
ムリやって！
あんなのの相手なんて
English: Noo, Ah don’ wanna!

Japanese: あたしだってムリ
English: Look, even I can’t deal with him.

Japanese: ほな　アンジュ姉ちゃんに…
English: Then Sis An--

Japanese: あれ？　どこ行きよった…？
English: Huh? Where’d she go?

Japanese: コソコソ…
English: *Tiptoe*... *tiptoe*...

Japanese: あっ　あそこ！
English: There she is!

Japanese: アンジュ姉ちゃん　逃げるなんて　ずるいで！
English: Sis Ange ya meanie! Don’ leave us behind!

Japanese: ふ…　ふたりが居れば　大丈夫かなって思って
English: I-I believe that y-you two can handle it.

Japanese: 大丈夫なワケないでしょ！
English: As if we can!

Japanese: せやせや！
English: Yeah!

Japanese:
アーハンッ！
これが　いわゆる放置プレイってヤツか？
オレサマ　初体験
English:
O-Oo!
Are we pretending to ignore moi?
This is my first time～

Japanese:
ヘンなの　なにいてるか
キュキュ　さっぱり　わからん…
English: Weird words, QQ can’t understand...

Japanese:
気にしない方が良いよ
特に意味はないだろうしね
English:
It would be better if you do not fret about it,
they mostly mean nothing anyway.

Japanese:
あ～　面倒くせェ！　話はそこまでだ！
今日こそ決着つけるぜ　ハスタ
覚悟はいいか？
English:
To hell with this!
Let’s just end this damn comedy act here!
Prepare yourself, Hasta!

Japanese: …君に刺された痛み　忘れてないよ
English: ...The place where you stabbed me still hurts, you know.

Japanese:
いやはや　みなさんやる気満々
ケド　ざーんねん！
English:
Dear, dear! Everyone’s fired up!
Sorry to ruin the mood, guys, but it’s time for my
beauty sleep.

Japanese:
わっちは今日は休み
あんさんたちの相手をしてるヒマはないピョロ
English:
If you were a few minutes earlier we could’ve gone
at each other, but I’m in a tight scheddy here.
Beautiful nightmares!

Japanese:
…まずいね
人が集まってきた
English:
...We might want to back off for now. 
They are gathering around us.

Japanese: 仕方ねェ　この決着は次だ！
English: Damn, guess so. Next time, I swear!

Japanese: グー…スーピー…　Ｚｚｚ…
English: Zzz...*snore* Zzz...

Japanese:
ああ　クソッ！
ホンット　ムカツク野郎だぜ
人をナメやがって！
English:
Dammit!
Damn bastard!
He’s totally laughing at us!

Japanese:
スパーダ　落ち着け
これ以上　騒ぎになる前に行くぞ
English:
Spada, settle down.
Let’s just leave before this gets out of hand.

Japanese: チッ…
English: Tch.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
あの女に１００人以上のファンがいるとか
あいつら　洗脳されてんじゃない？
English:
She’s brainwashing them!
There’s NO WAY she’d have a fanclub with over a
hundred members!

Japanese:
この前と比べると　一気に増えたね
彼女の教団内での人望が伺えるよ
English:
The club has grown considerably large 
compared to before. Chitose must 
be quite popular within the church.

Japanese: そうね…
English: True...

Japanese:
彼女の肩を持つわけではないけど
ある程度　人として出来ていないと
ファンはつかないわ
English:
I do not wish to speak in her place, however if you are
unkind to others then you will not get any fans.

Japanese:
あの女に人望？
人として出来てる？
English: Her? Popular? Kind?

Japanese: じゃあ　あたしなら１０００人は軽いわね！
English: Then I can easily get a thousand myself!

Japanese:
イ…イリア？
別に張り合わなくても……
English:
I-Illia, is this really something 
we should compete over...

Japanese:
あんたたち　今日から
あたしのファンクラブの会員よ！
English: From now on you guys will be part of MY fanclub!

Japanese:
会長は　もちろんあたし！
ルカ　あんたは幹部で会員番号０００１よ！
English:
I’ll be the president and, Ruca, you’ll be
Club Member #0001!

Japanese: えぇ～…
English: Do we really ha--

Japanese:
なに？
なにか文句でもあるの？
English:
What?
Got a problem with that?

Japanese: いえ…　なにも…
English: Oh-- Uhh... nothing.

Japanese: というわけで　解散！
English: Anyways, meeting over!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コンウェイ　今のって一体……
English: Kongwei, what was that just...

Japanese:
ああ　驚かせてしまったみたいだね
ごめんよ
English:
Ahh, apologies, it seems that 
I might have scared you all.

Japanese:
ボク　行く先々で
彼らにエサをあげていたんだけど
そのお礼のために　来てくれたみたいなんだ
English:
I have been feeding them while we were traveling,
they must have come here to give me this as thanks.

Japanese: その証拠が　ほら　この本さ
English: This book, see?

Japanese: うわ…　ヨダレでビチョビチョじゃん…
English: Ewww it’s covered in drool...

Japanese: こっち近づけんといてぇな
English: Ew, don’ bring it over here!

Japanese:
コンウェイ　この本　ふつうの本か？
なにかヘン…
English:
Kongwei, is this book normal book?
It feels strange...

Japanese:
その通り
この本には　不思議な力が宿っている
今後　ボクの力になってくれるはずだよ
English:
Exactly as you said, this book houses a strange
power. I am sure that its power will eventually become
useful to me in the future.

Japanese: なんだか　すごそうだね
English: I don’t know why, but it sounds amazing.

Japanese: んじゃ　ひと段落したしよ　そろそろ行こうぜ
English: Well, now that’s done and over with. Let’s go...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: 怪しい商人
English: Suspicious Merchant

Japanese:
アイヤー　そこのオニーサン
ちょっとコッチ来るネ　イイものアルヨ
English:
Aiyahh, brother, come here and check this out.
I have something good in store for you.

Japanese: なんですか…？
English: What is it?

Japanese: 怪しい商人
English: Suspicious Merchant

Japanese:
コレヨ　コレ　ガルポスで仕入れた幻のグミ
その名もトロピカルグミ　７つのフルーツの味が
するネ　１粒で７度おいしいアルヨ
English:
This, brother, I just acquired from Galpos.
Fabled gel, called Tropical Gel has taste of seven fruits.
Seven in one.

Japanese: すごい…　７色のグミだ
English: Whoa! It looks like a rainbow!

Japanese: 怪しい商人
English: Suspicious Merchant

Japanese: どうネ？　１個５万ガルド　とってもお買い得
English: It does, doesn’t it? Only 5000 gald. Very good bargain!
F-Five thousand!?

Japanese: え…えっと…いらないです
English: Uhm... I don’t need it, sorry.

Japanese: 怪しい商人
English: Suspicious Merchant

Japanese:
オニーサン　商売上手ネ　わかったアル
特別に３万ガルドにマケてあげるネ
English:
You’re good at bargaining, brother!
Fine, I give, I’ll sell it to you, special price,
only 3000 gald.

Japanese: あの…それでもいらないです…
English: Uhm... I’ll pass.

Japanese: 怪しい商人
English: Suspicious Merchant

Japanese:
今買い逃したら　一生後悔するアル
買わないと損ネ
English:
Not buying this gonna be lifetime regret.
Don’t miss out now!

Japanese:
買う前に　もう少しだけ
説明を聞かせてもらえますか？
English: May we ask something before purchasing it?

Japanese: 怪しい商人
English: Suspicious Merchant

Japanese:
アイヤー　オネーサンの方が話がわかるネ
このトロピカルグミ　食べればお肌はツルツル
髪はサラサラ　びっくりするほど綺麗になるネ
English:
Fuiyohh! Sis is very wise.
This Tropical gel make your skin soft and hair silky!
And you’ll be really pretty!

Japanese: すごいのね
English: Amazing～

Japanese: 怪しい商人
English: Suspicious Merchant

Japanese:
ワタシ　手に入れるの苦労したヨ
でも　オネーサン美人だから
２万ガルドにマケるネ
English:
This merchant had lots of trouble getting this, but
since Sis is really pretty I’ll sell this to you for only
2000 gald.

Japanese:
手に入れる…ね　そんなすごいものなら
国に売ったほうが稼げるんじゃないかしら？
…何故売らないんです？
English:
If it is that good, then would you not earn more 
by selling it to the government? What is stopping you?

Japanese: 怪しい商人
English: Suspicious Merchant

Japanese: そ　それは……
English: Th-that’s--

Japanese:
それに　そんなに珍しいものなら
どうして簡単に値引きするんです？
English:
Furthermore, if it is so uncommon, then why are you
giving big discounts so easily?

Japanese: 怪しい商人
English: Suspicious Merchant

Japanese:
ワタシ　みんなに幸せになって欲しいネ
だから国に売らないし　値引きするアル
English:
Sis, it’s simple. I want to make everyone happy.
That’s why I don’t sell it to the government and
make it cheap.

Japanese:
あら？
このグミ　よく見ると色が剥げてるわ
下地は…アップルグミかなぁ？
English:
Oh my, looking at this closely, it seems like the color is
slowly coming off, and apparently, it is... an apple gel.

Japanese: 怪しい商人
English: Suspicious Merchant

Japanese: ギクゥ！！
どういうことか　説明していただけます？
English: What is the meaning of this!? Explain yourself!

Japanese: 怪しい商人
English: Suspicious Merchant

Japanese:
オネーサン…鬼ね！　逃げるアル～～～！
この町は商売やりにくくて　仕方ないアルヨ～！
English:
She’s a demon! I’m leaving, selling here too hard
good bye!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: アンジュ　助けてくれてありがとう
English: Thanks for saving me back there, Ange.

Japanese:
ううん　ああいうのを見ると　どうしても
許せなくて…
English:
It was nothing... I just feel the need 
to act when I see such dishonesty.

Japanese:
それより　鬼だなんて酷いなぁ
私　そんなに怖い顔してたかな？
English:
Even so, was I really so 
scary that I appeared like a demon?

Japanese: す　少し怖かったかも…
English: Kinda... yeah...

Japanese:
次から気をつけないとダメね
それじゃあ　行きましょう
English:
I should be careful, next time.
Now, let us be off.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
うわぁ　すごい！
さっすが　マムート
にぎわってるわね～
English:
Whoa!
So this is Marmut... it’s so lively!

Japanese:
なぁなぁ　アッチの方
なんや面白そうやで
English:
Hey, sis! Look!
There’s sumthin’ interestin’ over there!

Japanese:
あっちもいいけど
こっちのお店も　いい感じよ
English: This shop also seems quite nice.

Japanese:
ね　ね！
自由行動にしない？
折角だし　ゆっくりみたいのよね～
English:
Hey, how about we all split up and shop?
I wanna take my time here while I can 
before we leave for Tenos.

Japanese:
ここから先は　過酷だからな
多少の息抜きも必要だろう
English:
Not a bad idea, we won’t have much leeway the
moment we leave town, so might as well take our
time here.

Japanese:
やった！
じゃあ　ルカ　ジャンプして
English:
Yay!
Ruca, you too, jump!

Japanese: え？
English: Huh?

Japanese: いいから　はい　ジャンプ！
English: Just jump, okay?

Japanese: よし…　ルカ　行くわよ！
English: Aight! Time to get movin’～

Japanese: やぁね　イリアったら…
English: Oh Illia...

Japanese: じゃあ　スパーダくん　ジャンプして
English: Okay, your turn, Spada. Jump!

Japanese: オレもかよ！
English: So I’M next!?

Japanese: 冗談よ
English: Just kidding～

Japanese: 冗談に聞こえねェっての…
English: You don’t sound like you’re kidding though.

Japanese:
はぁ…　面倒くせェけど
買い物くらいなら付き合ってやるよ
ほら　行くぞ
English:
Sigh... I was planning on doing something else,
but sure I’ll come with you.
We might need to get some stuff for the journey.

Japanese: おっちゃん…
English: Uncle...

Japanese:
ジャンプならせんぞ
俺も色々と　見たいものはあるが
騒ぎを起こされては迷惑だからな
English:
I’m not jumping. Although... I was initially planning
on checking some stores on my own, but it would
be a pain if something happens.

Japanese: 行くぞ
English: Come on, Hermana. Let’s go.

Japanese: さすがおっちゃん　わかっとるなぁ！
English: Yay, let’s git!

Japanese:
コンウェイ　みんな　ジャンプする
それ　ここの遊びか？
English: Kongwei, everyone jumped. Is it some play here?

Japanese:
さぁ　どうだろうね
キミも　見てくるといい
English: I wonder... You should go off and look around.

Japanese: コンウェイ　どうする？
English: What about you?

Japanese:
ボクはその辺で　本でも読んで待っているよ
じゃあね
English:
I will just read a book here while waiting for you guys.
Have fun.

Japanese: あー　楽しかったぁ！
English: That was fun!

Japanese:
思いっきり買い物するのって　久しぶり
とても有意義だったわ
English:
It has been a while since I properly went shopping.
This has been quite a memorable experience.

Japanese:
せやなぁ
うまいもんもあったし　この町は　最高やな
English:
Yeah, there were lotsa tasty stuff here.
It was amazin’!

Japanese:
面白いモノ　たくさんあた
キュキュ　もう少し　ココいたい
English:
Lot of interesting things too!
QQ want to stay longer.

Japanese:
その気持ち　よくわかるわ
でも　そろそろ行かないとね
English:
I understand how you feel, girls, but we will have to
leave soon.

Japanese: 来たくなったら　また来ればいいしね
English: We can always come back whenever.

Japanese: ほな　行こか

Japanese: ３人
English: 3 Men

Japanese: どうしたの　キミたち

女性の買い物に付き合うのって　大変なんだね…

English:
Girls really go all out on their shopping, huh...
She nearly blew through my money...

Japanese: ルカ　お前もか…
English: You too, huh?

Japanese: お前たちは　まだマシな方だ
English: You guys got off easy.

Japanese:
こっちは　あっちこっち連れまわされた挙句
エルが迷子になる始末だ
捜し出すのに　どれだけ苦労したことか
English:
I had to watch over Hermana and got dragged all over
the place. And when I finally got a break, she
disappeared and I had to look for her in this crowd!

Japanese:
みんな　お疲れ様
と　言いたいところだけど
ボクたちも　そろそろ行こうか
English:
My condolences, but unfortunately we must
leave soon.

Japanese:
彼女たちを　待たせたら
なにを言われるか　わからないしね
English:
Who knows what will happen if we make the girls
wait a bit longer.

Japanese:
ああ　これ以上の面倒は　ごめんだ
行くぞ…
English:
Sigh... you’re right.
Let’s head out.

Japanese: おじさん

English: Man

English:
I-I started this shop with my wife. When she died, the

English: Man

こんなことなら　アイツに料理を
教わっときゃよかった……

I should’ve learned how to cook from her when I had

English: Man

I’m not cut out for this, what should I do?

あなたに足りないのは　才能ではなく努力です
きちんと味見はしていますか？
材料は量っていますか？
English:
It was not a lack of talent, but your lack of effort that

Did you measure the ingredients?

Japanese: おじさん
English: Man

先ほどのパンプディングも
ぐちゃぐちゃで　ものすごく甘いだけ…

Japanese: これは食材への冒涜です！
English: This is an insult to the ingredients!

Japanese: アンジュ姉ちゃん　えらいとばしてんなぁ
English: Man, Sis Ange’s poppin’ off!

Japanese:
そういや　オレたちの料理にも
色々と言ってたっけな
English:
Oh yeah, now that you mention it, Ange also had a lot

Japanese:
うん…　食べ物のこととなると
アンジュ　厳しいよね……
English: Yeah, she’s surprisingly strict when it comes to food.

Japanese:
でも　アンジュ正しい
料理　きちんとやらない　まずくなる
English:
But Ange says right things. You gotta cook food 
properly or else it gonna be bad.

Japanese: おじさん
English: Man

Japanese:
確かに　ねえちゃんの言う通りだ
俺は　もう１度頑張ってみる
ありがとよ！
English:
You have a point. Alright! I’ll give it another shot!
Thank you!

Japanese: おじさん
English: Man

Japanese:
それとまた　来てくれないか？
ねえちゃんが次　来るときまでには
絶対　うまくなってみせる！
English:
When I do make it, would you mind coming by again
to taste it? I promise you it’s gonna be tasty next time!

Japanese:
そこまで言うなら
もう一度　チャンスをあげましょう
楽しみにしていますね
English:
Then, I will give you another chance. 
I am Looking forward to it!

English: You won’t be staying in your room tonight, will you?

Japanese:
外食するのが　楽しみなガキと同じで
大人も　たまには
外で飲みたくなることもあるのさ
English:
Look, just like how you brats like to eat outside,
we adults sometimes want to go out for a drink.

Japanese: ふぅん…　気をつけてね
English: Hm... Okay, take care then.

遅くなるから　俺のことは　気にせず
おまえらは　さっさと寝ろ　じゃあな
English:
Oh, and I’ll be returning late so don’t wait for me.

Ugh...
I drank... too... much...

White clothes...?

医者になりたかったのかな？
English: Maybe he wants to become a doctor too...?

僕らの夢の手伝いをさせてくれなんて

English:
I know! You said you wanted to

Japanese:
ありがとう　リカルド
おやすみなさい
English:
Thank you, Ricardo!
Good night!

このクソ寒い中
海水浴ってワケじゃねェだろ

I bet you’re not planning on going for a swim in this

せや！

私たちで　力になれることが
あるかもしれません
良ければお話を　聞かせてくれませんか？

We might be able to help, so if you do not mind,

あなたたちに　話したところで

English: Talking to you will never bring him back...

Japanese: 察するところ　恋人を亡くしたのか

…そうよ　彼はこの国の軍人

English:
Yes... He was a soldier assigned to the Northern
Front... Ye-Yesterday... I just learned that he died

English: Young Woman

これで　わかったでしょう？
だから　放っておいて
English: You got your answer, now leave me be!

Japanese: それで　キミはこの冷たい海に身を投げるの？

English: Young Woman

…ええ　彼の後を追うわ
あなたたちが　止めてもムダよ

Yes... I wish to follow him.

ボクは　止めるつもりはないよ
キミがどうなろうが　ボクに関係ないし

English: Young Woman

This vial contains a liquid that will bring an end to

あんた　ドサクサにまぎれて
バカやってんじゃないわよ！

Don’t mess with us, you’re not seriously planning on

Japanese:

I am merely offering it to her. Whether or not

Japanese: ね…ねぇ…　ダメだ……

English: Young Woman

Japanese: うっ…

Japanese: あんた　サイッテーよ！

Japanese: おねえさん
English: Young Woman

ライナスは生きてました！

Linus is still alive!

English: Young Woman

English: Tenos Soldier

はい
生存を確認しました

Yes, Ma’am, I was with him myself just now.

Japanese: おねえさん
English: Young Woman

Japanese: よ…良かった…良かった…

English: Tenos Soldier

English:
Now, if you excuse me, I’ll have to go and

English: Young Woman

生きててよかったね
だから　これ以降　なにがあっても
簡単に死ぬなんていわないことだね
English:
I am glad you are still alive.
From this point on, no matter what happens,

Japanese: おねえさん

え…ええ…
あの…ありがとうございます…
English: Y-Yes... thank you...

Japanese:
お礼を言う暇があったら
早く詰所に行ったら？
English: Why not hurry to him instead of thanking me?

Japanese: おねえさん
English: Young Woman

Japanese:
は…はい…
その…失礼します
English: Th-Thank you...

Japanese:
コンウェイさん
なぜ　彼女は生きているんですか？
English: I-- Kongwei, how is she still alive?

Japanese: 答えは簡単さ
English: Simple.

Japanese:
ボクがあげたものは
みんなが　考えていたようなものじゃ
なかったってことだよ
English:
The drink I gave her was not 
what you believed it to be.

Japanese:
なんで　あんなことしたのよ？
びっくりしたじゃない
English:
Then why the hell did you give it to her!?
You scared us!

Japanese: 敵を騙すには　まず味方からってよく言うだろ
English:
If you wish to fool your enemies,
you must first fool your allies.

Japanese:
それに　今の彼女に
口で言ったって　ムダだろうしね
English: Also, she did say that it was futile to stop her.

Japanese: 身をもって知らしめたのか
English: Basically, you wished to test her yourself.

Japanese:
なんや　コンウェイ兄ちゃん
優しいのか厳しいのか　わからへんわ…
English:
Sheesh, Uncle Kongwei. It’s so hard ta know if yer

Japanese:
どう思うかは　キミたちに任せるよ
さて　それじゃあ行こうか
English: Well, I will leave that up to you to decide.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
転生者の中には
ああいう人たちもいるのね
English:
Huh, guess there’s those kinds of people among
Reincarnators as well.

Japanese:
あ～あ　あたしもイナンナじゃなきゃ
こんな苦労してないのにな～
English:
Although, it’s thanks to Inanna that I’m in this
kind of situation.

Japanese:
そう？
僕はアスラでよかったと思ってるよ
English:
You think so?
Personally, I’m glad that I got reincarnated as Asura.

Japanese:
そういえば　ルカちゃんは
アスラにゾッコンでちたね～
English: Well, you do have a crush on him.

Japanese: そんなんじゃないよ

Japanese:

イリアに　出会えたんだって思ってる
だからアスラなのは　イヤじゃないんだ
English:
I think it was because I am Asura’s incarnation 
that I met everyone... especially you.
That’s why I don’t resent him for this life.

ちょっ…
な　なに恥ずかしいこと言ってるのよ！
このおたんこルカ！！
English:
Wh-What are you saying, you dummy!
You’re embarrassing me!

English: W-Wait up!

Japanese: やっと　気づいたか

Japanese: え～と　ドチラサマでしたっけ？

English:

Gang’s all here! What’s up? Oh my gods, don’t tell me.

違うっての
相変わらず　気色悪いわね
English:

Ye there, lassie! No take backsies!

Japanese:

気持ち悪っ！
English:
Ewww... Why’re ya suddenly talkin’ like me?
Disgustang.

Japanese:
気持ち悪いのは
なんとかバルドだけで十分だぜ
嬢ちゃん
English:
Oh girlie, if you want to feel disgusted, just take a look

Japanese:
で　ウチらを後悔させへんって
どういうことなん？
English:
So, what didja mean ’bout making sure
Ah don’ regret it?

はい！　それは　コレ
助けてくれたキミたちに

English:
Here! Y’all can have this, a special gift from Santa

Japanese:
プレゼントだと？
ふざけているのか？
English: A gift? You’ve got to be kidding me.

Japanese: リカルド先生　ここは空気を読んで

「ハスタさん　気前が良いね！
　ヨッ　男前！　惚れちゃう！　キャー！」

In these situations, you have to go “Oh～ Hasta’s soo

Japanese: って　喜んでくれないと　やる気が出ないゼ？

まっ　ど～～でもいっか！

Ahh well, whatever! At any rate, take this!

その名もハスタ・ノ・ヤリ！
大事に使えよ！
アデュー！

This baby’s name is Hasta’s Spear!
Take good care of her, alright?

Japanese: ねぇ…　逃がしちゃったけど良いの…？
