Japanese:
こんなところに本？
なんで落ちてるんだろう
English: What’s a book doing in a place like this?

Japanese: なに　これ…
English: ...What’s this?

Japanese:
なんだこりゃ
ラクガキか？
English: What the... are these drawings?

Japanese: うっわ　きったない…
English: Eww dirty...

Japanese: それより　なんなの　これ？
English: So, what the hell’s this anyway?

Japanese:
見たところ　文字のようだが
こんなものは　見たことがない
English:
Examining it closely, I assume it might be some kind of
script. However, I’ve never seen one like this before.

Japanese:
天上界の文字でもないし…
この本を書いた人　オリジナルの文字かな？
English:
It does not seem like Cielan script.
Perhaps one that the author made up?

Japanese: ボクにも　見せてくれる？
English: May I take a look?

Japanese: うん　はい
English: Here you go.

Japanese: ありがとう
English: Thank you.

Japanese: これは……
English: Ahh... I see...

Japanese: もしかして　読めるのか？
English: Can you read it?

Japanese:
まさか
こんなもの　見たことがないよ
English:
Of course not, I have never 
seen scripts like this before.

Japanese: そうか…
English: I see.

Japanese:
なぁなぁ　なんでもエエやん
そろそろ行かへん？
ウチ　寒くてたまらへんわ…
English:
Well, nuff of that, can we jus’ get goin’ already?
Ah’m freezin’ over here.

Japanese:
そーだそーだ！
コーダ　カッチカチになるぞ　しかし
English:
Yeah, let’s go already!
Coda’s body feels stiff from the cold!

Japanese:
だな
んじゃ　行こうぜ
English:
Good idea.
Let’s just go.

Japanese:
キュキュ
これは　キミが読むといい
English: I believe you should take a look at this.

Japanese:
その本　キュキュたちの国と文字　違くないか？
それなら　キュキュ読めない
English:
This book is in QQ’s language, right?
QQ would rather not read it.

Japanese:
見てみればわかるよ
それから　判断したら？
English:
I would recommend you decide 
after seeing it for yourself.

Japanese: …………これ日記か？
English: ...Is this a diary?

Japanese:
ああ
ボクの国ではなく　キミの国の人のね
English:
Yes. Seems that it was owned 
by someone from your country.

Japanese:
無垢なる絆の世界から　帰還者が
今まで　誰もいなかったのは　納得だ
これほどの強敵がいるとは……
English:
So the rumors were true, now that I’m here,
I agree that it’s near impossible for someone to
return back from the world of Innocent Bonds.

Japanese:
仲間は皆　死に　私だけになった
この地の寒さと　傷の深さでは
私も　もうダメだろう…
English:
The team I came in with was wiped out by a
formidable enemy. Fortunately, I managed to 
get out alive, but...

Japanese:
国命を　まっとう出来ないとは…
無念だ……
English:
I feel cold... my wounds are too deep... It hurts... 
I... don’t think I can go back anymore. I’m sorry, 
I won’t be able to serve my country anymore.

Japanese:
この日記を書いた人
諦めちゃったみたいだね
English: It seems that he had already given up...

Japanese:
そろそろ行こうか
ルカくんたちを　待たせてしまう
English:
We should go.
Let us not make them wait.

Japanese: コンウェイ　これ…ありがと
English: Thank you, Kongwei...

Japanese:
勘違いするなよ
キミにそれを渡したのは
ボクの欲しい情報が　載っていないからだ
English:
Now do not misinterpret my intentions. I merely gave
it to you because I had no use for it.

Japanese:
亡き同士たちよ
その魂　安らかなる眠りへと……
English: My brothers, may your souls find home.

Japanese:
……キュキュは　諦めない
なにがあても　絶対　国に帰る
だから　見てて
English:
...QQ will never give up, QQ will go home.
Watch over me.

English: None

Japanese: アルベール
English: Albert

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: アルベール　アルベール！
English: Albert! Albert!

Japanese:
え～と　キュキュさんでしたっけ？
なにか御用ですか？
English:
QQ, is it?
How may I help you?

Japanese:
機械の事　勉強する　したい
工場の機械　説明　欲しい
アルベール　お願い！
English:
QQ studying about machines!
Want you to explain factory machines to me.
Please!

Japanese:
うーん
一応　軍事機密もあるんだけど……
English:
I’m afraid that factory contains some
military secrets, so...

Japanese:
あう……
教えてもらう　ダメか？
English: Aww, QQ not allowed to learn?

Japanese:
まあ　いいでしょう
当たり障りのないところでしたら
説明してあげますよ
English:
Hmm... I suppose I can explain some
harmless machines.

Japanese: ほんと！　アルベール　ありがと！
English: Really?! Thank you, Albert～!

Japanese:
わわっ　離れてください
僕には心に決めた人が……
English:
P-Please let go of me!
I-I’ve already set my heart on--

Japanese:
こほん　ではここから
工場の入り口まで向かいましょうか
English:
A-Ahem.
Then, let us head down to the factory.

Japanese: その道中で説明していきましょう
English: I’ll teach you on the way.

Japanese: はい　わかた
English: Understood.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: アルベール
English: Albert

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: とまあ　こんな感じでしょうか
English: And that should be all.

Japanese:
いろいろ勉強　なた
アルベール　ありがと
English:
QQ learned a lot!
Thank you, Albert!

Japanese: キュキュさんは勉強熱心なんですね
English: You’re very diligent, are you?

Japanese:
キュキュが　見たもの　聞いたもの
いつか　みんなしあわせなること　役に立つ
そのために　キュキュ　いろいろ知りたい
English:
The things QQ hear and see will be useful for
everyone some day. That’s why QQ wants to
know a lot!

Japanese: だから　アルベール　ありがと！
English: So thank you, Albert!

Japanese:
ああっ　だから
僕には心に決めた人が……
English:
C-Can you p-please let go?
As I-I’ve said, I’ve already--

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
坊ちゃんたち　最近チトセちゃんと会ってる？
あの子　全然来なくて…　忙しいのかねぇ…？
English:
Young man, have you met Chitose lately?
That child hasn’t been visiting home, it’s strange.

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
ああ　そうそう
旅立っていった子が帰ってきたよ
かわいい　お嫁さんを連れてきたみたいでね
English:
Oh, right!
Those chicks came back here, look! Isn’t it cute?
They even brought home a wife!

Japanese: 小鳥
English: Small Bird

Japanese: ピィ
English: Tweet!

Japanese: 小鳥
English: Small Bird

Japanese: ピピ！
English: Tweet tweet!

Japanese: かわいらしいですね
English: Oh how lovely!

Japanese: 鳥か　いいスープが取れるんだな
English: Coda bets these birds would make great soup!

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
こら！　あんた　なに物騒なこと言ってんの！
坊ちゃんたちも　ペットはきちんと
しつけないとダメだよ　まったく…
English:
You! What do you think you’re saying!?
You people should properly teach your pet...!

Japanese: ご…ごめんなさい…
English: S-Sorry...

Japanese: 小鳥
English: Small Bird

Japanese: ピィ！　ピィ！
English: Tweet! Tweet!

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese: ほら　あの子たちも　そう言ってるよ
English: Look, these birds think so too!

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
ああ　そうそう　あんたたちに１つ
お願いがあるんだ
English:
Oh, right!
There’s one thing I’d like to ask of you.

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
もし　チトセちゃんに会ったら
このこと　教えてあげてくれる？
English:
I’d like to teach you this recipe, just in case you
meet her.

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
あの子　あたしの作ったサバみそパスタが
好きだったからさ　これ持ってって
ついでに作ってあげてよ
English:
That child liked my Miso Mackarel Spaghetti, you see.
If you take this, you can make her some if you ever
meet her again.

Japanese: おー　これは幻のレシピ！
English: Oh! It’s a Fabled Recipe!

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
幻のレシピ？
あたしのレシピが？
English:
A Fabled Recipe?
Do you perhaps mean my recipe?

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
そういえば　この料理って
なにか　いわれがあったねぇ
えーっと…　なんだったかしら…
English:
Now that you mention it, this recipe has some history
behind it, but I don’t really remember...

Japanese:
異国の饗宴
彼の王が食し　愛した庶民の味
だが　すでに失われて遠く久しい
English:
It’s a loong time ago, but there was a time when a
king fell in love with a foreign country’s local food.

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
ああー　思い出した　思い出した
昔　この国で不作が続いたときに
パスタを持った旅人が来たんだよ
English:
Oh I remember! A long time ago, this country fell into 
a series of poor harvests. That was when travellers 
came here carrying pasta.

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
ライスも野菜もなくて　魚しか出せなくてねぇ
ちょうど　そのとき出したのが
サバみそだったんだよ
English:
With no rice nor vegetables, the people had to make do 
with fish. At that time, the only thing they could serve 
was Miso Mackarel.

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
それで　量が足りなかったのか
旅人はパスタの上に　サバみそをのせて食べてね
それが非常に　おいしかったそうだよ
English:
Unsatisfied with the amount of food served to them, 
they started eating it with the pasta! And it was 
really tasty!

Japanese:
パスタもサバみそも　どっちもええ味してるから
うまいんは当然やな
English:
Ah bet it was, that’s cause Miso Mackarel an’ pasta 
both taste good on their own!

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
実は　この話には続きがあってね
その旅人は　とある国の王様だったそうなのよ
English:
And there’s more! That traveller turned out to be a 
king from another country!

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
どうやら　お忍びで来てたみたいで
城に帰ってからも　サバみそパスタを
食べていたみたいなの
English:
Apparently, he anonymously visited this country and 
when he returned back to his castle, he had asked his 
people to serve him Miso Mackarel Pasta.

Japanese:
そこから　噂が噂を呼び
やがて幻と化したんだろうね
English:
As time passed, those rumors slowly grew to 
become a Fable itself.

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
幻ってほど　幻でもないんだけどねぇ
この辺の家じゃ　当たり前に食べられてるし
English:
But, technically, it’s not really fabled.
It’s a common dish around this area.

Japanese:
ぬふぬふ～
早く　サバみそパスタを作るんだな
English: Coda can’t wait to try Miso Mackarel Pasta～

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
坊ちゃんたちが　作って食べるのは良いけど
機会があったら　チトセちゃんにも
作ってあげてね
English:
It’s nice to make it for yourself and all, but please
cook some for Chitose when you get the chance.

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
女の子がずっと暗い顔してちゃ　なんでしょ？
それじゃあ　よろしく頼んだよ
English:
I wonder why she always had such a dark expression
on her face...? Well, I’m counting on you!

English: None

よろしく伝えといておくれよ　じゃあね
English:
Are you leaving?
Then, I’ll be counting on you to make her some if you

Japanese:
その顔……
なぁ　あんた…もしかしてリカルドって人か…？
English:
That face...
Are you perhaps, Ricardo?

Japanese: そうだが？
English: And what if I am?

Japanese: アントン
English: Anton

Japanese:
おっと　そんなに警戒しないでくれよ
オレはアントン　ハリーの友人だ
English:
Oh, no need to keep your guard up, I’m Anton,
Harry’s friend.

Japanese:
ハリーさんって　前にリカルドに憧れてるって
言ってた人だよね？
English:
By Harry, do you perhaps mean the one who told
Ricardo he looked up to him, right?

Japanese: で　その友人がなんの用なの？
English: And what does this so-called “friend” need with us?

Japanese: アントン
English: Anton

Japanese: それが………
English: That is...

Japanese:
なに勿体ぶってんのよ
さっさと言っちゃいなさいよね
English:
What are you pausing for!?
Hurry up and spit it out!

Japanese: アントン
English: Anton

Japanese:
その…突然だけど
ハリーのやつ…この前　亡くなったんだ…
English: Uhm... it’s a bit sudden, but Harry... he’s gone.

Japanese: どういうことか　説明していただけますか？
English: Gone? Would you mind telling us... how?

Japanese: アントン
English: Anton

Japanese:
人から聞いた話だけど…
あいつ　一緒に仕事をしてたやつをかばって……
English:
I’ve only heard it from someone, but apparently he
died protecting others while on a job...

Japanese: アントン
English: Anton

Japanese:
リカルドさんに助けられたように
もし　仲間がやられそうになったら
助けるって　ずっと言ってたんだ
English:
He always said that he’d protect allies in danger the
same way you protected him, Ricardo.

Japanese: アントン
English: Anton

Japanese:
まさか自分が死ぬなんて
思ってなかっただろうに…
English: But to think that he’d die in the process...

Japanese:
覚悟のない者は傭兵などできん
そんなやつは邪魔なだけだ
English:
An unprepared person cannot be a mercenary, he
just ended up making himself a bother to others.

Japanese: アントン
English: Anton

Japanese:
そんな言い方…！！
いや…そうだな…　傭兵ならそうだろうよ…
English:
Why do you have to put it that--
No... You’re right. That’s just how mercenaries are.

Japanese: アントン
English: Anton

Japanese:
……あいつ　リカルドさんに会えたって
すげぇ　喜んでた
English:
You know, he...
Harry was really happy to have met you.

Japanese: アントン
English: Anton

Japanese:
今度の仕事も絶対　生きて帰ってくるって…
そして　リカルドさんと一緒に戦場に立つって
言ってたんだ……　それなのに…！！
English:
He said that he’d definitely return from his job,
and fight alongside you on the battlefield!
But still...!!

Japanese:
話はそれだけか？
それなら　先を急がせてもらう
English:
Is that all?
If it is, I’ll be going on ahead.

Japanese: アントン
English: Anton

Japanese:
待ってくれ！
これを…これを持ってってくれ！
English:
Wait!
...Please take this!

Japanese: これは…？
English: What is it?

Japanese: アントン
English: Anton

Japanese:
ハリーが　もし自分が帰らなかったら
リカルドさんにこれを渡してくれって…
English: Harry told me to give it to you if he didn’t come back...

Japanese: アントン
English: Anton

Japanese:
少しでもリカルドさんのお役に
立ちたいからってさ…
English: He wanted to help you in any way he could.

Japanese: そうか…　ありがたく頂戴しよう
English: I see... Then, I’ll take care of it.

Japanese: アントン
English: Anton

Japanese: じゃあ　オレはこれで…
English: And I’ll be going myself.

Japanese: さて　俺たちも行くとするか
English: Right, shall we go?

Japanese:
ねぇ　リカルド　悲しくないの…？
その…ハリーさんのこと……
English:
Ricardo...
Aren’t you a bit sad about Harry?

Japanese:
……１度や２度会ったくらいのヤツに
感傷を抱くほど　俺はできた人間じゃない
English:
I’m not soft-hearted enough to be sentimental
about a person I’ve only met once or twice.

Japanese:
……言っておくが　戦場に身を投じていれば
こんなことは日常茶飯事だ
感傷をはさむ余地など…ない
English:
Let me be clear, losing someone is common on the 
battlefield, and in a place where your life is always 
at stake, sentimentality is... just a hinderance.

Japanese: そうだよね…　ごめん…
English: ...You’re right. I’m sorry...

Japanese:
仲間をかばって…か…
…仲間思いのいいやつだったのだろうな
残念だ
English:
Harry... A shame, he must have been a good man,
to have died protecting someone.

Japanese: 一緒に戦えたら……
English: Had we only fought together then...

Japanese: いや…今考えたところでな…
English: No, now’s not the time to think of...

Japanese: 次は戦のない世で出会いたいものだな
English: I hope we meet again, in a world without war.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: どうしました？
English: What’s the matter?

Japanese: 傭兵
English: Mercenary

Japanese: 実は　峠に野盗が出て困ってるんだ
English:
Bandits appeared in Regnum Pass, you see, and 
they’re really hard to deal with.

Japanese:
それを退治するのが
お前たちの仕事じゃないのか？
English: Isn’t it supposed to be your job to get rid of them?

Japanese: 傭兵
English: Mercenary

Japanese:
我々もそうしたいところなのだが
野盗は狡猾で　捜しても見つからないんだ
English:
We tried, but they’re shrewd! We tried searching all over 
the pass but couldn’t find neither hide nor hair of them.

Japanese: 傭兵
English: Mercenary

Japanese:
女性や子ども　老人のような
弱い者たちしか　襲わないような
卑劣な野盗なので　なんとかしたいのだが……
English:
They’re despicable too! They only attack women, 
children, and the elderly! Truly the lowest of the low! 
Someone has to do something!

Japanese:
それなら　うちの女性陣の
誰かがオトリにでもなって……
English: Then how about we send one of the girls in as decoys?

Japanese:
ちょっと
あたしたちに　オトリになれっての！？
English:
What the hell, Spada!? Are you saying WE have to 
be decoys? REALLY?

Japanese:
私たちみたいな　か弱い女性を
オトリにしようなんて　スパーダくん最低よ？
English:
How horrible of you, Spada, how dare you suggest us 
delicate ladies to act as decoys.

Japanese: そーや　そーや！
English: Yeah! Spada Bro ya jerk!

Japanese: さいてー　さいてー
English: Jerk!

Japanese:
ぐおっ　そこまで言うことないだろ！？
オレは１つの案を出しただけで……
なあ　リカルド
English:
Come on, you don’t have to put it that way. 
It’s just a suggestion right, Ricardo?

Japanese:
アンジュを
危険に晒すわけには　いかないからな
その案は却下だ
English:
No. I’m not letting you put Ange in a dangerous 
situation. Think up of another one.

Japanese:
そうだね　イリアにも
エルにも　キュキュさんにも
オトリなんて　危険なことさせられないよ
English:
He’s right! I don’t want Illia, QQ, or Hermie to get 
hurt either!

Japanese: てめぇら　裏切ったなぁ！
English: You traitors!

Japanese: となると……
English: In that case...

Japanese:
……どうして
みんな　ボクの方を見るんだい？
English: ...What?

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
あっ　おかえり
どうだった？
English: Ah, welcome back, how did it go?

Japanese:
もうバカなことしようなんて思わないように
しっかり　お仕置きしてきたよ
English:
Oh nothing, I just made sure that they properly 
learnt their lesson. You will not see them ever again.

Japanese: 傭兵
English: Mercenary

Japanese:
そうか　助かった
また　野盗が出たときは力を貸してくれ
English:
Oh... thank Cielo... I’ll make sure to call you guys when
those guys come back.

Japanese:
冗談じゃないよ
もう二度とこんなことしないからね
English:
I am serious.
I assure you that they will not.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: おじさん
English: Man

Japanese:
取ってきてくれたのか！
ありがとよ
急いで作るから　ちょっと　待っててくれ！
English:
Great! You’re back!
Thanks for bearing with me and getting these.
I’ll go make it now, hold on!

Japanese: おじさん
English: Man

Japanese:
さぁ　食ってくれ
自信作だ
English:
And here we go! Dig in, guys!
I’m very proud of this one!

Japanese: いただきます
English: Bon appétit.

Japanese: これは……
English: This is...

Japanese: おじさん
English: Man

Japanese:
ど　どうだ…？　まだまずいか…？
味見だってしたし　材料だって量ったんだ
English:
H-How was it? Was it disgusting...?
I made sure I tasted it and properly measured the
ingredients this time, so...

Japanese:
いいえ　おいしいです　本当に
優しくて　どこか懐かしい…
とても愛に溢れているわ
English:
Not at all! This tastes amazing! It feels kind and
somewhat nostalgic. I can tell that you made this
with tenderness, love, and care.

Japanese: おじさん
English: Man

Japanese:
ほ　本当か！？
よ…良かったぁ…
これで　また店が続けられる！
English:
D-Do you really think so!?
Th-Thank Cielo! I-I can keep the store running!

Japanese:
なぁなぁ　なんで　急にアンジュ姉ちゃんが
うまいなんて　言うレベルになったん？
English: Hey hey, Sis Ange was it really that tasty?

Japanese:
材料を量っただけじゃ
こうはいかないよね
English:
I would assume it is not just because he properly
measured the ingredients.

Japanese: あの　なにか　心あたりはないですか？
English: Uhm... do you have an idea why?

Japanese: おじさん
English: Man

Japanese:
うーん…　作るときに
妻と一緒にやっていた頃を
思い出しながら　やってたくらいだけどよ…
English:
Hmm... I just tried reminiscing on the times I spent
cooking with my wife, while making it.

Japanese: 楽しかったですか？
English: Was it fun?

Japanese: おじさん
English: Man

Japanese:
もちろんだ！
あの頃は　２人とも　毎日笑っててよぉ
すごく幸せだったんだ
English:
Of course! The moments I had when she was here
were filled with happiness and laughter, there never
was a sad day with her.

Japanese:
その思いが　きっとこのパンプディングに
伝わったのでしょうね
その気持ち　大切にしてくださいね
English:
I am sure this bread pudding is filled with 
those feelings, be sure you treasure them.

Japanese: おじさん
English: Man

Japanese:
そうだったのか…
気づかせてくれて　ありがとよ
English:
Ohh so that’s why...
Thank you, for letting me know.

Japanese: では　私たちはこれで失礼しますね
English: Then, we shall be going now.

Japanese: おじさん
English: Man

Japanese:
待ってくれ！
良かったら　これ　貰ってくれないか？
English:
Wait! Please, take this!
If you don’t mind.

Japanese:
これは…レシピ？
この店の大事なものじゃ…
English:
Is this a recipe?
We cannot have this, this is your shop’s--

Japanese: おじさん
English: Man

Japanese:
いいんだ
ねえちゃんが居たからこそ
このレシピは完成したんだ
English:
It’s fine, take it.
I wouldn’t have perfected this recipe if it weren’t for you.

Japanese: おじさん
English: Man

Japanese:
ねえちゃんには　受け取る資格がある
だから　是非　受け取ってくれよ
English: You deserve it, so please, take it!

Japanese:
わかりました
ありがとうございます
English: I see. Thank you!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
あれ…？　ねぇ　エル　あの子って
確か前に花を売っていた子だよね？
English:
Oh, look!
Wasn’t that girl who sold us flowers back then?

Japanese: それなら　隣にいるおっちゃんは　おとんやな
English: Then that man must be the Da she was talkin’ ’bout!

Japanese: あの子のお父さん　元気になったみたいだね
English: Her dad seems to have recovered.

Japanese: ホンマや　あの子　めっちゃ楽しそうやな
English: Yeah, she looks mighty happy!

Japanese:
おとんが生きとったら
ウチもあんなふうやったんかなぁ？
English:
... Ah wonder if Ah’d be happy like her if mah
Da’s still alive.

Japanese:
案外　怒られてばっかりかもしれないよ？
ウロウロするなーって
English:
Well, you might end up pissing him off all the time
with all your gallivanting around.

Japanese: あり得るからイヤやなぁ
English: Ah don’ like the fact that it’s likely ta happen.

Japanese: せやけど　ウチ　これでも結構エエ子やってんで
English: But Ah’m still a purty good girl, ya know.

Japanese: 本当？
English: Are you, now?

Japanese:
って自分では思ってんねんけど
おとんやおかんから見たら　どうやったんやろな
今じゃ　聞くに聞けへんし…
English:
Well that’s what Ah’d like ta say, but...
Ah wonder what they’ll say when they see me now?
Not that Ah can ask ’em...

Japanese: あっ…　ごめん…
English: Oh... sorry...

Japanese:
ルカ兄ちゃん　気にせんといて
ウチなら大丈夫や
English:
Don’tcha worry ’bout it, Ruca Bro.
Ah’m gonna be a’ight.

Japanese:
エル…　エルはいい子だと思う
少し大雑把なところもあるけど
優しくて　いい子だよ　僕が保証する
English:
I... I think you’re a good girl, a bit rough, but you’re
sweet and kind.
This young man guarantees it.

Japanese:
それと…僕だけじゃない
きっと　みんなもそう思っているはずだよ
English: Not only me, I’m sure everyone thinks so too.

Japanese: そか　ちょっと元気でたわ
English: Thanks,

Japanese: ありがとぉな
English: that cheered me up!

Japanese: ほな　そろそろ行こか！
English: Let’s git!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: 怪しい商人
English: Suspicious Merchant

Japanese:
さすが　オニーサン
世界一　格好良いネ！
ワタシ　少し痺れたアル
English:
As expected of brother, the most stylish in the world!
I think I’m falling in love with you a bit.

Japanese: 怪しい商人
English: Suspicious Merchant

Japanese:
ブツはコレネ
さっそくかけてみると良いアル
English:
This is it, brother.
Hurry up and try it!

Japanese: 見たとこ　普通のメガネだけど…
English: It looks like a normal pair of glasses though.

Japanese: おっ　ルカ　似合うじゃねェか
English: Ooh, it suits you!

Japanese:
いやですねぇ　スパーダ
似合うのは当たり前です
これは私のメガネですから
English:
Of course it does, Spada.
They’re my glasses, after all.

Japanese:
そ…　そうか…？
それよりも　お前　どうしたんだ？
なんか　ヘンだぞ？
English:
O-Oh, it’s yours...?
H-Hey, are you messing with me, man?
You sound kinda weird.

Japanese:
おや　おかしいですねぇ
私はいつも通りなのですが
English:
Strange, how so?
I’m still the same as usual.

Japanese:
いつもって…
普段のあんたなら　そんなしゃべり方しないわ
どうしちゃったっていうのよ？
English:
The way you’re speaking changed, that’s what!
Normally you wouldn’t speak like that, what the hell’s
gotten into you!?

Japanese:
普段のあんた…ですか
普段の私とは　一体どんな感じなのでしょう？
参考程度にお聞かせいただけますか？
English:
Changed...?
Then, pray, tell me how do I normally speak?
So I would at least have a basis.

Japanese: そ…　それは…
English: Y-You... you...

Japanese: …答えられませんか？
English: Speechless?

Japanese:
ムカッ！
あんたねぇ…　ルカのクセに生意気よ！
English:
Grrr... YOU!
You’re too arrogant to be Ruca!

Japanese: 生意気とは　ひどい言われようですねぇ
English: Oh how cruel of you.

Japanese:
それにしても　ここまで言われるとは
これでは　どちらが生意気か　わかりませんね
English:
Still, I’m surprised that you’d go so far as to call me
“arrogant”, now which of us is the cruel one.

Japanese:
待って　ルカくん
どこに行くの？
English:
Ruca, wait!
Where are you going?

Japanese:
ここでは　特にすることもないようですし
陛下に報告でもしに行こうかと思いまして
English:
Since there seems to be nothing exciting going on,
I was hoping that I could go and report to his Highness.

Japanese: 本当　人使いが荒くて困ります
English: He’s a real slave-driver, that guy.

Japanese:
彼が　おかしくなったのは
あのメガネをかけてからだね
…どう思う　リカルドさん？
English:
I believe the glasses are the reason as to why he’s
gotten like this.
What do you think, Ricardo?

Japanese: ああ　俺も同じことを考えていた
English: Right, I was thinking the same thing too.

Japanese:
ルカ
そのメガネを　はずしてくれないか？
English: Ruca, can you take off those glasses?

Japanese: お断りです
English: I refuse.

Japanese: それは　何故だ？
English: Why?

Japanese:
おや　聞いていなかったんですか？
いけませんねぇ
人の話は　ちゃんと聞かないと
English:
Did you not hear what I said?
We can’t have that, you should listen to others properly.

Japanese: 確か…君のメガネだよね？
English: Then, correct me if I am wrong, it is the glasses, right?

Japanese:
ええ　そうです
ですから　はずす理由がありません
English: Exactly, that’s why removing it is unnecessary.

Japanese:
…そうか
どうしても　はずさないと言うのなら……
English:
I see... Then if you must insist, 
we’ll have to take it by force.

Japanese:
まったく…　皆さん　若いですねぇ
無抵抗の人間相手に　力で解決しようとは…
これは　きついお仕置きが必要そう…ですね
English:
Oh youth!
Forcing a defenseless old man such as myself to fight,
I suppose I’ll have to teach you a lesson.

Japanese:
うーん…
色々と　問いたいこともあるけど　その前に…
English:
Hmm... There are many things 
I still want to ask, but first of all...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: さて　みんな準備はいい？
English: Ready, everyone?

Japanese: 行くよ！
English: Let us make haste!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
あっ…　あれ？
僕……
English: H-Huh? I...

Japanese: ルカ　あんたなんともない！？
English: Ruca! A-Are you okay!?

Japanese:
う…うん　平気だよ
それより　どうしたの？
English:
Y-Yeah, I’m fine...
Wh-What’s wrong?

Japanese:
どうやら　メガネをかけた後のことは
覚えていないようだね
English:
It seems like he does not remember what happened
prior to wearing the glasses.

Japanese:
そうだ　僕　メガネをかけて…
誰かに会いに行こうとしていたような…
あれ…？
English:
Yeah... I remember wearing the glasses and...
feeling the need to go meet someone...?

Japanese: 怪しい商人
English: Suspicious Merchant

Japanese:
アイヤー…
だから　責任取れないって　最初に言ったアルよ
English: Aiyahh, I did warn you.

Japanese:
言い訳はええねん
あのメガネは　なんなん？
English: Forget ’bout that, what’s up with those glasses?

Japanese:
お答えいただけます？
返答次第では……
English:
Explain yourself!
And depending on your answer--

Japanese: 怪しい商人
English: Suspicious Merchant

Japanese:
わかった！　話す　話すネ！
だから　信用落とすマネは
しないで欲しいアル～！
English:
I-I get it! I’ll explain!
J-Just don’t ruin my reputation!

Japanese:
黒いの　最初から　信用ない
だいじょうぶ
English:
It’s okay!
Sussy doesn’t have reputation in first place!

Japanese: 怪しい商人
English: Suspicious Merchant

Japanese: 今日は厄日アル…
English: What a bad day...

Japanese: かけると　人格が変わってしまう…
English: So when you wear it, you turn into a different person...

Japanese:
つまり　あれは「呪われたメガネ」というわけか
まったく…　迷惑な代物だ
English:
To sum it up, those glasses were cursed.
Good grief, how troublesome.

Japanese:
あんたねぇ　そんなモン
ルカにかけさせるなんて　どういうつもりよ
English:
So if that thing changes a person’s personality,
then why the heck would you make Ruca try it on!?

Japanese: 怪しい商人
English: Suspicious Merchant

Japanese:
オニーサンたちなら　大丈夫かと思ったネ
それに　ワタシ　最初に警告………
English: I figured you’ll be fine, besides I did warn you...

Japanese:
その言葉は　聞き飽きたっての
覚悟はいい？
English:
Shut the hell up, I’m so sick of your bullcrap.
Brace yourself!

Japanese: 怪しい商人
English: Suspicious Merchant

Japanese:
ヒィ～～～！
それだけは　ご勘弁ネ～！
English:
Ahhhh～!
Anything but that, sister!

Japanese:
イリア　それダメ
みんな　見てる

English:
Oh Ange, I’m glad you’re here!
There’s something I’d like to ask of you.

Japanese: なんでしょう？
English: What is it?

Japanese:
急で申し訳ないんだけど
僕は今日　夜会に出なくてはならなくてね
English:
I must apologize for the sudden request,
but I have to attend a ball this evening.

Japanese:
そこで君に　僕のパートナーとして
出て欲しいんだ
English:
And, if possible, I would like you to come along with
me as my partner.

Japanese: 夜会ですか…
English: A ball...

Japanese:
なーなー　ルカ兄ちゃん　夜会ってなんなん？
ウチ　なんとなくしか　わからへん
English:
Hey, Ruca Bro, what’s a ball?
Is it like the round thingy ya play with?

Japanese:
えっと　夜会っていうのは
夜に開かれる舞踏会や晩餐会のことだよ
English:
Uhmm... A “ball” is an event in the evening where
couples take to the floor. It’s usually accompanied
with a banquet.

Japanese:
武闘会…？
アンジュ姉ちゃん　戦うんか？
English:
“Take to the floor?”
Is Albert takin’ Sis Ange ta go wrestlin’?

Japanese:
面白いことを言うね
でも　舞踏会は戦うところではないよ
男女がペアになって　踊るんだ
English:
Gracious me! You say the funniest things!
But fortunately, I can assure you that I won’t make
Ange fight, we’re just going to dance together.

Japanese:
アンジュ　踊れるか？
キュキュは初耳
English:
Ange dancing?
First time QQ heard!

Japanese: いいえ
English: No, I will not be dancing.

Japanese:
アルベール
このお話　お断りできませんか？
English: Albert, may I decline your offer?

Japanese:
私には　少し荷が重いようです
それに　服も靴もありません
English:
I have neither any clothes nor shoes for the occasion.
On top of that, I still have some things I have to do.

Japanese:
私が出たところで
アルベールに　恥をかかせてしまうわ
English:
If I came with you and danced, I would 
just end up being an embarrassment.

Japanese:
大丈夫　そこは僕がなんとかするよ
それに踊りは僕も　できる限り　リードするし
簡単なものなら　少し練習すればすぐにできるさ
English:
It’s alright, I’ll figure something out. As for dancing,
I’ll do my best to guide you, and we can even spend
some time practicing if it’s something simple.

Japanese: でも……
English: But...

Japanese:
俺たちは　先を急いでいる
それを知らない訳ではないだろう？
English:
I’m sure you’re well aware that we’re in a hurry,
aren’t you?

Japanese:
リカルドくん　つれないね
…いや　これもアンジュを守るためかな？
English:
How indifferent of you, Ricardo... or is this, perhaps,
another form of protecting Ange?

Japanese:
言っていなかったか？
それが俺の仕事だ
English:
Did I not say it before?
I’m merely doing my job.

Japanese:
はははは
アンジュ　君はいい傭兵を雇ったね
English: Hahahahaha, you’ve hired a great mercenary, Ange.

Japanese:
さて　本当はアンジュだけに
話そうと思っていたけど…
君たちにも話しておこうか
English:
That said, I’ve been meaning to only tell this to Ange,
but I suppose it can’t be helped...

Japanese:
……どうやら　僕の命が狙われているらしい
しかも　今日の舞踏会でね
English:
...It appears that someone is planning to assassinate
me, more so on the night of the ball too.

Japanese:
狙われるって…
あんた　なんかやったの？
English:
Assassinate...?
Why would they want to take your life?

Japanese: 心当たりがありすぎて困るよ
English: I’ll only be troubled if I think too deeply into it.

Japanese:
それだけではなく
僕は貴族に名を連ねる者だからね
色々な方面から狙われているのさ
English:
As a noble, it’s just natural that many people are after
me. You find that it comes with the territory.

Japanese:
そして今回は　転生者が刺客として
現れるとの情報を得ている
English:
But, this is no mere assassination attempt we’re
dealing with. This time, I’ve learned that they’ve hired
a Reincarnator to take my life.

Japanese:
だから　アンジュさんに
パートナーになって　欲しかったんだね？
English: So that is why you wanted Ange to come with you?

Japanese:
ああ　万が一の場合もあるし
僕はまだ　倒れる訳にはいかないからね
English:
Yes, just in case that it comes to happen, no matter
how unlikely. I can’t afford to die yet, you see.

Japanese:
停戦を申しこんだ　張本人が存在しなくては
ことがうまく運ぶとは　思えん
English:
Indeed, I can’t imagine the ceasefire coming along
if its leader isn’t there.

Japanese:
そういう訳で　アンジュ……
僕と踊ってくれませんか？
English:
That’s how it is. So, Ange, what do you think?
Would you like to come with me?

Japanese:
……わかりました
お役に立てるかどうかはわかりませんが
よろしくお願いします　アルベール
English:
Fine... Although I have no idea how I can be of use to
you, I shall be in your care.

Japanese: ありがとう
English: Thank you.

Japanese:
では　アンジュを借りていくよ
あとで　宿に部屋を取る
君たちはそこで待っててくれ
English:
If you guys don’t mind, I’ll be borrowing Ange for a
while. I’ve arranged some rooms at the inn, you guys
can wait there.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
なぁ　ルカ兄ちゃん
今日の晩飯　いつ頃いくん？
English: Hey, Ruca Bro, when’re we gonna eat dinner?

Japanese:
アンジュ姉ちゃん帰ってくるまで
ウチ　待てそうにないで
キュキュ姉ちゃんも　腹減ったゆうてたし
English:
Ah don’ think we can wait until Sis Ange comes back,
look even Sis QQ says she’s hungry.

Japanese:
アンジュなら　きっと食べてくると思うよ
お腹すいたなら　そろそろ行く？
English:
Ange’s probably already eating at the ball.
I’m getting hungry too, why don’t we go get some food?

Japanese: なんや　舞踏会って　踊るだけやないん？
English:
What?
So yer tellin’ me Sis Ange’s not only gonna dance?

Japanese:
舞踏会って言ったって　メシくらいは出るぜ
それも　とびっきりうまいヤツがな
English:
If it’s a “ball” then there’s definitely gonna be food there.
On top of that, they’d be the finest food you can eat.

Japanese:
なんやて！？
それなら　ウチが行けばよかった～～！！
English:
Whatcha say!?
Then it woulda been better if Ah’d gone instead!

Japanese: それは　ムリじゃないかな
English: I do not believe that would have been possible.

Japanese: なんでや？
English: Why?

Japanese:
夜会って　色々な方面の要人が集まるし
ある程度の気品や教養がないと
相手に失礼だからね
English:
There would be a lot of important figures in the event,
you would at least need a certain degree of education
and grace so as to not embarrass your partner.

Japanese: ってことは…
English: Meaning...

Japanese:
アルベールさんの人選は
的確だった　ということさ
English: Albert specifically chose Ange based on that criteria.

Japanese:
自分　えらいドギツイこと
サラっと言うねんなぁ…
ウチ　ちょっとヘコんだで
English: Ya made me a bit upset with how ya easily said that.

Japanese:
お詫びにデザートをご馳走するよ
それでどう？
English:
Then, how about I treat you to some dessert as
an apology?

Japanese: ん…　それで手ぇ打とか
English: Hmmm... sure.

Japanese:
ほな　こうなったら
今日はアンジュ姉ちゃんの分も食ったる！
ガッツリいくで～！
English:
Then, we better eat as much as we can fer
Sis Ange’s sake!
Let’s git～!

Japanese:
ちょお　みんな　なにしてんねんな！
はよ行くで！
English: What’re y’all doin!? Let’s go!

Japanese: あれ？　リカルド…？
English: Huh? Where’s Ricardo?

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: アルベール
English: Albert

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: 今日はありがとう　助かったよ
English: Thank you for coming with me tonight.

Japanese:
どういたしまして
何事もなく終わってよかったです
English:
You are welcome. I am just glad that it 
ended peacefully, the party might be over,

Japanese: でも　油断は禁物ですよ
English: but please keep your guard up.

Japanese: もちろんさ　肝に銘じておくよ
English: I’ll bear that in mind.

Japanese:
それはそうと　アンジュ
君のダンス　とても素敵だった
English: On one note, your dancing was magnificent.

Japanese:
少し教えただけだというのに
あそこまで踊れるなんて　正直　驚いたよ
English:
To be able to dance like that after what little time we
had practicing, I was quite surprised.

Japanese: 素敵だなんて…
English: Magnificent?

Japanese:
これもアルベールが
リードしてくださったおかげです
English:
I was only able to dance like that because of your
excellent leading.

Japanese:
ははは
前世では　君が僕に物を教えていたのに
今日は逆だね　不思議な気分だ
English:
Hahaha... What a strange feeling, you were the one
who always taught me in the past, yet now I’m the
one teaching you.

Japanese: ふふ　確かにそうですね
English: It is, is it not?

Japanese:
……さて　名残惜しいけど
そろそろ君を　帰さないといけないね
English:
...... As unfortunate as it is, I’m afraid it’s time for
you to go back now.

Japanese:
あまり遅いと
リカルドくんたちが　心配してしまう
English: You’ll make everyone worry if I keep you any longer.

Japanese:
…宿まで送るよ
さぁ　行こう
English: I’ll see you off at the inn, let’s go.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
なぁ　アンジュ姉ちゃん　舞踏会どやった？
うまいメシ　いっぱい食べたん？
English:
Welcome back, Sis Ange!
How was the ball? Didja eat a lot?

Japanese:
ううん　踊るのに精一杯で
つい　食べるのを忘れちゃった
English: Not really, I was so focused on dancing that I forgot.

Japanese:
アンジュ　気を使わなくていいわよ
あたしたちも　おいしいもの食べたし♪
English:
Oh don’t worry about us, Ange～
We ate lots too!

Japanese:
せやで　アンジュ姉ちゃんが
メシ食わへんなんて　おかしいで
English:
Yeah! Would be really strange 
if ya didn’t eat at the ball!

Japanese:
そうそう
だから　正直に言っちゃいなさいよ！
English: Yeah, so don’t worry about us and say it already!

Japanese: うーん　本当に食べてないんだけどなぁ
English: Hmm... but I really did not get to eat.

Japanese: イリア＆エル
English: Illia & Hermie

Japanese: えぇ！？
English: WHAT?

Japanese:
ご飯を食べないのは　体によくないけど
そんなに驚くことではないでしょう？
English:
While skipping meals is unhealthy for the body, I do 
not see why you both have to be so surprised about it.

Japanese:
忙しかったり　なにかに夢中になって
しまったら　そういうこともあるわ
English:
It can happen if you become so busy or if you get too
absorbed in something.

Japanese: アンジュ　もったいない～…
English: ...What a waste...

Japanese: 折角のチャンスやったのになぁ…
English: An’ ya had yer chance too...

Japanese: チャンスは　またいつか来るわ
English: Well, I am sure I shall get the chance again someday.

Japanese:
まっ　そうよねぇ
なんたって　アンジュは
良いカモ　ゲットだもんねぇ～
English:
I guess, yeah.
Especially since you managed to reel in a good
one～

Japanese:
いくらでも　好き放題できるし
うらやましい～
English:
With him there, you can do anything you want～
I’m so jealous～

Japanese: こーら　そんなふうに　言わないの
English: Come now, Illia! It is not like that!

Japanese: カモだなんて…　そんなのじゃないわ
English: I did not... reel him in.

Japanese: ふふっ
English: That is all～

Japanese:
アンジュ姉ちゃん
ごっつ悪い顔してんなぁ……
English: Sheeesh... jus’ look at yer face, Sis.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: やっぱ精度が問題ね…
English: I knew it, it’s definitely a problem with my accuracy...

Japanese:
逆腕の反応が遅い
戦場では命取りだぞ
English:
Quite the contrary, it’s because your reflexes are
delayed. A mistake that can cost you your life
on the battlefield.

Japanese: 覗き見なんて良いご趣味ですこと
English:
My, my, I never thought that you’d have a
“respectable” hobby such as spying.

Japanese:
銃声を聞いて来てみたら
おまえが居ただけだ
English: I have no interest in such hobbies.

Japanese: 覗きの趣味はない
English:
It’s just that, I heard a gunshot and 
came to check, and here you are.

Japanese: そーですか
English: Is that so～?

Japanese:
ただでさえ
照準のぶれやすいダブルアクションだ
English:
To expand on what I said earlier, a double action is
sensitive to the slightest deviations of your hand.

Japanese:
もっとしっかり狙わないと
当たらんぞ
English:
You’re going to have to get a proper grip on it if
you want your bullets to hit your mark.

Japanese: くっ…分かってるわよ！
English: Tch... I know that!

Japanese:
やれやれ…おまえは肩の力が入りすぎだ
少し力を抜いて撃ってみろ
English:
Sigh... Look, you’re putting too much force on your
shoulders. Try relaxing them a bit before shooting.

Japanese: なんであんたのアドバイスなんか…
English: That doesn’t make any--

Japanese: いいから撃ってみろ
English: Just do it.

Japanese: はいはい　撃てばいいんでしょ
English: Fine, I just have to shoot, right?

Japanese: え？　なんで…？
English: H-How...?

Japanese:
力んでいたら当たる物も当たらんさ
それが　おまえの本当の実力だ
English:
Simple, you won’t be able to hit anything if you’re too
tense. Learn to be calm and relax, and your real
power will shine through.

Japanese: これが…あたしの…
English: My real power...

Japanese:
俺はもう寝る
おまえも早く寝るんだな
English:
I’m going back to bed.
You should sleep soon too.

Japanese:
あっ
ちょっと待ちなさいよ！
English: Ahh-- Hey! Wait!

Japanese: なんだ？
English: What?

Japanese: あ…ありがとう…
English: Th-Thank you...

Japanese: ふっ…礼はいらんさ
English: Hmph. No need to thank me.

Japanese: …ったく　素直に取っておきなさいよ
English: Oh Ricardo... just be honest and take it.

Japanese: 力を抜いて…
English: Right. Relax...

Japanese: …撃つ！
English: Then shoot!

Japanese: ふっふっふ～　完璧ね！
English: Heheh～ Perfect!

Japanese:
待ってなさいよ！
マティウス！
English: Just you wait, Mattheus!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: シアン
English: Sian

Japanese: イリアのパパ
English: Illia’s Papa

Japanese: では……
English: Well then...

Japanese: イリアのパパ
English: Illia’s Papa

Japanese:
シアンくん　サニア村へようこそ
歓迎するよ
English: Welcome to Sania Village, Sian!

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese:
なにもないところだけど
ゆっくりしていってね
English: There’s not a lot to see here, but I hope you enjoy it!

Japanese: ……あ　ありがと…
English: Th-Thank you...

Japanese: それじゃあ　いっただっきまーす！
English: Right, then! Time to dig in!

Japanese: いただきます　なんだな
English: Dig in!

Japanese: ……おいしい…
English: ...... Delicious...

Japanese: あったり前よ　ママが作ったご飯だもの
English: Of course it is! It’s Mama’s cooking!

Japanese: あっ！　ちょっと　コーダ　それあたしの！
English: Ahh-- Coda! That’s mine!

Japanese: 早いもの勝ちなんだな
English: First come, first serve!

Japanese: くっ…！！
English: Grrr...!

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese:
イリア　まだご飯ならたくさんあるから
座って食べる
English:
Now, now, Illia! We still have a lot of food,
so go back to your seat!

Japanese: はーい
English: Okay～

Japanese:
そういえば……　ねぇ　シアン
まだ答え聞いてないけど　どう？
あたしのパパとママ！
English:
Oh yeah I haven’t asked you this before,
but what did you think of my Papa and Mama?

Japanese: イリアのパパとママ……
English: Your Papa and Mama...

Japanese:
うん…
……すごくいい人　あったかくて…好き…
English: They’re nice... Very kind people...

Japanese: ふふん♪　自慢の両親だからね
English: Heheh～ I bet they are! I’m very proud of them!

Japanese:
あっ！　コーダ　それあたしの肉！！
あー…　またやられた！！
English:
Ahh-- CODA!
You’re taking my meat! Darn it!

Japanese:
シアン　あんたもグズグズしてると
全部食べられちゃうわよ！
English:
You should start eating too, Sian!
Before Coda gets your food!

Japanese: あ　ああ…
English: Oh... Okay...

Japanese: おかわりか　ちょっと待ってろ
English: Seconds? Please wait...

Japanese:
お前たちも楽しいか　はは　ボクもだ
ここは…とてもいいところだよ
王都兵が　踏みにじっていいところじゃない
English:
Are you guys having fun? Me too...
This place is very nice.
I don’t want the Imperial Army destroying it.

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese:
シアンくん　席につきましょう？
差し入れのケーキ　切るわよ
English:
Sian, come back here!
We’re going to start cutting the cake now!

Japanese: ああ！
English: Oh-- Okay!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: あれ…？　抜けない…
English: Huh? He won’t budge...

Japanese: ルカ　ちょっと代われ
English: Let me do it, Ruca.

Japanese:
抜けねェ　どこをどう入ったら
こんな詰まり方すんだよ？
English:
He really isn’t budging.
How in the world did he become stuck like this?

Japanese: 仕方ねェ　ルカ　そっちの足持て
English:
Well, there’s no other way. Ruca, you take that leg and
we both do it together.

Japanese:
でも　ふたりで引っ張ったら
きっと　痛いよ…？
English: But if we both pull him, he might get hurt...

Japanese: じゃあ　どうすんだ？
English: So what do you suggest?

Japanese: うーん……
English: Hmm...

Japanese:
食べ物で釣ってみたらどう？
彼ら　食べ物には目がないんだよね？
それなら　もしかすると……
English:
How about we lure him out with some food? Muses all 
have a weakness to it, correct? So if we try this...

Japanese:
でも　これだけハマってたら
自力で抜け出せないんじゃない？
English:
But if he’s this stuck, do you really think he can pull
himself out?

Japanese: 物は試しだよ
English: We will not know unless we try.

Japanese: やってみましょう
English: Let us give it a try.

Japanese:
おい　リンゴを用意したぜ
食うんなら　出て来いよ
English:
Yo! We got an apple for you. 
You gotta come out if you want it.

Japanese: オーダ
English: Oda

Japanese: オーダ
English: Oda

Japanese:
リンゴ………リンゴ……リンゴ…リンゴ
リンゴリンゴリンゴリンゴリンゴリンゴ
リンゴリンゴリンゴリンゴリンゴッーーー！！！
English:
Apple... Apple... Apple Apple AppleAppleAppleApple
APPLEAPPLEAPPLEAPPLEAPPLEAPPLEAPPLE
APPLEAPPLEAPPLEAPPLEAPPLEEEEEEEEEE!!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
うわぁ…　すごい景色
僕たち　あんな下から　登ってきたんだね
English: What a beautiful view... We sure climbed a lot.

Japanese:
うげっ
こっから落ちたら　ひとたまりもないわね
English:
Yikes... You won’t stand a chance
if you fall down from here.

Japanese:
イリア姉ちゃん
足踏みはずさんように　気ぃつけてぇな
English: Sis Illia, be careful where yer standin’.

Japanese: それ　あたしじゃなくて　ルカに言いなさいよね
English: Don’t tell me that, tell Ruca.

Japanese: なんで僕なの？
English: Why me?

Japanese:
あんたの方が　うっかり落ちそうじゃない？
「あ～れ～」って
English:
You’re the type to carelessly fall and still be confused 
and be like “Huhhhh?”

Japanese: いくらなんでも　さすがにそこは気をつけるよ…
English: Hey, even I’d be careful at this height.

Japanese: 談笑するのも良いが　そろそろ行くとしよう
English: Lighthearted banter aside, we should get going.

Japanese:
ええ
こうしている間にも
王都軍と教団の間に　血が流れていますから…
English:
Right. More blood is being spilt between the 
Imperial army and the Church as we speak.

Japanese:
…ああ
一刻も早く　マティウスのところへ行かねェとな
English:
Yeah. We can’t let Mattheus have
the time to do what she wants.

Japanese:
みんな　行くか？
なら　出発！
English: Everyone go? Let’s leave!

Japanese: うわっ！？
English: Ahhh!

Japanese: ルカくん！！
English: Ruca!!

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ！
English: Ruca!

Japanese: コンウェイ！　ルカは！？
English: Kongwei, how’s Ruca!?

Japanese: だ…大丈夫だよ…
English: I’m... fine...

Japanese: はぁ～…　よかった…
English: Oh, what a relief...

Japanese:
くっ…
安心してないで　引き上げてくれないかな…？
さすがに　キツイんでね…
English:
Relief aside, mind helping me out? 
I cannot breathe...

Japanese:
わかった
その手を離すなよ
English: Okay, we’ll be separating your arms.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: ふぅ……　ありがとう
English: Thank you.

Japanese: コンウェイ　ルカ　無事か？
English: Kongwei, Ruca, unharmed?

Japanese: 少し腕が痛いけど　これくらい平気さ
English: My arm hurts a bit but, otherwise, I am fine.

Japanese: 僕も…　なんとか…
English: Me too... Somehow...

Japanese:
それにしてもコンウェイ
あんた　意外とやるじゃん
English: Still, Kongwei, you were unexpectedly cool.

Japanese:
ああ　見直したぜ
まさか一緒に落ちるなんてな
English: I saw that, to think you both would fall together.

Japanese: あれは　勇気がないと出来ひん
English: That was purty brave.

Japanese: ウチなら　チビってまうわ
English:
If it had been me, 
Ah woulda wetted mahself.

Japanese:
そういえば
コンウェイ兄ちゃんはチビってないん？
English:
That said, Uncle Kongwei, 
ya didn’t wet yer britches didja?

Japanese: エル　下品よ
English: Hermie, mind your words.

Japanese:
コンウェイ　ありがとう
君がいなかったら　僕は……
English: Thank you, Kongwei. If you weren’t there I...

Japanese:
礼なら別にいいよ
キミに死なれると困るから　助けただけだしね
English:
No need to thank me. I would be quite 
troubled if you died, so I just offered my hand.

Japanese:
あんたねぇ　こういうときくらい
もっと素直になったらどうなのよ？
English:
Look, you. What should we do with you to make you 
start acting a bit more honest?

Japanese:
やだなぁ
ボク　これでも結構　素直なんだけどな
English: There is no need. I am already honest enough.

Japanese: どこがよ…
English: When, exactly...?

Japanese:
まっ　とりあえず
無事だったんだから　良かったんじゃね？
English: Well, anyway, at least they’re both fine.

Japanese:
では　そろそろ行くとしよう
他の者も　足元の注意は怠るなよ
English:
Then let’s hurry. Everyone else should
be careful where they step, too.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
あの…武器を　持ってきました
これで大丈夫ですか…？
English:
Uhmm... I’ve brought the weapon.
Is this alright?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
おう！　よく見つけたな
こいつが呼ぶ声　わかったか？
English:
Yep! I’m surprised you managed to find it.
Did you hear his call?

Japanese: はい　なんとなくですけど…
English: Somehow, yeah.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: それはよかった　さて……
English: Great... Now!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
久しぶりだな　よく帰ってきてくれた
なんだ　俺の心配はいらねぇよ
この通りピンピンしてっからな　ガッハハハッ！
English:
Welcome back, it’s been a while since we met, haven’t
we? What? Gahahahaha! No need to worry about me!
As you can see, I’m still alive and kicking!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
お前さん　ありがとな
これからコイツを生まれ変わらせてくるが
ちょいとばかし時間がかかる
English:
Thanks for bringing him back here.
Thanks to you, he’ll be able to be reborn once again.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: 悪ぃが　その辺で適当にくつろいでてくれ
English:
This’ll take some time, feel free to make yourselves
at home.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: 出来たぜ
English: And here we go!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
こいつはお前さんと相性が良さそうだからな
大剣にしといたぜ
English:
I made him into a longsword since it seems like
he has a high affinity with you.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
……鍛冶師バルカンが息子
名をヴァルナ
English:
Now, child, in the name of the Blacksmith Vulcan, 
I bestow the name Varuna unto you.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: 心の優しい子だ　大切にしてくれ
English: He’s a kind boy, so take care of him!

Japanese: はい…！
English: Yes, sir!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
さて…　今日はもう遅ぇし
泊まっていくといい
English:
It’s a little late now, so you should stay in here for
the night.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
まっ　雑魚寝だけどな
ガッハッハッハ！
English:
You’ll be sleeping with me, though!
Gahahahaha!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アスラ
English: Asura

Japanese: とうとう　この境地に達したな
English: It looks like I’ve finally managed to reach you.

Japanese: だ　誰っ！？
English: Wh-Who’s there!?

Japanese: あなたは…　アスラ？
English: You’re... Asura?!

Japanese:
俺の物真似とはいえ
よくぞここまで剣術を極めたものだ
呆れつつも　褒めてやろう
English:
I must commend you for mastering the art of the sword,
even if you’re just imitating me.

Japanese: このアスラの力　自在の物とするがいい
English: My power is yours to command.

Japanese:
物真似なんかじゃないよ
僕は　あなた自身なんだから…
あなたの技は　僕のものだよ
English:
I’m not imitating you, we’re the same...
That means your techniques are also mine.

Japanese:
はっ　ひよっこが何を言う！
お前が俺だと？
ふざけられては困る
English:
Hah! Who do you think you are?
We’re the same?
You’ve got to be kidding me.

Japanese: けど　あなたは…　僕の…
English: But... I’m your...

Japanese:
魂の輪廻の越し方が
お前であることは　認めよう
English: Indeed, I acknowledge you as my incarnation.

Japanese:
だが考えてみよ
俺にも前世があり　お前にも来世がある
English:
Use that head of yours, child!
I exist in the past, and you exist in the now!

Japanese:
その連綿と続く　輪廻の転生すべてを
「同じ」だと　捉えるべきか？
English:
In this continuous cycle of death and rebirth, would
you still think that all still remains the same as before?

Japanese:
俺のことなど気にするな
お前はお前自身
自分を疑うな
English:
You needn’t worry about me, you are yourself.
Do not doubt it.

Japanese: 僕は…僕？
English: I am... me?

Japanese:
そうだ
俺に頼らず進め
俺の技は　あくまで借り物と心得よ
English:
Yes, you are you.
Don’t rely on me, and be aware that you are merely
borrowing my techniques.

Japanese:
真実の力とは　己自身から発せられる
…わかるな？
English:
True power comes from within yourself...
Do you understand?

Japanese: …でも　僕は自信ないよ
English: But I don’t think I can...

Japanese:
いや　すでに気がついているはずだ
俺への執着を捨てろ…
その中に　活路がある
English:
No, I’m sure you’ve realized it deep down.
Cast aside your obsession of me, and I’m sure you’ll
find it.

Japanese: ま　待ってよ！
English: W-Wait!

Japanese:
…忘れるな　お前は…
お前…自身…だ…
English: Don’t you forget, you... are yourself...

Japanese: 僕はアスラじゃない…
English: I’m not Asura...

Japanese: 僕は…　僕…
English: I am myself...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ねぇ　ルカ　なにか言った？
English: Hey, Ruca, did you say something?

Japanese: ううん
English: I didn’t say anything.

Japanese: おっかしいわねぇ　空耳…？
English: Weird... Did I mishear it?

Japanese:
あ　また聞こえた　なんなのよ　一体
オバケでもいんの？
いるなら出てきなさいよね！
English:
There it goes again!
What the hell...? Is it a ghost?
If you can hear me, show yourself!

Japanese:
イリア姉ちゃん　強気やなぁ
ホンマにオバケなんて出たらどうするん？
ウチ　真っ先に逃げるで？
English:
Oh Sis Illia, yer so strong.
What’re ya gonna do when an actual ghost comes out?
Personally Ah was plannin’ on runnin’ away.

Japanese:
ふん！　そんなのあたしの銃で
撃ち抜いてやるってーの！
English:
Hmph! If it did dare to come out, then I’ll just shoot it
in the head!

Japanese: イリア　後ろ…
English: Illia there’s...

Japanese: ゴミ　ついてる
English: ...rubbish attached behind you.

Japanese:
イリアさん
もしかして　怖いの？
English: Illia... do not tell me you are scared?

Japanese:
んなわけないっての！
たまたまよ　たまたま
バカなこと言ってないで　行くわよ！
English:
Of course I’m not!
I just fired it by accident!
Now shut up and let’s get movin’!

Japanese:
それにしても　うるっさいわねぇ…
こっちから聞こえるみたいだけど…
English:
Still, whatever that thing is it’s really hecking annoying.
Sounds like it’s coming this way though...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: は？　剣…？　なんで…？
English: A sword...?

Japanese:
…この声　こいつね
あー　もう　しつこいっての！
静かにしなさいよね！
English:
It’s definitely coming from here...
Agh dammit, shut up!
You’re too noisy!

Japanese:
ね　ねぇ…イリア…
その剣　もしかして
バルカンさんの剣じゃないかな…？
English:
Uhm... hey, Illia?
Could that sword be Vulcan’s?

Japanese: ……これが？
English: This?

Japanese:
バルカンは　俺たちの魂に反応して
呼びかけてくると　言っていたな
English:
If I recall correctly, Vulcan did say that the swords
will call out to our souls.

Japanese: ゲッ…！！
ど…どこも　欠けたりしてないわよね…？
English: I-It’s not... chipped somewhere or anything right...?

Japanese: 大丈夫そう？
English: It looks fine?

Japanese:
ル～～～カ～～～
あんたねぇ　そういう大事なことは
早く言いなさいよね！
English:
Ruca～～
You should’ve told me that earlier!

Japanese: ご　ごめん…
English: S-Sorry...

Japanese:
まっ　無事だったから　許してあげる
武器も手に入ったし　さっそく
バルカンのところへ行きましょ
English:
Hmph... Since it looks unharmed, I’ll forgive you.
Let’s take this sword back to Vulcan.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: 武器持ってきたわ　これでいい？
English: I’ve brought the weapon. This good enough for you?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
おっ　嬢ちゃんやるな
それで声は聞こえたか？
English:
Oh! Good job, missy!
Did you hear this child’s voice?

Japanese: ええ　イヤというほどね
English: Yes, I did. Waaay too much.

Japanese: こいつ　シツコイったらありゃしないわ
English: This guy’s too noisy, it shouldn’t exist.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
ガッハハハハハッ！
悪いな　それもこいつの性格だ
さて……
English:
Gahahahaha!
That’s just how he is!
Now then...

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
よう　久しぶりだな
お前さん　相変わらずの性格してるみてぇだな
ちったぁ成長しろや
English:
Yo, been a while huh?
Glad to see you’re still the same as usual,
but you need to grow up a bit.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
ガッハハハハハッ！　そりゃお互い様だ
それより　よく帰ってきてくれたな！
また　会えて嬉しいぜ
English:
Gahahahahaha! Well that makes two of us!
I’m glad you’re back, it’s good to see you again!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
ありがとな　これからコイツを
嬢ちゃんに合うようにしてくるが
ちょっとばかし時間がかかる
English:
Thanks, missy, for reuniting me with this fella.
Now hold on for a bit, this’ll take a good while.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
なんせコイツ　この気性だからな
え？　お前が言うなって？
ガッハハハハハッ！
English:
Why? Because this guy’s very spirited, that’s why!
Huh? You don’t say? Gahahahaha!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
んじゃあ　悪ぃが嬢ちゃん
その辺で適当にくつろいでてくれ
English:
Right, sorry missy, but feel free to make yourself
at home while you wait.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: 出来たぜ
English: And here we go!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
こいつは嬢ちゃんと相性が良さそうだからな
特別に銃にしといたぜ
English:
This guy seems to be quite attached to you,
so I made him into a gun.

Japanese: なにをどうしたら　剣が銃になるのよ？
English: How on Terro did you turn a sword into a gun?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
おいおい　そんなこと聞くのか？
そいつぁ　野暮ってもんだぜ
English:
Oi, are you really going to ask me that?
You’re pretty tasteless, aren’t you?

Japanese:
腑に落ちないけど　もらえるんだし
ま　いっか
English: Ehh, I don’t get it, but whatever. I’ll take it.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
……鍛冶師バルカンが息子
名をルシファー
English:
Now, child, in the name of the Blacksmith Vulcan, 
I bestow the name Lucifer unto you.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
ちょいと気性は荒いが　いいヤツだ
仲良くやってくれよ
English:
He’s a bit rough around the edges, but he’s kind. 
Now, play nice!

Japanese: わかったわ
English: Got it.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
さて…　お前さんたちも　疲れただろ？
泊まっていくといい
English:
You’re tired, right?
You should stay here for the night.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
といっても　雑魚寝だけどな
ガッハッハッハ！
English:
You’ll be sleeping with me though.
Gahahahaha!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: イナンナ
English: Inanna

Japanese: 立派になったものね
English: What a fine young lady you’ve grown into.

Japanese: げげっ　あんた…

あのアスラの転生者に会って以来
あなたも変わったわ
English:
You’ve changed ever since you met
Asura’s incarnation.

Japanese:
な～によぉ
そんなコト　言いに来たってワケ？
English:
So you came all the way here, in MY dream,
just to tell me that?

Japanese:
私は喜んでるのよ
私の力を　アスラのために使ってくれて
English:
I’m quite happy, you know?
Knowing that you’re using my power for Asura’s sake.

Japanese:
あんたなんかを喜ばせたくて
天術を使ったんじゃないってのよ！
English: I’m not using your power to make you happy!

Japanese:
それに…　別に
ルカのためなんかじゃないし…
English: And... it’s not like I’m using it specifically for Ruca...

Japanese: …本当かしら？
English: Is that true...?

Japanese:
…あいつは仲間だし力になりたいけど……
でも　そんなんじゃないわ
English:
I mean... of course, I want to help him as an ally,
but it’s not what you think it is.

Japanese:
素直になりなさい
本当は　あの少年に奉仕する喜びを
心の底で押し殺しているくせに
English:
Be honest, child.
The truth is, deep down in that heart of yours,
you’re happy to be of use to him.

Japanese:
はぁ？　あたしがルカに奉仕？
なに寝ぼけたコト言ってんのよ
夢にまで出てきて…　言いたいことはそれ？
English:
Me? Of “use” to him?
Are you dreaming, woman?
Is that all?

Japanese: …あなたには　この話　まだ早かったようね
English:
I suppose it’s still a bit too early to talk to you
about this...

Japanese:
でも　いずれ　わかる日が来る
その時が来るまで　私は待たせてもらうわ
English: But I’ll be waiting for the day when you’ll realize it.

Japanese:
はいはい
じゃあね～
English: Yeah, yeah, good riddance～

Japanese:
待ちなさい
話はまだ終わっていないわ
English:
Hold on!
I’m still not finished!

Japanese: んもう　なによ？
English: What now?

Japanese:
私の力　好きに使わせてあげるわ
これからも　アスラのために使ってちょうだい
English:
Feel free to use my power as much as you want,
for him especially.

Japanese:
なによ　いきなり
恩着せがましいわね
English: Don’t act like I owe you this, I don’t.

Japanese: それと　私からのアドバイス
English: And a small piece of advice.

Japanese:
女の子は素直なのが一番よ
心を開放して生きる素晴らしさを
決して忘れないでね
English:
It’s best for a girl to be honest, you know.
Never forget the joy of living with an open heart.

Japanese:
あんたなんかに言われなくても
わかってるってばっ
English:
You don’t have to tell me that!
I already know!

Japanese:
そう…　それでいいの…
私の代わりに…　あなたは…自由に…
English:
Yes... It’s for the better...
Be free... for my sake.

Japanese:
あたしは…
あんたの代わりなんかじゃないってのよ…
English: ...I’m not doing this for you.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: ハルトマン
English: Hartman

Japanese: ハルトマン邪魔するぜ
English: Hey, gramps. We’ll be dropping by for a while.

Japanese:
ん…？
なんだ…　今　呼ばれたような…
おい　ルカ　聞こえたか？
English:
Hm...? What was that
Hey, Ruca, did you hear that?
Someone’s calling out my name...

Japanese: ううん　僕はなにも…
English: No, I didn’t hear anything...

Japanese: まただ…　こいつはもしかして……
English: There it is again! Is it...?

Japanese:
お坊ちゃま　ようこそおいでくださいました
お出迎えが遅くなってしまい
申し訳ございません
English:
Welcome, Young Master.
I apologize for not being able to greet you on
your arrival.

Japanese:
ああ　構わねェよ
いきなり来たオレたちが悪いからな
English:
Oh, I don’t mind.
We’re sorry for dropping by so suddenly.

Japanese: ところでハルトマン　この剣どこで手に入れた？
English: By the way, where did you get this sword, Hartman?

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ハルトマン
English: Hartman

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
お坊ちゃま　ようこそおいでくださいました
お出迎えが遅くなってしまい
申し訳ございません
English:
Welcome, Young Master.
I apologize for not being able to greet you on
your arrival.

Japanese:
ああ　構わねェよ
いきなり来たオレたちが悪いからな
English:
Oh, I don’t mind.
We’re sorry for dropping by so suddenly.

Japanese: ところでハルトマン　この剣どこで手に入れた？
English: By the way, where did you get this sword, Hartman?

Japanese:
これは　じいが
ベルフォルマ家を出るときに
旦那様から賜ったものでございます
English:
I have received this from the Master during my time
back in the Belforma household.

Japanese: へぇ…　親父が…
English: Ohh, so it was from my old man...

Japanese:
なぁ　ハルトマン
ムリは承知だが　この剣　借りられるか？
English:
Sorry for the sudden question, gramps,
but can we borrow this for a moment?

Japanese:
どうぞお持ちくだされ
年老いた身には　過ぎたものでございます
English:
Please, take it.
I have grown too old to use a sword.

Japanese: 感謝するぜ
English: Thanks.

Japanese: しかし　本当にいいのか？
English: Are you really sure it’s fine?

Japanese: 構いませぬ
English: I do not mind.

Japanese:
旦那様からはお坊ちゃまが
いつかこの剣を必要とされたとき
渡すよう　仰せつかっております
English:
Your father had asked me to give it to you when the
time came that you needed it.

Japanese: …親父はともかく　ありがとな
English: Dunno about my dad, but... Thanks.

Japanese: 礼には及びませぬ
English: No need to thank us.

Japanese:
ねぇ　スパーダ　その剣って
もしかして　バルカンさんの武器？
English: Hey, Spada, could that sword be one of Vulcan’s...?

Japanese:
たぶんな　なにかオレに
語りかけてくる感じがするんだ
English: Yeah, maybe. I feel like it’s telling me something.

Japanese:
ほな　あとはバルカンのおっちゃんに
確認するだけやな
English: Then let’s go take it ta Uncle Vulcan.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: よう　バルカン　持ってきたぜ
English: Sorry for making you wait, Vulcan.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
お　よく見つけた
さすがこいつの弟だな
English:
Oh! Good job!
As expected of this guy’s little brother.

Japanese:
なに言ってるかは　わかんねェけど
オレを呼んでる感じはしたぜ
English:
I don’t know what you meant by that, but it
kinda felt like it was calling out to me.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
そりゃあ仕方ねぇ　こいつらだって
天上界の崩壊に巻き込まれてんだ
しゃべる力なんて…あまり残ってねぇ
English:
That’s just how it is, ever since Cielo fell, these fellas
have lost most of their ability to talk.

Japanese: どうりで…
English: No wonder...

Japanese: それで　そいつは大丈夫なのか？
English: So, is he okay?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
なぁに　俺の手にかかりゃあな
心配すんな　さて……
English:
Oh don’t worry, he’s with me now, after all...
Now...

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
よく生き延びた
また会えて嬉しいぜ
English: You’ve lived long, I’m glad to meet you again.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
よくやったスパーダ　ありがとな
これからコイツをお前の最高のパートナーに
生まれ変わらせてくるが　ちょいと時間がかかる
English:
Thanks, Spada.
From now on, this guy’s going to be your ultimate
partner. Now hold on for a bit...

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: 悪ぃが　その辺で適当にくつろいでてくれ
English: Sorry, but feel free to make yourselves at home.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: 出来たぜ
English: And here we go!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: こいつはお前さん向きに　双剣にしといたぜ
English: I made him into two blades for you.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
……鍛冶師バルカンが息子
名をスサノオ
English:
Now, child, in the name of the Blacksmith Vulcan, 
I bestow the name Susanoo unto you.

Japanese: ああ！
English: Ooh!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
さて…　お前さんたち
今日は泊まっていくといい
積もる話もあるしな
English:
Now, I believe it’s best if you guys stay for the night.
There’s a lot of things I want to talk about with you.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
ただし　ウチは雑魚寝だけどな
ガッハッハッハ！
English:
You’ll be sleeping with me though!
Gahahahaha!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: デュランダル
English: Durandal

Japanese:
我よ
我が魂の転生よ
English: Hear me, my incarnation.

Japanese:
ああ？
ンだよ　デュランダルじゃねェか
English:
What?
Oh it’s you, Durandal.

Japanese:
人の身で　よくぞ剣となった
我は敬意を表そう
English:
In human flesh, thou have grown into a fine blade.
I salute thee.

Japanese:
へっ…　お前ェに言われるまでもねーって
うちの家訓に従っただけさ
English:
Heh, you don’t have to tell me that!
I’m just following my family’s creed.

Japanese:
我も作り手の意図に従った
やはり　貴殿は我と似ているようだ
English:
I, too, have followed the path my maker desired.
As I thought, we are the same.

Japanese:
けっ　よせよ
嬉しかねェっての
English:
Tch, quit it.
I’m not amused.

Japanese:
我が魂に込められし力
制するがために使うが良い
English:
It is best if thou commandest the power slumbering
within my soul.

Japanese: ああ　そうさせてもらう
English: You bet I will.

Japanese:
では　さらばだ
我は常に貴殿の魂の元にある
貴殿の活躍　拝見させてもらうぞ…
English:
Farewell... I shall look forward to thy accomplishments,
from the depths of your soul...

Japanese: 相変わらず　口うるせェヤツだぜ…
English: As annoying as always…

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese: 君は…　もしかして　アンジュ…？
English: Is that you, Ange?

Japanese:
兄さま？
何故こんなところに…
English:
Brother?
Why are you here...?

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
おや　忘れてしまいましたか？　私は従軍牧師
戦場ならば居て当然です
なんら不思議なことではありません
English:
Oh my, don’t tell me you’ve forgotten.
I’m a chaplain, if there’s a war, it’s only
natural that I’d be there.

Japanese:
そうでしたね
兄さま　久しくごぶさたしています
お元気そうでなによりです
English:
Ahh yes, you were...
It has been a while since you have written to me,
but it seems that you are still doing well.

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
アンジュも　見ない間に随分と成長しましたね
会えて嬉しいです
English:
I should say the same, you’ve grown quite a bit
compared to when I last saw you.
I’m happy you’re all right.

Japanese:
アンジュとソックリ
しかも　すっごい優しそうな人ね
English:
Man, you’re just like Ange’s carbon copy!
On top of that, you look pretty kind too!

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese: ところで　君たちはアンジュのお友達ですか？
English: Oh, by the way, are you Ange’s friends?

Japanese:
はい　ルカ・ミルダと申します
アンジュと一緒に旅をしていて…
アンジュには　いつもお世話になっています
English:
Yes, I’m Ruca, Ruca Milda.
I’m traveling together with Ange, she’s been a
great help.

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
こちらこそ　うちのアンジュが
世話になっています
English:
Likewise, thank you for watching over my
younger sister.

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
しかし　旅…ですか
世界を見てまわることは大事ですが……
アンジュ　どういうことです？
English:
Still, you mentioned you were traveling...
While it is a grand idea to see the world,
would you mind explaining yourself?

Japanese:
それは……今度　兄さまが
家に帰られたときに　お話します
English:
That is... I would rather tell you about it 
when we are back home.

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
…ワケありということですか
わかりました
今は聞かないことにしましょう
English:
I see...
Then let’s leave it for another time.

Japanese: ありがとうございます
English: Thank you.

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
さて…久々の再会を
もっとゆっくり味わいたいところですが…
English: Now, as much as I’d like to relish our reunion...

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
アンジュ　それと君たち
今すぐここから立ち去ってください
English: Please leave this place immediately.

Japanese: 何故です？
English: Leave? Why?

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
先日　この森の奥に　強力な魔物が現れました
私たち軍でも苦戦を強いられています
English:
A very strong monster appeared in the forest the other
day. It was strong enough to drive away our military
forces, we barely made it out alive.

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese: なにか起きる前に　ここから離れてください
English:
I’d recommend you get far away from here before
something happens.

Japanese:
あんたはどうする？
見たところ　戦闘向きではない
しかも　軍が撤退する様子はなさそうだが？
English:
And what about you?
You don’t look like you can fight, and the army doesn’t
seem to be retreating either.

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
お察しの通り　私は戦えません
ですが　仲間の手当てくらいならできます
English:
As you said, I can’t fight.
But I can, at the very least, treat the wounded.

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
それに　私たちは　任務を終えるまで…
その魔物を倒すまで　町へ戻ることは叶いません
English:
And we can’t go back until our mission is over...
until that monster is defeated.

Japanese: そんな…
English: No...

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
軍属ならば　仕方のないことです
ミルダくん　どうか　気に病まないでください
English:
It can’t be helped, I am a member of the military,
after all. Please don’t worry about me.

Japanese:
せやけど　なんで町に戻れへんの？
魔物が襲ってくるかどうかなんて
わからへんのに
English:
Why can’tcha go back ta town?
Ya don’ even know if the monster’s gonna attack
or not.

Japanese:
もし　近隣の村や町に被害が出たら
魔物を退治できなかった軍の名折れだからな
English:
If the monster manages to get out of here and attack
nearby villages, the army will be blamed for not
destroying the monster, which would hurt its standing.

Japanese:
それに　なにも手を打たなければ
王都は本来　守るべき民を見放したことになり
国への不信感は一気に高まる
English:
And if nothing’s done about it, it will look like the
Capital has abandoned its people, and distrust
will grow against the government.

Japanese:
そして　黎明の塔に軍を集結させている今
王都は手薄　国家転覆を考えている輩にとっては
千載一遇のチャンスというわけさ
English:
With most of the army focusing their efforts on the
Tower of Dawn, the Imperial Capital would would be a
sitting duck. It would be the perfect moment to attack.

Japanese:
つまり　なにがなんでも倒さなあかん！
ってことか
English: So basically, they hafta beat it at all costs!

Japanese:
兄さま　その魔物
私たちに任せてもらえませんか？
English: Brother, can you let us deal with the monster?

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
…アンジュ　これは遊びではありません
聞き分けてください
English:
Now’s not the time for games, Ange.
Please be reasonable and leave.

Japanese:
いいえ
それは　できません
English: My apologies, but I am not leaving!

Japanese:
私には…私たちには
その魔物をどうにかする力があります
だから　お願いします
English:
I... No, we have the power to deal with this monster.
So please...!

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
……昔から君は　一度決めたことは
意地でも譲りませんでしたね
English:
Sigh... Ever since you were a child, it’s been near
impossible to stop you whenever you’ve set your mind
to something.

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
譲ったと見せかけ　隙を見て実行する…
そのクセもなくなってはいないようですね
English:
It seems that you still haven’t lost that habit of
pretending to give up, and striking when the
opportunity arises.

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
はい　いいですよ
とすぐには言えません
English: Do as you wish... although I don’t fully agree with it.

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
君たちの意見はどうです？
アンジュに賛成ですか？
English:
And what does everyone else think?
Are you going to let Ange do this?

Japanese:
彼女がそれを望むなら　俺は構わん
他の者も　おそらくそうだろう
English:
I don’t mind if it’s what Ange wants to do.
Pretty sure that’s also what the others think.

Japanese:
キュキュは手伝う
アンジュ　助けたい
だから　賛成する！
English:
QQ want to help, save with Ange!
QQ join!

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese: ……わかりました
English: I understand.

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
行きなさい　アンジュ
ですが　危なくなったらすぐに逃げてください
これは約束です
English:
Go Ange, but please promise me you’ll run away
if the situation gets out of hand.

Japanese:
はい　ありがとうございます
では兄さま　行ってきます
English:
I will, thank you.
We shall be going now!

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
魔物をどうにかする力ですか…
まさかな……
English:
To possess power as strong as that monster...
There’s no way...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: 兄さま　大丈夫ですか！？
English: Are you all right, brother!?

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese: ああ……　痛っ…！
English: Yeah-- ow!

Japanese:
動かないでください
今　治します
English: Please stay still as I heal you.

Japanese:
もう動かして大丈夫です
どうですか？
English:
You can move now.
How do you feel?

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
……不思議なくらい痛みがない
これが　異能の…
いや　転生者の力　というやつですか…
English:
Oddly enough, it doesn’t hurt anymore.
Is this what a Deviant’s-- no, a Reincarnator’s
power is like?

Japanese: 兄さま　何故それを……
English: How... How did you know that?

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
悩んでいる人の話を聞くのは　私の仕事です
それに　軍にいればそれくらいは　わかります
English:
It’s my job to listen to other’s worries, that and it’s
common knowledge especially if you’re in the army.

Japanese: この力　兄さまは　軽蔑しますか？
English: Do you... hate this power?

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
たとえ転生者だとしても
アンジュ…君は私の大切な妹です
それは変わりません
English:
You might be a Reincarnator, but you’re still,
and always will be, my dearest little sister.

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
それに君は　私のケガを治してくれました
それは紛れもない事実
ありがとう　アンジュ
English:
And most of all, it’s an undeniable fact that you were
the one who healed me.
Thank you.

Japanese: 兄さま…ありがとうございます……
English: ...Thank you.

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
君は感謝の言葉ばかりを口にするね
ですが　私の前では不要ですよ
English:
You’ve always kept saying thanks to me,
you don’t have to you know...

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
そうだ…！
彼らは…彼らは無事ですか！？
English:
Oh! What about the others...!?
Are they... are they okay?

Japanese:
先ほどの兵士たちなら　生きている
と言っても　重傷だがな
English: Those soldiers are still alive, albeit badly wounded.

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
よかった…
君には　どうお礼を言っていいか…
English:
Thank Cielo...
How should I thank you?

Japanese:
礼には及ばん
戦場なら　なおのこと
English:
You don’t have to thank me.
Especially since we’re on the battlefield.

Japanese: 兄さまは　これからどうされるんです？
English: What are you going to do from now on?

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
しばらく　ここに残ります
手当てをしなければならない兵も
まだ大勢いますから
English:
I’ll be here for a while, there’s still a lot of soldiers
I’ll have to treat.

Japanese: そう…ですか……
English: Oh...

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese: ……会いたくなったら　いつでも来てください
English: Feel free to drop by whenever you start to miss me.

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
ああ　でも　妹に戦場に来い
というのも　少々酷ですね
English:
Oh, but asking my little sister to come to war might
be a bit too much, isn’t it?

Japanese: いえ　それくらい大丈夫です
English: Oh, it is not. I am fine with it.

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
私が心配なんですよ
…こんな争い　早くなくなるといいですね
English:
Oh but I’m worried, you know?
I hope this war ends soon...

Japanese:
…そうですね
では　兄さま　私たちはこれで
また来ます
English:
I hope so too... Very well then, 
we shall be going soon, brother. Farewell!

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
待ってください　アンジュ
これを持っていってください
English:
Ange, wait!
Why don’t you take this with you?

Japanese: これは…短剣…？
English: A dagger?

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese:
前の戦場で商人から買ったものですが
君の旅の役に立つはずです
English:
I bought it from a merchant that happened by here,
but I believe this should be of more use to you.

Japanese:
今のは……
もしかして　バルカンさんの……
English: Was that Vulcan’s...?

Japanese:
兄さま　ありがとうございます
大切にします
English: Thank you, brother, I shall take good care of this.

Japanese: アンジュの兄
English: Ange’s Brother

Japanese: みなさん　アンジュのこと　よろしく頼みます
English: I’m counting on the rest of you to watch over her.

Japanese: では兄さま　また！
English: See you!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
武器を持ってきましたが
これで問題ありませんか？
English:
I brought the weapon.
I suppose this should be enough, right?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
ん～…………
ああ　問題なさそうだぜ
English: Doesn’t seem to be anything wrong with it...

Japanese: では　武器の作成をお願いできますか？
English: Then can you start preparing the weapon?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: そうだな　だがその前に……
English: Yes, but before that...

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
ったく…用心深いのは相変わらずだな
俺の顔を忘れちまったか？　なんてな
ガッハハハハハッ！
English:
Still as cautious as ever, aren’t you?
Don’t tell me you’ve forgotten my face, did you?
Just kidding! Gahahahaha!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
ん？　おぉ…？
そうか　良い人の手に渡っていたのか
それは良かったな
English:
Hmm...?
Oh, seems like you found yourself a great owner.
That’s great!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
さて　これからこいつを
生まれ変わらせてくるから
嬢ちゃんたちは　その辺でくつろいでてくれ
English:
Now, I’ll soon be crafting this fella into a new form.
Feel free to make yourself at home, miss.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: 出来たぜ
English: And here we go!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
嬢ちゃんは短剣使いだったな？
使いやすいようにしておいたぜ
English:
You use a dagger, right?
I’ve made it so this guy would be easier for you to use.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
……鍛冶師バルカンが息子
名をイスラフィール
English:
Now, child, in the name of the Blacksmith Vulcan, 
I bestow the name Israfil unto you.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
この子は注意深く　思慮深い子だ
嬢ちゃんと気が合うだろう
よろしく頼むぜ
English:
He’s a very cautious and prudent fella.
Pretty sure he’ll get along with you.
Now play nice!

Japanese: はい
English: I shall.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
さて…　お前さんたち
今日はもう遅ぇし　うちで休んでいくと良い
English:
Now, since it’s gotten a little late, it would be best if
we turn in for the night.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
ただし　雑魚寝だけどな
ガッハッハッハ！
English:
You’ll be sleeping with me though!
Gahahahaha!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: オリフィエル
English: Orifiel

Japanese: アンジュ…　起きておられるか？
English: Ange, are you awake?

Japanese: …あなたは　オリフィエルさん？
English: Are you perhaps, Sir Orifiel?

Japanese:
そうです
私との出会いを　覚えておられますかな？
English: I am, do you still remember the moment we met?

Japanese: もちろんです
English: Of course.

Japanese:
１０年以上も前　図書室にあった
記憶の場に触れて
あなたの記憶と力を得ました
English:
10 years ago in the library, I touched the memory
spring and awakened to your memories and power.

Japanese:
その時　記憶に呼び覚まされた
天上界の光景に　心惹かれたことこそが
私の信仰心の起源ですから
English:
At that time, I recalled Cielo’s light from your
memories and from that day forth, became
devoted to the faith.

Japanese:
あなたは立派に精進された
僭越ですが　あなたに報いましょう
わずかながら我が力　ここに授けましょう
English:
Your devotion is admirable.
If I may be so presumptuous, may I reward you
with a portion of my power?

Japanese: ありがとうございます！
English: Thank you!

Japanese:
この力…　ありがたく
役立たせていただきますね
天地を守るために…
English:
I shall gratefully use this power, for the sake 
of protecting this world...

Japanese: 夢でも謙虚なのですね
English: Even in dreams, you’re as humble as ever.

Japanese: そんなことありませんよ
English: That is not true.

Japanese:
この夢は　あなたの姿を借りて
私自身が　言わせているだけです
本当は　結構図々しいんですよ
English:
I am merely borrowing your form in this dream, and
telling such a thing to myself.
The truth is I am quite brazen.

Japanese:
さてさて
それも　あなたの本心かどうか……
まぁ　良いでしょう…
English:
Now, now, I wonder if you truly meant that or not...
Well, so be it.

Japanese: あら　もうお別れですか？
English: Oh? Is it finally time for a farewell?

Japanese:
ええ　もう十分でしょう
夢の中でなら　いつでも私に会えます
あなたが会いたい時に…ね
English:
Indeed, I’ve been here for too long, it’s about time I
return. Should you wish for it, you can always talk to
me in your dreams.

Japanese: さようなら　オリフィエルさん…
English: Farewell, Sir Orifiel.

Japanese:
…目が覚めれば　私はこの夢のことなんて
忘れちゃうんだろうな…
English: I suppose I shall forget about this when I awake...

Japanese: なし
English: None

English: Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

English: Hermana

English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

English: Ange

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: リカルド　どうかした…？
English: Ricardo?

Japanese: すまないが　少し待っててくれ
English: Sorry, but can you stay here for a while?

Japanese:
おっちゃん　どこ行くん？
なにかウマいもんでも見つけたん？
English:
Uncle, where’re ya goin’?
Didja see sumthin’ tasty?

Japanese:
野暮用だ
ガキはそこで大人しく待っていろ
English:
Just some unfinished business. 
You kids be quiet and wait here.

Japanese:
野暮用ってなんだ？
うまいのか　しかし？
English: So is that unfinished business something tasty?

Japanese: なぁ　もしかして　コレじゃね？
English: Hey, reckon it’s “that?”

Japanese:
はぁ？　女？
そんなわけあるはずないって
ここはグリゴリの里よ？
English:
A woman? No way!
We’re in the Grigori Village, you know!

Japanese:
キュキュも　そう思う
リカルド　女　会いにいた　違う
English:
QQ thinks so too.
Ricardo not here to meet woman.

Japanese:
そうね　あの様子から察するに
もっと大事なことじゃないかしら？
English:
You are correct, the way he acted gave the impression
it was more personal.

Japanese:
それって　ガードルのこと？
でも　なんで……
English:
Do you mean Gardle...?
But why would he--

Japanese:
わからないわ　ただの憶測だもの
すべてはリカルドさんが　戻ってきてからね
English:
I cannot say for certain.
Let us just ask him when he returns.

Japanese:
ウワサをすれば
戻ってきたみたいだよ
English: And speak of the devil, he’s back.

Japanese: 待たせたな
English: Sorry for making you all wait.

Japanese:
おっちゃん　なにしてたん？
もしかして　コレのところなん？
English:
What were ya up ta, Uncle?
Were ya doin’ “that?”

Japanese:
おい　エル
立てるなら　親指じゃなくて小指だ
English:
Look, Hermie, you’re probably mistaking
something here.

Japanese:
あっ　間違えてもうた
それで　おっちゃん　どうなん？
English:
Oh, mah bad.
So what’s up?

Japanese:
……ガードルの家に行ってきた
そこで　バルカンの武器らしきものを見つけた
English:
I went to Gardle’s place and found this,
it seems to be one of Vulcan’s swords.

Japanese:
この里に入ったとき　黙っていましたが…
あのとき　声が聞こえていたんですね
English:
Ahh I see... your silence earlier probably meant
you heard its call.

Japanese:
ンだよ　それならそうと言ってくれよな
そしたら　オレたちもついてったのによ
English:
Man, you should’ve told us that from the start,
we would’ve come with you then.

Japanese:
いや　あまり　ことを騒ぎ立てたく
なかったのでな
English: Oh, I just didn’t want to raise a fuss.

Japanese:
俺たちは　ここでは忌み嫌われている
下手に行動すれば
それこそ平和的な話し合いは　望めなくなる
English:
We’re hated here, so if we behaved poorly, 
we’d never be able to talk it out peacefully.

Japanese: なるほど…
English: Ahh, I see...

Japanese:
さて　用も済んだ
バルカンのところへ向かおう
English:
Now, let’s head back to Vulcan if you don’t have
anything else to do.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
バルカン　武器を持ってきた
確かめてくれ
English:
I’ve brought it, Vulcan.
Make sure it’s what you said it was.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
確かに俺の子どもだ
お前さん　もしかして　こいつの声
よく聞こえたんじゃないのか？
English:
Yes, I believe you’ve found my son here.
Did you also hear his voice?

Japanese: ああ　何故わかる？
English: I did, how did you know?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
なんてこたぁない
お前さんのことを気に入ったらしい
よかったな　ガッハハハハハッ
English:
Nothing, it looks like he’s grown quite fond of you!
Gahahahaha!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: さて……
English: Now then...

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
お前なら　生きていると信じていた
よく帰ってきたな
English:
I always knew you were still alive.
Welcome home...

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
お前さん　ありがとな
これからこいつを生まれ変わらせてくる
退屈だろうが　しばらくの間　待っててくれよ
English:
Thanks, man! Thanks to you, this guy can be reborn
again. You might get a bit bored waiting, but feel free
to make yourself at home.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: 出来たぜ
English: And here we go!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
こいつ　お前さんと一緒に戦いたくて
仕方がないそうだ
English:
This fella here insists on wanting to fight with you.
So I made him the same as your weapon.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
だから　お前さんが使ってる武器と
同じようにしておいたぜ
English: I guarantee you, he’ll deliver.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
……鍛冶師バルカンが息子
名をハーデス
English:
Now, child, in the name of the Blacksmith Vulcan, 
I bestow the name Hades unto you.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
お前さんのいいパートナーになるはずだ
よろしく頼むぜ
English:
Make sure to take good care of him. He’s the best 
partner you couldn’t have asked for.

Japanese: ああ
English: I will.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
さて…　お前さんたち　折角だ
今日はうちで休んでいくといい
English:
Since you’re here and all, might as well stay here
for the night.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
ただし　雑魚寝だけどな
ガッハッハッハ！
English:
You’ll be sleeping with me though!
Gahahahaha!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ヒュプノス
English: Hypnos

Japanese: 悲しいことだな
English: Pitiful.

Japanese: お前は…
English: You’re...!

Japanese:
私は転生してまで
死を看取らねばならぬのか…
English:
To think that even in the next life,
I’d still be observing ones’ final moments.

Japanese:
勘違いするな
看取っているのは俺だ
お前ではない
English:
Don’t misunderstand, 
I’m the one observing here, 
not you.

Japanese:
お前を通じて　私は見ているのだ
魂は循環し　引き継がれる
お前が知らぬわけがあるまい
English:
I have seen through your eyes, I have seen souls 
circulating and passing on. There is no way 
you wouldn’t have known!

Japanese:
勝手に見てるがいい
だが　俺の人生だ
お前に関係はない
English:
Then watch as much as you want, but
do know that it’s my life and not yours.

Japanese:
本当にそう思うか？
私の記憶や能力が　お前の人生に
なんの影響も与えていないなどと？
English:
Do you really believe that my power and memories
had never influenced you?

Japanese:
ああ　その通りだ
俺はお前の力を　利用しているだけに過ぎん
English:
It’s as you said, they never did.
I’m merely using your power for myself.

Japanese:
…馬鹿馬鹿しい
私の力に魅入られたからこそ
技を極めようとしているくせに
English:
Foolish, you try and master my skill just because
you are enthralled by my power.

Japanese:
まぁ　よい
私の力　上手く使え
そして　魂を循環させるんだ
English:
So be it, make good use of my power 
and let souls pass on.

Japanese: フン　言われるまでもない…
English: Hmph, you don’t have to tell me.

Japanese: では　さらばだ…
English: Farewell.

Japanese:
…お前の力
遠慮なく使わせてもらうぞ
ガキどもを守るために…な
English:
I’ll freely use your power alright, 
to protect those brats that is.

English: None

English: QQ

English: Hermana

Japanese: ……なんや？　今の…
English: What was that?

Japanese:
エル　どした？
みんな　置いてかれる
English:
Hermie, what’s wrong?
Everyone’s already gone ahead.

Japanese: あぁ！　待って～な！
English: Ahhh wait up～!

English: None

English: Ricardo

English: Illia
