Japanese: ポゥじいさん
English: Grandpwo

Japanese:
ほぉ　久しぶりだな
そんなにワシに会いたかったか
そうかそうか　では１曲プレゼントしよう
English:
Ahh long time no see, all of you came for me,
didn’t you?
I see... Then, let me sing you a present.

Japanese: あたしは　いらないわよ
English: No thanks!

Japanese: ボクも遠慮させてもらうよ
English: I will pass.

Japanese: ポゥじいさん
English: Grandpwo

Japanese:
ははは　そう照れるな
ワシのこの喜び　歌わずにはいられんのさ
English:
Hahaha, don’t be shy now!
I just can’t help but sing when I’m happy.

Japanese: 相変わらずだな　このじいさん…
English: This guy will never change, won’t he?

Japanese:
この手の者には　抵抗するだけ無駄だ
好きにさせておけ
English: Telling him to shut up is futile, just let him be.

Japanese: ポゥじいさん
English: Grandpwo

Japanese: では………
English: Then--

Japanese: あっーーーーーー！！！
English: OHHHHH!!

Japanese: ポゥじいさん
English: Grandpwo

Japanese:
な　なんだ…
いきなり大声を出して…
English:
Wh-What?
Wh-Why’re you shouting all of a sudden?

Japanese:
声や！　声！
なんや引っかかるとおもっとったら　声や！
English:
It was a voice!
Ah’ve been wondrin’ what was callin’ out ta me,
an’ it turns out ta be a voice!

Japanese: ええと…エル　なにが声なの？
English: A voice? What voice, Hermie?

Japanese:
ここにな　入ったとき聞こえたんや
きっと　バルカンのおっちゃんの子どもが
ウチのこと呼んどる！
English:
Ah’ve been hearin’ it calling fer me since enterin’ this
place! Ah’m sure it’s one of Vulcan’s children!

Japanese: 本当？　でも　どこに……
English: Really? Then where...

Japanese: この中や！　この中から聞こえとる！
English: It’s here! Ah can hear it comin’ from here!

Japanese:
なぁ　じいちゃん　テントの中　入ってええ？
ウチのことを呼んどる子がいるんや
English:
Hey, gramps, can Ah go inside the tent?
There’s sumbody callin’ ta me from inside.

Japanese: ポゥじいさん
English: Grandpwo

Japanese: ワシの歌を聞いてくれたら　構わないさ
English: I wouldn’t mind if you listened to my song.

Japanese:
ホンマに？　それなら　構へん構へん
聞いたったるから　はよ歌って～な
English: Ya sure? Hurry up an’ sing then, Ah’m listenin～

Japanese: ポゥじいさん
English: Grandpwo

Japanese: よくぞ言った！　心して聞くがいい
English: Well said! Listen closely now!

Japanese: ポゥじいさん
English: Grandpwo

Japanese:
♪　人の家にくるなら　礼儀を通せ　　　　　♪
♪　挨拶　手土産　これ基本　　　　　　　　♪
♪　え　手土産ない？　それなら金おいてけ　♪
English:
♪　Mind your manners while visiting　♪
 ♪　Bring some pleasantries and a present　♪
 ♪　What? Got nothing? Give me money instead　♪

Japanese: ほな　調べさせてもらうで
English: Thanks, gramps, Ah’mma go check it out now～

Japanese: ポゥじいさん
English: Grandpwo

Japanese:
こら！　まだ終わってはおらん！
少しくらいつっこんだら　どうだ！
English:
Hey, I ain’t finished yet!
Why don’t you stay for a while and listen to my
next songs.

Japanese: えー　あとどれくらいあるん？
English: How many do you still have left?

Japanese: ポゥじいさん
English: Grandpwo

Japanese: 新作含め１０曲だ
English: I’ve composed 10!

Japanese: ほな　みんな　テントの中調べるの手伝って
English: C’mon, fellas, help me look in his tent.

Japanese: ポゥじいさん
English: Grandpwo

Japanese: こ　こら！　待て　待て……
English: H-Hey! W-Wait...!

Japanese:
無事　武器も手に入ったし
バルカンさんに　確認してもらいましょう
English:
Now that we have got the sword,
let us go take it back to Vulcan.

Japanese: せやな
English: Right.

Japanese:
じいちゃん　ありがとうな
これであの子　親に会わせてあげられるわ
English:
Thanks gramps, with this Ah’ll be able ta reunite
this child with his parent.

Japanese: ポゥじいさん
English: Grandpwo

Japanese:
…よくわからんが　親との再会を
邪魔するわけにはいかんからの
ワシの歌は　次回　来たときにでも披露しよう
English:
I don’t really understand, but I didn’t intend to hinder
this child’s reunion with his parent.
I’ll just sing for you guys some other time.

Japanese:
その方向で　頼むわ
ほなな！
English:
Thanks fer the understandin’, gramps!
See ya!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
バルカンのおっちゃん　探してきたで
この子であっとる？
English:
There ya are, Uncle Vulcan.
This the child yer lookin’ fer?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
嬢ちゃん　よく見つけたな
ああ　間違いない　俺の子どもだ
English:
Thanks, lassie. Now lessee... yeah!
No doubt about it, this here’s my son.

Japanese: よかったな～　父ちゃんに会えて
English: Ah’m glad～ he’s finally reunited with ya.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: 嬢ちゃんのおかげで　こいつも喜んでるぜ
English: All thanks to you, lassie. This one here is also happy.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
お前さん　案外元気そうだな
しかも　いい嬢ちゃんに声をかけて
English:
My dear, you seem to be in an unusual good mood.
Moreover, you called out to a nice lassie.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
なんだ？　ホレたのか？　なんてな！
ガッハハハハハッ！
English:
What? You fell in love!?
Now what are the odds!
Gahahahaha!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
ありがとな　嬢ちゃん
これからコイツを生まれ変わらせてくる
English:
Thanks, lassie, thanks to you this one can be
reborn again.

Japanese: よろしゅう頼むわ
English: No problem, Uncle. Ah’m countin’ on ya.

Japanese:
自分　がんばってな
ウチ　応援しとる
English:
Work hard, Uncle, an’ Ah’ll be here if ya need
sum help!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: ガッハハハハハッ！　俺がやるんだ　大丈夫さ
English: Gahahahaha! It’s a’ight, lassie, I can do it.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
じゃあ　嬢ちゃんたちは
その辺でくつろいでてくれ
English:
You can help me out by making yourselves at
home over there.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: 出来たぜ
English: And here we go!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
こいつ　嬢ちゃんの役に立ちてぇそうだ
悪いが　面倒見てやってくれねぇか？
English:
Seems like this guy could be useful to you.
I’m sorry, but would you mind watching over him
for me?

Japanese: 構へんで
English: Ah don’ mind.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: では……
English: Then...

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
……鍛冶師バルカンが息子
名をルドラ
English:
Now, child, in the name of the Blacksmith Vulcan, 
I bestow the name Rudra unto you.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
少しボケっとしてっけど　いいヤツだ
よろしく頼むぜ
English:
He’s a bit absent-minded, but he’s a good fella.
Take care of him, a’ight?

Japanese: もちろんや
English: Of course!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
さて…　お前さんたち
今日はうちで　ゆっくりしていくといい
すぐに出発ってのもなんだろ？
English:
Now, then, you guys should relax at my place for today.
It’s not like you all are in a hurry, right?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
ただし　ベッドなんて
シャレたもんはねぇけどな！
ガッハッハッハ！
English:
You’ll have to share the bed with me, though!
Gahahahaha!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ヴリトラ
English: Vritra

Japanese:
これ　起きんかえ
小さき子よ
English: Arise, young one.

Japanese:
うーん…　むにゃむにゃ…
もう食べられへんー…
English: Hnn... no... Ah can’t eat anymore...

Japanese:
これこれ　ベタな寝言を
言うフリは止めておくが良いぞ
English:
Now, now, it’s time for you to cease your pretend
sleep talk child.

Japanese:
…なんや　自分
何の用なん？
English:
What’re ya?
Whadd’ya want?!

Japanese:
「自分」とな？
ワシを自分と呼ぶのかえ？
お前が　ワシをそう思うておったとはのぅ
English:
“What” am I? So I’m a “what”, now?
Is that what you think of me as?

Japanese:
あ　ちゃうねん　ちゃうねん！
ウチの口グセで「あなた」って意味で　使うてん
English:
Oh no, Ah didn’t mean ta call ya a “what!”
Ya jus’ surprised me!

Japanese: ややこしい言葉よのぅ…
English: Oh dear... What a troublesome child.

Japanese:
ほんで…　なんやのん？
なにしに来たん？
English:
So, can Ah help ya?
Why’re ya here?

Japanese: そうそう　忘れるところだったわい
English: Oh, right, I almost forgot.

Japanese:
お前が　頑張っておるのを見てな
少し力を貸してやりとぉなってのぅ
English:
You’ve been trying so hard recently that I figured I
might as well reward you with a little bit of my power.

Japanese:
ホンマ？
おおきに！
English:
Really?
Thank ya!

Japanese:
ほっほっほ
素直で物怖じしない　良い子じゃて…
English: Hohoho～ what an honest girl...

Japanese:
では　その力で
アスラの坊やを　助けてやっておくれ
この婆からのお願いじゃ
English:
Please use that power to help that child, Asura.
’Tis a small wish from this old grandma.

Japanese: おぅ　任せときっ！
English: Ah will! Leave it ta me!

Japanese:
おぅおぅ　本当に良い子じゃて…
転生して良かったわ…
English:
What a good child...
I’m glad I reincarnated...

Japanese:
ウチも　自分が前世で良かったでー！
ほな　またなー
English:
Ah’m also glad ya were mah past self!
See ya!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
へぇ…
どうやら　ボクを呼んでいるみたいだね
English: Hm... It seems like it is calling me.

Japanese: なによ　呼んでるって？
English: What is? Who’s calling you?

Japanese:
行けばわかるよ
この奥だ
さぁ　行こう
English:
You will understand once we get there. 
It is just a bit further. Let us make haste.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ビンゴ
これが　バルカンさんの言ってた武器だね
English:
Bingo! This should be one of the weapons Vulcan was 
talking about.

Japanese:
なぁなぁ
なんで武器がこんなところにあるん？
めっちゃ似合わへんで
English:
Hey hey, why’s there a weapon inna place like this?
It don’ seem appropriate.

Japanese:
うーん…
もしかして　研究されていたのかな？
English: Maybe it’s being researched?

Japanese:
その可能性はあるな
ここは……転生者を動力源にした
兵器を開発していたからな
English:
That might also be a possibility.
I believe this place is... a place where they develop
weapons that use Reincarnators as a source of energy.

Japanese:
転生者を動力源
すごい　技術！
English:
Reincarnators as a source of energy!
Amazing technology!

Japanese:
ええ…
でも　兵器よ
技術はすごくても　褒められたものではないわ
English:
It is amazing yes, but they are developing weapons 
here. Even if it is remarkable, these are not really 
things worth praising.

Japanese:
とりあえず　武器も手に入れたことだしよ
バルカンのところに持っていこうぜ
English:
Anyways, since we already have the weapon 
we should take this back to Vulcan.

Japanese:
…それにしても　ボクの魂にまで反応するとはね
この世界は　本当にミステリアスだ
English:
...Be that as it may, I did not expect it to call my soul.
This world truly is a mystery.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
持ってきたよ
あなたが言っていたのは　これだろう？
English:
I brought it. 
This is what you were talking about, correct?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
おぉ　そうだそうだ　こいつだ
よく見つけたな
English:
Ahh yes, this is the one! 
I am surprised you managed to find him.

Japanese:
不思議なことに　声が聞こえたからね
それがなかったら　わからなかったよ
English:
Strangely enough, I found it because I heard a voice
calling out to me. Had I not heard it, I would have 
missed it.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: だろうな
English: I bet you did.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
さてと…　久しぶりだな
随分と　色っぽい兄ちゃんを呼んだな
お前の好みか？　ガッハッハッハ！
English:
Now then... Long time no see! Didn’t know you’d pick
such a sexy young man. Is he your type? 
Gahahahaha!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
おいおい　拗ねんなって
悪かった　悪かったから
English: Woah, sorry, you didn’t have to sulk! My bad! Haha...

Japanese: 色っぽいねぇ…？
English: Sexy...?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: おぉっと…　こっちもご立腹か…
English: Oops... Looks like this one got angry too...

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
と…とりあえず　その辺でくつろいでてくれ
コイツが生まれ変わるには　時間がかかるんでな
じゃあ　後でな！
English:
A-Anyways, make yourself at home over there. 
It’ll take a while to give this one a new form, see?
See you later!

Japanese:
やれやれ…
あの剣も　なかなか苦労していそうだね
English:
Oh dear... it seems that sword is also going through 
some troubles...

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: 出来たぜ
English: And here we go!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
お前さん　本を使って戦うと聞いてな
悪いが　勝手に武器を拝借させてもらったぜ
English:
You fight with a book, correct? Sorry, for suddenly 
borrowing your weapon like this.

Japanese:
構わないよ
それで　どう？　うまくいったの？
English:
It is all right. 
So, how is it? Did it turn out well?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
ああ　もちろんだ
頑張って加工したぜ
English:
Yeah of course! 
I did my best making it.

Japanese:
あれが本になるなんてね
どういう原理で　そうなるのか興味があるよ
English:
For that sword to have turned into a book... I wonder 
what process it took for this sword to become as such.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
それはな　ちょちょいと剣をバラして
パラパラっと　本に埋め込んで　ババッ！
とやったんだ
English:
Well, you take the sword apart little by little, flatten the
small parts and slap em onto a book, like BAM!
And that’s how you make it.

Japanese: 大雑把な説明をありがとう
English: Thank you for your crude explanation.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
ガッハハハ！
礼には及ばねぇよ
English: Gahahahaha! No need to thank me!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: さて……
English: Now then...

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
……鍛冶師バルカンが息子
名をアスクレピオス
English:
Now, child, in the name of the Blacksmith Vulcan, 
I bestow the name Asclepius unto you.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: ちょっと　変わったヤツだが仲良くやってくれ
English: He’s a bit weird, but I hope you two get along.

Japanese: ありがたく頂戴するよ
English: I gratefully accept.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
さて…　お前さんたち
今日は泊まっていくと良い
歓迎するぜ
English:
Now... You guys should stay over for a while. 
You’re welcome here.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
といっても　ベッドなんてねぇ
雑魚寝だけどな！
ガッハッハッハ！
English:
I don’t have any extra beds, though. 
We can just sleep all together in a huddle! 
Gahahahaha!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
バルカンさんの武器…か…
不思議だね　手にとっていると
力が湧いてくるようだ…
English:
Vulcan’s weapon... How strange, ever since I have 
laid my hands on it I keep feeling my power welling 
forth from within me...

Japanese:
それに　何年も使っていたかのように
手に馴染む
こんなに使いやすい武器は　初めてだ
English:
Furthermore, it fits so perfectly in my hand just as if 
I had been using it for years, yet it is the first time I 
have held such a weapon.

Japanese:
…これが「鍛冶の神」の力か
ふふっ　彼に感謝しないといけないね
English:
So this is the God of the Forge’s power... 
I must give him my thanks.

Japanese:
これで　ボクの目的が達成しやすくなった
この力　存分に使わせてもらうよ
English:
My objective should be easier to achieve now, I will 
gladly use this power to my hearts’ content.

Japanese:
…もちろん　ボクだけじゃなく
彼らのためにもね
English:
Of course, I will use this not only for myself, 
but for them as well.

Japanese: いや　なんでもないよ

Japanese: また聞こえた　キュキュを呼ぶのは誰？

Japanese: バルカンのとこ　行く　早く！
English: Go see Vulcan, let’s go, quickly!

Japanese:
キュキュさん！？

English: QQ!? Wait...!

Japanese: まったく　せわしないなぁ

English: QQ

Japanese: バルカン　武器　持てきた！
English: I got Vulcan’s weapon!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: おっ　家出娘のご帰還だな
English: Alas, the prodigal daughter has returned!

Japanese: 家出娘？

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
ガッハハハハハッ
こいつ　いつのまにか
俺の元から　姿を消してな
English:
Gahahahaha!
This one disappeared from my sight before I even

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
まったく　いままで
どこへ行ってたんだか
English: Really though, where have you been until now?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
しかし…　よく帰ってきたな

バカ言うな　泣いてなんかねぇよ！
English:
Anyways... I’m glad you found your way home.
You had me all worried... 
Don’t say stupid things, I didn’t cry!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
ありがとな　こいつとは
もう　会えないんじゃないかと思ってたぜ
English:
Thank you. I really thought I wasn’t going to see 
her again.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
よし　それじゃあ
こいつを生まれ変わらせてくる
しばらくの間　待っててくれよ
English:
Alright, time to give this one a new life!
This might take a while, so would you mind waiting

Japanese:
バルカン　待つ
キュキュ　武器作るところ　見たい
いいか？
English:
Vulcan wait. 
QQ wants to see place where weapon is made. 
Is it okay?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
おっ　なんだ　興味があるのか？
嬢ちゃんみたいな子は珍しいなぁ
English:
Oh? Are you interested in seeing how weapons are
made? Pretty rare from young misses like you!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
よし来い
俺の技　見せてやる！
English: Alright, follow me. I’ll show you my skills!

Japanese:
はい
ありがと！
English: Yay! Thanks!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: 出来たぜ
English: And here we go!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
嬢ちゃんと　気が合ったみたいだから
扱いやすいように槍にしておいたぜ
English:
This lassie seems to have taken a fondness on you
so I made her into a spear that you can easily use.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
……鍛冶師バルカンが唯一の娘
名をアテナ
English:
Now, child, in the name of the Blacksmith Vulcan, 
I bestow the name Athena unto you.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
好奇心旺盛で　お転婆な娘だが
まあ　面倒見てやってくれ
English:
A curious tomboy, she is...  Please take good
care of her.

Japanese:
はい　共に歩む　誓た
キュキュに　任せる
English:
Yes QQ will protect her and bring her everywhere.
Leave it to QQ.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
さて…　お前さんたち
今日は泊まっていくと良い
嬢ちゃんも　ずっと隣で見てて疲れただろ？
English:
Now... You guys, feel free to stay over. Young girl, you
must be tired from observing the whole process, right?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
大した歓迎も　できねぇけどな
ガッハッハッハ！
English: I can’t offer you a fancy place though. Gahahahaha!

Japanese: なし
English: None

English: QQ

Japanese:
バルカン　天上界の技術　すごかた

English:
Vulcan’s Cielan craft was amazing! 
That knowledge and this weapon...

Japanese:
キュキュは大事　使う
だから武器　よろしく
English:
QQ will treasure it dearly! 
That’s why, nice to meet you, weapon!

Japanese:
…キュキュに　力貸してくれるか？
ありがと！
English: You’re going to lend QQ your power? Thank you!

English: None

Japanese:
うーん　結局なんだったのかしら？
悪い人たちじゃなかったみたいだけど
English:
Hmm... I wonder who they are?
They did not appear to be malicious...

Japanese:
そんなん決まってるやん
「正義の味方」…やろ？
English: Ain’t that obvious? They’re “allies of justice”... right?

Japanese: 自称だけどね
English: Self-proclaimed though.

Japanese:
そうか？
オレはあいつらに　熱い魂を感じたぜ！
English:
You really think so?
I think their spirit was legit though, I felt it!

Japanese:
そうだね
人々を守りたいって思いは　嘘じゃなさそうだよ
English:
You’re right, I don’t think they were lying about
wanting to protect others.

Japanese:
なんだっていいわよ
あたしたちも　そろそろ行きましょ
English: Whatever, let’s just get movin’.

Japanese:
そうか
あれが五色の英雄か…
English: I see... So those were the Five Colored Heroes...

Japanese: ホントか！？
English: Really!?

Japanese: もと　たくさん話しておけばよかた…
English: Wish we talked to them more...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

English: QQ

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: なんだろう　これ？
English: What’s this?

Japanese: なにかのレシピのようだね　どれどれ…
English: This seems to be some sort of recipe. Let me see...

Japanese: ぬふぬふっ！　このレシピは……
English: Ohoh～! This recipe is...

Japanese: 幻のレシピゲト～～～！！
English: Fabled Recipe Obtained～～!

Japanese: キュキュ　コーダのセリフ取るな
English: QQ, don’t take Coda’s catchphrase!

Japanese: ごめんごめん～
English: Haha～ Sorry～

Japanese:
それにしても　まさかレシピが
こんなところにあるとはな
English: But to think that there’d be a recipe in a place like this...

Japanese:
「円に魂を込めたものなり
　長きを経て　人から人へと受け継がれん
　探すこと　容易でなし」
English:
“A soul captured within a circle, passed down through
generations over time. For sure, this won’t be easy
to find.”

Japanese:
探すのすごく大変そうな感じなのに
なんだか　あっけなかったね
English:
It sounded like a pain to look for, but this is kind
of unsatisfying.

Japanese:
なにはともあれ
無事に手に入ったのは喜ばしいね
English: At any rate, I am just glad we managed to get it safely.

Japanese:
ねぇ　そのレシピに書かれてる料理って
どんなの？
English: Hey, what kinda recipe’s written in that anyway?

Japanese: パクまん！
English: PAKMAN!

Japanese:
キュキュ　パクまんじゃない
パックまんだ　しかし
English:
Not pakman, QQ.
It’s Pacman!

Japanese:
へぇ　なんだかおまんじゅうみたいね
あとで　作ってみましょ！
English:
Oooh, it looks like some sort of pastry～
Let’s try baking it later.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
あれ？
ねぇ　コーダのヤツ見てない？
さっきから　いないんだけど…
English:
Does anyone know where Coda went?
I haven’t seen him for a while now.

Japanese:
本当だ
どこ行っちゃったんだろう
English:
Oh, you’re right!
I wonder where he went?

Japanese:
ってか　イリア
お前　一応飼い主だろ？
English: Wait, aren’t you more or less his owner?

Japanese:
一応って何よ！
飼い主…よ…　あたしは！
English:
What the heck do you mean “more or less!?”
I AM his owner!
...Maybe.

Japanese: せやけど　ドコ行きよったんやろ？
English: Yeah, but Ah wonder where he went?

Japanese:
ねぇねぇ　探すのもメンドーだし
置いて行くってのはどぉ？
English:
Hey, how about we just leave him?
It’s kind of a pain looking for that rat.

Japanese: 最低ね
English: Nasty.

Japanese: ああ　最低だ
English: Very.

Japanese: イリア…　最低だよ
English: Illia, you’re horrible.

Japanese:
コ　コーダァ～！！
もう　どこ行ってたのよぉ
あたし　飼い主として心配したんだから～！
English:
C-Coda!
Wh-where the heck did you run off to?
You made your owner worry!

Japanese:
さっきまで　置いていこうとしていた
人の言うセリフとは思えないね
English:
Nice words coming from someone who was about
to leave him.

Japanese:
どーした　イリア？
しかし　そんな顔　初めて見たぞ
English:
What’s the matter, Illia?
That’s the first time Coda saw that expression though.

Japanese:
でも今　大事なのは　別の話だー
聞け　みんな！
幻のレシピって知ってるか　しかし？
English:
But that doesn’t matter right now!
Listen, everyone! Are you all aware of Fabled Recipes?

Japanese: なんやソレ？
English: What’re those?

Japanese: 聞くからにうまそうなモン　想像してまうなぁ
English: They sound delicious.

Japanese:
この世界に８品
失われたレシピがあるって話らしいぞー
English: Apparently, there’s 8 recipes lost around this world.

Japanese: あー　そーかよ
English: Ohh is that so...?

Japanese: さて　先を急ぐか
English: Let’s just go.

Japanese:
うー　みんな　興味ないのか　しかし？
きっとスゴい料理だぞー？
English:
Awww, are you guys not interested?
Coda’s sure they’ll be tasty though...

Japanese:
そうよ！　みんなヒドい！
あたしの愛するコーダの言うことを
聞かないなんて！
English:
You’re all horrible!
How dare you ignore my beloved Coda!?

Japanese: …みんな　話だけでも聞いてみようよ
English: ...... Fine... let’s hear him out.

Japanese:
そうよ　みんな
私は興味あるもの
English: Indeed, I am also interested.

Japanese: ほーんの少しだけ
English: Only just a little... bit...

Japanese: ウチも聞きたーい
English: Ah wanna know too!

Japanese: キュキュも！　キュキュも！
English: QQ too!

Japanese: …ならばとっとと話せ
English: ...Then hurry up and spit it.

Japanese: 手短に頼むよ
English: Keep it short.

Japanese: んー　じゃ聞け　みんな
English: Hmm... Alright, listen up!

Japanese:
聞いた話によると
この世界には　あまりの魅力のために
レシピを封印された料理があるという
English:
I’ve heard that there are recipes in this world sealed
because they’re too tempting.

Japanese: ンだよ　ソレ…
English: What the hell...

Japanese: 超スゴそうじゃねーか
English: That sounds hella cool!

Japanese: それでそれで？
English: And then...?

Japanese:
一つは熱さと刺激
そして甘さを極めし　味覚の調和王
English:
One of those recipes lords over the harmony of the
finest sweetness, heat, and stimulation.

Japanese:
その苛烈な辛さは　活火山の如し
その豊潤な甘さは　山にかかる白雲の如し
English:
Its spiciness is like an active volcano, and its mellow
sweetness like the clouds above its crater.

Japanese:
なんや　辛いんか　甘いんか
ようわからん食いもんやなぁ
どこ行ったらあるんやろ？
English:
What? Is it spicy or sweet?
Ah wonder where ya can find it?

Japanese:
一つは　円に魂を込めたものなり
長きを経て　人から人へと受け継がれん
探すこと　容易でなし
English:
Another one is a soul captured within a circle,
passed down through generations over a long time.
For sure, this won’t be easy to find.

Japanese:
ふむ…
これでは　まったくわからんな
English: Hmph... This doesn’t make any sense.

Japanese:
一つは　素材本来の味を
最大限に引き出した　味の境地
その豊かな風味に悟りを得るだろう
English:
And one, is a land of flavor that brings the best out
of its ingredients, one that will enlighten you with
its richness.

Japanese:
なんか大仰ね
さぞ　おいしいんでしょうよ
English: That sounds exaggerated, I bet it’s tasty.

Japanese:
一つは　異国の饗宴
彼の王が食し　愛した庶民の味
だが　すでに失われて遠く久しい
English:
And one is a dish that made a foreign king fall in
love with the land’s local flavors.
Yet it’s a legend lost to time.

Japanese:
曖昧だね
本当に存在しているのか　怪しいよ
English: How vague, does it exist or not?

Japanese:
一つは　かつての貴族たちが　乞い願うもの
その７色に輝く水は　ひとつの源流から出ずる
English:
And one is a drink that many nobles would beg to
taste, where 7 colors pour forth and sparkle from
its headwaters.

Japanese:
そして　それは滋養
ひとたび口にすれば　衰えた身体を
たちどころに癒すであろう
English:
They say that a weakened man will immediately be
cured the moment his lips touch its nourished waters.

Japanese:
へぇ…　貴族たちが…
聞いたことねぇけど　いっぺん飲んでみてェな
English:
Nobles, huh...?
Never heard of it before, but I sure would like to try
it out.

Japanese:
一つは　白き地に愛されしデザート
その温かさと甘さは
あらゆる者の頬を落とさせたという
English:
Another is a dessert beloved in the land of white,
the sweetness and warmth of which is enough to
make every person’s cheeks fall.

Japanese:
デザート…
素晴らしい食べ物みたいね
English:
Dessert...
It sounds so wonderful, I’d like to taste it someday.

Japanese:
一つは　その香ばしさ　体中を駆け抜け
食した者の荒野のような心に
清らかな風が　そよぐであろう
English:
And one is a meal whose aroma will course through
your body, its purifying wind rustling its eater’s
desolate heart.

Japanese:
香ばしい！
どれだけおいしいか気になる！
English:
Aroma!
Makes you wonder how good it is!

Japanese:
一つは　そのスープ　魅せられし者の心にあり
星　満つる時　かの地により　引き寄せられん
English:
And the last lies in the heart of one enchanted by this
soup, they will be drawn to the land when the stars
grow full.

Japanese:
へぇ　スープなんだ
でも　心の中にあるって　どういうことだろう？
English:
Oh, it’s a soup...
But, I wonder what you mean by it lying in
someone’s heart?

Japanese:
以上８品を「幻のレシピ」とし
所縁の地に封印す
決して味に溺れることなかれ
English:
And so these are the Eight Fabled Recipes which are
sealed within their respective lands, so as to not let
people wallow in its flavors.

Japanese: 以上が聞かされた話だぞー？　しかし
English: And that’s what Coda knows though!

Japanese:
所縁の地に封印…だと？
他に情報はないのか？
English:
Sealed within their respective lands?
Do you know any more?

Japanese: 知らんぞー？　しかし
English: Coda doesn’t though.

Japanese:
情報が少なすぎるわ
しらみつぶしで　各地を巡るしかないのかなぁ？
English:
We are lacking too much information, if we want to
find these recipes, we have to scour the land with
a fine-toothed comb.

Japanese: そんなのイチイチ　やってらんねェって
English: We don’t have the time to look for myths!

Japanese:
でも行く先々で　聞きまわるぐらいなら
大した手間じゃなさそうだね
English:
But if we go around asking about it won’t be
that much work.

Japanese: ま　それぐらいなら…な
English: Good point.

Japanese:
決まった
わざわざ探しに行くよりも
俺たちのすべきことを優先だ
English:
Right then, but let’s do what we have to do first
before we start going around asking about these.

Japanese:
う～…　仕方ないなー
しかし納得
English:
Awww, oh well.
Coda agrees.

Japanese:
ほ～ら　あたしの可愛いコーダちゃん？
悲しまないでね？
English:
Now, now～
Don’t be sad, my cute Coda.

Japanese: しかしイリア…
English: Illia...

Japanese: お前　ヘンすぎだぞ？
English: you’re acting too weird though.

Japanese: ところで　その話　誰に聞いたの？
English: By the way, where did you hear about those recipes?

Japanese:
んー
たしかワンワンなんとか
そんなカンジの名前だったー
English:
Hmm...
Coda’s sure it’s from someone called Woofy or
something similar...

Japanese: イヌが…？
English: A dog?

Japanese: まさかシアン？
English: D’ya perhaps mean Sian?

Japanese:
そんなはずはないと思うよ
あの彼が　あんな長い解説を
暗記出来るわけがないしね
English:
I doubt he heard it from him, there is no way Sian
would have been able to explain something that
long to Coda.

Japanese: …そうかも
English: Yeah, maybe...

Japanese:
まあ　とにかく　先に進もう
運が良ければ　きっと巡り会えるよ
English:
Anyways, we should go on, I’m sure we’ll meet them
when fate allows it.

Japanese: んー　コーダは運命を感じるんだなー　しかし
English:
We’ll definitely meet them again～!
Coda knows for sure!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ピーンと来た
コーダ　ここが幻のレシピが
封印された所だと思うぞ　しかし
English:
It’s here!
There’s a Fabled Recipe sealed around here!
Coda can feel it!

Japanese: ああ？　なんでそー思うんだよ？
English: Huh? What makes you say that?

Japanese:
あ…　でも
「その苛烈な辛さは　活火山の如し
　その豊潤な甘さは　山にかかる白雲の如し」
English:
Oh! I believe Coda mentioned along the lines of,
“Its spiciness is like an active volcano, and its mellow
sweetness like the clouds above its crater.”

Japanese:
だから
もしかして　ここを示してるんじゃない？
English: Maybe that’s describing this place?

Japanese:
ってか　一回聞いただけで
暗記したってのか？
English: Hol’ up, did you... you remembered all that?

Japanese: さすがに全部覚えたわけじゃないけど　大体は…
English: Well, not all per se. I just remember a gist of it.

Japanese: ふぇぇ～　兄ちゃんスゴいなぁ…
English: Whoa! That’s amazin’...

Japanese: ルカ　ヘンだな
English: Ruca, you’re weird!

Japanese:
それはともかく　おい　門番
幻のレシピについて教えろ　しかし
English:
Anyways, you there! Gatekeeper!
Teach us the Fabled recipe!

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese: 幻のレシピ…？
English: Fabled recipe?

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese:
ああ　そういえば思い出したよ
古文書のことだね
English:
Oh, that reminds me!
You must be talking about the old documents.

Japanese: 良ければ　詳しく教えていただけますか？
English: If it is all right, can you teach us about it?

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese:
構わないよ
ここは修行の地として有名だろ？
English:
Oh sure!
Did you know that this area’s famous for its
training grounds?

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese:
肉体鍛錬として　暑い火山帯の中で
あえて汗をかくべく　とある食べ物が
修行者の間で食べられ始めたんだ
English:
Since this land’s near a volcanic zone, martial artists
developed a dietary practice focused around making
them sweat near intensely hot areas.

Japanese:
へぇ？　ってコトァ
さぞ熱くて辛ェんだろうな
伝説にピッタリ合ってるぜ！
English:
Ohh, then it must be hella spicy then!
That’s a perfect fit!

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese:
そう　スパイスを調合して作られた
とても辛い食べ物だったらしい
English:
Yes, it’s made with so much spice that it’s
apparently super spicy.

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese:
けれど　ある日　修行者のひとりが
その食べ物にバナナを入れたことから
すべてが　始まったんだ
English:
But, it was that one day when one practictioner placed
a banana in it when it all began.

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese:
スパイスの辛さと
バナナの甘さが絶妙にマッチして
「丸ごと一本バナナカレー」が生まれたんだ
English:
The extreme spiciness of the spices and the sweetness
of the banana clashed together into harmony and thus,
the Whole Banana Curry was born!

Japanese:
なんや美味そうな響きやん？
ウチ　食べてみたいわぁ～
English:
Whoa that sounds mighty tasty!
Ah wanna try it!

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese: ところがレシピは封印されたんだ
English: Well, as you said earlier, the recipe was sealed.

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese:
美味しさのあまり　スパイスの奪い合いが
起きたり　バナナを求め　下山する者たちが
跡を絶たなくなってしまったんだ
English:
It was so tasty that crowds fought over spices,
and hoards descended down the mountains
in search of bananas.

Japanese:
ほうほう！
よっぽどうまいんだな！　しかし
English:
Oho!
It must’ve been really tasty then!

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese:
場を治めた聖職者が
相応しくない者は食すにあたわず　と
山の中に封印してしまったんだ
English:
Priests sealed them deep into the mountain, saying that
those unfit to eat it don’t deserve to eat!

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese:
そのレシピが書かれているのが
最初に言っていた古文書のことだよ
English: And that recipe is written in an old document.

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese:
まぁ　昔の話だから
どこまでホントか　知らないけどね
English: So old that even I don’t know where it is.

Japanese:
ま　ここまで来たんだ
せっかくだから
そのレシピを手に入れてみようぜ
English:
Well, I guess we can try looking for it now that we’re
all here.

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese:
でも　もうないと思うよ
１０年前くらいかな
持ち去られてしまったんだ
English:
But I think it’s long gone, been 10 years already
since someone took it away from me.

Japanese:
何やて？
ドロボーでも入ったんか？
English:
What?
Did a thief steal it?

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese:
いや　盗賊じゃないよ
なんでも噂を聞きつけた
スパイス愛好家を名乗ってたね
English:
Nah, he called himself a Spice Lover.
He wanted to go inside the volcano to look for it,
after he heard a lot of rumors about it.

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese:
山中に単独で入り
自力で古文書を見つけ出してたよ
English: He went alone, and came out with it in his hand!

Japanese: ソレ　今　ドコにあるんだー？
English: So, where’s it now?

Japanese:
それ以前に　この怪物だらけの山に
単独で捜索したってのか？
よっぽどのツワモノじゃねェ？
English:
So you’re telling me that guy went into that
monster-infested mountain alone and looked for it?
He must’ve been some kind of warrior.

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese:
あっ　そういえば
レグヌムの兵士だって言ってた気もする
English:
Now that you mention it, I think he was a
Regnum soldier.

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese:
当時　今ほど国の関係は　悪くなかったから
立ち入りを　禁止したりしなかったけど
English:
That was way back before our relationship with
Regnum had gotten worse though, so there wasn’t any
ban for foreigners coming in.

Japanese: それだけじゃあなァ…
English: Is that all...?

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese:
怖い感じの人だったよ
怒鳴り散らしてたし
English:
And he was a really scary chump, that guy.
Always shouted stuff like:

Japanese: 門番
English: Gatekeeper

Japanese:
「ふざけるな！　大声出せ！」とか
「この臆病のヘッピリ腰野郎！！」とか
もっと下品な言葉も言ってたような…
English:
“SPEAK LOUDLY YOU PIPSQUEAK!” and stuff like
“YOU BACK-BENT WIMP!”
And crude words like that...

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
{fixed}（あれ？　なんだか聞き覚えが
　あるような　ないような…？）
English:
(Huh? I have a feeling that I’ve met that guy before...
or not?)

Japanese:
チッ…仕方ねェ
その野郎を探すっきゃねェみたいだな
English:
Tch... can’t be helped, guess we’ll have to go look
for him.

Japanese:
せやけど　「相応しくない者」て
どんなんやろ？
どないすれば相応しくなれんの？
English:
Yeah but Ah wonder what he meant about “unfit?”
Whatre’ ya s’pposed ta do ta become fit ta eat it?

Japanese:
大丈夫　ソレはコーダのことだぞ
コーダはコーダだから
絶対食べるのだー　しかし！
English:
Don’t worry! Coda’s sure he’s talking about Coda!
Since Coda’s Coda, Coda can definitely eat it!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
来た　ピンと来た
この地方に　幻のレシピがある
道草を食うように　みんな　早く探せ　しかし！
English:
It’s here! There’s a Fabled Recipe around here!
Coda can feel it! Don’t loaf around and start looking!

Japanese:
それを言うなら
草の根をわけてでも　ね
English:
If you say so...
Although, I do not believe we have any bread left.

Japanese:
それより　まわり雪ばっかだしよ
雑草なんて生えてんのか？
English: Anyways, are there even any bakeries around here?

Japanese: んあー　そんなことより　早く探すんだな！
English: Then hurry up and look!

Japanese: こんな寒い中　探せるわけないでしょ
English:
You’re really expecting us to look in this freezing
cold place!?

Japanese:
それなら　てっとり早く
この町に詳しそうな人に
話を聞いたほうが良さそうだね
English:
If that is the case, why not ask someone
well-versed with this area?

Japanese: と言うと　あの人だね
English: Oh! Let’s go ask him then!

Japanese: それじゃ　行くわよ！
English: Right! Time to get movin’!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: アルベール
English: Albert

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
やあ　こんにちは
僕の飛行船は役立っているかい？
English:
Good day～
Are you making good use of my airship?

Japanese:
お前　幻のレシピって知ってるか？
知ってるなら　出すんだな
English:
You know about the Fabled Recipe, don’t you!?
Hurry up and spit it!

Japanese: は？
English: I beg your pardon?

Japanese:
あの　ごめんなさい　アルベール
唐突なんだけど　私たち
今　幻のレシピを探しているの
English:
I am sorry for the sudden question, Albert, but we are
looking for the Fabled Recipes right now.

Japanese:
幻のレシピ　だって？
聞いたことがあるなぁ
English:
The Fabled Recipes...
I know of it.

Japanese: まあ　それは話が早い！
English: That should make things easier!

Japanese: とっとと喋れー　しかし！
English: Spill it, four-eyes!

Japanese:
昔　各国が戦乱に明け暮れた時代
聖女と呼ばれる女性がいたんだ
English:
Once upon a time, in an era where all nations could do
nothing but wage war with each other, there existed
a Saintess.

Japanese: へえ～　アンジュと一緒じゃん
English: Ohh, sounds just like Ange!

Japanese:
教団に貢献した女性を
ことさらに喧伝して
信者を集めているだけですよ
English:
Although it was just a ploy to attract more 
followers by emphasizing women who 
have contributed to the Order.

Japanese:
何を言うんだい？
君は立派な「聖女」だと思うけどね
English:
Why would you say that?
I, for one, think that you’re a splendid Saintess.

Japanese:
脱線してるぞ　しかし
さあ　続きを話せー
English:
You’re going off on a tangent though,
hurry up and continue!

Japanese: ああ　えーっと…
English: Ah, yes...

Japanese:
その女性の居た地は　極寒で
このテノスよりも　寒かったそうだ
English:
The land where she lived was extremely cold,
much colder than here in Tenos!

Japanese:
傷ついた兵士や　焼け出された難民を保護し
死を賭して守り抜いたらしいよ
English:
Apparently, she would risk the cold to protect and
house wounded soldiers and burned refugees.

Japanese:
へえ　立派な人だね
それで　レシピというのは？
English:
Ohh, she must’ve been a splendid person.
What about the recipe though?

Japanese:
その女性は　とあるお菓子を作るのが
上手だったらしく　彼女の偉業を
語り継ぐため　レシピを広く配布した
English:
She was great at making sweets, and with her influence,
she planned to distribute her recipes so that she would
be well known for her achievements.

Japanese:
だけど　戦乱のおりに甘いお菓子は
贅沢品だったからね
大して広まらず消えて行ったらしい
English:
But as you might already know, confectionaries are
considered a luxury during times of war, so she failed
to disseminate the recipe as she had planned.

Japanese:
それ　残念
じゃあ　レシピ　残てない？
English: Awww... then no more recipe?

Japanese:
いやぁ　どうかな
少なくとも　その女性は教団に
多大な貢献をしたようだからね
English:
I wonder?
At the very least, the Church should at least have
records of her work.

Japanese:
きっと古い文献には彼女のことが
詳しく載っているんじゃないかな？
English:
Considering that she was a Saintess, I’m sure the
Church should have a detailed account of her
work somewhere.

Japanese:
なるほど…
少し調べてみる必要があるみたいね
English:
I see...
It seems we shall have to look into it a bit more.

Japanese:
おお！
調べるぞー　しかし！
English: Let’s go!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: ここなら　レシピのことがわかるのか？
English: So is the recipe here?

Japanese:
どうかなぁ
まあ　ちょっと調べてみるけど
あまり期待しないでね
English:
I wonder... Let us look into it for a bit, 
but do not get your hopes up.

Japanese: うえへぇ～　また調べ物かぁ
English: No way... We’re doing this again?

Japanese: めんどくせっ
English: What a pain...

Japanese:
ほら　せっかくここまで来たんだから
なにかプラスになる物を見つけましょう
English:
Since we are already here, we might as well look for it.
If we fail, we might find something else.

Japanese:
リカルドさん
今度は居眠り厳禁ですよ？
English: And no taking a nap this time, Sir Ricardo!

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
うわぁ
リカルドのおっちゃん　言われとるで～
English: Wow! Uncle got told off hahaha!

Japanese: エル以外
English: Anyone but Hermie

Speakers:
0 [ルカ]
1 [スパーダ]
2 [コーダ]
3 [リカルド]
4 [コンウェイ]
5 [イリア]
6 [キュキュ]
8 [アンジュ]
Japanese: エルも！
English: You too!

Japanese: ちょお　堪忍してぇなぁ～！
English: Oh-- Gimme a break!

Japanese: あ　これ…かな？
English: Is this it...?

Japanese:
どれどれ…？
……これね
English:
Let me see...
Looks like it is!

Japanese: 見つけたのか　しかし？
English: Did you find it?

Japanese:
「歴代聖女列伝　改訂版」という
本に　ソレっぽい人が載っていたの
English:
It is written in this book titled:
“The Lives of the Saints, Revised Edition.”

Japanese:
でも彼女の名前は
口伝では伝わっていないようだし
文献も名前の部分に虫食いがあってね
English:
As for her name, it does not seem like it was passed
down verbally, but the part where it was written in this
book got eaten away.

Japanese: その人かどうか　断定は出来ないんだけど…
English: So I am not really sure it is her, but...

Japanese: んー　しかし　それでどう書かれている？
English: Hmm... Then what’s written in there?

Japanese: えっと…
English: Let us see...

Japanese:
バナナとチョコレート
そしてモチモッチン粉を　用意してください
English:
“Prepare banana, chocolate, and a batter made out
of flour.”

Japanese:
モチモッチン粉で作った衣に
チョコバナナを通し　油で揚げます
カラっと揚がったら　できあがり
English:
“Cover the banana in chocolate, freeze before covering
it with your batter. Fry until crispy.”

Japanese:
へぇ…　バナナを揚げるなんて
スッゴイ変わってるわねぇ
English:
Frying bananas, huh...?
What a weird recipe.

Japanese:
せやなぁ
あんまり　うまそうな感じせぇへんわ
English: Yeah, it sounds like it doesn’t really taste nice.

Japanese:
そうか？
キュキュは　うまそう思う
きと　サクサク　甘々　とろとろ！
English:
Really?
QQ thinks it sounds super tasty, sounds crispy, sweet,
and syrupy!

Japanese: サクサク
English: Crispy...

Japanese: 甘々…
English: Sweet...

Japanese: とろとろ……
English: Syrupy...

Japanese: みんな
English: Everyone

Japanese: ゴクリ{fixed}…
English: Gulp...

Japanese:
それにしても　このレシピは考えられているね
確か聖女は　極寒の地にいたんだろう？
English:
Come to think of it, is the Saintess not from a very
cold place?

Japanese:
その気候で　温かく甘いものを出されたら
兵士や難民の士気もあがる
English:
I would wager tasting something warm and sweet in a 
cold enviornment like that will raise the 
soldier’s morale.

Japanese:
出された側は
まさに　天にも昇る気持ちだったろうね
English: Tasting it must have felt like paradise.

Japanese:
ああ　油で揚げられているため
カロリーも十分にあるからな
English: Exactly, it must have a lot of calories after frying it.

Japanese: うぅ…　カロリー……
English: ...Calories...

Japanese:
たくさん食わなきゃ
いいだけのことじゃねェか？
English: Should be fine if you don’t eat a lot.

Japanese:
んあー
お前たち　もう話は済んだかー？
そろそろ　行くんだな
English:
Are you all done?
Let’s go back.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: アルベール
English: Albert

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: また来たぞー
English: We’re back!

Japanese: やあやあ　幻のレシピは見つかったかい？
English:
Welcome back～
Did you find the recipe?

Japanese: おおー　見つかったぞー　しかし
English: Yeah, we did!

Japanese: 一体　どんなレシピだったのかな？
English: What kind of recipe was it?

Japanese: おー　これだ
English: Here!

Japanese:
へぇ　モチモッチン粉に
バナナにチョコレート…
これなら　すぐに用意出来るね
English:
I see... you cover a banana with chocolate,
then dip in batter before frying it.
If it’s this, then we can prepare it immediately.

Japanese:
そうだ　良ければ
先ほどの材料　持っていくかい？
ちょうど　食材の補充が完了したところなんだ
English:
Oh, right!
Since we’ve just finished replenishing our supplies,
would you like to have some?

Japanese: まあ　ご助力大変感謝いたします
English: You have done a lot, thank you!

Japanese:
なあに　これくらい気にしないでくれ
ほら　持って行きたまえ
English:
No need to thank me for something like this!
Now, take it!

Japanese:
感謝するぞ！
お前いいヤツだな　しかし
English:
Thank you!
You’re a nice guy, you know that?

Japanese:
大したことないよ
聖女の手助けは　世界の救いに繋がる
English:
No problem, helping Saintesses will help save the
world, after all.

Japanese:
買い被り過ぎです
私に出来ることなんて
たかが知れていますもの…
English: You are overexaggerating, I have not done much.

Japanese:
いや　僕は信じている
じゃあ　飛行船共々　役立ててくれたまえよ
English:
No I’m not, because I believe you’re doing a lot.
Now, feel free and use my airship as much as
you please!

Japanese: おー
English: Okay!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ハルトマン
English: Hartman

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: おい　じじい　いるかー？
English: Hey, gramps! Are you there?

Japanese:
これはこれは
ネズミを筆頭に皆様
ご機嫌麗しゅうございます
English:
My, my! Look who we have here!
It is the party led by the mouse!
I take it you guys are in good health?

Japanese:
ここに幻のレシピがあるはずだぞー？　しかし
教えろ　じじい
English:
There’s definitely a Fabled Recipe here,
now spill it, gramps!

Japanese:
まあ　うまいもん食わせてくれる
ハルトマンのことやからな
なんか知っとんのとちゃうかと思て
English:
Well, we figured Granpa Hartman might know sumthin’
’bout it since he always serves us super tasty food!

Japanese: 幻のレシピ…でございますか？
English: A Fabled Recipe...?

Japanese:
なるほど
少し　思い当たるところがございますな
English:
I see, I believe I have an idea of what you are
talking about.

Japanese:
本当ですか？
それって一体……
English:
Really?
Then what is--

Japanese:
おや…？　お坊ちゃま
お顔色が　あまりよろしくありませぬな
もしや　お疲れなのでは？
English:
Oh dear! Your complexion does not look healthy,
Young Master! Are you tired perhaps?

Japanese: 言われてみれば…
English: Now that you mention it,

Japanese: 体がダリィな…
English: my body feels a bit heavy...

Japanese:
日ごろの疲れが出たのでしょう
今日は　こちらでお休みください
English:
It must have been the fatigue from travelling, please
take your time and rest here, Young Master.

Japanese:
いや　そんなに
ゆっくりしているヒマはないんだ
English: No thanks, we don’t have much time to spare.

Japanese:
左様で御座いますか
それならば　少々お待ちくださいませ
お坊ちゃまに　良いものをお持ちします
English:
Is that so, Young Master?
Then, please wait for a moment 
and I shall make you something.

Japanese:
確かに　顔色がよくないね…
スパーダ　ムリしちゃダメだよ？
English:
He’s right, you don’t look so good, Spada.
Don’t force yourself, okay?

Japanese:
なーに　言ってンだ
これくらい平気だっての
English:
What the heck are you saying?
I’m fine!

Japanese: お待たせ致しました
English: Thank you for your patience.

Japanese: お坊ちゃま　こちらを
English: Please drink this, Young Master.

Japanese: ンだ？　こりゃ…
English: What the...

Japanese:
わたくしめの家に伝わる
秘伝の野菜汁で御座います
English:
It is a secret recipe for a Vegetable Soup that 
is handed down from my family.

Japanese:
おー　これが幻のレシピの料理かー？
すごい色だなー
English:
Oh～! So this is the Fabled Recipe!
What a color!

Japanese:
左様でございます
これを飲めば　お坊ちゃまのお体も
元気を取り戻しますぞ
English:
Indeed it is! If you drink this, Young Master,
you shall surely regain your strength!

Japanese:
さぁ　お坊ちゃま
どうぞ召し上がりください
English: Drink up, Young Master.

Japanese:
い　いや…　なんだか　腹もいっぱいだし
今日はやめておくわ…
English:
Hah? Ah-- Uhh-- No-- I--
Uhh... I’m full, n-no thanks.

Japanese: さぁ　お坊ちゃま
English: Now, now, Young Master!

Japanese: どうぞ　お飲みくださいませ
English: Drink.

Japanese: ク…クソッ！！！
English: D-Dammit--

Japanese: うわぁぁぁぁぁぁぁああアアッ！！
English: UwaaaaaaaaaaaaaaAAAAAAAh!!

Japanese: お坊ちゃま　お体は如何でしょう？
English: Now, how do you feel...?

Japanese:
ああ　絶好調だ
それに　なんだか体が軽い
さっきまでの調子が　ウソみてェだ
English:
Huh... Better than ever!
My body feels light!
It’s just like my condition earlier was a lie!

Japanese:
しっかし　色々な意味で
この秘伝の野菜汁　すげェな
さすが　幻のレシピ
English:
That said, color aside, this Secret Vegetable Soup
is amazing! So this is what a Fabled Recipe’s like...

Japanese:
あの　ハルトマンさん
この野菜汁って　貴族の人たちの間で
人気なんですか？
English:
Uhmm, Sir Hartman?
Is it true that this Vegetable Soup is popular among
the nobility?

Japanese:
「かつての貴族たちが　乞い願うもの
　その７色に輝く水はひとつの源流から出ずる」
と聞いたので…
English:
We heard that it’s a “drink that many nobles would
beg to taste, where 7 colors pour forth and sparkle
from its headwaters.”

Japanese:
昔　ベルフォルマ家にお仕えしていた頃
先々代が　風邪を召されまして
そのときにお作りしたのが　始まりでしょう
English:
It must have originated two generations ago, back
when I was working for the Belforma Family, one of
the nobles fell ill. That was when I made it.

Japanese:
先々代は　高熱にも関わらず
半日も経たずに　回復されたため
それが貴族の間で　噂となったのであります
English:
The noble that drank this had a fever so high that it
took half a day for him to recover.
That was when the rumors started to spread.

Japanese:
スゴいな
さすがじじいだ
English:
Amazing～
As expected of Gramps!

Japanese:
さて　お坊ちゃま
こちらをお持ちください
English: Now, take this, Young Master.

Japanese:
この先　またお体の具合が
よろしくない時がきましたら　お飲みください
English:
Please make this and drink it whenever you feel
under the weather.

Japanese: おう　ありがとな
English: Will do, thanks.

Japanese:
いえいえ
お役に立てて光栄でございます
English:
No need to thank me, 
I am honored to be of help to you.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
ピーンと来た
ここに幻のレシピがあるんだな！
イリア　早く探せ
English:
Coda can feel it!
There’s definitely a Fabled recipe around here!
Hurry up and look for it, Illia!

Japanese:
はぁ？　あんた　なに言ってんの
あたしん家にあるわけないでしょ
そんなの見たことないし
English:
What the heck are you talking about, you rat?
There’s NO way it’s in my house, heck I haven’t
even seen it before!

Japanese: ねぇママ　幻のレシピって聞いたことある？
English:
Mama! Know something about a Fabled Recipe or
whatever that is?

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese:
幻のレシピ…？
なんのことだか　全然わからないわねぇ…
English:
A Fabled Recipe?
No, I don’t have the slightest idea what you’re
talking about.

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese:
そうそう　そんなことより
イリア　毎日ちゃんとご飯食べてる？
English: By the way, are you eating right?

Japanese:
なに　いきなり…
ご飯なら食べてるわよ
English:
Why the sudden question?
Of course I am, Mama.

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese:
そろそろ　ママの料理が恋しくなる頃かと思って
あなたの好きなチキンの丸焼きのレシピを
用意しておいたのよ～
English:
I figured that you might end up missing my cooking
so I decided to prepare you the recipe of your
favorite Chicken Roast～!

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese: 食べたくなったら　作るといいわ　はい
English: Make sure to eat it whenever you start missing home.

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese:
こんなことくらいしかできなくて　ごめんね
ただし　食べすぎには注意よ
English:
I’m sorry that this is the only thing I can do for you,
but make sure you don’t eat too much, okay?

Japanese: う…　ありがとう
English: Th-Thanks.

Japanese:
イリア　よくやった！
それが幻のレシピだ！
English:
Great job, Illia!
That there is a Fabled Recipe!

Japanese:
えええええっ！？　コレが！？
コレ　幻のレシピだったの？
English:
WHAT!? You mean “this?!”
So “this” is a Fabled Recipe?!

Japanese:
どうりで美味しいはず…
じゃなくて！　なんであたしん家にあるのよ？
English:
Well, it is tasty, yeah...
BUT WHY IS IT IN MY HOUSE!?

Japanese:
ねぇ　ママ
このレシピって　どしたの？
どこで作り方を知ったの？
English:
Mama?
What’s up with this recipe?
Where did you learn to make it?

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese:
さぁ～？
ママも　ママのママから教わっただけなのよ
English:
Who knows?
I learned it from my Mama, and my Mama learned it
from hers.

Japanese:
ん～　まっ　いっか
レシピは手に入ったんだし！
English:
Hmm... Ah, well whatever.
At least we got it～

Japanese:
だな
イリアのママ　ありがとなんだな
English:
Right.
Thank you, Mama.

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese:
どういたしまして
コーダも　食べすぎには注意するのよ
English:
You’re welcome!
You better watch how much you eat too, Coda!

Japanese:
心配は無用だ
コーダの胃袋は　強いからな
English:
Don’t you worry about Coda!
Coda’s stomach is strong!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: ルカ…？
English: Ruca?

Japanese: この香り……　チーズスープだ…
English: It... smells like Cheese Soup...

Japanese:
懐かしいなぁ
母さんのチーズスープ　食べたいな…
English: I wish I could eat Mom’s Cheese Soup right now...

Japanese: あんた　またホームシックなの？
English: Are you homesick again?

Japanese:
ち…　違うよ
すごくおいしそうな匂いがしたから…
English:
N-No! I’m not!
It’s just... It smells delicious.

Japanese:
…この匂い　幻のレシピなんだな！
イリア　早くレシピを聞いてくるんだな
English:
This smells like a Fabled recipe, though!
Hurry up and ask them how to make it, Illia!

Japanese: ちょっと　なんであたしなのよ！
English: Hold on, why-- huh... what’s this?

Japanese: って…なにこれ…　スッゴク　イイ匂い…
English: What a nice smell...

Japanese:
…あそこん家ね！
ちょっと行ってくる！
English:
It’s coming from over there!
I’m gonna go check it out!

Japanese:
あっ…イリア…！
行っちゃった……
English:
I-Illia--!
And there she goes...

Japanese:
勝手な行動は慎んでもらわないと
と　言いたいところだけど…
English:
I have a good mind to bring up a word or two about
acting selfishly, however...

Japanese: この匂いには勝てないわね
English: I suppose I’ll let it pass this time.

Japanese: ホンマやなぁ　腹減ってくるわ
English: Yeah, Ah’m feeling a bit hungry mahself.

Japanese:
レシピ聞いてきたわ！
さっそく　あたしの家で作るわよ！
English:
Got it!
Let’s go to my house, I’ll go cook it for you guys!

Japanese: え…？　いいの…？
English: Huh!? Are you okay with that?

Japanese:
いいのいいの
あたしも食べたくなっちゃったし
それに　早く作らないと忘れちゃいそうだしね
English:
It’s fine! I want to eat it too!
And, I gotta cook it before I end up forgetting about it.

Japanese: まっ　とにかく　あたしの家に行くわよー！
English: That said, let’s go!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ぬふ！　この地方に
幻のレシピがあるような気がするぞー？
探せ　しかし　お前ら探せー！
English:
Oho! I feel it! There’s might be an fabled recipe
around this area! Search for it, everyone!
Search for it!

Japanese:
それなら　この国に詳しい
アシハラの王様に聞いてみましょう
English:
Why not ask someone who knows more about 
Ashihara? Let us be off to look for the king.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
あれ…？
ジロチョウさんいないみたいだね
どこに居るんだろう？
English:
Hm...?
The Town Elder doesn’t seem to be here.
I wonder where he might be?

Japanese: さぁ？　その辺でも散歩してんじゃない？
English:
Who knows? Maybe he’s off on a walk somewhere 
around here?

Japanese:
もしくは　自宅に帰っている
という可能性もあるね
English:
There is also a chance that he might have returned 
to his home.

Japanese: 国外にいることも　否定はできんぞ
English: Or perhaps he’s somewhere outside the country...

Japanese: ひとまず　町の中を探してみようか
English: Then why don’t we first look for him around town.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: な…なに　この臭い…
English: W-What’s this smell...?

Japanese: くっさ…！　なにこれ！！
English: Ew! What the-- Eugh stinky!

Japanese:
おー　スゴい匂いがするんだな！
きっとこれが　幻のレシピだ！　しかし
English:
Oh! What an awful smell!
This has to be a fabled recipe!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: すみません　勝手にあがりこんでしまって
English: Sorry for barging in like this, Town Elder,

Japanese: あの…ところで　この臭いは…？
English: but what’s that smell...?

Japanese: ジロチョウ
English: Town Elder

Japanese:
去年仕込んだ　ふな寿司を出してきたんじゃが
異国の者には　ちとキツイ臭いだったかのぉ
English:
Oh, just taking out some Funazushi that I prepared
years ago. It might be a bit too stinky for you foreigners.

Japanese:
ふな寿司…ですか？
聞いたことがありません
アシハラ独自の料理なんですか？
English:
Funazushi?
I do not believe I have heard of that before,
is it a recipe only known in Ashihara?

Japanese: ジロチョウ
English: Town Elder

Japanese:
そうじゃ　簡単に説明すると
ふなを発酵させて作った
素材の味を最大限に生かした寿司じゃ
English:
It is! Simply put, you ferment some carp with salt,
sake, and rice. A sushi that brings out the best out
of its ingredients.

Japanese:
ねぇ　それって
腐ってるって言うんじゃないの？
English: Wait, then doesn’t that mean that it’s rotten?

Japanese: ジロチョウ
English: Town Elder

Japanese:
これ！　腐ってるとは何事じゃ
チーズやミソと同じ　れっきとした食べ物じゃぞ
English:
What on our good king’s name are you saying!?
It’s not rotten, you can eat it normally the same way
you eat with cheese or miso!

Japanese: ジロチョウ
English: Town Elder

Japanese:
臭いはキツイが　味は抜群に良い
今　用意するのでな　味わって行くと良い
English:
It might have a horrid smell, but its taste is exceptional!
I’ll prepare it now so you brats can taste it for yourselves!

Japanese: げっ…！
ジロチョウ
English: Town Elder

Japanese: ほれ　遠慮することはないぞ
English: Now, now, don’t hold back!

Japanese: これがふな寿司…変わた食べ物ね
English: So this is Funazushi...

Japanese:
でも　おいしくなさそう
キュキュは　遠慮する
English:
What a strange food!
QQ’ll pass

Japanese: わ…私も　またの機会にします…
English: M-Me too...

Japanese: ジロチョウ
English: Town Elder

Japanese:
ふむ…？　若いのに慎み深いのぉ
じゃが　気遣いは無用じゃ
まだまだ　たくさんあるからの！
English:
How modest for such youths!
No need to hold back!
There’s more where that came from!

Japanese:
仕方ねぇ…　ここは腹をくくるか…
なぁ　おっさん？
English:
Tch... guess I’ll just brace myself and eat it,
you in, old man?

Japanese:
さっすがスパーダとリカルド！
あたしの分も頑張って！
English:
Ohh! Great job, Spada, Ricardo!
I’ll cheer you on so good luck!

Japanese:
あぁ？　なに言ってンだ？
お前も食うんだよ
English:
What the heck are you saying!?
You’re eating too, Illia!

Japanese:
はぁ？　あたしも！？
あんた…なに言ってんの！
English:
W-Wait, m-me too!?
Wh-What are YOU saying!?

Japanese:
よく言うだろ？
嫌いな食い物　みんなで食べれば　まずくない
って
English:
You know what they say!
If you eat bad food together then it won’t taste that bad!

Japanese:
言わないっての！
まずいものは　まずいのよ！
English:
Well you know what I say!?
I say that shit food tastes like shit!

Japanese:
まだ口にしていないものを
まずいと決めるのは　早計だよ
もしかしたら　おいしいかもしれないしね
English:
Are you not being a little too hasty? You have yet to 
even taste it! Who knows? You might be passing up
the chance to enjoy something truly delicious.

Japanese:
だから　イリアさん
おいしいと思って食べてみて
キミのその一歩が　みんなの一歩になる
English:
Now, Illia, why not take a small bite?
That small step that you take, will become a giant leap
for us as a team.

Japanese:
あんた　ドサクサにまぎれて
なにあたしだけが食べるように
話を仕向けてんのよ！
English:
Now don’t you take advantage of the situation and talk
me into eating this thing alone, Kongwei!

Japanese:
しかも　なにその顔
ムッカツク～～～！！
English: Oooooh when I get the chance I’ll--

Japanese:
とにかく　あたしとリカルドとスパーダだけ
食べるなんて　不公平だっての！
English:
Ahem! Anyways, it’s UNFAIR if WE’RE the only ones
eating it!

Japanese:
コンウェイ！　ルカ！
アンジュ！　エル！　キュキュ！
みんな一緒に食べるわよ！
English: YOU GUYS ARE EATING WITH US TOO!

Japanese: これなら誰も文句ないわよね！
English: And I better not hear any complaints from any of you!

Japanese: …これは予想外の展開だね
English:
Oh dear, what an unexpected development we
have here.

Japanese:
コーダも忘れるな！
食べるぞ　早く寄越せ　しかし！
English:
Don’t forget about Coda! Coda wants to try it too!
Give me some, gramps!

Japanese: ジロチョウ
English: Town Elder

Japanese:
なんだかよくわからんが
たくさんあるので　たんと食べるが良いぞ
English:
I don’t get it, but help yourselves out, there’s lots
to spare!

Japanese: じゃ…じゃあ…　いただきます…
English: Th-thanks, bon appetit.

Japanese:
へぇ～　案外　イケるもんなのねぇ
くっさいけど
English:
Huh, this is pretty good...
Stinks though.

Japanese:
せやけど　ウチ
その匂い　クセになりそうやわぁ
English: Yeah, but Ah think Ah can get used ta this smell.

Japanese:
匂いだけじゃなく　味もね
こんなに　旨味が凝縮されているなんて
すごいわ
English:
It is not just the smell, but also the taste!
This is amazing! Who would have thought that
you could pack this much flavor into fish!

Japanese:
ああ
それ以外にも　程よい酸味が　たまらんな
是非　酒の肴にしたいものだ
English:
Even this sourness... it’s irresistible!
I’ll definitely try this out alongside some alcohol!

Japanese:
ふな寿司ね…
こんなに衝撃を受けたのは　久しぶりだよ
English:
Funazushi...
It has been a while since 
I have been this pleasantly surprised.

Japanese:
これ　どう作るか？
キュキュ　知りたい！
English:
How do you make this?
QQ wants to try making it too!

Japanese: ジロチョウ
English: Town Elder

Japanese:
そんなに　気に入ったか
そうか　そうか
これを持っていくが良い
English:
Oho～ So you guys liked it, didn’t you?
I see, take this.

Japanese: ジロチョウ
English: Town Elder

Japanese:
これでいつでも　ふな寿司が食べられる
たんと食すが良い
English:
You can go make your own and eat it any time
you want!

Japanese:
ぬふぬふ～
ありがとなんだな～
English: Ohoh～! Thank you!

Japanese: ジロチョウ
English: Town Elder

Japanese:
なに　礼はいらん
ほっほっほ
English:
Hoh hoh hoh!
No need to thank me!

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
あんたたちかい？
果樹園を荒らしていた悪ガキを
懲らしめてくれたのは
English:
Was it you?
Were you the ones who punished the brat that was
destroying the orchard?

Japanese:
せやでー　ウチらにかかったら
ちょちょいのちょいや！
English:
Yeah, we are!
It was purty easy too!

Japanese: 余裕なんだな　しかし
English: She’s exaggerating though.

Japanese: おばさん

Japanese:

果物が取れなくて　本当に困っていたのよ
English:
Thank you, I was worried that I might not be able to

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:

Japanese:

頑張ったかいあったわぁ！

Japanese: コーダも食べるんだな　しかし！

Japanese: あ～もうお腹一杯や～
English: Ah-- Ah can’t eat any more...

Japanese: 大満足なんだな　しかし
English: Coda can’t eat another bite though...

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese: あっはっは　いい食べっぷりだねぇ
English: Hahahah, you two eat quite well.

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
作り方も書いておいたから
よかったら持っていきな
English:
Here, take this too. I wrote down the recipe here so
you can eat it back home.

Japanese:

どういうこと！？

Japanese: そんなこと僕に言われても…

English:
You’re not hiding anything from me are you, Ruca?
Hurry up and spit it out before I strip you!

Japanese: そんな隠すなんて…

Japanese: ……って　ほんとに脱がそうとしないでよ！

...Hold on, you’re not seriously going to strip me, are 
you?

Japanese:

よいではないか　よいではないか

Maybe...

Japanese: わわっ！　や　やめてよイリア！

Japanese:
まぁ冗談はこれくらいにしてっと
いらないもの売って
宿代にするしかないわね
English:
Well, enough jokes. I guess we’ll just have to sell what
we don’t need so we can afford a room.

Japanese: うん　仕方ないよね…
