Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカデレラ
English: Cinderuca

Japanese: 王子
English: Prince

Japanese: 意地悪な姉１
English: Ill-tempered Sister 1

Japanese: 意地悪な姉２
English: Ill-tempered Sister 2

Japanese: 側近
English: Close Aide

Japanese: ナレーション
English: Narrator

Japanese: 継母
English: Stepmother

Japanese: それでは{fixed}　『{variable}ルカデレラ』のはじまり　はじまり
English: Now let us start the tale of Cinderuca.

Japanese:
昔々　あるところに　ルカデレラと呼ばれる
とても美しく　心の優しい女の子がいました
English:
A long time ago, there used to be a kind and pretty girl
named Cinderuca.

Japanese:
ルカデレラは　共に暮らしている
継母と義理の姉２人に　その美しさを妬まれ
毎日　辛くあたられていました
English:
She lived alongside a stepmother and two stepsisters
who were jealous of her beauty.
Day by day, she suffered from their torments.

Japanese: そんなある日のこと…
English: Then one day...

Japanese:
お城で　王子様の妃を選ぶ
舞踏会が　開かれることになり
国中の良家に　招待状が配られました
English:
A ball was being held at the palace in search for the
prince’s future consort, and the castle decided to send
invitations to all respectable families all over the country.

Japanese:
そんなこんなで　ルカデレラは
期待を胸に　お城へと向かいました
一方　その頃　お城では………
English:
And so Cinderuca excitedly made her way to the ball.
Meanwhile, at the castle...

Japanese: ほぇ～　豪華な食器やなぁ
English: What lavish tableware!

Japanese: こら　１つくらい売り払っても
English: Ah bet it costs a lot,

Japanese: バレないんとちゃう？
English: reckon Ah’d get caught if Ah took one home?

Japanese: おいしいワイン…　もう１杯いただける？
English: May I have another glass of wine?

Japanese:
あっ　あと　それを詰めてちょうだい
家で待っている妹への　お土産にしたいの
English:
A-And can you wrap this up?
I’d like to take it to my younger sister waiting back home.

Japanese:
あの子たちったら
王子を落とさないで　なにやってるのよ
English:
What are you doing!?
There’s no way you’re going to seduce the prince
with that!

Japanese:
このままじゃ
あたしの豪遊生活の夢が　台無しじゃない
本当　役に立たないね！
English:
At this rate these useless girls will just end up
spoiling my plan of marrying into riches!

Japanese: こうなったら　あたしが行くしかないわ！
English: Fine! I’ll do it myself!

Japanese: 王子…　王子はどこ…？
English: Now where is he!?

Japanese: ここがお城…　素敵！　まるで夢のようだわ…！
English: So this is the castle... It’s like a dream come true!

Japanese: 王子様はどこかしら…？
English: I wonder where the prince might be?

Japanese:
美しい……　今の女性は一体…？
おい　どこのご令嬢かわかるか？
English:
How pretty... Now who might she be...?
You, do you know which family that gentlewoman
comes from?

Japanese:
ご…れいじょう？　それなにか？
キュキュ　わからん…
English:
Jentel... woman? What is jentel woman?
QQ doesn’t understand...

Japanese:
お前に聞いたオレが　バカだった
行ってくる
English:
Stupid of me to think you’d know.
Fine, I’ll just go ask her myself.

Japanese: ヘンな帽子　バカだたか？
English: Is weird hat dumb?

Japanese: あぅ　違う…　おう…おうじ……
English: Ahh-- wrong... Pr-prince...

Japanese: ヘンなバカ王子　がんばる！
English: Good luck, stupid weird prince!

Japanese: 王子様　一体どこにいらっしゃるのかしら？
English:
Where is he...?
Oh dear, I’m running out of time...

Japanese: もう時間がないのに…どうしよう…
English: What do I do...?

Japanese: お嬢さん　私と踊っていただけませんか？
English: Miss? May I have this dance?

Japanese:
は　はい…　あの　でも
あなたはもしかして　王子様では…？
そんな方が　私となんて……
English:
Y-Yes... umm... but are you not the prince?
Why would a person such as yourself even--

Japanese:
今の私は　あなたに心奪われた者の
ひとりに過ぎません
English:
Right now, I’m nothing but a man enthralled by
your beauty.

Japanese:
今宵は身分など忘れて
どうか　私と踊ってはいただけませんか？
English:
Let us forget our social status and dance the
rest of the night away. Shall we?

Japanese: …はい！
English: G-Gladly!

Japanese: 王子　やっと見つけた…！
English: I finally found you--!

Japanese:
はぁ？　なに？　あの子
王子にベタベタして…！
English: Huh? Who’s that girl dancing with him?

Japanese:
王子と踊るのは　あたしよ！
ブチ壊してやる！
English:
Get the hell out, witch!
I’M the one who’s supposed to be dancing with him,
not you!

Japanese:
ヘンなバカ王子　邪魔させない
衛兵　つまみ出す！
English:
I will not let you interfere!
Guards! Get her!

Japanese:
こ　コラ！　触らないでよ！
ちょっと　どこ触って…エッチ！
English:
H-Hey! Where are you-- hey!
You pervert!

Japanese:
こうして　ルカデレラは
王子と楽しい時間をすごしました
English: Cinderuca had a pleasant time with the prince.

Japanese:
しかし　楽しい時間はあっという間に
過ぎていきました
English:
However, it was only after a while when she realized
that she had lost track of the time.

Japanese:
いけない…　もう時間だわ
王子様　ごめんなさい…
私　もう行かなきゃ…
English:
Oh no, it’s almost midnight.
I’m sorry, your Highness, but I have to go.

Japanese: 行くってどこへ…？
English: Go? Go where?

Japanese: それは……

私は君を手放したくはない
側にいてくれないか？
English:
I don’t want you to leave.
Please, won’t you stay a little longer?

Japanese: ごめんなさい……王子様
English: I’m sorry, your Highness, but I’ll have to go.

Japanese: 素敵な時間をありがとう　さよなら
English: Thank you for dancing with me.

Japanese: 待ってくれ…！
English: Wait!

Japanese: あっ…！！
English: Ahh...!

Japanese: 待ってくれ！　ルカデレラ！
English: Please, Cinderuca, wait!

Japanese: ……急がなきゃ…！
English: ...I have to hurry!

Japanese:
はぁ…はぁ…　クソッ…！！
なぜ　私は…オレは彼女の手を離したんだ！
English:
Hah... Hah... Damn it!
Why? Why did she leave me...?!

Japanese:
……ん…？　あれは靴…？
ルカデレラのなのか…？
English: A slipper? Was that hers?

Japanese: 王子
English: Prince

Japanese: 側近！
English: AIDE!

Japanese:
はい
あのコ　探すか？
English:
You called?
Looking for girl?

Japanese:
ああ　急いで探し出せ
オレはあの娘と結婚する！
English:
Yes, look for her! I’ve decided!
I’m going to marry that girl!

Japanese:
それからお城では　国中に使いを派遣し
ガラスの靴がぴったり合う娘を捜しました
しかし　いつまで経っても　娘は見つかりません
English:
And so the palace sent forth envoys in search for a girl
who would fit the glass slipper. Yet, no matter how long
they tried, they never found her.

Japanese:
そんなある日のこと　ルカデレラの家にも
王子様とお城の使いがやってきました
English:
Until one day, the messenger from the palace arrived
at Cinderuca’s family’s doorstep.

Japanese:
継母や姉たちは　王子と結婚するために
ガラスの靴に足を入れますが
どう頑張っても入りませんでした
English:
In hopes of the chance of marrying the prince, the
stepmother and her daughters tried wearing the shoe,
but no matter how hard they tried, it never fit.

Japanese:
なんで　あたしじゃダメなのよ！
ぴったり入ってるじゃない！
English:
What are you saying!?
Of course it fits, look!

Japanese:
でも　ブカブカ
ピッタリ違う　ムリ
English:
But shoes too big.
Fit impossible.

Japanese:
おい
この家には　もう他に娘はいないのか？
English: Hey, is there no other daughter around in this house?

Japanese: い　居ないわよ
English: N-No, of course not.

Japanese: ……それは本当か？
English: Is that true?

Japanese:
いいえ　王子様　この家にはもう一人います
ルカデレラ！
English:
It is not true, your highness.
There is another person in this house.
Cinderuca!

Japanese: はい　お姉さま　なんでしょう？
English: You called?

Japanese:
話は聞いていましたね？
その靴をはいてみて
English:
So you have been listening, come.
Why, not try wearing that slipper?

Japanese:
この子は…なにを言い出すんだい！
ルカデレラが　はけるわけないでしょ！
English:
What are you-- Are you out of your mind?
There’s no way it’s Cinderuca!

Japanese: 黙れ　そこの娘　試せ
English: Silence! Let her try the slippers!

Japanese: ルカデレラ
English: Cinderuca

Japanese: 入った…
English: It fits...

Japanese:
そんなこと　あるわけないわ！
ほら　見て！　ちょっとスキマが出来てる！
English:
No way it doesn’t! Look!
There’s a gap right there!

Japanese:
ルカデレラ　あのときと姿が違い
一目見ても　気づかなかった
すまない　許してくれ
English:
Cinderuca, I must apologize for not immediately
recognizing you.
Please, forgive me...

Japanese:
いいえ　王子様
私は気にしておりません
English:
Please, your Highness, don’t worry about it.
I do not mind it at the least.

Japanese:
そうか　ありがとう
その…　もしよかったら
私とともに　城に来てもらえないか？
English:
I see... thank you.
And... umm... if you don’t mind...
would you like to come back with me to the castle?

Japanese: ……はい！
English: ...Yes!

Japanese:
それからルカデレラは　王子様と結婚し
末永く幸せに暮らしました
English:
And from that day onwards, Cinderuca and the
Prince got married.

Japanese:
一方　継母は　王子様に虚偽報告の罪で
城の地下牢に　幽閉されてしまいました
English:
On the other hand, the stepmother was sent to the
castle’s dungeon for lying in front of the prince.

Japanese:
意地悪な姉１は　持ち前の守銭奴を生かし
商売をはじめ　繁盛したとかしてないとか
English:
The money-grubbing sister took advantage of
her newfound wealth to start a new business,
which may or may not have flourished.

Japanese:
そして　意地悪な姉２は　ルカデレラから
一緒に暮らしたいといわれ　城へと居を移し
３人で　幸せに暮らしましたとさ
English:
And the other sister came to live with Cinderuca in the
palace. Together, the three of them lived the rest of
their lives happily. The end.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ハルトマン
English: Hartman

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: 皆様　ちょうど良いところに
English: Welcome, everyone, you just came at the right time.

Japanese: どうかしたのか　ハルトマン？
English: What’s up?

Japanese:
先ほど　良い食材が　手に入りましてな
是非　お坊ちゃま方に　召し上がって
いただきたいと　思っていたところで御座います
English:
I just happened to acquire some good ingredients, and 
the thought occured to me that I would like the young
master to try it.

Japanese:
もし　お食事がお済みでないのならば
ご用意いたしますが　如何いたしましょう？
English:
If you do not have any arrangements for dinner yet, 
I could cook for you. How does that sound?

Japanese: コーダ＆エル
English: Coda & Hermie

Japanese: 是非！！
English: Certainly!!

Japanese: 元気があって　良いですなぁ
English: How wonderfull, you are both so energetic.

Japanese: 悪いな　ハルトマン　よろしく頼む
English:
Sorry for making you go through the trouble, Hartman.
I’ll leave it to you.

Japanese:
かしこまりました
このハルトマン
久々に腕を　ふるわせていただきます
English:
Of course. Well then, it has been a while but I, 
Hartman, will wield these arms once again.

Japanese: お待たせいたしました
English: Thank you for waiting.

Japanese:
あれ？　コレっぽっち？
今日はやけに質素じゃない？
English: What? Only this? Isn’t the food awfully scarce today?

Japanese: こちらは前菜でございます
English: This is only an appetizer, Miss.

Japanese: こんなん　二口で食うてまうわ…
English: Aww... Ah’ll only end up finishin’ this in two bites...

Japanese:
お待たせしました
旬野菜のスープとパンで御座います
English:
Sorry to have kept you waiting. Here is the soup made
from fresh vegetables and bread.

Japanese:
少ないぞ　しかし！
もっと　出せ　じじい！
English: Not much, it’s not much! Give Coda more food gramps.

Japanese:
後ほどサラダ
そして魚料理　肉料理等　数品をお出しします
English:
After this will be salad. I will also serve some other
dishes, made with fish and meat.

Japanese:
さらにデザートと
食後のお茶がございますので　お楽しみ下さい
English:
Furthermore, there will be dessert. I also prepared 
some tea for later, so please look forward to that.

Japanese: なんでいっぺんに　持って来てくれへんの？
English: Why can’t you just bring it all at once?

Japanese:
こうして料理と料理の合間に
時間を持たせることが　重要なので御座います
English: The time between each dish is necessary.

Japanese:
お喋りをしたり　調度品を鑑賞したりして
時間を過ごすものなのです
English:
With such, it will be possible to spend your time 
conversing with each other and appreciating the 
surroundings.

Japanese:
面倒くさいなぁ
まあ　料理はめっちゃうまいけど
English: The food might be delicious, but this is a pain.

Japanese:
味を堪能するのも結構だけど
折角だから　ボクたちも
それにならってみても　良いんじゃない？
English:
It is wonderful to appreciate the food on its own. But
since we are already here, why not do as he says?

Japanese:
おいしかったなぁ
こうして　ゆっくりと食べるのは　久々ね
English:
That was delicious! It has been a while since I was 
able to take my time eating.

Japanese:
ああ
だが悠長に　時間を掛けてメシを食うなど
俺の性に合わないが
English:
Indeed, but I must admit that I’m not used to this 
manner of eating.

Japanese:
あ　ひょっとして
このコースって　昔実家でオレが
ちょくちょく　食ってたヤツか？
English:
Oh, is this the same four-course-meal I used to eat
back at my place?

Japanese:
左様で御座います
ところが坊ちゃまは　せっかちなお方
English:
Indeed it is. However, Young Master, you are still 
as impatient as you were before.

Japanese:
オードブルを　何回もお代りして　お腹を満たし
すぐ　遊びに出かけられてしまったのです
English:
You used to help yourself to several servings of hors 
d’oeuvres until you were full. And then you would 
immediately run off to play.

Japanese:
そのうち　オレだけ別室で
食わされるようになったもんな
English:
Eventually they started making me eat in a 
seperate room.

Japanese:
メイン料理と　オードブルと　サラダと
スープを　一つのトレイに乗せた
定食みたいなヤツだったけど
English:
They would bring me the hors d’oeuvres, salad, soup 
and the main course, all on one tray. Sorta like a 
boxed lunch.

Japanese: あれは実はコースと　同じ料理だったのですよ
English:
It was all the same dishes than what the rest of 
household would eat.

Japanese:
そうか…
オレ　親父や兄貴たちに嫌われて
別室で食わされてるかと思ってた
English:
I see... I thought my dad and brothers made me eat in
a separate room because they hated me.

Japanese:
でもそれって　礼儀作法が
しっかりしてなかったからだったんだな
English:
Turns out, it was because I didn’t have the proper
etiquette.

Japanese: ってか　あんた　こんなの毎日食ってたわけ？
English: So you’re saying that you ate this kinda food every day?

Japanese:
それなのにどうして？
なぜ太ってないの？
English: But even then... why... WHY ARE YOU NOT FAT?!

Japanese: アンジュ姉ちゃん　話ズレとるで…
English: Ange, yer a bit off topic...

Japanese: ガ　ガキの頃の話だって！
English: Th-That was back when I was a kid!

Japanese:
それに戦争が激しくなってから
貴族社会では　質素こそが美徳だっていう
風潮に変わって行ったんだよっ！
English:
Besides, ever since the war became more intense,
the noble society has changed and started to see
beauty in simplicity!

Japanese:
クソ…　俺がガキの頃は
ドロ水をすすって生き延びたというのに
English:
Damn... To think that I survived drinking muddy water
when I was a kid.

Japanese:
ウチかて　あーんなことや　こーんなことせんと
ロクに食うて行かれへんかってんで？
English:
Ah had ta overcome this an’ that, an’ still couldn’t 
eat right!?

Japanese:
キュキュも　食べれないことあた
ヘンな帽子　うらやましい…
English:
QQ also couldn’t eat a lot of things. I envy you,
 weird hat...

Japanese: なんでオレ　責められてんだ？
English:
What? Why am I being criticized for something 
like this?

Japanese:
みんな食べ終わったようだし
そろそろ　行かない？
English:
Seems everyone is done eating. Well, I think we 
should go.

Japanese:
だな
ハルトマン　ありがとな
English: Right... Thanks Hartman.

Japanese: メシ　うまかったぜ
English: The food was really good.

Japanese:
じじい　メシ　うまかったぞ　しかし
またなー
English: Yeah the food was good gramps, see you later.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: サクヤ
English: Sakuya

Japanese: アスラ
English: Asura

Japanese: ああ　こんなにも美しく咲いてくれるなんて…
English: This has bloomed quite well too...

Japanese:
この花壇が　わずかでも
お忙しいアスラさまの癒しになれば……
English:
If only for a bit, may these flowers bring Lord 
Asura comfort...

Japanese:
しかし　アスラさまは
お喜びになってくださるのだろうか…
English: Still, I wonder if Lord Asura will be delighted...

Japanese: サクヤ　こんなところに居たのか
English: Sakuya, so you were here after all.

Japanese:
アスラさま！？
お戻りになられていたとは
出迎えできず　申し訳ございません
English:
Lord Asura! I apologize for not being able to greet your 
return.

Japanese:
気にするな
俺も　こんなに早く戻れるとは
思ってはいなかった
English:
Don’t worry about it. I too did not think that I’d return 
this early.

Japanese:
ありがとうございます
あの…　私に何か御用事が…？
English:
Thank you. Um... is there something I can help 
you with?

Japanese: アスラ
English: Asura

Japanese: …美しいな
English: How pretty...

Japanese: え…？　あ…　あの…アスラさま…？
English: Huh? L-Lord Asura?

Japanese:
ああ　すまない
最近　あまり顔色が優れぬと聞いてな
English:
Apologies. I heard that your complexion hasn’t been 
well lately.

Japanese:
お…　お気遣い　ありがとうございます
ですが　アスラさまの御心を
わずらわせてしまうとは……
English:
Thank you for noticing... 
But I do not wish to trouble you...

Japanese:
なに　おまえは天上界統一のため
よく働いてくれているからな
English:
Why should I not be troubled. After all, you’ve also 
been working hard for the unification of Cielo.

Japanese:
しかし　こうも顔色が　優れぬのでは
うまくいくことも　うまくいかぬ
少し　休むがいい
English: Still, if your complexion is bad, it’s better for you to rest.

Japanese: しかし　私一人が休んでいるわけには…！
English: Still, I can’t just rest without--

Japanese:
お前に倒れられては　困るからな
俺のことなら心配いらん　任せておけ
English:
It will be quite troublesome if you collapse, after all. 
No need to worry, leave it all to me.

Japanese:
アスラさま　なんとお優しい…
私は　この先もずっと　アスラさまのために…
English: Lord Asura is so kind... I shall work hard for your sake...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: サクヤ
English: Sakuya

Japanese: アスラ
English: Asura

Japanese: イナンナ
English: Inanna

Japanese: アスラさま…
English: Lord Asura...

Japanese: …美しいな
English: How pretty...

Japanese:
あぁ…　アスラさま…　アスラさまが美しいと…
あの女ではなく　私におっしゃってくださった…
English:
Lord Asura... To think that he would call me pretty... 
He called “me” pretty, not her.

Japanese:
…おかしい
花の数が　少なくなっている？
English: How strange. The number of flowers has decreased.

Japanese:
枯れた跡もない…
これは　一体どういうこと…？
English:
It seems that none withered...
What’s the meaning of this...?

Japanese: 花なら　摘ませてもらったわ
English: If it’s the flowers, I helped myself to a few.

Japanese:
私の花を　勝手に……
どういうつもり？
English: You cut my flowers? Why?

Japanese:
その花　アスラさまが　美しいと褒めていたわ
だから　摘ませてもらったの
さすが花の女神ね
English:
Lord Asura has been praising the beauty of 
your flowers. That’s why I took a few. As 
expected of a flower goddess.

Japanese: アスラさまが…
English: Lord Asura does?

Japanese: お部屋に飾ったら　とても喜んでいたわよ
English:
He was quite happy when he saw 
his room decorated with them.

Japanese:
どうであろうと　アスラさまが
喜んでくださるのなら　私は……
English: Well, as long as he’s pleased I...

Japanese: 私は……私はアスラさまのために………
English: I... As long as it’s for Lord Asura...

Japanese: サクヤ
English: Sakuya

Japanese: イナンナ……あの女………ッ！！
English: Inanna... that Witch...!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: サクヤ
English: Sakuya

Japanese: オリフィエル
English: Orifiel

Japanese: もし…　もし　サクヤ殿
English: ...Sakuya... Do your hear me? Lady Sakuya...

Japanese:
オリフィエルさま　どうなさいました？
アスラさまならば　ただいま　外出しております
English:
Oh, Lord Orifiel, what’s the matter? 
If you’re looking for Lord Asura, 
he’s just gone somewhere.

Japanese:
ああ　いえ　違います
今日は　あなたに用があって
参りました次第でして
English: Oh, no that’s not it. I’ve come to look for you, in fact.

Japanese: 私に…でございますか
English: Me?

Japanese: ええ　失礼を承知で申し上げます
English: Indeed. Pardon me if I bothered you.

Japanese:
あなたが大事に育てた花
お譲りいただけませんか？
English:
Is it alright if you give me 
some of your treasured flowers?

Japanese: それはまた　何故でございます？
English: What do you need them for?

Japanese:
私の愛弟子へ　贈りたいのです
少しでも　あの子の心が安らぐように
English:
I wish to give them to my beloved pupil. 
So that child’s heart may at least be at ease.

Japanese:
そういうことでしたら
断る理由がございません
どうぞ　お好きなだけ　お持ちください
English:
If that is so, then I have no reason to refuse.
Please, feel free to help yourself.

Japanese: 心より　感謝致します
English: From the bottom of my heart, I’m grateful.

Japanese: あの…　オリフィエルさま…？
English: Lord Orifiel?

Japanese:
サクヤ殿　恐れ入りますが
どの花がいいか　見繕っていただけますかな？
私には　どれも可憐に見えてしまいまして…
English:
Lady Sakuya, I’m sorry to impose, but... 
what sort of flower should I choose?
I think all of them look so lovely...

Japanese: ふふっ　構いません
English: Heehee, that doesn’t matter.

Japanese:
いくら知識を修めようと
花ひとつ　満足に選べぬとは
いやはや　お恥ずかしい限りです
English:
How embarrassing that I, who has 
dedicated my own life to studying, 
feel troubled about choosing one flower.

Japanese: こちらで　如何でしょうか？
English: Then, how about this?

Japanese:
ああ　これは素晴らしい…！
あの子も　喜ぶことでしょう
English:
Indeed, this is wonderful!
That child will surely be happy.

Japanese: ヒンメル
English: Himmel

Japanese:
キレイな花だね　オリフィエル
ありがとう
English: What a pretty flower. Thank you, Orifiel.

Japanese: …ヒンメル様……
English: Lord Himmel...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: サクヤ
English: Sakuya

Japanese: アスラ
English: Asura

Japanese: イナンナ
English: Inanna

Japanese: アスラさま……
English: Lord Asura...

Japanese: サクヤ
English: Sakuya

Japanese:
アスラさまにもう一度
私を見てもらいたい…
English: I want to meet him again...

Japanese:
けど…アスラさまのことを想うなら
この気持ちは奥底へしまった方が…
English:
But... if he remembers me, these feelings that 
I buried deep into the depths of my heart will...
But...

Japanese: センサス兵Ａ
English: Sensus Soldier A

Japanese:
クソ！　ラティオの残党共め
悪あがきしやがって…！
English:
Damn! Those Ratio bastards 
don’t know when to give up...!

Japanese: センサス兵Ｂ
English: Sensus Soldier B

Japanese: しゃべるな　早く手当てしないと…
English: Shush! We need to hurry and get you treated or else...

Japanese: センサス兵Ａ
English: Sensus Soldier A

Japanese:
俺はまだ　戦える！
何で　連れ戻したんだ！
English: I can still fight! Why are you taking me back!?

Japanese: 怪我をしているのですか？
English: Pardon me, but are you wounded?

Japanese: センサス兵Ｂ
English: Sensus Soldier B

Japanese: サクヤさま
English: Lady Sakuya.

Japanese:
手当てをします{fixed} 
{variable}動かないでください
English: Please don’t move. I’ll be treating your wounds.

Japanese: センサス兵Ａ
English: Sensus Soldier A

Japanese:
し　しかしサクヤさま…
これくらいの傷ならば　今すぐにでも……
English: Please, Lady Sakuya, this small wound is nothing...

Japanese: …傷を見せてください
English: Please show it to me.

Japanese: センサス兵Ａ
English: Sensus Soldier A

Japanese: は　はい…
English: Yes ma’am.

Japanese: これでいいでしょう
English: This should be fine now.

Japanese: センサス兵Ａ
English: Sensus Soldier A

Japanese: …ありがとうございます
English: Thank you, my lady.

Japanese: …納得できませんか？
English: Do you understand now?

Japanese: センサス兵Ａ
English: Sensus Soldier A

Japanese:
い　いえ…
そのようなことは…
English: N-No... About that...

Japanese:
些細な傷であろうと
それがのちに　どのような形で
影響するかわかりません
English:
It might be a small wound, but I don’t know 
how much it will affect you later on.

Japanese:
治せるときに治しておくべきです
センサスのためを思うのなら　尚更
English:
It should fix itself up if you give it time to heal. 
Especially if you let it heal for Sensus’ sake.

Japanese: センサス兵Ａ
English: Sensus Soldier A

Japanese:
は　はい…
申し訳ありませんでした…
English: Yes ma’am... My apologies...

Japanese: センサス兵Ｂ
English: Sensus Soldier B

Japanese: あ　アスラさまのお帰りだ！
English: L-Lord Asura! Welcome back!

Japanese: アスラさま！
English: Lord Asura!

Japanese:
おお　イナンナよ！
待っていてくれたのか？
English: Inanna, my dear! Have you been waiting for me?

Japanese:
アスラさま　無事のご帰還で
なによりでございます
English: Lord Asura! I am glad that you’ve returned safely.

Japanese:
今回は思いのほか手間取ってしまった
しかし　これでラティオの残党も
あらかた片付いただろう
English:
I was quite late this time, but the remnants of Ratio’s 
forces should be eliminated now.

Japanese:
お疲れさまです
詳しい話はいつもの場所で
お聞かせくださいませ
English:
Good work. Please divulge me the details of your 
campaign later. At our usual spot.

Japanese: ああ　いいだろう
English: Yes, let’s.

Japanese:
アスラさまの目には
もう　あの女しか映っていない…
English: Lord Asura only has eyes for that woman...

Japanese: もう　あの女しか……
English: Only her...

Japanese:
私…私はっ……
アスラさま……！
English: I-I... Lord Asura...!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
ん…？
あんた　どこかで見た顔だね…
English: Hmm... I wonder where I’ve seen you before...

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
……あぁ！
かなり前にチトセちゃんと一緒にいた子！
English: Oh, that’s right! I saw you walking with Chitose before!

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
あれからチトセちゃんは　どうだい？
最近　あの子　全然来なくなっちゃったんだけど
そんなに忙しいの…？
English:
How is she?
That girl hasn’t been visiting recently,
I’m a bit worried.

Japanese:
えっと…
ごめんなさい　わからないです…
English: Uhmm... I don’t know. I’m sorry...

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
そう…　もし　チトセちゃんに会ったら
これを作ってあげてくれる？
English:
I see...
Well, if you ever meet her again, can you make
her this?

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
あたし特製のサバみそパスタ
あの子　これが好きでね
よく食べに来ていたんだよ
English:
It’s my special Miso Mackarel Pasta recipe.
Chitose loved this, you see.
She always came by to eat it.

Japanese: おー　これは幻のレシピなんだな！
English: Oh! It’s a Fabled Recipe!

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
幻のレシピ？
あたしのレシピが？
English:
A Fabled Recipe? 
Do you perhaps mean my recipe?

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
そういえば　この料理って
なにかいわれがあったねぇ
えーっと…　なんだったかしら…
English:
Now that you mention it, this recipe has some history 
behind it, but I don’t really remember...

Japanese:
異国の饗宴
彼の王が食し　愛した庶民の味
だが　すでに失われて遠く久しい
English:
It’s a loong time ago, but there was a time when a king 
fell in love with a foreign country’s local food.

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
ああー　思い出した　思い出した
昔　この国で不作が続いたときに
パスタを持った旅人が来たんだよ
English:
Oh I remember! A long time ago, this country fell into 
a series of poor harvests. That was when travellers 
came here carrying pasta.

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
ライスも野菜もなくて　魚しか出せなくてねぇ
ちょうど　そのとき出したのが
サバみそだったんだよ
English:
With no rice nor vegetables, the people had to make do 
with fish. At that time, the only thing they could serve 
was Miso Mackarel.

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
それで　量が足りなかったのか
旅人はパスタの上に　サバみそをのせて食べてね
それが非常に美味しかったそうだよ
English:
Unsatisfied with the amount of food served to them, 
they started eating it with the pasta! And it was 
really tasty!

Japanese:
パスタもサバみそも　どっちもええ味しとるから
おいしいんは当然やな
English:
Ah bet it was, that’s cause Miso Mackarel an’ 
pasta both taste good on their own!

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
実は　この話には続きがあってね
その旅人は　とある国の王様だったそうなのよ
English:
And there’s more! That traveller turned out to be a 
king from another country!

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
どうやら　お忍びで来てたみたいで
城に帰ってからも　サバみそパスタを
食べていたそうなんだよ
English:
Apparently, he anonymously visited this country and 
when he returned back to his castle, he had asked his 
people to serve him Miso Mackarel Pasta.

Japanese:
そこから　噂が噂を呼び
やがて幻と化したんだろうね
English:
As time passed, those rumors slowly grew to 
become a Fable.

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
幻ってほど　幻でもないんだけどねぇ
この辺の家じゃ　当たり前に食べられてるし
English:
But, technically, it’s not really fabled.
It’s a common dish around this area.

Japanese:
ぬふぬふ～
早く　サバみそパスタを作るんだな
English: Ohoho～! Coda can’t wait to try Miso Mackarel Pasta～

Japanese: おばさん
English: Grandma

Japanese:
もう行くの？
それじゃあ　チトセちゃんに会ったら
よろしく伝えといておくれよ　じゃあね
English:
Are you leaving?
Then, I’ll be counting on you to make her some if you
get the chance.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: 今の…なぜ　ここに……
English: Thing earlier why here...?

Japanese:
たぶん　キミが強引に世界をつないだ影響が
こんなところにも出ているんだろうね
English:
They are likely here as a concequence of you
forcefully connecting both worlds.

Japanese: あう…　キュキュのせいか…
English: Understood. If left alone big trouble.

Japanese:
落ち込んでるヒマがあるなら
自分の不始末をどうするか　考えるのが先だよ
English:
If you have the time to feel depressed, I recommend 
you first contemplate on how to fix this.

Japanese:
わかてる
このままだと　大変なことなる
English: Understood. If left alone big trouble.

Japanese:
本当なら　キミひとりに
やらせるつもりだったけど…
English:
Honestly, I would prefer that you clean this mess
by yourself.

Japanese:
この世界に悪影響が及ぶのは
ボクの旅の支障になりえなくもない
…少なくとも見過ごすことは　できないよ
English:
But these things are a bad influence on this world.
They might hinder my travels... At the very least, I 
cannot just ignore it.

Japanese: じゃあ…
English: So...

Japanese:
ああ　協力する
見つけ次第倒すよ
English:
I will help you. 
We will take care of any we run across.

Japanese: ねぇ　ふたりとも　どうかしたの？
English: Hey guys, what’s going on with you two?

Japanese:
どうやら　キュキュのせいで　色々と
時空のゆがみの影響が　出てるみたいなんだ
さっきの魔物も　そのひとつ
English:
It is possible that the monster we just saw was 
brought here through a distortion in the space and time
continuum... caused by QQ.

Japanese:
ちゅうことは　今みたいな魔物が
他の場所にも　おるってことかぁ…
English:
So what yer sayin’ is that, monsters like these 
might exist in other places...

Japanese: なぁ　それって　かなりマズくねェ？
English: Hey, ain’t that kinda bad?

Japanese: みんな…　ごめん……
English: Everyone... Sorry...

Japanese:
キュキュさん　落ち込まないで
私たちで　出来ることがあるなら　協力するわ
そうよね　みんな？
English:
Do not worry, QQ. We shall help however we can. 
Right, everyone?

Japanese:
アンジュが　そう望むのなら
俺は協力する
English: If that is what you wish, Ange, I’ll cooperate.

Japanese:
今の話を聞いて
放っておくことなんて　出来ないよ
English:
I can’t just listen to your problem and not do anything
about it!

Japanese:
そうね
突然のことで　町の人たちは驚いていると思うし
English:
That’s right. The people in the city must be surprised
by the recent events.

Japanese:
本当に良いの？
これは　ボクとキュキュの問題であって
みんなには　関係ないことなのに…
English:
Are you really fine with this? This is our problem, you 
guys have nothing to do with this...

Japanese: 関係ないなんて　言うなよな
English: Don’t say that, man.

Japanese:
せやで
ウチらは　仲間やろ？
English: That’s a’ight! We’re friends, ain’t we?

Japanese: …ありがとう
English: ...Thank you.

Japanese: みんな　ありがと！
English: Thank you everyone!

Japanese: キュキュ…　とてもうれしい！
English: QQ... is very happy!

Japanese: んで　これからどうすりゃいいんだ？
English: So, what should we do from here on?

Japanese: 魔物が出そうなところ　心当たりはありますか？
English:
Does anybody have an idea where the monster could
show up next?

Japanese: 残念だけど…
English: Unfortunately, no...

Japanese: ってことはなに？
English: Then what?

Japanese:
しらみつぶしに　世界をまわらなきゃ
なんないってこと？
English:
Don’t tell me that we’re going to have to go all 
over the world to search for this, are you?

Japanese:
ああ　だから　まずは各地の町で
住人から　変わったことはないか
話を聞いて辿るしかないんだ
English:
Unfortunately, we have no other choice but to ask 
around about rumors of anything suspicious appearing, 
or if anything has changed recently.

Japanese:
そら　大変やなぁ
ウチ　ちょっと心折れそうや…
English:
That’s gonna be one tough cookie.
Ah’m losin’ my marbles here.

Japanese:
でも　現実問題　こればかりに構っていられない
ボクたちには　なによりも優先すべきことがある
どうか　それを忘れないで欲しい
English:
However, realistically speaking, we cannot solely focus
on this problem. We still have other, more important,
things to do. Please do not forget that.

Japanese: …マティウスだね
English: Like Mattheus...

Japanese:
ああ　だから　これから
どう動くかは　みんなに任せるよ
English:
Yes, that is correct. That is why I am leaving the 
decision of how we move forward from here on 
out to you guys.

Japanese:
でも　キュキュは始末つけたい
この件　キュキュの責任
English: But QQ wants to get rid of it. It’s QQ’s responsibility.

Japanese:
お前たちの意向はわかった
しかし　依頼は果たしたんだ
まずは　依頼主に報告するぞ
English:
I understand your concerns. But we did what we 
were hired to do, so let’s first get back to our client.

Japanese:
そうだね
ジロチョウさんに報告しないと
English:
You’re right. Let’s go report back to the 
Town Elder.

English: None

Japanese: スパーダ

Japanese: 老人

Japanese: ふぅ…ふぅ……あいたたた…
English: O-Ow...

Japanese:
お？
そこのじいさん　ちょっと待った
English: Huh? Hey, old man, wait a second.

Japanese: 老人
English: Old Person

Japanese:
な　なんじゃ？
若いの…ふぅ…ふぅ…
English: W-What is it, young man?

Japanese: なにを急いでるのかはしらねェが　落し物だぜ
English:
I have no idea if you’re in a hurry or something,
but here, you dropped this.

Japanese: {fixed}（ん？　こいつは…）
English: (Hm...? You are...)

Japanese: 老人

Japanese:
おぉ…これはこれは…
すまんな　若いの

気にすんなって
高価な物なんだから大事にするんだぜ？

Japanese:

Japanese: ああ　それほどの物ならすぐにわかるぜ

Japanese: ふむふむ…なるほど…

Japanese: 酒場のマスター

おぅ　久しぶりだな
今回は大分　顔出さなかったが
長期の仕事だったのか？
English:
Oh, Ricardo! Long time no see!

Japanese: 酒場のマスター
English: Tavernkeep

ん…？
おい　そこのガキどもは…？
まさかアンタの……
English:
Hm...?
Hey, don’t tell me those kids are--

誤解するな
俺はまだそんな歳ではない
今は訳あってそいつらと旅をしている
English:

English: Tavernkeep

へぇ…　そりゃ　大変だな

English:

I never took you for the type to watch over children,
yet here you are. You’ve changed.

Japanese: 酒場のマスター
English: Tavernkeep

Japanese:
ところで　アンタが前に言ってたアレ
やっと入荷したぜ
ちょっと　裏に来てくれるか？
English:
Anyways, I’m glad to tell you that the package you
requested has finally arrived.
Would you like to try it out?

Japanese: すまないが　少しはずさせてもらう
English: Apologies, but I’ll have to make you wait for a while.

Japanese: アレってなんだろうな？
English: Huh, wonder what that was about?

Japanese:
ここ酒場　お酒じゃないか？
リカルド　夜　ひとり　飲んでる
きと　いいお酒
English:
This is tavernkeep, then isn’t it alcohol?
Ricardo always drink alone at night. I’m sure it’s
good alcohol.

Japanese: それにしても酒くさいわねぇ…
English: By the way, this place reeks...

Japanese:
仕方ないわ　ここは酒場だもの
とりあえず　一旦　外に行きましょう
English:
Well, it is a tavernkeep.
Why not wait outside for a moment?

Japanese: 酔っ払いＡ
English: Drunkard A

Japanese:
なぁなぁ　そこの綺麗な姉ちゃんよぉ
こっち来て酌してくれねぇか？
English:
Hey you, hottie! How about you leave those friends
of yours and pour us some alcohol, huh?

Japanese:
綺麗な？
どこにいるのかしら？　不思議ね
さぁ　みんな　外に行きましょう
English:
“Hottie?” I wonder who you are reffering to.
Now, everyone, let us be off.

Japanese: 酔っ払いＢ
English: Drunkard B

Japanese: おい！　お前だ　お前！
English: I’m talking about YOU, woman!

Japanese:
お酌…でしたよね？
それなら　お断りします
私は神に仕える身ですから
English:
Me? Pouring you liquor?
If so, then I must refuse.
I have dedicated myself to serving Cielo.

Japanese: 酔っ払いＡ
English: Drunkard A

Japanese:
あぁ！？　神がなんだってんだ
俺たちはなぁ　ガラムのために
命がけで働いてんだぞ！
English:
Pft, Cielo? What Cielo?
Listen here, missy, we’re the ones risking
our lives for this damn town, not some dead gods!

Japanese: 酔っ払いＢ
English: Drunkard B

Japanese:
だからよ
ちったぁ　サービスしてくれても
いいんじゃねぇのか？
English:
That’s why you should just shut up and pour, woman.
A service for our valiant efforts!

Japanese:
おい　おっさん　その辺にしろよ
イヤがってんだろ
English:
Drop it, geezer. Didn’t she already told
you she didn’t want to?

Japanese: 酔っ払いＡ
English: Drunkard A

Japanese:
ガキには　用はねぇんだよ
さっさと　消えろ
English:
This is adult business, brat.
Now scram!

Japanese: ンだと！？
English: The hell you say!?

Japanese: 酔っ払いＢ
English: Drunkard B

Japanese: おら　こっち来いって！
English: Bring it!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: 酔っ払いＡ
English: Drunkard A

Japanese: なんだ　テメェは？
English: And who the hell are you?

Japanese: 命がけで傭兵をしているのは結構
English: Risking your lives as mercenaries is splendid, but...

Japanese:
だが　酒に溺れ
本来守るべき市民に　手を出すとは…
傭兵としての誇りはないのか？
English:
To drown yourselves in alcohol, and to lay a hand
on the citizens that you’re supposed to protect...!
Have you no pride?

Japanese: 酔っ払いＢ
English: Drunkard B

Japanese:
誇りだぁ？
ケッ…そんなもん　とうの昔に捨てちまったよ
English:
Pride!? HAH!
I threw that away a long time ago!

Japanese:
そうか…　なら　これ以上
傭兵の名を汚すことがないよう
今ここで　終止符をうつ
English:
I see... Then I’m afraid I’ll have to stop you 
so you don’t give mercenaries a bad rap.

Japanese: 酔っ払いＢ
English: Drunkard B

Japanese:
な　なんだよ　ちょっとした冗談じゃねぇか
ほら　さっさとエモノをしまってくれよ
English:
Wh-What the hell, man?
I-I was just kidding!
Now p-put that away!

Japanese:
リカルドさん　その辺にしてください
無益な殺生はダメです
English:
Sir Ricardo, please put that away.
You should not waste your bullets on such people.

Japanese:
……わかった
行け
English: ...Fine. Leave.

Japanese:
こんなところに　長居をさせるべきでは
なかったな　俺の不注意だ　すまない
English:
I must apologize for making you wait
and putting you all in such a situation.

Japanese:
でも　結果的には守ってくれました
ありがとうございます
ところで…その服は一体…
English:
But you protected me in the end.
And for that, I must thank you.
Incidentally, what are you wearing...?

Japanese:
ああ　これは……
前々から　耐久性に優れた服を探していてな…
まさか　こんな服だったとは…
English:
Oh, this? I’ve been searching for some durable
high-quality clothing, you see, so I put in a request.
But to think that--

Japanese: 酒場のマスター
English: Tavernkeep

Japanese:
おいおい　そりゃあないだろ
動きやすい上に　耐久性もある
アンタの要望通りの代物さ
English:
Hey, I just did as you asked.
Resistant and easy to move in, as you requested.

Japanese:
ああ　試着した感じでは　かなり良い
しかし　この格好では目立ってしまうな…
着替えてくる
English:
Yes, wearing it now, I can tell its quality is very good.
However, it stands out too much...
I’ll go and change back.

Japanese:
おっちゃん　あの格好えらい似合ってたなぁ
ウチ　びっくりしたわ
English:
Uncle looked purty good in those though,
that was surprisin’.

Japanese:
ホント
黒い服だからより一層　顔が怖く見える
English:
I know right, he looked even scarier with those
black clothes on.

Japanese:
リカルド　カコイイ
別人みたいだた
English:
Ricardo cool!
Like a different person!

Japanese: ああ　おっさん　キマってたぜ
English: He always is.

Japanese: さしずめ　黒の護衛ってところかな
English: I would say he is more like a Black Ops Guardian.

Japanese:
待たせたな
オヤジ　代金は向こうにおいてある
では　行くぞ
English:
Sorry for making you wait.
I placed my payment over there, boss.
I’ll be going now.

Japanese: 酒場のマスター
English: Tavernkeep

Japanese: あいよ
English: Gotcha.

Japanese: 酒場のマスター
English: Tavernkeep

Japanese:
変わっちまったと思っていたが
全然　変わってねぇじゃねぇか
アイツの牙は今でも健在…か
English:
I thought he’d gone soft, but it seems like I was wrong.
His fangs are as sharp as always.

Japanese: 酒場のマスター
English: Tavernkeep

Japanese:
ガキどもも　苦労しそうだな　こりゃ
ははははは
English:
Although, those kids look like a pain in the ass too.
Hahaha!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
あら？
こんなところに花がおいてある…
なにかしら？
English: Oh my, why would a flower be in a place like this?

Japanese: なにか書いてあるわ
English: Oh, there seems to be something written here.

Japanese:
……旅の行商　ここに眠る…？
１年前……
English:
...Here lies two unnamed peddlers...
A year ago...

Japanese:
うーん　これ以上は文字がかすれて
読めないわね
English: Hmm... I cannot make out the other words.

Japanese:
ねぇ　アンジュ
それってもしかして　お墓？
English: Hey, Ange, could this be a grave?

Japanese:
ええ　おそらくは
ここで亡くなられたのでしょう
English:
I believe so...
I believe they died in this vicinity.

Japanese:
街からそう遠くないところだってのに…
無念だろうな
English: Must’ve been a shame, the city’s just nearby.

Japanese:
この墓を作った人も　物好きだね
ここで亡くなった人がいるというのに
危険を顧みず　葬るなんて
English:
Whoever built this grave must have had weird taste,
no one would risk building a grave in a place like this.

Japanese:
コンウェイ　失礼
仲間死んだ　弔う当然じゃないか？
English: Rude Kongwei, isn’t it normal to mourn for dead allies?

Japanese:
そうね　こういうのは親切というのよ
物好きとは違うわ
English:
She is correct, in this case, it is an act of kindness,
not a matter of weird taste.

Japanese: …そういうことにしておこうか
English: ...As you say...

Japanese:
せや　この前　花　買うたやん？
その花　供えていかへん？
枯らしてまうのも　勿体ないし
English:
Oh yeah, didn’t we buy sum flowers earlier?
Why don’ we lay ’em on the grave?
Would be a waste to let ’em wilt.

Japanese:
それいいな
これも　なにかの縁だしよ
English:
Great idea.
What a nice coincidence.

Japanese: これでいいね
English: This should be good.

Japanese:
ええ
それじゃあ　そろそろ行きましょう
English: Yes, should we go then?

Japanese:
あれ？
ねぇ　コーダ知らない？
English:
Hm?
Hey, where’s Coda?

Japanese:
彼なら　あそこ
ほら　木のところに
English: Coda is over there by that tree.

Japanese: ングング…
English: Gnaw, gnaw...

Japanese: カタイんだな　マズイんだな　しかし
English: This thing’s hard though.

Japanese:
コーダ　なに食べてるん？
木の実でも見つけたん？
English:
What’cha eatin’ Coda?
Ah don’ see any fruit ’round here.

Japanese:
エル　これ　まずい
コーダいらないんだな
エルにやるぞ
English:
This is disgusting, Hermie.
You can have it.

Japanese: これ……どこにあったん！？
English: ...!! Wh-Where didja find this!?

Japanese:
そこの木のところに埋まってた
しかし　キラキラしてたから
すぐにわかったんだな
English:
It was buried under the tree, but it was sparkling
so Coda found it!

Japanese: なんや…ここやったんか…
English: ...So it’s always been here...

Japanese: エル…？
English: Hermie...?

Japanese: この墓　たぶん　ウチの両親のもんや
English: Ah... Ah think this is mah parents’ grave.

Japanese:
そういえば　前に王都へ向かう途中に
襲われたって言ってたね…
English:
Come to think of it, you did mention that your parents
were attacked on their way to Regnum.

Japanese: 何故そう思う？
English: What makes you think so?

Japanese: これや
English: This.

Japanese: これ　コーダがさっき　食べてたやつ？
English: The thing Coda was eating earlier?

Japanese:
せや　ちょっとヨダレついてて
バッチイけどな　ウチのおかんのもんや！
おかんがつけてたん　覚えてんねん
English:
Yeah, it’s a bit dirty an’ covered in drool, 
but Ah’m sure this was mah Ma’s. 
Ah remember her wearin’ it.

Japanese:
ほら　ここの傷
ウチが振り回して　つけてしもたんよ
English:
See this scar?
Ah got it from playin’ with this.

Japanese: よく覚えてるのね
English: Your memory is amazing, Hermie.

Japanese: おかんのこと　大好きやったからな
English: See, Ah really love mah Ma,

Japanese: あ　もちろん　おとんもやで
English: but of course mah Da too.

Japanese:
それなら　しっかりと挨拶しないとダメよ
さぁ　エル
English:
If that is the case, then we should properly pay
our respects.

Japanese:
アンジュ　たったあれだけの情報で
そうだと決め付けるのは　早計ではないか？
English:
This is too good to be true, Ange.
Aren’t you being a little hasty!?

Japanese:
かもしれません
でも　私もエルと同じで
そうだと思いたいんです
English: I might be, but I would like to believe Hermie here.

Japanese: 甘いな…
English: How naive...

Japanese: それでも構いません
English: Then naive I am.

Japanese: ん？　なんや？　ここにもなにか書いて…
English: Oh look! There’s sumthin’ written here.

Japanese: ラルモ…夫妻…？
English: Mister an’ Missus... Larmo...

Japanese: …やっぱり　ここに眠ってたんやね
English: Ah thought so...

Japanese:
おとん　おかん　ウチ　大きくなったで
あのとき　なんもできへんでごめんな
English:
Ma... Da... ah’m older now...
Ah-- Ah’m so sorry Ah wasn’t able to do anythin’
back then.

Japanese:
あれからずっと　生きていくの大変やってん
けどな　今　すごい幸せや
English:
Ever since that day, life’s always been throwin’ me
lemons. Ah’m very happy now though.

Japanese:
ルカ兄ちゃんたちと一緒に
あっちこっち旅して　いろんなもん見て…
毎日楽しくて　全然　飽きへん
English:
Ah met Ruca Bro an ever since, Ah travelled all over
the world an’ saw lotsa stuff.
Ah’ll never get tired of this.

Japanese:
そうだね　エルといると
いつも楽しい気持ちになるよ
English:
Yeah, every day has always been exciting ever since
Hermie came with us.

Japanese:
エルには手を焼いていますが
とても心の優しい子です
English:
You always need to keep an eye on Hermie,
but she is a very kind child.

Japanese:
たまにムカツクときもあるけどよ
いいダチだぜ
English: She’s a little annoying, but yeah, she’s pretty great.

Japanese:
メチャクチャ食い意地張ってて
ケンカもするけど　たまにコッソリ
おかず　わけてくれたりするのよね
English:
She’s mean and eats WAY TOO MUCH, 
but she secretly shares her food sometimes.

Japanese:
手のかかるガキだが
エルの持つ行動力は悪くない
English: A bit hard to deal with, but I commend her energy.

Japanese:
色々と目につくところもあるけど
まぁ　悪い子ではないよね
嫌いじゃないさ
English:
There are some things that I would like to mention,
but she is not a bad child.
I do not dislike her.

Japanese:
エルと一緒　楽しい！
キュキュは　エル好き！
もといっしょ　居たい
English:
Being with Hermie is fun!
QQ likes Hermie!
QQ wants to keep being with her!

Japanese: どや？
English: Whatd’ya think?

Japanese: ウチには　スッゴイいい仲間がおんねん
English: Ah found me sum great friends, didn’t Ah?

Japanese:
ウチ　おとんとおかんの分まで
しっかりと生きたる
せやから　安心して眠っとって
English:
Ah’ll do mah best an’ live mah life fer ya,
don’ worry ’bout me an’ rest in peace.

Japanese: ほな　また来るわ
English: See ya.

Japanese: みんな　ありがとーな！
English: Thank ya, everybody!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
おう　ナーダか？
悪いが今日はなにもやれねぇ
English:
Oh is that you, Nada?
I’m sorry, but I’m not gonna do anything today.

Japanese:
こっちも　そろそろ
食料を買いに行かねぇと　いけないんでな
English: I guess it’s about time to go buy some food too.

Japanese: あの　すみません　人違いです…
English: Uhm, sorry but you’ve got the wrong person.

Japanese: あぁ？
English: Huh?

Japanese:
……人がここに来るなんざ　久々だな
で　注文は？
English:
...Oh, humans. It’s been a while since some dropped
by around here. So what do you want made?

Japanese: ちゅ　注文…？
English: M-Made?

Japanese:
なんだ　お前さん
たまたま俺ン家にあがりこんだってのか？
English:
What? So you’re telling me you just happened to
come inside my home?

Japanese: す　すみません…　すぐ出ていきます…！
English: S-Sorry! We’ll leave!

Japanese: 悪ぃな　おっさん
English: Sorry, gramps.

Japanese: ん…？　お前さん…まさか……？
English: Hm...? You... are you...?

Japanese: 近い近い　離れろおっさん！
English: Too close, old man! Back off!

Japanese:
おっさんとは酷いヤツだな
俺がわからねぇってのか？
English:
Oh how mean, how could you call me old man?
Don’t you know who I am?

Japanese: 知るかって　誰だテメェは？
English: As if I’d know! Who the hell are you, anyway?

Japanese: なんだよ　わかんねぇのか？　俺だよ　俺！
English: So you don’t? Come on, it’s me!

Japanese: わかるか
English: Who?!

Japanese:
ほら　俺だって　俺！
よーーく　思い出してみろって
English:
ME, remember?
Dig deeper into those memories of yours!

Japanese:
だから　名前言えって！
言わなきゃ　わっかんねェだろ！
English: Dammit! I’ll never know if you don’t tell me...

Japanese: バルカン！
English: Vulcan!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
なんだ　わかってんじゃねぇか
手間かけさせやがって　このッ！
English:
So you DO know!
Stop wasting my time, you twerp!

Japanese:
バルカンって……え…えぇっ！？
あのバルカン！？
English:
Vulcan? By Vulcan you mean... VULCAN!?
That Vulcan!?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
ああ　そうだ　俺がバルカンだ
だが　昔の名前はよしてくれ
前世があると言っても　俺は俺だからな
English:
Yes it’s me, Vulcan!
But can you please stop using my old name?
I may have been him in my past life, but I’m still me.

Japanese: ンで　今の名前はなんていうんだ？
English: So, what’s your current name?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: バルカンだ
English: It’s Vulcan!

Japanese: 一緒じゃねェか！
English: I don’t see any differences!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
ガハハハハッ！
偶然ってのは　恐ろしいな
それよりも　デュランダル　今はなんて名だ？
English:
Gahahahahah!
Coincidences are frightening, aren’t they? So how
about you? What’s your current name, Durandal?

Japanese: スパーダだ
English: It’s Spada.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
スパーダか　いい名前だな
それで　他の連中は？
English:
Spada, huh? Fine name.
And the others?

Japanese: こっちがルカで………
English: This guy here’s Ruca...

Japanese: ………とまぁ　コーダは見ての通りミュース族だ
English:
...and as you can see, Coda here’s part of the
Muse Clan.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
アスラにイナンナにヴリトラまで…
まさか　そうそうたるメンツが
揃って旅してるなんてなぁ
English:
So Asura, Inanna and even Vritra...
To think that I’d see you guys travelling together...

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
特にお前さん　最初見たとき
妙な感じはしたが　アスラだったとはな
English:
You especially, I’ve had a weird feeling about you since
I saw you, but to think that you’d be Asura.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
他の連中も　随分　変わっちまったなぁ
まっ　俺が言えた話じゃねぇけどな
ガハハハハッ！
English:
Everyone else seems to have changed too,
not that I’m one to talk!
Gahahahaha!

Japanese:
なぁ　アンジュ姉ちゃん　バルカンって
あのバルカンと大分　性格違わへん？
English:
Hey, Sis Ange, this Vulcan seems ta be quite different
compared ta the other Vulcan.

Japanese:
バルカンゆうたらもっとこう
気難しい感じやったろ？
English:
Ain’t Vulcan supposed ta be more...
how’d Ah put it, stoic?

Japanese:
そういうこと言わないの
エルだって　ヴリトラさんと全然違うでしょう？
それと一緒よ
English:
Now do not say that, Hermie.
Are you not also different compared to Vritra?
It is just the same.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
お前さんたちも　こいつらと一緒だと言うことは
なかなか腕が立つんだろうな
English:
And you two fellas must be pretty strong too,
if you’re with them.

Japanese: それほどでも
English: Somewhat.

Japanese: キュキュは自分の身　守れる強い
English: QQ is strong enough to protect herself!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: ははっ　頼もしい限りだ
English: Hahah! How reliable!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: さて　こうして巡りあえたのも　なにかの縁だ
English: Now, fate must have brought us here!

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
お前ら　武器は欲しくないか？
必要だろ？
English: I bet you fellas are gonna need a weapon, aren’t you?

Japanese: 何故そう思う？
English: What makes you think so?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
こんだけのメンツだ
なにかおっぱじめようって腹だろ？
それなら　武器は必須　違うか？
English:
With all these folks here, I bet you’re going to do
something big. And, for that, you’re going to need
weapons, aren’t you?

Japanese: …ああ
English: Pretty much.

Japanese:
バルカンすごい
占い師なれる
English:
Vulcan amazing!
Just like fortune teller!

Japanese: ああいうのは　観察眼が優れているというのさ
English: It is called having an eye for detail.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
それで　武器なんだが…
作るのには材料が必要でな
悪いが　人数分の材料を取ってきてくれねぇか？
English:
I’ll need some ingredients if I’m to make you fellas
some weapons.
Would you mind if you go get them for me?

Japanese: 構わねェけど　なにが必要なんだ？
English: We don’t mind, what do you need?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
それは　ただひとつ
前世で俺が作った武器だ
English:
Only one thing, I need the weapons I made in my
past life.

Japanese:
ねぇ　それって今もあるの？
天上界が崩壊したってのに？
普通　壊れてるんじゃない？
English:
Wait, do those still exist?
Cielo got destroyed, right?
Wouldn’t they have been destroyed alongside it?

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
嬢ちゃんの言う通り　天上界の崩壊で
死んじまった子もいるだろうな
English:
As you said, missy, some of my children might’ve
gotten destroyed alongside Cielo’s fall.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
けどよ　生きているヤツもいるはずだ
この世界のどこかに　俺の子どもたちはいる
だから　そいつらを探してきてくれ
English:
But, I guarantee you, that there’s still some who survived.
They’re scattered somewhere, around this world.
I want you to look for them.

Japanese:
だが　どうやって
あんたの作った武器だと判断する？
English:
So, how are we supposed to know which is a weapon
you’ve made?

Japanese:
せやせや　世界中の武器集めて
おっちゃんに見せるんは　大変やで？
English:
Yeah! It’s gonna be really hard if we bunched up
all the weapons in the world an’ showed it to ya.

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese:
そこは大丈夫だ
きっと　あいつらが呼びかけてくれる
お前さんたちの魂に反応してな
English:
You don’t have to worry about that, they’ll call out
to you. You’ll feel it in your soul.

Japanese: わかった　見つけたら持ってくるぜ
English: Right. We’ll bring them to you when we find them.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: シアン
English: Sian

Japanese: イリアのパパ
English: Illia’s Papa

Japanese:
いつも　ウチの子たちの面倒を見てくれて
すまないね
English: Sorry for always making you look after our kids, Sian.

Japanese:
別に…　ボクが好きでやってるだけだし
気にしなくていいよ
English:
It’s fine, I’m doing this because I want to.
Don’t worry about me.

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese:
それでは悪いわ　ねぇ　シアンくん
シアンくんの好きな食べ物はなぁに？
English:
We can’t have that!
Now, what would you like to eat, Sian?

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese:
今日はね　シアンくんの歓迎会も兼ねて
夕飯はシアンくんの好きなものにしようかと
思ってるの
English:
We didn’t get to celebrate your welcome party recently,
so I wanted to make you your favorite food for dinner.

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese:
といっても　そんなに豪華なものは
作れないんですけどね
English:
Although, I can’t really make anything extravagant,
I’m sorry.

Japanese: ボクの…歓迎会…？
English: My welcome party...?

Japanese: イリアのパパ
English: Illia’s Papa

Japanese:
ああ　君がウチに来てからも
村の中はバタバタしていて
ロクに歓迎もできなかったからね
English:
Yes, your welcome party.
The village’s been so busy since you came that we
didn’t get to properly celebrate it.

Japanese:
そんな…ボクはただ
休ませてもらってるだけなのに…
English: No-- I-- I’m fine just getting some rest.

Japanese: イリアのパパ
English: Illia’s Papa

Japanese:
子どもが遠慮するものではないよ
それに君は　王都兵を追い払ってくれたり
子どもたちの面倒も見てくれている
English:
It’s fine! Kids your age shouldn’t hold back! Besides,
you’ve been chasing away Imperial soldiers that come
close to the village and watching over our kids!

Japanese: イリアのパパ
English: Illia’s Papa

Japanese:
本来なら　なにかしら
お礼をするべきところなのだろうけど
なにぶん　この村の状況では…
English:
We’re the ones supposed to be thanking you,
but, as you can see, the village is...

Japanese: イリアのパパ
English: Illia’s Papa

Japanese:
だから　せめて君の…
シアンくんの歓迎をさせてくれないか？
English:
That’s why, at the very least, you should let us
welcome you to our home.

Japanese: はい…！
English: A-Alright.

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese:
そうと決まったら　準備を始めなくちゃ！
あたしも張り切ってご飯作るわね
English: Now that’s decided, I’ll start preparing preparing dinner!

Japanese: イリアのパパ
English: Illia’s Papa

Japanese: ああ　頼むぞ
English: Counting on you, sweetie.

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
パパ　ママ！　話は聞かせてもらったわ！
あたしたちもその歓迎会　参加する！
いいわよね？
English:
Papa! Mama! We heard everything!
We’re joining the party too, got that!?

Japanese: イリアのパパ
English: Illia’s Papa

Japanese:
ああ　イリア　おかえり
それと　お友達もいらっしゃい
English:
Oh, Illia! Welcome home!
All of you may come in!

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese:
もちろん　構わないわ
歓迎会は大人数の方がいいもの！
English:
Feel free!
The more we have for the party, the better!

Japanese:
では　お手伝いさせてください

English:
Then let me help, I would feel bad if I just sat here
and waited.

Japanese: 僕も手伝わせてください
English: Let me help, too!

Japanese: イリアのパパ
English: Illia’s Papa

Japanese:
ははは　それなら　みんなでやろうか
きっと　楽しくなるよ
English:
Hahaha, then all of you should help!
I guarantee you, it’ll be fun!

English: None

English: Ruca

Japanese: あら　気づいちゃった
English: Oh you noticed?

Japanese: それで　信者獲得の極意は？

More importantly, what’s the secret of 
acquiring Believers?

Japanese: 日々のお祈りかな
English: Daily prayer, maybe ♪

アンジュが言うと
本当にそうなんじゃないかって思っちゃうよ…
English:
If you say that, I might really end up thinking that it’s

Japanese:
ふふっ
この話は　また今度ね
English: Heheh... We shall talk about some other time ♪

元気そうなんだな　しかし
English: Ada and Soda. You seem to be energetic though.

Japanese: コーダも相変わらず　元気だけが取り柄なんだな
English:
Coda too, as usual. 
Being energetic is your only good feature ’doe.

Japanese:
そーだな！
コーダはいつも元気なんだな！
English:
That’s Soda right!
Coda is always energetic d’oh!

Japanese:
ねぇ　イリア…　これなに？
コーダが３人に見えるんだけど……
English:
Hey, Illia... What’s happening?

たまにサニア村に来るんだけど　パっと見
誰が誰だか　まったくわかんないのよねぇ
English:
These are Coda’s relatives. 
They visit Sania’s village from time to time.
They all look the same, right?

Japanese:
そーだな！　でも細かいことは気にしない
みんなまとめて家族で解決なんだな！
English:
That’s Soda right! But don’t mind the minor details,
in the end, all of us together are a family d’oh!

Japanese: う…うん　そうだね…
English: Y-Yes... That’so daright...

Japanese:
ん…？
その手に持っているモノ　どこかで…
ソレ　ちょっと見せるんだな！
English:
Hm...? That thing you’re holding in your hand,
I’ve seen it somewhere... 
That, let me have a look at it ’doe!

Japanese: 見せろって　もしかして……
English: Look at what? Do you mean this?

Japanese: ソーサラーリングのことか　しかし？
English: You mean the Sorcerer’s Ring though?

Japanese:
それと似たようなものを持ってるんだな
正味の話が
ソーダ　早く出すんだな
English:
I have something that resembles this.
True story. Soda, quickly, tell them ’doe.

Japanese:
そーだ！　これだ　これ！
アーダと旅したときに
雪国のヘンな場所で拾ったんだな！
English:
That’s Soda right! Look at this, this!
Ada picked it up in a weird place in 
the Snow Country during my travel d’oh.

Japanese: なに今の…？
English: What was that!?

Japanese:
ソーダの持つリングと
おまえの持つリングが　合体したんだな！
English: Soda’s and your ring combined d’oh!

Japanese: えぇぇっ　合体っ！？
English: Th-they combined!?

Japanese:
なにを驚いているんだ
おまえ　さっきその目で見てたんだな
English:
Why so surprised? 
You saw it with your own eyes earlier ’doe.

Japanese: しかし　なにが変わったんだ？
English: What changed though?

Japanese: ２倍なんだな　正味の話が
English: It ’doebled. True story.

Japanese: そーだそーだ　２倍だそーだ！
English: That’s Soda right, Soda right! It Soda d’ohbled!

Japanese:
おー　２倍か
それはすごいな　しかし！
English:
Oh it doubled!
That’s amazing though!

Japanese: ねぇ　２倍ってなにが？
English: What doubled?

Japanese: もちろん威力なんだな！
English: Its power of course d’oh!

Japanese:
はぁ？　威力が？
なんでそんなことがわかるのよ？
English: Its power...? How do you even know that?

Japanese:
そんなの簡単だな
２個が１個になったから
２倍になるのは　当然なんだな！
English:
It’s easy to understand d’oh.
Two rings became one, so 
naturally its power doubled.

Japanese:
コーダたちの再会により
ソーサラーリングが強化されました！
English:
Thanks to Coda’s reunion with his family, the
Sorcerer’s Ring has grown stronger!

Japanese:
威力が増し　今まで壊せなかったものが
壊せるようになっています
English:
With its newfound strength, your ring should now be
able to destroy things it couldn’t before!

Japanese: これを機に各地を巡ってみてはいかがでしょう？
English:
You should take this opportunity to revisit different
places you’ve already been in.

but didn’t do

Japanese: ？？　どうして？
English: Huh? Why would it break?

Japanese:
それは　ウチの口からはいえへんな～
自分のお腹に　手を当てて
聞いてみたらええんちゃう？
English:
Ah ain’t tellin’ ya that. 
Why don’tcha ask yer own stomach? Maybe it know.

Japanese: お腹に？？
English: My... stomach?

Japanese:
エ～～ル～～？
あなたは　まだ「人の道」を理解していないようね？
English:
Hermiee～～
It seems you still have yet to learn your lesson.

Japanese: あははは！　冗談や冗談！！
English: Hahahahaha! Ah’m kiddin’!

Japanese:
待ちなさい　エル！
今度こそ理解させてあげるから
そこに座りなさい！！
English:
Hold it right there, young lady!
This time I shall make sure you properly learn your 
lesson once and for all! Now sit!

Japanese: おい　だから慎重に歩けと……
English: Ange be care--
Ahh!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
なんだろう
この浮いているブロック…
English: I wonder why this block is floating...

Japanese:
恐らく　天術かこの塔自体の力で
浮遊している　ものだろうね
English:
I believe the Cielan artes flowing through the Tower 
of Dawn is what makes it float.

Japanese:
そうなんだ
でも　なんのためにあるんだろう？
English: I see. But what for?

Japanese:
侵入者を防ぐための　妨害装置だろうね
教団側にとって　ここは最後の砦だから
English:
Most likely a device meant to drive away intruders. 
Since this is the Church’s last line of defense.

Japanese:
さて　問題はどうやって
これを解いていくか…
English:
For now, we should think about how we 
are going to solve this...

Japanese:
こういう類の仕掛けは
なにか特殊な力を加えると
変化を起こすものだと思うんだ
English:
Regarding these types of mechanisms, something 
should change if you apply some sort of special 
power to it.

Japanese: 特殊な力って？
English: A special power?

Japanese:
そうだね　例えばソーサラーリングを
当ててみると　なにか変化があるかもしれない
English:
Indeed. Some change could happen if you hit it with the 
sorcerer’s ring.

Japanese:
それと床を見て？
光が灯っていないブロックと
灯っているブロックがあって……
English:
And look here on the floor, there are blocks that are lit 
and there are blocks that are not...

Japanese:
それらを繋ぐかのように
ブロックの模様がラインになっている
English:
And there are blocks that contain lines that seem to 
connect with each other.

Japanese:
つまり　ソーサラーリングで模様を合わせて
さっきみたいに　下へ移動させれば
仕掛けが　解けるかもしれない？
English:
To sum it up, if I match the pattern and make the 
mechanism move down, I would be able to disable 
this device?

Japanese: おそらく　そういう仕掛けだろうね
English: Most likely, yes.

Japanese: じゃあ　さっそくやってみよう！
English: Then let’s try it out!

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
あれ？
ブロックの模様が変わった？
English: Look! The pattern just changed!

Japanese:
どうやら　特殊な力を加えると
変化を起こすものらしいね
English:
It seems that it changes when we apply a particular
power onto it.

Japanese:
そうなんだ
でも　なんのためにあるんだろう？
English: I see. But what for?

Japanese:
侵入者を防ぐための　妨害装置だろうね
教団側にとって　ここは最後の砦だから
English:
Most likely a device meant to drive away intruders. 
Since this is the Church’s last line of defense.

Japanese:
さて　問題はどうやって
これを解いていくか…
English:
For now, we should think about how we are going to 
solve this...

Japanese: ルカ君　地面を見てもらえないかい？
English: Ruca, look here! On the ground!

Japanese:
光が灯っていないブロックと
灯っているブロックがあって……
English: There is a lit block and an unlit one...

Japanese:
それらを繋ぐかのように
ブロックの模様がラインになっている
English:
And there are blocks that contain lines that seem to 
connect with each other.

Japanese:
ソーサラーリングで模様を合わせて
このラインを合わせることができれば
仕掛けが　解けるかもしれないね
English:
If we manage to change these blocks by using the
Sorcerer Ring, we can connect them with
each other. That might unlock this mechanism.

Japanese:
あと　調べてみても
なにか　わかるかもしれない
試してみるといいよ
English:
We might learn something if we examine this closely.
Let us try it out.

Japanese: じゃあ　さっそくやってみよう！
English: Alright.

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
ハァ…　裏の林かぁ
あんまり行っちゃ行けないって聞くし
いきたくないな…
English:
Sigh... I’ve heard that you shouldn’t 
go near the back of the forest...
I don’t really want to go there...

Japanese:
ううん　ダメだダメだ　これは
僕に気合いを入れるための儀式だって
言ってたから　断れないよね
English:
No, let’s stop thinking this way! 
They said that this is supposed to 
be a rite to get me fired up so I have to go!

Japanese:
もし　危なくなっても　いざとなったら
エディとニーノがきっと
助けてくれるはずだし…急ごう
English:
But just in case it gets dangerous, I’m sure
Eddie and Nino will come to save me.
Let’s go!

Japanese: さっきの人
English: That Person Earlier

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
そういえば　さっきの人
ボクって言ってたし　男の人…だよね
English:
That person earlier...
was a man right...?

Japanese:
ハァ～…
あんなにキレイだと間違われそうだな
じゃなくて　あの本　大丈夫かな…
English:
Sigh... Being beautiful really
makes it easy for people to--
Wait... was that book okay?

Japanese:
あの人　魂の救済者って言ってたっけ
あの本には　そういう話が書いてあるのかなぁ？
一体　どんな内容なんだろう
English:
That person... said he was a “Saviour of Souls”,
right? I wonder if there’s such a story in that book? 
What’s written in it anyway?

Japanese:
っと…　いけない
こんなことしてる場合じゃなかった
フルフィの森に行こうっと
English:
Wait-- no! Now’s not the time
to be wondering about these things.
I should hurry to the forest.

Japanese: いざとなったら
English: In Case of Emergencies

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
この剣…　途中で折れたりしないよね
うぅ…　心配だな
English:
This sword... isn’t gonna 
break, right...?

Japanese:
でも　いざとなったら逃げればいいよね
一番奥の木まで　行けばいいんだし！
English:
I’m worried, but in case it does
happen, I should just run away.

Japanese:
うーん
でも　これじゃ　儀式にならないよね
ハァ…　出来る限り　頑張ろう…
English:
All I have to do is go to the innermost tree! Right!
I can’t go back... I’ll... I’ll give it my best shot!

Japanese: 足りるかな？
English: Is this Enough?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
そういえば　ホットドッグを
買いに行くのはいいけど
持ち合わせ　あったかな…
English:
I know they told me to buy those 
hotdogs, but do I even have
enough money...?

Japanese:
うん　これなら大丈夫そうだ
ついでだし　僕の分も買って行こう！
English:
Oh, this is more than enough!
Maybe I should buy myself some too?

Japanese: けど　そんなことしたら……
English: But if I do that...

Japanese:
「おっ　ルカ
　３つも買ってきたのか？　気が利くねぇ～」
English: They’d probably go...

Japanese: なんて言われるのがオチだよね…
English:
“Did you buy three, Ruca? 
You sure are smart!”

Japanese: それは僕のだ！　と言う
English: Say “That’s mine!”

Japanese: 持ち合わせがないことにする
English: Pretend you don’t have money

Japanese: よし　なにか言われたら
English: Okay, if they say something like that, I’ll tell them

Japanese: 「それは僕の分だ！」
English: “It’s mine!”

Japanese:
って言おう
これなら　僕も一緒に食べられるよね！
English:
and then maybe they’ll let me eat 
with them!

Japanese:
僕のおごりだし
それくらい強気に出たっていいはず！
English:
It is my treat, after all, I should at 
least be confident enough to do that!

Japanese:
…なーんてね！　そんなことしたら
なに言われるかわかんないからなぁ…
English:
What am I saying... Who knows what 
they’ll do to me if I told them that?

Japanese:
ハァ…
我慢しよう
English:
I’ll just try my best 
and endure it...

Japanese:
今日は　持ち合わせがなかった
ってことにして　戻ろうかな
English:
I wonder if they’d let me go back if 
I pretended not to have money?

Japanese:
でも　それだと　エディとニーノ
うるさそうだしなァ…
English:
But, then again, Eddie and 
Nino are pretty finicky...

Japanese:
ハァ…
おとなしく買いに行くか…
English:
I guess I should just shut up 
and buy those hotdogs...

Japanese: マスタードサービス１
English: Mustard Service 1

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
早くふたりに
ホットドッグを持っていかないと
English:
I should hurry up and bring 
these hotdogs to them.

Japanese: ハァ…　どうして僕が…
English: Sigh... Why am I even doing this?

Japanese:
そうだ！　ただわたすのも癪だから
ソーセージの下にマスタードを
たっぷり入れておいてあげよう！
English:
Oh I know! Why don’t I put a lot of 
mustard under the sausage? I bet
that will annoy them!

Japanese: マスタードを入れる
English: Put Mustard

Japanese: マスタードを入れない
English: Do not put mustard

Japanese: これくらいのイタズラ　良いよね
English: It’s going to be fine, right...?

Japanese:
ふたりの反応が楽しみだなぁ
ははっ　早く持って行こう
English:
I can’t wait to see their reactions!
Let’s hurry and bring it to them.

Japanese: なんて出来やしないんだけどね…
English: As if I can...

Japanese: ははっ…　早く持って行こう
English: Sigh... I’ll just go.

Japanese: マスタードサービス２
English: Mustard Service 2

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
そういえば　あんたから貰ったホットドッグ
異様に辛かったんだけど　なんで？
都会では　あれが普通なの？
English:
Oh yeah, why did you give me a spicy hotdog? 
Is that like a local specialty or something?

Japanese: あ　実はマスタードをサービスしておいたんだ
English: Actually, I put a lot of mustard under it.

Japanese:
はぁ！？　マスタード！？
あんたねぇ　あんなに入ったのを
食べさせるなんて　どういうつもりよ！
English:
Mustard!? What were you gonna do 
by making someone eat that!?

Japanese:
おー　そうだ
辛かったんだな　しかし
どう責任取るんだ
English:
Oh! It was really spicy though! 
How are you going to take 
responsibility for this?

Japanese:
ご…ごめん…
でも　あれは　買って来いって
言われたものだったから…
English:
S-Sorry... Someone told me to
buy those hotdogs, so...

Japanese:
ってコトはなに？
あんた　パシリにされてたの？
English:
So what? Did someone
force you or something?

Japanese: ……うん
English: Yes.

Japanese:
マスタード入れて　やり返そうとするなんて
見かけによらず　結構やるじゃん！
そういうの　あたし好きよ
English:
Ohh, so that’s why... You know, to 
think you’d put mustard under it as 
revenge. Not bad at all! I like that!

Japanese: え？　そ…そう…？　へへっ…
English: R-Really!? Teehee...

Japanese: なに照れてんの　そろそろ行くわよ
English:
What’re you being embarrassed for? 
It’s time to get movin’.

Japanese: うん！
English: Sure!

Japanese: コーダの心配事
English: Coda’s Worries

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: これからどうなっちゃうんだろう…
English: I wonder what’s going to happen to us now...?

Japanese:
そんなことより
食事はいつ出て来るんだな？
English: Who cares, when are we having lunch?

Japanese:
さ　さぁ？
飢え死にさせる気はないだろうし
食べ物はくれると思うけど…
English:
Who knows? I don’t think they’ll let us starve,
so I’m sure they’ll feed us eventually.

Japanese: そうか～　しかし　腹減ったな
English: Oh... Coda’s hungry though.

Japanese: {fixed}（この状況で食事の心配だなんて…）
English: (To worry about food in this situation...)

Japanese: シリンダーの中の転生者
English: The Reincarnators Within the Cylinders

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
あの人たち…
シリンダーの中にいる人たち
助けられないのかな？
English:
Do you think we can save those 
people within the cylinders...?

Japanese:
もしラティオだったら
また襲ってくるんじゃない？
English:
Wouldn’t we get attacked again if 
they were Ratio’s soldiers?

Japanese: う…　そうかも…
English: Yeah... I guess you’re right...

Japanese:
それにこんなに大勢いるなんて
知らなかったんだし
今はなにも対応できないでしょ？
English:
And we didn’t know there was gonna be 
a lot of them in the first place! We can’t
afford to help them right now!

Japanese:
今　あたしたちがやらなきゃいけないのは
聖女の救出！　これよ
English:
Our current objective here is to rescue the 
Saintess. Nothing more, nothing less!

Japanese: うん　そうだね
English: Yeah... You’re right.

Japanese: わかってんなら　急ぐわよ！
English: If you get it, then hurry up!

Japanese: スパーダＶＳロボット
English: Spada vs Robot

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
なぁ　ルカ
オレとあの新兵器どっちが強ェと思う？
English:
Hey, Ruca, who do you think is 
stronger: me or that machine?

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: 新兵器
English: Robot

Japanese:
やっぱり　スパーダかな
スパーダなら
あんな新兵器に負けたりしないよ
English:
You, obviously! There’s no way you 
can lose against something like that!

Japanese:
へへへっ！
嬉しいこと言ってくれるじゃねェか
English:
Hahaha! I’m glad that you 
believe in me so much!

Japanese:
もちろんオレは
あんなモンに負けたりしねェ！
English:
Of course I ain’t gonna 
lose against that thing!

Japanese:
お前もしっかり守ってやるから
安心しろよなっ！
English:
Rest assured, man! I’ll make 
sure to protect you!

Japanese: うん　頼りにしてるよ
English: I’m counting on you!

Japanese: あの新兵器…かなぁ？
English: The robot, probably...?

Japanese: んだと　コラァ！
English: WHAT!?

Japanese: ヒィッ！
English: Uuahh!

Japanese:
まぁ　確かに手ごわそうだけどよ
もっとオレを信用してほしいもんだぜ
English:
I know the robot’s strong and all,
but at least have faith in me, man.

Japanese: 工業区とルカ
English: Ruca and the Industrial District

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
そういえば　こっちの工業区は
ほとんど来たことなかったな
English: You know, I’ve never been here before.

Japanese: なんで？　自分の住んでる街でしょ？
English: Why not? Don’t you live here?

Japanese: それは……
English: That is...

Japanese:
列車も動いてねェし　ここは工場しかねェんだよ
それに働いてるのも　ガラの悪いヤツが多いしな
English:
There’s no reason for some rich kid like him 
to come here, that’s why.

Japanese: ルカみたいなボンボンは　まず来ねェよ
English:
The train doesn’t operate anymore, people 
only come here to work and there are a 
lot of bad types who hang around here.

Japanese: まぁ…そういうこと
English: Well, that’s how it is.

Japanese:
そういえば　ルカちゃんは
ボンボンでしたわね～
English: Oh yeah, you were rich, weren’t you?

Japanese: そのしゃべり方…どうしたのイリア
English: Why are you talking in that tone again?

Japanese:
フンだ
地味に金持ちって　自慢されたら気分悪いっての
English:
Bah! It feels weird to see this plain kid 
boasting about how rich he is.

Japanese: えぇ！？　そんな自慢なんてしてないよ
English: Hey, I’m not boasting at all though!

Japanese:
ただ…本当に　こっちには
あんまり来たことがなくて…
English: I’ve never really been here before...

Japanese:
母さんにも　工業区には
近寄っちゃダメだって言われてたし…
English: My mother always told me to stay away from this place...

Japanese: いいオフクロさんだな
English: What a nice mother.

Japanese:
さっきも言ったように　この辺りはガラが悪い
お前みたいなのが　ボケーっと歩いてたら
ヘンな因縁つけられかねないからな
English:
I’ve mentioned it before but, this place’s the type for 
bad sort to hang around in. If ya just walked around 
like an idiot, who knows what will happen to you.

Japanese: あー　確かに　ルカならありえそう！
English:
Oh yeah, that totally sounds like the sort of thing Ruca 
would do!

Japanese: そんな力強く言わないでよ…
English: That’s not reassuring at all...

Japanese:
じゃあ　あんた　因縁つけられたら
ひとりで逃げ切れる自信あるの？
English:
What if something did happen to you? 
Do you think you can run away?

Japanese: ある……　…ないかも
English: I think I could... or not.

Japanese: どっちよ
English: So can you or can you not?

Japanese: うん　ないや　ごめん…
English: Oh... I can’t. Sorry.

Japanese: 水滴
English: A Drop of Water

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: きゃっ！
English: Eek!

Japanese: ど　どうかしたのイリア！？
English: I-Illia, are you alright!?

Japanese:
なんでもないわよ！
ちょっと水滴が落ちてきて　驚いただけっ！
English:
I’M FINE! 
I was just surprised by a drop of water!

Japanese: それだけ？
English: Only that?

Japanese: 意外だね
English: Well that’s surprising

Japanese: そ　それだけ？
English: O-Only that?

Japanese: …それだけ
English: Only that...

Japanese: あーもー　ほら　さっさと進みましょ
English: Ah crap, let’s just go.

Japanese: う　うん
English: O-Oh okay...

Japanese: {fixed}（それにしても　かわいい悲鳴だったな…）
English: (That was pretty cute...)

Japanese:
意外だね
イリアがそれくらいで　驚くなんて
English:
Well that’s surprising, seeing you surprised by such a 
small thing.

Japanese: ルカちゃーん　それはどういう意味かしら～？
English: Ruca, let’s talk for a moment, shall we～?

Japanese: {fixed}（しまった…！）
English: (Crap...!)

Japanese:
あんた　あたしをなんだと思ってんの？
あたしだってねぇ　それくらいのことで
ビックリすることはあるっての
English:
Who do you think I am!? Even I’d get surprised by 
that sort of thing.

Japanese: だよね　ごめん…
English: Oh... sorry.

Japanese: この先大丈夫？
English: Will It Be Alright to Continue Onward?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
は～　やっぱ　レグヌムって大きいなぁ
こうやってじっくり歩いてまわると
余計そう感じるわ
English:
As Ah thought, Regnum’s mighty big! Ah feel like even 
explorin’ this on foot won’t be enough!

Japanese:
王都だからね
エルは　下水道に住んでたのに
街の中を歩いたことがないの？
English:
It is the Imperial Capital, after all. So, despite living 
in the sewers, you haven’t explored the city yet?

Japanese:
あるにはあるんやけど
観光とか　それどころやなかったからな
English:
Well, it is what it is though, 
we didn’t have any time ta sightsee.

Japanese:
それなら　観光気分で見てみるのは
どうかしら？　きっと新鮮よ
English:
Then, why not look around town for a bit. 
I am sure it would be a nice change of pace.

Japanese: ええな　それ！　あっ！　リンゴ発見！
English:
Ooh that sounds good! Oh! Look! 
There’s an apple o’er there!

Japanese: エル！！
English: Hermie!

Japanese: ピーチも見つけたんだな
English: Coda found a peach!

Japanese: コ…コーダ！
English: C-Coda!

Japanese: ダメだよ　コーダ　勝手に離れちゃ
English:
No, Coda! You know you can’t 
just stray off on your own!

Japanese:
エルもよ　勝手な行動は慎まないと
いきなりいなくなったら　みんな心配するわ
English:
Hermie too! You cannot just go off on your own! 
Everyone else will be worried!

Japanese:
え～…観光気分でエエって言ったの
アンジュ姉ちゃんやん
English:
Aw, but ya told me it’s fine ta sightsee! 
Sis Ange ya meanie!

Japanese: そーだそーだ
English: Meanie!

Japanese:
迷子になって
みんなに迷惑かけるのは　よくないでしょう？
English:
If you end up getting lost, 
everyone else will be troubled, understand?

Japanese:
だから　離れるときには
事前にちゃんと言うこと　いい？
English:
That is why you have to tell us 
before you go off somewhere!

Japanese:
ほな　あの店から良い匂いがしてるから
ちょっと行ってくるで！　で　エエの？
English:
Look! Some tasty smell’s comin’ from that shop 
over there! Is it fine if Ah check it out?

Japanese: ええ
English: Go on.

Japanese: ほな　行ってくるで！
English: Okay! Be back soon!

Japanese: コーダも付いていくんだな
English: Coda’s coming with you!

Japanese:
ところで
あのふたりってお金持ってたっけ？
English: So... Did they bring any money with them?

Japanese: さぁ…？
English: Who knows...?

Japanese:
あっ…　甘い香り…
ルカくん　ちょっと私も行ってくるわ
ここに居てちょうだい
English:
Oh, what a sweet smell. Ruca, I shall be going off
somewhere, so please wait here.

Japanese: この調子でこの先　大丈夫かなぁ…？
English:
That tone... 
I wonder if it’ll be alright to continue onward?

Japanese:
大丈夫だよ　ルカくん
こんなのいつもと変わらないから
English:
It is going to be fine, Ruca. 
It shall be the same as always.

Japanese: 掃除中
English: Currently Cleaning

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ふむ…　温泉は掃除中か…
English: They’re currently cleaning the hot springs, huh...

Japanese:
なんや　おっちゃん
風呂　入りたかったんか？
English: Oh, Uncle, didja wanna take a bath?

Japanese:
ああ　ここの温泉は　ケルム火山を
熱源としていて　源泉掛け流しでな
昔はよく　保養にきたものだ
English:
Oh, you see, the hot springs here are natural springs 
that derive heat from Kelm’s Volcano. I used to come 
here to recover from my wounds.

Japanese:
じゃあ　リカルドさんにとっては
思い出深い場所なんだね
English:
It must be quite a memorable place for you then, 
Ricardo.

Japanese:
まぁな
とはいえ　あまり美しいものではない
湯が生傷にしみた　痛い思い出ばかりだ
English:
Pretty much. That said, what I remember is more of 
the pain from the hot water penetrating my wounds 
instead of soothing it.

Japanese: うわ　それはイヤな思い出だね
English: Ouch, I would not want to remember that.

Japanese:
ところで　リカルドさん
ここの温泉には　どんな効能があるんです？
English:
Sir Ricardo, what sort of beneficial properties does 
the hot springs here have?

Japanese:
確か　切り傷　打ち身などの傷に
効くだけではなく　美肌効果もあると
言われていたな
English:
I believe that, aside from wounds, bruises and the like, 
it is also beneficial for your skin.

Japanese:
美肌……
是非　入りたいですね
English: For my skin...? I will have to check it out some time.

Japanese:
せやな
玉のお肌を　磨きたいわ
English: Ah wanna polish up my skin!

Japanese:
なぁ　おっさん
ここって　混浴はあるのか？
English: Say, old man, reckon this hot spring’s mixed?

Japanese:
あるにはあるが　時間が限られているな
それに　混浴に入るには水着が必要だ
English:
It is, but it depends on the time. Swimsuits are also 
necessary when bathing.

Japanese: ほーう！
English: Hooo--!

Japanese:
いやん
スパーダ兄ちゃん　不潔やで！
English: Spada’s bein’ dirty again!

Japanese: まだ　なにも言ってねェだろ！
English: But I haven’t said anything yet!

Japanese:
リカルド　他にはなにかないのか？　しかし
うまいものとか　うまいものとか！
English:
Is there something else, Ricardo? Coda wants some 
tasty food, tasty.

Japanese: そうだな…　あるとすれば温泉タマゴだな
English: Hmm... There are hot spring eggs.

Japanese: なにそれ？
English: What’s that?

Japanese:
この温泉を利用して　作られるんだ
半熟状でうまいぞ
English:
Half-boiled eggs made in these hot springs. 
They’re quite tasty.

Japanese:
食べたいんだな　しかし
早く温泉へ行くぞ！
English:
Coda wants to eat them though! 
Let’s go to the hot springs!

Japanese:
そうね
ゆっくりつかりたい
English:
Yes, let us!
I want to soak as soon as possible!

Japanese: よっしゃ～　待ってろよ　桃源郷！
English: HELL YES! Wait for me, Shangri-La!

Japanese: ほな　みんな行こか
English: Let’s git!

Japanese:
待て
掃除中で入れないと　最初に言っただろう
English:
Stop! Didn’t the guard say 
that they’re currently cleaning it?

Japanese: みんな
English: Everyone

Speakers:
1 [エルマーナ]
2 [ルカ]
4 [アンジュ]
5 [スパーダ]
6 [コーダ]
7 [イリア]
Japanese: あっ…
English: Awwww...

Japanese: 天然窯
English: Natural Stove

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
それにしても　ホンマあっついなぁ
そのうちウチら　こんがり焼けてまうんやない？
English:
It’s really hot in here ain’t it? 
Reckon we might end up gettin’ roasted?

Japanese: ははは　まさか…
English: Hahaha... I doubt that...

Japanese:
なんだ？　しかし　食い物の話か？
コーダにも食べさせろ　しかし
English:
What’s that? Are you talking about food? 
Give Coda some food too though!

Japanese:
かんにんしてやぁ
ウチ骨と皮ばっかでおいしないでぇ
English: Gimme a break, mah bones an’ skin ain’t tasty at all.

Japanese:
そうか～
しかし　それはガッカリだぞ～
English: Though... What a shame.

Japanese:
あのネズミ　食べへんとは言わんかったで？
そのうちウチら　かじられるんとちゃうやろか？
English:
Did that rat jus’ say that? 
Reckon that rat might end up nibblin’ us later?

Japanese: ははは　まさか…
English: Hahaha... I doubt that...

Japanese:
骨と皮なら　いいダシが取れるんだな　しかし
ぬふぬふぬふっ
English:
Skin and bones would make 
for good broth, though... Mfufufu...

Japanese: 食えないヤツ
English: Someone Who Doesn’t Eat

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: それにしても　あのパスタとかいうヤツ
English: That said, that Pasta fella...

Japanese: ほんまに食えんやっちゃなぁ
English: He really ain’t lookin’ like he’s eatin’.

Japanese:
食べられないパスタなのか？
残念だ　しかし
English:
A pasta you can’t eat? 
Aww, that’s a shame though...

Japanese:
でも　きっとコーダなら食べられるぞ
ぬふふふふ…
English: But Coda’s sure that Coda can eat it! Fufufu...

Japanese:
アカンアカン
あんなもん食べたら　おかしなってまうわ
English: No, no, it’d be really strange if ya eat ’em.

Japanese:
そうなのか？　じゃあ　コーダは
普通のパスタで我慢するぞ　しかし
English:
Is that so? 
Then Coda will just try hard with normal pasta though.

Japanese: せやな　普通なんが一番や
English: Right? Normal really is the best.

Japanese:
ほな　お腹も減ってきたし
何か食べに行こか
English: Aw Ah’m hungry again. Let’s go eat sumthin’ though.

Japanese:
さすがエルマーナ
どてっぱらだな　しかし
English: As expected! Hermana really has some guts though!

Japanese: それを言うなら太っ腹やろ…
English: That’s a very broad-minded thing ta say...

Japanese: キュキュの技
English: QQ’s Skill

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
ホンマ　キュキュ姉ちゃん
牢屋の鍵　開けるのすごかったわぁ
ウチ　ちょっと痺れたで
English:
Sis QQ was really cool when she opened
the cell door back there! It was so excitin’!

Japanese:
鍵ってさ　そんな簡単に開くものなの？
あたしにもできる？
English: Is lockpicking really that easy? Can I try it too?

Japanese:
簡単ない
イリア　たぶんムリ…
でも　キュキュなら　開けられる
English: Not simple. Illia probably can’t.

Japanese: ムリかぁ…
English: Aww...

Japanese: イリア姉ちゃん　なに考えてるん？
English: Whatcha thinkin’, Sis Illia?

Japanese: ナイショ
English: Secret～

Japanese:
ね　ね　ちなみに
鍵が掛かってるところなら
なんでも開けられるの？
English: Say, QQ, can you open anything that’s locked?

Japanese: はい
English: Yes.

Japanese:
なら　鍵の掛かった家とか
倉庫なんかも……♪
English:
Then you can probably open 
locked houses or warehouses～

Japanese:
そういうことやったんか
ほな　今度から　町行ったときは調べてみよか
English: Oh, Ah get it! Let’s test it out when we get ta town!

Japanese:
鍵が掛かってるくらいだから
きっと　スンゴイものがあるはずよ～！
うひひひひひひ～～！
English:
We might be able to open a lot of things!
Heeheeheeheehee～

Japanese: パスタなヤツ
English: That Pasta Fella

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
良かったぁ…
ルカ兄ちゃんが無事で
ほんまに良かったわ…
English: Ah’m so glad, Ah’m mighty glad that Ruca Bro’s safe.

Japanese:
それにしてもあの変なヤツ…
次に会うたら絶対許さへんからな
English:
Still, if Ah meet that weirdo again,
Ah’ll never let ’em get away!

Japanese: 名前はなんて言うたっけ…
English: What was his name again?

Japanese: ……ファルファッレ？
English: Farfalle?

Japanese:
蝶リボンの形をしていて
うまいな　しかし
English:
That butterfly-ribbon shaped 
food’s really tasty though!

Japanese: ちゃう……コンキリエやったっけ？
English: Nah that ain’t it... was it Conchiglie?

Japanese: 貝殻の形でうまいな　しかし
English: That seashell shaped food’s really tasty though!

Japanese: それもちゃうなぁ……リガトーニか？
English: Nah that ain’t it either... Maybe it’s Rigatoni?

Japanese: グラタンとかうまいな　しかし
English: Cooked as a gratin, it’s also tasty though!

Japanese:
アカン…ど忘れしとるわ…
あっ……ペンネ！
English: This is bad, Ah forgot what it was... Oh! Penne!

Japanese:
ペンの先みたいで
濃いソースにあってうまいな　しかし
English:
It’s also tasty with a dark sauce 
like the previous one though!

Japanese:
やっぱなんかちゃうなぁ…
…リングイネやったか？
English:
As Ah thought, it prolly ain’t that either... 
is it Linguine?

Japanese: ヌードルみたいで美味しいな　しかし
English: It’s tasty with alfredo sauce though!

Japanese:
ああ　もうええわ
なんやお腹空いたし
スパゲッティでも食べにいこ
English:
Ah can’t do it anymore, Ah’m hungry. 
Ah’mma go eat spaghetti.

Japanese:
おお！
コーダも付いて行くぞ　しかし！
English: Yay! Take Coda with you too!

Japanese: ………わざとなのかな？
English: Is she... doing that on purpose?

Japanese: 犬男のしわざ
English: Dog Boy’s Deed

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
スパーダさん
今なら果物を取っても　犬男のしわざ
ってことにならないザマスか？
English:
Sir Spada, if I happened to have taken 
a fruit, would it all be blamed on Dog Boy?

Japanese:
イリアさん　そのとおりザマス
では　ひとついただいて…
English: As you have said, Lady Illia. Let’s take one...

Japanese: わーーっ！　ダメだって　ふたりとも！
English: Cut it out, you two!

Japanese: 冗談よ　冗談
English: We’re just kidding.

Japanese: そうそう　マジんなんなって
English: Yeah, it’s not like we were being serious or anything.

Japanese: 本当かなぁ？
English: Are you sure?

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
なぁ　コーダ　今なら　果物もろても
シアンのしわざってことにできへんかなぁ？
English:
Hey, Coda, ain’t Sian gonna be 
blamed if ah took a fruit?

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
おー　エル　頭いいんだな
今なら　いけるんだな！
English: Oh! Great idea, Hermie! Let’s take one!

Japanese: わー！　ダメだよ　ふたりとも！
English: Hey! Cut it out, you two!

Japanese: 考えることは　みんな一緒みたいね
English: Seems like everyone’s thinking the same thing.

Japanese: だな
English: Damn right.

Japanese: まだら模様のキノコ
English: Mottled Mushroom

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
どこかに　トロピカルなフルーツ
なってへんやろか？
English: Ah wonder where the tropical fruits are at～

Japanese: あきらめてなかったんだね
English: I see that you haven’t given up on that yet.

Japanese:
当然やん！
あんなエエにおいしたもんを
あきらめられるわけないやん！
English:
Course Ah haven’t! 
As if Ah’d give up sumthin’ that tasty!

Japanese:
エル　腹減ったのか？
それなら　このキノコを食べるといいんだな
English:
Hermie, are you hungry? 
You should try this mushroom out!

Japanese:
なんやねん
この奇抜なまだら模様のキノコは…
こんなん食べて平気なん？
English:
That sure’s sum strikin’ mottled ’shroom ya got there. 
Ya sure it’s tasty?

Japanese:
ぬふっぬふっぬふっ
意外とうまいんだな　しかし
ぬふっぬふっぬふっ
English:
Mfu～! It’s... Mfu～! Unexpectedly tasty though... 
Mfu～! Mfu～! Mfu～!

Japanese:
ふっ…ふふふふふ…
オススメは　できないけどね
ふふっ…　ふふふふふふっ……
English:
But... hehheh... it is a bit...
hehheh... hard to continue...

Japanese:
くくく…
まったくだ…くくっ…
English: Hahah... Tell me about it... Hahah...

Japanese:
な…　なんだよ
ふたりして　気持ち悪ぃな…
English:
Wha... what the hell? 
Y’all are starting to creep me out. Knock it off.

Japanese:
うっかり　コーダに　ふふっ…
キノコを口に　ふふふ…
ふふふっ…　ねじ込まれてしまってね…ふふっ
English:
Coda *giggle* f-forced the *giggle* mushroom in 
*giggle* into my mouth...

Japanese:
俺は…　アンジュの……　毒見をし………
くっ…くくくくくくっ…
English:
I was *giggle* checking *giggle* if it was 
*giggle* poisonous for An...

Japanese:
この笑い方　異常…
キュキュでも　わかる…
English: Your laugh strange. Even QQ knows...

Japanese:
あっ　これワライダケだ
毒キノコの一種だよ！
図鑑で見たことある
English:
This is... Isn’t this a variety of the 
Panaeolus papilionaceus mushroom?
I’ve seen it in a book before!

Japanese:
げっ！
ちょっと　それ大丈夫なの！？
English: Huh!? So is... is it safe?

Japanese:
幸い毒性が弱い種類みたいだし…
そのうち治まるとは思うけど……
English:
If I recall correctly, its poison is quite weak so it should 
subside soon.

Japanese: アンジュは　食べてないわよね？
English: You didn’t eat it, did you, Ange?

Japanese:
ええ
でも　おいしいのなら
笑いが止まらなくなるのを覚悟で…
English: Yes, but if it is just laughter I can endure it...

Japanese:
アンジュ　チャレンジャー…
でも　キュキュ　ススメない…
English: Ange challenger... But QQ can’t...

Japanese: ぬふっぬふっぬふっぬふっ！
English: Ohohoho～!

Japanese: ふふふふふふっ…！
English: *giggling*

Japanese: くくくっ…くくっ！
English: *giggling*

Japanese: 理想の自分
English: The Ideal Self

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
♪　みんなを守る　強い体　　♪
♪　何にも屈さぬ　強い心　　♪
♪　誰にも負けぬ　強い自分　♪
English:
