♪　A sound body to protect everyone　♪
♪　A sound heart unwavering to anything　♪
♪　A sound self not losing to anyone　♪

Japanese: うっわ！　なによその歌？
English: What the heck is that song?

Japanese:
ポゥじいさんみたいに
理想の自分を歌にしてみたんだけど…
English:
I wanted to try singing about my ideal self 
just like what Old Man Pwo was doing...

Japanese:
ルカ　大事なことだから
はっきりというわよ？
English: Okay, Ruca, this is important. So pay attention.

Japanese: あんたには才能がないわっ！
English: YOU. DON’T. HAVE. TALENT.

Japanese: そう思う…
English: Agree with Illia.

Japanese: そんなことないよ
English: Disgree with Illia.

Japanese: うん…　僕もそう思う…
English: Yeah... I think so too...

Japanese:
なに　気づいてたの　それならよかった
気づかずにやってたら　悲惨なだけだったわ
English:
Oh, so you do know? 
Would’ve been bad if you didn’t.

Japanese: だね…
English: Yeah...

Japanese: そんなことはないと思うけどなぁ…
English: I don’t think so, though...

Japanese:
訂正
あんたには才能以前に　センスがないわ
English:
Correction: 
You don’t have the sense, let alone the talent.

Japanese:
うぅ…
そんなふうに言わなくたって　いいじゃないか…
English:
Aren’t you being a bit harsh...? 
You didn’t have to say that...

Japanese:
ホントのことだしねぇ
それとも…
English: It’s not like I’m lying. What? You want me to go...

Japanese:
ルカ上手！　天才！　最高！
まさに天使の歌声！　もっと歌って！　キャー！
English:
“Oh Ruca, you’re so cool! So talented! 
I can hear the angels singing! Sing more! Kya～～～”

Japanese: とかのほうが良い？
English: This good enough for you?

Japanese: ごめん　僕が間違ってた
English: Yeah, forget about it. Sorry...

Japanese: わかればいいのよ
English: As long as you understand.

Japanese: 死体に噛まれると…
English: When Corpses Bite...

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
うわぁ…これはホンマにきっついなぁ
元気な死体なんて洒落にもならへんわ
English:
Whoa, this guy’s tough. Fresh corpses ain’t sumthin’
ta scoff at.

Japanese: なあ　エル知ってるか？
English: Hey, Hermie, did you know?

Japanese: この死体に噛まれたヤツはなぁ…
English: When this corpse bites you...

Japanese: 知っとるで…
English: Ah know...

Japanese:
噛まれただけやない　爪で引っかかれたり
ちょっとした傷を負わされたら
おんなじような死体になってまうんやろ
English:
Not only when it bites ya, but also if it scratches ya or
gives ya a wound, then ye’ll also become a corpse.

Japanese:
マジかよ！？
引っかかれてもダメなのかよ！
English: Wait, really!? So even getting a scratch is bad!?

Japanese: 冗談に決まってるやん
English: Ah’m kiddin’ of course.

Japanese: キュキュと戦争１
English: QQ and War 1

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: どうしたのキュキュ？
English: What’s wrong, QQ?

Japanese: 戦争のにおい　する
English: It smells like war...

Japanese: 戦争のにおい？
English: Like war?

Japanese: そんなにおいする？
English: Do you smell it?

Japanese: 鼻が利くんだね
English: That sure is one sense of smell

Japanese: そんなにおいする？
English: Do you smell it?

Japanese: ルカ　わからないか？
English: Ruca don’t know?

Japanese: う　ごめん
English: No, sorry...

Japanese:
ルカは最近まで　戦争とは無縁だったんだ
そう責めてやるな
English:
Ruca hasn’t been involved in a battlefield
until recently, so please don’t blame him.

Japanese: 戦争が　……無縁？
English: Hasn’t been involved... in a battlefield?

Japanese:
それより　ここから先は
本格的な戦争の真っ只中だ
２人とも　気を抜くなよ
English:
At any rate, we’ll be going through a
full-blown battlefield from here onwards.
You both better stay alert.

Japanese:
鼻が利くんだね
僕にはわからないや
English:
Wow, QQ, that sure is one sense
of smell you got there.

Japanese:
鼻が利く　ちょと違う
ん～　空気が　ピリピリの感じ？
English: Smell kinda wrong... it’s like air electric.

Japanese:
戦争の雰囲気を感じ取ったんだろう
俺も少々　気分が高揚している
English:
It’s likely that she’s feeling the
atmosphere of the battlefield.
I’m feeling a bit peppy myself.

Japanese: それ！　フインキ！
English: That’s it! A moss sphere!

Japanese: ふんいきだ
English: It’s “atmosphere.”

Japanese:
う～ん
僕にはわからないや
English: Hmm... I don’t really get it.

Japanese: ルカ　そんなで大丈夫か？
English: Are you alright with it, Ruca?

Japanese: う　ごめん
English: No, sorry...

Japanese:
ルカは最近まで　戦争とは無縁だったんだ
そう責めてやるな
English:
Ruca hasn’t been involved in a battlefield
until recently, so please don’t blame him.

Japanese: 戦争が　……無縁？
English: Hasn’t been involved... in a battlefield?

Japanese:
それより　ここから先は
本格的な戦争の真っ只中だ
２人とも　気を抜くなよ
English:
At any rate, we’ll be going through a
full-blown battlefield from here onwards.
You both better stay alert.

Japanese: キュキュと戦争２
English: QQ and War 2

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
みんな　たくさん戦争してる
なのにルカ　戦争と無縁　どういうことか？
English:
Everyone’s fighting lots,
but why Ruca is indifferent?

Japanese:
裕福な家庭　安全な首都
ルカにとっては戦争なんて
遠い世界の話だったはずだ
English:
Ruca grew up from a rich family in the Imperial
Capital, you see. So war is a completely different
world from what he’s used to.

Japanese:
戦わなくても
生きていける環境だったということだ
English:
It means that he lived in an environment
where he didn’t have to fight.

Japanese:
……はい
なんとなく　わかた
English: Yes... I think I get it.

Japanese:
キュキュ　生まれたとき　戦争してた
家族……仲間守るため　戦た
戦わなきゃ　ならなかた
English:
From the time QQ was born, QQ has been in war.
Fighting to protect family and friends. QQ had to.

Japanese:
キュキュが　戦争の近く　いる
そういうことか
English: It means QQ has always been close with war.

Japanese:
俺も似たようなものだ
仕事といえば
傭兵くらいしかなかったからな
English:
It’s the same for me too,
I’ve always been a mercenary.

Japanese:
でも　そうするしかなかた
不幸だた　わけ違う
けど……
English:
But QQ had no choice.
Unfortunate. Different, but...

Japanese:
けど　戦争ない　みんな　しあわせ
そんな日　来ると　キュキュ　うれしい
English:
But if war gone, everyone happy.
QQ would be happy if that day comes.

Japanese:
そうだな
そんな世界になればいいな
English: You’re right... I wish the world could be like that.

Japanese: あたためて
English: Warm Me Up

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: ア　アカン…さむ…寒すぎるわ…
English: T-T-This ain’t g-g-good! It’s t-t-too cold!

Japanese: エル　大丈夫？
English: Are you alright, Hermie?

Japanese:
ルカ兄ちゃん…
ウチ　もうダメかもしれん…
English: Ruca Bro, Ah don’ think Ah can make it...

Japanese:
ちょ　ちょっと！
エル　しっかり！！
English:
H-Hermie!?
G-Get a hold of yourself!

Japanese:
なら兄ちゃん　あたためてぇな…
ほんま寒ぅてあかんねん…
English:
Warm me up, Ruca Bro,
Ah c-can’t take the c-c-cold anymore...

Japanese:
な　何を言ってるんだよ！？
そんなこと　できるわけが…
English:
What are you talking about!?
As if I can--

Japanese: 人助けや思うて…お願いやって…
English: Please...

Japanese: だ　だって僕には…イリアが…
English: But I... Illia...

Japanese:
あぁぁぁぁ！　もうアカン！！
アンジュ姉ちゃんにあたためてもらお！！
English:
Ah c-c-can’t take this anymore!
Sis Ange～!

Japanese: あ　あれ…エル…？
English: Huh...? Hermie...?

Japanese: 滑って転んで１
English: Slippery and Slidey 1

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
ところどころ地面が凍っているようだ
注意しろ
English: Be careful, there are patches of ice everywhere.

Japanese: 地面　ツルッツル！　すごい楽しい！
English: Ground! Slippery! Fun!!!

Japanese:
あまりはしゃぐな
本当に滑るぞ
English: Don’t get too excited or you’ll slip.

Japanese: 大丈夫　だいじょう…うひゃ！？
English: QQ’s fine! QQ--!!

Japanese: あうっ！
English: Ahh!

Japanese: 忠告したというのに…
English: And after I just warned her...

Japanese: コンウェイ　避ける　酷い…
English: Kongwei dodged! Meanie...

Japanese:
酷いもなにも
ボクが受け止められるわけないだろう？
English: Meanie or not, it is not like I can prevent your fall...

Japanese: あぅ…　確かに…
English: Aww... that’s true...

Japanese:
くっそ～！　おいしいシチュエーションを
棒に振るなんて　おまえそれでも男かよ！
English:
DAMN IT! And you call yourself a man?
How dare you avoid that spicy situation?

Japanese:
キュキュ　次からは
オレに抱きついてきていいからな！
English: You can cling on to me next time, QQ!

Japanese:
はい　わかた
そのとき　ヘンな帽子のとこ行く
English: Understood. Next time I go to weird hat.

Japanese: おう！　まかせとけ！
English: Yeah! Leave it to me!

Japanese: やれやれだね…
English: Oh dear...

Japanese: 滑って転んで２
English: Slippery and Slidey 2

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
うぅ…さぶっ…！
おっちゃん　あったかそうでエエなぁ
ちょっと　そのコートにくるませてーな
English:
C-Cold...!
Hey, Uncle, ya look kinda warm in that.
Can ya lend it ta me?

Japanese: 断る
English: I refuse.

Japanese: 少しくらいエエやん　ケチやなぁ
English: C’mon, jus’ a bit... please?

Japanese: 馬鹿なことを言っていないで　先へ進むぞ
English: Stop saying such things, we’re going.

Japanese: うわあっ！
English: Uwaah!

Japanese: へ？　キャアッ！
English: Huh? Kya--!

Japanese:
ちょっとどこ触ってんのよ！
早くどきなさいよ　おたんこルカっ！！
English:
H-Hey where the heck are you touching me!?
Get off of me! You damn dummy!

Japanese: あわわっ！　ご　ごめん！！
English: S-S-Sorry!

Japanese: ふんっ！
English: Hmph!

Japanese:
えっへっへっへ
うまくやりやがったなァ　この～！
English:
Heheheheh.
You sure are getting it on, Ruca. Pop off!

Japanese: そんなっ！　わざとじゃないよ！
English: Of course not! I’m not doing it on purpose!

Japanese:
で　どうだったんだ？
オニーサンに言ってみろよ？
English:
So? How was it?
C’mon, tell your big brother
all the itty bitty details!

Japanese: えへへ…　やわらかかった…
English: Hehe... it was pretty... soft...

Japanese: って　なに言わせるんだよぅ！
English: Hold on, what am I even saying!?

Japanese:
くっそ～！　うらやましいぜ！
こうなったら　ワザと滑ってみるか！
English:
Damn it I’m so jealous, man!
At this rate I should just slip on purpose!

Japanese:
そうとくれば…よし…！
ヒャハッハッハッハ！
待ってろよ　オレの楽園！
English:
And when I do...
Heheh...
Wait for me, my paradise!

Japanese: 滑って転んで３
English: Slippery and Slidey 3

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
へへっ　いいタイミングでアンジュが
前を歩いてやがるぜ
English:
Hah, it’s time!
I’ll let Ange walk forward first.

Japanese: おおっとぉ！　足が滑ったァ！
English: Oh no, I slipped!

Japanese: ん？　なんかやけにカッタイぞ？
English: Hmm? Why is it hard?

Japanese: あら　大丈夫？
English: Oh my, are you all right?

Japanese: 何も問題ない
English: No problems here.

Japanese:
って　リカルドのおっさんっ！？
なにしてくれてんだよ！
English:
Old man Ricardo!?
What the heck are you doing?

Japanese:
ふっ
アンジュの護衛が俺の仕事だからな
English: Just doing my job.
Hm?

Japanese: 行くぞ　アンジュ
English: Let’s head out, Ange.

Japanese:
くっそ～～！　なんでうまくいかねェんだ！
もう少しで　楽園へ辿り着けたってのに
仕方ねェ　今度はキュキュで試してみるか
English:
Dammit, why won’t anything work out!?
I was so close... towards my paradise!
Okay... I’ll try it on QQ next time!

Japanese:
楽園ねぇ…
その話　詳しく聞かせてもらえる？
English:
“Paradise”, huh...
Mind explaining what this “paradise” is?

Japanese:
ア…アンジュ…
おっさんと先に行ったんじゃ…
English:
A-Ange! Didn’t y-you go ahead
with that old man...?

Japanese:
スパーダくんのことが気になってね
それで　なにがうまくいかなかったのかしら？
English:
I find your recent actions quite... interesting.
So, would you mind divulging the details?

Japanese:
い…いや…それは…そのアレだ　アレ…
アレがこうして　そうなってだな…
English: Uh... No... uh... well... that happened?

Japanese:
いまいち　要領を得ないわね
向こうでじっくりとお話ししましょうか
English:
Hm? Mind repeating that again? Let us continue 
in that corner so I may hear you properly.

Japanese:
オ…オレが悪かった！
オレが悪かったから　勘弁してくれ～～！
English: I’m sorry! I’m really sorry! Please forgive meeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee～!

Japanese:
スパーダくんにも　困ったものね
でも　これに懲りたら　少しは行動を慎むわよね
English:
Oh you troublesome child!
I hope this discourages you from trying that again!

Japanese: 突風注意
English: Warning for Sudden Winds

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
それにしても高いなぁ
これ　落ちたら　ひとたまりもないんとちゃうか
English:
Purty high up here.
No one ta stop ya if ya fall.

Japanese: エル　あまり端によると危ないよ
English: Hermie, be careful; don’t go near the edge.

Japanese:
大丈夫やって
ルカ兄ちゃんは心配性やなぁ
English: Ah’m fine! Yer such a worrywart, Ruca Bro.

Japanese: こんなん　突風でも吹かん限り……
English: Unless there’s like a gust of wind--

Japanese: わっ　わわわっ！？
English: Whoa!

Japanese: エル！！
English: Hermie!

Japanese: あ　危なかったぁ…
English: Th-that was scary...

Japanese: そのまま落ちたら…
English: If you fell...

Japanese: エルを怒る
English: Get mad at her

Japanese: そのまま落ちたことを　想像するとイヤだね…
English: I don’t even want to think about you falling...

Japanese: せやな…
English: Yeah...

Japanese: エル　だから　言ったじゃないか！
English: Didn’t I just tell you to be careful!?

Japanese: ご　ごめん…ウチが悪かったわ…
English: S-Sorry... It was mah fault...

Japanese: 兄ちゃん　助けてくれてありがとうな
English: Thanks for savin’ me, Ruca Bro.

Japanese: うん　無事でよかったよ
English: Yeah, I’m glad you’re okay too.

Japanese: でも　今度から危険な事はしないようにね
English: Try not to do anything too dangerous next time...

Japanese: そーするわ
English: Yeah...

Japanese: きな臭い
English: Smells Fishy

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
アルベールが戦場でもない遺跡へ…か
きな臭い話だぜ…
English:
Albert’s not on the battlefield but in the ruins...
Smells kinda fishy.

Japanese: どこが？　全然匂わんで？
English: Fish? Where? Ah can’t smell anythin’!

Japanese: オレじゃねェ　嗅ぐな！
English: Not me! Don’t sniff me!

Japanese: ほな　きな臭いって　なにが臭いん？
English: Then what’s fishy?

Japanese:
その　なんだ　さっき街の連中が
部隊の訓練だとか言ってたろ？
それが　うさんくさいってコトだ
English:
It’s those... uhh... that guy said earlier
that they’d be doing drills in the ruins, right?
That smells hella fishy.

Japanese:
それならそうと　うさんくさいって
言えばええんのとちゃう？
English: Then why don’tcha jus’ tell me in the first place?

Japanese:
あっ　スパーダ兄ちゃん
もしかして　カッコつけたかったん？
English: Don’ tell me, are ya try’na look cool in fronta me?

Japanese: そ　そんなことねェよ
English: NO!?

Japanese:
エエねんエエねん　隠さんで
みんなには黙っといたる
English:
Tis fine, Spada Bro.
Even if ya try ta hide it, no one would say sumthin’.

Japanese: だから違うってーの！
English: I’m telling you I wasn’t!

Japanese: リカルドの決意
English: Ricardo’s Resolution

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: 兄者……
English: Brother...

Japanese: リカルドさん…大丈夫ですか？
English: Are you all right, Sir Ricardo?

Japanese:
……アンジュか
心配は無用だ
English: You needn’t worry about me, Ange.

Japanese:
そうですか
それなら安心しました
English:
Is that so?
That’s a relief then.

Japanese:
こんなところで
腑抜けて貰っては　困りますしね
折角　雇った意味がありません
English:
After all, hiring you would be meaningless
if you turn your back now.

Japanese:
ふっ…言ってくれる
心配するな
English: Hmph, don’t worry...

Japanese:
お前達の未来を守るためにも…
必ず　マティウスを倒す
English:
I’ll make sure to defeat Mattheus
to protect everyone’s future...

Japanese: ええ　頑張りましょう
English: Indeed, let us do our best!

Japanese:
そして　兄者の愛した…
この世界のためにも…
English:
As well as the world my brother
oh so dearly loved...

Japanese: ハァ…
English: Sigh...

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
…はぁ　エディとニーノかぁ
クラスメートなんだけど
このふたり　苦手なんだよなぁ
English:
Sigh... Even though Eddie and Nino
are my classmates, they’re giving
me a headache.

Japanese:
なにかと図々しくて　いっつも僕を
からかうために　引っ張り出すんだ
宿題だって　いつも丸写しされるし…
English:
They always humiliate me and drag
me out to play without listening to me.
Even copy off my homework...

Japanese:
今日は　僕に気合いを入れる儀式かぁ
気合いを　入れるどころか
気が重いや…
English:
Not knowing what they’re going to
force me to do today is making me
feel rather uneasy...

Japanese: ニミっち
English: Nimmy

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
アニーミさん…　かぁ
前世の縁で巡り会った　運命的な出会い
名字で呼ぶのは　よそよそしいかな
English:
So she’s called “Illia Animi”, huh... We were fated to 
meet because of our past lives... I wonder if I would 
seem distant if I just call her “Miss Animi?”

Japanese:
アスラみたいに　シブく「イナンナ」って
呼んでみたいけど　さすがに失礼だし…
English:
I want to try calling to her in a tasteful manner
just like how Asura used to. But I guess it 
might come off as rude.

Japanese: あ…　そうだ！
English: Oh, I know!

Japanese:
あだ名で呼んで　ふたりの距離を
グッと　縮めてみよう！
ようし　これだ！　これしかない…
English:
Let’s call her by her nickname to bridge that gap!
I’ve got it! Let’s try doing that!

Japanese:
イリっち…　じゃあ　なれなれしいし
アニっち…　とかは　どうかな？
いや　ここは思い切って…
English:
“Lily”... well, that might come off as overly familiar. 
Then, how about “Annie?” No, something more daring...

Japanese:
ニミっちってのは　どうだろ？
ニミっち…　ようし　これだ！
このアダ名なら　気に入ってもらえるぞ！
English:
Then how about “Nimmy?” Nimmy...
This is it! I’m sure she’ll like this nickname!

Japanese:
きっと　誰も彼女をニミっちなんて
呼ばないだろうし　僕だけが
ニミっちって　呼ぶんだ…
English:
No one’s probably called her by that yet, 
so I’ll be the only one who’s going to use it!

Japanese: そして　いつか「イナンナ」って…
English: And maybe someday, she’d let me call her “Ina--”

Japanese: ちょっと　どうかした？
English: Hey, something up?

Japanese: うわッ！！
English: Whoa!

Japanese:
こいつ　ヘンだな
独り言　言ってたぞ　しかし
English:
This guy’s talking to himself though.
He’s pretty weird!

Japanese:
いや　その…　あの…
なんでもないんだ
その…　ニミッ…　アニーミさん
English: Th-That’s-- It’s nothing, Nimi-- Miss Animi.

Japanese:
そぉ？
だったら　いいけど
English:
Oh, really?
Sure, I guess.

Japanese:
あはは　やっぱり
いきなりアダ名は　失礼だよね？
そうに決まってるさ…
English:
Ahaha... I guess it really does come off as rude if I
suddenly start calling her with a nickname.
Of course...

Japanese: これ、何？
English: What’s this?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: で　これは一体　なに…？
English: So, what’s this?

Japanese:
「これ」って　コーダのことだな　しかし
おまえ　「これ」とは
失礼だな　しかし！
English:
“This” is Coda though!
Coda is not a thing! Calling
Coda “this” is rude!

Japanese:
ああー　それね　うちの地方に
住み着いてる　生き物でね
あたしに　付いて来ちゃったの
English:
Oh, that. It’s an animal that lives
in the region where I’m from. 
It came with me.

Japanese: どういう生き物なの？
English: What kind of animal is it?

Japanese:
砂漠に　穴を掘って
暮らしてるんだけどね
その巣穴が　危険なのよねー
English:
They dig holes under the sand and live in them.
Their burrows are pretty dangerous though.

Japanese:
馬が巣穴に　足を突っ込んで
骨折したりするから　一斉に捕まえて
管理してんのよ
English:
Horses tend to fall into them and break their bones, 
so we gathered them all up to keep an eye on them.

Japanese:
南西部の砂漠って　すっごく広いよね？
それを一斉に捕まえるって…
どうやったの？
English:
The southwestern desert is really vast, isn’t it?
How did you manage to gather them all?

Japanese:
簡単よ
エサで　釣って
一網打尽にするの
English:
Simple. We lured them all into 
one place with some bait.

Japanese:
エサで釣って　一網打尽って
…カブトムシみたいだね
English: So just like catching fish then?

Japanese:
とにかく　食い意地の張った連中でね
大人しいから　飼いならすのは
楽でいいんだけど　エサ代がかかるのよ
English:
At any rate, they’re a stubborn, yet docile bunch, so 
they’re easy to raise. The only problem is that feeding
them can get pretty expensive.

Japanese:
最近　あんまり　いいメシが食えないからな
コーダは　うまいメシを
求めて出て来たんだな　しかし
English:
The food hasn’t been tasty lately, so Coda
came along to find tasty foods though!

Japanese:
まあ　おかげで心細い思いをせずに
済んだんだけどね
いい加減　こいつうるさくて…
English:
Thanks to him, instead of feeling despair, I was
just annoyed coz he’s too damn noisy...

Japanese:
それは　イリアが
メシをケチるからだぞ　しかし！
English: It’s because you don’t share your food though!

Japanese:
それで…
なんで言葉をしゃべってるの　これ？
English: So... how does it talk?

Japanese:
気にするな！
食べる以外に　口を使ってるだけだぞ？
ああ　腹がへったなぁ～　しかし！
English:
Don’t worry about it! 
I only use my mouth for eating! 
Ohhh... I’m hungry though!

Japanese: 異能者の噂
English: The Rumoured Deviant

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
せっかく　レグヌムまで来たのに
すぐ出てきちゃった
もったいないなぁ～
English:
To think that the moment I get to Regnum, 
I just end up leaving immediately.
What a waste.

Japanese: レグヌムには　なにをしに来たの？
English: Why were you at Regnum, anyway?

Japanese:
決まってんでしょ？
異能者を　探しに来たのよ
ちょいとウワサを　聞きつけてね
English:
Isn’t that obvious?
I was looking for a Deviant.

Japanese: それって僕？　と聞く
English: Ask her “Is it me?”

Japanese: 先ほど逮捕者を見たと言う
English: Tell her that you saw one get arrested earlier.

Japanese: それって　僕のこと？
English: Do you mean me?

Japanese:
あんた　人のウワサになるような
異能者だったの？
English: You’re the rumored Deviant?

Japanese: そんなことはないけど…
English: Probably not...

Japanese:
でしょうね　覚醒も
ついさっきみたいだったし
English: Duh. You only just awakened earlier.

Japanese:
あ　異能者らしい人が
兵隊さんに　捕まってたよ？
English:
Oh, I saw someone like that being
towed away by the soldiers earlier.

Japanese:
あっちゃあ…　ひと足遅かったかぁ
この街に　人間離れした強い男がいるって
聞いて来たのになぁ
English:
Aww so I just missed them, huh...
I heard there was someone super strong here,
so I came to check them out.

Japanese:
人間離れした強さって
どういう人なんだろう…
English: I wonder what kind of person he’s like...

Japanese:
ケンカで負けナシなんだって
素手で　武装したチンピラグループ
３０人を　軽～くノシちゃったって話だけど
English:
I heard he never lost a fight.
Rumors say he once took on 30 gang members
unarmed and easily won.

Japanese:
…ぶっそうな話だね
あんまり　関わり合いになりたくない
人種だなぁ
English:
How dangerous. I’d rather not get involved with 
those types of people.

Japanese:
まあ　あんたなら
そーでしょうね
いかにも　人畜無害そうだもん！
English:
Well, for you, yeah. You look like the type who 
wouldn’t hurt a bug.

Japanese:
とにかく
早く　街から離れましょ
English: Anyways, let’s hurry and get ourselves out of here.

Japanese:
う…　うん
じゃ　急ごう
English: Y-Yeah. Let’s go.

Japanese: お互いの呼び方
English: The Way We Address Each Other

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: 「あんた」かぁ…
English: “You”, huh...

Japanese: ん？　どーした　しかし？
English: What’s the matter though?

Japanese:
僕もイリアを「あんた」って呼んだら
どうなるだろう
English:
I wonder what will happen
if I call Illia “you?”

Japanese: それは　試してみればいいぞ　しかし
English: Why don’t you try it out though?

Japanese:
でも　怒りそうだなぁ…
第一「あんた」なんて呼び方
偉そうな　気もするし
English:
But I think she’ll get mad... At any rate, calling
people “you” would make me seem arrogant.

Japanese:
んじゃあ　呼ばれて
ムカツクのか　しかし？
English:
Do you get annoyed when
people call you that though?

Japanese:
とんでもない！
…ちょっと嬉しいぐらいだよ
English: Not at all! Quite the contrary, really...

Japanese:
じゃあ
なにが不満なんだな　しかし？
English: So what are you worrying about, Ruca?

Japanese:
僕が「イリア」って呼ぶように
僕も彼女に「ルカ」って
呼んでもらいたいんだけどなぁ
English:
I just want her to call me “Ruca” the 
same way I call her “Illia.”

Japanese:
そう　イリアに言えばいいぞ　しかし？
おーい　イリア　ルカが話あるみたいだ…
English:
Then you can just tell Illia that. 
Hey, Illia! Ruca wants to tell you--

Japanese: モガモガ！
English: Mmph!

Japanese: なに？　なんか用？
English: What? Need anything?

Japanese:
あ…　いや！　なんでもないよ？
ええっと…　その…
今日は　いい天気だねぇ？
English:
Oh nothing! Uh... well... 
The weather sure is fine today!

Japanese:
はぁ？
ん～　まあいい天気だけどさぁ
あんた　どうかしたの？
English:
Really? I guess it is...
What’s gotten into you?

Japanese:
はは…　なんでもないよ？
なんでも…
English:
Oh, nothing! 
Haha... Nothing...

Japanese: ヘンなヤツ…
English: Weirdo.

Japanese: グリゴリって変だよね？
English: Grigoris Are Weird, Right?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
な～によっ！　あのグリゴリってヤツ！
ムカツクし　ヘンな名前だし！
English:
What’s with that Grigori guy!
He’s annoying and he has a weird name!

Japanese:
グリゴリは
あの人の名前じゃないと　思うよ？
「我ら」って　言ってたし
English:
I don’t think his real name is “Grigori”...
After all, he did say “we.”

Japanese:
はっ！　どーでもいいっての！
とにかくよ　あたしたちのジャマする
ヤなヤツには　違いないじゃない！
English:
“We!?” Who cares! Anyways, that guy’s the
same as the other ones who’re after us!

Japanese:
ちょっとあんた　お腹痛くなった
フリして　カギ開けさせなさいよ！
入って来たところ　ブン殴ってやるから！
English:
Anyways, try pretending you have a bellyache. 
Then, when he comes in, we get his ass!

Japanese: やってみようかなと思う
English: Let’s try it

Japanese: たしなめる
English: Rebuke

Japanese: 代案を提示する
English: Think of another plan

Japanese:
やってみてもいいけど…
どうしよう？
どこが痛くなったことにする？
English:
Well, I don’t mind trying, but what kind 
of ache are we going with exactly?

Japanese:
どこって…
お腹って　言ったじゃないの
English:
What kind?
Didn’t I just say a bellyache?

Japanese:
でも　胃が痛いのか　腸が痛いのか
シクシク痛むのか　ズキズキ痛むのか
English:
Well, there’re different kinds of bellyaches. It could
come from the stomach or the intenstine, and the kind
of pain can vary from being long and dull or sudden...

Japanese:
そういうディテールで　演技が
ゼンゼン変わると　思うんだけど
English:
I think knowing those kinds of details will greatly
enhance the quality of the performance.

Japanese:
どーだっていいじゃない
そんなの！
English:
Huh?! That doesn’t even matter!
Who even cares about those things!?

Japanese:
ええ～？
よくないよぉ
English: No, it does matter!

Japanese: そんなの上手く　いくかなぁ？
English: Are you sure we can pull it off?

Japanese:
なんでよ？
上手くいくに　決まってんじゃん！
English:
Ain’t that obvious?
Of course, we can!

Japanese:
う～ん…
第一に　僕は演技なんてできない
第二に　カギを開けてくれる保障がない
English:
No... It’s not. First of all, I can’t act.
Second of all, we’re not even sure 
if he’ll open the door or not.

Japanese:
第三に　イリアが素手で彼らを
のしてしまえるなんて　思えない
以上　説明終わり　…これで納得してくれた？
English:
Last of all, I don’t even think you can take
him down with your bare hands. That’s all,
any questions?

Japanese:
あ～　もう！
グダグダうっさいっての！
男なら　ドーンとやりなさいよ！
English:
Blah, blah, blah, blah, blah! You’re 
too naggy! Just man up, and do it!

Japanese:
じゃあ　こういうのはどう？
イリアが　お腹痛くなったことにして
僕が慌てて　人を呼ぶの
English:
Then, what about this? You pretend to
have a bellyache and I scream for help.

Japanese:
はぁ？
反対になってんじゃない
English:
Isn’t that just the same but 
with our roles flipped?

Japanese:
だって　僕の演技力を前提にした
計画なんて　上手くいきっこないよ
イリアが　やったほうがいいって
English:
I don’t think I can pull off a convincing act.
I think it’s better if you do it instead.

Japanese:
あたしに　演技なんて
できるわけないじゃん！
English: As if I can act!

Japanese:
…じゃあ
腹痛の線は　諦めようよ
English: Then let’s just give up.

Japanese: グリゴリ兵
English: Grigori Soldier

Japanese:
おい！　やかましいぞ！
静かにせんか！
English: Hey, you’re too noisy! Shut up!

Japanese: やっぱ　とっちめてやる！
English: We really have to take him out!

Japanese:
ムリだよ
天術は封じられちゃったし
力だって　僕たちより強そうだもの…
English:
It’s impossible. Our Cielan Artes are
sealed and, in terms of physical
prowess, we’re not strong enough.

Japanese:
どういう人たちか　わからないけど
普通じゃないと思うな
English:
I don’t know about the others,
but I think they must be Reincarnators too.

Japanese:
クソ…ッ　天術が戻ったら
見てなさいよ！
あいつら　絶対泣かしてやる！
English:
Damn it! Just wait and see!
When I get my powers back,
I’ll make them pay!

Japanese:
イ…　イリア…　そういうのは
もっと小声で　お願いします
English: Illia, lower your voice, please!

Japanese: 同士！
English: Comrade!

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: よう　おまえ　名前は？
English: Hey, you, your name?

Japanese:
イリアよ
んで　なにか用？
English: Illia. What do you want?

Japanese:
いやさ　おまえとあのルカってヤツ
どういう関係か　気になってよォ
English:
Y’see I was just wondering what 
your relationship with that Ruca is.

Japanese:
おかしな勘ぐりは　やめてよね！
あんなの　ただの旅の連れなんだから
English:
I hope you’ll stop having weird thoughts 
coz Ruca’s just someone who 
happened to come along with me.

Japanese:
そのわりにゃあ
ずいぶん尻に敷いてる感じじゃねェ？
English:
The way you said it, sounds like you 
have him wrapped around your thumb.

Japanese:
…まあ嫌いってわけじゃないんだけど
ああいう　ウジウジしたタイプって
なーんか　いじりたくなるのよねぇ
English:
I don’t really hate him but, I gotta admit, I
just can’t help but tease shy-types like him.

Japanese:
おっ　それわかるぜ！
ありゃあ　生まれ付いての
パシり体質だよな
English:
Yoo, I totally feel you! It’s just like he was 
born to be a gopher or something, y’know?

Japanese:
へえ　良く見抜いたわね
もしかして　あたしたち
気が合うのかも
English:
Oooh, you sure got that fast!
Reckon we’ll get along?

Japanese: ああ　そうみたいだな
English: Seems so.

Japanese:
…でも　あんまり
ヒドイいじり方はしないでよ？
一応　手加減してあげてね
English:
Try not to tease him too much though. 
At least learn when to stop, okay?

Japanese:
おう　ああいう手合いは
キレるとヤバいからな
おまえも　手加減しろよ？
English:
Sure. I’m crap at these kinds of competitions,
so go easy on me too, okay?

Japanese:
オッケー
じゃあ　ふたりで念入りに
可愛がってあげましょうか
English:
That’s a deal then! Let’s give our little-sweetie-Ruca
lots of love and attention!

Japanese:
ああ　ジックリと念入りにな
ヒャハハハハ！
English:
Damn right, we should!
Bwahahahaha!

Japanese: 不穏な空気
English: A Disturbing Atmosphere

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: イリアと　なにを話してたの？
English: What were you talking about with Illia?

Japanese:
いや　別に？
ただ　これから仲良くしようって
話してただけだぜ
English:
Nothing much.
We’re just chatting and getting along.

Japanese:
で　でも…
なんだか楽しそうだったんだけど…
English: B-But you both look so happy together...

Japanese:
あ？
なんだよ　それがどーかしたか？
English:
What?
Got a problem with that?

Japanese: うらやましがる
English: Envy

Japanese: 平静を装う
English: Feign Calmness

Japanese:
…初対面なのに
あんなに楽しそうに　話せるなんて
なんだか　その…　なんていうか…
English:
It’s the first time you both met and suddenly 
you’re getting along so well... I’m... how do I put this...

Japanese:
一体　なにが言いてェんだよ！
ハッキリ言えよ　ああ？
English: What are you saying?! Speak up!

Japanese:
イ…　イリアと仲良くなって
どうする気なのかなぁって…
English:
I-I was wondering what I should do to
get along with her too...

Japanese:
な…　なんでもないよ？
イリアが…　誰と話をしようと
僕には関係ないもの
English:
Nothing... It’s nothing, alright?
Whoever Illia talks to is none of my business.

Japanese: なーんだよ　そりゃ？
English: What the heck’s up with you!?

Japanese:
も…　もういいよ
うん　イリアはいい子だよ
どんどん話をすればいいじゃないか…
English:
F-Fine, it’s nothing. Yeah... Illia’s a 
nice girl, why don’t you just keep 
chatting with her?

Japanese:
ははーん
なんだよ　おまえ
やきもちか？
English:
Haha, what?
You jealous or something?

Japanese:
そ…　そんな！
やきもちとか　そんなんじゃなくて…
いや　その…　僕は…
English:
No! N-Not at all!
It’s not like I was jealous or something...
It’s just... I...

Japanese:
おいおい！　心配すんなよ！
マジで挨拶しただけだって
English:
Hey, hey, don’t worry about it man!
We were just greeting each other.

Japanese: ホントに？
English: Really?

Japanese:
ああ
これから　ふたりとひとりで
仲良くやっていこうってさ
English:
Yep. I was just telling her that we should 
get along together with you.

Japanese:
ああ　よかった！
三人で仲良くやって
いければいいね！
English:
Oh... thank goodness!
I hope we get along well!

Japanese: ああ　ふたりとひとりでな！
English: Yep. Us and “you” that is.

Japanese:
う…　うん…
ふたりと…
うん？
English: Y-Yeah! Us and... huh?

Japanese: いい雰囲気じゃん？
English: Now Ain’t That a Nice Atmosphere?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
どうしたのよ　あんた
あの女と　ずいぶん
いい雰囲気だったみたいね？
English:
What’s up with you and that chick?
You both look like you got something going on.

Japanese:
そ…　そうかな？
おかしいな　僕　初対面の人
苦手なのになぁ…
English:
R-Really?
How weird, I’m not usually good at 
talking to people I don’t know.

Japanese:
ん～　横から見てて
なんていうか…
いわゆる　甘い空気？
English:
Well, from here it looked like you both have a...
what was that word again?
Good chemistry?

Japanese: へぇ…　そう見えた？
English: Oh... Really?

Japanese: うん　正直ムカツク
English: Yep. Honestly, it’s kinda annoying.

Japanese: へ？
English: Huh?

Japanese:
なーんか　あの女ヘンじゃない？
だって　あんた相手に
甘い雰囲気よ？
English:
Doesn’t that woman weird you out?
You both just met and suddenly you’re
getting along, you know?

Japanese: ヘコむ
English: Yield

Japanese: 言い返す
English: Talk Back

Japanese: 勝ち誇る
English: Boast

Japanese:
そ…　その言い方じゃ
僕に魅力がないみたいじゃないか…
English: The way you said it, it’s like I don’t have any charm...

Japanese:
まあ　そこまで言わないけどさ
でも　所詮あんた程度よ？
English:
Well, I’ll leave it at that. But, it’s “you” we’re 
talking about, y’know?

Japanese:
うわぁぁん！
もっと　ヒドイ言い方された！
English: Wow... that’s even meaner!

Japanese: も～　冗談だってばぁ
English: C’mon, y’know I’m joking.

Japanese:
そ…　そんな言い方ないだろ！
僕にだって…　その…
魅力がないわけじゃない！　はず…
English:
Hey, don’t talk to me like that!
I... uhh... It’s not like I don’t have any charm!
Right...?

Japanese:
じゃあ　逆に聞くけど
一体　あんたのどこに
そんな魅力があるのよ？
English:
Then, let me ask you a question. 
In what way are you charming?

Japanese:
体を寸刻みにして　ひとつ残らず
ひっくり返せば　ちょっとは
見つけられるかもしれないけどさ
English:
Reckon we’ll find something if we turn 
your whole body inside out?

Japanese:
僕って…
そこまで魅力ないの？
English: Am I really not charming?

Japanese:
も～　冗談よ～
ちょっとぐらいならあるんじゃない？
その魅力…　とやらが
English:
I’m kidding, I’m kidding.
You’re charming...
Kinda.

Japanese:
フフンだ
僕だって　見る人が見れば
結構　魅力あるんだよ
English:
Well, duh! Just one look at me and people
can immediately tell I’m charming!

Japanese:
ふ～ん
その見る人って　臆病で　ナマイキで
貧弱な部分には　目をつぶってるわけ？
English:
I see. So what you mean is that when people
look at you, they’re just ignoring that weak, 
impertinent, cowardly side you have?

Japanese: そ…　そんなの問題じゃないよ…
English: Th-That’s not the point...

Japanese:
そうねぇ
どーでもいいことよねぇ～
English:
Right then...
I’m sure NOBODY cares you’re a coward.

Japanese:
でも…　彼女
いい人に見えるけどなぁ
English: Still, she seems like a good person...

Japanese:
あんたからみれば
そうなんでしょうよ
English: To you, maybe.

Japanese: じゃあ　イリアから見ると？
English: Then how about you?

Japanese:
…………
なんだかムカツク
English:
For some reason, I find her... 
kinda annoying.

Japanese:
ふたりして　同じこと言ってる
女の子って難しいな…
English:
They both said the same thing...
Women sure are a mystery.

Japanese: 戦争怖い…
English: War Is Scary

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
ねぇ　聞いた？
ぼ…　僕ら戦場に送られるって…
English:
Hey, did you hear? Th-That guy just said 
that w-we’re going to get drafted...

Japanese: …そうね
English: Yeah.

Japanese: らしいな
English: Apparently.

Japanese:
ふ…　ふたりとも
どうして　そんなに冷静なの？
僕…　怖くて怖くて　仕方ないよ…
English:
H-How can you both be so calm about this?
I can’t help but tremble at the thought!

Japanese:
そりゃ
あたしだって　怖いけどさぁ
あんた見てると　逆に落ち着くのよねぇ
English:
Well, I’m also scared too, y’know. 
But looking at you made me feel 
somewhat calm.

Japanese:
そうそう
「お？　オレの代わりにビビッて
　くれてるぞ？」って感じだな
English:
Yeah, coz it feels like there’s someone 
out there being scared for me.

Japanese:
う…　うん
じゃあ　僕が怖がってるのも
役には立ってるんだね…
English:
So... it’s like me being scared 
is somewhat helpful...

Japanese:
そういうことだな
だから　もっと盛大に
怖がってくれよ！
English:
Exactly that! Be scared! As much
as you want, it’s gonna be fine!

Japanese: 指揮官、怖い…
English: The Commander’s Scary

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
なによっ！　あのおっさん！
ムカツク！
English: Ugh, that old man’s so annoying!

Japanese:
しぃ…　イリア！
聞こえちゃうよ…
English: Illia, shh! They’ll hear you...

Japanese:
まあ　新兵への態度なんて
あんなもんじゃねーの？
English:
Isn’t that just the typical attitude
towards new recruits?

Japanese:
…にしても　ムカツクわね
後ろから　こっそり
石投げてやろうかしら
English:
Still annoying. I should throw a 
rock at him some time.

Japanese:
やめようよ～　相手は軍人だよ？
きっと呼吸するように
僕らを　始末したりできるんだ…
English:
Stop! You’d be up against a soldier, you know? 
He can easily deal with us in an instant.

Japanese: そんなわけねェって
English: Yeah, right! hE CaN dEaL WiTh Us iN An InStAnT...

Japanese:
いや　そうだ
きっと　そうなんだぁ～…
English: No, I’m sure he can...

Japanese:
…じゃあ　とっとと諦めて
戦場で　華々しく戦死して
二階級特進しようぜ
English:
Then let’s give up, brilliantly die in 
battle, and get ourselves promoted.

Japanese:
うわぁあん…
そっちも　イヤだよぅ！
English: I don’t want that either!

Japanese: 戦場の恐怖
English: The Terror of the Battlefield

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
…なんだろう
イヤな匂いがするよ
English: What a horrible smell...

Japanese:
そうね
イヤ～な匂いね
English: You’re right... What a horrible smell.

Japanese:
この程度で
なに言ってんだよ
English: You better get used to it.

Japanese:
この先　火薬の匂いに　死骸の匂い
もっと　とんでもないもんの匂いが
テンコ盛りだぜ？
English:
The smell of corpses and gunpowder 
will just get worse the deeper you go in.

Japanese: 弱音をはく
English: Whine

Japanese: 現実逃避する
English: Change topic

Japanese:
ああ　もうイヤだ…
具合が悪くなったフリすれば
休ませて　もらえるかな？
English:
I don’t want this...
I wonder if they’d let me skip if I pretend I was sick?

Japanese:
そんなことしても
あの怖いおっさんに　どやされるのが
オチだぜ？
English:
If you do that, that scary old man’s gonna make
a smug face ya know?

Japanese:
じゃあ　死なない程度に
どこか撃ち抜いてあげようか？
English:
Then, why don’t I shoot you 
til you’re hanging by a thread?

Japanese:
うわわわわ！
弾のムダづかいは　良くないよ！
English: H-Hey, you shouldn’t waste bullets!

Japanese:
じゃ　オレが軽く斬ってやろうか？
大丈夫　殺しゃしねェよ
慣れてるからな！
English:
Then how about I give you some light cuts? 
It’ll be fine, you won’t die and you’ll 
get used to it anyway!

Japanese:
ごごごご…　ごめんなさい！
ちゃんと戦場に出ますから…
English: I-I-I’m sorry! I’ll go to war...

Japanese:
ああ…　いい天気だなぁ
流れる雲を眺めて　ボーッとしてたら
突然　戦争が終わったりしないかなぁ…
English:
How nice... I wonder if the war will end if I stare
at the clouds long enough.

Japanese:
そうねぇ
じゃあ　こういうのはどう？
English: Yeah... Then how about this?

Japanese:
あんた　今ここで　大ケガしなさいよ
そのあと　包帯まみれにされてベッドで
一生　天井の染みを数え続けるってのは？
English:
You get yourself hurt here and then spend the rest
of your life staring at the spots on the ceiling.

Japanese:
な…　なに？
その物騒な提案は！
English: What’s with that dangerous proposal!?

Japanese:
そうだな　心優しきルカくんには
戦場は　耐えられねェだろうよ
English:
You’re right. I bet our kind-hearted
Ruca can’t handle the battlefield.

Japanese:
これも情けだ
死なない程度に　痛めつけてやるよ
English:
That’s too bad. Then at least let me 
break your kneecaps.

Japanese:
あわわわ！
勘弁してよ～
English:
Ahhhh!
P-Please have mercy!

Japanese:
だったら　しゃんとしなさい
このいくじなし！
English: Then man up, you sissy!

Japanese: 根性ナシめ！
English: Loser!

Japanese:
そ…　そういう問題じゃないと
思うんだけど…
English: I don’t think that’s the problem here...

Japanese: マッタリと見物
English: A Savory Spectacle

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
なにあの女　マジ　ムカツク！
ルカのデレデレ顔
ひっぱたいてやろうかしら！
English:
What’s with that woman!? 
She really pisses me off! 
Maybe I should give Ruca’s face a good slap?

Japanese: まあまあ　落ち着けよ
English: Now, now, calm down.

Japanese:
な～によ！
また止めようっての？
English: What? You gonna stop me again?

Japanese:
まあ話　聞けよ
どうせなら　もっといいタイミングで
ふたりの仲　ジャマしようぜ
English:
Well, listen closely.
We’ll find a better time to 
mess with them both, anyway.

Japanese:
はぁ？
そんな理由で　あたしを止めてたの？
あんた　意地悪いわね
English:
Wait... Is that why you stopped me earlier?
Wow, you sure are sadistic.

Japanese:
おまえに言われたくねェよ
まあ　とにかくだ
どうせなら…　もっと楽しもうって話だ
English:
I don’t want to hear that from you.
Well, if anything, let’s enjoy it a bit more.

Japanese:
ふうん…
そういう理由なら納得ね
いひひひひひ…
English:
Hmmm... If that’s the case, then I agree.
Hihihihihi...

Japanese:
なんだよ　その笑い方
明らかに　悪人じゃねェか…
English:
What’s with that laugh?
You sound like a villain.

Japanese: チトセって
English: Chitose

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada
Sigh...

Japanese: あんた　何ぼんやりしてんのよ？
English: What’re you sighing about?

Japanese:
おいおい　イリア
それを聞くのは
ヤボってもんだぜ
English: Oh, Illia, you’re so tasteless.

Japanese:
去り行く背中を
見送って　ウットリするくらい
自由にさせてやれよ
English: Just let him see her off freely.

Japanese:
あ～ら　そうねぇ～
気が利かなくて
ごめん　あそばせ～
English: Oh my. You’re right! Pardon me, I didn’t notice.

Japanese:
どうしたの？
…なんだかヘンだよ　ふたりとも
English:
You’re both acting weird, guys... 
What’s wrong?

Japanese:
ヘンなのは
あんたの方じゃなくて～？
English: Aren’t you the weird one?

Japanese: 言い返す
English: Talk back

Japanese: あしらう
English: Brush off

Japanese: 困る
English: Be troubled

Japanese:
いちいち　僕に突っかかってこなくても
いいじゃないか
ちょっと放っといて　欲しかったな
English:
You’re always nitpicking EVERY. SINGLE. THING. I do. 
Can’t you just leave me alone for once?

Japanese:
なによ！
どうせ　あの女のこと考えてたんでしょ
考えごと　ジャマされたくないってわけ？
English:
What? You’re just thinking about that woman anyways. 
Are you saying that I shouldn’t disturb you while
you think about her!?

Japanese:
そういうわけじゃないけど
イリア　なんだか怒ってるし
話したりしない方がいいかなって…
English:
It’s not that but, why are you angry, Illia?
Maybe I should just drop it...

Japanese:
怒ってないっての！
まったく　もう！
English: I’m not angry for crying out loud!

Japanese: 怒ってるじゃないか…
English: You sound angry though...

Japanese:
ヘン…　かな？
そうかもしれないね
English:
Am I weird...?
Maybe I am...

Japanese:
まあ　ヘンにもなるわな
あのチトセって女
なかなか　イイ女だもんなぁ
English: Well, weird or not, that Chitose chick is kinda hot.

Japanese:
うん　そうだよね…
い…　いや！
そうじゃなくて！
English:
Yeah, she is...
Wait-- No!
That’s not what I mean!

Japanese: だってよ　イリア？
English: So he says, Illia.

Japanese:
あ～ら
ご趣味の悪いことですわねぇ～
English:
I see～
My, what bad taste you have～.

Japanese:
あ…　いや…　その…
まいったなあ
English:
Oh... no, that’s not...
Sigh... Oh well...

Japanese:
そんなに　あの女のこと
気になるわけ？
English: Are you really that curious about that woman?

Japanese:
…どうだろう
そういうんじゃない気がする
English: I wonder... I don’t think it’s that.

Japanese:
あの程度の女じゃ
気にもならねェってか？
ゼイタク　言ってんじゃねェよ
English:
What, so you’re not into that kind of woman?
Don’t tell me you’re into the luxurious type.

Japanese:
そういう目では　見てないってば
どうして　ああいう態度で
僕に接してくるのか　不思議に思っただけ
English:
Hey, don’t look at me like that.
I was just wondering why she treats me that way.

Japanese:
そうそう　絶対ヘンだって
きっとなにか企んでる！　はず！
English:
That’s really weird!
She’s definitely planning something!

Japanese:
そうやって　決め付けるのも
ヘンだろ
English: If you’re gonna focus on that then it’s definitely weird!

Japanese:
でも　なんだろう
この感じ…
English: But I wonder what this feeling is...

Japanese: 恋ってヤツじゃねェの？
English: Isn’t it love?

Japanese:
はぁ…
恋…　でございますか～？
English: Well, is that not “love?”

Japanese:
…そういうんじゃなくて
あの人と話をしてると　なんだか
後ろめたいっていうか　落ち着かないんだ
English:
I don’t think that’s it...
For some reason, I couldn’t help but 
feel guilty when I talked to her.

Japanese: そりゃ　おめェ　恋だな
English: Then that’s definitely “love.”

Japanese:
そりゃ
恋じゃございませんこと～？
English: Then, are YOU in “love?”

Japanese: 恋…　なのかなぁ…
English: Is it... “love”...?

Japanese:
そこは否定しなさいよ！
もう！
English: For goodness sake, just DENY IT!

Japanese: 説得上手
English: Persuasiveness

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
スパーダ
あんた　説得上手ねぇ
English: You sure are persuasive, Spada.

Japanese:
そうでもねェよ
いつも　言い聞かされてたからな
たまには言う側に　回ってみたかったんだ
English:
That’s not it. I always get told off so I just 
wanted to do it myself this time.

Japanese:
ふうん？
あんたにも　親身になって
お説教してくれる人がいたのね
English:
So you tend to give sermons to people 
you’re close to, huh?

Japanese: ん…　ああ　まあな
English: I guess.

Japanese: 「で？」って　なんだよ？
English: What?

Japanese:
この後は　あんたの身の上話に
展開すんじゃないの？
English: So after this you’re gonna tell us your life story next?

Japanese:
残念だったな
オレのガキの頃の話なんて
つまんねェもんさ
English: Unfortunately, my childhood is a bit boring.

Japanese:
そんなの聞いてみないと
わからないじゃないの
English: Well, we won’t know until we hear it.

Japanese:
まあ　そういう話は　そのうちにな
ルカが　せっかくやる気出したんだ
おまえも　油断すんなよ
English:
I’ll leave that talk for later since Ruca’s already
motivated. You should keep your guard up too.

Japanese:
ちぇ　はぐらかしやがった　つまんないの
どうも　スパーダのヤツ
なにやら　秘密がありそうねぇ
English:
Tch. He dodged the question.
Spada’s hiding something.

Japanese: スパーダの笑い方
English: Spada’s Laughter

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ヒャーハッハッハッハ！
English: HA--HA HA HA HA!

Japanese:
スパーダの笑い方
ときどき　ヘンだな　しかし
English:
You know, Spada laugh is 
sometimes weird though.

Japanese:
そ…　そうかな？
笑い方も個性じゃないかなぁ
English: I-Is it? Isn’t it just unique?

Japanese:
なんだよ
そのいかにもな　優等生的発言はよ
English: What’s with that model student remark?

Japanese:
コーダ　そんな笑い方
あまり聞かないぞ　しかし
English: Coda doesn’t hear that laugh often, though.

Japanese:
ああ？　じゃあ　おまえは
どんな笑い方するんだよ？
English: Huhhh? Then how do YOU laugh?

Japanese:
コーダは　あれだ
うまいメシ　想像すると　こう笑う
English:
Coda laughs like this when he 
thinks about tasty food.

Japanese:
ぬふふ…
ぬふふふふふ…
ぬふふふふふ！
English:
Mmmfufu...
Mmmfufufufufu...
Mmmfufufufufu!

Japanese:
おまえだって　十分ヘンだよ！
よく飼い主に　気味悪がられなかったな
English:
That’s really weird! I’m surprised 
you haven’t creeped Illia out yet!

Japanese:
イリアな
イリアの笑い方は　ステキだぞ　しかし
おーい　イリア！
English:
Illia? Oh, Illia’s laugh is amazing though!
Hey, Illia!

Japanese:
なに？　あんたが呼んでるって
コーダが言ってたけど
English: What? Coda said you were looking for me.

Japanese:
…えーっとだな　ルカのヤツが
面白い冗談を　思いついたらしいぜ？
English:
Uhh... Ruca has this 
really funny joke!

Japanese:
うわっ！
どうして　僕に振るのさ…
しかも　そんなヒドいフリ…
English:
Hey, why me...?
And at something I’m bad at too!

Japanese:
へえ　珍しいじゃない
んじゃ　聞いてあげよっかな
English: Now ain’t that rare. Let’s hear it.

Japanese:
ええ～？　う～んう～ん　じゃあ…
…………
ネコがネコろんだ？
English:
Huh? Hm... Then... “I bought a boat 
because it was for sail?”

Japanese:
………………
はぁ　なによそれ？
それが面白いとでも　思ってんの！？
English: What? Did you really think that was funny?

Japanese:
ヒャーッハッハッハ！
つまんね～！
こりゃ　罰ゲームだな！
English:
Gyahahaha! LAME!
A penalty game it is!

Japanese:
そんなぁ
ムチャクチャだよぉ…
English: This is absurd...

Japanese:
わざわざ呼びつけて　聞かされたのが
そんな　つまんない冗談じゃ
とーぜんね！
English:
You call me over here, just to 
tell me that lame ass joke.
That’s just natural!

Japanese:
いひひひひひ…　さあて！
罰ゲームに　なにやらせようかな！
いひひひひひ…
English:
Hihihihi. Now, what should we make you do...?
Hihihihi～

Japanese:
ああ…
この笑い方か…
English: Oh... Her laugh’s...

Japanese:
なんとかは
飼い主に似るってヤツだね…
English: ...Just the same as Coda’s.

Japanese: 火事？
English: A Fire?

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
こんな森の中で　火事？
大惨事になるじゃない！
English:
A fire in the middle of a forest? 
That’s totally bound to become a disaster!

Japanese:
これって敵の策略じゃないの？
火計ってヤツ
English:
Isn’t this an enemy tactic?
The work of an arsonist?

Japanese:
なんか焼けてるなー
匂ってくるぞ　しかし
English: Coda can smell something burning though.

Japanese: う…　気分が悪くなりそう…
English: I-I’m gonna feel sick...

Japanese:
オーブンの前にいると　イイ匂いが
ただよって来るのになー
全然違うな　しかし
English:
It smells completely different compared
to the smell from an oven though...

Japanese:
緊張感のない会話してんじゃねーよ！
オラ！　状況確認しに
さっさと　陣地に戻るぞ！
English:
This is not the time for this kind of conversation! 
Let’s hurry and go confirm the situation back at camp!

Japanese: 役目は果たせたのか？
English: Did You Manage to Accomplish Your Job?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
ねえ　リカルドさん
西の戦場では　指揮官の暗殺が
仕事だったんだよね？　成功したの？
English:
Ricardo, you had an assassination
job back at the Western Front, right?
Was it a success?

Japanese:
…残念ながら　とどめは刺せなかった
ハスタの乱入さえなければ
可能だったんだがな
English:
Unfortunately, I wasn’t able to land the final
blow on him. If Hasta hadn’t interrupted me,
I would’ve been able to.

Japanese:
言い訳かよぉ
カッコ悪ぃな
English: Hah! Lame!

Japanese:
俺を非難していいのは　依頼主だけだ
それに王都軍の敗走は　俺の手柄だからな
仕事は　キチンと終えたさ
English:
Only my client can criticize me.
Besides, since I caused trouble for the Imperial Army,
I’d say the job was a success.

Japanese: なぐさめる
English: Comfort

Japanese: 話題を変えてみる
English: Change Topic

Japanese:
残念だったね
暗殺失敗しちゃって…
English: How unfortunate...

Japanese:
特別　残念だとは　思ってはいない
人を　ハスタみたいに言うな
English:
It’s not something worth being sad about. 
Don’t compare me to someone like Hasta.

Japanese:
でも　得意なんだろ
暗殺？
English: Isn’t assassination your forte though?

Japanese: まあな
English: Pretty much.

Japanese:
でも　あの指揮官さん
殺されなくて　良かったよ
English:
Still, it’s a relief that you weren’t
able to kill the commander.

Japanese:
おまえ　あんなにビビッてたじゃねーか
あのおっさんのこと
嫌いだったんじゃねェの？
English:
Are ya stupid or something?
Didn’t you hate that old man?

Japanese:
イリアは　嫌ってたけど
僕は　そうでもなかったよ
ちょっとは　怖かったけどさ
English:
Illia hated him, but I didn’t really.
He was scary, though.

Japanese:
どんな人物だろうと
俺にとって敵ならば　殺さねばならん
戦場とは　そういう場所さ
English:
Whoever it might be, as long as they’re my enemy,
I will have to kill them. That’s the kind of place 
a battlefield is.

Japanese:
そういえば　前世でも
僕を暗殺しに来たんだよね
English:
On that topic, you also came to
assassinate me in our past lives, right?

Japanese: 返り討ちだったけどな
English: And failed.

Japanese:
言われてみれば　確かに若い頃から
狙撃や待ち伏せに　興味があったな
前世の影響かもしれん
English:
Now that you mentioned it, I’ve had an
interest in assassination since I was a child.
It might’ve been because of my past self.

Japanese:
じゃ　今の傭兵リカルドがあるのは
僕のおかげってこと？
English:
Then does that mean that you’re
now a mercenary because of me?

Japanese:
フン　バカを言え　狙撃も待ち伏せも
傭兵として　当然の訓練だ
前世など関係なく　今の腕にはなってたさ
English:
Don’t say stupid things. That’s just the training that
comes with being a mercenary. My past life has
nothing to do with my skill today.

Japanese:
まあいいや　頼りにしてるぜ
次なんかあったときは
失敗しねェでくれよ
English:
Well, whatever.
I’ll count on you not to fail next time.

Japanese:
いずれ　俺の本当の腕前を
見せてやるさ
English: Someday I’ll show you my true skill.

Japanese: 前世で敵だったのに…
English: Even When We Were Enemies in the Past...

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
あの傭兵　前世では敵だったのに
襲い掛かって　来なかったな
English:
That mercenary earlier was our enemy in the past but 
he didn’t swoop down on us the moment he saw us.

Japanese:
そーね
ああいう人もいるのね
English: Yeah, so there are those kinds of people out there...

Japanese:
話してわかる人で　良かったね
次に会ったら
もっと話してみようよ
English:
I’m glad we were able to talk to him. I hope the next 
time we meet, we’d be able to hear him out a bit more.

Japanese:
ああ？　傭兵相手にか？
あのヤバ気な雰囲気は
戦場以外じゃ　生きていけねェタイプだぞ
English:
That mercenary? Those guys are the dangerous type 
that can only live on the battlefield y’know.

Japanese:
…ってことは　戦場に行かないと
会えないのよ？
あんた　また戦場で戦うつもりなの？
English:
That means that we won’t be able to meet him outside 
the battlefield. Do you want to go back to the frontlines 
again?

Japanese:
う…　う～ん
諦めるよ…
English: N-No.

Japanese: まあ　しょうがねェよな
English: Welp, can’t be helped.

Japanese:
死神ヒュプノス…
また会いたいな
会えたら…　ちゃんと謝りたい…
English:
Hypnos... I want to meet him again. And if I do... 
I want to apologize to him properly...

Japanese: ずいぶん嬉しそうだな
English: You Sure Are Happy

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: いひひひひ…
English: Hihihi...

Japanese: ずいぶん　嬉しそうだな
English: You sure are happy.

Japanese:
そりゃ　そーよ！
あのチトセとかいう女が
あたしの前から　消えてくれたんだもん
English:
Well of course! That Chito-whoever woman finally 
disappeared from my sight.

Japanese:
その嬉しそうな様子を
ルカの前でも　隠そうとしない
おまえって　スゲェよ
English:
And you’re not even bothering 
to hide it from Ruca. Very cool...

Japanese:
でしょ～？
いひひひひひ！
English: Ain’t I? Heeheeheehee!

Japanese:
誉めてねェよ…
皮肉も　通じねェなんて
よっぽど　嬉しいんだな…
English:
I wasn’t praising you. She must be pretty
happy if sarcasm isn’t getting through to her.

Japanese: チトセもくればよかったのに
English: It Sure Would Be Nice if Chitose Came Along

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: はぁ…
English: Sigh...

Japanese:
なに落ち込んでんだよ
そんなに　あのチトセって女
気に入ってたのか？
English:
What are you so depressed for? 
Are you really that into Chitose?

Japanese:
そんなつもりはないけど
でも　いなくなると寂しいなぁ
English:
Well, not really... but since she’s gone now, 
I’m kind of lonely.

Japanese:
でもよ　あの女
絶対イリアと
仲良くできなかったろうな
English: You know that she and Illia definitely won’t get along.

Japanese:
…転生者に会って　情報を集めるって
言い出したのは　イリアなんだからさぁ
仲良くしてくれればいいのに
English:
It sure would be nice if they did get along since Illia’s 
the one who proposed that we gather information 
about Reincarnators in the first place.

Japanese: それ　イリア本人に言ってみれば？
English: Then why don’t you tell her that?

Japanese:
と…　とんでもない！
そんなこと言ったら
なにされるか…
English:
A-Absolutely not! 
If I told her that, who knows what she’ll--

Japanese: だったら　諦めるしかねェな
English: Then give up.

Japanese:
そうだねぇ
はぁ…
English: Yeah... Sigh...

Japanese: 帰りたい
English: I Want to Go Home

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: はぁ…　帰りたいなぁ…
English: Sigh... I want to go home...

Japanese:
どした　ルカ？
元気ないな　しかし
English: What’s up, Ruca? You look down.

Japanese:
ああ　うん…
コーダは
お家のこと　気になったりしない？
English: Oh, nothing... Coda, don’t you miss your home?

Japanese:
お家？
オウチって　アレだな？
メシが食えるとこだな　しかし
English: My home? Is it that place where you can eat?

Japanese: まあそう…　かな
English: I guess... it is.

Japanese:
ぬふふふふ
ルカは　食いしん坊だな！
そんな　メシが気になるのか　しかし
English:
Mmmfufufufufu～
So Ruca’s also a gourmand! 
Are you curious about what Coda eats there though?

Japanese:
い…　いや
そういうわけじゃ…
English: N-No... I don’t--

Japanese:
大丈夫だぞ　しかし！
メシはイリアに頼んで
しっかり　用意してもらおうな　しかし
English:
That’s alright! If we just ask Illia, she’ll prepare us 
some food though!

Japanese:
…はぁ　コーダなんかに
話を聞いてもらおうとした
僕がバカだったよ…
English:
Sigh... How foolish of me to think that 
I could ask Coda for advice...

Japanese: 元気ないルカ
English: Dejected Ruca

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia
Sigh...

Japanese: わあっ！！
English: Boo!

Japanese:
………ああ
なんだ　イリアか…
English: ...Oh, Illia, what’s up?

Japanese:
テンション低ッ！！
ちょっと　どうしちゃったのよ？
English: You didn’t even flinch! What’s the matter?

Japanese:
ん…　なんでもないよ
アハハハハ…
English: It’s nothing... ha... haha...

Japanese:
そんな　いかにも構って欲し気な
物言いじゃ
説得力ないってば！
English:
Hey, that weak response makes it sound like it’s a 
big deal.

Japanese: なんでもないフリをする
English: Pretend it was nothing

Japanese: ごまかす
English: Dodge the question

Japanese:
いや　本当になんでもないんだ
心配かけて　ごめんね？
English: It really is nothing. Sorry for making you worry.

Japanese:
しつこい女って　思われたくないから
あんまり言うつもりないけどさ
…でも　ホントに大丈夫？
English:
Hey, I don’t want to come off as the stubborn type,
but... are you sure you’re all right?

Japanese:
う…　うん
なんだか元気出てきちゃった！
…かな？
English: O-Okay! I’m alright now! ...maybe?

Japanese:
こ…　ここのところ
あんまり眠れなくて…
ちょっと体が　ダルいかなぁ
English: I-I shouldn’t fall asleep here... I feel kind of sluggish.

Japanese:
ふ～ん？　ルカって枕が変わると
寝られないタイプでしょ？
なんか　そんな感じだもん
English:
Are you the type that can’t fall asleep without a pillow? 
You seem like that type?

Japanese: 別にそんなわけじゃ…
English: It’s not like--

Japanese:
これだから　神経質なヤツって
イヤなのよね～
English: This is why I don’t like fussy people...

Japanese:
とりあえず　たっぷり食べて
たっぷり運動しましょ！
English: Anyways, you gotta eat and exercise a lot!

Japanese:
ルカって　見るからに食が細くて
運動苦手っぽいもん
English: After all, you look so frail and thin.

Japanese:
確かに　そういうの
苦手だなぁ…
English: I guess I do look like that, huh...

Japanese:
まあまあ　細かいことは気にしない！
サッパリと　生きて
サッパリと　死にましょ！
English:
Hey, don’t worry about it. Live life to the 
fullest and die feeling refreshed!

Japanese:
うん…　そうだね…
って　死ぬのは　イヤだよ！
English: Y-You’re right! Wait, I don’t want to die yet!

Japanese: ナーオスに来て
English: Arrival at Naohs

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
やっぱり　前線が遠いからか
ずいぶん　穏やかな雰囲気じゃない？
ここって
English:
It sure is peaceful. Maybe it’s coz the 
battlefield’s far from here?

Japanese:
そうだな！
きっと　うまいメシがあるはずだな
しかし！
English:
You’re right though!
I’m sure there’s some tasty food here!

Japanese:
のどかで　いい感じじゃねーか
ルカのヤツ　疲れてるみてェだし
ゆっくりさせてやりてェな
English:
The peacefulness here’s pretty nice.
Let’s take it easy here for a while, 
especially since Ruca seems tired.

Japanese:
そーね
でも　転生者をまず見つけないと
適当に町を　歩いてみない？
English:
Right, since we’re looking for a Reincarnator, 
we might as well just wander around town.

Japanese:
適当ねェ
まあ　しょうがねェか…
English: “Wander”, huh? Can’t be helped.

Japanese:
わぁい　コーダ
うまいメシ探すぞ　しかし！
English: Yay! Coda’s gonna look for some tasty food though!

Japanese: こう見えて村長の娘
English: A Village Chief’s Daughter

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
なあ　イリア
おまえ　ホントに村長の娘なわけ？
English: So, Illia, are you really a village chief’s daughter?

Japanese:
そうだけど　なによ　その言い方
文句ある？
English: Yeah, that’s right. Got a problem with that?

Japanese:
そういえば　イリアって
南西部出身だったよね
English: Oh yeah... you came from the southwest right?

Japanese:
南西部は　銃が一般にも
普及してるって　聞いたけど
English: I’ve heard that guns are quite popular there.

Japanese:
ガンマンの本場出身かぁ
どうりで…
なんか納得だな
English: Makes sense.

Japanese:
納得しないでよ！
どうせ無学で　礼儀知らずだって
思ってんでしょ？
English:
No it doesn’t “make sense!” 
You think I’m this rude, uncivilized person, don’t you?!

Japanese:
そんなことないよ　レグヌムじゃ
銃なんて珍しいし　しかも女性ガンマンだもの
南西部出身なら　納得だってことだよ
English:
That’s not it. It’s not common to see 
guns in the capital, let alone a 
female gunman from the southwest.

Japanese: だったら　いいけどさ
English: Then fine...

Japanese:
…………
まあ　そういうことにしとくか…
English:
...
Well, let’s just leave it at that...

Japanese: 五箇条の解説
English: The Five Pillars of Chivalry

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
「心に剣を持ち　誰かの楯となれ」
「右手に規律を　左手に誇りを」
「己を殺し　永久の礎にせよ」
English:
Rest thine heart unto thy blade to become a shield for 
others. Upon thy right hand lay order and on thy left, 
pride. Slay thyself and be reborn...

Japanese:
「正しき道を　正しく歩め」
「個よりも　全に仕えよ」か…
English:
...as an exemplar of which the needs of others are 
foremost. As thou tread upon the path of the righteous.

Japanese:
それって　ハルトマンさんと言ってた
士道訓ってヤツだよね？
English:
Is that the Five Pillars of Chivalry that 
Mr. Hartman mentioned?

Japanese:
ああ　騎士の心得だ
オレが　棒切れを剣代わりに振り回すより前に
叩き込まれた言葉さ
English:
Right. It’s the Knight’s Creed. I had to learn it by heart
before I was allowed to wield a wooden sword.

Japanese:
それぞれが生き様　規範　自己犠牲
正義　それに忠誠心を
表しているのかな？
English:
And the pillars must be conduct, setting an example, 
self-sacrifice, justice, and loyalty.

Japanese:
うへぇ…
よくチョロっと聞いただけで　わかるなぁ
English: Sheesh, you sure got that instantly.

Japanese:
オレなんて
毎日　何百回と暗唱させられて
ようやく意味が　わかったのによ
English:
I had to recite that a hundred times every day before 
I finally got what it meant.

Japanese:
意味は
教えてもらえなかったの？
English: They didn’t tell you what they were?

Japanese:
ああ　こういうのは生活の中で
会得していくもんなんだってよ
礼儀作法とかも　教えてもらえなかったしな
English:
Nah, they said that it’s so that I’d be able to 
implement it in how I live. They didn’t even
teach me etiquette.

Japanese:
人は立場によって
自然と礼儀を　身につけるもんだってさ
English: They said I’ll just know what to do in front of others.

Japanese:
へえ
そういう　考え方ってステキだね
English:
Ohh...
That is also a quite splendid way of thinking.

Japanese:
兄貴が　何人もいたから
オレを　しつけるのが
面倒だっただけじゃねェのかなぁ
English:
I have a lot of brothers, see, 
so maybe it just became a bother to teach it to me.

Japanese: 一応　否定する
English: Roughly deny

Japanese: 笑ってごまかす
English: Laugh it off

Japanese:
そ…　そんなこと…ない…んじゃ
ない…かな？
たぶん…
English:
I-I’m sure... that’s not the case? 
Maybe...

Japanese:
なんだよ
その聞く者に　不安を抱かせる
煮え切らねェ　返答っぷりはよ
English: What’s with that half-hearted, worry-filled answer?

Japanese:
まあ　でも
そんな風に　言ってくれたのは
おまえが　初めてだぜ
English: That said, you’re the first one to tell me that.

Japanese: あはは　そんなことないよ
English: Haha... That’s not true.

Japanese:
そうでもねェさ
だって　兄貴が６人もいたんだぜ？
English: Course it is! I have six brothers, after all!

Japanese:
あはは…　は？　６人？
さすが　貴族の名家だね
だったら　仕方ない…かなぁ
English:
Haha... what... Six?
As expected of a noble family...
If that’s the case, it can’t be helped, I guess.

Japanese: 仕方ねェよなぁ～
English: I know, right...

Japanese:
でも　スパーダって
ただの不良じゃなかったんだね
English: Still, to think you’re not just some delinquent.

Japanese:
なに言ってんだ　おまえ？
なめてんのか　ああ！？
English: What’re you saying? Ya makin’ fun of me, huh!?

Japanese: ひぃ…
English: N-No!!

Japanese:
そんなビビんなよ！
冗談だって　じょーだん！
English:
Hey, hey, I was kidding.
Don’t get scared now!

Japanese:
やっぱ　不良だなぁ
この人…
English: This guy really is a delinquent...

Japanese: ルカ、根性見せる
English: Show Your Guts, Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
ルカのヤツ　言いやがったな
へ…　男を見せやがって
English:
Oooh that Ruca’s said some fine words!
He sure showed me who the man is.

Japanese: どうせ　あんなの一瞬よ！
English: At any rate, that’s just a one-time thing!

Japanese:
そーだ！
ルカは臆病者だぞ？　しかし
English:
Coda agrees!
That Ruca’s supposed to be a coward though?

Japanese:
臆病者なもんかよ
あそこまで　タンカ切るのに
どんだけ　勇気がいると思ってんだ
English:
Coward? Heck nah.
It takes a lot of courage to say 
something like that, y’know.

Japanese: そ…　それは…
English: Th-That’s...

Japanese:
あのヘタレなルカが　おまえのために
頑張るって　言ってんだぜ？
そんな言い方ねェだろうがよ
English:
You know that string bean is giving
it his all for you, right? Ain’t it wrong
to treat him that way?

Japanese:
そーだ　イリア
そんな言い方はダメだぞ　しかし
English:
Spada’s right, Illia!
You shouldn’t treat him that way though!

Japanese:
そ…　そんなのわかってるって
ちょっと　言ってみただけじゃない
English:
I-I know that!
I’m just saying, y’know...

Japanese:
そうか？
だったら　いいけどよ
English:
That so?
Then that’s fine.

Japanese: うん　いいけどな　しかし
English: That’s fine though.

Japanese:
…なによ　スパーダのヤツ
ルカのこと　良くわかったフリしてさ
English:
Who does he think he is, 
acting like he knows Ruca?

Japanese:
あたしの方が　あいつとの
付き合いは　長いんだから…
English: Ruca’s been together with me longer than him!

Japanese: やっぱスパーダって…
English: Spada Really Is...

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
どうかしたの？　おたんこルカ
顔色悪いけど…
English: What’s wrong, you dummy? You look kinda pale.

Japanese:
うん…　いや…　あのさぁ
スパーダって　やっぱり怖いなぁって
English:
Oh... nothing... I was just thinking that Spada’s 
really scary.

Japanese:
そうだ　ルカ
スパーダは不良だぞ　しかし
English: That’s true, Ruca. Spada’s a delinquent though.

Japanese:
まったくよ
どうすれば　あんなに
ガラ悪く　振舞えるのかしら
English:
Sheesh. At any rate, maybe he just acts that way 
coz that’s just how he is.

Japanese:
ち…　違うよ
そういう怖さじゃなくって
責任感が強いっていうか…
English:
N-No, that’s wrong. He’s not scary that way, 
it’s because he has this strong sense of responsibility...

Japanese: はぁ？　あいつが？
English: That guy?

Japanese:
んー
あいつがか　しかし？
English: Yeah, that guy?

Japanese:
ああいうタイプの人って
責任感が　強いからこそ
相手にも　同じものを求めるんだ
English:
People with a strong sense of responsibility 
are the type to expect the same things 
from their companions.

Japanese:
スパーダを　前に
無責任なことしてたら
男として　認めてもらえないよ
English:
Spada will never acknowledge someone irresponsible 
as a man.

Japanese: そういうもんなの？
English: Is that so?

Japanese: スパーダを語る
English: Talk about Spada

Japanese: 男を語る
English: Talk about men

Japanese:
イリアも　そのうちわかるよ
スパーダは
仲間のために　生きる人
English:
I’m sure you get it, Illia. Spada’s the type to live for 
his allies.

Japanese:
だから　仲間の和を乱すことは
絶対に許さない…
その代わり　すごく信頼できると思うよ
English:
That’s why he will never forgive anyone that tries to 
harm his friends... In exchange, he is really reliable.

Japanese:
ふ～ん…
確かに　そうかもね
English: Ohh... that might be the case.

Japanese:
女の子には　わかんないかもね
「男」として　なにかを守ろうとする姿勢
スパーダは　仲間のために生きる人
English:
Maybe girls can’t understand. 
You see, us guys have to protect 
something and Spada lives to protect his friends.

Japanese:
だから　仲間の和を乱すことは
絶対に許さない…
その代わり　すごく信頼できると思うよ
English:
That’s why he will never forgive anyone that tries to 
harm his friends... In exchange, he is really reliable.

Japanese:
そうかもしんないけどさぁ…
「男」とか言われても
あたしには　わかんないって
English:
That might be the case but... 
I didn’t really get what you meant.

Japanese:
とにかく　僕は口だけの
人間じゃないってこと
スパーダに　見せないと…
English:
Anyways, my point is that Spada will only show that 
side of himself to his friends...

Japanese:
じゃあ　あたしも
ちょっとは　期待させて
もらおうかな
English: Then I’ll look forward to that.

Japanese:
ん～　よし　ルカ
コーダも　見てるぞ　しかし
English: Coda will too though!

Japanese:
珍しくアツくなってんじゃん
…なんかいいなぁ
男同士って
English: How passionate... boys will be boys.

Japanese: 聖女ってどんな人？
English: What Kind of Person Is the Holy Maiden?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
聖女って
どんな人だと思う？
English: I wonder what kinda person this Saintess is?

Japanese:
きっと　優しい人だと思うな
それでいて　神々しいくらいの美人で
僕を見下すような目で　見ない人だよ
English:
I’m sure she’s going to be nice. And I’m sure she’s 
going to be really pretty and won’t boss me around.

Japanese:
なによ　それ…
あんた　なんか　あたしたちに
言いたいことでもあるの？
English: Is there something you wanna tell us, Ruca?

Japanese:
でもまあ　若くても　美人とは限らねェよな
そもそも　シワくちゃの
バアさんかもしれねェぜ？
English:
Y’know, we don’t know whether she’s gonna be 
youthful and pretty. For all we know, she could 
also be a wrinkly grandma.

Japanese:
確かに「聖少女」とか「聖熟女」とか
言わないあたりに
年齢への配慮が　感じられるもんね
English:
That’s right. They never specified whether she’s a 
little girl or a mature woman.

Japanese: それは　考えすぎだと思うけど…
English: I think that you’re overthinking this...

Japanese:
まあ　とにかく
行ってみれば　わかるさ
早く確かめるためにも　先を急ごうよ
English:
Anyway, we will know when we finally meet her. 
Let us make haste before it is too late.

Japanese: 許せない
English: Unforgivable

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
…許せない
転生者だからって
あんなヒドイ目に…
English:
Unforgivable... 
To be treated that way...
Just because they’re Reincarnators...!

Japanese:
まったくよ！
あたしたち　なんにも
悪いことしてないっての！
English:
Damn right!
We’re not really even doing anything wrong!

Japanese:
う～ん…
この力でケンカに　明け暮れてたのは
きっと　悪いことだよなぁ…
English:
Hm...
(But I think using this power to fight is just wrong...)

Japanese:
ねえ　そうよね
スパーダ？
English: Right, Spada?

Japanese:
あ…　ああ！　ああ！
もちろん　そう思うぜ？
悪いことは　ダメだよな！　な！
English: Oh! uh... of course! Bad things are forbidden! Yeah!

Japanese:
うん？
どうしたのさ
そんなに慌てて？
English: Why are you suddenly so flustered?

Japanese:
な…
なんでもねェよ！
English: N-Nothing!

Japanese: 逃走中だってば！
English: On the Run

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
そういえば　皆さんのこと
まだ　詳しく
教えてもらってませんでしたよね？
English:
Oh right... I believe I have 
yet to be introduced to everyone.

Japanese:
ああ　そうだったね
えーっと　僕は…
English: Oh yeah... I’m--

Japanese:
今は　そんな
悠長な話をしてる場合じゃないよ
English: Now is not the time for that!

Japanese:
そ…　そうよ！
早く逃げない…
エフッ　ゲホッゲホッ…
English:
Th-That’s right!
We should hurry and-- *cough*

Japanese: あら　大丈夫？
English: Oh my, are you all right?

Japanese:
慌てて
怒鳴ったりするからだよ
English:
It’s because you started screaming 
while sprinting.

Japanese:
うるっさいわね！
あたしは　あんたたちみたいに
ノンキじゃないだけ！
English:
Shut up, you!
I’m not as carefree as you guys!

Japanese:
まあ　とにかく話は
ここから　逃げ出してからにしようよ
English:
Anyway, let us leave the introductions for
after we have managed to escape from here.

Japanese:
そういうこと！
ほら　急ぐわよ！
English:
Exactly.
Hurry, let’s get movin’!

Japanese: アレってなんだったの？
English: What Was That Just Now?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
そーいえばさぁ
アンジュが入ってた　あのデッカイ
乗り物って　一体なんなの？
English:
Say, what was that huge thing
Ange was in a while ago?

Japanese:
ああ　あれね
「ギガンテス」って呼ばれてたかな
English: Oh... Those are called “Gigantes.”

Japanese:
ギガンテスって　聞き覚えがあるよ
伝説に出てきた　巨人の名前だったっけ？
English:
Gigantes... I believe those were what the
giants in the old legends were called...

Japanese:
そうそう　天上界では罪人を捕まえる
巨人の一族だったみたいね
English:
Correct. Apparently, the sinners caught by
the Cielo were part of the Gigantes tribe.

Japanese:
昔　教団の奇跡によって　命を与えられた
土人形にも
その名が使われてたのよ
English:
In the olden days, the Church’s miracles gave clay
dolls life and these dolls took on the name.

Japanese:
へえ～？　でも　奇跡って
もう起こらないんでしょ？
じゃあ　あれはどうやって動いてたの？
English:
Hm...? But miracles don’t work now, right? 
How can they move?

Japanese:
…天術の代わりに　転生者の力を
使ってたってこと？
English:
...In exchange for Cielan Artes, 
they used Reincarnators instead?

Japanese: そういうことでしょうね
English: That appears to be the case.

Japanese:
じゃあ　ヘタすりゃ
あたしも　あの中に
入れられてたってわけ？
English: You mean other people like us are inside those things?!

Japanese:
転生者なら
誰でもいいってことは
なかったみたい
English: It seems that any other Reincarnators would suffice.

Japanese:
まだ　研究中だったから
転生者との　相性があるらしいわ
だから　実戦配備されてないんだって
English:
However, there is still a matter of compatibility with the 
Reincarnators used, so that is why they are not being
deployed yet.

Japanese: 扱いの悪さに腹立てる
English: That treatment irritates me

Japanese: アンジュをねぎらう
English: Comfort Ange

Japanese:
僕　許せないよ
あんな狭いところに　閉じ込めて
人殺しの道具にするなんて
English:
I’ll never forgive them. To trap someone into such a 
cramped space and force them to kill others...

Japanese: 人を一体なんだと　思ってるんだ
English: What exactly do they think people are?!

Japanese:
ルカくん　あなたは優しい子ね
他人の私のために
本気で　腹を立ててくれるなんて
English:
Getting mad for other people’s sake... you are such a 
gentle person, Ruca...

Japanese:
そ…　そんなことないよ
ただ　僕がそんな目にあったら
イヤだなって　思っただけだよ
English:
Th-That’s not really the case... Just that... I don’t like 
the thought of me being placed in that situation...

Japanese:
そういう想像力が　大切なのよ
想像力は　人を優しくする
ルカくん　あなたは優しい　いい子よ
English:
You should treasure that imagination, Ruca, it is what 
gives us the ability to empathize with others. I believe
that is why you are a kind child.

Japanese:
あんなところに閉じ込められて…
ツラくなかったの？
English: Wasn’t it scary being trapped in there?

Japanese:
んー…　そうでもないかな
あの中では　眠っていたようなものだったから
目覚めて　現実を知る方がツラいかも…
English:
Hmm... It might have been. To be honest, being inside 
that thing felt like I was sleeping. But, maybe if I 
woke up, I would have been scared.

Japanese:
じゃ…　じゃあ
僕たち　余計なことしちゃった？
English: Th-Then, we didn’t disturb you did we?

Japanese:
冬の朝　お布団から出るのを
イヤがってちゃ
なにもできないでしょ
English:
You cannot help but hate getting out of your 
bed during the morning, right?

Japanese:
眠ってばかりじゃいられないもの
だから　目を覚まさせてくれて
とても感謝してるわ
English:
Yet I cannot simply sleep forever so, I am grateful that 
you woke me up.

Japanese:
まあ　とにかく
早く　ここを出ましょ！
English: Anyway, let’s hurry up and get out of here!

Japanese:
そうね
また　あの中に閉じ込められるのは
ごめんだもの
English:
I feel sorry for the people captured, but... 
you are correct. We should hurry...

Japanese:
…でも　みんな一緒に
閉じ込められるんだったら
寂しくないかなぁ？
English:
Suppose that everyone got captured... 
Do you believe it would be less lonely?

Japanese:
ええ！
そんなの僕　イヤだよ！
English: I don’t want that!

Japanese: うふふ　冗談よ♪
English: Just kidding～!

Japanese: ガラム兵のおかげ
English: Thank Garam

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
いいタイミングで
逃げるチャンスができたな
English:
Great timing. Let’s take the chance
and run while we can.

Japanese:
ガラム兵って
奇襲作戦が　得意なのかな？
English:
I wonder if surprise tactics are 
Garam’s specialty or something.

Japanese:
たぶん　王都軍よりも兵力が
少ないんだと思う
English:
I’m sure since Garam’s military power is considerably 
smaller compared to Regnum’s forces,

Japanese:
だから　ゲリラ戦や
こういう奇襲作戦が
基本なんだと思うよ
English:
Garam has no choice but to rely on ambush tactics 
such as guerilla warfare.

Japanese: ふ～ん？　詳しいじゃん
English: Hmm... you sure know a lot about this.

Japanese:
アスラの夢で
覚えた知識だけどね
English: Well, it’s just what I remember from Asura’s memories.

Japanese:
おい　話し込んでる場合じゃねェぞ！
早く行こうぜ！
English: Hey, now’s not the time for chit-chat, c’mon let’s move!

Japanese: 高価なアクセサリー
English: An Expensive Accessory

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
それにしても
アンジュの渡したものって
よっぽど　高価なものなのねぇ
English:
In any case, the item you handed
over to Ricardo must’ve
been expensive...

Japanese:
もちろんよ　レグヌムの王族から
いただいたプラチナ製の首飾りだもの
ナーオス聖堂の　誇りの逸品ね
English:
Of course. It is a platinum necklace 
I received from the Regnum Capital.
It is the pride of the Naohs church.

Japanese:
そんな大事な物
ポンと渡しちゃって　大丈夫？
English:
Is it really okay to hand over such
an important thing?

Japanese:
私はね　お金で解決するなら
それを惜しむことはないと　思うの
English:
I, for one, think that if money is the solution,
then we should be willing to spend it.

Japanese:
ナーオスの教会って
やっぱり　お金持ちなの？
English: Is the Naohs Church that rich?

Japanese:
麦や　ワインを　奉納してもらえるから
食べ物に困ることは　ほとんどないわね
English:
We receive donations in the form of
wheat and wine, so we rarely have
to worry about food.

Japanese:
それに　お金や貴金属を
寄進してくれる信者さんも
結構　多いのよ
English:
Also, there are quite a few
believers who donate money
and precious metals to us.

Japanese: 儲け話を聞く
English: Ask more about the profits of the church

Japanese: 正直な感想をもらす
English: Give your honest opinion

Japanese: じゃあ　大儲けだよね？
English: Then, that means the church earns a lot?

Japanese:
でもね　なにかあったときには
貯めてあったものを　全部放出して
信者さんを助けるの
English:
But, you know, if something happens,
I am willing to spend it all to help
our followers.

Japanese: へ～　気前いいのね
English: How generous...

Japanese:
教義に「救い」を掲げている以上
困っている人を助けるのは　当然でしょ？
それが　私たちの使命だもの
English:
Since we have “salvation” as our doctrine,
it is only natural to help those in need, correct?
That is our mission.

Japanese:
それって　教会にいるだけで
お金や食べ物が
転がり込んでくるってこと？
English:
So you mean that food and money
just happened to end up in the church?

Japanese:
表現は悪いけど　そういうこと
でも　寄進してもらえるほど　信者の信頼を
得るのは　並大抵じゃないんだけどね
English:
That is one way of saying it, but yes.
Though, it is quite uncommon for a church
to gain its believer’s trust through donations.

Japanese:
じゃあ　どうすれば
信者から信頼を　得られるの？
English: Then how do they usually gain a believer’s trust?

Japanese:
無私無欲を　実践するのが
一番の近道ね
イリアも　うちで働いてみる？
English:
The easiest way to do that is through acts
of selflessness. Would you like to experience
working in a church, Illia?

Japanese: う…　遠慮しとく…
English: I-I’ll pass...

Japanese:
それにしても　気前いいよね
あんな高価なものを
あげちゃうなんてさ
English:
Even so, that’s very generous of you to
give away such an expensive item.

Japanese:
確かに　お金や物は大切だけど
それに捕らわれては　いけないわ
私たちは　清貧であるべきだもの
English:
It is certainly true that money and material wealth
are important, but we should not get caught up in
them. We should strive to live humble lives.

Japanese:
さすが　お説教が上手ね
なんか納得しちゃう…
English:
As expected, you’re really good at
giving sermons. Somehow, I agree with it...

Japanese: 心の準備
English: Mental Preparedness

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
ナーオスに向かうなら
アンジュと　リカルドに
ひと言　言っておかないと…
English:
If we’re heading to Naohs, we gotta
give Ange and Ricardo a heads up...

Japanese:
そうだね　与えるショックは
少ないに越したことはないものね
English:
You’re right. We have to prepare
them for the shock.

Japanese:
確かに　ボクですら
最初に聞いたときは
かなりの衝撃だったもの
English:
Even if someone gives them forewarning,
it would still be quite shocking to them.

Japanese: でも　気が重いな…
English: But... I still feel bad...

Japanese:
んー　だったら
コーダが言おうか　しかし？
English: Then, would you want Coda to tell them?

Japanese:
そうだね　キミに伝えてもらった方が
冗談に聞こえて　最初の衝撃は
小さいかもしれないね
English:
That must be it. If you were to convey the message,
they might think it is in jest and it will not be
as shocking.

Japanese: おー　任せとけ　しかし！
English: Leave it to Coda!

Japanese:
さっきから
なに深刻そうに話してんだ？
English: What were you talking about?

Japanese: ちょっと大事な話があってね
English: Something very important.

Japanese:
そうそう
アンジュとリカルドのために
会議してたのよ
English:
Yep. An important meeting for
Ange and Ricardo.

Japanese:
ああ？　オレ抜きでか？
そりゃねェだろがよ！
English:
And you leave me out?!
There’s no way that’s important!

Japanese:
でも
スパーダの話だから…
English: But it’s about you...

Japanese:
なんだよ！
オレが　どうかしたのかよ！
English: What? Got a problem with me!?

Japanese:
あのふたり　あんたが「お坊ちゃま」って
呼ばれてること知ったら
ショックを受けるんじゃないかなって…
English:
They might get shocked when they
learn that you’re a “Young Master”...

Japanese:
なんだよ　それ！
じゃ　コーダが伝えに行ったのは…
てめェ　待ちやがれ！
English:
What the heck!?
So Coda went off to--
HEY GET BACK HERE, YOU RAT!

Japanese:
んぎゃ～　痛い痛い痛い！
乱暴は禁止だぞ　しかし！
English:
Ow ow ow! Domestic abuse is
banned thou-- ow!

Japanese:
うるっせェよ！
このクソネズミ！
English: Shaddap you damn rat!

Japanese:
これで　ちったあ大人しくなるだろう…
おめェらも　余計なこと
言うんじゃねェぞ！
English:
That should shut him up.
You lot better lay off too or else!

Japanese:
隠してても
いずれバレるじゃないか
English:
You do know that they’ll still find out about 
it even when you try and hide it, right?

Japanese:
別に隠してねェし！
それに　聞いてどうにかなるほど
おかしな話でもねーっての！！
English:
I ain’t hiding anything anyway!
And it’s not like I can do anything
about it!!

Japanese:
いい加減にしろよ
おめェらは！
English: So, shut up and drop it already!

Japanese: リカルド自己紹介
English: Ricardo’s Self-introduction

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
そういえば　リカルドさんのこと
詳しくお聞きしてませんでしたね
English:
Now that I think about it, we do not know much about 
you yet, Sir Ricardo.

Japanese:
名前は知っているな？
そして俺は　傭兵だ
それで　十分だと思うが？
English:
I see that you know my name? Aside from that, I’m a 
mercenary. I suppose that should suffice?

Japanese:
これから　一緒に旅するんだから
もっと　いろいろ聞いておいた方が
いいと思うんだけど…
English:
From now on, you’ll be travelling with us. I think it’d be 
nicer if we got to know you a bit more...

Japanese:
かもしれんな
だが　全員の名は覚えたぞ
English: That may be the case. But I already know your names.

Japanese: え…　もう？
English: Already?

Japanese:
おまえが　ルカ・ミルダ
雇い主はアンジュ・セレーナ
English: You are Ruca Milda. My employer is Ange Serena.

Japanese:
あの娘がイリア・アニーミ
あのガキはスパーダ・ベルフォルマ
彼はコンウェイ・タウ
English:
The girl is Illia Animi. The brat is Spada Belforma. 
He’s Kongwei Tao.

Japanese: そして　あの生き物がコーダだったな
English: And that animal is called Coda.

Japanese:
これで
問題なかろう？
English: With this, I suppose there are no more problems?

Japanese: 照れているのか？　と聞く
English: Are you embarrassed?

Japanese: 同意する
English: Agree

Japanese:
もしかして
照れてるの？
English: Could it be that you’re embarrassed?

Japanese:
まあ　そういうことだ
仕事柄　他人に深く個人的事情を
知られるのに　慣れていないからな
English:
Well, that’s how it is. My job doesn’t 
usually entail personal interaction with 
others so I’m not quite used to this.

Japanese:
うーん…　確かに十も歳の違う
子ども相手に　打ち解けるのって
時間がかかるのかもしれないね
English:
I see... I suppose it’d take some time to open up to 
children ten years younger than you...

Japanese:
そうね
時間が解決してくれるまで
待ちましょうか
English:
Indeed, let us just wait until we have enough 
time for proper introductions.

Japanese:
確かに　今は
名前がわかってればいいのかな
それが人付き合いの　最初の一歩だもんね
English:
Maybe it’s fine to know someone’s name for 
now? That’s the first step in socializing, after all.

Japanese:
心配するな　俺は傭兵だ
おまえたちの和を
乱すようなマネはしない
English:
Don’t worry about it, I’m just a mercenary. 
There’s no need for me to 
disturb your group’s dynamic.

Japanese:
昨日まで　敵だった相手と
同じ部隊で　過ごすことも
よくあるくらいだからな
English:
I’m already used to spending time 
with people who were my enemies yesterday.

Japanese:
その言葉を聞いて
安心しました
English: Hearing your words is quite relieving.

Japanese:
では　これから
よろしくお願いしますね
リカルドさん
English: Then, from now on, let us get along, Sir Ricardo.

Japanese: ああ　よろしく頼む
English: I’ll be in your care.

Japanese: 契約違反じゃないの？
English: Isn’t It a Breach of Contract?

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
あのリカルドってヤツ
腕は立ちそうだけど…
ホントに　信用できんのか？
English:
That Ricardo sure can fight but... 
can we really trust him?

Japanese:
さぁ～　どうだか
悪人じゃなさそうだけどね
English: Who knows, he doesn’t seem like a bad person though.

Japanese: 私は　信用できると思うけど…
English: I believe he is trustworthy, though...

Japanese:
でもよ　あんなに簡単に
金で寝返ったんだぜ？
English:
But you do know that he can just switch sides when 
offered enough money, right?

Japanese:
私は　それだけの人じゃないと思うわ
きっと　あの方は
契約を重んじる人なんでしょう
English:
I am sure he is not that type of person. He is the kind 
of person to honor his contracts.

Japanese:
契約不履行時には
違約金を　支払うってところまでが
交わされていた契約だったのよ
English:
After all, he only turned sides once I paid for his 
contract’s penalty.

Japanese:
確かに　いい加減なヤツなら
違約金なんか
踏み倒しちゃいそうだもんね
English:
You’re right... if he was the irresponsible type, he 
would’ve just ran off with the money.

Japanese:
でもよ　それって
金さえあれば　裏切り放題ってわけだろ
やっぱ信用ならねェぜ
English:
That just means that he’ll still turn sides with the right 
amount. I really can’t trust him.

Japanese:
それは　そうかもしれないけど
スパーダくんなら　気に入らない依頼を
引き受けてくれたりする？
English:
That may be the case but, if it were you, would you 
accept a request that you did not like?

Japanese:
私に雇われてくれたのは
きっと　誘拐なんて
元々　やりたくなかったのよ
English:
I am sure he allowed me to employ him because he 
did not enjoy kidnapping me in the first place.

Japanese:
ああ？　えーっとつまり…
オレたち　あいつに
気に入られてるってわけか？
English: So... does that mean that he wanted to be with us?

Japanese:
へえ　良かったじゃん　スパーダ
あんた　気に入られてるってさ！
English: Ain’t that nice, Spada! Someone wants to be with you!

Japanese: 気持ち悪い　言い方は止めろって！
English: Shut the hell up, you make me sound like a creep.

Japanese:
でも　そういうことだから
リカルドさんと　仲良くやってね？
ね　スパーダくん
English:
But that is the case. Please get along with Sir Ricardo, 
Spada.

Japanese:
ああ…　まあ
そういうことなら　仕方ねェよな…
English: Ah-- well, alright. If that’s the case, it can’t be helped...

Japanese: リカルドについて
English: About Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
あのリカルドって人
なんか　うさん臭くない？
ヘンな趣味持ってそう
English:
Isn’t Ricardo kinda shady?
I’m sure he’s got some really
gross hobbies!

Japanese: なんで　そうなるのさ？
English: Gross... hobbies?

Japanese:
ああ～　根が暗そうだもんな
マリンスポーツとかは
絶対しないタイプだ
English:
Definitely. He’s looks so gloomy,
I bet he’s never gone swimmin’
at the beach.

Japanese:
ああ～　しないしない！
絶対に爆笑とかしないよね？
English:
Gyhahaha! DEFINITELY NOT!
I bet he’s totally not the type to laugh out loud!

Japanese:
ヒャハハハハ！　しないしない！
絶対に　約束に遅刻しそうになっても
全速力で　走ったりしないよな？
English:
Bwhahaha! DEFINITELY NOT!
Bet you, that he’s not gonna
run even when he’s late!

Japanese:
いひひひひひ！　しないしない！
逆に走ってる人に
足引っ掛けるタイプよね？
English:
Gyheeheehee! DEFINITELY NOT!
In contrast, he’s the type that trips
those who do!

Japanese:
それそれ！　ヘンな器具とか使って
コッソリ筋トレとかしてるんだぜ！
それからよ…
English:
That’s right, that’s right! He’s totally the 
type to buy weird machines
and use them to bulk up! And...

Japanese:
ねぇねぇ
そういう陰口とか　無責任なウワサって
僕　感心しないんだけど…
English:
Hey... Uhh... Can we not speak ill about him behind
his back? This isn’t really sitting well with me, but...

Japanese:
やーだねぇ　優等生は！
ただの冗談だって！
English:
Ugh, you’re such a goody-two-shoes!
We’re just kidding y’know.

Japanese:
いや　冗談なのは　わかってるよ
僕が言いたいのは
そんなことより…
English:
No, I know you’re joking.
What I was going to say was...

Japanese: なによ？
English: What?

Japanese:
ふたりとも
笑い方が　ヘンじゃない？
English: Aren’t your laughs kind of weird?

Japanese: ああ？
English: Huuuh?

Japanese:
はぁ？　うっさいっての
笑い声が　聞きたくないってなら
あっち　行ってなさいよ
English:
Huh? Butt out!
If you don’t want to hear us laugh that much, 
then go sulk somewhere else!

Japanese: …わかったよ
English: ...Fine.

Japanese:
ホント　おたんこルカって
空気読まないよね？
いひひひひひ！
English:
That dummy doesn’t know how to read the 
atmosphere, am I right? Heeheeheeheehee!

Japanese:
ああ　まったくだな！
ヒャハハハハハ！
English:
Damn right!
Bwhahahaha!

Japanese:
…………
今さらだけど　あんた　笑い方
おかしくない？
English:
...
I just noticed now, but...
isn’t your laugh kinda gross?

Japanese:
おめェに
言われたくねェよ！
English: I don’t want to hear that from you!

Japanese: 顔色悪ッ！
English: You Look Pale!

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
リカルドさんって
色が白いですね
English: Sir Ricardo sure is fair-skinned.

Japanese: ってかさぁ　顔色悪くない？
English: Isn’t it coz he’s pale?

Japanese:
そうか？
特に　意識したことはないが
English: Am I? I don’t really pay attention to these things.

Japanese: 体調　悪いんじゃないの？
English: You feeling aight?

Japanese: あいにく　健康そのものだ
English: Sorry to disappoint you, but I feel fine.

Japanese:
前世が　死神だったことに
関係あんのかな？
English:
Perhaps being a Reaper in his past
life has something to do with this?

Japanese:
もしそうだとしたら　ルカは
もっと男臭い姿をしているだろうな
English: If that was the case, Ruca would look more macho.

Japanese:
スパーダに関しては
これはもう　明らかに関係がない
English: And it’s obvious Spada’s not really affected by it.

Japanese:
そして　アンジュは　こう見えて
実は　男ということになるんじゃないか？
English: And, as you can see, Ange’s not a man, is she?

Japanese:
あら…
バレてしまいました？
実は私…
English:
Oh my...
I suppose the cat is out of the bag now.
In truth, I’m...

Japanese: なにッ！？
English: Wait what!?

Japanese:
うげ！
そ…　そうだったの？
English: R-Really!?

Japanese:
冗談よ　冗談♪
イリア　そんなに引かないで
English:
I am just kidding!
Illia, come back here.

Japanese:
想像して　血の気が引いちゃった
そんな冗談　毎日聞かされたら
あたしも　色白美人になれそうね…
English:
Ugh, I felt the blood drain from my face.
I swear to Cielo, if I hear that kinda joke
every day I’ll prolly end up a fair maiden myself.

Japanese: 頭痛イリア
English: Headache-y Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
イリア
昨日の頭痛　もう良くなった？
English: Illia, is your headache from yesterday gone?

Japanese:
うん　もう大丈夫みたい
心配かけちゃった？
English:
Yep! I’m aight now.
Were you worried?

Japanese:
じゃあ　あれは知恵熱か？
教団の話やら　ややこしかったもんなぁ
English:
Maybe she had a teething fever...
After all, the Church talk was pretty complex.

Japanese: スパーダに注意する
English: Warn Spada

Japanese: イリアの様子をうかがう
English: Ask how Illia is doing

Japanese: 冗談を言う
English: Tell a joke

Japanese:
こういうとき　からかっちゃダメだよ
本人にとっては
深刻なのかもしれないし
English:
Now’s not the time to say such things, Spada!
We have no idea if it’s something serious!

Japanese:
いいのよ　この程度の冗談なら
気分転換になるもん
もう大丈夫だから　気にしないで
English:
