It’s fine. These kinds of jokes help lighten up the mood. 
Like I said, I’m already aight so don’t worry about it.

Japanese:
さっすが　イリア
オレの配慮が行き届いた
ナイスな冗談　わかってくれた？
English:
Nice one, Illia.
You totally got that.
Was it a nice joke?

Japanese:
まあ　ルカの冗談聞くよりは
マシよね～
English: Better than Ruca’s, at least～

Japanese:
…………
冗談が　ヘタで悪かったね…
English: Well sorry for making a bad joke...

Japanese:
知恵…って　じゃあ
熱もあるの？
だ…　大丈夫　イリア？
English:
S-So Illia had a fever!?
A-Are you sure you’re alright, Illia?

Japanese:
もう　スパーダ
そういう　不用意な冗談やめてよ！
ルカが　本気にしちゃうじゃない
English:
Sheesh, Spada!
I told you you gotta be careful with your jokes. 
See? Ruca ended up taking that seriously.

Japanese: ああ　悪ぃ悪ぃ
English: Haha... my bad.

Japanese:
じゃあ　熱はないんだね？
ああ　良かった
English: So you don’t have a fever? Phew...

Japanese: ホント　冗談の通じないヤツねぇ
English: This guy really doesn’t get jokes, does he.

Japanese:
確かに　イリアやスパーダには
話が難しすぎたよね！
English:
Yeah! It might’ve been too complex 
for the both of you to understand.

Japanese: はぁ？
English: Huh!?

Japanese: ああ！？
English: Huh!?

Japanese:
しまった　調子に乗っちゃった…
やばい！
English: Crap! That might’ve come off differently as I intended...

Japanese:
なに　あんた？
つまり　自分が勉強できること
鼻にかけたいわけね？
English:
Got a problem? Just coz you can study doesn’t
mean that you can brag, got that?

Japanese:
なに　おまえ？
つまり　オレたちのこと
バカにしたってわけだな？
English: Basically, ya think we’re stupid, huh?

Japanese:
あああ…　あのそのぅ　そのような意図は
まったくもってございませんわけで…
English:
Uh... That is... I honestly did not mean for 
it to come off that way...

Japanese:
誤解なきようお願いしたい所存であると
心より　申し上げたく存ずる次第でして…
あのそのぅ…
English:
I want you to know that I did not think you guys 
would take offense. I apologize from the bottom
of my heart... uhh...

Japanese: なに言ってんのか　わかんねェよ！！
English: What the heck are you saying?

Japanese:
うわぁあん！
調子に乗りました！
ごめんなさい…
English:
I-I mean I ended up using the wrong term for it!
I’m sorry...

Japanese: 見直したぜ、ルカ
English: You’ve Improved, Ruca

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
なるほどねぇ
「人前で弱音を吐かないって決めた」かぁ
English: “I won’t complain anymore”, huh...

Japanese:
もう…　言い直さないでよ
大きなこと　言い過ぎたかなって
反省してるんだから
English:
Come on, Spada, cut it out.
I really made a big fuss out of
that and I still feel guilty about it.

Japanese:
んー
ルカには似合わん言葉だな　しかし
English:
Hmm...
What a Ruca thing to say though.

Japanese:
ああ　泣き言ピーピー言ってた
おまえは　どこ行っちまったのやら…
English:
Yeah, I wonder where that whiny
little Ruca went off to...?

Japanese: さらに　大きな事をいう
English: Emphasize

Japanese: 恥かしがる
English: Be embarrassed

Japanese:
人は成長するものだよ
以前の僕とは違うのさ
…ま　ちょっとだけだけど
English: People grow. I’m different from the me before... a bit.

Japanese: どうだろうな
English: I wonder...

Japanese: ちぇ…　厳しいなぁ
English: Harsh...

Japanese:
いや　「ちょっと」じゃねェって話だよ
自分じゃ　わかってないかもしれねェけど
ちゃんと立派になってるぜ　おまえ
English:
Nah, I didn’t mean it that way.
You might not know it yet, but you’ve really grown a lot.

Japanese: 本当？
English: Really?

Japanese:
おう　そーだなー
ルカ　前より　たくさんメシ
食べてるぞ　しかし！
English: Yeah! From now on, you should eat a lot, y’know!

Japanese: そういうこっちゃねェよ
English: Not that!

Japanese:
んー　でも　メシを
たくさん食べるのは立派だぞー　しかし
English: But, it’s splendid if you can eat a lot though.

Japanese:
じゃあ　コーダは
とっくに立派だな
English: What’s splendid with you?

Japanese:
んー！
コーダ　立派だぞー　しかし！
English: Yes.

Japanese:
よしてよ
前の話なんてさぁ
English: Stop it already... that was a long time ago.

Japanese:
ヘタレのおまえじゃないと
いじり甲斐がないんだよなァ
English: It sure isn’t worth teasing you if you’re not a wuss.

Japanese:
そーだ　そーだ　ルカ
もっといじられるといいぞ　しかし！
English: That’s right, that’s right. Let yourself get teased more!

Japanese: そんなのイヤだよ！
English: No way!

Japanese: つまらんな　しかし
English: That’s lame though!

Japanese:
まあよ
前に　イリアのために頑張るとか
言ってたときとは　違うよな
English: You said that for Illia’s sake, didn’t you?

Japanese: そう…　かな
English: I... guess?

Japanese:
イリアのためじゃねェ
おまえの「誇り」の部分から
にじみ出た　言葉だったんだろうぜ
English:
I’m sure it wasn’t for Illia, 
but rather, your pride speaking.

Japanese: 僕の…誇り…？
English: My... pride...?

Japanese:
ホコリ～？
ゴミか　しかし？
English: Parade～? Is it trash?

Japanese:
まあ　そうだな
ある意味　ゴミみてぇなもんかもな
English:
Well, pretty much.
It’s meaning might as well be trash, yeah.

Japanese:
でもよ　そういうゴミみたいなもんでも
命懸けて守れよな　ルカ！
English:
But y’know? It might be trash, but it sure will save
your life someday!

Japanese:
う…　うん　わかったよ
ありがとうスパーダ
English: O-Oh... I understand. Thanks, Spada!

Japanese: イリアって
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
どうしたの　リカルドさん？
深刻な顔して
English:
What’s the matter, Ricardo? You have a serious look
on your face.

Japanese:
イリアという娘
なぜああも　適当なのだ？
English: Why is that Illia girl so... sloppy?

Japanese:
さあ　出会ったときから
そういう子だし…
English: Who knows. She’s been like that ever since I met her...

Japanese:
イリアの大雑把
あれは昔からだなー　しかし
English: Illia has been rough since a long time ago though.

Japanese:
まあ　適当で大雑把でいい加減なのは
性格として仕方がない
English:
I suppose it can’t be helped if it’s in her nature
to be sloppy, rough, and careless.

Japanese:
だが　問題は一行の舵取りを
そんな人物に　任せていることだ
English:
But, the problem is, letting that kind of person lead
the group.

Japanese: 同意する
English: Agree

Japanese: 同意しない
English: Disagree

Japanese:
そうだね　おかげで教団には　にらまれるし
捕まって兵士に　仕立て上げられて
今じゃ　逃亡生活だもの
English:
You’re right. It’s thanks to her I got into trouble with the
Church, was caught and brought to the battlefield, and
am now on the run.

Japanese:
それらは　すべて
イリアが原因なのだろう？
English: All of that was because of her?

Japanese:
でも　だからといって
僕たちは　イリアを
責めたりする気はないよ　絶対ない
English: Even so, I have no intention of blaming her.

Japanese:
…そうか　その覚悟があるならいい
俺は　ただの雇われ人だ
おまえたちの選択を　尊重しよう
English:
I admire your resolve...
So be it, I’ll respect your decision. 
After all, I’m no more than a hired gun.

Japanese:
そんなの問題じゃないよ
彼女がいなければ　僕らはここに
今こうしていなかったもの
English:
That’s not the problem.
After all, we wouldn’t be here if it weren’t for her.

Japanese:
言い換えれば　彼女がいなければ
逃亡生活をすることもなかった
戦場に出ることもなかったのだぞ？
English:
And no thanks to her, you’re now on the run and
have already been on a battlefield.

Japanese:
で…　でも
それは仕方ないじゃないか
English: B-But we couldn’t control that.

Japanese:
…まあ　おまえやみんなが
納得しているなら
俺が　とやかく言うことではないがな
English:
At any rate, I don’t even have much of a say on
your decision.

Japanese:
でも　コーダなー
イリアに　くっついて来て
良かったぞー　しかし
English: Coda’s glad that Illia came here though.

Japanese:
…珍しくて美味しい物が
食べられるから？
English: Because of the new delicacies?

Japanese:
おお～　なんでわかったー？
ルカは頭イイなー　しかし
English: Yeah! How did you know? Ruca sure is smart!

Japanese:
やれやれ　まあいい
俺は　ただせいぜい賢明な選択を
願うのみだ
English:
Good grief... So be it.
I only want someone sensible to take the lead.

Japanese:
あー…　イリアのムチャは
ひとつの芸みたいなものだからなぁ…
賢明さは　期待できないと思うよ？
English:
I think being rash is the only thing Illia’s good at, 
so I don’t think she can be sensible.
Good grief...

Japanese: レグヌム美食巡り
English: Regnum Delicacies

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: お腹すいたなー　しかし
English: Coda’s stomach feels light...

Japanese:
ホント
コーダは食いしん坊だなぁ
English: You really are a glutton, huh?

Japanese:
前に来たときは　あんまりゆっくり
できなかったからなー
うまいメシ食べられなかったしな　しかし
English:
Ever since you came, Coda never really got to eat
delicious food though.

Japanese:
僕　ホットドッグ
あげたじゃないか…
English: I gave you a hotdog, didn’t I...?

Japanese:
お…　なんだよ？
うまいメシの話なら
地元のオレに　聞いてくれよな
English:
Yo, wassup? If y’all wanna know 
about Regnum’s food, just ask me.

Japanese:
スパーダだけじゃなくて
僕も一応　地元なんだけど…
English:
We live in the same town, you know...
You could also ask me.

Japanese:
ああ　そーいや　そうだったな
じゃあ　コーダに教えてやれ
English:
Oh yeah?
Then tell Coda what kind of food is in Regnum.

Japanese: 見栄を張る
English: Show off

Japanese: 正直に言う
English: Tell the truth

Japanese:
レグヌムといえば
文化の中心地だからね
当然食文化も　栄えているよ
English:
Regnum’s the center of civilization so it’s only natural
that their cuisine is well-known.

Japanese:
ほうほう　どんなのが
食えるんだー？　しかし
English: I see! Say, what kind of food can you eat here?

Japanese:
…えっと　お酢の和え物とか
コンソメで　煮た根野菜とか…
オーブンで　焼いた肉とか…
English:
Let’s see... You can eat food like salad dressed in
vinegar, a clear soup made from boiling root crops,
meat roasted within an oven...

Japanese: んあー　普通だなー
English: How normal...

Japanese:
なんだよ！　その地味な家庭料理の
ラインナップはよォ！！
English:
What the hell? You’re just talking about some home 
cooked food!

Japanese:
し…　仕方ないじゃないか！
僕の母さん　料理好きだったんだよ
美味しいから　僕も文句なんてなかったし…
English:
Hey, I can’t help it! I love my mother’s cooking!
It’s so tasty that I can’t even describe it...

Japanese:
おまえ
いいとこのボンボンのはずなのに
えらい庶民的だな
English: You’re rich but you’re into home cooked food...

Japanese: うん……
English: I guess I am...

Japanese:
あ～…　実は僕の家
母さんの家庭料理ばっかりだったんだ
だから　名物料理って詳しくないんだよね
English:
Oh, actually, I’ve only eaten my mothers food, so I’m
not really well-versed in Regnum’s delicacies.

Japanese: ガッカリだなー　しかし
English: Awww...

Japanese:
おまえ
いいとこのボンボンだろ？
English: Ain’t you supposed to be rich?

Japanese:
でも父さんは　倹約家だし
母さんは　料理好きだったからね
外食は　ほとんどなかったかな
English:
My dad’s a really thrifty person and my mom’s cooking
is delicious, so I didn’t really get to eat much outside.

Japanese:
けっ　しょうがねーな
じゃあ　一応　名家で育った
このオレさまだ
English:
Tch... Guess can’t be helped, huh.
Let me tell you what high class cuisine actually is.

Japanese:
ゴージャス・ディナ{fixed}－{variable}のなんたるかを
語ってやろうじゃないか
English:
I’ll show you what an actual 
GORGEOUS DINNER is like.

Japanese: おう　楽しみだなー　しかし！
English: Yes! Coda can’t wait!

Japanese:
前菜は　そうだな
チーズと魚介を絡めた　ディップと
鴨肉とジュレを添えた　テリーヌ
English:
For the appetizer, you’d have seafood cheese dip and 
duck foie gras terrine.

Japanese:
そして　スモークサーモンのサラダ
貝とタコのマリネ…
ポルチーニ茸のスープポットパイとか…
English:
And then you’ll have smoked salmon salad, marinated 
seafood... porcini pot pie...

Japanese:
ぬおおおお！　よくわからんが
うまそうな響きだな！　しかし！
English:
I don’t really get what those are, but they sound
tasty though!

Japanese:
僕　食べたことないものばっかりだよ
ディップって　なに？
English:
They all sound like things I haven’t tasted yet!
What’s a “dip?”

Japanese:
そりゃ　あれだァ…
なんかトロトロしたヤツを
パン切れに　乗っけて食うんだ
English:
A “dip” is... uh that!
It’s kinda syrupy and you eat it with bread.

Japanese:
……？
ジュレとか　テリーヌって？
English: What about “jello” and “terrine?”

Japanese:
えーっとだなぁ　なんかトロトロしてて
四角いんだ
で　パン切れに　乗っけて食うんだ
English:
Uhh... it’s this square that’s kinda syrupy 
and you eat it with bread...

Japanese: マリネって？
English: “Marinade?”

Japanese:
なんかヒタヒタした汁の味がして
パン切れに　乗っけて食うんだ
English:
It’s this kind of sauce that you spread 
across bread before eating it.

Japanese:
よくわからないけど
パン切れに乗っけてばかりだね
English: I still don’t get it. But you eat it with bread, right?

Japanese:
それだけじゃねーんだよ！
クラッカーに乗っけても
美味いんだぜ？
English:
Not only that!
You can also eat it with crackers y’know?

Japanese:
クラッカーなー！
パリパリして美味いなー　しかし
English: Crackers are so crunchy and tasty though!

Japanese:
だろー？
クラッカー　いいよなー　しかし
English: Right? Crackers are so cool y’know!

Japanese: …もういいよ
English: Oh whatever.

Japanese: コンウェイの望み
English: Kongwei’s Wish

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
そういえば　ルカくんと
ふたりきりになるのは　初めてだね
English:
Oh, I suppose this is the first time we are alone 
together.

Japanese:
え…
ああ　うん
そうだね
English: Oh... uh... yeah.

Japanese:
他のみんなは
うまく情報を　集められているのかな
English:
Everyone seems to have gone to gather
information now.

Japanese:
どうだろう
でも　やっぱり転生者の話を
聞くのは　難しいんじゃないかな
English:
I wonder... I don’t think we’d be able to gather a lot of 
information about Reincarnators though.

Japanese:
…なんだか　コンウェイさんを
こんなことに　付き合わせるの
悪い気がするよ
English:
For some reason, it makes me feel bad that you’ve
gotten yourself involved with us.

Japanese: それは気にしないで
English: It matters not. Do not trouble yourself over it.

Japanese:
でも　コンウェイさん
転生者でもないのに　どうして…
なにか　やりたいこととかないの？
English:
But why? You’re not even a Reincarnator... 
Is there something you want to do?

Japanese:
…………
ボクの望みは
魂の救済
English: I want to bring about a soul’s salvation.

Japanese: 魂の…　救済？
English: A “soul’s salvation”...?

Japanese:
そう
でも　ボクの手は　ふたつしかない
だから　魂もふたつしか救えない
English:
Yes, but I only have two hands,
so I will only be able to save two souls.

Japanese:
悪いけど　ルカくんの席はないんだ
だから　キミの魂は
キミ自身で　救わなければならない
English:
I apologize, but your soul does not have a position on
my list. You shall have to save your own.

Japanese: ボクは　それを見届けたいんだ
English: That I can assure you.

Japanese:
えっと…
ごめん　意味がよくわからないや
English: I don’t follow... sorry.

Japanese:
ふふ…　いいよ
今は意味が　わからなくても
キミはキミの旅を続ければ　それでいい
English:
It is fine if you do not understand for now, just as long
as you let me join you in your journey.

Japanese:
ボクは　ただ
それに付いて行くだけさ
English: I just want to come along. That is all.

Japanese: あのコ、一体誰？
English: Who’s That Kid?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: で？
English: So?

Japanese: え　なに？
English: What is it?

Japanese:
決まってんでしょ
なによ　あのコ？
どっから連れて来たのよ？
English:
Ain’t that obvious?
Who’s that kid?
Where did you find her?

Japanese: とぼけてみる
English: Feign ignorance

Japanese: 聞いた事を話す
English: Tell her what you know

Japanese: 不機嫌になる
English: Pout

Japanese:
さあ…　だって名前も
まだ聞いていないし
English: Who knows. I don’t even know her name yet.

Japanese:
どんなナンパの手口よ！
ナンパと言えば　普通　自己紹介と
天気の話から　入るものでしょ！
English:
You smooth criminal!
If you’re going to hit on her you should start with
some self-introductions then some small talk!

Japanese:
…………
イリア　あなたって
変わったナンパされてるのね
English:
Uhh, Illia, that is quite a peculiar way of hitting
on someone.

Japanese:
ここにコッソリ　住んでるんだって
僕が　連れて来たんじゃないよ
English:
I didn’t take her with me. She seems to 
have been living here for a while now.

Japanese:
ホントにぃ？
こんなとこに　人なんか住めるの？
English:
Are you sure?
Do you really think a human can live here?

Japanese:
…イリア
疑うところ　ズレてない？
English: Illia, aren’t you focusing on the wrong thing here?

Japanese:
ち…　違うってば！
ここに住み着いてるって　言ってたよ！
English:
Y-You’re wrong! She told us she 
was living here when we arrived.

Japanese:
あら　良かった
あんた　モテないのを苦に
思い切ったことしたのかと思っちゃった…
English:
Oh that’s a relief... I thought you couldn’t bear the
pain of being unpopular any longer...

Japanese: なんだよ　それ…
English: Why would you...

Japanese:
うん　ルカくん
怒っていいと思うよ
イリア　今のは　ちょっとヒド過ぎ
English:
Ruca, you should get angry.
Illia has most definitely overstepped her bounds here.

Japanese:
とりあえず
かくまってくれるみたいだから
悪い子じゃないと思うんだけど…
English:
At any rate, she’s offering her place to us 
and it doesn’t look like she’s a bad kid either...

Japanese:
方言だと　地方出身っぽくて
いい子に感じるよねぇ
English:
Of course, the countryside girl with a strange 
accent’s seems like a good kid.

Japanese:
そ…　そうだね
…っというか　イリアだって
十分　地方出身じゃないか…
English: Y-You’re right... but you’re not from here either.

Japanese:
ん？
なんか言った？
English: Did you say something?

Japanese:
い…　いや
なんでもないよ
English: N-Nothing.

Japanese:
じゃあ　お言葉に甘えて
しばらく　ここにいさせてもらいましょうか
English:
Then, let us take advantage of her offer
and stay here for a bit.

Japanese:
多少　事情も話しておいた方が
いいよね
通報される心配もなさそうだし
English:
At the very least, it seems like we can talk to her and
it doesn’t look like she’d report us to the authorities.

Japanese: じゃあ　そうしましょ
English: Then, sure.

Japanese: ちゃんと自己紹介
English: Proper Introductions

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
あ…　せや
そっちのおふた方にも
キチンと　挨拶しとかんとなぁ
English:
Oh, that said, 
Ah haven’t properly introduced 
mahself ta y’two ’fore, have Ah?

Japanese:
小さいのに
ずいぶん　礼儀正しいな
English: For someone so small, you sure know your manners.

Japanese:
なんだよ　挨拶　オレたちが最後かよ
あの隠れ家
オレが作ったんだぞ？
English:
What the heck, you’re greeting us last?
Ya know I was the first one to live in 
your place, right?

Japanese:
あ～　そうやそうや
そのヘンも　めっちゃ感謝してんねんで
English: Ah, yer right! Ah’m also grateful fer that.

Japanese:
ホンマ　どないお礼言うてええんか
わからへんから　いっそのこと
言わんでええかなぁと　思うててん
English:
Really was wonderin’ when Ah would be able ta say
thanks so Ah figured it’d be better sooner or later.

Japanese:
言えよ！
そこは！
English: Then say it!

Japanese: フン　面白い娘だ
English: What an interesting girl.

Japanese:
それにしても自分ら　男前やな
でも最初は　まず名前聞いてぇや
せやないとモテへんで？
English:
That said, y’two sure are handsum. 
But first of all, ya both gonna hafta introduce yerselves. 
Else, ya ain’t gonna be popular.

Japanese:
挨拶するって言ってんだから
おめェが　先に名乗るのが
スジだろ？
English:
You’re the one who proposed self-introductions, 
so you go first.

Japanese:
あー　せやなぁ～
自分の言う通りや
ウチは　エルマーナ・ラルモっちゅうねん
English:
Oh, right, jus’ as ya said.
Name’s Hermana Larmo.

Japanese:
オレはスパーダ・ベルフォルマ
これでいいか？
English: And I’m Spada Belforma. This enough for you?

Japanese:
おおきに
もうひとりの男前さんは？
English: Jus’ right. Now, what ’bout the other fella?

Japanese:
リカルド・ソルダート
傭兵だ
English: Ricardo Soldat, mercenary.

Japanese:
自分　顔色悪いなぁ
まあええわ
ほんなら　よろしゅうしたってなー
English:
Yer complexion sure’s bad... 
well, whatever, nice ta meet ya too.

Japanese: ほんでこのネズミ、何なん？
English: So, What’s This Rat, Really?

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
ほんで　なんやのん？
この生き物は
ネズミの一種？
English:
Now what’s this anyway?
Sum kinda rat?

Japanese:
コーダはコーダだ
ネズミではないぞー　しかし
English:
Coda is Coda.
Coda is not a rat though.

Japanese:
うわ！　しゃべりよったでぇ？
ビックリやなぁ…
よぉ　できてるわ
English:
WHOA! It spoke!?
That surprised me...
Ya sure are good...

Japanese:
だろー？　コーダ　よくできてる
おまえ　よく見抜いた
ルカより見る目あるな　しかし
English:
Right? Coda is good. 
You sure saw right through me,
just like Ruca did though!

Japanese:
ああ　あの兄ちゃんな
ぼーっとして　そうやもん
あんなんウチと比べたら　あかんで
English:
Oh that’s big bro? He’s always daydreamin’...
Ah don’ like bein’ compared with sumone like ’em.

Japanese:
おまえ　気に入った　しかし
今度うまいメシ　食べに連れて行け
English:
I like you though!
Take me to some delicious food next time!

Japanese:
普通　誉められた方が
連れてってくれるんとちゃうん？
English:
Ain’t the one praisin’ supposed ta be the one who
treats others?

Japanese:
でも　ウチが連れて行くんやったら
あんまり期待せんといたってなぁ
English:
Now, if yer expectin’ me ta take ya sumwhere, 
don’ expect much.

Japanese:
んー　わかったぞ　しかし
コーダ　あんまり期待しないぞ　しかし
English:
Coda understands though.
Coda won’t expect much though.

Japanese:
そういうたら…
ネズミって　食えるんやったなぁ
English:
Now that Ah think ‘bout it... Ah wonder what rat
tastes like.

Japanese:
そうか　そうか
あの人ら　そういう目的で
連れて歩いてんねんな
English: Ah see... so that’s why everybody’s bringin’ it along...

Japanese: どんな味？
English: What Does It Taste Like?

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: なあ　自分
English: Howdy.

Japanese:
おー　エル
キノコのこと　怒ってるか　しかし？
English:
Oh hey, Hermie. Are you still mad about
the mushroom?

Japanese:
済んだことは　しゃあないやん
もう怒ってへんで
それより　どんな味やった？
English:
Oh, Ah got over that already.
Ah ain’t mad anymore, hear? 
That said, what did the mushroom taste like?

Japanese:
んーあー　しみじみと
マズかったなー　しかし
English: Hmm... uh... it was very... disgusting though.

Japanese:
やっぱマズイんかぁ
良かった　食べへんで
English:
So it was disgustin’, huh?
Sure am glad Ah didn’t eat it.

Japanese: 食べるつもりだったか　しかし？
English: Were you planning on eating it?

Japanese:
ウワサを聞いて
さぞ　美味しいもんやろ思うて
期待しとってんけどなぁ
English:
After hearin’ all sortsa rumors, Ah expected that it’d
have ta be purty tasty.

Japanese: なんや　興ざめやわぁ
English: An’ now my curiosity’s all gone.

Japanese:
しかし　あれだぞ
コーダ　健康になった気がする
頭も良くなった気もするぞー　しかし
English:
Still, Coda feels healthier now. Coda also feels smarter 
too though.

Japanese: ホンマ？
English: Really?

Japanese:
んー　コーダ　今なら数字が
３以上数えられる　気がするぞ　しかし
English: Yeah! Now, Coda can probably count beyond three!

Japanese: １たす１は？
English: What’s 1 + 1?

Japanese: ニヤリ…
English: *grinning*

Japanese: ６だな　しかし

こら　あかんわ
あのキノコ　頭には効かんらしい
English:
This is bad. That mushroom seems ta have gotten ta
his head.

Japanese:
正解か？
正解だろー？
English:
Was Coda right? 
Coda’s right, right?

Japanese: キノコっていくら？
English: How Much Was the Mushroom?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
色々あったけど
とりあえずキノコ　ゲットやな
English:
A lot ended up happenin’ but, we did get 
the mushroom in the end.

Japanese:
高価なものって言ってたけど…
いくらぐらいになるの？
English:
You’ve mentioned it was expensive before, but how
much is that mushroom anyway?

Japanese:
ちゃんと　苦労した
甲斐あるんでしょーね？
English: It better be worth all that trouble we went through.

Japanese: いくらぐらいや思う？
English: How much didja think it’s worth?

Japanese: １００ガルドぐらい
English: 100 Gald

Japanese: １０００ガルドぐらい
English: 1000 Gald

Japanese: １００００ガルドぐらい
English: 10000 Gald

Japanese: １００ガルドぐらいかなぁ？
English: One hundred gald perhaps?

Japanese:
キノコ１本にしちゃあ　破格だけど
その程度じゃ　あの子の生活が
保障されるほどじゃないんじゃない？
English:
That’s one special mushroom, but I don’t think the
children would be able to live well with only that much.

Japanese:
そうだね…
じゃあ　もっと高いのかな
English: You’re right... then it might be more expensive.

Japanese: １０００ガルドぐらいかな？
English: A thousand gald perhaps?

Japanese: キノコ１本で？
English: For one mushroom?

Japanese:
でも　それぐらいじゃないと
高価とは言わないんじゃない？
English:
But if it’s not that much, then you wouldn’t have said it
was expensive in the first place.

Japanese:
よーし　思い切って
１００００ガルド！
English: TEN THOUSAND GALD!

Japanese: うわっはぁ！　景気イイッ！
English: How lively!

Japanese: でも　まさかそんなはずないよねぇ…
English: But it’s probably not that expensive...

Japanese:
正確な額は　わからへんけど
家一軒　建つくらいらしいで
English:
Ah don’ know it’s exact amount but Ah heard that it’s
enough ta let ya build a house.

Japanese: ３０００ガルドぐらい？
English: So around three thousand gald?

Japanese:
ふ～ん
イリアの村じゃ　その値段で
家が建つんだね
English: So that’s enough to build a house in your place, huh?

Japanese:
ムッカ～！！
どーせ　ド辺境育ちよ！
English: Well EXCUSE ME for being a country bumpkin!

Japanese: うわっ　暴力反対～！
English: Hey, no violence!

Japanese:
ちょお　家建てる相場
教えたってぇや～
English: Wait, tell me how much it is first!

Japanese: さっきの話　どう思う？
English: What do you think?

Japanese:
そうですね　霊薬として
珍重されている　キノコだそうですから
確かにそのくらいは…
English:
Well, since it is a highly valued mushroom... I assume 
its price would be...

Japanese:
…ということは
１０万ガルドは下らないか…
English: More or less, around a hundred thousand gald...

Japanese:
かじった跡があるから
おそらく　買い叩かれるでしょうね
それでも　５万ガルドは下らないかと
English:
Since it already has a bite, its price would be lower. 
Somewhere around fifty thousand gald...

Japanese:
フン　運のいいガキどもだ
一日にして　ひと財産か…
English:
Lucky brats... First day of the month and they’ve
already gotten a fortune...

Japanese:
あの子と　その友達が慎ましく
暮らすだけなら　数年は大丈夫でしょう
ただ　問題は…
English:
If they lived modestly, it might be able to last them for
a few years.
The only problem is...

Japanese:
エルマーナが　転生者ということだな
さて　どうするか…
English:
That Hermana’s a Reincarnator.
What to do...

Japanese: エルマーナのパワー
English: Hermana’s Power

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: すげーじゃん　おまえの力
English: Man, your power’s so cool!

Japanese:
あんな　力一杯
人どついたん　初めてやわ
ウチ　強かってんなぁ
English:
That’s the first time Ah let loose everythin’ in
one punch! Ah sure am strong!

Japanese:
やっぱり　ヴリトラは
頼りになるね！
English: Vritra really is reliable!

Japanese:
ホンマ？
ウチ　みんなに付いて行っても
ジャマにならへん？
English:
Ya sure?
Ah won’t get in the way if Ah come with ya?

Japanese:
ああ　あの戦いぶりなら
ルカなんかより
よっぽど　役に立つぜ
English:
Damn right!
You’re prolly more useful in battle than Ruca here.

Japanese: 肯定する
English: Agree

Japanese: 否定する
English: Disagree

Japanese:
素手で　あれだけ強いなんて
やっぱり　龍の力だね
僕なんて　足元にも及ばないよ
English:
To hit that hard even while bare-handed, 
I can’t hold a candle to a dragon’s power.

Japanese:
あー　そんな風に
自分のこと言うたら　あかんで
English: Bro, puttin’ it that way’s kinda bad.

Japanese: どうして？
English: How so?

Japanese:
アスラは　そんなん言わへんかった
…まあ　兄ちゃんにアスラと同じこと
求めても　しゃあないけどな
English:
Asura ain’t the type ta say it that way... welp, 
is not like Bro and Asura’s the same 
person anyways.

Japanese:
そ…　そうだね
僕も　もっと堂々としてなきゃ
English:
Y-You’re right...
But I’d like to gain his confidence.

Japanese:
似合わねェよ
オドオドしてない　おまえなんて
English: I can’t really imagine you being bold.

Japanese: …やっぱ　そうだよね
English: You’re right...

Japanese:
そう…　かな？
目覚めたばかりの　彼女より
今なら　まだ僕の方が役に立ちそうだけど…
English:
Is that so...? I think I’m still more useful than some girl
who just awakened though...

Japanese:
お！　おまえも
言うようになったじゃねーか！
English: Oh! You sure know some big words!

Japanese:
へえ？　そら楽しみやなぁ
アスラを　思い出させてくれるような
ええ戦いっぷり　見せてもらうか
English:
That so? Ah can’t wait ta see what ya managed ta 
remember in battle.

Japanese:
だな！　じゃあ　ルカ
おまえ　しばらく切り込み隊長な！
English:
Damn right.
So, for the moment you’ll be our attack leader!

Japanese:
ええ…！
そんなぁ　うわ～
余計なこと言っちゃったよ～
English:
Wha--?!
Oh dear... seems like I’ve said too much this time.

Japanese: 抱っこの感触
English: The Feeling of Being Hugged

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
エル！
おまえを見込んで　頼みがある！
English: Hermie, we have a big favor to ask of you!

Japanese: なんやの３人そろうて…
English: What didja three need?

Japanese: いや　僕たちはスパーダに…
English: No, Spada--

Japanese:
頼み込まれて
ムリヤリ連れて来られ…
English:
Well, we are not here for a request per say, 
it is more like Spada forcibly brought us along...

Japanese: うるせェ！
English: Shut it!

Japanese:
痛ッ！
ぶつことないじゃないか
English: Ow! You just hit me...

Japanese:
ぜひ　聞かせてくれ！
アンジュの抱っこの感触は
どど…　どうだった？
English: Please, tell me... what did Ange’s hug feel like?

Japanese:
なんや　そんな話かぁ
３人とも　やっぱり男やなぁ
English:
Oh, that?
Man, ya three really are boys...

Japanese:
いや　ボクは別に…
どうして　ボクまで　こんな話に
巻き込まれてるんだ…
English:
No, it is not that... 
Why did I get involved in this?

Japanese: そらぁ　ええもんやったでぇ
English: Oh it’s fine, it’s fine!

Japanese:
ゴクッ
で…　どんな感じだった？
English:
*gulp* 
So... how did it feel like?

Japanese:
ホンマ　柔らこぉてなぁ
ウットリしてもうたわぁ
あれは　枕に最適やで！
English:
It’s mighty soft, like divin’ inta clouds.
Like the best pillow!

Japanese:
お　おうッ！
確かに　あのサイズだしな…
English: O-Oh! Indeed if it’s that big...

Japanese:
あの肌触り…
くっついた　ほっぺたが
喜んどったもん
English: An’ the feelin’ as it clings ta yer cheek’s the greatest.

Japanese:
マジか！
くそう　羨ましいぜェッ！！
English: Really!? I sure am jealous!

Japanese:
ホンマ　あの服
ええ生地　使ぉてるわぁ～
English: An’ she uses the best type of fabric fer her clothes～

Japanese: は？
English: Huh?

Japanese:
柔らこぉて　肌触りもええ
着心地も　最高の服やろなぁ…
English:
It’s soft texture gotta feel good ta wear.
Truly the best clothes Ah’ve felt since...

Japanese:
あのぅ　エルマーナさん？
そういうことが聞きたいわけでは
なくてデスねぇ
English: Uh... Miss Hermana? That’s not what I meant.

Japanese:
もう　説明するん面倒くさいわ
自分で　抱っこしてもろたらええやん
ウチ　言うてきてあげよか？
English:
Huh? Ya sure are makin’ it hard fer me here.
If ya want Ah can ask Sis ta give ya a hug, hear?

Japanese: け…　結構だッ！
English: P-Pass!

Japanese:
……まったく
スパーダも　しょうがないね
English: Oh, Spada...

Japanese:
せやな
でも　ルカ兄ちゃんたちにやったら
聞かせたってもええで？
English:
Right. But y’know, Ruca Bro? If ya want Ah can tell ya
more ’bout it?

Japanese:
いや　だから　ボクは別に
そういうの　興味ないんだけど…
English:
No, like I said, I am not particularly interested in these 
kinds of... things.

Japanese: 喜ぶ
English: Gratefully accept

Japanese: 照れる
English: Get embarrassed

Japanese: ホ…　ホントに！？
English: R-Really!?

Japanese:
あ～　その顔
さっきのスパーダ兄ちゃんと
おんなじ表情やわぁ　やーらしっ！
English:
Oh that face’s jus’ like what Spada Bro had earlier.
Nasty...

Japanese: か…　顔に出ちゃってたかな…
English: D-Did I really make that expression...

Japanese:
男の子やもんなぁ　そら当然やわ
でもアスラは　モテモテやったのに…
兄ちゃんには縁　なさそうやなぁ
English:
Ya really are a boy, ’course it’s natural. But y’know?
Asura was well-liked... Seems like ya ain’t like ’em 
in that way.

Japanese:
もう　そういうのヘコむからさ
勘弁してよ…
English: I give up. Sorry...

Japanese:
エヘヘ
もう　照れてからに！
かわいいなぁ
English: Haha, yer so cute when yer embarrassed!

Japanese:
そ…　そんなぁ
別にいいよぉ…
English: N-No thanks... It’s fine.

It’s fine if yer embarrassed. Sis Ange’s boobies are... 
how do Ah put it...

Japanese:
あわわわわ！
ストップ！　ストップ！
English:
Woah!
Hold on! Stop!

Japanese:
なんや　照れてしもて
素直やないなぁ…
ホンマは　聞きたいクセに～
English:
What’re ya bein’ embarrassed fer? Ya sure ain’t bein’
honest with yerself. Truth is, ya really want to know 
don’tcha～?

Japanese: 秘密の地下室
English: The Secret Basement

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
教会の下に
秘密の地下室かぁ…
English: A secret basement underneath the church, huh...

Japanese:
どないしたん？
なんやオモロイ顔になってんで？
English: What’s up with the excited look on yer face?

Japanese:
だってよォ　「地下室」の上に
さらに「秘密」と来たもんだ！
これが落ち着いていられるか！
English:
It’s a basement, man. A secret basement.
As if I can calm down after hearing that!

Japanese:
あかん
ウチ　ようわからへん…
English: Oh man, Ah don’ get this at all...

Japanese: 僕も　よくわからないなぁ
English: I don’t get it either...

Japanese:
じゃ…　じゃあ
コンウェイなら　わかるだろ！？
English: Then K-Kongwei, do you get it too!?

Japanese:
わかるわけないだろ
なに言ってるんだ　キミは？
English:
Get it? I have not the faintest idea of what you are 
talking about.

Japanese:
「秘密」って言葉は
謎めいてて　楽しそうだけど
どうして「地下室」で　そんなに…
English:
Well I get why you’d get excited on what the “secret”
might be, but I don’t really get the “basement” part...

Japanese:
確かに　ボクも
「秘密」という言葉には
多少の興味を　そそられるけど…
English:
Indeed, I am also quite interested about what this
“secret” might pertain to...

Japanese: なんで　わかんねェんだよ！
English: Why DON’T you understand it!?

Japanese: わからないね
English: I do not comprehend.

Japanese: さっぱりだよ
English: Not at all.

Japanese:
ちぇ…　なんだよ
「秘密の地下室」だぜ？
English: Tch... It’s a “secret basement”, man.

Japanese:
秘密基地の　匂いがするじゃねェか
それだけで興奮するだろ　普通！
ホント　おめェら　ノリ悪ぃな！
English:
It has the same vibe as a secret base, so it’s totally
normal to be excited about these kinds of things.
Y’all don’t get it at all!

Japanese:
スパーダが　下水道なんかに
隠れ家を作った理由が
なんとなくわかったよ…
English: I think I get why you hid your place in a sewer now...

Japanese: そうだね…
English: Indeed...

Japanese: なし
English: None

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
なんだよ
ハルトマンいねェのか…
English: Oh, Gramps ain’t here...

Japanese:
そんなバカな！
うまいメシのジジイ　いないのか　しかし！
コーダ絶望したぞ！　しかし！
English:
That can’t be! Tasty Food Gramps isn’t here!? 
Coda’s depressed.

Japanese: …メシって　そこまで大事か？
English: “Tasty food?” So you care about him to that extent?

Japanese: 技術への関心
English: Technological Interests

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
教会の地下に入るような
機械仕掛けって　僕大好きだな
どういう構造になってるの？
English:
I really like the mechanism that caused the basement
door to open. I wonder what sort of structure it has?

Japanese:
昔　私も同じ質問をしたことがあったけど
帰ってきた答えは　ひとつ
「すべては　天の恵みだ」
English:
I remember asking a similar question as a child but the 
answer I got was just “It is Cielo’s blessing.”

Japanese:
……え？
じゃあ　あの仕掛けって
天術に関係あるの！？
English:
Huh...? Then does that contraption have
something to do with Cielan Artes?

Japanese: さあ？
English: Who knows...

Japanese:
さあって…
それは　秘密を守るために
僕には　教えちゃダメってこと？
English:
“Who knows”? Does that mean you won’t tell me
because you can’t?

Japanese:
ううん　私に「すべては　天の恵みだ」と
教えてくれた人も　それ以上は
教えてくれなかったの
English:
Not at all. They only told me that it was because of 
“Cielo’s blessing”, nothing more.

Japanese:
きっと　さっぱり理解できてなかったか
興味がなかったかの　どちらかね
English:
I am sure they either did not understand how 
it worked nor did they have any interest in 
knowing why it works.

Japanese:
えっと　じゃあ
アンジュは　それ以上
調べたりはしなかったの？
English:
Uhh... then, were you unable 
to examine it a little closer?

Japanese:
言ったでしょ？
「すべては　天の恵みだ」って
それで十分じゃない
English:
Have I not told you that it is all because of Cielo’s
blessing? I think that should be enough.

Japanese: アンジュも　興味ないんだね…
English: So you’re not interested in it...

Japanese: 爆睡の理由
English: Justifying a Power Nap

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
はぁ～　教会の地下では
ホンマ　よぉ寝たなぁ…
English: Man, Ah slept mighty well in the library...

Japanese:
そーだなー
よく寝たなー　しかし
English: I slept well too though～

Japanese:
あっきれた！
あんたたち　ホントにサボッてたのね
English: Damn, so you two were really slacking off, huh...

Japanese:
せやけど　寝られるときには
寝とった方がええって　言うてたんやもん
リカルドのおっちゃんが
English:
Right, but Uncle Ricardo said that ya should sleep
when ya hafta sleep.

Japanese:
そんなのサボるための
口実に決まってんでしょ？
English:
Didn’t it occur to you that’s not a 
good reason for slacking off?

Japanese:
そうそう　ウチも　そない思てん
せやから　サボったらあかんでって
注意してん
English:
Well, Ah thought so too. That’s why Ah tried 
ta warn ’em that it ain’t good ta slack off.

Japanese:
そーだそーだ
そう言ってたな
エルはマジメだなー　しかし
English: She did, she did, Hermie’s really honest!

Japanese:
ほんなら　サボりやのぉて
息抜きやねんて
その方が効率よう働けるて　言わはってぇ
English:
He told me that if he slacked off he’d be able
ta conserve energy an’ work efficiently.

Japanese:
寝られるときには　寝た方がいいって話が
急に効率の話に
スリ替わってるじゃないのよ
English:
You told me earlier that he’d sleep when he feels like 
it and now you tell me that it’s about efficiency.
You just changed your excuse!

Japanese:
そうやってん
そんときは　気付かへんかってんけど
あとで「言い逃れやん！」って思うて…
English:
Right, at the time Ah didn’t notice, but eventually Ah
realized that he managed ta escape.

Japanese: もちろん　言ったのよね？
English: I suppose you told him that?

Japanese: まあ　夢の中でやけどな
English: Yeah! In my dreams!

Japanese:
言ってないじゃない！
ホント　しょうがないわねぇ！
English:
So you didn’t tell him!?
You really are hopeless!

Japanese: 何食えたんやろ…
English: I Wonder What We’re Eating...

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
なあ　ルカ兄ちゃん
コーダが言うとった
タダ飯の話なんやけどな？
English:
Say, Ruca Bro, Ah have a question ‘bout this 
free meal that Coda menshuned...

Japanese:
ハルトマンさんのこと？
タダ飯呼ばわりは　ヒドいよ
お世話になる人なんだからさ
English:
Are you perhaps talking about Hartman? Calling him 
a “free meal” is kind of mean. He’s someone who took 
care of us.

Japanese:
せやなあ
…で　どんな美味しいもん
食べさせてもろたん？
English:
Right... so, what kinda delicious food did he let ya
eat?

Japanese: 期待させる
English: Raise her expectations

Japanese: あまり期待を持たせない
English: Don’t raise her expectations

Japanese:
それはそれは
料理は大した物だったよ
English: Quite a lot!

Japanese:
ハルトマンさんは　スパーダのお屋敷で
働いていた人だから
いい物を食べてたんだろうね
English:
Since Hartman worked for Spada’s family, he must’ve
made a lot of good food.

Japanese:
ホンマか！　ほなちょっとくらい
旅なんか遅れたってええやん！
English: Right! Then, we should hurry up to his place!

Japanese:
ほんで　リカルドのおっちゃんなんか
待たせとったら　ええねん！
ご飯食べよ！
English:
Then it’s fine if we jus’ eat and 
make Uncle Ricardo wait!

Japanese:
なに言ってるんだよ
ダメだよ　そんなの！
English: What are you saying? That’s mean!

Japanese:
…冗談やん
そない　怒らんでも
ええやん…
English: Ah was kiddin’... Don’ get mad...

Japanese:
そんなに期待しない方がいいよ？
美味しいけど　家庭料理の域は
出ないからね
English:
Don’t expect much, alright? It’s tasty but it’s 
not as tasty as what my mom cooks.

Japanese:
そうなん？　あ…　でも待てよ？
ルカ兄ちゃん　ええとこのボンボンやから
舌は肥えとるはずや
English:
That so? Oh, now that ya menshun it, Ah forgot yer a
rich kid so yer palate must be quite refined.

Japanese: そんなことないと思うけど…
English: I don’t think that’s it...

Japanese:
ちゅうことは　ウチみたいな庶民派の
質より量タイプにとったら
かなりのご馳走やな！
English:
Reckon ya mean that the portion of food he served 
must be quite large compared to what we 
normal folk eat!

Japanese:
食事については　今回は時間がないから…
でも　また来る機会があれば
お世話になるはずだよ
English:
This time, we won’t have enough time to eat 
his cooking but, whenever we have the 
chance we can take our time.

Japanese:
せやな　ほな　きちんと
挨拶しとかんと　あかんなぁ
English: Right. Then, Ah hafta greet ‘em properly then.

Japanese:
「ウチのルカが　いつも
　お世話になっております」っちゅう感じで
ええのんかいな？
English:
Would sumthin’ like, “thanks for takin’ 
care of Ruca” be good enough?

Japanese:
あはは…
まあ　それで構わないけどね
English: I guess that’s fine...

Japanese:
おっしゃあ　メシ！　…やない
挨拶は　ウチに任せといたってや！
English:
A’ight! Let’s git ourselves some food... or 
not. Jus’ leave the greetin’ ta me!

Japanese: オズバルドって？１
English: Oswald Is...? (1)

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
リカルドさん
オズバルドという方を　ご存知ですか？
English:
Sir Ricardo, are you perhaps aware
of a man named “Oswald?”

Japanese:
知らんな
軍の高官に　そんな名前のヤツがいた気はするが
English:
Not at all, I’d have recognized his
name if he were a higher rank.

Japanese:
リカルドのおっちゃん
知らんの？
そういうの詳しそうやのに
English:
Ya don’ know, old man Ricardo?
Ah thought ya knew everythin’!

Japanese:
あいにく　傭兵風情には
軍の高官など　縁がないものだ
それと…
English:
Unfortunately, a lowly mercenary wouldn’t
have any relation with high ranking military 
officials, and also...

Japanese: それと？
English: Also?

Japanese:
あまり　おっさん呼ばわりされるのは
好きではないな
English: I don’t really like being called an “old man”...

Japanese:
ちゃうちゃう！
「おっさん」やのぉて
「おっちゃん」やで？
English:
A’ight, a’ight, so rather than “old man”
can Ah call ya “uncle” then?

Japanese:
そのふたつって
違いがあるの？
English: Is there any differences between those two?

Japanese:
当ったり前やん
言い方　ゼンゼン柔らかいやろ？
English: Course! “Uncle” is more pleasant, right?

Japanese:
そうねぇ
でも　リカルドさんは別の呼び方をして
欲しいみたいだけど
English:
I suppose... but it seems that Sir Ricardo
would rather be addressed differently.

Japanese:
そんなん　面倒くさいわ
ウチから見たら　おっちゃんは
おっちゃんやん
English:
That’s so troublesum though, Ah see
’em either as an “uncle” or an “old man”.

Japanese:
……
…………そうか
おっちゃんなのか…
English: I see... “Uncle”, huh...

Japanese: 船旅
English: Voyage

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
船かぁ…
あたし　苦手なのよねぇ
English: A ship, huh... I’m not really good with ships...

Japanese:
僕も船旅なんて　初めてだよ
別荘近くの湖での　舟遊びなら
経験あるけど
English:
This is going to be my first time being on a ship!
Although, I do have experience riding on a boat
on the lake beside my villa.

Japanese:
なにそれ
ムカツクーッ！
English: That kinda pisses me off...

Japanese:
でもよ
イリアって　船旅したことあるんだろ？
だったらルカよりもスゲェじゃん
English:
Illia, you’ve been on a ship before, right?
Wouldn’t that make you more awesome
than Ruca here?

Japanese:
でも　あたしの場合　自分の村からの
逃避行で　レグヌムまで乗っただけだもん
ゼンゼン楽しくなかったし
English:
Yeah, but since I only took it while running away from
my hometown, it wasn’t really the best of times.

Japanese: 僕と　初めて会ったときのこと？
English: Are you perhaps talking about the time we met?

Japanese:
そーなの
船酔いでゲーゲー戻しちゃって
なにも食べられなかったもん
English:
I was puking from seasickness at the time so I didn’t
get to eat much.

Japanese:
ああ…
だから　腹ペコだったんだね
English: Ohh, so that’s why you were starving.

Japanese:
フ～ンだ！
どーだっていいでしょ！
English: Who cares about that!

Japanese:
私は何度か　経験あるんだけど
最初は　楽しくても
結局　飽きちゃうのよねぇ　船旅って
English:
I have ridden a ship a few times before and,
although it might be fun at the start, it gets 
quite boring towards the end.

Japanese:
そうか？　オレん家には
専属のサーカスがいたから
そんなに　退屈しなかったなぁ
English:
Is that so? My family had an exclusive circus
so it didn’t really get that boring.

Japanese:
せ…　専属のサーカス…？
どうも　スパーダくんの
意見は　一般的じゃないみたいね
English:
An e-exclusive... circus...?
Spada, I think you are missing the point here...

Japanese:
あ～　へいへい
参考にならなくて　すみませんねェ
English: Well excuuse me for not being a good reference point.

Japanese: エルは船　乗ったことある？
English:
How about you, Hermie, have you been on a ship
before?

Japanese:
あるわけないやん
だって　水の上　走るんやろ？
沈むって！　ありえへん
English:
‘Course not. Ah’d hafta travel over water
fer that, right? What if Ah sink?

Japanese:
うーん…　船は沈まないのよ？
そういう構造になってるの
English: Well, did you know that ships are built not to sink?

Japanese:
せやけど　ウチ　沈むで？
水に浮かへんもん
English: But what if they sink? Ah can’t float in water.

Japanese:
エル　こっち　いらっしゃい
きちんと　説明してあげるから
English:
Hermie, come here, I shall explain it to you
properly.

Japanese: やれやれ　先が思いやられるね
English:
Oh dear, everyone else seems 
to be worried about something.

Japanese:
まあ　騒々しいのは　いつものことだけど
今回の船旅は　長くなりそうだから
少し　ツラいかも
English:
Well, they are still the same lively bunch, but 
since the voyage this time will be quite long, 
we may encounter some difficulties ahead.

Japanese:
それに戦争中だから
なにが起こるか
わからないのもあるよね
English:
Well, we would be travelling in the middle of
wartime, so who knows what might happen.

Japanese:
うん
ただの愉快な旅ってわけには
いかないかもしれないね
English:
Indeed, it might not end up as a
pleasant journey this time.

Japanese: アシハラ名物とは？
English: What’s Ashihara’s Specialty?

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
海を渡ると
ずいぶん景色が　違ってくるものね
English:
The scenery sure has changed after crossing an
ocean.

Japanese:
アンジュは
アシハラは　初めてか？
English: Is this your first time in Ashihara, Ange?

Japanese:
ええ　ここは教団から見れば
異教の国ですから
私には　縁がありませんでしたね
English:
Indeed, from the Church’s perspective,
Ashihara’s a paganistic country.
Thus, I have no relation to it.

Japanese: リカルドさんは来たことあるの？
English: How about you, Ricardo?

Japanese:
いや　だが　この国出身の傭兵とは
何度か一緒に　戦ったことがある
English:
No, but I’ve fought alongside a lot of
mercenaries from Ashihara.

Japanese: どんな人たちだった？
English: What kind of people were they?

Japanese:
みな勤勉で　優秀な兵士だったが
魚を生で食べる習慣には
驚かされたな
English:
They are diligent and brilliant mercenaries.
I was quite surprised to see them eat raw fish.

Japanese:
それ　もしかして
火の起こし方を　知らないなんてことは…
English:
To think such a country would lack the concept 
of cooking over a flame...

Japanese:
まさか！
アシハラは　少々ユニークだが
非常に文化的な国だぞ
English:
Of course they would know about fire!
Ashihara might be a bit unique, but
its culture is quite extraordinary.

Japanese:
でも　魚を生で食べるなんて
お腹壊したりしないの？
English:
But eating “raw fish”? Wouldn’t
that destroy your stomach?

Japanese:
いや　川魚はムリだが
海水魚は　わりと平気らしい
English:
No, I believe that only applies for freshwater fish. 
I heard that saltwater fish is quite safe.

Japanese:
俺も　サバイバル訓練で
ずいぶん　いろんな物を食べたが
生の魚も　決して悪い物ではないぞ
English:
I’ve eaten a lot of things during my survival
training and raw fish isn’t that bad.

Japanese:
コーダも　食うぞ　しかし
生の魚　食べてみたいんだな　しかし
English:
Coda wants to eat it! Coda wants to
know what raw fish tastes like though!

Japanese:
ホンマや
それ聞いたら　食わんとしゃあないなぁ
ほな行こ！　はよ行こ！
English:
True! After hearin’ that, Ah wanna know
what it tastes like. Let’s git!

Japanese: 急ぐぞー　しかし！
English: Let’s go though!

Japanese:
確認したいんだけど　生の魚しか
食べないわけじゃないよね？
English:
I’d like to confirm it but, does
it really have to be raw fish?

Japanese:
いや　焼き魚や煮魚
それに魚のすり身なども有名だ
English:
No, grilled and simmered fish and the
like are also well known around here.

Japanese:
ああ　そうなんだ
良かった
ちょっと安心したよ
English: Oh... I see! That’s a relief.

Japanese:
そうね
生以外の魚は　楽しみね
English:
Indeed, I should like to try anything aside from
raw fish.

Japanese:
ボクも生の魚は　遠慮したいな
それに魚以外に　食べる物がないとしたら
それも　ツラいかもね
English:
I would also like to refrain from eating raw fish,
but it would also be a bit difficult if there is no
other food aside from fish here.

Japanese:
ああ　魚の他は
ライスが　主食という話だが…
English:
Aside from fish, I believe the
other staple food here is rice--

Japanese:
ええ～？　ビーフは？　ミート！　お肉！
羊でも馬でも豚でも　いいけどさぁ
お肉はないの？
English:
HUH!? What about beef? MEAT!? Look, I’m
fine with sheep, horse or pig meat but is
there really no meat!?

Japanese:
あるにはあるだろうが　牧畜に適した
土地ではないから　肉は貴重品だろうな
鳥なら　問題ないんじゃないか？
English:
I’m sure there’s some, but land fit for livestock is 
quite scarce, so meat in this area tends to be quite
valuable. I suppose you’d be fine with bird meat?

Japanese:
ええ～　そんなんじゃ
力出ないわよ！
English:
Nooo, if it’s bird meat I won’t be able to bring 
out my full power!

Japanese:
じゃあ　どんな食べ物があるか
私たちも　確かめに行きましょ
楽しみね！
English:
Then, we should check out what kinds
of food there are. I cannot wait!

Japanese:
食事ひとつで　大騒ぎだな
まったく　やれやれだ
English:
Good grief, once food becomes a topic,
everyone becomes quite lively.

Japanese: イリアと二人っきり…
English: Alone with Illia...

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
うわぁ…　イリアとふたりきりだ…
な…　なにを話せばいいんだろ？
これってデート？　デートだよね！？
English:
I’m alone with Illia... I-I wonder what I should talk
about? This is a date, right? Right?

Japanese:
だって　誰にもジャマされず
ふたりで一緒に　時間を過ごすんだもの
間違いなく　デートだよね！？
English:
After all, no one’s going to disturb us, and we 
can pass the time alone together.
This is definitely a date!

Japanese:
ご飯は　どこで食べようかな？
会話のリードは　僕がするものなのかな？
手とか…　つなぐものなのかな？
English:
I wonder where we’ll eat lunch? Would I be 
able to lead the conversation? Can we... hold hands?

Japanese:
なに　おたんこルカ？
どうしたのよ
ボーっとしちゃってさぁ
English: What’s wrong, dummy Ruca? You daydreaming?

Japanese: あ…　ごごごごご　ごめんなさい！
English: I’m s-s-sorry!

Japanese:
別に　謝んなくていいけど…？
ヘンなの
English:
It’s not really something you should be apologizing
for, weirdo.

Japanese:
今の会話って　盛り上がったよね？
さあ　次の話題は…と
え～っと　え～っと…
English:
That conversation just now sure was exciting!
Then, the next topic would be... uhh...

Japanese: ねぇ　ルカってば！
English: RUCA!

Japanese: あわわ　ごめんなさい！
English: I’m sorry!

Japanese:
だから　謝んなくていいってば
早く行きましょ？
English:
That’s not something you should be apologizing for!
Let’s go?

Japanese:
う…　うん　よ～し
本番は　これから　これから！
うまく誘ってみるぞ！
English:
O-Okay... Alright, I should ask her now while I have
the chance!
I hope it goes well...

Japanese: どうしよう…
English: What Do I Do...

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
ああ…　どうしよう
これから　どんな顔して　会えばいいんだろ
…もう戻らないでおこうかな
English:
What do I do...? What expression should
I use when I meet her again...?
I can’t go back now...

Japanese:
いや　そんなことできないよぉ
案外　普通に接すれば大丈夫…かな？
だ…　大丈夫だよね？
English:
I can’t just run away... Let’s just go back
there as if nothing happened... It’s going
to be alright, right?

Japanese:
…………
………………
ああ…　バカなことしちゃったなぁ
English: Gosh, I’m so stupid...

Japanese:
はぁ…　僕のバカ！
もう　どうしたらいいんだろ…
English: Stupid! What should I dooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooooo...?

Japanese: 気まずい…
English: How Awkward...

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
…………
…………あのぅ　イリア？
English: Um... Illia?

Japanese:
むー…
とっとと行くわよ！
English: Tch, we’re going!

Japanese:
ね…　ねえ！　ちょっと待って！
あのぅ
ご…　ごめんなさい…
English: Hey, wait... I’m... I’m sorry.

Japanese:
はぁ？
なんで　謝ってんのよ！？
English: HUH? What are you apologizing for?

Japanese:
だって　イリア
怒ってるみたいだから…
English: Well, you look angry...

Japanese:
どうして　あたしが怒ると
あんたが　謝んのよ？
English: So? Why do you have to apologize when I’m angry?

Japanese: え…　あ…　だってさ…
English: Huh? Because I...

Japanese:
ああ　もう！
あんたってヤツは　もうっ！
English: Damn it! I GIVE UP ON YOU!

Japanese:
…もういいわ
ほら　怒ってないから
港へ行くわよ！
English: It’s fine... I’m not angry, okay? Let’s get moving.

Japanese: …やっぱり　怒ってるじゃないかぁ
English: So you really are angry...

Japanese: あのルカに限って！
English: Lock That Ruca Up!

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ねえねえ　聞いてよ！
English: Hey, y’know what?

Japanese: ああ？　どーしたよ？
English: What is it?

Japanese:
あたし　ルカのヤツが
ウジウジ　うっとうしいから
しばらく放っといたの
English:
Ruca’s been sulking so much that it’s
starting to piss me off. Let’s beat him up!

Japanese:
すると　あいつ
なにしてたと思う？
悠長に　ナンパしてやがったのよ！
English:
What the hell does that idiot think
we’re doing exactly? Damn flirt!

Japanese:
あの　ルカがァ？
ンなわけねーだろ！
English: Ruca? No damn way he’s like that!

Japanese:
マジだって！
しかも　それはそれは
も～う濃厚な　ラブシーンを…
English:
Yes way! And y’know what, he
had this passionate moment wi--

Japanese:
ラブシーン？
おい　イリア
なんで　そんなウソつくんだ？
English:
A “passionate moment!?” 
Why are you lying about stuff like that, Illia?

Japanese:
なんでウソって
決め付けんのよ！
English:
Why the hell would I lie to you?
And what makes you so sure it’s a lie?

Japanese:
ったりめーじゃねェか！
このオレが　あのルカに
先を越されてたまるかってんだ！
English: Ain’t that obvious? As if Ruca could get ahead of me!

Japanese:
とーにかく！
おたんこルカの　スケベ少年
認定だからね！
English:
ANYWAYS! 
Just remember that dummy Ruca’s a perv!

Japanese:
…クッ　信じねェ！
オレは　そんな話　信じねェ！
ルカ　オレは　おまえを信じてるぜ！
English:
No way, I don’t believe this!
As if I’d believe such a thing!
Ruca, I believe in you!

Japanese: 真実を　突き止めてやる！
English: I’ll dig into this for sure!

Japanese:
なにが信じてるぜ！　…やねん
「真実　突き止める」ゆうてる時点で
ゼンゼン信じてへんやん…
English:
“Ah believe in ya” he says while lookin’ inta it...
Ya totally don’ believe in ’em.

Japanese: ホントのところは？
English: What happened, Exactly?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
あ　スパーダ
一体どうし…
English: Oh, Spada, what’s the ma--

Japanese:
やぁ　ルカくん
ご機嫌うるわしゅう
English: Yo, Ruca, I hope you’re in good health!

Japanese:
さて　今日の議題は他でもない
イリアくんからの　タレコミなんだが
おまえ　ナンパしてたって？
English:
Now, first things first, I heard from
Illia that you’re a “playboy?”

Japanese:
ち…　違うよ！
僕がナンパなんて　できるはず
ないじゃないか！
English: N-No! As if I’d be able to hit on someone!

Japanese:
だよなぁ…　心の底から　安心したぜェ
おまえに　そんな天を恐れぬ
大それたことできるわけねェよな！
English:
Right, what a relief! There’s no way in
Cielo you’d be able to do that.

Japanese:
…………
そういう反応されると　それはそれで
カチンと来るんだけど…
English: Seeing you react that way hurt me a bit, though...

Japanese:
でも　どうしてイリアは
そんな告げ口を　スパーダにしたの？
ゼンゼン事実と　違うじゃないか！
English:
But why would Illia tell you such a thing?
That’s the complete opposite of what
actually happened!

Japanese: 事実って　なんだよ？
English: So what happened, exactly?

Japanese:
…実は　チトセさんに会ったんだ
それで　ふたりで話をしていたら
イリアがやって来て…
English:
So, I ended up meeting Chitose and
we ended up talking together until Illia came.

Japanese:
ンだとぉ！
やっぱり
ヨロシクやってんじゃねェか！
English: What the heck!? So you really were flirting?

Japanese: 話をしただけだよ！
English: NO! We were just chatting!

Japanese:
話をしただけ？　まあそうだろうな…
でも　これでわかった
ただの腹いせかよ
English:
Just “chatting”, huh? I think I
get it now, it’s just revenge.

Japanese:
やっぱり　チトセさんを誘ったのが
悪かったんだな…
English: So inviting Chitose out to talk was a bad idea, huh...

Japanese: どうした？　ブツブツ言ってよ
English: What? If you have any gripes just let it out, man.

Japanese:
なんでもないよ
でもこれって　謝った方がいいよね？
English:
It’s nothing... I think I really should
apologize to Illia, shouldn’t I?

Japanese:
いや　イリアのヤツ　おまえに
怒ってるわけじゃねェしな
ただチトセが嫌いなだけだよ　こりゃ
English:
Nah, man, she’s not mad at you.
She just hates Chitose a lot.

Japanese:
…ああ　そういうことか
納得
English: Ohh so that’s why... I think I get it!

Japanese:
…じゃないよ！
それでどうして　僕に嫌がらせするのさ！
イリアって
English:
Wait, no I don’t get it! If she hates Chitose
then why would she pester me about it?

Japanese: そりゃあ　おまえ…
English: Well... it’s coz you...

Japanese: うん？
English: Me?

Japanese:
まあ…
星の巡り合わせってヤツだな
諦めろ
English: Well, it’s just happenstance, let it be.

Japanese:
…………
諦めないといけないのかなぁ
English: Is it really hopeless to keep hanging on...?

Japanese: ヘンな口調だったけど…？
English: A Weird Way of Talking...?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
お墓の門番
なーんかヘンな口調のヤツが
ひとりいたよね？　あれって　なに？
English:
Those gravekeepers sure have a weird
way of talking. What’s up with that?

Japanese:
なんだろう
節回しといい　お化粧といい
独特だったけど
English:
Their manner of speaking and even
their cosmetics are quite peculiar too...

Japanese:
あれが　ひょっとして
アシハラの伝統文化「カブキ」かな？
English:
Could it perhaps be part of 
Ashihara’s culture, the “Kabuki?”

Japanese: …カブキ？
English: Kabuki?

Japanese:
私も　よく知らないけど
節回しやメイクに　特徴のある
大衆向けの演劇らしいの
English:
I am not quite familiar with it, but I heard
that its characteristic make-up and manner
of speaking is what makes it stand out.

Japanese:
わざわざ門番しながら
伝統文化の練習ってわけ？
大変ねぇ
English:
So you mean that they’re making actors act
as gravekeepers as practice? That’s unfortunate.

Japanese: アシハラの文化も　どうなるかわからない
English: I have no idea what will happen with Ashihara’s culture.

Japanese:
島民全員が　力を合わせて
伝えていくしかないのでしょうね
English:
But the islanders probably have no choice but
to cooperate with each other to propagate their culture.

Japanese:
…あの人　個人の
趣味なんじゃないかなぁ
English: I wonder if it’s their hobby...?

Japanese: 契約内とはいえ
English: The Contract’s Contents

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
アンジュ　人助けとはいえ
自ら　危険に飛び込むような
行動は困るぞ
English:
Ange, it is quite troublesome that you keep
jumping in front of danger just to save someone.

Japanese:
確かに　リカルドさんが
守ってくれるからといって
なにをしてもいいとは　思いませんけど…
English:
While that may be true, I do not believe it is
acceptable to abstain from taking action just
because you are protecting me.

Japanese: でも　今回は仕方ないでしょ？
English: However, this situation is quite unavoidable, is it not?

Japanese:
…プロの意見としては
俺に任せて　ひとり残ってもらうという
提案をさせて　もらいたいところだがな
English:
I still heavily prefer that you leave the
extermination request for me to handle...

Japanese:
そんなに　私の護衛は
負担ですか？
English:
Oh my, is protecting me that
heavy of a responsibility for you?

Japanese: 任せるように言う
English: Leave it to us

Japanese: 違うと言う
English: That’s not it

Japanese:
リカルドさんの言う通り　僕たちに任せてよ
リカルドさんは　アンジュに
ケガをして欲しくないだけだよ
English:
As Ricardo said, just leave it to us.
After all, he only wants you to be safe.

Japanese:
あら　それは私も同じ気持ちよ？
みんなにケガして　欲しくないから
私も一緒に　行きたいのに…
English:
But that is also why I am fighting with you,
I do not want anyone to get hurt...

Japanese: そんなの　ちょっとズルい
English: That’s a bit unfair...

Japanese:
そういう意味じゃなくて
リカルドさんは　アンジュに
ケガをして欲しくないだけだよ
English:
That’s not what Ricardo meant; he meant
that he just wants you to be safe.

Japanese: ああ　そういうことだな
English: Exactly.

Japanese: あら　お優しいのね
English: Oh, how kind of you.

Japanese:
そのお気持ちは　ありがたいけど
私だけ　のんびり
待ってるわけにはいきません
English:
I am glad that you think that way, but I have
no intention of leisurely relaxing in the backlines.

Japanese:
ふぅ…
そう言うだろうと　思っていた
ただ一応　提案してみただけだ
English: As I thought... I only proposed it for the time being.

Japanese:
でも　ホントのところ
アンジュの助けがないと
僕らも　無事では済まないよね
English:
But to be honest, if you’re not with us, we
would’ve gotten in way more trouble.

Japanese: まあ　そうだな
English: That’s true...

Japanese:
私を仲間外れなんかには
させませんからね？
English: I will not allow myself get left behind, after all.

Japanese:
もう　そういう提案はなしですよ
リカルドさん
English: That is why I reject your proposal.

Japanese:
心得た
依頼人の意向に沿おう
English: Understood. I’ll do as you wish.

Japanese:
はい　それでは　私の護衛
よろしくお願いしますね
English: Then, I am counting on you to have my back.

Japanese: チトセ過敏
English: Oversensitivity Regarding Chitose

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
美しい島なのに
水没の危機にあるなんて…
チトセさんも　悲しんでたよ
English:
It must be quite sad for Chitose to gradually
see her beautiful hometown slowly sink into the sea...

Japanese:
へええぇええぇぇぇ～
むわぁぁたチトセさんのお話ですかぁ？
耳にタコが　できそうですわぁぁ
English:
Ewwwww he’s yakking about Chitose again!
You never shut up, do you?

Japanese:
耳にタコって…
僕　そんなにチトセチトセ
言ってないじゃないか！
English:
“I never shut up?” It’s not like 
I’m always talking about her!

Japanese:
は～い　今　二回言いましたね！
あと一回でも　言ったら
豪華賞品　贈呈決定！
English:
But you just said her name TWICE! Hey, if 
you say it one more time I’ll give you an 
extravagant present!

Japanese:
「一度聞いたら　次の誕生日までに
　忘れないと　不幸になる言葉」を
耳元で　ささやきます！
English:
I’ll whisper words about the misfortune that will
occur on your birthday so that you won’t forget.

Japanese:
なんだよ
その嫌がらせ！
イリアは　チト…
English:
So you’re gonna harass me?! Aren’t you being
a bit too oversensitive about Miss Chito--

Japanese: チ・ト？
English: “Chito...?”

Japanese:
チトホニャララさんのこと
意識しすぎなんじゃないの！？
English: About Miss Chito Miranda!

Japanese:
はて？　ワタクシ
「チトホニャララさん」のことなんて
意識しておりましたっけかしら～？
English:
Pardon me, but did you just say that I’m oversensitive 
about this Miss Chito Miranda person?

Japanese: もういいよ…
English: Oh forget about it...

Japanese:
フンだ！
なによ！　勝手に怒っちゃってさ！
English: Blah! Why even get offended, like yuck!

Japanese:
どう見ても
怒っとるのんは
イリア姉ちゃんのほうやんか…
English: No matter how ya look at it, Illia’s definitely angry...

Japanese:
やれやれ
ホント　そうだよね
English: Oh dear... it really does seem that way, does it not?

Japanese:
ねえ　これからしばらく
ボクたち　あれに付き合わないと
いけないのかな？
English:
Do you think it is fine for us to
leave them be for the time being?

Japanese:
付き合うたらな　あかんのんちゃう？
ちゅうか　逆に楽しむくらいやないとな！
English:
Ya mean it would be bad if we continued interactin’ 
with ’em? Ah reckon it’d be way more interestin’.

Japanese:
キミは　小さいのに
そういうところは
本当に　前向きだなぁ
English: You sure are optimistic despite your stature.

Japanese: 庶民派国王
English: King of Common People

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
さっきのジロチョウという
おじいさん
あの格好で　王さまだったんだね
English:
So it seems that the Town Elder back there
was the king of this country...

Japanese:
なんや不思議やなぁ
王さまって　お城のデッカイ椅子に座って
踏ん反り返ってるもんやと　思うてたで
English:
That’s strange, Ah thought a king’s s’pposed ta be
sumbody who sits on a chair in a castle
an’ orders people ’round.

Japanese:
今のアシハラは　滅亡の危機だからね
ああして　民衆の声が
直に聞こえる場所にいるんだろうね
English:
Ashihara, as it is now, is in the imminent danger
of sinking. I assume he’s there so he can
easily be called when in need.

Japanese:
でも　特に忙しそうには
見えなかったけどね
English: He did not appear to be preoccupied, now did he?

Japanese:
そうそう
むしろ　ヒマそうだったよね
English: Right, he did seem to be relaxing back there.

Japanese: 言い返す
English: Repeat what you say

Japanese: 同意する
English: Agree

Japanese:
それは…　どうかな？
一国の王さまが　ヒマなわけないと思うよ
たまたま　そう見えただけじゃないの？
English:
Was that the case? I think we just happened to 
catch him during his spare time. Kings are busy,
after all.

Japanese:
そうかもしれんけど
ルカ兄ちゃん
なんで　そんなにあの人の肩持つん？
English:
That might be the case, but why’re ya making up
an excuse fer a fella like him, Ruca Bro?

Japanese:
もしかして　老人専門の趣味に
なっちゃったんじゃない？
English:
Maybe it’s coz Ruca enjoys
the same hobby as he does?

Japanese:
そんな！
ちちち　違うったら！
僕はただ普通に　そう思っただけで…
English: No! O-Of course not! That’s just a normal conclusion...

Japanese:
そない慌てて　否定せんでも…
ええ加減　イリア姉ちゃんの冗談ぐらい
受け流せるようにならんとあかんで？
English:
Now don’ be so flustered. Ya gotta learn ta take a 
joke from Sis Illia, hear?

Japanese:
確かに　そんな感じだったよね
でも　たまたまじゃない？
一国の王さまが　ヒマなんてことないと思うよ
English:
It did seemed that way, didn’t it? But it might also be
the case that we just happened to catch him during
his free time. Kings are busy, you know.

Japanese: まあ　そらそうやろな
English: Yeah, that’s prolly true.

Japanese:
…あたしのパパなんて
あんなんじゃなかった
English: My Papa’s not always busy though?

Japanese:
そうか　イリアって村長の娘だったね
お父さん　開拓民の村で
バリバリと　働いてたの？
English:
Ohh, your father is a village chief, right?
Is your father actively working on
your village’s development?

Japanese:
ううん
もっっっとダラダラしてたよ？
English: Not really... It’s more at a leisurely pace...

Japanese:
でも　あんな暮らしできるんやったら
ウチも　王族になりたいわ
English: But, y’know, Ah sure wanna be a royal sumday.

Japanese:
あら　エルったら
どうやって　王族になるつもりなの？
English: And how are you planning on doing that, Hermie?

Japanese:
簡単やん
王さまに見初められたらええんやって
English: Duh, Ah’mma jus’ make one fall in love with me.

Japanese:
ええ？
じゃあ　あんなおじいさんと
結婚するつもりなの？
English: Oho? So you are planning on marrying that old man?

Japanese:
生活のためとはいえ
そういう結婚は　賛成できないなぁ
English:
I won’t approve of it if you’re planning on
marrying just because of that.

Japanese:
ちゃうねん　ちゃうねん
イリア姉ちゃんが
お嫁入りしたら　ええんやって
English: No, no, Ah’m plannin’ on havin’ Sis Illia marry him.

Japanese:
ウチ　その妹や　言うて
ムリヤリ王族に　潜り込んだるねん
English:
An’ when she does, Ah’m gonna sneak inta her
family an’ call myself her younger sister.

Japanese:
あんたが妹なのは　構わないけど
あんなジイさんは　私も勘弁って感じ
あ…　でも若い孫はいるかも？
English:
I don’t mind being your sister, but no way am I 
marrying some old geezer. Maybe he has a hot 
grandson I can marry?

Japanese:
ずいぶん遠大な計画だね
ゆっくり話し合っててよ
English:
That’s a pretty grandiose plan you’ve got there.
Make sure to talk about it more thoroughly.

Japanese: 泳ぐの苦手？
English: Weak at Swimming?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: はぁ……
English: Sigh...

Japanese:
エル　どーした？
お腹空いたのだなー　しかし
English: What’s the matter, Hermie? Are you hungry though?

Japanese:
アホか…
なんもノド通らへんっちゅうねん
English: Ya stupid, nothin’s goin’ down my throat is all.

Japanese:
コーダは　コーダだ！
アホじゃないぞ　しかし！
English: Coda is Coda! Coda is not stupid though!

Japanese:
エル　どうしたの？
気分悪そうだけど
English: Hermie, what’s wrong? You don’t look good.

Japanese:
あー…　ここ海の底なんやろ？
そのこと考えたら　息が詰まんねん
まあ　大したことないねんけどな
English:
Everytime Ah remember that we’re technically
under the sea, Ah feel my breath go short.

Japanese: 哀れに思う
English: Pity

Japanese: 同情を寄せる
English: Sympathize

Japanese:
そうか　エルって
カナヅチだったのか
可哀想だね…
English: Ohh right, you don’t float. That’s a shame...

Japanese:
ちゃうちゃう
ウチは　単に水中活動が苦手なだけ
English: No, no, it’s jus’ that Ah’m not really good with water.

Japanese: …やっぱり泳げないんだね？
English: So you really can’t swim?

Japanese:
そうは　言うてへんでぇ～
案外　パチャパチャ泳ぎよるかも
しれへんやろ？
English:
Ah didn’t say that～! Who knows if Ah’d jus’
end up splashin’ ’round, right?

Japanese: じゃあ　後で試してみようか
English: Then why don’t we try that out later?

Japanese:
すんませんでした！
ウチ　めっちゃ泳げないです！
English: Ah’m sorry! Ah really can’t swim!

Japanese: そうか…　泳げないんだね
English: I see... so you really can’t swim...

Japanese:
ウチから言わせたら
泳げる方が　ヘンやねんて！
English:
Ah thought that if Ah said that,
ya wouldn’t force me inta the water!

Japanese:
水は冷たいし　鼻から水入って
めっちゃ苦しいやん！
ウチ　水に浮くようにできてないんやって
English:
Water’s cold and gets inta yer nose! 
It’d be impossible fer me ta float in water!

Japanese: 前世では龍だったのに…
English: Even though you were a dragon back then...

Japanese:
今は　ただの子どもやもん
そら　しゃーないわ
English: Ah ain’t a dragon now, Ah’m jus’ a young’n!

Japanese:
泳げないか
エルは　ダメだなー　しかし
English:
So Hermie can’t swim... 
Hermie’s really hopeless, though...

Japanese:
自分にまで
言われんのかいな…
English: Yer one ta talk.

Japanese: コーダは泳げるの？
English: Can you swim, Coda?

Japanese:
泳ぐ？　あの冷たい水の中で
鼻から水が入る　あれなー
コーダ　あれ嫌いだな　しかし
English:
Swim? In that cold water that 
gets into your nose...? Coda hates it though.

Japanese: ほな　自分もあかんやん！
English: Same!

Japanese:
コーダ　利口だから水入らないぞー
水は飲むもんだなー　しかし
English:
Coda is too smart to go in the water.
Water is only for drinking though!

Japanese: それは同感！
English: Same!

Japanese:
泳ぎを練習する気とかは
ゼンゼンないんだね
ふたりとも…
English:
Seems like the thought of swimming practice 
is out of consideration for you two, huh?

Japanese: 頭痛イリア、再び
English: Another Headache

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
イタタタタ…
もおッ！
English: O-Ow... sheesh!

Japanese:
最近　頭痛が多いみたいね
一度　お医者に診てもらった方が
いいんじゃない？
English:
You seem to have been getting a lot of headaches 
lately. Should we consult a doctor?

Japanese: …いや　大丈夫
English: No, I’m fine...

Japanese:
もう　そうやって強がるから
治りが遅いのよ？
English:
That strong facade of yours might end up
halting your recovery process, you know?

Japanese:
違うの
どうして　痛くなるのか
なんとなく　わかってきたから…
English:
That’s not it... It’s just that I think I know
why I keep getting these headaches...

Japanese: それ　どういう意味？
English: What do you mean?

Japanese:
あ…　治まった
さあ　行きましょ
English: And it’s gone... let’s get movin’?

Japanese:
ホントに大丈夫かしら
心配だなぁ…
English: Is she really okay? I cannot help but worry...

Japanese: イリアが裏切る？
English: Illia will Betray Us?

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
なんだよ！　あの女！
イリアが裏切るだとォ？
ああ！　ざけんなッ！　クソッ！
English:
What the hell is that witch saying!? Illia?
Betraying US? BULLCRAP.

Japanese: 肯定する
English: Agree with Chitose

Japanese: 断固否定する
English: Deny

Japanese: 黙る
English: Stay Silent

Japanese:
ああ！？　なに言ってんだ？
てめェ　優しく撫でてやろうかァ！！
English:
What the hell are you saying? Want
me to sock you or something?

Japanese:
やめて　スパーダ…
だって　そうかもしれないでしょ？
English:
Spada, stop... After all, that 
might be the case...

Japanese: そうかもって…　イリア…
English: “Might be?” Illia...

Japanese:
…イリア　スパーダ　ごめん
僕　ヘンなこと言った
English: I’m sorry... I’ve said something stupid.

Japanese: チッ…
English: Tch...

Japanese: いいのよ…
English: It’s fine...

Japanese:
…そんなわけないじゃないか
僕らは　前世からの…　縁なんだから…
English:
Of course not... Because of our 
past selves we... because fate...

Japanese: ね？　イリア？
English: Right, Illia?

Japanese:
ああ　そうだ！
ったりめーじゃねェか！
な？　イリア？
English: Of course! Right, Illia?

Japanese:
…さあ　そんなの…
わかんないわよ
English: I... as if I know that...

Japanese:
お…　おい
ルカ　なんか言えよ！
なぁ　ルカ…
English: H-Hey, Ruca... Say something...

Japanese:
お　おい　待てよ！
イリア！
English: I-Illia, wait up!

Japanese:
なあ　イリア姉ちゃん
どないしたん？
なんかヘンやったで？
English:
Say, what’s up with Sis Illia?
She was actin’ kinda strange...

Japanese: さあ　僕には　なんとも
English: Who knows... I don’t really...

Japanese:
この始まりは
おまえとイリアの　出会いだろう？
一番　付き合いが長いはずだ
English:
Weren’t you the one who met Illia first?
You’re closer to her than the rest of us.

Japanese:
そうそう
ルカ兄ちゃんが　なんとかせんと…
English: Right, right, jus’ do sumthin’ Ruca Bro...

Japanese: 問い詰めよう
English: Cross-examine

Japanese: 聞き流そう
English: Ignore

Japanese:
キチンと話をした方がいいかな？
場合によっちゃあ
強く問い詰めてでも…
English:
Will talking to her be alright? We should at 
least ask her ab--

Japanese:
ええ～？　ウソ～ん
問い詰めるって…
English:
Ya wanna ask her!? Ya gotta 
be kiddin’ me, Ruca Bro...!

Japanese:
いや　それも手だろう
事の次第を　ハッキリさせねばな
それに　話すことで気が楽になることもある
English:
No, that’s also a feasible solution. It’s best if we 
have a clear idea about the situation, and on top 
of that, talking about it can make one feel better.

Japanese:
でも　傷口にしょっぱいもん…
ええっと　塩？
塩すり込むことにならへん？
English:
But it’s jus’ like salty wounds... Uhhh... Salt...? 
Oh! Won’t it jus’ be like rubbin’ salt on her wound?

Japanese:
それは　あるかもしれん
だが　一番早い解決法だろう
おまえにできるか　ルカ？
English:
That might be the case, but it’s also the fastest
solution. Do you think you can do it, Ruca?

Japanese:
どうだろう
でも…
English: I wonder...? But--

Japanese:
まあ　よく考えてみるがいい
考えなしの行動は　分別のない
ガキのすることだからな
English:
Well, it’s best if you think about it a bit
more. After all, impulsively doing things
is what senseless kids do.

Japanese:
…なにもなかったことにして
普通に接するのがいいのかな？
English:
But I haven’t done anything... Would it be 
okay if I just treat her like always?

Japanese: そうそう　それが一番やって
English: Right, right. That’s how it should be.

Japanese:
だが　しこりを抱えたまま
旅を続けることになるのだぞ
それでもいいのか？
English:
But this problem will continue to fester as we
continue our journey. Are you okay with that?

Japanese: …どうだろう
English: I wonder...?

Japanese:
今は　なんもなかったことにするんが
ええんちゃう？
English: Won’t jus’ treatin’ her as usual be a’ight?

Japanese:
ルカ　とりあえず落ち着いて　よく考えろ
今は　おまえもイリアも
平静ではないだろうからな
English:
Ruca, you have to calm down and think about
it... As of now, both of you are quite shaken.

Japanese:
そうそう
とりあえず　深呼吸からやな
English: Right, ya have ta take a deep breath first.

Japanese: …イリア　大丈夫かなぁ？
English: I wonder if Illia’s alright...?

Japanese:
ほな　ウチが見てきたるわ
スパーダ兄ちゃんも
頭に　血昇ってたっぽいしなぁ
English:
That’s what we came here fer, after all.
Since Spada Bro seems ta get hot-headed
purty easily too.

Japanese:
ハァ…　まったく
あのチトセっていう子
なんて迷惑なの？
English: Dear me, why is that Chitose child such a nuisance?

Japanese:
…俺は詳しく知らんが
前世の色恋沙汰を
端に発するらしいな
English:
I only got the gist of it, but it seems like 
it happened because of a love affair...

Japanese: へぇ　そうだったんだ
English: Ohh... was that the case?

Japanese:
私も　あの３人が前世で
どんな関係だったのか　詳しくは知りません
English:
I also had no knowledge of what their relationship 
was like in the past either.

Japanese:
でも　イリアのことは
知っているつもりです
だから　今のイリアは　ちょっと心配ね
English:
However, I am supposed to know about 
Illia, so I am a bit worried.

Japanese:
…で　ルカくん　彼女とのこと
どうするつもりなの？
English: So, Ruca, what do you intend to do?

Japanese: 謝る
English: Apologize

Japanese: 考える
English: Think

Japanese:
とりあえず
イリアに　謝ってみるよ
English:
I think I should try and apologize 
to her for the time being.

Japanese:
うーん…　それじゃ三角ね
イリアが　求めているのは
謝罪じゃないと思う
English:
Hmm... I do not believe an apology is what 
Illia needs at the moment...

Japanese:
たぶん　ルカくんに対して
怒ってるんじゃないもの
English: Because she is not really angry at you.

Japanese:
まあ　でも　ボクは
なにかしなければならないという
ルカくんの気持ちは　評価するよ
English:
At the very least, I appreciate your
motivation to do something.

Japanese:
たとえ　それが
どういう結果だったとしてもね
English: No matter how it will end.

Japanese:
今までのカンシャクとは
ゼンゼン違うみたいだよね…
どうすれば　いいんだろう？
English:
It seems that her irritation’s different 
from usual. What should I do...?

Japanese:
そうね　一緒に考えましょ
ここまで　旅を続けてきたんだもの
そう簡単に　この関係は壊れないはずよ
English:
Indeed, let us brainstorm a solution together. We have
been together for a good while, our relationship
will not break so easily.

Japanese:
まあ　いずれ
なにか解決策が見つかるかもしれないしね
English: Who knows, we might find a solution along the way.

Japanese:
ルカ
とにかく　恐れずイリアに話しかけろ
まずは　それからだ
English:
Ruca, you should try and talk to 
Illia first. What happens after is up to you.

Japanese:
うん　わかった
…なんとか　自然に振舞ってみるよ
English: O-Okay... I’ll just react accordingly.

Japanese:
実は私　イリアよりルカくんの方が
心配なんですけど…
English:
To be honest, I am more worried 
about Ruca than I am about Illia.

Japanese:
…あまり深く考えるな
イリアの機嫌が　治れば
元の通りの関係に　戻るだろう
English:
Don’t think too much about it... Once Illia
regains her spirits, it’ll be just as usual...

Japanese:
こういうことは
時が解決することもあるだろうし…
English:
In these situations, letting time pass
is also a feasible solution.

Japanese:
そうですね
それまで　ルカくんが暴走しないよう
気に掛けておかないと
English:
Indeed. Until then, we should
worry about Ruca acting rashly.

Japanese:
まさか　このボクが他人の人間関係に
口を挟むことになるなんてね
まったく　やれやれだ…
English:
To think that even I would end up 
discussing other people’s relationships...
Good grief...

Japanese: 男発言ッ
English: A Manly Statement

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
こんなときになんだが
あのセリフ　良かったぜ…
English:
No idea if this is a good time for it or not, but
I’m glad you said that earlier.

Japanese:
おう
コーダ頑張ったからなー　しかし
English: Yeah! It’s because Coda’s trying really hard though!

Japanese:
おまえじゃねェよ！
ルカの「イリアを守る」って
ヤツのことだよ！
English:
Not you! I’m talking about the time
when Ruca said “I’ll protect Illia!”

Japanese:
あー　それはコーダのとは
違うなー
残念だなー　しかし
English: Oh... that’s not what Coda said... Sad though...

Japanese:
ああ　うん…
なんとなくそんなこと
言ったような気がするよ
English:
Oh yeah... To be honest, 
I don’t really know why I said that.

Japanese: あのセリフな
English: You know, man...

Japanese: うん？
English: Yeah?

Japanese: 熱かったぜ
English: That was pretty cool.

Japanese: なー　アツかったなー　しかし
English: It was pretty cool, though!

Japanese: そう…　かな？
English: W-Was it...?

Japanese:
あのセリフ　イリアの心には
ちゃんと　届いてた
間違いねェ！
English: I bet you it definitely reached her heart back there.

Japanese:
あのセリフを聞いて
おまえを裏切ったら
そりゃあ　もう人じゃねェよ
English:
If they betray you after hearing all that,
they’re not even human anymore.

Japanese:
でも　コーダは　うっかり
裏切ってしまうかもしれないな　しかし
English:
But Coda might end up unknowingly
betraying you though!

Japanese:
おめェは　元々　人じゃねェから
別にいいんだよ
English: You’re not human in the first place, so it’s fine!

Japanese: 旅の喜びとは
English: The Delights of Traveling

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
急がないと　船に乗り遅れちゃう！
ちょっと　せわしないよね
English:
It’s a bit hectic, but we should
hurry to the boat before it leaves!

Japanese:
船旅ってな
もっと優雅なはずなんだがなァ
English: Voyages should be wayyy more chill than this...

Japanese:
ホンマや
旅の一番の楽しみ　食べ歩きと
お土産屋のハシゴも　でけへんかったわ
English:
Too true, Ah wanted ta enjoy mah first journey
by eatin’ lots an’ buyin’ a lotta souvenirs...

Japanese:
お！　エルのヤツ！
なかなか　わかってんじゃねェか
English: Yeah, exactly!

Japanese:
食べ歩きは　ともかく
お土産屋に　寄るぐらいの
時間は欲しかったで　ホンマ
English:
At least we should take the time ta buy sum
souvenirs and eat some food ’fore leavin’.

Japanese: キーホルダー！
English: Keychains

Japanese: 置物！
English: Ornaments

Japanese: 賛成しない
English: Disagree

Japanese:
お土産の定番といえば
キーホルダーだよね？
English: By “souvenirs” do you perhaps mean keychains?

Japanese:
ああ？
ンなもん買ってどーすんだよ
English: And what’ll you do with keychains in the first place?

Japanese: え？　だって定番じゃないか…
English:
Huh? But that’s just what 
you usually buy as a souvenir...

Japanese:
そうそう　持ち歩くんには　ちょうどええし
悪趣味なんを買うて　人に見られて
苦笑いされるんは　お約束やで？
English:
Right, right, it’s sumthin’ you can carry ’round,
but people will think ya have bad taste an’ 
laugh at ya.

Japanese:
苦笑いされねェような
オシャレなヤツ　選べよ…
English:
No one will laugh at you if you
choose something stylish.

Japanese:
なに言うてんねんな　お土産屋に
オシャレなキーホルダーなんか
売ってるわけあらへんやん！
English:
What’re ya sayin’!?
As if sumbody would sell stylish keychains!

Japanese:
お土産の定番といえば
置物だよね？
English: By “souvenirs” do you perhaps mean ornaments?

Japanese:
お！　良くわかってんじゃねェか！
温度計なんかついてたら
最高だよなッ！
English:
Right on, now we’re talkin’! Ornaments
like thermometers are hella cool!

Japanese:
え～？
そんなん　置き場所あらへん
English: Huh? As if. Ya gotta have the space ta put that in!

Japanese:
わかってねェな
たとえ　なにを犠牲にしてでも
置物は　置くもんなんだよ
English:
You don’t get it, man. You have to buy an
ornament no matter how much it is.

Japanese:
そら　スパーダ兄ちゃんの家やったら
めっちゃ広いんやろうけど
ウチ　宿なしやってんから…
English: That’s cause yer house is really big! Ah’m homeless!

Japanese:
じゃあ　持ち歩きゃいいだろ？
温度わかるんだぜ？
便利じゃねェか
English:
You can still carry a thermometer around! 
It’s useful too!

Japanese:
温度なんか　わかっても
なにが便利なんか
さっぱり　わからんで…
English:
Even if Ah know what temperature it is,
Ah still don’ know how it’d be useful!

Japanese:
荷物になるから
お土産なんて　買わない方が
いいんじゃないかなぁ
English:
I don’t think we should buy any more souvenirs.
They’ll just end up as baggage, anyway.

Japanese:
ああ～　ルカ兄ちゃん
その発言は　あかんわぁ
なんちゅう　夢のない…
English: That won’t do, Ruca Bro! Don’ ya have any ambition...?

Japanese:
ルカ　おまえ　空気読めよ
今は　お土産にまつわる
面白トークをする場面だろうが！
English:
Dude, can’t you read the atmosphere? We’re
supposed to be having an interesting conversation
about souvenirs!

Japanese:
はぁ…　困った兄ちゃんやなぁ
一から教えたらんとあかんか～
English:
What a hopeless brother, Ah’m gonna
hafta teach ya from scratch～

Japanese:
優等生ぶるのもいいけどよ
場合に　よりけりなんだぜ？
English:
It’s fine to be an honor student, okay?
But that only depends on the situation.

Japanese:
それにしても　残念やなぁ…
アシハラのお土産屋って
どんなペナント売ってたんやろか
English:
It’s still such a shame... Ah wonder what
sorta souvenirs Ashihara sells?

Japanese:
ああ　木刀…
きっとステキなヤツが
あったんだろうなぁ…
English:
Wooden swords, prolly. I’m sure there’s
someone selling some good ones.

Japanese:
…もっと実用的なお土産じゃ
ダメなの？
English: Can’t we just buy something more practical?

Japanese: 例えば　なんだよ？
English: Like what?

Japanese:
おまんじゅうとか
食べればなくなるから
かさばらないし
English:
Like manju, or something. If we can’t eat them,
our baggage will just end up being bulky.

Japanese:
あとアクセサリーとか
身に着けて歩けば　荷物にならないよ
English:
And accessories that we can carry. If we get
those, we won’t have to worry about baggage.

Japanese:
ああ　なるほど
その発想はなかったわぁ
English: Oh, Ah see! Ah forgot ’bout that one!

Japanese:
ホント　おまえって
優等生的発言しか出てこねェのな
もうちょっと人生　楽しもうぜ
English:
Wow, what a generic remark from the honor
student. You should enjoy life more, Ruca.

Japanese:
人生　ムダなことも
大事なんだぜ？
English: You only live once, after all.

Japanese: ハスタってどんなヤツ？
English: What Kind of Person Is Hasta?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
なあなあ　ハスタっちゅうのんは
どういうヤツなん？
詳しぃ教えたってぇな
English: Hey, hey, what kinda person is Hasta?

Japanese:
ねえ　イリア
エルが　ハスタについて　聞きたいんだって
説明してあげてよ
English:
Hey, Illia, Hermie wants to know what kind of
person is Hasta. Mind explaining it to her?

Japanese:
え？　ちょっと！
なんで　あたしが　あんなのの
説明しなきゃいけないのよ！
English: Hey, hold on! Why me!?

Japanese:
ええやん
教えたってぇな
English: It’s fine, jus’ tell me.

Japanese:
お断り！
あんなヤツのこと
口にも　出したくないっての！
English: Hell no! I don’t wanna talk about him!

Japanese:
言ってることが　意味不明で
タチ悪くて　会話が通じなくて
変態チックなヤツのことなんてさ！
English:
He’s a pervert that says things that are so weird
and cryptic that it’s almost impossible to start a
conversation with him!

Japanese: …っていう感じなんだけど
English: What Illia said.

Japanese:
んー　まあ
なんとなくわかったわ
English: Ohhh... Ah think ah get it now.

Japanese: リカルドＶＳハスタ
English: Ricardo vs Hasta

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
そういえば　西の戦場で会った後
ハスタと戦ったんだよね？
English:
Hey Ricardo, didn’t you fight Hasta after 
meeting him in the Western Front?

Japanese:
ああ
あのときトドメを
刺しておけば　良かったのだが…
English:
Oh, that. It would’ve been better if I had 
managed to deal the final blow.

Japanese: じゃあ　勝ったの？
English: So... you won?

Japanese:
まあな
俺の弾を食らって
アイツは　うずくまった
English:
Pretty much. That guy fell to pieces 
in one shot.

Japanese:
そのとき　あいつは言ったのだ
「おまえ　ヒュプノスだろ？」と…
English: After that he said, “You’re Hypnos, right?”...

Japanese:
じゃあ　ハスタも
転生者だったってこと？
English: Then does that mean that Hasta’s also a Reincarnator?

Japanese:
そうだ　しかも　どうやらヤツも
俺と同じく　ラティオの
陣営に属していたらしい
English:
Correct. 
And, apparently, he was also affiliated with Ratio.

Japanese:
だから　ついヤツの話に気を取られてな
気がつけば　ヤツは
全速力で　逃げ出していた
English:
That’s why when I finally realized what he said, 
he immediately ran away at full speed.

Japanese:
でも　同じ傭兵だったのに
ハスタが　転生者だって
知らなかったんだね
English:
So you didn’t know that he was a Reincarnator 
despite being both mercenaries.

Japanese:
もしかすると　俺との戦闘で
覚醒したのかもしれん
English: He probably awakened while fighting me...

Japanese:
…だとしたら　ヤツの今の暴走は
俺にも　責任がある
English:
If that’s the case, then that’s all the more reason
for me to take responsibility.

Japanese:
そんな…　たとえそうだとしても
誰もリカルドさんを　責めたりしないよ
それより　一緒にあいつをやっつけよう
English:
No, even if that’s the case, 
no one’s really blaming you for it. 
Let’s try and defeat him together.

Japanese:
ああ　そうだな
もちろん　そうさせてもらう
English: You’re right, of course.

Japanese: 強いように見えない
English: Doesn’t Look Strong

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: ホンマ　感じ悪いなぁ～
English: What a really bad feelin’.

Japanese: まったくだっての！
English: Too damn true!

Japanese: どうしたの　一体…？
English: What’s up?

Japanese:
さっきの入り口の
おっさんが言ったこと
English: It’s about what that guard said back there.

Japanese:
だって　この腕自慢のあたしたちを
ただの旅行者扱いよ？
見る目ないんだから
English:
He totally thought that we were just tourists, y’know? 
He’s totally underestimating us!

Japanese:
ホンマや
ウチのパンチ　お見舞いしたろか
English: Should Ah punch ’em?

Japanese: 仕方ないと言う
English: “It can’t be helped”

Japanese: 同意する
English: Agree

Japanese:
それは　仕方ないんじゃない？
だって　君たちの見た目は
可憐な女の子だもの
English:
But he can’t help it.
At a glance, you both look like lovely girls.

Japanese:
あら～
可憐やなんて　お上手やわぁ
ルカ兄ちゃんも　言うようになって
English:
“Lovely”, huh～ Ruca Bro, ya sure have gotten good at 
flatterin’ folks.

Japanese:
せやけど　ホンマのとこ
ウチら　強いんやけどなぁ
English: It’s true, but we’re both still mighty strong!

Japanese:
そうそう　だから　なんだか
バカにされたように
感じたんだけど
English: Right, right, that’s why we can’t help but feel mocked.

Japanese:
…じゃあ
いかにも　強そうな格好したら？
スパーダやリカルドさんみたいにさ
English:
Then, how about trying out clothes that make you 
look stronger? Like what Spada and Ricardo wear.

Japanese:
え～　今さっき
可憐て　言うてくれたやん
English: Huh? But ya jus’ said we look lovely.

Japanese:
そーよ　そーよ
女らしさを　捨てるなんて
バチ当たりなマネ　できないっての
English:
Right, we can’t just throw away 
our femininity like it’s nothing.

Japanese:
じゃあ
どうすりゃいいのさ…
English: Then, what should we do?

Japanese:
まったくだね
イリアの銃の扱いや　エルの豪腕は
どんな敵でもイチコロなのに
English:
Too true, no one can stand against your guns, Illia, 
and Hermie’s punches too.

Japanese:
せ…　せやろか？
ウチ　そこまで豪腕やないで？
English: R-Really? Ah don’ think Ah’m that good yet though?

Japanese:
フフン
あたしは　正当な評価ね
English: An appropriate description for me.

Japanese:
でも　イリア姉ちゃんは
飛び道具やで？
なんか　ズルない？
English: But ya use guns, Sis Illia. Ain’t that unfair?

Japanese:
じゃあ　エルも
銃を使えばいいじゃない
English: Why don’t you use guns, Hermie?

Japanese:
ほな　二丁持ってんねんから
一丁ちょうだいや
English: Then, since ya have two, can ya lend me one?

Japanese: やーよ！
English: No way!

Japanese: ほな　両方ちょうだい！
English: Gimme!

Japanese:
イ・ヤ・よ！
なんで増えんのよ
English: N. O. WAY!

Japanese:
でも　やっぱり
人は外見で　判断するよね
English:
In the end, people really do 
judge others’ outward appearance.

Japanese:
ああ　そうね
あんたなんて　見た目
まんまモヤシよね
English: Yeah, at first glance you totally look like a bean sprout.

Japanese:
あ～　せやなぁ
悪いけど　ルカ兄ちゃんの方が
よっぽど　弱そうに見えてるで
English: Oh, true! Sorry, Ruca Bro, but ya look really frail.

Japanese:
あたしたちが　ただの旅行者に見えたの
案外　あんたの
見た目のせいだったんじゃない？
English:
Maybe you’re the reason why that guy thought we 
were all tourists?

Japanese:
そうそう　ウチがうらやむくらい
色白美肌の　細腰やもん
たぶん　そうやでぇ
English: True, Ah’m so jealous of that fair skin an’ thin waist!

Japanese:
ちぇ…
結局　僕の話になるんだな
こういうときってさ
English: Tch... in the end they started talking about me.

Japanese: なんだかスパーダが変？
English: Isn’t Spada Kind of Acting Strange?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: う～ん…
English: Hmm...

Japanese:
ルカ
どうかしたのか　しかし？
English: Ruca, what’s wrong though?

Japanese:
スパーダの様子が　ヘンなんだ
なんだか　思い詰めてるって言うか…
English:
Isn’t Spada acting kind of strange?
It’s like he’s brooding over something...

Japanese:
それは　あれだな
お腹空かせたんだなー　しかし
English: Oh, he’s probably hungry though.

Japanese:
そんな…
コーダじゃあるまいし
English: That can’t be... he’s not you.

Japanese: どないしたん？
English: Ayo whaddup?

Japanese:
ああ　スパーダの様子が
おかしいって話なんだけど…
English:
Oh, we were talking about
how Spada’s acting strange.

Japanese: お腹でも空いてるんじゃないの？
English: Is he not just hungry?

Japanese:
そら　そうやろ
お腹減ったに　決まってるで
English: Right, it’s troublesum when he’s hungry.

Japanese: 同意する
English: Agree

Japanese: 反論する
English: Disagree

Japanese:
…じゃ　今日は
ご飯を早めに食べようか
English: Then, let’s have lunch early today.

Japanese: やった！
English: Yay!

Japanese: やったな　しかし！
English: Yay!

Japanese:
さすが　ルカ兄ちゃん
話わかるわぁ！
English: Ruca Bro sure knows what’s up!

Japanese:
自分たちが
お腹空いてただけなんじゃないか…
English: Weren’t they just hungry?

Japanese:
エルも　アンジュも
お腹空いてるんだね…
English: So you’re both hungry, huh...

Japanese:
あら　失礼ね　ルカくん
ちゃんと　私たちも
スパーダくんのこと　心配してるのに
English: How rude! We are simply worried about Spada!

Japanese: ホンマ　失礼やわぁ
English: Really rude!

Japanese:
エル　コーダ
あっちに行って
３人で　おやつでも食べましょ
English: Coda, Hermie, let us be off. We shall just have a snack.

Japanese: さんせ～！
English: Yay!

Japanese:
アンジュは　まったく
いいこと言うな　しかし！
English: Ange sure knows what’s up though!

Japanese:
やっぱり
お腹が空いてたんだね…
English: So they were really just hungry.

Japanese: ダイエットを決意する
English: Determined to Diet

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ねえ　ルカくん
正直に答えてちょうだい
English: Ruca, answer me honestly.

Japanese:
うわ　アンジュ　目が本気だ…
え～と　な…　なに？
English:
(Oh dear, Ange has a serious look in her face)...
Wh-What is it?

Japanese: 私って　太ってると思う？
English: Do you think me to be overweight?

Japanese:
え…　え～と…
ストレートな質問だなぁ…
English: Th-That’s... that’s quite a straightforward question...

Japanese:
ルカくん　目が泳いでるけど
どうなの？
率直に答えて
English:
Ruca, why are you avoiding my gaze?
Just answer me honestly!

Japanese: 正直に言う
