English: Answer honestly

Japanese: 誤魔化す
English: Dodge the question

Japanese:
イリアや　エルに比べると少し…
そう　見えないこともないけど…
English:
Compared to Illia and Hermie,
it’s not that obvious, but...

Japanese: けど？
English: But?

Japanese:
気にするほど
太ってないんじゃないかなぁ？
English: It’s not to the extent that you should worry about it.

Japanese:
そう？
やっぱり　そうよね！
それならいいんだけど
English:
Really?
That is what I thought！
I suppose I am fine then.

Japanese:
それはぁ…　非常に難しい問題だね
だいたい　こういう問題は見た目じゃなくて…
そもそも　僕個人の意見より…
English:
That’s... quite an unusual question, Ange.
In the first place, the problem here isn’t about
appearances and to just ask my opinion is...

Japanese:
私は　ルカくんが
どう思ってるか知りたいの！
English: But I want to know what you think!

Japanese:
ええっと…　痩せてはいない
…とは思うけどぉ…
気にするほどじゃないかと…
English:
Well... I don’t think you’re slim...
but I don’t think you have to--

Japanese:
そう…　なのかな？
う～ん…
English:
Is... that so?
Hmm...

Japanese:
エルだって　本気で
言ったんじゃないと思うよ？
ちょっと　ふざけただけだって
English:
And I don’t think Hermie said that seriously.
She was just fooling around.

Japanese:
少しの悪ふざけが
人を傷つける場合もあると
あの子には　説いておいたのよ
English:
I did explain it to her that even
the smallest jokes can hurt others.

Japanese:
でも　本気じゃなかったとはいえ
少しは　そう思ってたはずよね…
English: I also believe she was not being serious about it.

Japanese:
だからぁ　エルの基準に合わせても
しょうがないんじゃない？
English:
So there’s no way that you’re fat
like Hermie described you as.

Japanese:
アンジュ自身が　自分の体形を
どう思ってるのかが問題だよ
English: The problem is just how you view yourself.

Japanese:
だったら…　やっぱり…
もうちょっとだけ　痩せたい…かな？
もうちょっっっとだけね
English:
So I guess I shall have to...
lose weight for a bit.
Only a bit...

Japanese:
僕は　気にしすぎだと
思うけどなぁ
English: I think you’re worrying too much about it though.

Japanese: 思ったんだけど…
English: I’ve been thinking...

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
ねぇ
思ったんだけどさ…
English: Hey, I’ve been thinking...

Japanese:
余計な口をきくと
体力を　消耗するぞ
English:
Don’t talk to me like that.
You’ll waste your energy.

Japanese:
その体力消耗の原因って
僕たちの　服装にあるんじゃない？
English: Aren’t we getting tired because of our clothes?

Japanese:
フン…　あらゆる局面を想定しておけば
衣服や装備品は
自然と実用的になるものだ
English:
Hmm... In preparing for any situation,
our clothes and equipment are necessary.

Japanese:
さすが　傭兵だね
…でも　その服　暑くないの？
English:
As expected of a mercenary, but...
aren’t you hot in there?

Japanese:
これは軽い防弾着も　兼ねているからな
文句は　言ってられん
English:
What I’m wearing is light as well as bulletproof.
It’s quite useful so I have no complaints.

Japanese:
暑さをガマンすることなど
命を落とすことに　比べれば
なんてことはない
English:
Between enduring the heat and staying safe,
it’s obvious which one is more important.

Japanese:
…う～ん
説得力あるなぁ
English: I see your point...

Japanese:
さあ　おしゃべりは
ここまでにして
先を急ごう
English: Now, let’s stop talking and move forward.

Japanese: やっぱりスパーダが変
English: Spada’s Really Acting Strange

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
やっぱり　スパーダの様子
おかしいよ
English: Spada has been acting really strange lately...

Japanese:
どうしたのかな
お腹空いてんじゃないの？
English:
I wonder why?
Isn’t he just hungry?

Japanese:
その意見　さんざん聞かされたよ
でも　違うみたい
English:
I’ve already heard that from the others,
but that doesn’t seem to be the case...

Japanese:
…ならば
前世に関わる話ではないのか？
English:
Perhaps it might have something
to do with his past life...?

Japanese:
ああ…　そうか
だったら　不用意に話しかけない方が
いいよね？
English:
Ohh I see... Then it might be best if
we don’t bother him, right?

Japanese: かもしれんな
English: Most likely.

Japanese:
そうかなぁ？
いいじゃん
ストレートに　聞いちゃえば？
English:
Is that so? Then why don’t we
ask him directly about it?

Japanese: 聞いてみる
English: Ask him

Japanese: 放っておく
English: Leave him alone

Japanese:
スパーダ　ひとりで
悩んでるのかもしれないね
ちょっと　聞いてみようかなぁ
English:
Spada seems to be worrying alone,
should I ask him?

Japanese:
そうそう
それが　仲間ってもんよ
English: Yeah, that’s what friends do.

Japanese:
どうだろうな
単に腹を減らしている
可能性も…
English: I wonder... he might just be hungry.

Japanese:
だから　もう
腹ペコ話は　いいってば！
English:
Again, he doesn’t seem hungry!
Can we JUST drop that topic, PLEASE!?

Japanese:
うーん…
今は　そっとしておいた方が
いいよね？
English: Hmm... I think we should leave him alone.

Japanese: だろうな
English: Right.

Japanese:
ええ～？
そんなの　つまんない！
English: Huh!? But that’s so boring!

Japanese:
だが　ただの思い過ごしということも
あるだろう？
English: Aren’t you just reading into it too much?

Japanese:
ああ…　単にお腹が
空いてるだけだったとかね！
English: Right! Like he might just be hungry, right?

Japanese:
だから　もう
腹ペコ話は　いいってば！
English:
Again, he doesn’t seem hungry
so can we just drop that topic?

Japanese:
やはり　本人の問題だからな
少なくとも　今は
余計な口出しは　不要だろう
English:
At the very least, it’s his problem.
So talking about it is unnecessary.

Japanese:
ホントに　なにかあれば
あいつの方から
話してくれるかもしれないしね
English:
True! If there’s something wrong,
he’ll bring it up.

Japanese:
そうか…　そうだよね
うん
しばらく様子を　見るよ
English:
Ohh... that’s true.
Let’s just wait and see.

Japanese: 冷淡リカルド
English: Heartless Ricardo

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
それにしても　リカルドって
やっぱ冷てェな
ルカが死ぬこと前提に　話するなんてよ
English:
Ricardo was really cold when Ruca 
was about to die back there.

Japanese:
確かに軍人なら　最悪のことを考えるのは
仕方ないのかもしれないけど…
ちょっと　冷たいかも
English:
It’s true that soldiers can’t help but assume the
worst-case scenario, but... it’s still a bit cold of him.

Japanese:
ああ…
あの話ね
English: Ohh that.

Japanese:
ルカが　目を覚ましたからいいけどよ
オレが直に　あの話を聞いてたら
ぶっ飛ばすところだったぜ！
English:
It’s fine because Ruca’s awake now, but I swear I’ll
send him flying if I hear that from him again.

Japanese:
スパーダって
たまに物騒よね
English: Spada can get really unhinged sometimes, right?

Japanese:
ねえ　リカルドのことだけど
彼は…
English: Hey, about Ricardo, he...

Japanese:
あー　あたしは別に怒ってないって
確かに　ちょっと冷たいとは思ったけど
リカルドとしては　仕方ないんでしょ
English:
Oh, it’s not like I’m mad or anything.
It’s true that he was a bit cold back there, 
but that’s just how he is.

Japanese: 今の聞いてた？
English: Did you hear all that?

Japanese: なんの話だ？
English: Hear what?

Japanese:
みんな　気がついてないみたいだけど
あなたが　ちゃんとルカくんの
乗船券も　用意してたってこと
English:
It seems that everyone has yet to notice, 
but you were preparing Ruca’s ticket,
were you not?

Japanese:
フン　俺はムダが嫌いな質でな
チケットが１枚　ムダにならずに済んで
ホッとした
English:
I hate inefficiency, so I’m glad that ticket
didn’t go to waste.

Japanese:
最初から　そう言えばいいのに
どうして　ルカくんの
遺体の話なんて…
English:
You should have told that to them at the start.
What possessed you to even mention
Ruca’s corpse?

Japanese:
最悪の事態を　想定しておけば
それに耐える心構えも　できるだろう
English:
I had to bring up the worst-case scenario as a 
means to make them brace themselves for it.

Japanese:
いきなり　友を失うツラさは
ガキには耐えられん
English: Brats can’t stand it when they lose a friend.

Japanese:
みんなに誤解されたままで
あなたは　いいの？
English: And you are fine with that?

Japanese:
構わんさ
他人から　誤解を受けることなど
慣れている
English: Yes. I’ve grown used to being misunderstood.

Japanese:
いちいち　そんなことを気にしては
傭兵など　やっておれんからな
English:
I can’t be a mercenary if I keep 
worrying about the small things.

Japanese: 憎まれ役も　大変だね
English: It must be quite a hard role...

Japanese:
フン…
そうだな
English: Hmph... You’re right.

Japanese:
やれやれ
素直じゃないなぁ…
English: Goodness gracious, you are so dishonest.

Japanese: おこりんぼイリア
English: Temperamental Illia

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
もう　ルカのヤツ…！
あ～　もう！　ルカったら！
ええい　ルカめ！　ルカめ！
English:
Ruca! Grrr... RUCA!
Dummy! You dummy!

Japanese:
どうしたの？
ルカルカって　何度も…
English:
Is something the matter? 
Why do you keep saying Ruca?

Japanese:
な…　何度もなんて
言ってないってば！
English: HUH!? I didn’t say anything!

Japanese:
今　間違いなく
言ってたじゃない…
English: But I am certain you were...

Japanese:
でも　本当は嬉しいんでしょ？
ルカくんが　目を覚ましてくれて
English:
Oh well... In truth, you are actually elated 
that Ruca woke up, are you not?

Japanese:
べ…　別に
嬉しくなんか…
English: It’s... it’s not like I’m happy or anything...

Japanese: ……そう？
English: Is that so?

Japanese: そりゃ…まあ…　嬉しいけどさ…
English: Well... I guess... I am... a bit...

Japanese:
じゃあ　直接
そう言えばいいじゃない
English: Then you should have said that outright.

Japanese:
…そんなの　できないもん
どんな顔して　どんな言葉
かければいいか…　わかんないし…
English:
I-I don’t know what I should say or what my 
expression should be... I can’t...

Japanese:
もう　困った子ね
ルカくんも　困った子だけど
ここにも　困ったちゃんがいたみたい
English:
Oh, you are such a handful... 
Ruca is quite a troublesome child himself, 
but it seems we have one here as well.

Japanese:
…フンだ
もう　放っといてよ…
English: Bleh, just leave me be!

Japanese:
照れちゃって
もう　カワイイんだから♪
English: You are so adorable when you are flustered～

Japanese: ゆっくり旅情
English: Light Travels

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
はあ　今回はゆっくりできて
楽しかったなぁ～
English:
We sure took our time here!
It was purty fun!

Japanese:
わっ　エルのバカ！
その話は　ナイショだって
言っただろ！
English:
Hermie, you idiot!
That was supposed to be a secret!

Japanese:
？？？
どういうこと？
English:
Hm?
What do you mean?

Japanese:
あちゃ～
いや　ホラ　おまえ
三日間　寝てただろ？
English:
Oh shoot, here we go. 
Okay, so you were asleep for three days, right?

Japanese:
横で　みんなが雁首そろえて
見つめとっても　しゃあないやん？
せやから　交代で遊びに行っててん
English:
Instead of everybody jus’ starin’ at sumbody sleepin’ 
we decided ta watch over ya in shifts while the rest 
went out ta play.

Japanese:
え～　そうだったの？
でも　ナイショにしなくても
いいじゃないか
English:
Ohh, was that the case? 
Isn’t it supposed to be a secret?

Japanese:
いや…
おまえを置いて　遊んでたなんてよ
やっぱ　後ろめたかったんだよな…
English:
No... You already know anyway, 
besides I kinda feel guilty not telling you.

Japanese:
別に　それは気にしてないけど
…で　楽しかったの？
English:
It’s not really something you have to worry about. 
Was it fun?

Japanese:
ああ　結構な
食べ物も独特で　美味かったしな
English: Yeah, the food was pretty delicious.

Japanese:
アンジュ姉ちゃんが　言うとったけど
ここ結構　高地やから
ヤギが　たくさんおるらしいわ
English:
Ah know Sis Ange’s menshuned it ’fore, 
but remember how there were lotsa goats here?

Japanese:
美味しかったで　ヤギの肉とか
ヤギのミルクとか
チーズも　食い放題やった
English:
We ate lotsa goat’s meat, milk, an’ cheese! 
They were awfully tasty!

Japanese: すねる
English: Sulk

Japanese: 平気なフリをする
English: Reply calmly

Japanese:
みんな　ズルいなぁ
僕　ずっと寝てたのに…
English:
You all suck! 
All the time I was sleeping, and you guys did that...

Japanese:
いや　マジで悪ぃ…
機会があったら
次はオレが　おごってやっからよ
English:
Really sorry, why don’t I treat you 
next time we get the chance?

Japanese: も～　約束だよ？
English: You promise?

Japanese:
ふうん　良かったじゃない
僕も機会があったら
食べてみるよ
English:
Isn’t that nice? I want to eat some too...
If I get the chance.

Japanese:
…もう　そんな涙目で言われたら
ウチ　困るわ～
English: Now don’ give me that face, yer makin’ me feel sad.

Japanese:
な…
泣いてなんかないよ！
English: It’s... it’s not like I’m crying or anything!

Japanese:
ハイハイ
ホンマ　カンニンやで
次　ご馳走したるからな？
English:
Okay, okay, Ah’m sorry.
Ah’ll treat ya next time.

Japanese:
え…　ご馳走って
エルが？
English: You will?

Japanese:
お金出すんは　スパーダ兄ちゃんやけどな
ウチ　お金ないし
English: Technically Spada Bro will, Ah’m broke ya see.

Japanese: オレが出すのかよ！
English: So I’m treating him!?

Japanese:
でもお土産屋に　寄られへんかったんは
ちょっと　ツラいなぁ～
English:
It’s kinda sad that we didn’t get 
ta stop an’ buy sum souvenirs though.

Japanese:
う～ん
今から寄るのは　時間的にムリかぁ
でもどうして　行っておかなかったの？
English:
We don’t have time to buy them now, but... 
Why didn’t you buy them earlier?

Japanese:
そりゃあ
おまえ　あれだぜ？
English: Well, y’know it’s coz...

Japanese:
お土産　見せびらかしたりしたら
寝てるルカ兄ちゃん置いて　遊んでたん
モロバレやんか～
English:
If we bought souvenirs while ya were asleep,
it woulda been obvious that we played ’round.

Japanese:
むむ…
なんだか　ちょっと
腹立って来たかも…
English: Hmm... for some reason that kind of pisses me off.

Japanese:
でもな　ホンマ言うと
みんな　ゼンゼン楽しそうやなかったで
楽しいフリしとっただけ
English:
But ta be honest, nobody looked like they
were havin’ fun. They looked like they were
jus’ pretendin’ ta be happy.

Japanese:
遊びになんか　行かんでもええから
ルカ兄ちゃんと　一緒の方が
やっぱり　ええわ
English:
Goin’ out was fun, but it woulda been 
better if ya were there with us.
Yeah...

Japanese:
そう
ありがと　エル
English: Thanks Hermie!

Japanese: アンジュの悩み
English: Ange’s Worries

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
アンジュって…
結構ダイエット　ダイエットって
口にしてるよね
English:
Ange’s been talking about dieting
for a while now, hasn’t she.

Japanese:
そのクセ　食いしん坊やし
そやから　逆に
後ろめたいんやろか？
English:
Ah wonder if it’s cause she’s feelin’
guilty fer bein’ a glutton?

Japanese:
でも　そんなに太ってるわけじゃ…
いや　やっぱり　ちょっと
ぽっちゃり…　かな？
English:
But it’s not like she’s fa--
Wait, maybe she is a bit chubby...

Japanese:
カワイイんやから
気にせんでええのになぁ
English:
But she’s cute so Ah don’ think
she should worry ’bout it.

Japanese:
なんだかんだ言って
アンジュも
女の子ってことよね
English: I suppose Ange’s also a girl, huh?

Japanese:
イリア　エル？
どうかしたの？
English: What’s the matter, you two?

Japanese:
え～と　いや　あの…
アンジュって
そんな全然　太っては…
English:
Huh!? Oh... uhh... it’s not
like you’re fat or any--

Japanese:
あん？　なにか今
不穏当な言葉が　聞こえたけど
気のせいかな？
English:
Hmmm? Did I just hear you say something
inappropriate or was it my imagination?

Japanese: きききき…　気のせいですぅ！
English: I-I-I didn’t say anything!

Japanese:
そうそう！
気のせい　気のせい！
さいなら～！
English:
Right, right!
Jus’ yer imagination!
Bye～!

Japanese:
私
そんなに　太ってなんか
………
English: Am I... really that fat?

Japanese:
はぁ～…
この下っ腹…
やっぱり　軽くマズいかも…
English:
This belly of mine...
Perhaps it has grown a tad large...

Japanese: 暑い…
English: Hot...

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
ここって
ホント　暑いね…
English: This place really is hot.

Japanese: …暑いわね
English: Hot...

Japanese:
暑いなー！
コーダ　服脱ぐぞ　しかし！
English: Hot! Coda’s taking off his clothes though!

Japanese:
ああ　動物は　いいなぁ…
もう　なにここ！
ムシムシする！
English:
Must be nice for animals... Sheesh, what’s with this 
place? It’s so hot and humid!

Japanese:
どうでもいいけど
ガルポスに教団の信仰が
根付かなかった理由　よくわかるわ
English:
Forget about that. I get why the Church’s religion 
was unable to spread here now.

Japanese:
だって　教団で支給される
衣装だと　信者を獲得する前に
脱水症状で　死んじゃうもの！
English:
With the clothes the Church issues, you would die 
before you even managed to build a temple!

Japanese:
ハハ…
ホント
どうでもいい話だね…
English: Sigh... Who gives a crap about that...

Japanese:
ああ～　ルカくんが
こんな辛口コメントを…
English:
Sigh... to think that Ruca would 
say something this harsh...

Japanese:
え…　あ…　いや　ごめん
どうしたんだろ　僕…
English:
Oh... uh... I’m sorry.
Something must’ve gotten to me...

Japanese:
ルカにさえ　あんな辛口コメントを
言わせるなんて
この暑さ　ホント殺人的ね…
English:
To think that Ruca would end up saying something like 
that... this heat isn’t something to be underestimated!

Japanese: ヘンなじいさんだったな
English: What a Weird Gramps

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
しっかし　なんだ？
あのおかしなジイさんは…
English: What’s with that weird old man back there?

Japanese:
だが　このジャングルで生き抜く
生存技術は　大した物だと思うぞ
English:
Still, to have managed to survive in this jungle for such 
a long time... he’s no mere old man.

Japanese:
ひょっとしたら　元は
優秀な兵士だったのかもしれんな
English: He might’ve been a superior officer before...

Japanese: まっさか～
English: No way～

Japanese: 案外　立派な人だったのかも
English: And a splendid person...

Japanese: まっさか～
English: No way～

Japanese:
確かに　アシハラの王さまのように
人は　見かけによらない場合もあるからね
English:
He might be just like Ashihara’s king.
We must not hastily judge books by their covers...

Japanese: まっさか～
English: No way～

Japanese:
そうだね　ひょっとしたら
ガルポスの王さまなのかも…
English: Right! He might also be Galpos’ king!

Japanese: まっさか～ッ！！
English: No way～!!

Japanese:
王都からバカンスに来た
貴族の可能性だってあるぞ？
English:
There’s the probability that he might also be a 
noble from Regnum...

Japanese: まーさーかー！！
English: No～ way～!

Japanese:
そうそう　実は
レグヌムの王さまなのかも！
English: Right! He might actually be Regnum’s King!

Japanese: まさ…
English: No--

Japanese:
いや　ルカ
いくらなんでも
それは話が　ムチャだろ…
English: Ruca, no. That’s totally impossible.

Japanese:
せっかく　きれいな流れが
できてたのにね…
English: And we were on a roll too...

Japanese:
ホント　こいつ
流れ止めるんだよな～
English: You really had to stop it, huh?

Japanese: ごめん…
English: Sorry...

Japanese: 犬男→シアン
English: Dog Boy -> Sian

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
あの犬野郎　シアンって
名前だったんだな
English: So that dog brat was called Sian, huh?

Japanese:
せやってんなぁ
そういうたら　初対面のとき
名前　言うとった　気ぃするわ
English:
Oh was it? Ah was sure he said his name when we 
first met.

Japanese:
気の毒な子だったんだね
果樹園を荒らすのは　良くないけど
同情の余地はあるかも…
English:
I know that destroying an orchard’s bad, but he must
be miserable.

Japanese:
確かに　生まれは不幸だけどよォ
でも　それとこれとは
話が　違わなくねェ？
English:
Look, I know that he was born unfortunate,
but aren’t they both different things?

Japanese:
せやなぁ…
どないしたらええんやろ
English:
Right. Ah wonder what we 
should do when we meet ’em?

Japanese: 彼を救うべきだ
English: Let’s save him

Japanese: 自分で考えさせるべきだ
English: Let him decide for himself

Japanese: 同情は良くないと言う
English: Sympathizing isn’t good

Japanese:
あの子には　頼りになる人が
周りにいなかったんだ
だから　マティウスなんかの元に…
English:
That child didn’t have people he could rely on... that 
must be why he went to Mattheus.

Japanese:
そーだな
オレたちなら　そこそこ頼れる仲間に
なってやれそうだよな
English:
You’re right. If it were us, I think we could be 
good friends.

Japanese:
せやせや
やっぱちゃんとした　友達がおらんと
人間　曲がってまうねんて
English: Yeah! He’s gotta have human friends he’d hafta turn to.

Japanese:
でも　あの子は　自分で自分の過ちに
気がつく必要が
あるんじゃないのかな？
English: But I think he should realize his own mistake.

Japanese:
たとえ　あの子を救うことが目的でも
僕たちの仲間になることを　強要したら
それはマティウスと　同じだよ
English:
Even if we want to save him, we’re still the same as 
Mattheus if we force him to join us.

Japanese:
そうやな…
どっちにせよ
きっちり　話しせんとあかんで
English: Yer right... Either way, we hafta talk ta ’em properly.

Japanese:
でもよォ　今はマティウスの下で
言いなりになってんだろ？
自分で物事の判断が　できねェかもな
English:
But isn’t he under Mattheus’ thumb? I don’t think he can 
decide properly by himself.

Japanese:
う～ん
どないかしたらんと
あかんなぁ…
English: Hmm... either way is bad though...

Japanese:
だからと言って
不用意に
同情するのは　良くないよ
English:
Just because we know his situation doesn’t mean that 
we can just sympathize with him.

Japanese:
マティウスの　部下になった責任は
あの子にだってあるだろうし
English:
After all, he’s responsible for becoming Mattheus’ 
underling.

Japanese:
だよなぁ
違いねェ
ちょっとは　叱ってやらねーとな
English: Right, we have to scold him properly.

Japanese:
え～？
かわいそうやん
English: What, no!

Japanese:
でもよ　このまま
放っといても　仕方ねーぜ？
English: You know we can’t just let him do what he wants.

Japanese:
なにが正しいか　自分で
判断できねェのなら　首根っこ
押さえつけてでも　教えてやんねェとよ
English:
We gotta teach him what’s right even if we have to hold 
him by the scruff of his neck.

Japanese:
…まあ　そうやなぁ
それも　しゃあないんかなぁ
English: Well, Ah guess yer right...

Japanese: 次に会ったら…
English: The next time we meet him...

Japanese:
ウチが　話してみるで
ことわざにもあるやろ？
English: Ah’ll try an’ talk to ’em by sayin’ a proverb.

Japanese:
「ナントカ　ナントカするも
　ナントカのナントカ」って
English:
Sumthin’ like: “Even a blah blah is caused by blah in 
yer blah blah.”

Japanese:
ナントカばっかで
ひとっつも　わかんねェよ！
English:
No way he’s gonna understand you if you keep saying 
“blah, blah, blah, blah, blah.”

Japanese:
「袖擦り合うも
　多生の縁」のことじゃないかな
English:
Isn’t it “Even a chance acquaintance is caused by a 
connection in your past life?”

Japanese:
ああ　それそれ！
さすが　ルカ兄ちゃん！
English: Yeah! That! Thank ya, Ruca Bro!

Japanese:
ルカ…
なんで　あれでわかるんだよ
おまえ　すげェな…
English:
How the heck did you even know what proverb that is? 
Scary...

Japanese: ウチ、エラいん？
English: Was I Good?

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
そうか～　ウチ
一応　神さまやってんなぁ～～
English: Ah see... so Ah was once a god, huh?

Japanese:
そうよ　エル　ヴリトラを信じ
ヴリトラを　愛した人たちが
こうして　あなたを祀ったのよ
English:
Yes, Hermie. Everyone believed and loved Vritra, and 
thus, worshipped you.

Japanese:
ヴリトラは…　その人らに
なんぞしてあげとったんやろか？
English: An’ what did Vritra... do fer ’em?

Japanese: さあ？
English: Who knows?

Japanese: さあ？　って…
English: “Who knows”...?

Japanese:
迷える子羊が　素朴な疑問
カマしてんねんで？
なんぞ　答えたってぇな
English:
Ah’m jus’ askin’ a simple question here, hear? What 
kinda answer is that?

Japanese:
人というのはね
心の平安が欲しいから　祈るの
English:
You see, people will only pray if they want peace 
of mind.

Japanese:
人が勝手に　天に向かって
祈るだけだから　なにもしてあげなくても
別に構わないのよ
English:
They will turn towards Cielo on their own accord, 
whatever they pray for does not matter at all.

Japanese: そんなもんなん？
English: Was that the case?

Japanese:
だって　私は祈りたくて祈ってたもの
天の恵みが欲しくて
祈ったことなんてないなぁ
English:
I have only prayed because I wanted to pray, 
not because I needed Cielo’s blessings.

Japanese: そんなんで　幸せなん？
English: And yer happy with that?

Japanese:
もちろん
幸せよ
English: Of course I am.

Japanese:
ふ～ん　ウチには　わからんなぁ
ただ　祈るだけなんて
別に腹も　ふくれんやろうに…
English: Ah don’ get it, it’s not like Ah’ll be full if Ah pray.

Japanese: 悲しき転生者
English: Wretched Reincarnator

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia
Sigh...

Japanese:
どしたの？　ルカ
落ち込んだ顔してさぁ
どういう構われ方　されたいわけ？
English:
Okay, What’s with the long face? You want me to 
cuddle you or something?

Japanese:
…いや　あのさ
やっぱり転生者って　不幸だよね
シアンを見て　改めて感じたんだ
English:
No, it’s just that... After meeting Sian, I’ve started to 
see Reincarnators in a more unfortunate light.

Japanese:
あの子の不幸は　別格だから
参考にならないと思うけど？
English:
Sian’s different compared to normal Reincarnators so I 
don’t think he’s a good reference point to look at.

Japanese: 同意する
English: Agree

Japanese: 同意しない
English: Disagree

Japanese:
そう…　だね
あの子の場合　生まれ育ちが
不幸だった
English:
I suppose... in his case, he’s been wrought with
misfortune ever since the day he was born.

Japanese:
そーよ　そーよ
だったら　幸せを取り返すぐらいに
頑張らなきゃ
English:
Right. That’s why he has to work hard to take back 
his own happiness.

Japanese:
そう…　かな？
ヘタをすれば
僕も　ああだったのかもしれないよ
English: Is that so...? He might just be awkward like me.

Japanese:
なんにしても
今が不幸なら　なんとかして
幸せになろうと頑張らなきゃ！
English:
Anyways, he has to work against his misfortune and 
take back his own happiness.

Japanese: 人生は　楽しまないと損でしょ？
English: I mean you gotta enjoy life while it lasts.

Japanese:
確かに　シアンはもっと
楽しい生き方をした方がいいと思う
English: I think it’d better if Sian lives a happy life.

Japanese:
ありゃあ　あんたに言われるなんて
よっぽどね
あんたも　不幸に酔うタイプなのに
English:
That’s so... I can’t believe you’d say that since you’re 
also a miserable type.

Japanese:
今　思うと…
僕は　不幸なんかじゃ
なかったんだね
English: Thinking about it... maybe I’m not really unhappy.

Japanese:
「不幸なんかじゃない」じゃなくて
あんたなんか
「全然幸せな方だった」が　正解かな
English:
Maybe it’s not that you’re “unhappy” but rather, you 
were never happy in the first place.

Japanese:
家は　お金持ちで
今は　仲間にも出会えて
あの子に比べれば　全然幸せな方よ
English:
You’re rich and you’ve met a lot of people 
in this journey. Compared to that kid, you 
should be happier than he is.

Japanese:
うん
イリアの言う通りだ
自分の生い立ちに　感謝しなきゃ
English: Right, I’ll have to be more grateful for how I am now.

Japanese: アレがマティウスか…
English: So that was Mattheus...

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: あの人が　マティウス…
English: That was Mattheus...

Japanese:
顔を隠してるなんて
いけすかねェな
English: Pretty lame of her to hide behind a mask.

Japanese:
そーよ！
胡散臭そうなヤツだけど
実際ホントに　胡散臭いのよ！
English:
Damn right! 
She really is as shady as she looks!

Japanese:
あの人の考え　詳しく聞きたかったな
こういう言い方は　良くないけど…
絶対　言い負かしてやったのに
English:
I wish I could have gotten a better glimpse of the ideals
that drive her. Although I know such an action is rude, I
feel a strong need to refute them to her very face.

Japanese: アンジュ　怒ってンなァ
English: Damn, Ange’s mad...

Japanese:
「すーみついん」だっけ？
そいつらが　バックにいるのが
気に食わないんじゃないの？
English:
Are you mad coz the “Private Count Sill” or 
whatever’s backing her up?

Japanese:
信仰は　自然発生的な存在のはずよ
権力に取り入って　布教を行うなんて
摂理に　反すると思うの
English:
Faith is supposed to be a natural occurence.
Cozying up to political power in order to propagate 
faith is contradictory to divine providence.

Japanese:
で…　でもアンジュのいた
ナーオスの教会だって
昔は　すっごい権力持ってたんでしょ？
English:
But didn’t you mention that the Church in Naohs used 
to possess a lot of political power?

Japanese:
それは社会が未成熟で　政教分離が
進んでいなかった　昔の話よ
今は　そうじゃないもの
English:
That was before the Church and the State separated 
into two entities, something that had happened a long 
time ago.

Japanese:
にもかかわらず
聖職者が　軍隊とつながって
武力で　こんなことするなんて…
English:
To think of merging the Church into the armed forces 
despite that...

Japanese:
あの人は
教義を忘れてしまったとしか　思えない
そうは思わない！？
English:
I do not believe that someone like her 
would simply “forget” the doctrine... 
Do you not think so!?

Japanese: アンジュ　マジっぽいね…
English: She’s serious...

Japanese:
ああ…
いつもの　おちゃらけ感が
まったくないな…
English: The lighthearted vibe she always has is... nada.

Japanese:
ちょっと！
ちゃんと聞いてるの！？
English: ARE YOU BOTH LISTENING TO ME!?

Japanese: はい！
English: Yes ma’am!

Japanese: 聞いてます！
English: We’re listening, ma’am!

Japanese:
あら
じゃあ　続きを話していい？
English: Then may I continue the discussion?

Japanese:
…………
さいなら～！
English: BYE!

Japanese:
もう！
マジメな話になったら
途端に　こうなんだから！
English:
Sheesh! Right after the conversation started to 
get serious!

Japanese:
ちょっと
ふたりとも待ちなさ～い！
English: You two, stop!

Japanese: リカルド…あの野郎！
English: Ricardo You Bastard!

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: リカルドの野郎！
English: Ricardo, you bastard!

Japanese:
まったく！
リカルドのクソ野郎め！
English: Damn right! Ricardo, you bastard!

Japanese: 同意する
English: Agree that he betrayed everyone

Japanese: 同意しない
English: Disagree that he betrayed everyone

Japanese:
確かに　なにか事情があるにしても
僕らに　なんの説明もないのは
いけないよね
English:
I know that Ricardo has his reasons, but he 
should’ve at least explained himself 
before doing what he did.

Japanese:
事情？　そんなもんがあったとして
あの裏切りが許せるか？
許せるわきゃねェだろ！
English:
“Reasons?” Look, even if he has his own reasons,
d’ya really think I can forgive him that easily?

Japanese:
そうそう！　しかも実は
なんの事情もなかったりしたら
どーしてくれんのよ！
English:
Yeah! What if he doesn’t have any reason 
for what he did? What’re you gonna do?

Japanese:
…いや　それは
どうもしないけどさ
English:
If he doesn’t... No...
I don’t really want to think about it...

Japanese: だったら　黙ってなさいよ！
English: Then SHUT UP!

Japanese:
ああ　まったくだ！
黙ってろ！
English: Damn right! Shut up!

Japanese:
どうして
僕が責められなきゃ
いけないんだよ…
English: Why are you blaming me for this?

Japanese:
ホントに　リカルドは裏切ったのかな？
なにか事情があったのかもしれないよ？
English:
Did Ricardo really betray us?
Maybe he has his own reason for doing so?

Japanese:
ああ？
事情があったら　裏切っても
いいってのか？
English:
HUH? So you’re saying he betrayed 
us coz of something?

Japanese:
…でも　ガードルって言ったっけ？
前世で兄弟だったんだよね
English:
But he did mention that “Gardle” person was his 
older brother...

Japanese:
きっと僕たちには　わからない
複雑な事情があるんじゃないかな
English:
I’m sure he has a complicated reason that 
we don’t know about.

Japanese:
だからって　仲間を
裏切っていいわけないでしょ！
English:
But that still doesn’t mean that he can just 
immediately betray us!

Japanese:
きっとまた　リカルドに会える
そのときに　話を聞いてみようよ
English:
I’m sure we’ll meet him again, so let’s ask him
when the time comes.

Japanese:
でもよ
一発だけ　殴らせろよな？
English: If we do, can I hit him? At least once?

Japanese:
あたしは　お尻
蹴っ飛ばしてやるんだから！
English: I wanna kick his ass. HARD.

Japanese:
まあ　それぐらいなら
バチは　当たらないかな…
English:
I don’t know if you’ll be able to
if you both just want to beat him up...

Japanese: リカルド…どうしたんだろう…
English: Why did Ricardo...?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: リカルドさん…
English: Sir Ricardo...

Japanese:
ホンマ
どないしたんやろか…
English: Tell me ’bout it. Why did he even...?

Japanese: 許す
English: Forgive

Japanese: 許せない
English: Do not forgive

Japanese:
僕は　彼を責めないよ
きっと　事情があったんだろうしね
English: I won’t blame him. I’m sure he has his reasons.

Japanese:
…………
ルカくんの心の広さには
感心するわね
English: I admire that mercy of yours, Ruca.

Japanese:
ホンマやで
そこそこ大きい　ウチの胸にも
収められへんわぁ
English: Yeah! It’s so big that it can’t even fit mah chest!

Japanese:
事情はあるのかもしれないけれど
僕らに　ひと言あってもいいじゃないか
僕　許せないよ
English:
He could’ve said something if he had a reason. 
I’ll never forgive him...

Japanese:
ホンマや　相談ぐらい
乗ったるっちゅうねん
English: True, he coulda at least asked us fer advice...

Japanese:
そう…　ね
ただ　話を聞いても　あの人の気持ちは
理解できないかもしれないけれど…
English:
You are correct, but... I do not believe we 
would be able to fully understand his 
feelings even after hearing him out.

Japanese: ふたりとも　怒ってるの？
English: Are you both angry at him?

Japanese:
「怒り」とは　少し違うかな
リカルドさんを　理解できない自分を
恥じているのかも
English:
It is a bit different from “anger”... It might be that I feel 
ashamed for not being able to understand him.

Japanese:
ごめんなさい
私も　自分でどう感じているのか
上手く説明できない…
English:
I am sorry, I cannot really express what I am currently 
feeling.

Japanese:
ウチは怒ってへんで
ただ　ちょっと気ィ悪いだけやねん
English: Ah’m not mad either. Ah jus’ feel a bit bad.

Japanese:
そう
僕は　とにかく
リカルドと　会って話したい
English: Oh. At the very least, I want to hear him out.

Japanese:
あの方は　契約を守る人
だから必ず　私との契約も果たしてくれる
私は　そう信じたい…
English:
He is the type to honor his promises, so... I want to 
believe that he shall follow our contract to the end.

Japanese:
でも　アンジュ姉ちゃん
…それは　甘い考えかもしれんで
English: But Sis Ange, ain’t that a bit too naive?

Japanese:
そうかな…
うん　そうかも…
English: Is it...? I suppose you may be right...

Japanese: 幽閉なんて勘弁！
English: Gimme a Break from Imprisonment!

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
なによ　このシケた場所は！
あ～　もう信じられない！
English:
What the hell is this muggy place!?
UGHHHH, I can’t FREAKING believe this!

Japanese: 大きな声だね…
English: Loud...

Japanese:
声もデッカくなるっての！
幽閉よ　幽閉！
こ・ん・な・と・こ・ろ・で！
English:
You bet it can get louder!
WE’RE STUCK HERE! 
S-T-U-C-K! STUCK!

Japanese: こ・ん・な・と・こ・ろ・で！
English: S-T-U-C-K! STUCK!

Japanese:
発音練習じゃないっての！
なんでマネすんのよ！
English:
Why are you copying me!?
It’s not like I’m practicing how 
to pronounce it!

Japanese:
お…　イリア
練習　ダメか？
English: Practice with Illia bad?

Japanese:
イリア
キュキュさんに
当たらなくてもいいじゃないか
English: Illia, you shouldn’t take your anger out on QQ.

Japanese:
当たりたくもなるわよ
ずっとここに　閉じ込められてたんじゃ
楽しいこと　なんにもなさそうじゃない
English:
Well she better get used to it. It ain’t like there’s gonna 
be anything fun here in the first place.

Japanese:
サーカスも　来ないし
乗馬も　できないし…
パパにもママにも　会えないのよ！
English:
No circus, no horse riding... and I won’t be able to meet 
Papa and Mama anymore!

Japanese:
サーカス？　ジョウバ？
それ　なにか？
キュキュ　知りたい
English:
Circus? Horse Riding? 
What are those? QQ want to know!

Japanese:
はぁ…　どうせヒマだから
いろいろ　教えてあげる
あっち　行きましょ
English:
Well, I’m bored anyway so lemme teach you. 
Let’s go over there.

Japanese:
…ホント　学校もテストもないなんて
張り合いがないよね　…って　あれ？
ねえイリア　僕の話も聞いてよ！
English:
Tell me about it, no one to compete against in tests or 
in school-- Huh? Illia, are you listening to me?

Japanese:
テストなんて
楽しくもなんともないでしょー
あんたバカじゃないのー？
English:
What’s so fun about tests? 
Are you an idiot!?

Japanese:
え～…
そ…　そうかな
楽しいじゃないか　テスト…
English: Huh? But tests are fun... right?

Japanese: リカルドを慰めてみる
English: Comforting Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
あ…　あのリカルド
大丈夫？
English: Are you alright, Ricardo...?

Japanese:
フン…　心配するな
ガードルの死は
俺に　なんの影響も与えてはいない
English:
Don’t worry about me. Gardle’s death did not affect me 
in the slightest.

Japanese: いぶかしむ
English: Doubt

Japanese: そういうことにしておく
English: If you say so...

Japanese:
そうかな
僕には　リカルドが
すごく悲しそうに　見えるよ
English: Is that so? I think you look quite sad, though...

Japanese:
だとしたら
それは　ヒュプノスの記憶に
よるものだろう
English:
If so, it might have something 
to do with Hypnos’ memories.

Japanese: 彼は　兄想いだったようだからな
English: He cared a lot for his brother, after all.

Japanese:
…そうだね　たとえ悲しくても
それは　リカルドのものじゃないよね
きっと　ヒュプノスの…
English:
You’re right... whatever sadness you have 
probably isn’t yours, but Hypnos’...

Japanese: ああ　その通りだ
English: Indeed.

Japanese:
せめて　遺体だけでも
引き上げられれば
良かったのにね
English:
If only we could at least retrieve 
his body from the ocean...

Japanese:
いや　あのままでいい
あのまま朽ちて　地上とひとつになる…
きっとそれが　彼の望みだろう
English:
No, leave him be. As he decays, 
he will slowly become one with Terro. 
I suppose that’s also what he wishes.

Japanese: お墓は要らないの？
English: Not even a grave?

Japanese:
ああ　必要ない
この世界が　彼の墓となる
それでいい
English:
Not even a grave. Let the world we step on 
become his tomb, he’s fine as he is.

Japanese: マムート訛り
English: The Marmut Accent

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
そういえば　この町の人の訛りって
エルに似てるね
English:
You know, everyone’s accent here 
is quite similar to Hermie’s.

Japanese:
ああ　案外エルマーナの親は
ここの出身だったのかもしれんな
English: It might be because Hermana’s parents are from here.

Japanese:
ちょっと　聞いてみようか
おーい　エルー！
English: Should we ask her? Hey, Hermie!

Japanese: なんでおます？
English: Whazzamatta?

Japanese: お…　おます？
English: Wha-- za... what?

Japanese:
えーっと…　エルの言葉って
この町の人の訛りに似てるんだけど
ご両親って　この町の人だったの？
English:
Anyways, your accent is quite similar 
to how the people in this area speak.
Are your parents from here?

Japanese:
へぇへぇ　ウチの両親は
行商人しておりましたんや
English: Me parents were peddlers, aye?

Japanese:
せやから
いろんなところへ　旅しておったと
聞いておりまんねん
English:
That’s prolly why they picked up 
lotsa stuff on their travels.

Japanese:
えーっと　ご両親は
いつ頃　亡くなったの？
English: Then... How old were you when you lost them?

Japanese:
１年前ですかいなぁ
王都へ向かう途中　敗残兵崩れの
野盗に会うてしもて…
English:
T’was one year ago when me parents ran inta 
former soldiers turned bandits while on tharrr
way ta Regnum...

Japanese:
そうだったんだ…
でも　行商人だったのなら
この町の出身でも　おかしくないね
English:
Ohh... but if they were peddlers, it 
wouldn’t be strange if they were 
from this town.

Japanese:
おとんにも　おかんにも出身なんて
聞いたこと　おまへんねんけど
案外　そうかもしらんねぇ
English:
Aye nevarrr knew about where
me Ma and Pa were born.
So that mighta been the case.

Japanese:
…いつもの訛りとは　少し違うな？
ということは　生粋のマムート人では
ないのかもしれんぞ
English:
Your usual accent’s a bit different, isn’t it? 
So you might not be from Marmut.

Japanese:
そうですねん
せやけど　言葉が似てるせいで
完全に　うつってしもうたんでがす
English:
Yer right, but it’s kinda depressin’
since they’re both kinda similar.

Japanese: 方言を褒める
English: Praise her dialect

Japanese: 違和感を覚える
English: There’s something off

Japanese:
でも　その言葉遣いも
かわいいね
English: But your manner of speaking is also pretty cute.

Japanese:
ほんまでっか？
やっぱ　ルカ兄ちゃんは
優しい人で　おますなぁ
English: Really? Ruca Bro ya sure are kind!

Japanese: 不思議だね　しっくり来ないや
English: How strange... The way you speak feels a bit off.

Japanese:
ウチも　そない思うとんのでごわす
せやけど　自分でも
どないもならんとーよ
English:
That’s what Aye think too,
but Aye can’t help meself.

Japanese:
…ところどころ　全然違う
言葉が混ざってない？
English:
Aren’t you blending in some
other words into your dialogue?

Japanese:
言葉が違うだけで
まるで　別人みたいだね
English:
The way you speak is different, but it’s 
almost as if you’re a different person.

Japanese: そうでんなぁ
English: Righto, ain’t it?

Japanese:
ちょっとちょっと　リカルドも言葉
うつってるよ…
English: Hold on, Ricardo, your accent’s slipping a bit.

Japanese:
ああ　ホンマや…
カンニンどすえ
English: Ahhh you’re right, sorry...

Japanese: エル、疲れてるの？
English: Are you Tired, Hermie?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ふぅ…
English: Sigh...

Japanese:
ねえ　エル
体調悪そうだけど
どこか悪いの？
English:
You don’t look so well.
Hermie, what’s wrong?

Japanese:
まあ　そらぁ１３年も生きとったら
悪いところも　出てくるわぁ
English:
Well, after livin’ thirteen years there’s
bound ta be some bad stuff.

Japanese:
１３年って
まだまだ　子どもじゃないか…
English: “Thirteen”... that’s still quite young.

Japanese:
でもな　ウチ　つい最近まで
普通の不幸少女やっとったのに
突然　このパワーに目覚めてんで？
English:
But y’know, Ah’ve been a normal
unfortunate girl until recently an’
then, Ah suddenly got this power.

Japanese:
そらぁ
あちこち　ガタも来るで
English: Ah’m just a bit rattled.

Japanese:
どこが悪いの？
ヒザ？　腰？
English:
Where does it hurt?
Your knee? Back?

Japanese:
疲れが　たまったんかいなぁ
肌が荒れてきて　指の逆むけとか
ちょっと　水にしみんねん
English:
Ah suppose Ah’m jus’ tired. My skin’s
startin’ ta get chappy an’ my fingers are
peelin’ an’ drinkin’ water has been harder.

Japanese:
な～んだぁ
それって　単に北の戦場の
冷たい水のせいじゃないか
English:
Ohh... isn’t that just because
of Tenos’ colder water?

Japanese:
あ～！！　大事なことやねんで？
ウチは　イリア姉ちゃんみたいに
スタイル良うないし
English:
This is important, hear?
S’not like Ah’m as purty as Sis Illia.

Japanese:
アンジュ姉ちゃんみたいに　乳ないもん
ウチには　肌のキレイさしか
取り得ないねん…
English:
An’ Ah don’ have big boobies like
Sis Ange does, Ah can only rely on
mah smooth skin...

Japanese: そんなことないよ
English: That’s not true.

Japanese:
ええ～…？
ほなウチ　肌汚い？
English: Huh? See, mah skin’s all dirty.

Japanese:
ち…　違うよ！　そうじゃなくてさ
エルは　まだ１３歳でしょ？
English: N-No that’s not it! You’re just thirteen, right?

Japanese:
これから背は　伸びるし
胸だって　大きくなるよ
English:
From now on, you’ll grow taller
and your chest will get bigger.

Japanese:
ホンマに？
イリア姉ちゃんや
アンジュ姉ちゃんみたいに？
English: Really? Jus’ like Sis Illia and Sis Ange?

Japanese: 断言する
English: Affirm

Japanese: 少し質問する
English: Ask a small question

Japanese:
今は　スタイルのことなんて気にせず
しっかり食べて　ちゃんと眠れば
イリアや　アンジュ以上になれるよ
English:
Right now, you’re worrying too much about how
you look. You have to eat and sleep properly and
you’ll become better than Illia and Ange.

Japanese:
え～と　じゃあ
その前に　エルのお母さんって
スタイル　どんな感じだったの？
English:
Hmm... first of all, what did
your mother look like?

Japanese:
背ぇデカかってん
女の人に　あるまじき長身やったな
English:
She was mighty tall!
Taller than the average woman!

Japanese: お父さんは？
English: And your dad?

Japanese:
背ぇは　低かったな
でも　太っとったから
乳はデカかったかもしらん
English:
He was awfully short, but since he was fat,
maybe his boobs were big.

Japanese:
…じゃ　じゃあ　理想の体型に
なれるんじゃないかな？
English:
Then doesn’t that mean you’d
get your ideal body?

Japanese:
上手く行けば　ご両親の特徴が
都合よく現れるかも
English:
Hopefully, you might inherit your
parents’ appearance.

Japanese: …そうか～
English: Ohh...

Japanese: よっしゃ　ほな　ウチ頑張る！
English: A’ight! Ah’ll do mah best too!

Japanese:
胸はイリアぐらい
身長は　アンジュぐらいなら
保証できるんだけどなぁ…
English:
At the very least, I can guarantee that
she’ll be as tall as Ange and as big as Illia’s.

Japanese: 動く死体
English: Moving Corpses

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
あ～　それにしても
気持ち悪い敵だった…
English:
Yuck, those enemies were
pretty disgusting.

Japanese:
気温が低いせいかな
匂わなくて　良かったね
English:
Maybe it’s because it’s cooler,
but I’m glad we can’t smell them.

Japanese:
う～…　折れた骨が飛び出してたり
筋肉のピンクの断面とかさぁ
見た？
English:
Ughh... The bones... they were flying around...
heck, did you even see those patches of pink
flesh on it?

Japanese:
あれ　思い出したら
骨付きチキンになんか
かぶりつけなくなっちゃいそう…
English:
God, I don’t think I can bring myself
to eat chicken anymore...

Japanese:
まだ死体を　見慣れていない
新兵たちが　似たようなことを
よく言うものだ
English:
New recruits often say similar
things at the sight of a dead body.

Japanese:
まあ　戦場に一週間も居れば
平気になるものだがな
English:
A week on the battlefield
and you’ll get used to it.

Japanese:
だったらさ　イリア
一週間　肉断ちしてみる？
English:
Why don’t you hold off on
the meat for a while, Illia?

Japanese:
冗談でしょ！
今でも牛肉や豚肉なら　食べるもん
たいてい　骨付きじゃないし！
English:
I’m kidding! I can still eat pork and beef! 
It’s just... I don’t think I’ll be able to
handle any meat with bones.

Japanese:
なら　牛や豚でも　スペアリブや
Ｔボーンステーキは　食えないな
English:
Then that means no spare ribs
or t-bone steak for you.

Japanese:
う…
い～や　頑張って食べる！
English: Aww... I’ll try... my best!

Japanese:
じゃあ　骨付きチキンも
頑張れば
食べられるんじゃないの？
English: Then does that mean you can try and eat chicken?

Japanese:
う～ん…
そう言われてみれば　そうね
好き嫌いは　良くないし…
English: If you put it that way, then yeah...

Japanese:
じゃあ　骨付きチキンも
頑張って食べることに　決～めた♪
English: Imma try my best eating chicken from now on!

Japanese:
やれやれ
うちの女性陣の　食欲には
まったく驚かされるな
English:
Good grief, the appetite of these ladies
is quite the force to be reckoned with.

Japanese: ホントだね…
English: True...

Japanese: ぶつぶつぶつ
English: *Grumble*

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
う～ん…
ぶつぶつぶつ　ぶつぶつぶつ
English: Hm... *grumbling*

Japanese: 構う
English: Meddle

Japanese: 放っておく
English: Leave her alone

Japanese:
エル　なにか考えごと？
それとも　エルのことだから
ただ　考えごとのフリしてるだけ？
English:
What are you thinking about, Hermie?
Or... are you just pretending?

Japanese:
あ！　ルカ兄ちゃん　ヒド～
フリちゃうっちゅ～ねん
ホンマに　考えごとしてんねんで？
English:
Ruca Bro yer so horrible!
Ah ain’t pretendin’, Ah’m really
thinkin’ ’bout sumthin’!

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
…ルカ兄ちゃん
ニヤニヤ　見つめて
なんか用？
English:
Ya been smirkin’ at me fer a while now.
Whatcha want Ruca Bro?

Japanese:
なんだか　考えごとしてるみたいだから
温かく　見守ろうと思ってさ
English:
Oh, you seem to be lost in thought
so I was just observing.

Japanese:
そんなニヤついた顔で
見つめられると　気になって
考えごとどころや　のうなってまうわ
English:
Can ya stop starin’ at me with that expression?
Yer disturbin’ me.

Japanese:
エルの考えごとって
やっぱり　ご飯のことかな？
English: Maybe Hermie was actually thinking about lunch?

Japanese:
決まってんでしょ？
ご飯のことよ
English: Dummy, of course she’s thinking about lunch.

Japanese:
ああ　間違いなく
メシのことだな
English: Yeah, no doubt about it. Definitely lunch.

Japanese: だったら　心配ないかぁ…
English: Oh, so there’s no need to worry...

Japanese: アンジュ、考えごと
English: Ange’s Thoughts

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ねえ　アンジュの様子が
気になるんだけど…
English: About Ange...

Japanese: おそらく　前世絡みだろうな
English:
It’s very likely that the way she is now has
something to do with her past life.

Japanese:
彼女が　悩みごとなんて
珍しいね
English:
It is quite rare for her to be worried
about something.

Japanese:
うん
話　聞いた方がいいかな？
English: Yeah. Should I ask her about it?

Japanese:
でも　彼女なら　悩みがあれば
自分から　相談してくるんじゃないかな
English:
I think if she has something she’s
worried about, she will likely tell us about it.

Japanese:
確かに　アンジュは
そういうタイプだろう
心配はいらん
English: Indeed, that’s what kind of person she is.

Japanese:
そんなの　わからないよ
案外　言いたくても
言い出せないのかも…
English:
But we don’t know that.
Maybe it’s something she’s been
wanting to tell us but can’t.

Japanese: これがルカなら　そうだろうな
English: That might be the case if it was you.

Japanese:
聞いてみたところで　彼女の方に
相談する気がなければ　のらりくらりと
かわされるだけだと思うよ
English:
I believe that she will just avoid your
questions if it is something she
does not want to talk about.

Japanese:
…のらりくらりって
コンウェイだって
いつも　そうじゃないか…
English: ...Isn’t that what you usually do?

Japanese:
あ！　アンジュ！
ねえ　なにか悩みごとが
あるんじゃない？
English:
Oh, Ange! What’s wrong?
Are you worried about something?

Japanese: あら　ルカくん　鋭い
English: Oh Ruca, you are too perceptive.

Japanese:
この先　寒くなるでしょ？
だから上着を　新調しようかと
悩んでいたところなの
English:
I have been wondering about getting a new
coat lately, since it shall be colder from
here onwards.

Japanese:
…………
それ　本当？
English: Is that... really it?

Japanese:
…………う～ん
本当は…
English: Hm... To be honest...

Japanese: うんうん！
English: Yeah?

Japanese:
上着だけじゃなく　下着も
新調しようかと…
ねえ　ルカくん　どう思う？
English:
To be honest, I have been thinking of getting
not only a new coat but also a new set of
undergarments. What do you think?

Japanese:
し…　下着って…
僕に　そんなの　わかんないよ！
English:
U-Under-undergarments...
As if I’d know something about that!

Japanese:
そう？
でも　心配してくれてありがとう
ルカくん
English:
Oh, you do not?
Still, thank you for worrying about me, Ruca.

Japanese:
ちぇ…
リカルドとコンウェイの
言った通りだったみたい…
English:
Tch... it went as Ricardo and Kongwei
said it would.

Japanese: たまに死神っぽい
English: Kind of Like a Reaper

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
リカルドって　ときどき
元は死神だったんだなぁと
思うようなこと　言うよな
English:
Ricardo, you sure say some Reaper-like
things sometimes.

Japanese:
おまえたちの　知らんことを
少し知っているだけだ
English: I know a few things that you might not.

Japanese:
へえ～？
じゃあ　たとえば
どんなこと　知ってるの？
English:
Really?
What kind of stuff do you know about?

Japanese:
今となっては　まったく役に立たんが
地上人の魂を　引っ張り出す方法や
健全な魂の持ち主を　選別する方法だな
English:
For example, while it’s a bit useless now, I know 
the means of extracting a soul and of 
identifying the owner of a healthy soul.

Japanese:
げ…　それって　マジおっかなくねェ？
うっかり　オレの魂
抜き取ったりしねェでくれよな…
English:
Is... isn’t that a bit scary?
You sure you won’t accidentally pull out my soul?

Japanese:
安心しろ
ただ方法を　覚えているだけさ
この体には　そんな力はない
English:
Don’t worry, I only remember the process.
This body doesn’t have such an ability.

Japanese:
ああ…　そういうこと
ビックリした
English:
Oh... so that’s the case.
That scared me.

Japanese:
俺がライフルを好むのは　敵を撃つ瞬間が
前世で　鎌を振るっていた
あの感触に　近いからかもな
English:
Perhaps the reason I like rifles is how close
the feeling of shooting an enemy is to 
wielding a scythe in my past life.

Japanese:
へぇ～
あんたが　自分のことを話すなんて
珍しいな
English:
I see... Pretty strange to hear you
talking about yourself.

Japanese:
まあ　たまには…　な
そういう気分のときもあるさ
English: Sometimes... You get those moods... Sometimes.

Japanese: 戦場の危険について
English: The Dangers of the Battlefield

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: 戦場かぁ…
English: The battlefield...

Japanese: 俺にとっては　馴染みの匂いだ
English: This place is like home to me.

Japanese:
僕も　一度　戦場に立たされたけど
やっぱり　不安だなぁ
English:
I’ve fought in one before, but I still can’t help but 
feel anxious.

Japanese:
いいだろう
なら　少し戦場の心得を教えてやる
English: Fine, then let me teach you a bit about the battlefield.

Japanese:
ええ？
いや　別にいいよぉ…
English: Huh? That’s fine, but I--

Japanese:
黙って聞け！
口答えなど　誰が許可したか！
English:
Shut up and listen! Who gave you permission to 
talk back to me?

Japanese:
その締まりのない口を
許可なく　二度と開くな！
いいな！？
English:
Don’t you dare ever open that unruly mouth, 
understand!?

Japanese: う…　うん…
English: O-Okay...

Japanese: 返事は「はい　上官どの！」だ！
English:
I want to hear “Sir, yes sir!” from you, 
not that half-assed answer.

Japanese:
今度　違う言葉を　その薄汚い口から
吐き出してみろ！
その可愛いケツを　蹴り上げてやる！
English:
Now, I want to hear those words out of your filthy
mouth before I kick it out of your cute little ass!

Japanese:
ええ…
はぁい　上官どのぉ…
English: Huh? Sir, yes sir...

Japanese:
ふざけるな！　大声を出せ！
貴様は「大声を出すな」と　しつけられた
お嬢さんか！？
English:
Don’t mess with me! Louder! You call that loud? 
Are you a little lady or something?

Japanese:
ど…　どうしたのさ　リカルド
突然　そんな口調で…
English:
Ricardo, what’s gotten into you... 
why are you acting like this...?

Japanese:
ふぬけを相手に　質問するのは
俺の仕事だ！
わかったら　とっとと返事をしろッ！！
English:
I’m the one asking the questions here!
If you understand, then answer me properly!

Japanese: は…　はい！　上官どの！
English: S-Sir, yes sir!

Japanese:
ようやく　いい返事が聞けたな！
ご褒美だ
家に来て　俺の母親と…
English:
Finally, a fine answer. 
Come to my house and my mom will--

Japanese: …どうした　なぜ泣く？
English: What’s the matter? Why are you crying?

Japanese: だって　怖くて…
English: Because it’s so scary...

Japanese:
誰が泣くのを　許可した！
さっさと　そのクサレ涙を止めるよう
涙腺に伝えろ！
English:
Who gave you permission to cry? 
Tell your damn tear glands to stop!

Japanese: う…　うわぁぁぁ～～ん！
English: W-Waaahhh!

Japanese:
ちょっと！　リカルドさん！
ルカくんが　泣いているでしょう？
一体　どうしたんです？
English:
Ricardo, please! Can you not see that Ruca’s already 
crying? What has gotten into you?

Japanese: ハッ…！！
English: Ma’am!

Japanese:
「ハッ…！！」じゃ
ありません！
English: Don’t "Ma’am" me!

Japanese:
すまん…
つい　俺が新兵だったころの
悪夢が　よみがえってしまって…
English:
Apologies... It appears that my memories from when 
I was a new recruit resurfaced...

Japanese:
もう　しっかりしてください
ルカくん
もう大丈夫だからね？
English:
Please, get a hold of yourself! 
Ruca, it is all right now, see?

Japanese: う…　うん
English: Y-Yeah...

Japanese: すまん　ルカ…
English: Ruca, I’m sorry...

Japanese:
どこの軍でも　新兵相手の口調って
同じなんだね
ああ　怖かった…
English:
So the way people speak in the military is the same 
everywhere... That was scary...

Japanese: またまたイリアが変…
English: Illia’s Acting Strange Again...

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ねえ　イリアの様子が
また　おかしいんだけど…
English: Hey, Illia’s acting kind of strange again...

Japanese:
ルカくん　いちいち　イリアの様子を
みんなに　説明してまわる
必要なんてないでしょ？
English:
Ruca, I do not believe you have to point out
how Illia is doing to everyone all the time.

Japanese:
そうかもしれないけど　心配でさ
だから　同じ女の人に意見を聞いた方が
いいかと思ったんだけど…
English:
You’re right, but I’m worried about her.
So I thought it’d be best to ask another
woman about it.

Japanese:
じゃあ　教えてあげるけど
女の子って　いろんなことに
頭を悩ませるものなのよ
English:
Well, let me enlighten you.
Girls often have a lot going
on in their minds.

Japanese: そ…　そうなの？
English: R-Really?

Japanese:
だから　いちいち構わなくても
いいと思うの
わかった？
English:
That is why you do not have to
make a big deal of it. Understand?

Japanese:
う…　うん
じゃあ　もう聞かないようにするよ
English: Oh... okay, I’ll stop.

Japanese: 戦場のリカルド
English: Ricardo of the Battlefield

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
なあ…
リカルドが　ヘンなんだけど…
English: Hey, isn’t Ricardo acting kinda strange?

Japanese:
そうやねん…
ウチも　そう思とってん
English: Ah know right? Ah think so too.

Japanese:
んー？
どうヘンなんだ？　しかし
English: Hmmm? How is he strange though?

Japanese:
妙に張り切ってるし
やたらと　注意してくるしな
English:
He’s been acting strangely uptight and
paying too much attention to me.

Japanese:
「そんなことでは死ぬぞ！」とか
やたら大声で叫ぶねん
English:
An’ then he’ll shout at me an’ say
stuff like “You’ll get yourself killed!”

Japanese:
ヘンなのー
リカルドは　無口で大人しくて
メシを　たくさん食べる男なのにな　しかし
English:
That’s weird! Ricardo’s always quiet, silent,
and always eats a lot though.

Japanese:
貴様ら！　悠長に立ち話などするな！
格好の標的になる！
そんなことでは　すぐに死ぬぞ！
English:
DON’T JUST STAND THERE!
GET YOUR ASSES OUT OF THERE AND MOVE!
YOU’LL GET YOURSELVES KILLED!

Japanese: な？
English: See?

Japanese: なるほどだな　しかし
English: I see though...

Japanese:
おい　貴様ら！
なにを　グズグズやっているか！
English:
WHAT ARE YOU LOT MUTTERING
TO YOURSELVES FOR!?

Japanese:
早く伏せるか　茂みに潜るなりしろ！
そんなことでは　死ぬぞ！
English:
FIND SOME COVER TO HIDE BEHIND
BEFORE YOU GET YOURSELVES KILLED!

Japanese: へいへい…
English: Fine, fine...

Japanese:
ありゃ　戦場でのクセなんだな
やれやれ　とっとと
こんなところから　抜け出そうぜ…
English:
Sheesh... That’s definitely coz of this place.
Let’s get the hell out of here.

Japanese: そうだなー　しかし
English: That’s right though!

Japanese: またアイツか…
English: Him again...

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: また逃したか…
English: He got away again...

Japanese:
チッ…　仕方ねェ
次は　あのクサレ脳みそのクサレ舌
二度と　動かねェようにしてやる！
English:
Tch, can’t be helped... I swear, the next time I
see him, I’ll make sure his rotten brain will 
never flap his stupid gums again.

Japanese:
あ～　ぜひ　そうしてちょうだい
…っていうか　どっちかっていうと
二度と　会いたくないんだけど
English:
Sure, do that. I’d rather not
meet him again though.

Japanese:
いや
あいつは　また必ず現れる
English: No, he’ll definitely appear again.

Japanese:
次こそ　あいつとの因縁
キッチリと　清算させてやる！
あの野郎も　そう望んでるはずだ
English:
The next time we meet, I’ll make him pay.
I’m sure that’s what he wants too.

Japanese:
キライなら　会わなきゃいいのに
案外　あいつのこと
気に入ってんじゃないの？
English:
Look, if you hate him, then shouldn’t you be happy
if you don’t meet him again? Are you SURE you 
don’t actually like him?

Japanese: ああ！？
English: The hell you saying!?

Japanese:
イリア　それは愚問だな
俺は　あいつの名を口にするのも
ヘドが出るほどだ
English:
What a foolish question. Just hearing his name
or his voice is enough to make me vomit.

Japanese:
ああ　名前を耳にするのも
わずらわしいぐらいだぜ
English: Yeah, just hearing his name drives me up a wall.

Japanese:
イリアの方こそ
気に入ってるのではないか？
English:
How about you, Illia, are
you sure you don’t like him?

Japanese:
だーれが！　あんな最低野郎！
あいつのこと　想像しただけで
体中に…
English:
WHO would EVER like that slimy, disgusting, 
lower-than-lowest son of a--! UGH!! Just 
the thought of him is enough to make me--

Japanese:
…な　イリア
おまえの質問が　どんだけ
不愉快か　わかっただろ？
English: See? Your question sucked ass.

Japanese:
う…
そうね　ごめんなさい…
English: Ugh... you’re right. I’m sorry...

Japanese: 寒っ！
English: Cold!

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
ちょっ…
なんやこれ！　めっちゃ寒いやん？
English:
Whoa!
It got mighty cold all of a sudden!

Japanese:
そりゃあ　ずいぶん
「北」に「来た」からねぇ
English:
Since we’ve been going “up” north,
the temperature’s bound to go “down.”

Japanese:
うわぁ…
なによそれ　寒ぅ！
English: Eugh... Holy hell that sucked!

Japanese:
ホント　寒いこと言うよね
ルカって
English:
You sure say the corniest
things don’t you, Ruca?

Japanese: え？　え？　どういう意味？
English: Huh? What do you mean?

Japanese: あれ？　今の素やったんか…
English: Oh? ’bout earlier...

Japanese:
まあ　そりゃそうか…
いくらルカでも「北」と「来た」で
ダジャレを言うなんて　ないよねぇ～
English:
Uhh... yeah, no way in Terro would Ruca
make a pun as lame as “going up north,
the temperature’s bound to go down”～.

Japanese: 当たり前じゃないか！
English: Of course I can!

Japanese:
ほんなら　素やない
ルカ兄ちゃんの実力　見せてもらおか
English: Then lessee yer true power, Ruca Bro.

Japanese:
見せてもらいましょうか
ワクワク♪
English:
Reeaaally, looking forward to it～
*giggle*

Japanese: なにか言う
English: Say something

Japanese: なにも言わない
English: Say nothing

Japanese:
え～っと　え～っと…
じゃあ　とある夫婦の話
ある夜　妻が夫に言いました
English:
Let’s see... hmm... One night, while a
married couple were talking with each other,
the wife made a declaration to the husband.

Japanese:
「あなた　いいニュースと
　悪いニュースがあるわ
　どっちから　聞きたい？」
English:
The wife said, “Dear, I have some good
news and some bad news, which would
you like to hear first?”

Japanese:
「じゃあ　いいニュースから聞こうか」
「私　赤ちゃんが　できたみたいなの」
「それは素晴らしい！　…で　悪い方は？」
English:
The husband goes, “Let’s hear the good news first.”
She responds, “I think I’m having a baby...” Elated,
he exclaims, “That’s great! What’s the bad news?”

Japanese: 「あなたの子じゃないの」
English: She pauses before saying, “It’s not yours.”

Japanese:
…………
それは　笑えへんなぁ
English:
...
That’s jus’ stupid.

Japanese:
ああ…
それが　ルカの精一杯なのね
でもまあ　努力は買ってあげる
English:
Well, that’s Ruca for you.
Anyway, at least you tried.
Have a cookie.

Japanese:
え～？
恥かくのイヤだなぁ…
パスさせてよ～
English:
Pass, please spare me
from the embarrassment...

Japanese:
ルカって　あいかわらず
空気　読まないわね
English: Can’t read the atmosphere, as always...

Japanese:
ルカ兄ちゃん
ここは　スベッてでも
なんか言わんとなぁ
English:
Ruca Bro, ya hafta say sumthin’
even if it’d cost ya yer honor.

Japanese:
そんなこと言ったって
僕には　ムリだよ…
English:
Even if you say that...
I... can’t. I’m sorry...

Japanese: はぁ　もうガッカリ！
English: Lame!

Japanese:
わかったよ
もっと精進するよ…
English: Fine, I get it, I’ll try harder next time...

Japanese: アルベールって？
English: Albert is...?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ホント　アルベールって
どんな人なんだろ？
English: I wonder what kind of person Albert is?

Japanese:
俺も仲介人を通じて
依頼を　受けただけだからな
人物像までは　わからんな
English:
No idea, since I’ve only talked to him via a third party. 
I don’t even know what he looks like.

Japanese:
なぜ　私を連れて来るよう
リカルドさんに依頼したのかも
まだ　わかってませんね
English:
I still do not know why he would
hire Sir Ricardo to fetch me.

Japanese:
ただ　テノス軍の高官でも
あるらしいからな
一筋縄では　いかん男だろう
English:
All I know is that, apparently, he’s a high
official of Tenos’ army. Rest assured,
he’ll be hard to deal with.

Japanese: 会うことを勧める
English: We’ll know when we meet him

Japanese: 会わないように諭す
English: Let’s avoid him

Japanese:
とにかく一度　会ってみれば
いいんじゃないの？
English:
At any rate, wouldn’t it be
better if we met him first?

Japanese:
そうね
案外　話し合いで解決できるかも
しれないものね
English:
You are correct, he might be someone
we can reason with.

Japanese:
それは　どうかな？
アンジュ宛ての　手紙も書かず
いきなり俺に　誘拐を依頼する相手だぞ？
English:
I wonder about that... he’s someone who
commissioned me to kidnap Ange through
a letter, after all.

Japanese:
……う～ん
それも　そうですねぇ
English: Hmm... I suppose that is also true.

Japanese:
じゃあ　絶対
アンジュとは　会わせない方が
いいよね？
English:
At any rate, I think it would be better
if we don’t let him meet Ange.

Japanese: ああ　そうだな
English: Yes, that’s correct.

Japanese:
でも　一度会って
キチンと　お話するべきでは
ありませんか？
English:
However, in the case we do meet him,
why not try and talk to him first?

Japanese:
正式な招待より先に　俺に誘拐を
依頼する男だぞ？
話が通じるとは　思えんな
English:
What kind of man hires a mercenary to kidnap 
someone before officially meeting them? I don’t 
think he’s the type we can just talk to easily.

Japanese:
……う～ん
それも　そうですねぇ
English: Hmm... I suppose that is also true.

Japanese:
いずれにせよ
アルベールの動きには
気をつけねばな
English:
At any rate, we have to be careful
when moving around Albert’s territory.

Japanese: 本拠地のテノスだもんね
English: Tenos is his headquarters, after all.

Japanese:
では　リカルドさん
きっちり護衛　お願いしますね？
English:
Then I expect you to do your job properly,
Sir Ricardo.

Japanese:
まかせてくれ
料金分は　働いてみせる
English:
Leave it to me.
I’ll make your fee worthwhile.

Japanese:
おまえたちの期待を　裏切るようなマネは
二度としない
English:
I won’t let you down a second time.
Never again.

Japanese: 食べすぎ…かな？
English: Maybe I eat too much?

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia
Hmm...

Japanese:
アンジュ姉ちゃん　どないしたん？
お腹つまんで
English:
Wassup, Sis Ange?
Why’re ya pinchin’ yer belly?

Japanese:
バカねぇ
エルが言った言葉
気にしてんに　決まってんでしょ？
English:
Are you daft? She’s obviously worrying
about what you said earlier.

Japanese:
別に　エルだけじゃなくて
みんなから
平等に傷つけられたんだけど…
English:
It is not just because of Hermie,
but what everyone else said too...

Japanese:
え…？
ま…　まあいいじゃない　ね！
English: Huh? Well ain’t that fine...?

Japanese:
そうそう　アンジュ姉ちゃんも
めっちゃ太っとるわけやないやん？
English: Yeah, yeah, it ain’t like yer really fat.

Japanese:
アンジュはね
むしろ　運動して
筋肉つけた方がいいんだって！
English:
Yeah, rather, I think you should work
off that fat and gain muscles.

Japanese:
そうそう！
食べた分　動いたらええねん
筋肉ついたら　太りにくなるし
English:
Yeah, yeah!
Ya gotta move as much as ya eat!
Ya gain muscle an’ won’t get fat.

Japanese:
だって　私
インドア派だもん…
English: But... I am an indoor person...

Japanese:
せやけど
多少は　鍛えんと～
English: Yeah, but ya hafta discipline yerself!

Japanese:
そうそう
乗馬しましょ　乗馬！
あたしが　教えてあげるから！
English:
Yeah! Look, I’ll teach you horseriding
to help out with your exercise!

Japanese:
ウチとは　鬼ごっこしよか！
ええ運動なるでぇ
English: An’ let’s play tag! It’s good exercise!

Japanese:
ふたりとも
私に　付き合ってくれるの？
English: Are you two really fine spending time with me?

Japanese:
じゃあ　私もお返しに
天の御心について
わかりやすく　説明してあげるね！
English:
Then, as a way to repay my gratitude,
I shall give you an easy-to-understand
sermon about Cielo’s grace.

Japanese:
ええ～…
それ　お返しちゃうやん
仕返しやん…
English: But... that ain’t gratitude, that’s revenge!

Japanese: ほかの格言は？
English: Do you have any more Proverbs?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
アンジュの自作格言
なかなか面白いね
他にはないの？
English:
Your makeshift proverbs are quite
interesting, Ange.
Do you have more?

Japanese:
そうねぇ　いくつかあるけど
なにがいいかなぁ…
English:
Well, I have a few, but which
should I start with...?

Japanese:
「天はたまに　ヨソ見をする」とか
どうかな？
English:
Then how about,
“There are times when Cielo turns a blind eye?”

Japanese:
それって
どういう意味？
English: What does that mean?

Japanese:
ほら　善行を積んで
天上界に　見てもらうのが
私たちの務めでしょ？
English:
It is Cielo’s duty to watch over us and
record our good deeds, correct?

Japanese:
でも　天は　いつも私たちを
見ているわけじゃないと思うの
English:
I believe that Cielo cannot
watch over us all the time.

Japanese:
ふんふん
…で　どういうときに使うの？
English: I see... So, when do you use this proverb?

Japanese:
うっかり　寝坊しちゃったときとか
つい　つまみ食いしちゃったときかな
English:
Like when I oversleep, or I eat
food that I stole in secret...

Japanese:
そういうとき　たまには天も
ヨソ見してくれてるんじゃないかなぁって…
ダメ？
English:
At those times, I tell myself that Cielo
must be turning a blind eye towards me...
Does that count?

Japanese: もう～　いい加減だなぁ…
English: That’s... really irresponsible.

Japanese:
あら　普段　マジメだからこそ
失敗しても　そんなに怒られないのよ？
English:
Hey! I am usually earnest so I do not believe
Cielo will punish me at the slightest blunder.

Japanese:
それに「寛容」も
天の代弁者たる　私たちの務め
自ら実践して　手本を見せなきゃ！
English:
And “forbearance” is one of my
responsibilities as Cielo’s voice!
It is my duty to set an example by practice.

Japanese:
ああ…
アンジュって
言いわけが　上手なんだね
English: You’re... really good with your words, Ange.

Japanese:
う～ん…
そう言われると
身もフタもないなぁ
English:
I... have no idea how to react
if you put it that way...

Japanese: 遺跡探検
English: Ruins Expedition

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: 遺跡…
English: Ruins...

Japanese:
…と言えば
探検だね
English: Exploration!

Japanese:
ヒャーハッハ！
ルカ　おめェも
話がわかるようになったじゃねェか！
English: Gyahahaha! Ruca! You finally get it now!

Japanese:
うん　特に薄暗い遺跡なんて
興奮するね…
English:
Yeah! I can’t help but feel excited when 
it comes to ruins. Especially dark ones!

Japanese:
あんたら　鼻息荒いじゃん
一体どーしたっての？
English: You two seem to be excited. What’s up?

Japanese:
ヘヘ　こういうところに忍び込んで
探検ごっこに　興じるのが
男子の流儀ってヤツなのさ
English:
Sneaking into places like this and exploring, 
it’s one the things we boys dream of doing.
Just like Diana Jones!

Japanese:
そうそう
そして　秘密基地を作るんだ
English: Right! And making secret bases, too!

Japanese:
はぁ？　なによ　それ？
ぜーんぜん　わかんない
English: Huh? What’s up with that? I don’t get it at all!

Japanese:
え～？　秘密基地だよ？
いろんな物　持ち込んで
入り浸ったりする…　んだよね？
English:
Really? It’s a secret base, y’know? 
You bring your own stuff and 
hang out in it... right?

Japanese:
「んだよね？」って
じゃあ　あんたも
わかってないんじゃない
English: “Right?” You don’t even get what you’re saying!

Japanese:
僕　レグヌムにいた頃は
みんなに　一人前扱いして
もらってなかったからさ
English:
People always treated me like an adult when 
I was a kid, so I never got to experience it.

Japanese:
ずっと　入り口の見張りだけを
やらされてたんだ…
English: They just made me guard the entrance instead.

Japanese: うわぁ　ブルーな話…
English: Wow... How sad...

Japanese:
だから　こういう人並みな遊び
やってみたかったんだ
English:
That’s why, I always wanted to try 
those kind of games.

Japanese:
そ…　そうか
よし　わかった！
じゃあ　楽しもうな　遺跡探検
English:
Oh... Ok! Then let’s make sure 
that we enjoy our time here!

Japanese: うん！
English: Yeah!

Japanese: アンジュの様子が変？
English: Isn’t Ange Acting a Bit Strange?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
…ねえ　イリア
アンジュが独り言を　言ったりしてて
なんだか様子が　ヘンなんだ
English:
Illia, Ange’s been speaking to
herself lately...
It’s strange...

Japanese:
ふ～ん
別にいいじゃない　独り言ぐらい
English:
Hmmm... ain’t that fine?
She’s just monologuing.

Japanese:
うわぁ　イリア姉ちゃん
ゼンゼン話　聞く気あらへんがな…
English: Uwah, Sis Illia ain’t listenin’ at all...

Japanese:
イリア　聞く気ない
キュキュでも　わかる…
English: Illia not listening. Even QQ knows.

Japanese:
イリアやスパーダの様子が　ヘンだったとき
あまり構わない方がいいって
アンジュは　言ってたんだけどさ…
English:
Ange told me not to worry about it when
you and Spada were acting strange...

Japanese:
でも　やっぱり
僕　気になって…
English: But I couldn’t help it...

Japanese:
はぁ？
じゃあ　あんた　あたしのこと
ず～っと観察してたわけ？
English:
Hey, so you’re saying you’ve been 
sneaking a peek at me all this time!?

Japanese:
しかも　あたしじゃなくて
勝手に　他人に相談するって
どういうことよ！
English:
And you chose not to ask ME,
but someone else!?
What the hell?

Japanese:
いやいや　イリア姉ちゃん
食いつくところがちゃうやろ…
English: C’mon, Sis Illia, it obviously ain’t that...

Japanese:
イリア　違う
キュキュでも　わかる…
English: Illia wrong. Even QQ know.

Japanese:
わ…　悪かったよ
そんなに　怒らないでってば！
English:
Hey, look, I’m sorry okay?
So can you not get mad at me for that?

Japanese:
…でね　アンジュは　前世のことで
悩んでるんじゃないかって
僕　ちょっと心配でさ…
English:
It’s just that I’m worried...
Ange looks like she’s worrying
about her past life...

Japanese:
前世のこと！？
そういう大事なことは
先に言いなさいよね！
English: Her “past life!?” You should’ve brought it up earlier!

Japanese:
じゃあ　みんなでアンジュの悩み
解決してあげなきゃ！
English: So we can all help Ange solve her problems!

Japanese:
先に言えって…
イリア姉ちゃんが
話まともに　聞いてへんかったんやん…
English:
“Should’ve brought it up earlier”...
Sis Illia totally ain’t listenin’.

Japanese:
イリア　聞いてなかた
キュキュでも　わかる…
English: Illia didn’t hear. Even QQ know.

Japanese:
だから　同じ女の子のイリアが
アンジュの悩み　聞いてあげるのが
一番　いいんじゃないかなって…
English:
That’s why, I was hoping you’d ask Ange
about it since you’re both girls...

Japanese: え～？　面倒くさ～
English: Huh? What a pain～

Japanese:
ルカ　あんた責任持って
悩み　聞いてあげなさいよね
English:
You’re the one who’s supposed 
to be doing this...

Japanese: んじゃ
English: Aight, bye.

Japanese:
さっき　みんなで解決するって
言ったじゃないか…
ハァ…
English:
But you just said it’s better
if we all help solve it...
Sigh...

Japanese:
うわ～　ホンマ
イリア姉ちゃんと　話するん
大変やなぁ…
English:
Tell me ’bout it. It’s really hard
ta talk ta Sis Illia...

Japanese:
イリアと話する　大変
キュキュでも　わかる…
すごく　わかる
English:
Talking to Illia hard.
Even QQ know.
QQ know very well...

Japanese: アンジュったら！
English: Sheesh, Ange!

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
こら　リカルド！
あんた　護衛として
雇われてんでしょ！
English: Ricardo! Aren’t you her bodyguard!?

Japanese:
ホンマや！
どないなっとんの？
おっちゃん　ちゃんと仕事してぇや！
English:
Yeah! What were ya doin’!?
Ya gotta do yer job properly, Uncle!

Japanese:
アンジュは　自らの意思で
アルベールの元へ　向かったのだ
あれ以上　どうして俺が止められる？
English:
Ange went to Albert of her own free will.
Considering that, what should I have done?

Japanese:
う…
そう言われれば　そうね…
English: If you put it that way...

Japanese:
…でも　アンジュ姉ちゃん
いきなり　行ってしもたなぁ
なんでやろ？
English:
Speakin’ of, Ah wonder why
Sis Ange went off on her own?

Japanese:
おまえたちは　記憶にないのか？
ふたりの話に　出てきた名
ヒンメルに…
English:
You both don’t remember anything?
She mentioned “Himmel” when they
were talking earlier...

Japanese:
ヒンメルって…
確か　ラティオの？
English:
“Himmel”... If I recall correctly
he’s from Ratio...?

Japanese:
俺は　あまり記憶にないが
恐らく　前世で深い因縁が
あるのだろうな
English:
I don’t really remember much about him...
But it’s likely that they were both quite
close back then.

Japanese:
前世の縁かぁ
ほな　しゃあないなぁ
English:
Yer “past life’s fate”, huh...
guess it can’t be helped.

Japanese:
エル　あんた
本気で　そう思ってんの？
English: Are you serious?

Japanese:
そんなわけないやん
ウチ　アンジュ姉ちゃん好きやもん
どっか行くなんて　イヤやぁ～！
English:
Course Ah ain’t, Ah like Sis Ange a lot.
Ah don’ want her ta go away!

Japanese:
だったら
連れ戻すのよ
English: Then let’s take her back!

Japanese:
フン…
泣こうが　わめこうが
力ずくでムリヤリ…　か？
English:
By force?
Even if it’d make her cry and scream...?

Japanese:
そらええなぁ
アンジュ姉ちゃんが　泣いてもわめいても
力ずくでムリヤリ！
English:
Fine by me!
Ah’ll take her back even if it
makes her cry an’ scream!

Japanese:
そういう　言い方すると
まるで　あたしたちが
悪者みたいじゃない…
English: It’s almost like we’re the villains here...

Japanese: アルベールのヤツ…
English: That Albert...

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: 兵器工場か…
English: The Arsenal, huh...

Japanese:
まさか　アンジュ
前みたいに　ムリヤリ兵器の中に
閉じ込められてるんじゃ…
English:
Hey, could it be that Ange’s being
held against her will in...

Japanese:
いや　そりゃねェだろ
どうも　あのふたり
前世で　なにかあったっぽいしな
English:
No, obviously not, it probably has to
do with both of their past lives.

Japanese:
アンジュ　ヒドいこと
されてなければいいけど…
English:
I hope he’s not forcing her
to do something bad...

Japanese:
あん？
ヒドいことって　どんなことだよ？
English: “Bad?” Like what?

Japanese: 話す
English: Tell him

Japanese: 話さない
English: Don’t tell him

Japanese: 例えばさ…
English: For example...

Japanese: うんうん
English: Yeah?

Japanese: ロープで　きつく縛り上げられて…
English: He might tie her up with a rope and...

Japanese: ほぅ！
English: *gasp*

Japanese:
身動きできないようにした
アンジュを…
English: Unable to move, Ange will...

Japanese: ふんふん
English: Mmhmm.

Japanese: 宙づりにして…
English: Hang in midair...

Japanese: それで　それで？
English: And then...?

Japanese: ご飯を食べさせないとか？
English: And then she won’t get to eat?

Japanese:
…………
なんだよ　それ！？
期待させるんじゃねェよ！
English:
...
What the heck, you got my hopes up!

Japanese:
？？？
どんな期待したのさ？
English:
???
Got your hopes up?

Japanese:
ケッ…
ホント　おまえ　つまんねェな…
English: Dude, you’re so lame...

Japanese:
いや…
どんなって言われても…
English: Nah, even if I tell you...

Japanese:
おいおい！　照れんなよ！
さあ　このスパーダさんだけに
こっそり　話してごらん？
English:
Hey, don’t you dare get embarrassed!
Now, tell Mr. Spada... Don’t be shy...

Japanese:
なに？
どうして　そんなに食いつくの？
English: Hm? Why are you so hung up on it?

Japanese:
だって　おまえ　あのアンジュが
男に捕まったんだぜ？
そりゃ　おまえ…
English: Dude, Ange’s captured by a guy, y’know...

Japanese:
やっぱり　兵器に
利用されるんじゃないかなぁ
English:
Maybe they’re going to use
her as a weapon?

Japanese:
ホント　おまえ　つまんねェな…
…ってな　冗談なんか
かましてる場合じゃねェな！
English:
Shesh you’re so lame--
hey, now’s not the time for jokes!

Japanese:
とにかく
アンジュを　見つけないと…
English: At any rate, we have to look for Ange...

Japanese: ああ　急ごうぜ！
English: Right, let’s go!

Japanese: 真意を確かめよう
English: Let’s Find Out His Real Intentions

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: 気のせい…　かな
English: Am I just imagining it...?

Japanese:
アルベールとやらに　付いて行った
アンジュって
特に　イヤがってなさそうだったよね
English:
It looked like Ange did not seem to mind
when Albert told her to come with him...

Japanese:
うん…
僕にも　そう見えた
English: Yeah, I think so too...

Japanese: …そうだな
English: Yes...

Japanese:
もしかして　彼女
もう戻らないつもりなのかな？
English:
Perhaps it is possible that she may not be
planning on coming back anymore?

Japanese: 否定する
English: Deny

Japanese: 言葉を濁す
English: Be vague

Japanese:
そんな！
アンジュに限って…
English:
No, that can’t be...
I bet she’s being held against--

Japanese:
そう思いたいがな…
あの状況では
取引や　脅迫があったとは思えん
English:
I’d like to think not...
It doesn’t seem that she was
threatened or bribed...

Japanese:
彼女が自分の意思で
ボクたちの元を　去ったのなら
追わないほうがいいのかも…
English:
I think it would be best to let her be if she
chose to leave us of her own volition...

Japanese:
そうかもしれんが
理由も告げずに　去られて
納得できる　俺たちでもあるまい
English:
That might be the case, but she didn’t
even announce her intentions when
she chose to leave us.

Japanese:
じゃあ　今はとにかく
アンジュを　追いかけないと！
English: At any rate, we have to go after her!

Japanese:
そ…　それは…
どうなんだろう？
English: Well... I wonder...?

Japanese:
とにかく　確かめよう
理由も告げずに　立ち去るなど
アンジュらしくないからな
English:
At any rate, it’s best if we hear from her directly.
It’s not like her at all to leave without warning.

Japanese:
それは　やっぱり
雇われの傭兵としては
納得できないってこと？
English:
Do you mean that even you cannot
accept it despite being her mercenary?

Japanese:
ああ…　アンジュの真意を
問いただすまではな
English: Not until I hear her intention that is...

Japanese:
だが　もう戻らないつもりなら
それはそれで　仕方あるまい
English:
But I can’t do anything about it
if she doesn’t want to come back.

Japanese:
なんにしたって　今はとにかく
アンジュを　追いかけないと！
English:
Whatever her intention is,
we have to go after her!

Japanese:
焦るな　ルカ
落ち着いて　行くぞ
English:
Calm down, Ruca.
Let’s head out.

Japanese:
彼女の元に
たどりつけなければ　彼女の真意を
聞くこともできないもの
English:
Hey, don’t you dare get embarrassed!
Now, tell Mr. Spada... Don’t be shy...

Japanese:
うん
わかったよ
English: I understand.

Japanese: アルベールってどう？
English: What Do You Think of Albert?

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ねえねえ　アンジュ
アルベールって　実際のとこ
どうだった？
English: Hey, hey, Ange, what do you really think of Albert?

Japanese: 前世の縁で　再び巡り会うた　ふたり
English: Both, reunited by their past live’s fate.

Japanese:
そらぁ　盛り上がるもんが
盛り上がるっちゅう話やろ！
English:
Course that’s something anyone would get
excited thinking ’bout!

Japanese:
そうねぇ…
まだまだ　紳士と呼ぶには
早いかな
English:
That is true...
I wonder if it is still early to call him a gentleman?

Japanese:
でも　貴族よ！　顔も十分　合格圏内だし
なにより　アンジュに
気持ち向かってそうじゃん！
English:
But he’s a noble! A good-looking one at that!
And, most of all, he seems to have feelings for you!

Japanese:
玉の輿やなぁ
うらやましいこっちゃで
English:
Marryin’ a rich man, huh...
Man, Ah’m so jealous.

Japanese:
うーん…
もう　ひと押し欲しいかなぁ
なにか…　ちょっと足りないのよね
English:
Hm... I am still not quite sure...
Perhaps I need just that teeny tiny push...

Japanese:
あれでも　満足しないっての？
ぜーたくねぇ
English: No way... that’s still not enough for you?

Japanese:
あ！　それやったら
ウチが　もらお！
English:
Fine! If ya won’t get him,
Ah’ll go after ’em mahself!

Japanese: エル　ダ・メ・よ！
English: Hermie, STOP!

Japanese: 「ソレはソレ　コレはコレ」だから
English: This and that are different matters.

Japanese:
う～ん　貴族をキープかぁ
アンジュって　やっぱり
チャッカリしてるなぁ…
English:
Oh I see now, you want to keep the
noble to yourself. You sly woman...

Japanese: 緊張した…
English: Nervousness...

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: どした　リカルド？
English: What’s up, Ricardo?

Japanese: 顔色が良くないみたいだけど
English: You don’t look so good...

Japanese:
なんでもない
気にするな…
English:
It’s nothing.
Don’t worry about me.

Japanese: それならいいけど…
English: If you say so...

Japanese:
リカルド
だいじょぶに　見えない…
English: Ricardo doesn’t look fine at all.

Japanese:
…よ　よし！
なんとか無事　横づけできた…
俺も　やればできるじゃないか…
English:
P-Phew! I managed to land it... somehow...
See? I can do it after all!

Japanese:
それにしても　緊張したな…
ヘンな汗を　たっぷりかいて
下着まで　グッショリ…
English:
Man, I was so nervous...
I feel like I sweated so much that
even my underwear was--

Japanese:
そうか　リカルド
グッショリか…
English: I see, Ricardo’s underwear...

Japanese:
…クソ！
これだから　独り言なんて
言うもんじゃないんだ…
English:
Damn it!
This is why I should stop talking to myself!

Japanese: ボクを無視するな！
English: Don’t ignore me!

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: シアン
English: Sian

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: あのさ…
English: Say...

Japanese: あのさ…
English: Say...

Japanese: な…　なによ…？
English: W-What?

Japanese:
えっと
イリアが　先に言ってよ
English: You go first, Illia.

Japanese:
イヤよ
あんたが　先に言ってよ…
English: No way, you go first...

Japanese:
こうして　ふたりっきりになるのって
久しぶりだから…
少し緊張してるんだ
English:
It’s been a while since we were
alone together, so...
I’m a bit nervous.

Japanese: あの～　もしもし？
English: Uh... hello?

Japanese:
そうね…
ふたりっきりって
いつぶりぐらいかな？
English:
You’re right, how long has it been
since we were last alone together?

Japanese:
え～と…
一応　ボクもいるんだけど…
English:
Umm...
I’m right here though...

Japanese:
旅の　ほんの最初の頃だけだよね
でも　僕　ふたりきりの時間
なんとなく好きだなぁ
English:
I think we were only alone together at the start,
but I kind of like it when we’re alone together.

Japanese:
そうね…
ふたりきりの時間も
そんなに　悪いもんじゃないかな
English:
Yeah... I guess being alone together
isn’t so bad at times.

Japanese: だから　ボクもいるってば！
English: Hey! Hello!? I’m over here!

Japanese: なんだか照れるね…
English: This is kind of embarrassing...

Japanese:
そう言われると
そうかも…
English: Now that you mention it, yeah...

Japanese:
おーい！！
無視するなよ！
English: Hey! Don’t ignore me!

Japanese:
…………
ここまで豪快に　無視されたの
生まれて　初めてだよ！
English:
...I think this is the first time I’ve 
been ignored to this extent.

Japanese:
ケル！　ベロ！
ボクの友達は　やっぱり
おまえたちだけかも！
English:
Cer, Berus! Maybe you’re my only
friends after all...

Japanese: 戻って来てくれてよかった
English: I’m Glad You’re Back

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
ルカ
よく戻ってきたな　しかし！
English: Ruca, you came back though!

Japanese:
あ～ら　別に戻って来なくたって
ホントのところは
全然　困らなかったけどね
English:
Oh...? You didn’t have to come back though?
It’s not like I was troubled at all.

Japanese:
あはは…
イリアは　そういうと
思ってたよ
English: Hahaha, I thought you’d say that.

Japanese:
だったら　戻って来なきゃ
良かったじゃん
English: Then you shouldn’t have come back at all!

Japanese:
さっきと　言ってることが違うよ
さっきは僕のこと　待っててくれたって
言ったじゃないか
English:
But that’s not what you told me earlier.
What you said was, “I’ve always been
waiting for you.”

Japanese:
な～に言ってんのよ
あたしは「みんなが」待ってるって
言ったの
English:
What the heck are you saying!?
I said, “we’ve all been waiting for you!”

Japanese:
「あたしが」待ってたなんて
言ってないでしょ
English:
I didn’t say that “I” was waiting
for you at all!

Japanese:
あはは！　うん　そうだね
あ～　良かった　いつものイリアだ
English:
Hahaha, that’s true.
Oh, I’m so glad that you’re still the same.

Japanese:
いつものイリアに
また会えて　僕　嬉しいよ…
English: I’m so happy to see the usual Illia...

Japanese:
…………
フ～ンだ！
ナマイキ　言っちゃって！
English:
Bleh!
Don’t get ahead of yourself, dummy!

Japanese:
そーだそーだ！
ルカ　ナマイキだぞー　しかし！
English:
Yeah, yeah, Ruca!
Don’t get ahead of yourself though!

Japanese:
へへッ　イリアのヤツ
照れてやがるぜ
English: Haha, you made Illia embarrassed.

Japanese:
…素直に再会を
喜べばいいものを
English: Why can’t she just be happy to see you again?

Japanese:
じゃあ　スパーダとリカルドは
喜んでくれてるの？
English: Are you both happy that I came back?

Japanese:
ケッ　最後の最後でオレたちを
信じられなかったクセに
よく言うぜ
English:
Tch, idiot, you couldn’t even
trust us at the last minute.
How dare you.

Japanese:
…この貸しは　返してもらうまで
てめェのそば　離れたりしねェから
覚悟しやがれよ！
English:
I won’t let you out of my sight until you’ve
paid that debt of yours, so get ready!

Japanese: フ…　まあ俺は大人だからな
English:
Hmph, let’s just say that I can tolerate small
tantrums like what you did back there.

Japanese:
ルカがやったような
ガキがかんしゃくを　起こした程度の騒ぎには
寛容だとだけ　言っておこう
English: I’m an adult, after all.

Japanese:
…ふたりとも
ありがとう
English: Thank you, you two.

Japanese:
ルカくん
私たちは　素直に喜んでるのよ？
English: Ruca, just know that we are really happy, okay?

Japanese:
せやで
ウチらは　素直やで～？
English: Yeah, we’re really really really happy, hear?

Japanese: 本当？　嬉しいな…
English: Really? I’m happy...

Japanese:
だって　ルカくんがいないと
イリアとスパーダくんが
もう不機嫌で　不機嫌で…
English:
After all, without you, Illia and
Spada would be very sad...

Japanese:
そうそう
おかげで　めっちゃ雰囲気が
悪なってん
English:
It’s true. The atmosphere among
us was really bad cause of ya.

Japanese:
ホ～ント
ルカくんには　しっかり…
English:
Honestly～
Ruca is really...

Japanese: いじられ役　やってもらわな！
English: Yeah, yer the one they’re supposed ta tease!

Japanese:
え…　それって…
全然　喜べないんだけど…
僕は　いじられないと　ダメってこと？
English:
Huh? But that doesn’t really make
me happy though...
Do I really have to be teased?

Japanese:
よぉ　わかってるやん！
ホンマ　ルカ兄ちゃんは
賢いええ子やなぁ
English:
Glad ya understand.
Yer an awfully clever boy～!

Japanese:
イリア　コーダ　リカルド
アンジュ　エル　ヘンな帽子
ルカと　一緒　うれしい
English:
Illia, Coda, Ricardo, Ange, Hermie,
and weird hat are really happy you’re here.

Japanese:
でも　素直　言わない　恥…？
キュキュは　言う
ルカと　一緒　うれしい！
English:
But they can’t say coz they’re... embarrassed?
QQ will say, she’s glad you’re here.

Japanese: …あ～　ん～　コンウェイ
English: Uh... hmm... Kongwei...

Japanese:
{triverse}OYSE_DURAKAWIA_TIAD
OYETI_SIEMU_TES[
English:
{triverse}OYSE_DURAKAWIA_TIAD
OYETI_SIEMU_TES[

Japanese: …わかったよ　キュキュ
English: All right, QQ.

Japanese:
ルカくん
キミが　戻って来てくれて
みんな　喜んでる
English: Everyone is really glad you are back, Ruca.

Japanese:
このキュキュも
そして　もちろんボクも…
キミは　なにも気に病むことはない
English:
QQ and, of course, me too.
You do not have to worry about anything at all.

Japanese:
この先は　もう迷わなくていい
キミが　必要と思う道を進めば
それが　正しい道だよ
English:
There is no need to wonder from here on out.
Just choose path you think is the best.

Japanese: 道だ！
English: Path!

Japanese:
キミは　キミ自身の力で
自らの魂を　救済したのだから…
English:
After all, you have already redeemed
your soul with your own power...

Japanese:
…戻って来て　良かった
ただいま
みんな…
English:
I’m glad I came back...
Everyone, I’m home...

Japanese: 抱っこしてみる？
English: Want to try Hugging?

Japanese: シアン
English: Sian

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: そ…　それでさぁ…
English: S-So...

Japanese: ん？　どないしたん？
English: Hm? What’s up?

Japanese:
前に　言ってただろ？
あのぅ…　ほら
ガルポスの遺跡でさ
English:
You said it earlier, didn’t you...?
Back in Galpos’ Ruins.

Japanese:
ああ！
ひょっとして　抱っこのこと？
English:
Ahh!
Are ya talkin’ ’bout the hug?

Japanese:
え～と…
さ…　さあ？　そんな話だったっけ？
English:
Hm...?
Maybe? Was that a thing?

Japanese:
あんまり　憶えてないけど…
ま…　まあ　その話でもいいや
English:
I don’t really remember it, 
but... I wouldn’t really mind.

Japanese:
なんやねんな　自分
素直に　お願いでけへんねんやったら
なかったことにすんで？
English:
What’s wrong with ya, if ya won’t say it properly
Ah’ll jus’ pretend it never happened.

Japanese:
あ…　いや
ちょっと…　それは…　困る…
English: Uh... no, wait... that’s...

Japanese:
なんだよ！
おまえが　言い出したことじゃないか！
約束だろ！
English:
You said it before!
It was a promise!

Japanese:
…ホンマ　しゃあないコやなぁ
ほな　目ぇつむって　待っときぃ
English:
What a dishonest kid.
Now, close yer eyes an’ wait.

Japanese:
あれ？　意外と硬い…？？？
ヘンだな…　想像と全然…
English:
Huh? Why’s it hard?
This is not what I expect--

Japanese: って　なんだ　おまえ！
English: Huh!? Who are you!?

Japanese:
フン…　なんだとは　なんだ？
こっちは　ガキの面倒を押し付けられて
迷惑しているというのに
English:
“Who am I”, you say?
After the trouble I went through to do this...

Japanese:
なぜ　罵声など
浴びなきゃならんのだ？
English: Why are you yelling at me?

Japanese:
アンジュ姉ちゃん
今　忙しい言うとってなぁ
リカルドのおっちゃんで　ガマンしとき？
English:
Sis Ange’s currently busy, hear?
Tha’s why ya gotta make do with
Uncle Ricardo here.

Japanese:
そんなの話が…
違うじゃないか！
English: But that’s not what you promised me!

Japanese:
………
もう…　しゃあないなぁ
English:
...
Gee, guess it can’t be helped...

Japanese: これでガマンしとき
English: Jus’ endure it.

Japanese:
…………
ハイ　おしまい！
English:
...
A’ight, all done!

Japanese:
なんだ　今の…
さっきの男と　ほとんど同じで
ただ　硬いだけだったぞ
English:
What was that...
She was just as hard as that guy earlier...

Japanese: こんなの　サギじゃないか…
English: This is just cheating...

Japanese: 王都軍の動向
English: The Imperial Army’s Attitude

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
どうして　王都軍が
マティウスたちと戦うの？
彼らは　仲間だったんじゃないの？
English:
So, why is the Imperial Army fighting Mattheus?
Weren’t they allies?

Japanese:
王都軍の目的も　創世力なのだろう
マティウスが　創世力を手に入れ
世界の滅亡を　狙う今…
English:
Most likely, the Imperial Army’s goal is
the Genesis itself. Were Mattheus to get a
hold of it, the world would surely collapse.

Japanese:
途端に利害の対立が　生まれたのさ
つまり　ヤツらは最初から
仲間なんかじゃなかったってことだ
English:
It just happened the moment their interests
opposed each other’s. In other words, they
were never allies to begin with.

Japanese:
でも王都軍には　マティウスと
戦う余裕なんて…
English:
To think that the Imperial Army would still
have power to spare to fight against Mattheus...

Japanese:
いや　王都軍は
テノス・ガラムの同盟軍と
停戦協定を　結んだのだろう
English:
No, I believe that the Imperial Army has
signed a cease-fire with both Tenos and Garam.

Japanese:
アルベールあたりが
レグヌムに話を
持ちかけたのではないかな
English:
Albert or someone else must’ve
gone to Regnum to negotiate about it.

Japanese:
だから　王都軍が
こんなところにいるのか…
English: So that’s why the Imperial Army is here...

Japanese:
じゃあ　そのおかげで僕たち
教団兵と王都兵を　一度に
相手しなくちゃいけなくなったんじゃ…
English:
And thanks to that, we have to 
deal with both all at once.

Japanese:
フン　教団全軍を
俺たちだけで
相手にするつもりだったのか？
English:
Hmph... Do you intend to take on
the entire Church all at once?

Japanese:
王都兵が　教団を引き受けてくれる分
楽になったと思うがな
English:
I suppose it should be easier now that the Imperial
Army and the Church are facing each other.

Japanese: ああ…　そういうことか
English: Yes, exactly.

Japanese:
わかったら
先を急ぐぞ　ルカ
English:
I see.
Let’s head out, Ruca.

Japanese: ウンザリ…
English: I’m Sick of this...

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
ねえ　リカルド
これからも　飛行船の操縦は
任せたからね！
English:
I’ll be counting on you to pilot
the airship again, Ricardo.
Sigh...

Japanese:
あれ？
なんだか　顔色が
良くないようだけど
English: Hm? You look pale, is something wrong?

Japanese:
ホントは　リカルド
空　飛ぶ　怖…
English: You see, Ricardo is sc--

Japanese: 黙れ！
English: Shut up!

Japanese:
ホントに　どうしたの？
なんだか　ヘンだよ
English:
Hey, what’s wrong?
You’re acting strange...

Japanese:
フン　少し寝不足なだけだ
心配するな
English:
Hmph... Merely insomnia.
Don’t worry about it.

Japanese:
そう？
ムリはしないでね
English:
Really?
Don’t force yourself.

Japanese:
ああ
わかっている
English: Affirmative. I won’t.

Japanese:
俺が　あれの操縦をか…
もう　うんざりだ
English:
Sigh...
I think I’m starting to get
sick of flying this thing...

Japanese: 空　飛ぶ　キライか？
