美しい場所…
それが　なんで
こんな風になっちゃったの？
English:
A beautiful place...
How did it end up like this?

Japanese:
雪解け水が運ぶ　土砂のせいで
徐々に　湖が埋まったために
こうなってしまったそうよ
English:
Sediments from melted snow gradually
built up in the lakes and thus it ended
up this way.

Japanese:
そう…　美しかったはずの湖が
時をかけると　こうなるのか…
English: So this is what happens to a lake over time...

Japanese:
そうね…
こうなってしまうには
１００年じゃ　きかないと思う
English: Indeed, this takes longer than a century though...

Japanese:
じゃあ　もっと時間が経てば
土砂が　さらに流されてきて
湿原じゃなくなるってことも…
English:
So does that mean that, as time passes,
this marsh will get covered up by more
sediments?

Japanese:
うん　もしかすると
いずれは　美しい森になるかもね
English:
Indeed, and when that happens it will
eventually become a beautiful forest.

Japanese:
でも「無恵」以来
土地が　痩せちゃったから…
どうなるかは　わからないわね
English:
However, because of The Fracture, the land 
has grown barren, so I am not really sure
what will eventually happen.

Japanese: テノスについて
English: About Tenos

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
ねえ　リカルド
テノスについて　詳しく教えてよ
English:
Hey, Ricardo, can you tell me
what you know about Tenos?

Japanese:
ふむ　蒸気機関が普及したせいで
石炭の需要が　高まった
English:
As the country that popularized the use of 
steam engines, its demand for coal is high.

Japanese:
おかげで　石炭を産出する
大陸北部の開発が　進められ
テノスの街は　飛躍的に発展したんだ
English:
And because of their production of coal, 
the northern part of the continent is 
slowly advancing in developments.

Japanese:
じゃあ　石炭採掘が
この街の　主要産業なんだね
English: So coal mining is this country’s main industry?

Japanese:
確かに　その通りだが
テノスの真価は
蒸気機関技術の　高さにある
English:
It’s as you said, but Tenos’ true worth
lies in their advanced steam engine technology.

Japanese:
温度差が大きいほど　機関の効率も
上がるらしいからな
English:
Apparently, the greater the differences in temperature,
the higher the efficiency of the engines...

Japanese:
気温の低い　この土地に
蒸気機関は　うってつけなのだ
English:
...and the cold climate of this area is the
ideal environment for such technology.

Japanese:
蒸気機関車の実用化も
テノスのおかげだったって　聞いてるよ
English:
I’ve heard that it was also thanks to
Tenos that steam locomotives are in use.

Japanese:
そして　その蒸気機関が発達したおかげで
テノスは国力を増し
レグヌムと　対立するようになった
English:
Thanks to the advancement of Tenos’ technology,
the country’s power increased and eventually
came into conflict with Regnum.

Japanese:
そうか…　人を幸せにするはずの技術が
進歩したせいで　戦争が起こるなんて
悲しい話だね…
English:
Oh... it’s a bit sad to think that technological
advancement can also lead to war instead
of bringing happiness to others.

Japanese:
ジョウキ機関…　石炭…
寒いとコウリツ上がる…
なるほど　なるほど
English:
Steam engines... coal...
cold... efficient...
I see, I see...

Japanese: 天空城について
English: About Ciela Castello

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
天空城ってさ
やっぱり　地上から見た人が
名付けたのかな？
English:
“Ciela Castello”...
I wonder if its name was given by Terrans?

Japanese:
天上人が　自分たちのお城を
天空城って呼ぶのって
おかしいと思うんだ
English:
I mean, wouldn’t it be strange for
Cielans to call their own castle a
“Castle in the Sky?”

Japanese:
ちゃうで　天空城は
天上界でも　宙に浮いとってん
English:
Nah, s’not it, cause it’s already
floatin’ even in Cielo.

Japanese:
ええ！　そうなの！？
お城なんて　デッカイ物
どうやって　宙に浮かせたのよ？
English:
Huh!? Really?
How does a castle as big as that float anyway?

Japanese:
そんなん　簡単やん
ほら　飛行船かて　空浮くし
English: Simple, jus’ like how this airship’s flyin’.

Japanese:
そうよね　天上人が
造ったものなんだから　飛行船より
出来も　いいはずだもんね
English:
Yeah, since it’s made by Cielans,
they must also have airships themselves.

Japanese:
せやろ？
せやから　天上界が崩壊した後も
落ちてこんと　今でも浮いてんねんで
English:
Right?
That’s why even after Cielo collapsed,
it’s still floatin’ over there.

Japanese: なるほど　納得ね～
English: I see... I think I get it～

Japanese: 質問をする
English: Inquire

Japanese: 意見を言う
English: Say what you think

Japanese:
ちょ…　ちょっと待ってよ！
そんなので　納得できるの？
English:
H-Hold on, you’re fine with
something like that?

Japanese:
あんたねぇ　飛行船が浮く時代よ？
いつまでも　大地にしがみ付いてちゃ
時代に　取り残されちゃうっての！
English:
Oh, you dummy, we’re already in the era
of airships! If you stay on the ground you’ll
find yourself left behind.

Japanese:
せやで
科学は「にっしんげっぽ」らしいからな
English:
She’s right, apparently science is
“steadily advancin’”, hear?

Japanese:
エル　その言葉の意味
わかってる？
English:
And do you know what that means,
Hermie?

Japanese: 知らん
English: No.

Japanese:
そんなこと　どうでもいいじゃない！
とにかく
浮くものは　浮くの！
English:
Who the heck cares about that!?
Floating things float!

Japanese:
わ…　わかったよ
浮くものは浮く
…んだね？
English:
F-Fine, I get it!
Floating things float!

Japanese:
そうそう
よーし　おたんこルカも
これでひとつ　お利口になったわね！
English:
There we go～ I hope you’ll behave yourself now, 
you dummy!

Japanese:
でも　お城と飛行船じゃ構造が違うし…
なにか　そういう特別な技術が
天上界にはあったの？
English:
But a castle and an airship’s structure
are both completely different...
Did Cielo really have such technology?

Japanese:
まあ　なんていうか
ひと言で　言うと「知らん」やな
English:
Hmm... How do Ah put it...
Ah don’ know.

Japanese:
え…　いや
「知らん」って　断言されてもさぁ
English:
Huh...? You “don’t know?”
That doesn’t affirm anything!

Japanese:
まあまあ
細かいことは　ええやん？
大人になったら　わかるって
English:
Well ain’t it fine?
Frettin’ over details won’t lead anywhere.
Ye’ll understand when ya grow old.

Japanese:
あ…　いや　やっぱり色々と
納得できないことが…
あ！　ちょっと待ってよ！
English:
Hm... No, I still can’t accept such a thing--
I... hey! Wait up!

Japanese:
まあいいか
どうせ聞いても　答えなんて
返って来ないだろうしね
English: Eh... whatever. I won’t get a good answer anyway.

Japanese: 黎明の塔について
English: About the Tower of Dawn

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
ところでさ　黎明の塔の
「れいめい」って　どういう意味？
English: Say, why is it called the Tower of “Dawn” anyway?

Japanese:
「黎明」とは
物事の最初を指す言葉よ
English:
Well, “dawn” can also mean
the “beginning” of something.

Japanese:
天上界から降ろされた地上人は
天に帰るために
高い塔を　建設し始めたの
English:
Terrans created this tower after being
exiled as a means of returning to Cielo.

Japanese:
そんなん建てたからっちゅうて
ホンマに　天に帰れんの？
English:
Reckon ya can go back ta Cielo
if ya built sumthin’ like that?

Japanese:
どうかなぁ　でも住み慣れた
天上界から　追い出される苦しみは
私たちには　想像がつかないもの
English:
I wonder. It is difficult to imagine how much
harder it would have been to get used to 
living in Terro just after being exiled.

Japanese: きっと　必死だったんでしょうね
English: They must have been desperate.

Japanese:
ほんで　結局
塔は天上界に　届いたん？
English: Then, did the tower manage ta reach Cielo?

Japanese:
もちろん　届かないままよ
文献には建設の途中で　巨大な雷が落ちて
犠牲者が　たくさん出たとあるわ
English:
Of course not. According to literature, halfway
into the creation of the tower, an enormous
lightning bolt struck the apex killing many.

Japanese:
うへぇ…
その雷って　ひょっとして天上人が
落としたのかな？
English:
Yikes...
Did the Cielans do it?

Japanese:
教団は　そう考えているわね
その故事から「天からの許しを乞う」という
教義が　確立したんだもの
English:
Well, that is what the Church believes.
That event is why the Church established a
doctrine of “requesting forgiveness from Cielo.”

Japanese:
その巨大な雷が落ちてきたことが
教団の始まりだったとして
「黎明の塔」と　名付けたというわけ
English:
That enormous lightning bolt led to the
creation of the Church, and gave name 
to the Tower of Dawn.

Japanese: んで　今はマティウスたちの巣窟なのね
English: And now, it’s Mattheus’ lair.

Japanese:
ついでに　もう何発か　雷を
ぶち込んでおけば　良かったのに
English:
Sure would be better if they
threw another bolt at it.

Japanese: 銃社会について
English: About Gun Laws

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
このあたりって　銃を携帯してる人
全然いないじゃん　不用心ねえ
English: How careless, no one’s carrying guns here at all.

Japanese:
あたしが　いきなり
銃ぶっ放したりしたら　どうすんだろ？
English: I wonder what would happen if I shoot at them?

Japanese:
どうしたの
突然　ぶっそうな話するね
English: Why the sudden notion?

Japanese:
まあ　そのときは　俺がイリアを止めてやろう
苦しまないよう　即死させてやるから
なにも心配は　いらんぞ
English: No worries. I won’t let her do that.

Japanese:
じょじょじょ　冗談よ？　冗談！
だからリカルドさま　ライフルから
手を離していただけません？
English:
I-I-I was kidding, aight! So can you please put 
down your rifle...? Please, Lord Ricardo?

Japanese:
でも　イリアの故郷の人って
みんな　銃持ってるの？
English: But... everyone carried guns in your village, right?

Japanese:
全員じゃないけど…
持ってる人は　結構いるわね
English: Not everyone, but there’s some who do.

Japanese:
あのあたりは　法整備が進んでないからな
頼りになるのは　己と銃のみという
考え方らしい
English:
The southwest is a lawless region, after all.
A place where you can only trust yourself and your gun.

Japanese:
そーなの
銃なら体格差が　あんまり関係ないから
女が男と　対等に戦えるもの
English:
Exactly. Difference in physical power doesn’t matter 
as long as you have a gun, so that’s why men and 
women fight equally there.

Japanese:
なるほどね　身を守るための
知恵のひとつってわけか
English: I see... it is just wise to carry one in order to survive.

Japanese:
そうそう
この銃のおかげで　あたしは何度
命を救われたことやら
English:
Yep, exactly! These babies have 
saved my life countless times.

Japanese:
確かに戦場でも　ライフルを携行する
歩兵部隊が　主力となりつつある
English:
Indeed. Even in war, troops who carry guns are often 
placed on the front lines.

Japanese:
すでに　剣で切り合うような
戦い方は　時代遅れだからな
今後　剣術は廃れていくだろう
English:
In the meanwhile, troops which wielded swords 
have grown old-fashioned and even 
swordsmanship has begun to die out.

Japanese:
でもさ　そうなると
銃を使った犯罪が　増えたりしない？
English:
If that’s the case, then wouldn’t crimes involving guns 
increase?

Japanese:
それは…　アレよ
心の汚れた人の弾なんて
まっすぐ飛ばないから　平気なのよ
English:
That is... uhhh... The evil parts of a man’s heart won’t 
disappear anyway, so it’s fine.

Japanese:
いや　すでに　その手の犯罪は増えつつある
だから善良な市民も　対抗手段として
なおさら銃は　手放せないのだろう
English:
No. Gun crimes did increase. In exchange, the public 
developed laws meant to counter gun ownership.

Japanese:
ふうん…　誰も銃なんて
持たなくて済む
平和な世の中になるといいのにね
English:
I see, so it ended in the creation of laws that prevent 
someone from easily acquiring them. How nice.

Japanese: 飛行船について
English: About the airship

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
キュキュ　聞きたい
この船　どやて飛んでるか？
教えて欲しい
English:
How does this ship fly?
QQ wanna know. Tell me.

Japanese:
テノスが石炭採掘中に偶然　地下から噴出する
特殊なガスを　発見したそうだ
それを集めると　空に浮くことができるらしい
English:
Apparently, they discovered a strange gas when
they were mining coal in Tenos. When collected,
this gas allows objects to float in the sky.

Japanese: ガス？
English: “Gas?”

Japanese:
空気のことさ
この船を　浮かせるくらいだから
ずいぶん　軽いガスなんだろうね
English:
He means air. This gas must be quite light
to be able to make a ship like this float.

Japanese:
へえ！　そりゃスゲェ！
オレは　また蒸気機関で
飛んでるのかと　思ったぜ
English:
Dude, that’s awesome!
I thought this was caused by
steam engines again!

Japanese:
浮力は　ガスだが
推進力は　蒸気機関だ
English:
It’s the gas that lets the ship float,
but the steam engine is what propels it.

Japanese:
気球の外部に　プロペラを付け
それを回転させて　進んでいるのだが
このプロペラの動力は　蒸気機関だな
English:
There are propellers fixed outside the balloon,
but it’s the steam engines within it that moves them.

Japanese:
じゃあ　そのガスさえ手に入れば
誰でも　飛行船を作れるんだな！
English:
Then, as long as they can get a lot of that
gas, anyone can make an airship!

Japanese:
そうか　それすごい
ヘンな帽子　いいこと言う
English:
I see... that’s awesome!
Nice, weird hat!

Japanese: いや　話はそう簡単じゃないな
English: No, it’s easier said than done.

Japanese:
浮力を殺さないほど　軽く出力の強い
蒸気機関を　作る技術がなければ
飛行船は　飛ばせない
English:
In order not to hamper the buoyancy of the ship,
you would need a light but powerful engine,
otherwise it won’t be able to fly at all.

Japanese:
つまり　今のところ
蒸気機関の　先進国ならではの
乗り物ってわけだね
English:
For now, it is a ride that only countries
with developed steam engines can afford.

Japanese:
だが　飛行船が
実用レベルであることは　判明した
今後　これが戦争に　使われるようになれば…
English:
While they’re still identifying ways on how
an airship will be useful, if they’re able to
use this in the war...

Japanese:
おっかないこと言うなよ
あんなに楽しい　乗り物だってのによ
English:
Dude, quit saying such ominous crap.
This ride’s supposed to be fun...

Japanese:
そ…　そうか？
楽しいのか？
English:
Is that so...?
You find this fun?

Japanese:
窓からの景色とか
スッゲェ　きれいだったじゃねェかよ
English:
I mean, yeah!
The view from here’s hella pretty!

Japanese:
俺は操縦に　手一杯で
景色なんて眺めてる　余裕は…
English:
Look, I have my hands full steering this ship here.
I don’t really have the spare time to--

Japanese:
なんだって？
なんか言ったか？
English: Huh? You said something?

Japanese:
い…　いやなんでもない
気にするな！
English:
N-Nothing! I’m fine!
Don’t worry about me!

Japanese:
なんだ？　リカルドのおっさん
急に落ち着きなくしてよ
English:
Hm? Why was the old man flustered 
all of a sudden?

Japanese: 戦争について
English: About the War

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
なあなあ　結局のところ
なんで　戦争なんてしてんの？
English: Hey, hey, why’re they still fightin’?

Japanese:
戦争の原因なんて
なかなか　ひと言では
説明できないかなぁ
English: It would be a bit difficult to explain in a few words.

Japanese:
人の歴史というものは
原因と結果の　連続だからな
戦争の原因も　ひとつということはない
English:
We would have to explain the causes
and the results of years of human history.
There’s no specific reason for it.

Japanese:
そこを　なんとか
３行でお願い
English:
Then can ya sum it up? 
In three lines or less please?

Japanese:
基本的には　レグヌムと
他の国の関係悪化だ
レグヌムは　各国と仲が悪い
English:
To summarize, Regnum’s relationship with three
countries deteriorated as time passed and now,
it’s on bad terms with every other country.

Japanese:
ほな　なんで仲悪くなったん？
これも３行で！
English:
Why are they on bad terms?
Three lines max too, please!

Japanese:
元々は　地域による信仰の違いが
ぶつかったのね
戦争は　その延長よ
English:
Their disagreements originated from differences 
between the religions of each country. The war
is simply an extension of those disagreements.

Japanese:
レグヌムは　教団の宗主国として
威張り散らしていた
それが　各国には鼻についたんだな
English:
Regnum acted as the Church’s suzerain state
and threw its weight around. And that must’ve
rubbed other nations the wrong way.

Japanese:
へぇ～　そぉやったんか
大体　わかったわ
おーきにやで
English:
Ohhh so that’s the case...
Ah think Ah get it.
Thanks.

Japanese:
この程度で　わかったつもりじゃ
ダメよ　エル
ついでに　大陸興亡史についても…
English:
That alone will not suffice, Hermie.
Next, we have to talk about the
rise and fall of the continents...

Japanese: えーっと　あー　うー…　あかん！
English: Uhh... Oh-- Oh no!

Japanese:
あたたたた　ウチ　お腹痛なってきた！
ちょっと　トイレ～！
English:
This is bad, guys, mah tummy’s startin’ ta hurt, Ah’mma
go ta the toilet fer a bit...

Japanese:
エル！　大丈夫よ！
じゃあ　トイレで
お話してあげる！
English:
No need to worry, Hermie!
We shall continue this lecture in the bathroom!

Japanese:
うわっ　ついて来よった！
カンニンやで　アンジュ姉ちゃん！
English: Stand back! Gimme a break, Sis Ange!

Japanese:
…しかし　アンジュは
本当に　話好きだな
俺は　あそこまで　熱心にはなれん
English:
Ange sure loves talking...
I’ll...
be over there.

Japanese: 魔物について
English: About Evil Spirits

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
しっかし　なんでこんな
猛獣が町を襲うように　なっちゃったの？
いい迷惑じゃん
English:
That said, why is this town being attacked by
monsters? It’s so troublesome for those who live in it.

Japanese:
まったくだぜ
これじゃ　一般人は気軽に
旅行も　できねェよな
English:
You’re right, no way any ordinary person
can travel out of town coz of this.

Japanese:
悲しいことだけど
これも「無恵」の影響だと
考えられてるの
English:
It is a sad thought, but I wonder if this
has something to do with the Fracture.

Japanese:
天上界から見捨てられ　祝福をなくした
地上人は　信仰を失った
そのしっぺ返しを　もらったというわけね…
English:
It might be an act of retaliation from Terro for
being abandoned and losing Cielo’s blessing...

Japanese:
でも「無恵」の原因は
地上人が　信仰を
忘れたからだけじゃないでしょ
English:
But wasn’t The Fracture the reason why Terrans 
forgot about their faith?

Japanese:
そーだぜ
天上界が　消滅したからだろ？
しっぺ返しも　クソもねェよな
English:
Right, wasn’t Cielo destroyed?
It’s not retaliation or negligence, right?

Japanese:
…と　教団では説かれていたの
「信仰を忘れると　ひどい目に遭う」って
宗教の基本でしょ？
English:
And remembering such beliefs is
the basis of the Church’s teachings.

Japanese:
じゃあ　猛獣が現れるのは
「無恵」と　関係ないの？
English:
So does that mean that The Fracture has
nothing to do with the beasts appearing?

Japanese:
いえ　天上界がなくなって
天と地のバランスが　崩れたこととは
関係があると思うわ
English:
No, I believe it has something to do with the
imbalance between Cielo and Terro
caused by Cielo’s disappearance.

Japanese:
まあ　なんにせよ
襲ってくる敵は
ぶっ倒すってことだな？
English:
In any case, all we have to do is 
to kick their asses, right?

Japanese:
そうね　生きるためだもの
襲ってくる敵は
やっつけるしかないでしょうね
English:
Yes, it is for survival that we must
chase them away, after all.

Japanese:
へへッ！
腕がなるぜ！
English: C’mon, let’s move!

Japanese:
…人が生きるためだもの
仕方のない…　ことよね？
English: We have to do it to save others... right?

Japanese: ミュース族について
English: About the Muse Clan

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ン～♪　ン～♪　ヌフ～♪

いいことでもあったのか？
なんだよ　その歌
English: Did something good happen? Why are you singing?

Japanese:
これはコーダが　お腹を空かせたときに
発するメロディなのだ
知らんのか　しかし？
English:
This is the melody that my stomach lets out whenever 
I’m hungry though?

Japanese:
知らねェよ…
なんで腹へって　歌を歌うんだよ
イリア　マジでこいつ　一体なんなんだ？
English:
As if I’d know... why does your stomach sing, anyway? 
Illia, what the heck is this thing?

Japanese:
あー　えーっと…
あたしの故郷の近くに　住んでる生き物で
ミュース族っていうの
English:
Oh uhh... it’s an animal that’s part of the Muse 
clan that lives near my village.

Japanese:
えー…　なぜかしゃべる
……………………
以上終わり…　かな
English: Um... for some reason it talks... That’s all?

Japanese:
おまえの故郷って　かなりの荒野だろ？
こんな食い意地の張ったヤツ
生きていけんのか？
English:
Isn’t your town in a desert? Can these creatures 
even live in such a place?

Japanese:
こう見えて　実は乾燥と飢えに
すっごく強いのよ
English:
Yeah it is and, as you can see, thirst and starvation is 
very prominent there.

Japanese:
その分　食べられるときには
反動で　食欲旺盛になるみたい
English:
That’s why these guys get very 
lively when it comes to food.

Japanese: 食い溜めができるってわけか…
English: So these guys can stuff themselves full, huh...

Japanese:
おう　コーダ　食うぞー
しかし！
English: Yeah! Coda can eat though!

Japanese:
イリアの故郷には
こんなのが　ウジャウジャいるのか？
English:
How long have these guys been living near your 
place anyway?

Japanese:
ウジャウジャどころか
村まで作って　暮らしてるわよ
だから　キチンと契約してるの
English:
Well, they’ve been living there since the time 
my village was built, so there’s an agreement 
between my village and them.

Japanese: なんだよ　契約って
English: An agreement...?

Japanese:
簡単な仕事を　任せる代わりに
エサを与えるって　感じかな
好き勝手　食い散らかされないようにね
English:
They do simple jobs and we give them 
food in exchange... Well, something like that. 
It’s an easier means of getting food after all.

Japanese:
こいつらのできる
簡単な仕事ってなんだ？
English: What kind of jobs can these guys do?

Japanese:
そうねぇ
朝　起こしてくれたり　留守番を頼んだり
掃除は頼んだけど　ダメだったかなぁ
English:
Good question. We give them tasks like waking us in 
the morning, house sitting and cleaning the place. 
In hindsight, was it even worth having them do that?

Japanese:
ホントに　簡単なことしかできねェな…
そんなんで　エサ代の割に合うのか？
English:
They can’t even do simple jobs... 
Was feeding them ever worth it?

Japanese:
んー…
でも　ペットとして人気あるから
English: Yep. They’re more popular as pets, anyway.

Japanese:
おう　そーだ　そーだ
コーダの一族　ミュース族
大人気だぞー？　しかし！
English:
That’s right! That’s right! Coda’s clan, the Muse clan, 
is really popular though!

Japanese:
イリア　こいつペットとして
ホントに　かわいいと思うのか？
English: Illia, do you really think this thing is cute for a pet?

Japanese: それは　その…
English: Well that’s...

Japanese:
んー？
イリア　どうして　コーダの方を
見ないんだ　しかし？
English: Illia, why are you looking away from me though?

Japanese: 大主天について
English: About the Great Cielan

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
ねえ　マティウスって
結局　どういう人なの？
大主天って　呼ばれてたけどさ
English:
Say, what kind of person is Mattheus anyway? 
Didn’t the old man earlier call her a “Great Cielan?”

Japanese:
ん～　あたしの村には　月に一日
巡回で　教団の人間が来る程度だったから
詳しくは　知らないんだけどね
English:
Hm... the Church Followers only visit my village 
once a month so I’m not really sure.

Japanese:
まあ　とにかく
大主天ってのは　教団で
一番　いばってるヤツのこと
English:
At any rate, this so-called “Great Cielan” is a really 
bossy person.

Japanese:
…で　もちろん
一番　悪いヤツってことね
English: Of course they’re the worst person around.

Japanese: 賛成する
English: Agree

Japanese: 反対する
English: Disagree

Japanese:
うん…　教団に入信しようっていう人は
きっと　マティウスに
騙されてるんだよね
English:
Yeah! I’m sure that Mattheus 
is deceiving her believers.

Japanese:
そうそう　どんな理由があるにせよ
あいつが　村を襲ったこと
あたしは絶対　許さないんだから！
English:
That’s right. No matter what, that person still 
destroyed my village. I will never forgive her.

Japanese:
なんのために　創世力とやらを
探してるのか　知んないけど
ロクでもないことに　決まってるわよ
English:
We’ll search for the Genesis 
leaving no stone unturned.

Japanese:
でも　マティウスを頼って
教団に入信しようって
人もいるくらいだし　本当のところは…
English:
But, y’know, there are also other people outside 
the Church that trust Mattheus. Maybe it’s--

Japanese:
ああん？　じゃあ　あんた　なに？
あたしの村を襲ったヤツの
肩を持つわけ？
English:
What, you telling me you’re siding with the 
person who attacked my village, huh?

Japanese:
い…　いや
そういうわけじゃないけど
なにか　事情があるのかなぁって…
English:
N-No, that’s not what I meant. I was thinking if there 
were some circumstances related to it...

Japanese:
どんな事情があるにせよ
あいつが　村を襲ったこと
あたしは絶対　許さないんだから！
English:
What circumstance? 
That person attacked. my. village! 
I’ll never forgive them!

Japanese:
なんのために　創世力とやらを
探してるのか　知んないけど
ロクでもないことに　決まってるわよ
English:
I have no idea why she needs the Genesis, 
it might be futile or whatever but I’ve decided!

Japanese:
マティウスは　悪いヤツ！
あんた　今度　これについて反対したら
ぶっ飛ばすわよ
English:
Mattheus is bad! If you’re going to keep opposing me, 
I’ll have no choice but to make you into a colander
along with her.

Japanese: 教団って？
English: And the Church is?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
教団とか　信仰について
イリアは　詳しい方？
English:
Do you know anything about 
what the Church worships?

Japanese:
あたしの村は　開拓村だったからなぁ
全然詳しくないのよね
English:
My village is still being developed so 
I don’t really know much about it yet.

Japanese:
ほとんどの人が　生活に追われて
信仰どころじゃなかったもん
English:
Everyone’s too caught up with their own lives
to care about some kind of religion.

Japanese:
だって　人間
まずは　食べていかなきゃダメでしょ
English: All humans have to eat, right?

Japanese: 食えないのはダメだな　しかし！
English: Not eating is not allowed though!

Japanese:
レグヌムからの　移民でできた村だから
信仰に熱心な人も
中にはいたけどね
English:
Since it’s a village made up of Regnum immigrants,
there’s naturaly some religious folk.

Japanese:
うちも父さんが
信仰に熱心な方じゃなかったから
ほとんど　なにも知らないのと同じかな
English:
My father is also the type to not care about
religion so I know just the same as you do.

Japanese:
でも　教団に追われてる間に
レグヌム以外の国…
English:
But, y’know? I heard about the other
kingdoms while I was running away.

Japanese:
レグヌムと戦争やってる　ガラムとか
東の島国の　アシハラっていう国には
教団とは　別の宗教があるって聞いたわ
English:
I heard that the country Regnum’s battling against,
Garam, and a country in the east, Ashihara,
don’t share the same beliefs as the Church’s.

Japanese:
根っこは　同じ天上界を信じてるんだけど
その土地に合った　個別の神さまを
信じてたりするんだってさ
English:
They all believe in the same Cielo, but each region
believes in different individual gods.

Japanese: 大変だったね
English: That must’ve been terrible

Japanese: うらやましいな
English: I’m jealous

Japanese:
教団に　追われて
大変だったね
English:
It must’ve been terrible being chased around 
by the Church.

Japanese:
まあ　レグヌムに着いたときには
お金も　食べる物もなくて
ホント　絶望感いっぱいだったけどね
English:
Well, by the time I reached Regnum, I
didn’t have enough money or food so
I was pretty depressed back there.

Japanese:
食う物ないと
絶望だな　しかし！
English: Nothing to eat and depressed, though!

Japanese:
レグヌムに　着くまでには
いろいろあったけど
楽しいこともあったかな
English:
On the upside, there were also some
fun moments when I was traveling.

Japanese:
そんな風に思えるなんて　イリアはすごいな
もし　僕がイリアと
同じだったらと　思うと…
English:
You’re pretty amazing considering that, Illia.
I wouldn’t know what to do if I were you.

Japanese:
だったら　あたしを
不安がらせないように
もっと　しっかりしてよね
English:
Then go straighten yourself up so that
I won’t have anything more to worry about.

Japanese:
僕　レグヌムの外には
ほとんど　出たことなかったから
そういうの　うらやましいよ
English: I’ve never been outside of Regnum so I’m jealous.

Japanese:
まあ　そう言われてみれば
そうね
English:
Well, when you put it that way...
I guess it wasn’t so bad.

Japanese:
レグヌムに　着くまでには
いろいろあったけど
楽しいこともあったから
English:
A lot of things happened before I reached Regnum,
but I won’t deny that I had fun.

Japanese:
あたしも　こんなことがなかったら
一生　自分の村から
出なかったかもしれないし…
English:
If this didn’t happen to me, I would’ve
lived the rest of my life back in Sania...

Japanese:
あんた　なかなかいいこと言うじゃない
そういう　前向きな考え
あたし　キライじゃないわよ
English:
You sure say some nice things. 
I don’t dislike that optimism.

Japanese: 基地の場所
English: The Base

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
ねえ　スパーダ
ここで軍の部隊が
全滅しかけたって　話なんだけど…
English:
About what you said earlier, about the army getting 
annihilated...

Japanese:
ああ
兄貴のひとりが　所属してた部隊がな
English:
Oh... I meant the unit in which one of my older brothers 
belonged to.

Japanese:
でも　どうして軍は
そんな場所の先に
基地なんて　造ったんだろう
English:
But, why would the army even make a base near a 
place like this?

Japanese:
おそらく　他に知られたくない
研究でもやってんだろ
English:
Most likely they’re probably researching something 
highly classified.

Japanese:
わざわざ　こんなところ越えて
基地に　近づくような物好きは
いないからな
English:
They put the base there so that no one could just
accidentaly stumble into the building and find out 
what’s in it.

Japanese:
それに兄貴は　詳しく教えちゃくれなかったが
基地には　ナーオスから船を出せば
海路でも行けるはずだ
English:
My older brother didn’t really explain it to me that much 
but apparently you can reach the base from Naohs 
by sea.

Japanese:
へ…？
じゃあ　あんたのお兄さん
こんなところで　なにやってたのよ？
English: Oh... then what’s your brother doing here?

Japanese:
言ったろ
ここには　他と生態系の違う
普通じゃ　勝てない敵が出るって
English:
Didn’t I say? Apparently, it’s because the ecosystem 
here is distinctly different from outside. The monsters 
that appear are near unbeatable.

Japanese:
おおかた　兵器にでも使うつもりで
ここの生き物を　捕まえるのが
目的だったんじゃねェかな？
English:
Maybe my brother came here to gather 
samples to be used against the weapons 
being developed by the army.

Japanese: 感心する
English: Be impressed

Japanese: 疑問に思う
English: Express doubt

Japanese:
へぇ～
スパーダって　物知りだね
English: Spada sure knows a lot～

Japanese:
止せよ
オレは　ただ兄貴の受け売りで
しゃべってるだけさ
English:
Cut it out. I’m only repeating what 
my brother has told me.

Japanese:
でも　こういう話をしてると
自分の家が　戦争屋の家系なんだって
思い知るぜ
English:
This just made me realize that my family 
are just a bunch of warmongers.

Japanese:
誰かの楯になるってことは
場合によっちゃあ　人を守るために
誰かと　戦うってことだからな
English:
“Become a shield for others”... 
In cases where you’ll have to protect someone, 
you’re most likely going to have to fight someone else.

Japanese:
結局　戦争のためか
気分のいい話じゃないね
English: In the end, we ended up talking about the war...

Japanese:
悪ぃ悪ぃ
そんなつもりじゃなかったんだけどよ
余計な話までしちまったな
English:
My bad, I didn’t mean to come off that way... 
I ended up saying some unnecessary stuff.

Japanese:
でも　こういう話をしてると
自分の家が　戦争屋の家系なんだって
思い知るぜ
English:
This just made me realize that my family 
are just a bunch of warmongers.

Japanese: 時空のゆがみについて
English: About the Space-Time Distortion

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
コンウェイさんが　僕たちと一緒に
来てくれることになったときのこと
なんだけど…
English:
Mr. Kongwei, about the time 
when you asked to join us...

Japanese:
うん？
どうかしたの　ルカくん？
English: What is it, Ruca?

Japanese:
あのとき　時空のゆがみが
どうとかって　言ってたでしょ？
もう少し　詳しく聞かせてよ
English:
At that time, you mentioned something
about a “space-time distortion?”
Can you tell us more about it?

Japanese:
そうだなぁ　ボクも
ほとんど　知らないに
等しい程度なんだけど…
English: Oh... Unfortunately I, too, know as much as you all...

Japanese:
この世には　境界線のような場所があって
そこには　ゆがみや　ひずみが
生まれやすいんだ
English:
When the boundary of this world grows thin,
strains and distortions start to appear.

Japanese:
そこへ　人が迷い込むと
そのまま　姿を消すこともよくある
English:
There people tend to get lost 
and disappear quite frequently.

Japanese:
中でも　子どもが姿を消す場合は
神隠しと　呼んでるみたいだね
English:
Locally, we know it as being “spirited away.” 
This happens when a child happens to 
wander near such a place and disappears.

Japanese:
ああ　神隠しの話なら
オレも　小さい頃
じいに　よく聞かされたよ
English:
I think I remember gramps telling me about that when I 
was a kid.

Japanese:
昔は　天が子どもを
呼び寄せることが　あったんだってな
English:
Back then, it was said that the children who 
got lost were called by Cielo.

Japanese:
…で　その子が　いい子なら　神さまに
天上界に連れてって　もらえるんだけど
悪い子だと　死神に魂ごと食われるんだって
English:
...Good souls will be taken by Gods to Cielo while the 
naughty souls will get eaten by the Reapers.

Japanese:
へぇ　そんな風にも
言われてるんだ
English: I see... so that is how they also interpreted it...

Japanese: さらに問う
English: Ask a bit more

Japanese: 納得する
English: Agree

Japanese:
確か　あのときコンウェイさんは
僕たちを　待ってたって
言ったよね？
English: If I recall correctly, you were waiting for us, right?

Japanese:
ああ…　うん
本当にキミたちが　現れるかどうかは
賭けだったんだけどね
English:
Ahh... well, actually I made a wager 
on whether you guys would actually 
pass through that place or not.

Japanese:
賭け？　えっと…
それって　どういうこと？
English: A wager? Uhm... What do you mean by that?

Japanese:
…まあ　それについては
機会があれば
おいおい　話すよ
English:
...Well, the wager was a chance on whether I 
would be able to catch your attention or not.

Japanese:
ボクは　キミたちの旅に付き合いたい
ただの物好き
今は　それでいいじゃないか
English:
Consider the reason why I wanted to join your 
journey to be merely out of curiosity.

Japanese:
境界線に　神隠しかぁ
知らないに等しいって　言っても
やっぱり　いろいろ知ってるんだね
English:
To know a wide variety of things from “world 
boundaries” to “spiritings”, you sure 
know a lot, Kongwei!

Japanese:
まあ　多少知識のある学生なら
誰でも　知ってることさ
English:
You happen to learn about all sorts 
of things when you’re a scholar, after all.

Japanese:
この程度のことで
お役に立てたのなら　ボクも嬉しいよ
English: And I am fine as long as I am of use to everyone.

Japanese: コンウェイの興味
English: Kongwei’s Interest

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
転生者を　動力源に…　か
面白いアイデアだな
English:
Using a Reincarnator as a source
of power... What an interesting idea!

Japanese:
そういえば　コンウェイさん
あの筒に　ずいぶん興味を
持ってたみたいだけど…
English:
Kongwei... You’ve been staring at 
that cylinder for a while now...

Japanese:
ああ…　うん　やっぱり
珍しい物　自分の知らない物には
興味を　ひかれるからね
English:
Oh... Well, I have not seen these things before,
you see. They are quite strange and interesting.

Japanese:
…そうか　キミたち　転生者にとっては
興味本意で　話をされるのは
気分の良くないことだったね
English:
Oh... right, you guys do not like the idea
of Reincarnators being taken away for this...

Japanese: 肯定する
English: Agree

Japanese: 否定する
English: Deny

Japanese:
うん…　自分が
あんな風になるなんて想像すると
やっぱりね
English:
Yeah, I can’t help but think that 
it could also happen to me...

Japanese:
ルカくん相手で　少し油断したな
悪かったね
これからは　気をつけるよ
English:
My mistake, I was unaware that you guys were also 
Reincarnators... I will be careful next time.

Japanese:
そ…　そんなことないよ
どうして　興味があるのか
不思議に　思っただけ
English:
T-That’s not it. I was just wondering
why you were so interested in it.

Japanese:
ああいうことを　戦争に利用する人たちが
悪いんだし　コンウェイさんのこと
そんな風に悪く　思ったりしてないから
English:
I know that people who use those things are bad,
but I’ll never think that you’re that type of person.

Japanese:
いや…　キミの顔を見ればわかるよ
ルカくん相手で　少し油断したな
これからは　気をつけるよ
English:
No. Your expression says it all. Ruca, 
from now on you should be careful 
with whom you let your guard down.

Japanese: ナーオスの立場
English: Naohs’ Position

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ナーオスでは　心配していたほど
さかんに　異能者狩りは
行われていないようだな
English:
It doesn’t seem like Naohs hunts Deviants 
as frequently as I expected.

Japanese:
そうですね
同じレグヌムの領内でも
王都と比べると　活発ではないでしょうね
English:
Indeed. It might be within Regnum’s domains
but, in comparison, it is less lively.

Japanese:
軍の兵士たちも
ナーオス基地から　ときおり巡回に
現れる程度ですから
English:
Although infrequently, soldiers from Naohs
base would come and patrol the town.

Japanese:
自国の領内と言えど　王都レグヌムも
自由に手出しは　できないか…
ナーオスが　聖都と呼ばれる　ゆえんだな
English:
Despite that, Regnum can’t freely interfere here...
I suppose it’s not called a Holy City without reason.

Japanese:
大聖堂と　信者のおかげで
王都の影響力が　比較的小さかったですから
でもそれも　これからは…
English:
Thanks to the Grand Cathedral and its believers,
the Capital’s influence here is comparatively small. 
But now...

Japanese:
いずれにせよ　おまえたちの
安全のためには　目立たないに
越したことはない
English:
In any case, it won’t hurt to lay
low as we do our business here.

Japanese:
おかしな騒ぎなどは
起こさないで　欲しいものだな
English: I don’t want you to cause any more uproar here.

Japanese: コンウェイとの出会い
English: How I Met Kongwei

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
ねえ　コンウェイさん
レグヌムで
僕と　会ったときのことなんだけど…
English:
Mr. Kongwei, about the time
when we met in Regnum...

Japanese:
ほら　慌ててた僕が
コンウェイさんに　ぶつかって
その本を　落としちゃった…
English:
Y’know, that time when I accidentally
bumped into you and your book fell...

Japanese:
ああ…　そう言われれば
そんなことがあったね
English:
Ahh... Now that you mention it,
that did happen.

Japanese:
あのとき　ぶつかった僕の方が悪いのに
コンウェイさん
ちっとも　怒らなかったでしょ
English:
I bumped into you quite hard but
you didn’t get angry at all, did you
Mr. Kongwei?

Japanese:
だから　一緒に旅をしたいって言われたとき
優しそうな人が　一緒に来てくれるのは
嬉しいなって　思ったんだ
English:
So, when you asked me if I wanted
to travel with you, I was glad someone
so gentle was coming with us.

Japanese:
転生者じゃないのに
僕たちのこと
いろいろ　助けてもくれるし…
English:
You’ve helped us quite a lot too,
despite not being a Reincarnator...

Japanese:
まあ　途中で旅を止められると
困るから
English:
To be fair, it would be troublesome
for me if your journey suddenly ended...
I’m sorry...?

Japanese:
いや　なんでもないよ
そうだな…
English:
No, it is nothing.
It is just...

Japanese:
ボクは　ルカくん　キミに
すごく興味があるから
お手伝いをしているだけだよ
English: I am only helping because I am interested in you.

Japanese: 疑いを持つ
English: Doubt him

Japanese: 素直に喜ぶ
English: Be delighted

Japanese:
興味…？
…僕に一体　どんな興味があるの？
English:
Interested?
Why would you be interested in me?

Japanese:
ああ　表現が悪かったかな
別に　ルカくん目当てっていう
意味じゃなくてね
English: Oh, my bad, I did not mean it like that.

Japanese:
ただ　キミと旅をしてると
いろんな経験ができて　楽しいってことさ
深い意味はないよ
English:
It is just that I am glad that I got to experience
a lot of things while travelling with you.

Japanese:
…僕に興味？
そんなこと言われたの　初めてだから
ちょっと嬉しいな
English:
You’re interested in me?
It’s the first time someone told me that,
so I’m rather flattered.

Japanese:
キミは　自分では
気がついてないかもしれないけれど
ボクは　キミの謙虚なところ　好きだよ
English:
You might not have noticed it,
but I like your humility.

Japanese:
父さんからは　覇気がないって
よくしかられてたけどね
English:
Although, my father has always been telling
me that I don’t have enough ambition.

Japanese:
そう？
ボクは　うぬぼれ屋や　我の強い人間より
よっぽど　好感が持てると思うけどな
English:
Is that so?
I think that you are a lot more likable than
any conceited or egotistical person.

Japanese: スパーダの記憶
English: Spada’s Memories

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
なんでだろうな　みんなと違って
オレ　別にあの祭壇　見ても
懐かしく　感じたりしなかったんだよな
English:
I wonder why I didn’t feel nostalgic 
when I saw the altar...

Japanese:
でも　アンジュは天上界と
雰囲気が近いって　言ってたよ
English:
But, Ange did say that we were near a place that gave 
off the same atmosphere as Cielo.

Japanese:
もしかすると　スパーダの前世が
人ではなく　剣であったことに
起因するのではないか？
English:
Could it be because Spada was a sword in his past life 
instead of a person?

Japanese:
俺も　懐かしく感じたということは
センサスと　ラティオの
違いでもないはずだからな
English:
The fact that I also felt nostalgic about it means that 
it doesn’t matter whether you were from Sensus 
or Ratio.

Japanese:
ん～　あ…　そっか
そうだ　そうだ
オレ　みんなの中で一番若いんだ
English:
Oh... I see... It’s coz, compared to everyone else, 
I was the youngest.

Japanese:
だから　天上界自体に
みんなの前世ほど　思い入れがないんだ
そうだ　そうだ
English:
That’s why I don’t remember Cielo as much as 
everyone does.

Japanese:
ええ！？
デュランダルが　一番若かったの？
English: Wait, Durandal was the youngest!?

Japanese:
ああ　アスラなんかも
若い方だったと　思うけどよ
English:
Well, I did get the impression 
that Asura was quite young...

Japanese:
神さま連中は　何千歳なんてのが
ゴロゴロいたからなぁ
English:
Gods that are around the age of a thousand or so are 
usually arrogant.

Japanese:
…で　デュランダルは
そういうヤツらに　造られた剣なわけ
English: Durandal was raised by that kind of guy.

Japanese:
なるほど　造った神より
造られたデュランダルの方が
若いのは　道理だな
English:
I see, it makes sense that Durandal’s younger than the 
one who created him.

Japanese:
確か　デュランダルはアスラよりも
ずいぶん　若かったと思うぜ
English: I bet Durandal’s younger than Asura.

Japanese: あきれる
English: Be amazed

Japanese: 感心する
English: Admire

Japanese:
にも関らず　君って…
デュランダルって　あんなに偉そうに
しゃべってたんだね
English:
In spite of that, you-- Durandal 
still spoke quite arrogantly.

Japanese:
名剣だっていうから　てっきり
アスラは　古くから伝わる剣だとばかり
思ってたよ
English:
Durandal was a famous sword so Asura thought that 
he had been passed down through generations.

Japanese:
なんだかんだ言って
やっぱり　スパーダは
デュランダルの影響　受けてるんだ
English: Besides that, Spada was still influenced by Durandal.

Japanese:
うっせェよ！
そういう風に　造られたんだから
しょうがねェだろ
English:
Oh shut up! I was created like 
that so it can’t be helped.

Japanese:
そんなに若いのに
デュランダルは
名剣と　呼ばれてたんだね
English:
Despite being so young, 
Durandal was known as a famous sword.

Japanese:
すごい名剣だっていうから　てっきり
アスラは　古くから伝わる剣だとばかり
思ってたよ
English:
It’s because of that popularity that Asura thought that 
Durandal has been passed down through generations.

Japanese:
まあ　偉いのは造ったヤツで
オレじゃねェけどな
English:
Well, the popular one was the one who created me, 
not me, myself.

Japanese:
でもよ　若かったからこそ
デュランダルが唯一　思い入れがあったのは
アスラだったんだぜ…
English:
But y’know, even though he was young, the only 
one Durandal ended up remembering was Asura...

Japanese: 無口なコンウェイ
English: Taciturn Kongwei

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
あの…　コンウェイさん
鍾乳洞で　ほとんど
なにも　しゃべってなかったけどさ
English:
Umm, Kongwei, you haven’t spoken since
we entered the Limestone Cave...

Japanese:
やっぱり　退屈だった？
なんだか　仲間外れにしたみたいで
気になって…
English: Are you perhaps feeling left out?

Japanese:
そんなことないよ
横で話を　聞いてるだけでも
とても興味深かった　退屈なんて全然
English:
Not at all, I might not have anything to do with
the conversation, but it is all very interesting for me.

Japanese:
ただ　キミたちのジャマをしないように
黙ってただけさ
English: I just kept silent so I would not bother you guys.

Japanese:
なにせ　記憶の場…　だっけ？
あれで　みんなになにが見えているのか
ボクには　よくわからないからね
English:
At any rate, that... “Memory Spring”.
It seems as though all of you witnessed 
something that I was unable to...

Japanese:
まああまり　気にしないで
所詮　ボクは部外者だから
English:
At any rate, no need for you to worry.
I am nothing but an outsider, after all.

Japanese: 肯定する
English: Agree

Japanese: 否定する
English: Disagree

Japanese:
そ…　そうだね
でももし　なにか気になることがあったら
聞いてよ　わかるように説明するから
English:
I-I understand. But still, if you’re curious about
something, please don’t hesitate to ask me.
I’ll gladly explain it to you.

Japanese:
ありがとう
でも　ホント　ボクのことは
気にしないでいいよ
English:
Thank you.
But, really, there is no need to worry about me.

Japanese:
キミたちの旅の　ジャマをすることは
ボクの本意じゃないからさ
English: I have no intention of meddling in your journey.

Japanese:
そんなことないよ
コンウェイさんは
僕たちの仲間じゃないか
English: You’re wrong, Kongwei. You’re one of us.

Japanese:
だから　もしなにか
思いついたときは　話してみてよ
English: So don’t hesitate to tell us when you have an idea.

Japanese:
きっと　外から見てるからこそ　わかる
大事なことだってあると　思うんだ
English: I’m sure that a different point-of-view will matter greatly.

Japanese:
ふむ　なるほどね…　わかった
次からは　気になることがあったら
口にしてみるよ
English:
I see... Then, if something catches my attention,
I will make sure to bring it up with everyone.

Japanese:
でも　ボクのことは　気にしないで
キミたちの旅の　ジャマをすることは
ボクの本意じゃないからさ
English:
But, really, there is no need to worry about me.
I have no intention of meddling in your journey.

Japanese: ひとつやふたつ
English: Just One or Two...

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
は～　こんだけ　高そうなもんあったら
ひとつや　ふたつ　くすねても
バレへんのんと　ちゃうやろか
English:
Whoa, if yer this rich, 
ya prolly won’t be able ta notice if one 
or two of yer things get swiped.

Japanese:
いや　ひとつや　ふたつと言わず
４つや５つくらい…
English: No, not jus’ one or two, more like four or five...

Japanese:
おまえ　ちょっとは反省しろよ
なにが原因で
今　こんなことになってるのかをよ
English:
Why don’t you reflect for a second, huh!?
This is why this happened in the first place!

Japanese:
でもな　兄ちゃん
ウチら　あるとこからしか
盗ってへんかってんで
English: But, Bro, we only stole from ’em!

Japanese:
なに自慢げに　言ってんだよ
ないところからは
盗れねェだろが
English:
What are you bragging about?!
Stealing is nothing worth being proud about.

Japanese:
兄ちゃん　なかなかスルドイ！
でも　先にオチ言うたら
あかんわぁ
English:
Bro, ya sure have a sharp tongue!
Like Ah said earlier, it’s useless.

Japanese:
でもな　あるとこ狙うだけちゃうねんで
悪いことしてそうなとこ
狙うんが　コツやねん
English:
But, we don’ jus’ steal from sum
rando’ person’s place, ya hear? 
We take stuff from bad folk’s places.

Japanese:
悪いことして　貯めたもんは
盗まれても　おおっぴらにできんさかい
たいてい　泣き寝入りしてくれよんねん！
English:
Since they’ve acquired their wealth through dishonest
means, they can’t easily bring it up with authorities.
They’ll jus’ end up cryin’ in their sleep!

Japanese:
全然　反省してねェな
こいつ…
English: This brat hasn’t reflected at all...

Japanese: ガラム港と鉱山について
English: About Garam Harbor and the Mines

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
リカルドさんは
ガラムについて　詳しいの？
English: What do you know about Garam, Ricardo?

Japanese:
そうだな…　ここガラムは港を手に入れてから
自国の鉱物資源が　輸出可能になり
以来　発展が著しいそうだ
English:
After Garam obtained this harbor, it opened 
up possibilities for the exportation of 
minerals and development.

Japanese:
いくら鉱物資源が　豊かとはいえ
ただ　持っているだけでは
宝の持ち腐れだからな
English:
At the end of the day, what use is the abundance 
of minerals if you only possess it.

Japanese:
ここほどの鉱山を持つ国は　他にあるまい
これからは　鉱物資源を持つ国が
力を持つようになるのかもしれん
English:
No other country possesses more mines than this 
one, and eventually, countries that possess a lot 
of mineral resources will become powerful.

Japanese:
でも　それがまた
戦争の火種になってるわけか…
English: The value of those minerals can often cause wars...

Japanese:
まあ　そういうことだ
王都にとって　ガラムの鉱物資源は
魅力だからな
English:
Well that’s how it is. After all, Regnum’s interested 
in Garam’s mineral resources.

Japanese: 戦争を悲しむ
English: Be sad about war

Japanese: リカルドの知識を誉める
English: Praise Ricardo’s knowledge

Japanese:
せっかくの資源なんだから
仲良く　分け合ったりすればいいのに
なんでも　戦争の原因になるんだね
English:
It’s a precious resource. Why can’t they just 
get along and share it with one another?
Everything’s always a reason for war...

Japanese:
でも　戦争のおかげで
いろんな技術が　発達するのも
事実だよ
English:
As sad as that may be, we cannot deny that war
also causes rapid advancements in technology.

Japanese:
うん…　それはわかってる
歴史で習ったから…
でも　やっぱり悲しいよ
English:
I know. I learned about it in history class... 
But it’s still sad...

Japanese:
ふふ…　わかっていても　悲しいか…
そういう　キミだから　みんなは
一緒に旅を　続けられるんだろうね
English:
So it still saddens you, despite knowing the benefits... 
that innocence is why everyone travels alongside you.

Japanese:
さすが　リカルドさん
なんでも　知ってるんだね
English: You sure do know everything, Ricardo!

Japanese:
特別　勉強したわけじゃないんだがな
傭兵をやっていると
自然と　この手の知識も増えるものだ
English:
It’s not knowledge I gained through studying, though. 
It’s just knowledge that I’ve gathered during my time 
as a mercenary.

Japanese:
旅慣れた人が　ひとりいると
いろいろ　助かるね
English:
Having someone who is well-travelled 
is a great help in many ways.

Japanese:
フン…　まあ　この手の知識も
アンジュの支払う　代金に
含まれていると　思ってくれ
English:
Hmph... This sort of information was 
included with Ange’s payment, that’s all.

Japanese: リカルドと仲悪い？
English: A Bad Relationship with Ricardo?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
ねえ　コンウェイって
ときどき　リカルドと仲悪いよね
キライなの？
English:
Say Kongwei, your relationship
with Ricardo seems bad. 
Do you perhaps hate him?

Japanese:
そんなストレートな質問…
キミは　ときどき
ビックリするくらい　無遠慮だな
English:
That is... very straightforward of you to ask that. 
It appears that you can be rude on occasion.

Japanese:
でも　なんだか
そんな風に見えるから
ちょっと心配で…
English:
But it seems that way for some
reason, so I was a bit worried...

Japanese:
そんなことないよ
逆に　あの人のことは
好きなくらいさ
English: I do not really hate him, I actually like him.

Japanese:
好き…
あれで？
English: Like him, how?

Japanese:
あの人　根がマジメだからね
つい　反応が面白くて
からかいたくなるのさ
English:
He is a very honest person.
I find his reactions very interesting.

Japanese: 賛成する
English: Agree

Japanese: 否定する
English: Disagree

Japanese:
コンウェイから見ると
そうなのかもね
English: If you say so, then maybe they are.

Japanese:
あの人　自分は　大人だって
宣言しちゃってるから
感情を　表に出さないようにしてさ
English:
That man tries to act mature most of the time,
so he finds it hard to express his real feelings.

Japanese:
特に　怒らないように
ガマンしてるときには
からかいたくなるんだよね　ふふ
English:
Especially when he tries to remain calm.
I just cannot help but tease him.

Japanese:
なんとなく　わかったよ
コンウェイって
見かけによらず　イジワルなんだ…
English:
I think I get it.
So you’re just teasing him...

Japanese:
そうかなぁ
僕には　よくわからないよ
English: Is that so? I don’t really get it.

Japanese:
あの人　自分は　大人だって
宣言しちゃってるから
感情を　表に出さないようにしてさ
English:
That man tries to act mature most of the time,
so he finds it hard to express his real feelings.

Japanese:
特に　怒らないように
ガマンしてるときには
からかいたくなるんだよね　ふふ
English:
Especially when he tries to remain calm.
I just cannot help but tease him.

Japanese:
見てる　こっちはハラハラするから
ああいうの
やめて欲しいんだけどなぁ
English:
I always get anxious when you do
that, so can you please cut it out?

Japanese: ヘソがピリピリ
English: My Bellybutton is Tingling

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
む～
ヘソが　ピリピリするんだな　しかし
English: Mmmmmm... My bellybutton is tingling!

Japanese:
それってゲートと
関係あるんだろうか…
ふむ…　面白いな
English:
What an interesting phenomena, perhaps
this has something to do with the
existence of a nearby gate...

Japanese:
コーダは　ときどき
危険が危ないと
ヘソがピリピリするんだな　しかし
English:
When Coda’s in danger,
Coda’s bellybutton tingles though!

Japanese:
へ～　コーダのおなかって
食事を　詰め込む以外にも
役に立つんだね
English:
Ohhh so your stomach’s useful for
something other than being filled up.

Japanese:
お！　ルカ　いいこと言う！
コーダの腹は　メシ以外にも
役に立つぞ　しかし！
English:
Oh! You’re right, Ruca! My stomach is useful
for something other than food!

Japanese:
どんな風になってるのか
今後のために
ちょっと　解剖させてよ
English:
I wonder how it works? 
May I start dissecting you at once?

Japanese:
おー！　カイボウか　しかし
いいぞ　しかし！
English: Oh! “Dissect?” Sure!

Japanese: 止める
English: Stop him

Japanese: 一緒に解剖する
English: Dissect him together

Japanese:
ええ！？　ホントに大丈夫なの！？
カイボウって　解剖のことでしょ
お腹切ったりする
English:
Huh!? Y-You’re fine with that?
It’s “dissection!” He’s going to open your stomach!

Japanese:
なに！？　コンウェイ
コーダのお腹切るつもりか　しかし！
ギャー！　この人殺し！
English:
What!? Kongwei is gonna open Coda’s
stomach though!? You human murderer!

Japanese: キミ　人じゃないじゃないか
English: But you are not a human in the first place.

Japanese:
ギャー！　このコーダ殺し！
た～す～け～て～　し～か～し～！
English:
You Coda murderer!! Save me～!!! 
HELP! ME! THOUGH!

Japanese:
そんなに　大騒ぎしなくてもいいだろ
ちょっとした　冗談だよ…
English: No need to make a racket, I was jesting.

Japanese:
ふふふ…　じゃあ　コーダ
ちょっと　そこに横になってよ
English: Okay, Coda, why don’t you lie down there?

Japanese: おー　任せろ　しかし！
English: Okay! Leave it to Coda though!

Japanese:
でも　解剖って
お腹切ったりするんだけど
本当に　大丈夫？
English:
Are you okay with it? Dissection
means that we will open up your stomach.

Japanese:
なに！？　ルカ
コーダのお腹切るつもりか　しかし！
ギャー！　この人殺し！
English:
What!? Ruca’s gonna cut my stomach
open though!? You human murderer!

Japanese: キミ　人じゃないじゃないか
English:
But you are not a human in the first place.
Only humans have rights, Coda.

Japanese:
ギャー！　このコーダ殺し！
た～す～け～て～　し～か～し～！
English:
You Coda murderer!! Save me～!!!
HELP! ME! THOUGH!

Japanese:
ちょっとした
冗談だよ　冗談
English: Hold on, we were just kidding.

Japanese:
へ～　ルカくんも
たまには　気のきいた冗談
言えるようになってきたんだね
English:
Hoho～ You sure have gotten better
at making witty jokes sometimes, Ruca.

Japanese:
…………たまにはって…
そうか　僕の評価って
まだまだ　そんなもんなんだ…
English: “Sometimes”... I guess I still have a long way to go.

Japanese: ゲートについて
English: About the Gate

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
ねえ　コンウェイ
あのゲートって
他にもあるものなの？
English:
Say, Kongwei, are there any more
gates other than this one?

Japanese:
さあ　どうだろうね
誰かが　専門的に調査したなんて話
聞いたことがないからなぁ
English:
Who knows? I am not really equipped to
talk about such a technical thing.

Japanese:
キミたちの旅が続けば　この先
見つけられることも　あるんじゃないかな
…どうかしたの？
English:
Perhaps we might be able to discover
something if we continue onwards-- 
Is something amiss?

Japanese: さらに問う
English: Ask more questions

Japanese: 納得する
English: Agree

Japanese:
あのとき
見えたもののことなんだけど…
English:
When we saw that thing before 
in the Forest of Sorrow...

Japanese:
あそこのこと
異界の入り口とかって　言ってたよね？
English:
You mentioned something about 
a gate opening, right?

Japanese:
ああ　そのことか…
あまり　不確かなことを話すのは
ボクの性に合わないんだけど…
English:
Ohh, That... I prefer not to speak of things 
I hardly understand, however...

Japanese:
ああいう場所は　ときおり
別の世界へ　すごく近づくことがあってね
それを仮に　異界の入り口と呼んでるわけ
English:
There are times when places like the Forest of Sorrow 
grow close to a different world. That is what I was
referring to back then.

Japanese:
あのときに　見えたのは
こことは別の世界の記憶と　言われてる
…まあ　知ってるのは　このくらいかな
English:
What you saw back there was 
a different world’s memory... 
That is what I know so far.

Japanese:
ふ～ん　別の世界か…
なるほどなぁ
English: A different world... I see...

Japanese:
ふぅ…
余計なこと　しゃべりすぎたかな
気をつけないと…
English:
I might have said something unnecessary... 
I will have to be more careful...

Japanese:
この先も　同じようなことがあると
大変かなって
ちょっと　思っただけ
English:
I was just worried that something like 
that might happen again...

Japanese:
大丈夫だよ　キミたちとともにいる以上
ボクは　キミたちを必ず助ける
だから　安心して
English:
It will be fine, if something like that happens again, 
I will be there to have your back.

Japanese:
ボクは　キミたちの旅が
続くことを
本当に　願っているから
English: After all, I just want you to continue your journey.

Japanese: 「ヘンな」の意味
English: Meaning of “Weird”

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
それにしても
ヘンな女　拾っちまったな
English:
We sure have gathered a lot 
of weird chicks in our party.

Japanese:
スパーダ
そういうこと言うの
止めなよ
English: Spada, can you please stop that?

Japanese:
スパーダくん　キミさ
彼女が　言葉よくわからないと思って
油断してるでしょ？
English:
Hey, Spada, are you not acting carelessly? 
Do you think QQ cannot understand you?

Japanese:
言っておくけど　彼女　しゃべるのが
苦手なだけで　キミの言ってること
ちゃんと理解してるよ　たぶん
English:
Let me just get this through. She might not 
be able to speak properly, but she can 
understand what you are saying.

Japanese:
…なに！？
そういうのは　早く言えよ！
English:
What the heck!? 
You should’ve told me that from the start!

Japanese: ごまかす
English: Cover Spada

Japanese: 謝る
English: Apologies

Japanese:
え…　え～と　あはは
スパーダの言った　ヘンなって言うのは
別にヘンな意味じゃなくて　あの…　その…
English:
Um... uhh... ahahaha... Spada really didn’t mean “weird” 
weird but rather... uh...

Japanese:
ほらスパーダって　ちょっと
言葉の使い方　よく知らないところがあって
悪い意味で　言ったんじゃないよ　ね？
English:
Spada doesn’t know what words mean, so he didn’t 
really mean for that to come off badly right, Spada?

Japanese:
…………
はい　わかた
ヘンなは　悪い意味じゃない
English: QQ understand, Spada didn’t mean to be bad.

Japanese:
ルカ　てめェ…
オレが言葉の使い方　知らないって
どういう意味だよ
English:
Ruca, you bastard, I don’t know what words mean!? 
What the hell are you implying?

Japanese:
しょうがないだろ
ヘンなこと言う　スパーダが
悪いんじゃないか
English:
It can’t be helped, alright? 
It’s your fault for saying she’s weird.

Japanese:
しかも　ルカくん
たぶん　今のじゃ
ごまかせてないと　思うよ…
English: And, I believe Ruca was covering for you just now.

Japanese:
あの　ごめんね　キュキュさん
スパーダの言った　ヘンなって言うのは
別に　悪い意味じゃないんだ
English:
I’m sorry, QQ, I don’t think Spada meant to come off as 
mean there.

Japanese:
キュキュさんとの出会いが
ちょっと　変わってたっていう程度の
意味だから　気にしないで
English:
I think he meant that his meeting with you was 
quite unusual, so please don’t mind it.

Japanese:
…………
はい　わかた
ヘンなは　悪い意味じゃない
English: QQ understand, Spada didn’t mean to be bad.

Japanese:
もう　せっかくキュキュさん
仲間になってくれたんだから
気をつけてよね
English:
Sigh... QQ’s already part of our group,
so you have to be careful from now on, Spada.

Japanese:
悪ぃ悪ぃ　どういうヤツか
まだ　よくわかんねェもんな
English:
Yeah, sorry. I just didn’t know 
what kinda person she was.

Japanese:
オレも　余計なこと言って
キズつけたりしたくねェからよ
気をつけるぜ
English:
I said something unnecessary 
and ended up hurting her... 
I’ll be careful, next time.

Japanese:
でも　彼女
スパーダくんに対しては
まだ全然　根に持ってると思うけどね
English: I believe she is still upset about it.

Japanese: キュキュの力
English: QQ’s Power

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
ねえ　コンウェイ
キュキュさんも
天術　使えないんだよね？
English:
Kongwei, QQ also can’t 
use Cielan Artes either, right?

Japanese:
ああ　もちろん
彼女も　転生者じゃないだろうから
English: Of course. She is not a Reincarnator, after all.

Japanese:
ふたりとも　天術を使えないのに
あんなに　強いんだ…
English:
You’re both so strong despite the fact that neither 
of you can use Cielan Artes...

Japanese:
えと…　もしかして
コンウェイの国の人って
みんな　ふたりみたいに強いの？
English: Could it be that your countrymen are also strong?

Japanese:
そんなことはないよ
強い人もいるし
そうじゃない人もいる
English:
Not really. There are strong ones 
and there are weak ones.

Japanese:
ただ　キミたちのように
どういう違いで　力の有無が分かれるのか
その理由は　ハッキリしてないね
English:
It is just that, like you, the difference between 
having and not having power is unclear.

Japanese:
ボクから見れば　転生者だから天術が使えると
ハッキリわかってる　キミたちの方が
奇妙に　感じるくらいだよ
English:
In my case, I clearly understand that Reincarnators 
can use Cielan Artes. They give off a different feeling.

Japanese: 適当に納得する
English: “I think I understand”

Japanese: 突っ込んでみる
English: Delve into the topic

Japanese:
ふ～ん　コンウェイにとっては
僕たちの方が　奇妙か…
English: Ohhh so, to you, we give off a different feeling, huh?

Japanese:
まあ　キミたちと　旅を続ければ
ボクや　キュキュの強さの理由も
わかるかもしれないけど…
English:
Well, you might come to understand our power 
as you travel alongside us.

Japanese:
ボクは　それには
あまり興味がないかな
English:
But I am not really interested 
in growing stronger though.

Japanese:
ボクにとっては
この力が　キミたちの役に立つ
それだけで　十分さ
English: I am satisfied as long as my power is of use to you.

Japanese:
僕たち転生者が　天術を使えることと
コンウェイと　キュキュさんが
強いことって　関係あるのかな？
English:
I wonder if our ability to use Cielan Artes has 
a relation to what you guys have?

Japanese:
さあ　どうだろうね
もしかすると　キミたちを深く調べれば
なにか　わかるかもしれないけど…
English:
I wonder? Perhaps you might discover something
if you were to delve a little bit more.

Japanese:
まあ　これ以上
推測で物を言っても　しょうがないから
この話は　止めにしようよ
English:
At any rate, any further conjecture will lead us
nowhere. Therefore, let’s leave it at that.

Japanese: キュキュの興味
English: QQ’s Curiosity

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
船　乗る
キュキュ　楽しみ！
English: Ship ride! QQ excited!

Japanese:
ほら
キュキュさん　気をつけないと
迷子になっちゃうよ
English:
Miss QQ, please be careful! 
You might end up getting lost!

Japanese:
でも　どうして　そんなに
船に乗るのが　楽しみなの？
English: But why are you so excited about riding a ship?

Japanese:
ここの船　どんな船か
見たい　知りたい
それ　キュキュの望み
English:
QQ want to know what kind of ships 
are here and what they are for!

Japanese:
キュキュ　いろんなこと知る
この国　たくさん見て回る
それが　キュキュの国の役に立つ
English:
QQ want to know about a lot of things! 
QQ wants to see a lot of things here 
too! It will be helpful for QQ’s country!

Japanese: 良かったと思う
English: I think that’s nice

Japanese: 変わってると思う
English: I think that’s strange

Japanese:
じゃあ　船に乗ることになって　良かったね
そんな風に　喜んでくれると
僕も　嬉しいよ
English:
I’m glad that you got to ride a ship! 
If you’re happy, then I’m also happy.

Japanese:
これから　旅を続ければ
もっともっと　いろんなものが
見られるんじゃないかな
English:
If you keep traveling with us, you might 
end up seeing a lot of things!

Japanese:
キュキュも　ルカたちと旅できて　うれしい
キュキュ　ルカたちの役に立つ
だから　ずといっしょ　いいか？
English:
QQ also happy to be traveling with Ruca! 
QQ’s gonna be helpful, so can QQ stay?

Japanese:
もちろん！
僕も　仲間が増えて
心強いよ
English: Of course! Having a lot of friends is reassuring!

Japanese:
いろんなものを　見て回ると
国の役に立つの…？
なんだか　変わってるね
English:
Seeing a lot of things will be helpful for your country? 
That’s quite a strange way of putting things.

Japanese:
変わてる…
キュキュ　ヘンか？
English: Strange... is QQ strange?

Japanese:
あ…　いや　そんなことないけど
国の役に立つっていうのが
よくわからなかっただけ
English:
Oh, no I didn’t mean that. I was just wondering 
how it’d be helpful for your country.

Japanese:
国の役に立つ　とても大事
それは　みんなの役に立つこと
English:
Helping country is important. That’s how 
everyone can be helpful.

Japanese:
だから　キュキュ
ルカたちと旅できて　うれしい
船　乗るも　うれしい　わかた？
English:
That’s why QQ happy traveling with Ruca. Riding 
ship also makes QQ happy! Understand?

Japanese:
うん
とにかく　僕たちとの旅を
喜んでくれてるのは　よくわかったよ
English:
I understand that you’re at least 
happy that you’re with us.

Japanese: 戦艦とキュキュ
English: QQ and the Battleship

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: 大きな戦う船　すごい…
English: A huge fighting ship! Amazing!

Japanese:
キュキュ
この船に興味があるのは　わかるけど
今は　先を急ごう
English:
QQ, I know you are interested in ships, 
but we are in a hurry here.

Japanese:
…はい　わかた
でも　少し残念…
English: QQ understand. But it’s still a bit sad...

Japanese: キュキュの肩を持つ
English: Take QQ’s side

Japanese: コンウェイの肩を持つ
English: Take Kongwei’s side

Japanese:
牢から出られたのは
キュキュさんの　おかげだし
ちょっとくらいなら…
English:
It’s thanks to Miss QQ that we managed to 
get out of that cell so can she at least...

Japanese:
いや…
キュキュには　悪いけど
今は逃げるのが　先決だよ
English: No. Sorry, QQ, but we have to escape from here first.

Japanese:
ありがと　ルカ　でも　いい
今は逃げる　大事
それくらい　キュキュでも　わかる
English:
Thank you, Ruca, but QQ’s fine. Running away, 
important. That, QQ at least understands.

Japanese:
ほら　ルカくん
キュキュも　こう言ってることだし
今は　先を急ごう
English: See, QQ said so herself. Let us make haste.

Japanese:
命があれば
キュキュにも　また船を
見学する　機会くらいあるさ
English:
If we manage to survive here, QQ might be able to see 
more ships.

Japanese:
キュキュさんには　悪いけど
今は　早くこの船から逃げないと…
English: I’m sorry, Miss QQ, but we have to get out of here...

Japanese:
そうだね
ほら　ルカくんも　こう言ってることだし
先を急ごう　キュキュ
English: Ruca is correct. Let us make haste, QQ!

Japanese:
はい　わかた
今は　逃げる大事
それくらい　キュキュでも　わかる
English:
Understood. Now, running away important. 
That, QQ at least understands.

Japanese:
…でも　やぱり
ちょと残念…
English: But... It’s still a bit sad...

Japanese: イリアの頭痛
English: Illia’s Headaches

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
ねえ　イリア　頭が痛いのは
良くなった？
English: Illia, did your headaches stop?

Japanese:
ああ　うん　今は全然平気
…なんだろ
ここは気候が　いいせいかしらね
English:
Oh, yeah, I’m completely fine... 
I wonder if it’s coz of the climate?

Japanese:
まあ　暑すぎるから
気候がいいのも
逆に迷惑って　話だけどさ
English:
Well, moving from a super hot climate to
a nice one is the opposite of annoying.

Japanese:
やっぱり　南育ちのイリアには
このくらいの暑さが
ちょうど　いいのかしらね
English:
Oh right, since you grew up in the southwest, 
I suppose this is just the right amount of heat for you.

Japanese: 冗談を言う
English: Joke

Japanese: 心配する
English: Worry

Japanese:
じゃあ　イリアのかんしゃくも
しばらくは　聞かないで済むね！
English:
Then that means that we won’t have to listen to your 
tantrums for a while, Illia. Isn’t that nice?

Japanese:
ルカくん…
せっかく　そのかんしゃくを
聞かないで　済むはずだったのに…
English: You did not have to bring that up, Ruca.

Japanese:
どうしても　あたしの怒鳴り声が
聞きたいみたいねぇ
ル～カ～！
English:
Well, I suppose Ruca does love listening to my angry 
voice, doesn’t he～?

Japanese:
……ハッ！　わわわ！
久しぶりに　調子に乗りました！
ごめんなさい！
English:
Oh crap! Oh crap! it’s been a while since I got carried 
away, I’m sorry!

Japanese:
でも　だからって
ムリはダメだよ　イリア
English: That doesn’t mean that you should push yourself, Illia.

Japanese:
そうね
頭痛の次は　暑さで参ったりしないよう
気をつけてね
English:
He is correct, you have to take care 
and not faint from the heat next time.

Japanese:
わかったわよ　ふたりとも
病弱キャラだと思われるのも　しゃくだし
気をつけますよ～だ
English:
Fine, fine I get it, you-two-who-think-I’m-weak-and-feeble. 
I’m gonna be careful now.

Japanese: 幸せの体
English: The Body of Happiness

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
アンジュ　気にする
ダイエット　なにか？
English: Curious about Ange, what’s a “diet?”

Japanese:
あ～
アンジュの　ダイエットのことか
English: Oh, you’re talking about Ange’s diet obsession, huh?

Japanese:
う～ん　ちょっとアンジュは
自分の体重を　気にしててね
もう少しやせた方が　いいかなって
English:
She’s been worried about her figure lately, you see.
Like if she should slim down a bit and the like.

Japanese:
アンジュ　体　重いか？
キュキュ　そう思わない
English:
Is Ange heavy?
QQ don’t think so.

Japanese:
気のせいかしらね
またなにか　不穏当な会話が　行われてる
気がしたんだけど…
English:
Am I imagining things or did I just hear you
two having an inappropriate discussion?

Japanese:
え？　あ…　いや
そういうわけじゃなくて…
English:
Huh? What?
Oh, it’s not that...

Japanese:
キュキュ　思う
アンジュ　今がいい
やせる　良くない
English:
QQ think that Ange’s fine now.
No need to slim.

Japanese:
…え？　そ…　そうかしら
でも　やっぱり
もう少しくらいは…
English:
H-Huh? Is that so...?
But if only I were a bit...

Japanese: キュキュに同意する
English: Agree with QQ

Japanese: アンジュに同意する
English: Agree with Ange

Japanese:
キュキュさんの　言う通りだよ
アンジュは　体重のこと
気にしすぎなんだってば
English: As QQ said, you don’t have to worry about your figure.

Japanese:
キュキュは　思う
アンジュの体　幸せの体　うらやましい
食べる　幸せ　大事
English:
QQ thinks Ange’s body is body of happiness.
QQ jealous. 
Eating important.

Japanese: キュキュの言うこと　わかるか？
English: Do you understand QQ?

Japanese:
…………うん　そうね
食べ物があることは
なによりの　幸せだものね
English:
You are right, I am just happy as long 
as we have food.

Japanese:
そうそう　だから
ムリに　ダイエットなんてしなくても…
English:
Right, that’s why you don’t
have to force yourself to diet.

Japanese:
う～ん
でも　それとこれとは
やっぱり　話が別なのよねぇ
English:
Hmm... but this and that are not really the same thing, 
are they?

Japanese:
キュキュは　アンジュの体なりたい
アンジュ　幸せの体
やせる　良くない…
English:
QQ want to have Ange’s body.
Ange’s body is body of happiness.
No need to slim.

Japanese:
そうだね
そんなに　気になるんなら
少し　気をつけた方がいいかもね
English:
You’re right. If you’re worried about it,
you should be a bit more careful.

Japanese:
う～ん
そうよねぇ…
English: Hmm... I suppose...

Japanese:
でも　キュキュは　思う
アンジュの体　幸せの体　うらやましい
食べる　幸せ　大事
English:
QQ think Ange’s body is body of happiness.
QQ jealous. Eating important.

Japanese: キュキュの言うこと　わかるか？
English: Do you understand QQ?

Japanese:
う～ん　わかるんだけど
でも　それとこれとは
やっぱり　話が別なのよねぇ
English:
Hmm... I understand what you are getting at,
but this and that are not really the same thing, 
are they?

Japanese:
キュキュは　アンジュの体なりたい
アンジュ　幸せの体
どして　やせるか…　わからん
English:
QQ jealous of Ange’s body.
Ange’s body is body of happiness.
No need to slim.

Japanese: アンジュの主義
English: Ange’s Principle

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
ねえ　アンジュ
前から聞きたかったんだけど
マティウスって　教団の大主天でしょ
English:
Hey, Ange, I’ve been meaning to ask this for a while
now, but isn’t Mattheus a Great Cielan or whatever?

Japanese:
それなのに　アンジュは
あたしたちと　一緒にいて
本当に　いいの？
English: Are you fine having to travel with us?

Japanese:
う～ん…　それについては
私の中でも　完全に答えが
出てるわけではないのよね
English:
I... cannot really give a complete answer 
to your question.

Japanese:
ただ　今の教団のやり方には　納得できないし
私を助けてくれた　あなたたちを
信じてる…　そういうことかな
English:
As of now, I cannot support the Church’s actions. 
The only ones whom I can believe in are the
ones who saved me, you all.

Japanese: 問いかける
English: Ask her a Question

Japanese: 感謝する
English: Thank her

Japanese:
じゃあ　場合によっては
アンジュが　僕たちの元を離れて
教団の方に　戻ることもあるってこと？
English:
Then does that mean that you’ll turn back to the
Church depending on the situation?

Japanese:
なに縁起でもないこと
言ってるのよ　ルカ！
English: What the hell are you talking about, Ruca?

Japanese:
そうね
そういうことも　あるのかもしれない
English: You are correct... That might happen, yes.

Japanese:
ちょっと　ちょっと
アンジュまで　止めてよね！
English: You cut that out too, Ange.

Japanese:
未来のことなんて　誰にもわからないもの
だから私は　私の信じる道を行く
今は　それしか言えないわ
English:
No one knows what the future holds, after all. That is
why, for now, I shall walk on the path I believe in.

Japanese:
助けてくれただなんて…
僕たちの方こそ　アンジュが一緒で
ありがたいことばかりだよ
English:
Just because we saved you... Thank you, Ange, for 
coming with us.

Japanese:
そうそう　その通りよ
ルカも　たまには
いいこと言うじゃん！
English: Right, exactly. What Ruca said.

Japanese:
ルカくんも　イリアも　そしてみんなも
そういう風に　思ってくれてるのが
私には　わかるもの
English: I know... I know everyone thinks so...

Japanese:
だから　私も　あなたたちを信じてる
今　私がみんなと　一緒にいる理由は
それで　十分ね
English:
That is why I shall also believe in you guys. 
Right now, that reason is enough for me 
to keep on going with you.

Japanese: イリアの本気度
English: Illia’s Commitment

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
それにしてもさ
イリアが　学校の先生になりたいなんて
ちょっと　ビックリしたなぁ
English:
Still, I never thought that you dreamt
of becoming a teacher.

Japanese:
はあ？　なに言ってんの？
あたし　そんなこと言ってないわよ
English:
What the heck are you talking about!?
I never said such a thing!

Japanese:
はあ？　なに言ってるの？
言ってたよ
学校作って　先生になりたいって
English:
What the heck are YOU saying? You totally did!
You said that you wanted to build
a school and become a teacher!

Japanese:
バカねぇ
あたしは　学校作って
「校長」先生になりたいの
English:
Oh, you dummy. I want to build a school
and become a headmaster.

Japanese:
それで　生徒のみんなと
給食を食べたり　休み時間に
一緒に　遊んだりするのよ
English:
And I’ll feed the school’s students and
play with them during their lunch break.

Japanese:
えっと…　じゃあ
誰が授業するの？
English: So... who’ll teach?

Japanese:
決まってんでしょ
授業のできる人を探して
その人に　やってもらうの
English:
Ain’t that obvious?
I’ll just hire one.

Japanese: 応援する
English: Cheer

Japanese: あきれる
English: Be Perplexed

Japanese:
う…　うん
そうなんだ…
僕　応援するよ…
English:
O-Oh... of course.
I’ll be cheering you on!

Japanese:
応援なんていらないから
あたしが　学校作ったら
教師として　雇われちゃいなさいよ
English:
I don’t need you cheering me on,
I want to hire you as a teacher when
it’s finally up.

Japanese:
ええ～…
イリアが校長先生の　学校なんて
なにさせられるか　わかんない…
English:
Huh...? I don’t get it.
Why do you even want to build
a school in the first place?

Japanese: うん？　なんか言った？
English: Got something you wanna tell me?

Japanese:
あ～　あはは
イリアが校長先生の　学校なんて
なんだか　楽しそうだなって
English:
Hahaha... I’m looking forward
to the school you’ll build,
Headmaster Illia.

Japanese:
でしょう？
楽しみにしてなさいよね！
English: Haha, you better!

Japanese:
今の話　本物の校長先生が聞いたら
絶対　怒ると思うよ…
English:
I think an actual headmaster will
get mad if they heard that though...

Japanese:
どうしてよ
得意な分野を　伸ばすのが
あたしの方針なのに
English:
Why?
I’m always looking for ways
to improve my strengths.

Japanese:
授業のできる人は　授業をするし
給食を食べたり　子どもと遊ぶのが
得意なあたしは　校長先生
English:
People who are good at teaching will teach,
kids will be eating and playing,
and I’ll be the headmaster.

Japanese: どこも　おかしくないでしょ
English: It’s not weird at all, okay?

Japanese:
イリアって　学校のこと
いろいろ　誤解してると思うな…
English:
I think you’re misunderstanding
what a school is supposed to be.

Japanese: センサスとラティオ
English: Sensus and Ratio

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
それにしても　ラティオの連中って
ホント　センサスのことがキライなんだな
死んでまで　憎んでるなんてよ
English:
Still, those Ratio fellas sure hate Sensus, huh?
Even though they’re already dead.

Japanese:
そうね…　ラティオは
生真面目な人ばかりだったから
English:
Those from Ratio are overly-honorable
people, after all.

Japanese:
うん？
なんで　生真面目なヤツばっかだと
センサスを嫌うんだ？
English: Hm? Why do they hate Sensus then?

Japanese:
センサスの人たちは　戦争を
スポーツか　ゲームの一種くらいに
考えてた節があるから…
English:
You see, it is because Sensus viewed
war as merely a sport or a game...

Japanese:
それが　ラティオの人たちには
許せなかったのね
English:
Which is something that Ratio
cannot fogive.

Japanese:
ええ…！？
そうだったんだ…
English: Huh!? So that’s why...

Japanese:
少なくとも　ラティオの人たちは
そういう風に　センサスを
見ていたの
English: At the very least, that is how Sensus was percieved.

Japanese: ショックを受ける
English: Get shocked

Japanese: あきれる
English: Be disgusted

Japanese:
戦争が　スポーツだなんて
僕には　ちょっと信じられないよ…
English:
I find it hard to believe that Sensus
thought of war that way...

Japanese:
でもよ　天上界で
何千年も　生きてると
そうなっちまうヤツもいたのかもな
English:
But, y’know, maybe that’s what spending
millenia in Cielo does to you.

Japanese:
戦争が　スポーツか…
センサスの人たちは
命を　なんだと思ってたんだろ
English:
Warfare as mere sports...
What did Sensus think lives
are in the first place anyway?

Japanese:
そうだよなぁ
でもよ　今のオレたちの尺度で
天上界の連中を　見ちゃいけねェのかもな
English:
That’s true, but maybe we shouldn’t judge
Sensus based on our standards.

Japanese:
天上界で　何千年も生きてると
命の意味なんて
オレたちとは　違うだろうしよ
English:
After spending millenia in Cielo, their own
meaning of “life” must be pretty different.

Japanese:
負ければ　地上送りだったはずだから
センサスなりに
真剣に戦っていたとは　思うんだけど…
English:
Since they would get sent to Terro if they lost,
I would like to believe that Sensus was fighting
earnestly in their own way.

Japanese:
それでも　やっぱりラティオから見れば
力の誇示や　戦うこと自体が
目的だったように　見えたのね
English:
Still, from Ratio’s point of view, Sensus fought
as a means of showing off their power.

Japanese:
それは　ラティオの人たちにとっては
ガマンできないことだったのよ
English:
That is why those from Ratio
could not help but feel that way.

Japanese: アスラの親不孝
English: Asura’s Disobedience

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
確かにアスラは　天上界の戦争を終わらせた
ええ子やったけど　ヴリトラにとっては
親不孝もんでもあったんやで
English:
It’s true that Asura did end the
war in Cielo but, ta Vritra, he’s
nothin’ but a disobedient young’n.

Japanese:
え…
どういうこと？
English: Really? How so?

Japanese:
そらそうやん
親より先に　死ぬ子があるかいな
English:
Ain’t that obvious?
What kinda child is lookin’ ta
die before his parent does?

Japanese:
アスラに　先立たれて
ひとり残った　ヴリトラが
どんだけ　寂しかったか
English:
Vritra must’ve been awfully lonely
when Asura left ’fore she did.

Japanese: あやまる
English: Apologize

Japanese: 感謝する
English: Thank her

Japanese:
そうだね…
ごめん
English: Oh... sorry.

Japanese:
あ～　ウチの方こそ　カンニンやで！
そんなん　今さら言うたって
しゃあないのになぁ
English:
Oh! Ah should be the one doin’ that.
It was mah fault fer bringin’ it up.

Japanese:
そんな顔されたら
ウチ　自己嫌悪やわ
ルカ兄ちゃんと　アスラは違うのに…
English:
Now don’tchu make that face,
yer makin’ me feel bad.
Yer different from Asura...

Japanese:
ううん　それだけ　エルが…
ヴリトラが　アスラのこと
大切に　思ってくれてたってことだから
English:
But that’s how much Hermie--
Vritra cared about Asura.

Japanese:
その想いが聞けて　嬉しかったよ
だから　気にしないで
English:
I’m happy that you expressed her
feelings to me. That’s why, don’t
worry about it.

Japanese:
さすが　ルカ兄ちゃん
ええこと言うわ
English:
As expected of Ruca Bro,
ya sure are nice.

Japanese:
ヴリトラは　アスラのこと
本当に　大切に思ってくれてたんだね
English: Vritra really cared a lot about Asura, didn’t she?

Japanese:
そやから　ルカ兄ちゃんは
体　大事にしたってや
転生しても　親不孝なんてカンニンやで
English:
That’s why ya gotta take good care of yerself,
Ruca Bro. Ah won’t forgive ya that easily if ya
don’ jus’ cause ya been reincarnated.

Japanese: アンジュ食いしん坊
English: Ange the Glutton

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
アンジュ　食いしんぼ一番
でも　キュキュ　思う
みんな　食べる　好き
English:
Ange biggest eater, but QQ also
thinks everyone likes eating.

Japanese:
そ…　そうよね！
私が一番…　かもしれないけど
みんなだって　食いしん坊よね！
English:
Y-You are correct! I might be the biggest eater,
but I also believe everyone eats a lot as well!

Japanese:
エル　イリア　コーダ
みんな　だいたい　いっしょ
あ～　これ　なんて言うか？
English:
Hermie, Illia, Coda, everyone are...
uhhh what word?

Japanese:
…………
どっこい　どっこい？
English: Hm... same-y same same?

Japanese: 肯定する
English: Affirm

Japanese: 否定する
English: Refute

Japanese:
そうだよね
食いしん坊なのは
アンジュだけじゃないよね
English: You’re right, Ange’s not the only glutton here.

Japanese:
それに　キュキュ　思う
食いしんぼ　いいこと
たくさん食べる　悪くない
English:
But QQ thinks eating a lot good.
Not bad at all.

Japanese:
そ…　そうよね！
キュキュさんとは
改めて　仲良くやっていけそう！
English: Amen to that! Let us get along more, Miss QQ!

Japanese:
でも　食べすぎ　ダメ
アンジュ　わかた？
English:
But eating too much bad.
Understand, Ange?

Japanese:
は…　はい
食べすぎ　ダメ…
アンジュ　わかた…
English:
Y-Yes... Eating too much bad...
Ange understands...

Japanese:
でも　僕も　アンジュが
一番の食いしん坊だと　思うなぁ
English: But I still think that Ange’s the biggest eater.

Japanese: う…　やっぱり？
English: Aww... you really think so?

Japanese:
でも　キュキュ　思う
食いしんぼ　いいこと
たくさん食べる　悪くない
English:
But QQ thinks eating a lot good.
Not bad at all.

Japanese:
でも　食べすぎは
良くないわよね…
English: But eating too much is unhealthy, right?

Japanese:
そう！　アンジュ　えらい
食べすぎ　ダメ
アンジュ　わかてるから　だいじょぶ
English:
Yes! Good Ange! Eating too much bad.
As long as Ange knows.

Japanese:
…それにしても　キュキュさん
どっこい　どっこいなんて
ヘンな言葉　知ってるなぁ
English:
“Same-y same same?”
QQ sure knows some strange words

Japanese: アルベールの目的は？
English: What is Albert Planning?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
それにしても　あのアルベールって野郎
アンジュを連れてって
一体　なにをするつもりなんだ？
English:
That Albert... What’s he planning to
do by taking Ange with him?

Japanese:
そんなの
どうせ　ロクでもないことに
決まってるわよ
English:
That... He’s definitely planning
something really bad!

Japanese:
そうや　そうや
ウチらから　アンジュ姉ちゃん
連れてくようなヤツやで
English:
Yeah!
He’s the one who took
Sis Ange from us after all!

Japanese:
なんぞ　悪いこと
企んどるに　決まってるで
English: He’s definitely plannin’ lotsa bad stuff!

Japanese:
アンジュの態度も　おかしかったし
ただ　前世の因縁だけで
連れて行ったわけじゃないのかも…
English:
Ange was acting strange back there.
I’m sure there’s more to this than
meets the eye.

Japanese:
…………
今は　これ以上考えても
仕方あるまい
English:
...
There’s no point thinking
about it at this moment...

Japanese:
そうだね
今はアンジュを　取り返すことだけ
考えなきゃ…
English:
You’re right, we have to think about
how we can get Ange back...

English: How can that “archaeologist” easily open a jail cell?

Japanese:
さあ　人類学者や　考古学者のたぐいは
研究資料とか　新発見と称して
いろんな物を　持ち出すクセがあるからね
English:
Who knows? Archaeologists and anthropologists 
are the type to dig up artifacts and call them new 
discoveries, after all.

Japanese:
それで　身についたんじゃない？
彼女も適当に　そのへんの物
くすねてるかもしれないよ
English:
Maybe that is how she learned it? It might have 
been because she swipes stuff at random.

Japanese: あはは
English: Hahaha.

Japanese:
それって
泥棒って　言わねェか…？
English: Isn’t she just a thief then...?

Japanese: 自称考古学者(訳)
English: Self-Proclaimed Archaeologist

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
ねえ　キュキュさんって
僕たちと　一緒に来て
どうするつもりなの？
English: Hey, QQ, why did you decide to come with us?

Japanese:
キュキュ　この国　たくさん見たい
たくさん知りたい
それだけ
English:
QQ wants to know and wants
to see a lot about this country!

Japanese:
人　生きる　暮らす
いろいろいる　それ知りたい
あ～…　わかるか？
English:
Lot’s of people living and getting a lot.
QQ want to know about them!
Do you understand?

Japanese:
う～ん　ごめんね
ちょっと　よくわからないや
English: Sorry... not really.

Japanese:
どうも　彼女は　この国での
人の生活や　暮らしに
興味があるみたいだね
English:
It appears that she is interested in
how the people of this country live.

Japanese:
まあ　キミたちの言葉でいう　人類学者か
古い物にも　興味があるなら
考古学者あたりの卵　なんじゃないかな？
English:
Based on what you said, she sounds like an
“anthropologist”, but if she has interest in older
things, then would “archaeologist” not be more apt?

Japanese: あ～　コウコ　ガクシャ？
English: Arkay- yologist?

Japanese:
面倒だから
そういうことにしてくれないか？
English:
It would be a pain to explain, 
so can you just play along?

Japanese:
それなら
いろいろ　見て回っても
怪しまれないから
English:
If you do, no one will find it strange if
you start wandering off somewhere.

Japanese:
…………はい　わかた
キュキュ
コウコ　ガクシャ！
English: Okay, got it! QQ is Arkay- yologist!

Japanese:
だから　この国
たくさん見たい　知りたい
English: That’s why QQ want to know a lot about this world!

Japanese:
ふ～ん
考古学者かぁ…
English: Ohhh... an archaeologist, huh?

Japanese:
まあ彼女が　そう言ってるだけだし
実際は　旅行者に
毛が生えた程度かもしれないけどね
English:
It is what she claims she is, but a “traveller” is
something of a more apt description.

Japanese:
フン…　学者か
これはまた　ずいぶん物騒な
学者もいたもんだ…
English:
An “archaeologist”, huh...
What dangerous “scholars” we have here...

Japanese: アスラの剣技
English: Asura’s Swordsmanship

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
それにしてもよ
ルカが　あのアスラだなんて
ホント　不思議だよなァ
English: It’s freaking weird to think you used to be Asura.

Japanese:
自分でも　そう思うよ…
アスラは　勇猛で豪胆で
僕と　まるで正反対だもんね
English:
I think so too. Asura’s brave and daring. 
Exactly the opposite of me.

Japanese:
でもよォ　やっぱアスラの太刀筋は
オレの魂に　刻み込まれてんだな
ちゃんと憶えてたもん　おまえの太刀筋
English:
But you have his swordsmanship. I know it because it’s 
etched into my soul.

Japanese:
デュランダルは　アスラを信頼してた
身を委ねるに　相応しい持ち主だってな
English:
Durandal trusted Asura to the extent that he entrusted 
himself to him.

Japanese:
ふ～ん　アスラって
すごい人だったんだね
English: Asura’s a really amazing person!

Japanese:
人ごとみたいに言うなよ
おまえのことだろ
つっても　まあ前世の話だけどよ
English:
Don’t say that as if he’s someone else. 
He’s you. Though, it’s more like he’s your past life.

Japanese:
そう言われてもさ…
僕　腕に全然自信ないもの
English:
So you say... I’m not really confident about my 
swordsmanship though.

Japanese:
アスラと　おまえは違うけど
オレは　おまえのことも
キライにはなれそうもねェ
English:
You and Asura might be completely different,
but I can’t bring myself to hate you.

Japanese:
だから　おまえは　おまえで
これから　腕磨いていきゃあ
いいんじゃねーかな
English:
That’s why you just gotta be yourself!
From now on, you’ve gotta work on 
polishing your skills.

Japanese:
そうだね　うん
ありがとう　スパーダ
English: You’re right! Thank you, Spada.

Japanese: そうできればいいんだけど
English:
It would be better if I could become 
as strong as him, though.

Japanese: 成果を問う
English: An Inquiry About the Outcome

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
そういえば　ルカ
ヒュプノスが　死に際に言った言葉
憶えているか？
English:
Hey Ruca, do you still remember 
what Hypnos said back then?

Japanese:
えーっと…　確かヒュプノスは
「アスラ…　貴様の首尾の如何
　問うてくれようぞ」って言ってたっけ？
English:
I think so... I think it was:
“I shall judge the consequences 
of your deeds myself.”

Japanese: そうだ
English: Indeed.

Japanese: 自問する
English: Ponder

Japanese: 思うところを言う
English: Speak your mind

Japanese:
どうだろう…
アスラは　なにかを果たせたのかな？
English:
I wonder... What did Asura manage
to accomplish, anyway?

Japanese:
思い出せていないのか
それとも　アスラは　なにも成すことが
できなかったのか？
English:
You don’t remember, huh? Either that
or Asura was unable to achieve what 
he wanted to do...

Japanese:
なにかを　成し遂げられたとは思えないよ
だって　天上界の統一は果たせたけど
結局　消滅しちゃったし…
English:
I don’t think I’ve managed to accomplish
anything. Even if I did manage to unify
Cielo, everything still got destroyed.

Japanese:
まだ　すべてを
思い出せたわけではあるまい
English:
We still haven’t remembered
enough to come to a conclusion.

Japanese:
これから　ルカ自身を見て
アスラが　なにを成し遂げられたのか
俺が　判断させてもらおう
English:
From now on, you shall have to observe
it, yourself, and be the judge of what 
Asura has managed to accomplish.

Japanese:
アスラのしたことって
戦争を　終わらせたくらいかな
でも　それになんの意味が…
English:
Asura did manage to end the war,
but I wonder if that even ma--

Japanese:
いや　戦を終わらせるということは
それだけで　偉業なのだ
English:
Just the mere fact that he was able to
end the war is great enough as it is.

Japanese: そ…　そうかな
English: I-Is it?

Japanese:
戦が終われば　死ぬはずだった兵が生きのび
子を産み育て　田畑を耕すこともできよう
English:
By ending the war, the soldiers who were
supposed to die are able to raise their
children and cultivate the land.

Japanese:
それだけで　国は栄える
アスラは　民の繁栄の礎を築いたのだ
結果的に滅んでしまったことは　残念だがな
English:
With that, Asura had laid a foundation of
prosperity for a country. It is a shame that
all of it got destroyed.

Japanese:
僕　アスラが繁栄させた天上界を
見てみたかったなぁ
English: I wish I could’ve seen a flourishing Cielo.

Japanese: ヴリトラの孤独
English: Solitary Vritra

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: …なあ　アンジュ姉ちゃん
English: Say, Sis Ange...

Japanese: なぁに　エル？
English: What is it, Hermie?

Japanese: …抱っこ
English: Huggies...

Japanese:
はいはい
おいで　エル
English: Very well, Hermie, come here...

Japanese: 急にどうしちゃったの？
English: Why a hug all of a sudden?

Japanese:
なんかな　ウチ　ときどき
急に　ひとりぼっちな感じになんねん
English: Sumtimes, Ah suddenly feel lonely fer no reason.

Japanese:
ひとりぼっち？
大丈夫よ
みんな　そばにいるから
English: It is going to be fine, Hermie, everyone is right here.

Japanese:
あのときの感じ　思い出すねん
天上界が滅んで　だーれもおらんかったとき
ヴリトラひとりが　生き残っとったのを…
English:
Ah remember how Ah felt when Cielo got destroyed 
an’ Vritra lived the rest of her life alone...

Japanese:
ヴリトラの不死身の体が　アダになってなぁ
死ぬに　死なれへんかったんや
あのときばっかりは　自分を恨んどったわぁ
English:
Since Vritra’s immortal, it was impossible 
fer her ta die as she wished so she spent 
the rest of her time hatin’ herself.

Japanese: エル…
English: Hermie...

Japanese:
強いのんは
ええことばっかりでもないんやで
English:
Ah’m strong. Even if everythin’ 
ain’t good, Ah’ll be strong.

Japanese:
抱っこなら　いつでもしてあげる
甘えられるときにウンと
甘えておかないと　損するわよ？
English:
Hermie, remember to come to me if you ever 
need a hug. You need to be spoiled when 
you can before it’s too late, you know?

Japanese:
思い出だけが　ヴリトラの財産やった
不死身の体で　ひとりで生きとっても
思い出があったら　生きていけんねん…
English:
Memories were her only treasure so even if she 
lived alone, she can never escape her memories...

Japanese:
あなたの思い出は
これからも　たくさんできるのよ
English:
From now on, you shall be able 
to make many more memories.

Japanese: そうやなぁ
English: Yer right!

Japanese:
このおっぱいの感触は
そうそう　忘れられへんなぁ
English: Ah’ll never forget the feelin’ of these boobies.

Japanese:
ねえ　エル
どうせなら　もっと他のことを
憶えておいて　欲しいんだけど…
English:
Hermie, I would prefer it if you
remember something else...

Japanese: バルカンについて
English: About Vulcan

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
確か　デュランダルは
鍛冶の神バルカンの
最後の作品だったのよね
English:
If I recall correctly, Durandal is Vulcan’s 
last piece of work, correct?

Japanese: 作品ねェ
English: Not a piece of work.

Japanese:
あ…　ごめんなさい
気を悪くしちゃった？
じゃあ　息子…　かな？
English: Oh, sorry... Then, “son?”

Japanese:
気にしないでいいよ
そもそも　オレとバルカンは
親子と呼ぶにも　微妙な関係だったしな
English:
Don’t worry about it. In the first place, my relationship 
with Vulcan is more complex than with a parent 
and their kid.

Japanese: なによ　微妙な関係って
English: “Complex”? How so?

Japanese:
さっさと　納品されたから
一緒にいたのは　短い間だったんだよ
English:
The time I spent with him wasn’t that 
long before I got shipped out.

Japanese:
だから　オレ　バルカンについちゃ
ほとんど　なんにも知らねーんだ
English: That’s why I don’t really know much about him.

Japanese:
鍛冶の神バルカンはね
風変わりで　頑固な人だったみたいよ
English:
Ohhh... Apparently Vulcan was quite a strange and 
stubborn person.

Japanese: 職人気質ってヤツね
English: He’s someone who has a lot of pride in his craft.

Japanese:
私の前世　オリフィエルもね
バルカンに　武器を作ってって
頼んで断られたのよ
English:
In my life as Orifiel, I had once asked him to 
make me a weapon but was refused.

Japanese:
バルカンって　自分が
気の向いたときにだけ　武器を作って
使い手に　嫁がせていたんだって
English:
Vulcan will only make a weapon 
for someone on a whim.

Japanese: ふええ　それで商売になるの？
English: Is that even how you do business?

Japanese:
バルカンの　生み出す武器は
すべての武人たちの　憧れだったのよ
その武器を巡って　争いが起きるほどにね
English:
You see, those who held the weapons that Vulcan 
created were all great warriors. So much so that
there were conflicts over the weapons themselves.

Japanese:
そして　デュランダルを最後に
もう武器は　作らなくなったんだって
English:
And Durandal was apparently 
the last weapon that he created.

Japanese:
え…
どうして？
English: Huh? Why so?

Japanese:
作品たちが　争い合ったり
作品たちを巡って　争いが起きたりするのが
イヤになったのよ
English:
He started to hate the strife that the weapons brought 
alongside them. To sum it up, he got sick of it.

Japanese:
ああ　そうかもな
確かに　バルカンは
戦争を　苦々しく思っていた
English:
Ohh so that’s why... I’d gotten the impression 
that Vulcan was a pacifist.

Japanese:
戦争嫌いなのに　武器職人だなんて
なんかヘンなの
English:
Isn’t it weird that he hates war despite being 
a blacksmith?

Japanese:
そうね　でもバルカンは
自分の子どもを愛する
情の深い人には　違いなかったと思うわ
English:
Indeed, but I believe he is a kindhearted person 
who cared a lot about his children.

Japanese:
だってさ♪
あんた　愛されてたんじゃん！
