English: See? He loves you!

Japanese: へッ　うっせェよ…
English: Shut the hell up!

Japanese: なぜ天空城は残っているの？
English: Why Did Ciela Castello Remain?

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
ねえ　どうして
天上界は滅びたのに
天空城は　残ったんだろう？
English:
If Cielo got destroyed, then why did
Ciela Castello remain in the sky?

Japanese:
元々天空城は　天上界からも浮いていた
天空城と　呼ばれる所以だな
English:
You’re aware of how Ciela Castello came to be
called as such, correct? It was called that
because it floated in the sky, even in Cielo.

Japanese:
それ故に恐らくは　天上界崩壊の
災難からも　免れたのだろう
English:
Perhaps that disconnect from Cielo is what spared
it from destruction when The Fracture happened.

Japanese:
でも　遺体が残ってるってことは
完全には　免れなかったんだね
English:
But the fact that these bodies are still here
means that the castle didn’t completely
escape the destruction.

Japanese:
ああ　天上界崩壊の力は
ただごとではなかったのだろうな
English:
It might be that the force of Cielo’s
collapse isn’t as strong as we imagine.

Japanese:
…でも　懐かしい感じがする
僕は　ここをよく
歩いていたような気が…
English:
It’s strange... this place feels so nostalgic,
as if I’ve been here before.

Japanese:
そらそうや
センサスの勇者　アスラさまの御殿やし
English:
Of course it would.
It used ta be Sensus’ Hero Asura’s court after all.

Japanese: ええっ！　アスラの？
English: Asura’s!?

Japanese: イナンナと　一緒に住んどったやん
English: Yeah, he lived together with Inanna here.

Japanese: いッ…　一緒に！？
English: T-Together!?

Japanese:
アスラとイナンナは　夫婦同然やってんで
ヴリトラも　ここら辺で
よぉベローンて　昼寝さしてもろとったわ
English:
They were like a married couple.
Vritra used ta take her naps here too.

Japanese:
アスラの住まいに　創世力が…
アスラは　どこまで創世力に
関わっていたんだろう…
English:
The Genesis... in Asura’s home...
I wonder how long Asura had been in posession of it.

Japanese: 巨人の願い
English: The Giant’s Wish

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: シアン
English: Sian

Japanese:
なあ　おまえ　創世力が
なんなのか　知ってるのか？
English:
Hey, you, do you have any idea
of what exactly the Genesis is?

Japanese:
ううん　実はよく知らないんだ
結局は　世界を滅ぼす物なのか
世界を生み出す物なのか…
English:
Not really... I’m not sure if it’s something 
that destroys the world or creates it.

Japanese:
創世力は　創世の神
始祖の巨人の意志だ
English:
The Genesis is the God of Creation,
the Primordial Giant’s Will.

Japanese:
意志…？
確か　巨人が天上界と天上人を
創ったって　話だったけど
English:
“Will”...?
I thought the Primordial Giant
created both Cielo and Terro.

Japanese:
そう　始祖の巨人は　自らの肉体を
天上界と天上人たちに変え
その意志は　創世力として残した
English:
That’s true. He wrought Cielo and Cielans
from his flesh and what remained was his Will.

Japanese:
なんのために意志を…
創世力として　残したんだろう
English:
I wonder why he left behind his Will--
the Genesis?

Japanese: 寂しかったからじゃないか？
English: Wasn’t it because he was lonely?

Japanese: どういうこと？
English: What do you mean?

Japanese:
始祖の巨人は　体をなくしたあとも
世界とともに　ありたかったんだよ
English:
The Giant probably wanted to live alongside
the world even after it lost its body.

Japanese:
一緒に　みんなといたかった…
それが　巨人の願いだったと思う
English: I believe it was its wish to be with everyone...

Japanese:
だから　世界を変える力は
みんなが幸せになるための
力のはずなんだ
English:
That’s why the Will they left behind,
the power to change the world, was
meant to make everyone happy.

Japanese:
だったら　きっと始祖の巨人は
悲しんでるだろうね
English: Then I’m sure the Giant must’ve been pretty sad.

Japanese:
創世力を使って　天上界を崩壊させ
世界を　始祖の巨人が願っていたのと
違う形に…
English:
Cielo got destroyed because of the Genesis,
and the world as it is now isn’t what the
Giant initially wished--

Japanese:
ボクは　始祖の巨人の願った世界を見てみたい
ボクに創世力を　使う資格はないけど
おまえになら任せられる…　そんな気がする
English:
I want to see the world the Giant wanted to make.
I know that I don’t have the qualifications to use it,
but I believe that you do...

Japanese:
うん…
わかったよ　ありがとう
シアン
English:
I understand.
Thank you, Sian.

Japanese: 天上界について
English: About Cielo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ねえ　アンジュ
天上界ってさ　どういうところだった？
English: Hey, Ange. What was Cielo like?

Japanese:
ルカくんは
思い出せてないの？
English: You have not remembered it yet?

Japanese:
僕が思い出すのは　戦場で
戦っていたところばかりで　天上界が
どういうところなのか　よく思い出せなくて…
English:
I only remember fighting on the battlefield,
but nothing about Cielo...

Japanese:
そうねぇ　私の知る限りでは…
本当に空の上にあって　地上が雲の隙間から
見え隠れしたりしてたって　感じかな
English:
Let us see... As far as I know... 
It is a land above the sky, 
hidden from Terro by clouds...

Japanese: …それだけ？
English: ...Is that all?

Japanese:
そう　それだけ
だから　それ以外は
地上と　それほど変わらないかな
English:
It means that they are willing to settle down on Terro 
and live the rest of their lives here.

Japanese:
今の地上の　科学技術のようなものは
存在しなかったから
原始的に　見えるでしょうけどね
English:
If we look at it now, it might seem primitive 
since the science and technology that we 
know today did not exist yet.

Japanese:
でも　その分　天術が使えたから
不便は　まるでなかったのよ
English:
In exchange, Cielo had Cielan Artes so it was 
not as inconvenient as you would expect.

Japanese:
教団で　説かれているような
夢のような世界ってわけでも
なさそうだね
English:
It doesn’t seem to be the same as the Utopia 
that the Church described it to be.

Japanese:
まあ　信者さんに夢見てもらうのが
私たち教団の仕事だものね
English:
Well, it is the church’s job, to get its believers to 
accept such a thing, of course.

Japanese:
でも　実際　天上界は
今の地上と　あまり変わらないかも
English:
In reality, there is not much of a difference 
between it and Terro.

Japanese: 戦争をするところもね…
English: Even though they were both constantly in turmoil...

Japanese: そういうことね…
English: Yes...

Japanese: 魂の管理者「死神」
English: The Reaper: Warden of Souls

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
そういや　リカルドってさ
前世じゃ　死神だったんでしょ？
English: Oh yeah, wasn’t Ricardo a Reaper in his past life?

Japanese:
うん
僕　死神ヒュプノスと戦ったことがあるよ
戦場でね
English:
Yep. I fought the Reaper Hypnos on the 
battlefield before.

Japanese:
死神かぁ…
地上人の魂を狩る役職を　担う人たちよね
English:
A “Reaper”, huh... Someone tasked with the duty of 
hunting souls in Terro.

Japanese:
えっ…　そうだっけ？
アンジュは覚えてる？
English: Was... that the case? Do you remember, Ange?

Japanese:
ええ
天上界は　地上人の信仰心で
維持されていたの
English:
Indeed. As I have told you before, Cielo was once 
maintained with the faith gathered from Terro.

Japanese:
でも　それでは間に合わなくなって
地上人の魂を　天上界を維持する力に
あてたのよ
English:
However, when that faith became insufficient, 
human souls were used in exchange.

Japanese:
その仕事を司るのが　死神ね
ラティオにしかいない人たちよ
English:
And those who are tasked with that job are Reapers. 
A service that is mandatory for the people of Ratio.

Japanese:
ラティオにだけ…
どうして？
English: Only for Ratio? Why so?

Japanese:
センサスの民は　地上人の信仰を
とても　尊く感じていたの
そのお陰で天上界があるのだ…　とね
English:
Sensus holds Faith from Terro in high regard because,
“If it were not for it, Cielo would not have existed.”

Japanese:
だから　ラティオの死神が
地上人の魂を　狩るのには
反対していたみたい
English:
That is why they were opposed towards Ratio’s 
Reapers gathering souls from Terro.

Japanese:
ヘンねぇ
アスラと　ヒュプノスが
戦場で　戦ったなんてさ
English: It’s weird. Why was Hypnos fighting on the battlefield?

Japanese:
地上人の魂が必要なら　死神の仕事を
放り出して　戦場で戦ってる場合じゃ
なかったんじゃないの？
English:
If collecting souls was necessary, 
then why did he abandon his 
role and fight?

Japanese:
そうだね
ラティオは　兵力不足だったのかも
English: Perhaps Ratio lacked the military forces in that battle?

Japanese:
そんなことはなかったと　思うけど
そういえば　そうね
どうしてかしら
English:
That should not be the case. Now that you mention it, 
I wonder why...

Japanese: なにか事情が　あったのかな…？
English: Maybe something was at play...?

Japanese: 神の誕生
English: The Birth of a God

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana
Hmmmm...

Japanese:
エル
どうかしたの？
English: What’s up, Hermie?

Japanese:
レグヌムに　置いてきた
あの子ら　元気かなーって
English:
Ah was wonderin’ if Michelle 
an’ Gaetano are doin’ a’ight.

Japanese:
大丈夫だよ　あの用心棒の人が
ちゃんと　面倒
見てくれてるって
English:
I’m sure they are. That bodyguard uncle’s
taking care of them, after all.

Japanese:
けど　子ども育てんのって　大変やでぇ？
手ぇつけられんときも
あるさかいなぁ
English:
But carin’ fer childrens’ hard, y’know?
Sumtimes it can get outta hand.

Japanese:
アスラも　そうやったわぁ
ヴリトラは　ホンマ苦労してんで
English:
Same with Asura, Vritra really
had a hard time takin’ care of ’em.

Japanese:
…えっ！？
そうだったの？
English: Huh!? Really?

Japanese:
ヴリトラは　アスラが
生まれたときから　ずっと面倒見ててん
産湯に入れたり　おまんま食べさしたりな
English:
Ever since Asura was born, Vritra took care
of ’em by givin’ baths or feedin’ ’em an’ such.

Japanese:
なんだか
そう聞くと　頭が上がらないや
English: Somehow I find it hard to imagine it.

Japanese:
アスラはな　土の中から生まれてん
産声が聞こえたから　ヴリトラが
掘り起こして　見つけよったんや
English:
Y’see, Asura was born from beneath the earth.
When he was born, Vritra dug ’em out cryin’.

Japanese:
土の中？
アスラって　お母さんから
生まれたんじゃないの！？
English:
“From beneath the earth?” 
So Asura didn’t have a mom!?

Japanese:
そら　もちろん
そういうこともあるけどな
English: Course, it does happen sumtimes.

Japanese:
天上界で　新しい命が生まれるときは
お産の神さんから　お告げをもろて
拾いに行く　場合もあんねん
English:
There are times when the god of childbirth will give 
an oracle about a new life born into Cielo. 
In those times, we go and pick ’em up.

Japanese:
天上界の赤んぼはな　空から降ってきたり
木の実の中におったり　川から流れてきたり
橋の下に　落ちてたりすんねんで
English:
Cielan babies, y’see, can fall from the sky, become
fruits of trees, flow from rivers an’ fall from under
bridges an’ the like.

Japanese:
は…　橋の下…
じゃあ　ヴリトラが
見つけてくれなかったら　アスラは…
English:
U-Under a bridge... Then if Vritra
hadn’t found Asura he would’ve...

Japanese:
まあ　地上人と違ぉてヤワやないさかい
死には　せぇへんけどな
でも　どない育っとったか　わからんで？
English:
Well, Cielans are different from Terrans. 
They don’ really die. But who knows 
what woulda happened.

Japanese: 感謝する
English: Thank her

Japanese: 疑問に思う
English: Doubt

Japanese:
育ててくれて
ありがとう　エル
English: Thanks for raising me, Hermie.

Japanese: ウチに言われても　しゃーないけどな
English: Ah don’ really mind.

Japanese: …あ　でも　ほな　こうしよか
English: ...But tell ya what.

Japanese:
アスラが　できんかった親孝行
ウチが　できる機会　与えたる
English:
Ah’ll give ya the chance ta do what
Asura couldn’t fer his parents.

Japanese:
えーっと
どうすればいいの？
English: So... what should I do?

Japanese:
前世の恩は　ルカ兄ちゃんの出世払い
ヴリトラへの恩も　返せるし
兄ちゃんの気ぃも済むし　みんな大喜びや
English:
Promise ta pay back yer previous life’s karma, an’
Ah’ll pass it along ta Vritra. It’ll make ya feel better
an’ everybody will be happy.

Japanese:
それって…　みんなじゃなくて
大喜びなのは　エルひとりなんじゃ…
English: That’s... I didn’t mean everyone... I meant--

Japanese:
いやいや　そうやって大喜びのウチを見て
みんなが　幸せな気持ちになったら
ええねんて！　な？
English:
No, no, seein’ everybody happy 
will also make me happy, hear?

Japanese:
ハァ　なんだか
うまく口車に　乗せられてるような…
English: I feel like I’m being manipulated.

Japanese:
もしヴリトラが　アスラを
育ててくれなかったら
どうなってたんだろうね？
English:
I wonder what would’ve happened
if Vritra hadn’t raised Asura?

Japanese:
そらぁ　札付きのワルやで
街でケンカして　ロクに家にも帰りよらん
仕舞いに下水道とかに　隠れ家作りよんねん
English:
Well, he’d end up becomin’ hopeless an’ minglin’ with
the bad sort of kids an’ makin’ a hideout in the sewers.

Japanese:
それって　どこかで
聞いたような…
English: I feel like I’ve heard that before...

Japanese:
せやから　アスラはヴリトラに
もっと親孝行せな　あかんかったわなぁ
English: That’s why Asura shoulda been kinder ta Vritra.

Japanese:
親孝行か…
僕　父さんと母さんにも
できてないかも…
English:
Kinder, huh... I might not be able
to be kind to my mom and dad...

Japanese:
ほな　ヴリトラの代わりは
ウチがするさかい　なんぼでも
親孝行してもろて　ええで！
English:
Then Ah’ll take Vritra’s place. Ya can repay
yer parents as much as ya want.

Japanese:
具体的には　ルカ兄ちゃんがウチに
なんぞ　お金的なもんとか
宝石的なもんとかを…　な？
English:
Fer example ya can repay me with anythin’.
Like money or jewels, hear?

Japanese:
「な？」　じゃないよ
どうして　そうなるのさ
English:
No, not here! Why are you asking 
me to repay you with that!?

Japanese:
なんでか　そうなってまうねん
不思議なことに…　な？
English: No idea. But ya gotta repay yer parents, hear?

Japanese: だから「な？」　じゃないってば…
English: That’s not my point!

Japanese: 信仰を集めてどうするの？
English: What Happens to the Faith That Was Collected?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ねえ　アンジュ
天上界の仕組みについて
聞きたいことがあるんだけど…
English: Hey, Ange. I want to ask something about Cielo.

Japanese: ん　なぁに？
English: Yes, what is it?

Japanese:
天上界を　維持するために
地上の信仰が　必要だったって
言うけど…　どういう意味なの？
English:
You’ve mentioned before that the Faith collected 
from Terro was used to maintain Cielo.
What does that mean, exactly?

Japanese:
そうねぇ
天上界と地上が　元々ひとつの
世界だったのは　知ってるよね？
English:
Ahh... I believe you are aware that Cielo and
Terro were parts of a whole, are you not?

Japanese:
確か　天上界から追放された人たちが
地上に住んでたって…
English:
If I recall correctly, those who were exiled from
Cielo came to live in Terro...

Japanese:
そう　その地上を産み出すために
天上界を　維持するための力が
ずいぶん　使われてしまったのよ
English:
Correct. Cielo ended up using all
of its power when creating Terro.

Japanese:
その足りなくなった力を
埋め合わせるのが　地上の信仰心
信仰の力ってわけね
English:
To compensate for that, Cielo began collecting
faith from Terro.

Japanese:
天上界を　維持するために
地上人の信仰心が
必要だったってことだね
English:
Basically, the faith from those in Terro became 
necessary for Cielo’s maintenance.

Japanese:
信じる力　祈りの力は
とても尊く　強い力なんだけど
でも　それも徐々に　失われてしまったの
English:
Faith gathered from prayers is a valuable and
strong power. But that, too, gradually 
decreased as time passed.

Japanese:
失われたって…
どうして？
English: Why so?

Japanese:
地上の人々が　元々自分たちが
天上人だったことを　忘れてしまったからよ
English:
It is because we, who were once Cielans,
slowly forgot our heritage as gods.

Japanese:
なぜ　自分たちは　天に許しを乞うのか
その理由が　失われてしまえば
信仰心もなくなるでしょ？
English:
When the reason to ask for Cielo’s
salvation disappears, faith does too.

Japanese:
天上界から　追放された罪の
許しを乞う
そこが　忘れられてしまったのね
English:
As time passed, we eventually forgot the reason
why we were exiled from Cielo and along with it 
went our faith.

Japanese:
…で　天上界と地上の存在について
あれこれ理屈をつけて　経典にしたのが
教団の起源というわけ
English:
In order to unify the varying theories on Cielo
and Terro’s existence from the doctrine,
the Church was created.

Japanese:
じゃあ　教団は天上界を支える
役に立ったんだね
English: Then the Church was useful in sustaining Cielo...

Japanese:
それは　一概に言えないのよねぇ
一度　経典が出来てしまうと
解釈も　複数生まれる…
English:
That might not be the case...
When the doctrine was created, numerous
interpretations started floating around...

Japanese:
解釈が複数生まれると　信者は
自分に都合の良い　教義を選ぶようになる
English:
...and believers followed the interpretation which 
suited their own preference.

Japanese:
結果的に　天上界が必要とした信仰心とは
かなり違う物に　なっちゃったの
English:
As a result, the faith that Cielo ended up
collecting was different from what they needed.

Japanese: 仕方ないと言う
English: “I guess it can’t be helped”

Japanese: 眉をひそめる
English: Frown

Japanese:
でも　それって仕方ないよね
天上界に許しを　乞わなくてもいいって人も
出てきただろうし
English:
But that couldn’t be helped, right? People
aren’t obligated to beg for the Cielans’ forgiveness.

Japanese:
そうね　地上で生きることに
喜びを見つけた人は　天に帰りたいなんて
思わなくなったでしょうしね
English:
Indeed. When you have found joy in living in
Terro, you no longer consider returning
back to Cielo.

Japanese:
天上界と地上が　切り離された時点で
天上界は　いずれ滅びる運命に
あったのかもしれないね
English:
So ever since Cielo and Terro’s separation,
Cielo’s destruction became inevitable.

Japanese:
じゃあ　結局　教団の存在が
地上から信仰心を　なくしてしまったんだね…
教団って　本末転倒だなぁ
English:
Then, in the end, the Faith that Cielo gathered
from the Church was irrelevant...
They sure got their priorities wrong.

Japanese:
地上人が　みんな　本気で
天上界に帰りたいと　望んでいたら
天は　今でも存在していたかもしれないわね
English:
If everyone had been serious in their desire for
forgiveness, then Cielo still might have existed 
to this day.

Japanese: 地上人はどう見られてたの？
English: How Were Terrans Viewed As?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
なぁ　アンジュ
天上界の連中は
地上人を　どんな風に見てたんだ？
English: Ange, how did those from Cielo see Terrans?

Japanese:
あら　スパーダくん
思い出せてないの？
English: Do you not remember, Spada?

Japanese:
たぶん　思い出せてないっていうより
デュランダルにとっては
どーでも　いいことだったんだろうな
English:
Rather than not remember,
I think Durandal just didn’t care about it.

Japanese:
興味がないから
そのあたりの記憶も
スパっとないんだよ
English:
And since he didn’t really care
about it. I don’t remember
anything about it.

Japanese:
うーんと　ラティオの民は
地上人を　忌み嫌っていたみたいね
English:
Hmm... I believe those from
Ratio detested Terrans.

Japanese:
神の力を奪われて　地上に落とされたから
地上人なんだよな？
だったら確かに　関わりたくないだろうな
English:
Terrans were once Cielans who had
their divinity stripped away, right? No wonder
Ratio didn’t want to associate with them.

Japanese:
地上人は　天上界を荒らして追放された
ならず者たちっていう意識が
ラティオには　強かったのね
English:
There must have been a prejudice among
Ratio that Terrans were banished because
they were destroying Cielo...

Japanese:
でも　センサスの民は違った
天上界を信仰する　地上人たちに
畏敬の念を　払っていたみたいね
English:
But Sensus thought otherwise.
They were in awe of the Terrans
who believed in Cielo.

Japanese: ね？　ルカくん？
English: Right, Ruca?

Japanese:
あ…　うん　ハッキリとは覚えてないけど
地上人たちの　信仰心のおかげで
生かされてるって　考えてたみたいだね
English:
Oh, right. I don’t remember it clearly, but I think 
Sensus recognized that it was due to the Terrans’
faith that they were able to live in Cielo.

Japanese:
ふうん…　センサスは情に厚かったのかな
でも　そんなセンサスの連中が転生して
今は地上で　迫害されるんだもんな
English:
Hmm... Sensus might’ve been passionate
about it, but right now they’re being
persecuted here on Terro.

Japanese:
地上人に　畏敬の念を払ってたのに
センサスの民って
気の毒だよな…
English:
Suffering in the hands of the Terrans
they once looked up to, Sensus sure
are unfortunate.

Japanese: 堕天
English: Fallen From Cielo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ねえ　リカルド
English: Ricardo...

Japanese:
…なんだ？
慰めなら
勘弁して　もらいたいのだがな
English:
What is it?
I’d prefer it if you hold back your condolences
if that’s what you came to me for.

Japanese:
ガードル…
お兄さんは
大事な人だったんでしょう？
English:
But Gardle-- your brother was
someone you held dearly, right?

Japanese:
兄者は魂を狩りに　地上へ降りたとき
地上人の女と　恋に落ち
自らの意思で　天上界を去った
English:
It was my brother who fell for a Terran woman;
he left Cielo of his own accord.

Japanese:
その行為はラティオでは　裏切りとされ
俺たちは　兄弟揃って
死神の役目から　降ろされた
English:
That deed alone was considered treason
and we were both demoted from our role
as Reapers.

Japanese:
もっとも兄者は　地上人の魂を狩る
死神の役目など
とっくに　放棄していたがな
English:
Despite the fact that my brother had already
abandoned his role as a Reaper.

Japanese:
死神の役目を　降ろされたから
ヒュプノスは　戦場へ？
English:
So that’s the reason why you
were on the battlefield?

Japanese:
ああ…
そして　おまえと…
アスラと　戦ったんだったな
English:
Indeed, it was also where
I fought you as Asura.

Japanese: また謝る
English: Apologize once again

Japanese: 無言でいる
English: Say nothing

Japanese:
それで　その…　ヒュプノスを…
リカルドを　倒しちゃって…
だから　僕…
English:
And because I defeated you--
Hypnos, I mean...

Japanese:
前世の話で
いちいち　謝るんじゃない
English:
No need to apologize for what your
previous incarnation has done.

Japanese:
う…　うん
ごめん…
English:
O-Okay...
I’m sorry.

Japanese:
わからんヤツだな
あの戦いは　避けることのできない
運命だった
English:
You never learn, do you?
That battle was inevitable.

Japanese:
おまえが　謝る必要はない
おまえは　おまえの未来を
しっかり見つめて　生きればいい
English:
So that’s why you don’t need to apologize,
it’s better if you live your life looking to the future.

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
ふ…ッ　そんな顔をするな
おまえに…　アスラに倒されたことは
根に持ってなどいない
English:
Don’t look at me like that. You don’t have
to be upset for what your previous incarnation
has already done.

Japanese:
それどころかヒュプノスは　最後に戦えた
相手が　あの猛将アスラだったことに
感謝すらして　死んだんだ
English:
On the contrary, Hypnos was grateful
that the Great General Asura was the
last man he fought.

Japanese:
ラティオを裏切った　お兄さんのこと
恨んでないの？
English:
Do you... hate your brother for
betraying Ratio?

Japanese:
ああ…　元々　兄者は天上界のために
地上人の魂が　搾取されることを
良しとしていなかったからな
English:
Well, my brother was already concerned about Cielo’s 
exploitation of Terran souls.

Japanese:
理解はできなかったが　恨んではいなかった
むしろ愛を貫くため　地上に降りた
兄者を　尊敬すらしていた
English:
I couldn’t comprehend why he did such a thing,
but I didn’t hate him. Rather, I revered him for
descending to Terro for his love.

Japanese:
ガードルは
ずっと愛し続けたんだね
地上を…
English: So Gardle continued loving Terro...

Japanese:
命を賭して…　な
愛とは　偉大なものだ
English:
It was outstanding of him to
stake his life for love.

Japanese: なぜ創世力を守っていたの？
English: Why were you Protecting the Genesis?

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: シアン
English: Sian

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
ねえ　シアンくん
ケルベロスは　どうして創世力を
守ることになったの？
English:
Sian, do you know why Cerberus
was protecting the Genesis?

Japanese:
世界を簡単に　変えてしまう力を
野放しには　できないだろ？
だから　番人として生み出されたのさ
English:
We can’t just let anyone have a force that can easily 
change the world, correct? That’s why a guardian had 
to be created to watch over it.

Japanese: 生み出された？
English: Had to be “created?”

Japanese:
始祖の巨人に　天上界が創られてまもなく
神々たちの　手によってね
未来永劫　創世力を守るためだけに
English:
Shortly after the Primordial Giant created Cielo,
gods were born to eternally watch over the Genesis.

Japanese:
だから　寿命が来て　死んでも
次のケルベロスとして　生まれ変わるのさ
創世力の元へ　何度も何度も…
English:
That’s why, when one of the god’s lives came
to an end, another Cerberus was born to watch
the Genesis once again... no matter how many times...

Japanese:
あなたが　マティウスの元に
引き寄せられたのも
そういう　因縁からかもしれないわね
English: I suppose that is what drew you towards Mattheus.

Japanese:
結局　創世力で　天上界は
崩壊しちゃうんだもんな
English:
In the end, all she wanted was to
destroy the world with the Genesis.

Japanese:
アスラになんか　創世力を
渡すんじゃなかったよ
English: I shouldn’t have given it to Asura.

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
しかし　ケルベロスの姿は
大きく恐ろしげな姿だと
言い伝えられていると　思ったが…
English:
But, I thought Cerberus was supposed
to have a more fearsome form...

Japanese:
どうも　おまえを見ていると
そのような気配が　感じられんな
English:
No matter how you look at it,
you didn’t seem scary at all.

Japanese:
それは　先代のケルベロスの話
ボクは　ちょうど生まれ変わったばかりで
まだ小さかったんだよ
English:
That was the previous Cerberus.
I had just been born so I was still small.

Japanese:
ボクだって　成長すれば{fixed} 
{variable}大きくて怖い姿になったはずさ
English:
Even I... Even I will be big and
scary after I grow up.

Japanese:
ふん
つまり　おまえは　前世でも
今と同じ　ガキだったということか…
English:
Hmph, that means that you were still
a brat even in your previous life.

Japanese:
ああ！　またボクをバカにしたな！
フンだ！
もう　おまえなんかと話するもんか！
English:
Agh! You’re making fun of me again!
Bleh! I’m not talking to you ever again!

Japanese:
もう…　リカルドさんたら
今のシアンくんの　気持ちを考えて
もっと大人の態度を　取ってください
English:
Come now, Sir Ricardo, you should consider how
Sian feels and act like a proper adult.

Japanese:
む…　ああ
今のは確かに　俺が悪かったな
面目ない
English:
Hmm... yeah.
I was definitely in the wrong there.
Sorry.

Japanese: ラティオとセンサスの違い
English: The Difference between Ratio and Sensus

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
あー…　わっかんねーな！
結局　センサスとラティオの違いって
なんなんだよぉ！
English:
Dammit, I don’t get it at all! What’s the difference
between Sensus and Ratio anyway?

Japanese: 国の違い…　とかじゃないの？
English: Weren’t they from different countries?

Japanese:
ああ？
だから　なんで
その国を　分けちまったんだよ！
English: Then how are they different!?

Japanese:
僕に　怒られても
困るんだけど…
English:
It’s quite troublesome if you keep
getting angry at me like that...

Japanese:
スパーダくん　知らないことは
ちゃんと質問しないと　ダメなのよ？
ルカくんが　涙目になってるでしょ
English:
Spada, it is improper to keep asking someone who
does not know something. Can you not see that
Ruca is about to cry?

Japanese: うう　グス…
English: *sob*

Japanese:
わかった　わかった
じゃあ　わかるように
教えてもらおうじゃねェか！
English:
Ok, I get it.
Then why don’t you explain it to me!?

Japanese:
人にものを　尋ねる態度じゃないけど
まあ　いいわ…
まず　天地を分けた原因はわかるわよね？
English:
That is not how you should ask others either...
Fine. First of all, do you know why
Cielo and Terro separated?

Japanese:
ああ　罪人や　ロクでなしを
天上界から　地上に隔離したんだろ？
English:
Wasn’t it because the criminals and bums
in Cielo got exiled to Terro?

Japanese:
その後で　さらに天上界は
センサスと　ラティオに
分かれちゃったんだよね？
English:
And after that, Cielo split even further into
Sensus and Ratio, right?

Japanese:
そう　この地上人を隔離する政策の
賛同者と　反対する者とを
ラティオとセンサスと　呼び分けたのよ
English:
Indeed. Those who supported and objected
to the policy of exile into Terro were
eventually called Ratio and Sensus.

Japanese:
もちろん
隔離に賛同したのが　ラティオ
それに反対していたのが　センサスね
English:
And of course, those who supported the policy
were called Ratio and those who objected
were called Sensus.

Japanese:
ずいぶん　大雑把な感じがするね
人種とか　国の違いじゃないの？
English:
That’s quite a broad explanation.
Don’t they have a different race or country?

Japanese:
社会性と規律を　守りたい人たちと
そうじゃない人たちで　それぞれ集まって
同好会を　作った感じかな？
English:
I suppose they would be two different
organizations that had contrasting ideologies.

Japanese:
同好会って…
そんなもんなのかよ？
English: Is that so?

Japanese:
もちろん　それほど話は
単純じゃないんだけど　こう話したほうが
わかりやすいでしょ？
English:
Well, it is a bit more complicated than that, but
this explanation is quite easy to understand, is it not?

Japanese:
ラティオは　規律を守ることで
より世界が　発展することを
願った人たちだったのよ
English:
Ratio was the type of group that concerned themselves
with preserving the order of both worlds.

Japanese:
でも　地上を隔離したせいで
発展どころか　天上界のバランスを
崩しちゃったんでしょ？
English:
But didn’t that lead to Terro being separated,
which brought imbalance to Cielo?

Japanese:
だから　天上界を維持するために
地上人の魂を　集めてたって…
English:
That’s why, to maintain Cielo, human souls 
were gathered...

Japanese:
地上を隔離したのは
天上界にとって　不測の事態だったから
仕方なかったのかもね
English:
That was an unforeseen effect that came with Terro’s 
separation. They might have needed to make do with 
what they could.

Japanese:
地上に　ならず者と呼ばれた人たちを
隔離する前の天上界は
相当　ひどい状態だったみたいだもの
English:
Apparently the so-called “scoundrels” were already in a 
horrid state before they were exiled into Terro.

Japanese:
でも　センサスの願いは
「天地の融合」なんだろ？
そっちの方が　正しそうだけどな
English:
But wasn’t the “Unification of both worlds” Sensus’
ideology? They seem like the good guys.

Japanese:
さあ　それは　どうかしら
センサスに　集まった人たちも
案外　どうでも良かったんじゃないかなぁ
English:
Who knows...
It seems that Sensus did not really care about it
that much.

Japanese:
センサスには　能天気な人たちが
多かったみたいだし
English: Since most of them were quite laid-back.

Japanese: え…　そうだったの？
English: Really?

Japanese:
ラティオは　自分たちで規律を作って
生真面目に　守る人たちだったから
当然　国や軍隊が　発展したの
English:
Ratio was composed of people who were passionate in 
preserving order, so they were able to develop a
country as well as a military.

Japanese:
対して　センサスは気の合う者同士で
思い思いに　集まってただけだから
まるで国の体を　成してなかったもの
English:
In contrast, Sensus is composed of like-minded
individuals who just did as they pleased.

Japanese:
じゃあ　アスラが
掲げてた　理想って…
English: Then the reason Asura’s will was...

Japanese:
んー…
まあ　センサス全員の
悲願とは　言えないでしょうね
English: It is likely that he never told all of Sensus about it.

Japanese:
でも　お祭り好きな人たちだったから
楽しむために　一致団結したんでしょう
アスラは　そんなみんなのまとめ役ね
English:
However, since they were the rowdy type, they all 
gathered around Asura in search of entertainment.

Japanese:
なんだか
イメージ違うなあ…
English: That’s quite different from what I imagined...

Japanese:
ふふふ　ちょっと誇張しすぎたかしら
でも　ラティオとセンサスの違いは
わかりやすかったでしょう？
English:
I may have exaggerated a bit but, do you understand
the difference between Sensus and Ratio now?

Japanese: まあ　そうだけどね…
English: Yeah...

Japanese: 魔王
English: Overlord

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
チトセさんが　言っていた…
マティウスは　僕のよく知る人物だって
それが魔王なのかな　やっぱり
English:
Chitose told me that Mattheus was someone I knew
quite well. Is she the Overlord?

Japanese:
「魔王　創世力を高く掲げ
　その力　長き眠りから呼び起こす」と
壁画に　刻まれた文字にはあったけど…
English:
“The Overlord raised the Genesis and called upon its 
slumbering power.” This inscription was etched onto 
the mural, however...

Japanese:
…っちゅうことは
やっぱり　ルカ兄ちゃんが
言うたように…
English: To sum it up, it’s jus’ as Ruca Bro said...

Japanese:
マティウスっちゅうのが　魔王で
創世力を　欲しがっとるのは
地上も　滅ぼすためなんちゃうかなぁ
English:
If Mattheus was the Overlord, then the reason she
wants the Genesis is so that she can destroy Terro...

Japanese:
センサスと　ラティオの戦いのあと
創世力をめぐって　アスラと魔王の間で
なんかあったのかもしれねェな
English:
Maybe the Overlord appeared right after Ratio 
and Sensus fought for the Genesis?

Japanese:
でも　アスラの記憶には
魔王なんて　出てこないんだよね
English:
But the Overlord doesn’t appear 
in Asura’s memories...

Japanese:
単純に　思い出せて
いないだけなのかもしれないわよ
English:
It could also be that Asura did not 
want to remember it.

Japanese:
うん
そうなのかな…
English: Oh... I guess...

Japanese: アスラの育ての親
English: Asura’s Foster Parents

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
なあ　ルカ兄ちゃん
寝グセついてんで
ちゃんと　直しや
English:
Say, Ruca Bro, ya have sum hair 
stickin’ out, lemme fix it.

Japanese: あ…　うん
English: Oh... okay.

Japanese:
ホンマ　そういうとこは
アスラと　よう似とるなぁ
English: Ya really resemble Asura this way.

Japanese:
え…　アスラって
そういうの　だらしなかったの？
English: Huh...? Was Asura really like that?

Japanese:
結構　そういうとこあってん
ほんで　アスラはヴリトラを
「ばあや」て　呼んどってんで
English:
Purty much. Didja know that
Asura used ta call Vritra “mummy?”

Japanese: う…　うん…
English: Y-Yes...

Japanese:
ヴリトラは　世話焼きやったからなぁ
アスラは　よう
面倒くさそうにしとったで
English:
Vritra was Asura’s caretaker, hear?
He was quite a handful back then.

Japanese:
でも　ヴリトラが　アスラに
武術とか　紳士のマナーも
教えたってん
English:
But she also taught him all sortsa
things from martial arts ta etiquette.

Japanese:
僕の母さんも　世話焼きでさ
少し　うっとうしいと　思ってたけど
今思うと　大事にされてたんだなぁ
English:
My mom also took care of me. I thought she
was annoying at first, but now I think
she cares for me a lot.

Japanese:
あ…　でも　そういうエルだって
寝グセついてるじゃないか
ほら　目ヤニだって　ふかなきゃ
English:
But even you have bad sleeping habits too,
Hermie. You’ve got sleepies in your eyes.

Japanese:
動いちゃダメだよ
そのまま　そのまま…
はい　取れた
English:
Now, don’t move.
Stay still... just a bit more... okay, done.

Japanese: あー………　んもう…
English: Ohhh...

Japanese: どうしたの？
English: What’s wrong?

Japanese:
親と別れてから　こない世話してもらうこと
ウチ　なかったなぁと思て…
ほんで　ちょっと嬉しかったん
English:
Ever since Ah lost mah parents, Ah thought no one
would take care of me anymore. Ah’m jus’ a bit happy.

Japanese:
そっか　エルは　こんなに小さいのに
年下の子を　世話したり
僕の面倒を見たり…
English:
Despite being so small, you took care of two
children and even looked after me...

Japanese:
本当は　僕の方が
面倒を　見てあげなくちゃ
いけないのにね
English:
Although I don’t really need someone to look
out for me.

Japanese:
ええねんて
ウチ　好きやし　人の世話すんの
English: It’s fine. Ah like takin’ care of others.

Japanese:
あのフニャフニャやった　アスラを
一人前のダンディに　育て上げた
実績が　ウチにはあんねんで？
English:
Ah managed ta raise that soft an’
squishy Asura into a fine dandy, hear?

Japanese: 照れる
English: Get embarrassed

Japanese: 照れ隠しする
English: Hide your embarrassment

Japanese:
もう　前世をダシにからかうのは
止めてよね　エルったら
English:
Oh Hermie, can you stop teasing 
me about my past life?

Japanese:
そうは　いかんで
ウチには　このくらいでしか
ルカ兄ちゃんを　いじるネタないもん
English: No can do, this is the only thing Ah can tease ya with.

Japanese:
別に　いじらなくたって
いいじゃないか…
English: It’s not like you have to tease me or anything...

Japanese:
いじられんと
ルカ兄ちゃんちゃうで？
それにいじるのは　愛情表現やし！
English:
Ah ain’t jus’ teasin’ ya! 
It’s how Ah express mah love!

Japanese: そ…　そうなのかな…
English: Is... is that so?

Japanese:
アスラだったら　きっと
鼻で笑っちゃうよ　そんな話
English: Asura would’ve laughed through his nose at that.

Japanese:
ちょっと　なにムクレてんの
ルカ兄ちゃんは　いじられてなんぼやのに
これぐらいで怒ったら　あかんで？
English: It’d be bad if ya got angry at jus’ that, Ruca Bro.

Japanese: 怒ってはいないけどさ…
English: It’s not like... I was angry or anything...

Japanese:
そうそう　ルカ兄ちゃんは
素直が一番
照れ隠しなんかしたらあかんて　な？
English:
Okay, okay, it’s bad to hide yer
embarrassment though, Ruca Bro, hear?

Japanese: サクヤとの関係
English: Relationship with Sakuya

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
ねえ　スパーダ
サクヤって　覚えてる？
English: Spada, do you remember anything about Sakuya?

Japanese:
あのチトセってヤツの　前世だろ
オレも　思い出したよ
English: Chitose’s past self, right? I remember her.

Japanese: どういう子だったっけ？
English: What was she like?

Japanese:
花の女神でよ
センサスの男どもの
憧れの的だったな
English:
She’s a goddess of flowers, someone that many
men from Sensus looked up to.

Japanese: それだけ？
English: Is that it?

Japanese: あとは　尽くすタイプ
English: She’s a devoted kind of person.

Japanese: えっと…　他には？
English: Anything else?

Japanese:
一途な女かな
ずっと　アスラだけを見つめてたっけ
アスラとイナンナが　くっついた後でもさ
English:
Well, I guess she’s earnest. She was dedicated 
to Asura and followed closely behind him 
and Inanna.

Japanese:
まあ　とにかく　奥ゆかしい女だったぜ
アスラが　幸せになるのならって
イナンナのために　身を引くくらいによ
English:
Anyways, she’s a very modest woman.
She stepped aside to let Asura and Inanna
be happy together.

Japanese:
チトセが　初めて会ったときから
おまえにやたら　興味を持ってたのは
そのせいだろうな
English:
I think that’s also the reason why Chitose was
interested in you the moment you two met.

Japanese: う…　ん…
English: O-Oh...

Japanese:
罪作りなヤツだよな
アスラもよ
English: You sure are a sinful one, just like Asura.

Japanese: 僕…　どうすればいいのかな？
English: W-What should I do?

Japanese:
んなこと　知らねェよ
アスラだって　サクヤの気持ちを知ってて
結局　イナンナを選んだんだ
English:
As if I’d know! Even Asura chose Inanna
despite being aware of Sakuya’s feelings.

Japanese:
他人が　どうこう言えることじゃねーよ
そもそも　前世の話じゃねェか
English:
I can’t control how others will act.
Besides, we’re talking about our past selves here!

Japanese:
それは　そうだけど
僕　チトセさんのこと
そういう対象には　見られないし…
English: That’s true, but Chitose doesn’t look at me that way.

Japanese:
だったら　どうすればいいかなんて
オレに聞くなよ
おまえ　思い上がってねェか？
English:
Then why the hell are you asking me what you
should do? 
Is your head swollen or something?

Japanese:
イリアが　今の話　聞いてたら
ぶっ飛ばされるぞ
English:
If Illia heard what I said just now,
she’d turn me into a colander!

Japanese:
そ…　そうだね
声に出すときには
イリアに聞かれないように　気をつけなきゃ
English:
R-Right... We have to be quiet when
talking about this so she won’t hear.

Japanese:
気をつけるとこが　違うだろ…
好きでもない女の話なんか
イリアの前でするなって　言ってんだよ
English:
Rather than being careful, just make sure not to talk
about that woman in front of Illia.

Japanese: 感謝する
English: Say thanks

Japanese: 反論する
English: Refute

Japanese: うん　そうだね…
English: Y-Yeah, you’re right...

Japanese: ありがとう　スパーダ
English: Thanks Spada.

Japanese: いいってことよ
English: No problem, man.

Japanese:
でもよ　そういう相談を
オレにしてくれるってのは
やっぱ　嬉しいもんだな
English: I’m really happy that you’d come to me for advice.

Japanese:
でも　僕を気にかけてくれる
女の人のことだし…
English: But she’s someone who cares about me...

Japanese: じゃあ　勝手にしろ
English: Then do what you want.

Japanese:
でもな　てめェが惚れた女のこと
ぞんざいに　扱うようなマネは
たとえ　おまえでも　許さねェからな
English:
But if you treat a woman you like with disrespect, 
I’ll never forgive you.

Japanese: アスラとオリフィエルの同盟
English: Asura and Orifiel’s Alliance

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ねえ　アンジュ
オリフィエルは　元はアスラの敵
ラティオの側にいたんでしょ？
English:
Say Ange, since Orifiel was once a part of Ratio’s 
ranks, wouldn’t that mean that for a time, he and 
Asura would have been enemies?

Japanese:
それが　どうして
センサスに　いるようになったの？
English: So how did Orifiel end up in Sensus?

Japanese:
ああ
私も最近　思い出したのよ
English: Oh, I believe I have just remembered that.

Japanese:
戦場でアスラと　顔を合わせているうちに
いつの間にか　意気投合しちゃってね
内緒で　同盟を結んだの
English:
After meeting with Asura on the battlefield, we both 
reached a mutual understanding with each other 
and formed an alliance in secret.

Japanese:
じゃあ　オリフィエルは
ラティオを　裏切ったの？
English: So, Orifiel betrayed Ratio?

Japanese:
裏切ったというより　オリフィエルは
うまく和平に　持ち込みたいと
思っていたのよ
English:
Rather than betray, I believe Orifiel thought
he could bring peace between the two groups.

Japanese:
アスラなら　きっとラティオの民と
センサスの民が　一緒に歩める道を
作ることが　できるだろうって
English:
If it was Asura, he could surely lead
Sensus and Ratio to advancement.

Japanese:
オリフィエルって　大胆な人だったんだね
敵将のアスラを
そこまで　信じられるなんてさ
English:
Orifiel sure was an audacious person,
for him to believe in the enemy general
that much...

Japanese:
オリフィエルが　大胆だったというより
アスラが　懐が深くて
気さくな人だったせいかな
English:
Rather than Orifiel being audacious,
I suppose it is more of Asura being an
open-minded individual.

Japanese:
敵のオリフィエルですら
心を通わせられるほどにね
English: Although Orifiel was an enemy, Asura understood him.

Japanese:
懐が深くて気さく…　かぁ
腕が立って　勇猛で　豪快で　女性にモテて
仲間も多くて…　それから　それから…
English:
Open-minded, huh...?
He’s also talented, brave, heroic, 
popular with women, and... and...

Japanese:
あ…　あのぅ　ルカくん？
それ以上　考えると
落ち込むだけよ？
English:
Um... Ruca? If you think about that any longer, 
you shall end up more depressed.

Japanese:
うう…
ホントに　僕
アスラだったのかな…
English: Was I really Asura...?

Japanese: イナンナとイリア
English: Inanna and Illia

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
チトセ　あの女！
…ったく　もう
English: Chitose, that witch!

Japanese:
…でもイナンナが　あんな女だったなんて
ああやって　イナンナは
アスラを　奪ったんだ
English:
But come to think of it, Inanna was like that too. 
After all, she stole Asura away...

Japanese:
ああやって？
誰から　奪ったの…？
アスラのそばに　いつもいた女…
English:
Who did she steal him from?
Was it from that woman who was always beside him...?

Japanese:
サクヤ…　そう　サクヤだ
いつもアスラを　陰から支えていた
あの女…
English:
Sakuya... Yeah, I think she was Sakuya.
That woman who always supported Asura from
the shadows...

Japanese:
イナンナは　サクヤから
アスラを　奪った
English: Inanna stole Asura from Sakuya.

Japanese:
サクヤが　アスラに想いを寄せているのを
知った上で…
English:
Even when she was aware of Sakuya’s 
feelings for Asura, she...

Japanese:
………………
やだな　あたし
前世では　あんな女だったんだ
English:
I hate this... To think that I was that kind of woman 
in my past life.

Japanese: デュランダル出陣
English: Durandal’s Departure

Japanese: アスラ
English: Asura

Japanese: デュランダル
English: Durandal

Japanese:
さすがだ
あれほどの敵を　斬り捨ててもなお
刃に曇りひとつ　残らぬとはな
English:
As expected, no matter how many enemies 
I slay, your blade stays clear.

Japanese:
どうだ　デュランダル
初めての戦は？
English: How was it, Durandal, your first taste of battle?

Japanese:
なにか　非を見つけてやろうと
思っていたのだがな
なにも言うことが　思いつかぬ
English:
I had planned to find faults within your 
swordsmanship, but was unable to.

Japanese:
つまり　俺はおまえの所有者として
認められたのだな
English:
Does that mean that you acknowledge 
me as thine owner?

Japanese:
我は　戦が好きではない
だが　この力を活かすことは
やぶさかでない
English:
I do not care for battle, but I shall not hesitate 
to unleash my power.

Japanese:
そうだ　おまえと俺で
この戦を　終わらせるのだ
それで守れる物は　計り知れん
English:
Indeed. You and me, let us end this war together. 
And united, we shall protect all.

Japanese:
…ふむ　アスラ
我は　おまえに仕えよう
戦のない世を　待っている者がいる
English:
Asura, wield me as you see fit. I await the day 
you bring about the world you promised:
a world without war.

Japanese:
ああ　任せろ　俺も人を待たせるのが
好きではないのでな
こんな戦　俺の手で　すぐに終わらせてやる
English:
I promise, with my hands I shall end this war soon.
After all, I do not like to make people wait.

Japanese: デュランダルとゲイボルグ
English: Durandal and Gaebolg

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
ハスタの野郎とは
きっと　これっきりじゃねェ…
ヤツとは　また会う気がする
English:
I have a feeling that we’ll meet that bastard Hasta
again...

Japanese:
そんときゃあ　ルカ
おまえを　必ず守ってみせる
ってか　あの野郎
English:
When that time comes, I promise I’ll
protect you from that bastard.

Japanese: 即ぶったおす！
English: I’m gonna kill him!

Japanese:
でも　前世じゃ
兄弟だったんじゃないの？
English: But weren’t you both brothers in your past life?

Japanese:
あんなヤツ　兄弟なもんかよ
ただ　鍛冶の神バルカンの手から　生まれた…
製造元が　同じってだけさ
English:
I ain’t brothers with that bastard,
it’s just that we share the same maker.

Japanese:
ヤツは殺しと　破壊のために作られた
転生しても　それは変わらねェようだな
English:
That bastard reincarnated only to bring destruction
and death in his wake, and that will never change.

Japanese:
おまえ　思い出してねーのか？
オレと　おまえで
ゲイボルグを　倒したときのことをよ
English:
Don’t you remember the time when
we fought and defeated Gaebolg?

Japanese:
僕も　なんとなく思い出したよ
ゲイボルグを持つ者が　戦場に現れたときは
みんな　震え上がってた
English:
I kind of remember it. When Gaebolg appeared on the 
battlefield, I felt the atmosphere tremble.

Japanese:
ああ…　あの魔槍の持ち主は
敵味方構わず　殺し回り
死ぬまで　戦わされてたよな
English:
Right, the one who wielded him fought
and killed friends and foes alike.

Japanese:
…ったく　前世の因縁てのは厄介だな
次こそ息の根　止めてやらぁ
English:
Damn it, our past life’s destinies are such a pain.
I hope we stop him in this life.

Japanese: 嘆く
English: Regret

Japanese: 賛成する
English: Agree

Japanese:
…でも　悲しくないの？
前世でも現世でも　敵同士だなんて
English:
But aren’t you sad that you’re enemies in the past
and this life as well?

Japanese:
そうでもないさ
前世なんざ　関係なしに
オレは　野郎のことが嫌いだからな！
English:
That ain’t it. My past life doesn’t have anything to do
with this. I just really hate that bastard!

Japanese:
殺したいほどに？
…それって　やっぱり少し悲しいよ
English: To the extent of murder? That’s the sad part.

Japanese:
誰彼構わず　傷つけるなんて
僕も許せないよ
English:
To hurt anyone and everybody, I’ll never forgive such
a man!

Japanese:
…だな
あの野郎
次こそ　覚えてろよ！
English: Damn right! Next time for sure, I’ll remember this!

Japanese: デュランダルの作り手
English: Durandal’s Creator

Japanese: バルカン
English: Vulcan

Japanese: デュランダル
English: Durandal

Japanese:
やはり　おまえに
魂を持たせるべきでは　なかったかもな
English:
As I thought, you weren’t 
supposed to have a soul.

Japanese:
我を生み出したことを
後悔しているのか？
バルカン
English: Dost thou regret creating me, Vulcan?

Japanese:
いや　おまえの誕生は
私にとっては　とても喜ばしい
English: Not at all, I’m happy that you were born.

Japanese:
だが　デュランダルよ
おまえが　いずれ私の手を離れ
戦地で　血を浴びると思うとな…
English:
But someday, you’ll leave my hand and 
eventually shower the battlefield with blood.

Japanese: 我は　すでに覚悟を決めている
English: I have already resigned myself to that duty.

Japanese:
私の作品は　おまえで最後だ
もはや　刀鍛冶としての
私の存在は　無意味
English:
You are my last masterpiece. My existence
as a swordsmith is already naught.

Japanese:
私は　いずれ転生の輪廻から離れ
いずこともなく
この世界から　消え去ることを願う
English:
I wish that someday, I shall separate from the
cycle of reincarnation and disappear from this 
world.

Japanese:
この世界から　消え去ることを願うだと？
それが「幸せ」という感情を
もたらすというのか？
English:
Thou wish to disappear from this world?
Will that givest thou happiness?

Japanese:
………………
さあな
私にも　わからん
English: Who knows... I don’t know either.

Japanese: デュランダルの裏切り
English: Durandal’s Betrayal

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
オレ　思い出したよ
なぜ　デュランダルが
おまえの手に　渡ったのかを
English:
I remember it.
How Durandal fell into your hands...

Japanese:
アスラを　殺すために
イナンナに　託されたんだった
English: He was given to Inanna to kill Asura.

Japanese:
…皮肉なもんだよな
殺すために　出会った相手が
最高の所有者だったなんてよ
English:
How ironic...
The best owner Durandal met was
the one he was meant to kill.

Japanese:
アスラも　最高っていうところは
同じ思いだったよ
デュランダルは　最高の相棒だったって
English:
Asura felt the same way about Durandal.
He thought Durandal was the best partner.

Japanese:
相棒…　ねェ
口うるせえし　生意気だったから
案外ウザったく　思ってたんじゃねェの？
English:
“Partner”, huh... Durandal was pretty loud
and impertinent though. You sure Asura 
didn’t find him annoying?

Japanese: そんなことないよ
English: Not at all.

Japanese:
デュランダルは　アスラを裏切った
所詮　ただの道具
人並みの心なんて　持ってなかったのさ
English:
In the end, Durandal betrayed Asura.
He was nothing but a tool. Never 
had a human heart at all.

Japanese:
そんなことないよ　スパーダ！
デュランダルは
ちゃんと心を　持っていた
English:
That’s not true, Spada.
Durandal had a proper heart.

Japanese:
デュランダルは　イナンナと同じように
天上界の平和を　願ってた
だから　アスラを殺す以外なかったんだよ
English:
He, like Inanna, wanted to bring peace to the world.
That’s why he had no choice but to kill Asura.

Japanese:
所有者を裏切り　暗殺して
それで「平和を願ってた」って
言うのかよ？
English:
You telling me that betraying and assassinating
his owner was because he wanted “peace?”

Japanese:
確かに天地の融合は　戦乱を生むかもしれねえ
アスラを　止めるには
暗殺しかなかったんだろう
English:
It might be that Durandal had no choice but to 
kill Asura because the unification of Cielo and 
Terro would’ve only lead to more war.

Japanese:
でもそんなこと　裏切りの言い訳にはならねえ
オレは…　オレはアスラを裏切った
デュランダルが　許せねェんだ
English:
But I can’t accept such an excuse for betrayal.
I... I betrayed Asura... I can never bring myself
to forgive Durandal.

Japanese: 反論する
English: Refute

Japanese: 同意する
English: Agree

Japanese:
たとえ　前世でも
自分の信念を　悪く言っちゃいけないよ
English:
Look, even if it all happened in the past,
don’t you ever doubt what you believe in.

Japanese:
信念か…
そんなもの　本当に
あのデュランダルにあったのかな
English:
What I “believe” in, huh...
I wonder if Durandal had
something he believed in...

Japanese:
オレには　ただ
周りに流されてただけにしか
思えねェぜ…
English:
It just seems to me that I was going 
along with the flow...

Japanese:
そうだね　スパーダが自分を…
デュランダルを　許せないっていうなら
仕方ないよね
English:
You’re right. I guess it can’t be helped if you
can’t bring yourself to forgive Durandal.

Japanese:
でも　僕は
そんなスパーダだから
一緒にいたいと思うんだ
English: But I still think I want to be with “you”, Spada.

Japanese:
へッ
おまえ　ホントお人好しだよな
お世辞だとしても　救われるよ…
English:
Man, you sure are a softie, aren’t you?
Flattery will get you nowhere, you know.

Japanese: オリフィエルの使命
English: Orifiel’s Obligation

Japanese: オリフィエル
English: Orifiel

Japanese: 元老院
English: Senate Member

Japanese: お呼びでしょうか？
English: You called?

Japanese: 元老院１
English: Senate Member 1

Japanese:
オリフィエル
たった今　天空神ヒンメルさまが
ご転生なされた
English:
Orifiel, our lord, Himmel the Celestial,
has just reincarnated this very moment.

Japanese:
おお　ついに
天上界を支える　我らラティオの王
天空神が　ご転生なされたのですな！
English:
Oh! So the Lord that sustains Cielo itself,
Ratio’s Celestial King has just reincarnated!

Japanese: 元老院２
English: Senate Member 2

Japanese:
天空神といえど　まだ赤子だ
ラティオの王として
学んでいただくことが　数多くある
English:
The King himself is nothing but a mere baby.
He still has many things to learn before taking
up the role of Ratio’s king.

Japanese: 元老院３
English: Senate Member 3

Japanese:
そこで　オリフィエルよ
おまえを　ヒンメルさまの
教育係に　任じようと思う
English:
That said, we appoint you, Orifiel,
to become his own mentor.

Japanese:
なんと　もったいないお言葉
これほどの栄誉は　ございませぬ
English:
I am honored, but I’m afraid that
I don’t deserve such words.

Japanese:
私などで　よろしければ
喜んで　この身を捧げましょう
English:
But if thou insist, I shall gladly
devote myself to this task.

Japanese: 元老院１
English: Senate Member 1

Japanese:
では　頼んだぞ
オリフィエルよ
English: We’re counting on you, Orifiel.

Japanese:
はッ！
この身　ヒンメルさまに捧げる
覚悟にございます！
English:
Sir!
I am prepared to offer myself to the Lord.

Japanese: オリフィエルの迷い
English: Orifiel’s Hesitation

Japanese: オリフィエル
English: Orifiel

Japanese: ラティオ兵
English: Ratio Soldier

Japanese:
オリフィエルさま
この先　センサスの軍が布陣しております
どうか　ご指示を！
English:
Lord Orifiel, we will soon be 
approaching the Sensus’ Army!
Your orders, Sir!

Japanese:
敵将は恐らく　あのアスラ
激しい戦になろう
近隣住民の避難が　最優先であろうな
English:
We are most likely going to face Asura himself.
This battle might get intense.
Focus on evacuating the citizens first.

Japanese: はッ！
English: Yes, Sir!

Japanese: オリフィエル
English: Orifiel

Japanese:
多くの血が　流れゆく一方だ…
この戦を　終えるまでに
一体　どれほどの流血が　必要なのか…
English:
A lot of blood will be shed in this fight...
How many more lives should we sacrifice
for this war to end?

Japanese:
センサスを　野蛮と言うが
ラティオとて　変わらぬな
English:
They call Sensus barbaric
yet Ratio is the same.

Japanese:
センサスを　排しても
ラティオによる　新たな支配が始まるだけ
そしてまた　地上に追放される者が出る
English:
Once Sensus is exiled, a new reign will start and
more will eventually be kicked down into Terro.

Japanese:
地上人　そしてセンサス…
追放に次ぐ追放の　果てに残る物とは
一体なんだ？
English:
Terrans... and eventually Sensus...
If more were banished, who will remain?

Japanese:
これでは　ますます天上界は
不安定になるばかり
元老院は　なにを考えているのだ…
English:
At this rate, Cielo will fall into further imbalance.
What is the Senate even thinking...?

Japanese: オリフィエルの戦術
English: Orifiel’s Fighting Style

Japanese: オリフィエル
English: Orifiel

Japanese:
戦略の正道とは
敵よりも　多数の兵を用いること
English:
It seems the correct course of action is
to outnumber the enemy in manpower.

Japanese:
しかし　アスラには通じぬ
彼は　常に寡兵を以って
我が軍を　打ち破っている
English:
But Asura is a force to be reckoned with...
For being able to overpower our troops
whilst commanding a small platoon himself.

Japanese:
こちらの動きを　直感で把握し
柔軟に対応して　兵を動かす
まさしく「後の先」
English:
To be able to intuitively grasp our
movements while flexibly communicating
with his team in response...

Japanese:
敵ながら見事
そして　あの剣技…
ひと太刀で　数十人をも切り伏せる　あの力
English:
Despite being an enemy, he’s amazing.
On top of that, he is able to slay ten men
with one swing of that sword of his.

Japanese:
兵の中に恐怖が生まれ　全軍に伝播し
士気は挫けて　壊走する…
正道では　アスラに勝てぬな
English:
Spreading fear among our troops, lowering
their morale and breaking them down...
He can’t be defeated through straightforward means.

Japanese:
………いや
もはや　ラティオは
勝ってはならぬのかもしれん
English:
No... perhaps Ratio no longer has
any chance of winning...

Japanese:
アスラは　天を変える者
限界を迎えている　この天上界を
破壊し　再生する者かもしれぬ
English:
Asura... the one who will change Cielo.
The one who will destroy and recreate
this crumbling world.

Japanese:
アスラと　ヒンメルさまを
お引き合わさせる…
それが天上界　唯一の太平の道やもしれぬな
English:
Bringing Asura and Lord Himmel together
might be the only way to bring peace to
Cielo once more.

Japanese: オリフィエルの願い
English: Orifiel’s Wish

Japanese: アスラ
English: Asura

Japanese: オリフィエル
English: Orifiel

Japanese:
オリフィエル殿よ
俺には　まるで　わからぬ
なぜ　ラティオは　まだ俺に歯向かう？
English:
Lord Orifiel, I cannot comprehend why
Ratio still bites the hand I offer them.

Japanese:
すでにオリフィエル殿も
我がセンサスに　帰順し
もはや　戦の趨勢は決しておろうに
English:
And thou hast sworn thy allegiance to Sensus.
This battle is already decided.

Japanese:
簡単ですよ
彼らは　逆転の機会があると
今も信じているからですな
English:
Simple, it is because they believe in winning
a losing battle at the last second.

Japanese:
ほう…
このアスラの命を　戦場で奪うことが
ヤツらに可能と？
English:
I see... so they are considering the possibility
of taking my life on the battlefield.

Japanese:
もうひとつ　手が…
アスラ殿が　創世力を手にする前に
ラティオ側で　所有することです
English:
As well as the possibility of Ratio
obtaining the Genesis before you do.

Japanese:
なるほど
確かに戦場で　戦いに注力する間
俺は創世力を　手にすることはできぬだろう
English:
I see... It is true that I was unable to procure
the Genesis because I was busy focusing
on the battle...

Japanese:
だが　それはラティオも同じではないか？
あのケルベロスが　やすやすと
創世力を　渡すはずがないであろうに
English:
But is it not also the same for Ratio?
I am sure that Cerberus won’t calmly
hand over the Genesis to such men.

Japanese:
やすやすと　渡させる手段を
講じておるのでしょう
そのための　時間を稼いでおるのですよ
English:
I am sure they are merely buying some time to 
work out a plan for them to have Cerberus
hand over the Genesis peacefully.

Japanese:
ラティオ軍は　必死です
負ければ　あなたに皆殺しにされると
信じておりますからな
English:
Ratio is desperate.
They believe that you will have them
all killed once they’ve lost.

Japanese:
なぜだ？
俺に　そんな意思はないぞ！
English:
But why?
I have no such intentions!

Japanese:
そうでしょうとも
しかし　ラティオの政では
常に敗者を　切り捨ててきました
English:
I’m sure you don’t, but it is Ratio’s culture
to have their weak be culled.

Japanese:
今度は　己が切り捨てられると
思い込んでおるのですよ
English:
Even I myself thought that I
would die the other day.

Japanese: バカな！
English: You fool!

Japanese:
ええ　バカですな
ですが　仕方ありますまい
所詮　根本が異なる者同士ですから
English:
Indeed I am, however, it cannot be helped.
After all, we’re both fundamentally different.

Japanese:
俺は　皆殺しなどせぬ！
天上界の維持には　ラティオ勢の力も
不可欠だからな！
English:
I will not annihilate them!
After all, Ratio is also essential in
maintaining Cielo’s balance.

Japanese:
おい！　軍議だ！
ラティオへ　使者を出すぞ！
イナンナ！　ヴリトラを呼べ！
English:
War council!
Summon a messenger,
and call for Inanna and Vritra!

Japanese:
まったく　打てば響く　お人だ
あの御仁なら　暗きラティオの未来にも
光を灯すことが　できるやもしれん
English:
What an impressive man.
If it’s him, I’m sure he’d be able to shine
a light into Ratio’s murky future.

Japanese:
そして　願わくば
その光の元に　ヒンメルさまを…
English: And, I pray that by that light, Lord Himmel...

Japanese: オリフィエルとケルベロス
English: Orifiel and Cerberus

Japanese: オリフィエル
English: Orifiel

Japanese: ケルベロス
English: Cerberus

Japanese:
もし…？　もし…？
ケルベロス…　殿？
English:
Is anyone there...?
Lord... Cerberus?

Japanese:
わんわんわわん！　わんわわん！！
不審者わん！　不審者わんわん！！
不審者わんわんわんッ！！
English:
Woofwoofwooofff! Woofwoofff!
Intruder! Intruder! woof!
Intruder! Woofwoofwoofff!

Japanese:
ひぃぃ！！
き…　貴殿は
ケケケケ！　ケルベロス殿でありますな…？
English:
Eeeeek!
A-A-Are you p-p-perhaps...
Lord... Cerberus?

Japanese:
いかにもわん！
創世力　守護するケルベロスわんよ
おまえ　なんの用わん？
English:
Indeed Woof!
it is I, Cerberus, Woof, Guardian of the Genesis!
What dost thou woof need?

Japanese:
あ…　あのぅ…　そのぅ…
本日はお日柄も良く　大変結構な時節柄
創世力を賜りたく　馳せ参じました次第で…
English:
Oh, ahh... hmm... Since today’s a great day and
at a very good time of year, I’ve come to ask
for the Genesis.

Japanese:
ウウウゥ～…
おまえ　ラティオの者わん？
English: Grrrrrr... Art thou from Ratio?

Japanese:
ここは　とっくの昔に　センサスの領域わんよ
しかも　創世力がある　この奥
立ち入っていいの　死者だけわん
English:
This area is deep into Sensus territory.
Woof! Only the souls of the dead and the
Genesis lie within this cavern. Woof!

Japanese:
いやはや　存じております
本日は私　ラティオの者ではなく
いち個人として　参りました次第でしてな
English:
No, in truth, I did not come here on
behalf of Ratio, but as an individual.

Japanese:
天上界と地上が　平等な力に守られた
理想の世界を創るため
どうか　創世力をお譲りくだされ
English:
I wish to create a world where Cielo and Terro are
both equal. Please hand over the Genesis to me.

Japanese:
じゃあ　両手の親指で　鼻ほじりながら
３０回　ぐるっとまわって
あっかんべーするわんよ
English:
Then put both of thy thumbs in thy nose,
pull thy lower eyelids and stick thy tongue out.
Spin while counting to 30.

Japanese:
え…　そ…　それで創世力を
お譲りいただけるので？
English:
If... if I do that... will you be willing
to give me the Genesis?

Japanese:
その程度なら　喜んで！
では　さっそく…
English:
If it’s just that, then I’d be glad to!
Now...

Japanese:
い～ち…　にぃ～…　さ～ん…
しぃ～…
English:
Wannn...～ Thoo...～ Thwee...～
Fohh...～

Japanese:
誰も　そんなことで
創世力を渡すなんて　言ってないわん
おまえ　頭悪いわん？
English:
I never said anything about bestowing thee
the Genesis. Art thou a knave, nay, a dumbass?

Japanese: うくく…　では創世力は…
English: Oof... then... the Genesis...

Japanese:
理想の世界　創る言うなら
責任持って　その世界
治めなくては　いけないわん
English:
Thou must be willing to take responsibility if
thou is willing to meld the world to thy ideal.

Japanese: おまえにその器　あるわんか？
English: Dost thou have that resolve? Woof!

Japanese: いや　それは…

あのアスラが　この戦争で
天上界を統一に　導いたら
創世力は　アスラに渡すわん
English:
That Asura deduced that the only way to unify Cielo
is through warfare.
Thus, I’ve decided to bestow it unto him.

Japanese: 彼が　すでにここへ？
English: That man has already been here before...?

Japanese:
そろそろ　ご飯の時間だから
骨　掘り返すわん
でも　大事な骨の隠し場所　バレるわん…
English:
Oh, it’s lunch. Time to dig up my bone. Woof!
But I can’t have thee knowing about where my 
bone is hidden. Woofwoof!

Japanese:
それ困るわん
だから　おまえ　もう帰るわん
English: That’s why thou shouldst go home. Woof!

Japanese:
さっさと　帰らないと
さっきのマヌケな姿
みんなに　言いふらしてやるわん
English:
If thou won’t, then thou might woof end up
being talked about like the woof previous
bastard woof’s been here.

Japanese:
…その程度のこと　私にとっては
恥でも　なんでもないんですがねぇ
なんなら創世力を　力づくで奪うことも…
English:
Such embarrassment is irrelevant to me.
If you won’t give me the Genesis then I
have no choice but to take it by force.

Japanese:
わん！　わんわんわん！
わわんわんわん！　わわんわん！！
English:
WOOF! Woof woof woof!
Woowoof woof woof! wo-woof woof!

Japanese:
うひゃああ！
やはり　イヌは苦手だぁ！！
English: Noo! I really can’t stand dogs!

Japanese: ヒュプノスの仕事
English: Hypnos’ Job

Japanese: ヒュプノス
English: Hypnos

Japanese: タナトス
English: Thanatos

Japanese: ラティオ兵
English: Ratio Soldier

Japanese: …今日のノルマ分の魂だ
English: ...and that should be enough for today’s quota.

Japanese:
ご苦労さまです
これほどの　地上人の魂があれば
天上界は　その潤いを取り戻すでしょう
English:
Good job. That should be enough Terran
souls for Cielo to recover its blessing.

Japanese: だが　それも僅かな間だ
English: But it’s only temporary.

Japanese: そうかもしれませぬなぁ
English: Perhaps.

Japanese:
だからこそ　ヒュプノスさまを始めとする
死神の皆さまには
今後も　頑張っていただきたい！
English:
But that’s why I want Lord Hypnos
and the other Reapers to continue
doing your best!

Japanese:
いつまで　こんなことを
続けなければならないのか
English: How long must this persist?

Japanese:
地上人どもは　いくらでも増えます
我々の天上界を　維持する糧が
途絶えることは　ありませんよ
English:
No matter how many we take, Terrans will
still continue to multiply. It’s impossible to
run out of souls to fuel Cielo’s maintenance.

Japanese:
そう言えば　タナトスさま
魂を狩る以外にも　頻繁に地上へ
降りておられるようですが…
English:
Speaking of, Lord Thanatos, I see that
you’ve been descending to Terro more
often outside of work.

Japanese: たまにだがな…
English: Sometimes...

Japanese:
左様ですか
しかし　タナトスさま　あなたもラティオの民
不用意に地上へ参られるのは　お控えください
English:
Is that so?
Please remember that you’re a citizen of Ratio.
You might get caught unawares while in Terro.

Japanese:
そもそも　なにが目的で　職務以外で
あんなところへ　参られるのか
私どもには　わかりかねますな
English:
But still, I don’t understand why you’d
have to descend down into Terro aside
from your duties.

Japanese:
ふん
貴様らごときには　わからぬ
English:
Hmph...
You know nothing.

Japanese:
…兄者　あなたの考えは　俺にもわからん
一体　地上などに　あなたを惹きつける
どんな魅力があるというのか…
English:
Even I don’t understand, brother.
What charm does Terro have that
attracts you towards it?

Japanese: ヒュプノスと兄
English: Hypnos and his Brother

Japanese: ヒュプノス
English: Hypnos

Japanese: タナトス
English: Thanatos

Japanese: …兄者
English: Brother...

Japanese:
おまえか
ヒュプノス
English: Is that you, Hypnos?

Japanese:
魂を狩る以外の目的で
地上に　降りているらしいな
English:
I’ve heard that you’ve been descending into
Terro for reasons outside of reaping souls.

Japanese: それがどうした
English: And what if I am?

Japanese:
さらに　死神の職務を
放棄しているとも聞く
English:
I’ve also heard that you intend to
abandon your job as a Reaper.

Japanese: 俺は　もう奪うことに飽きたのだ
English: I’ve grown tired of stealing, Hypnos.

Japanese:
兄者　まさか地上に魅入られたのか？
任を放棄するなど
元老院が　お許しになるはずがないぞ！
English:
Brother, do not tell me that you’ve become
enthralled by Terro! The Senate will never
allow you to abandon your duties!

Japanese:
すまんな　ヒュプノス
いずれ　元老院に
伝えておいてくれ
English:
I’m sorry, Hypnos, but you’ll have
to tell them eventually...

Japanese:
「この世界から　消え失せろ
　ジジイども」とな
English: To “Keep their sticky fingers out of this world.”

Japanese:
兄者…
本気なのか…？
English:
Brother...
are you really serious?

Japanese: ヒュプノスの願い
English: Hypnos’ Wish

Japanese: ヒュプノス
English: Hypnos

Japanese: ラティオ兵
English: Ratio Soldier

Japanese:
ヒュプノスさま
ただ今より　死神の任を解くと
元老院から　通達がありました
English:
Lord Hypnos, the Senate wishes to inform you
that you’re dismissed from your duties as a Reaper...

Japanese: そうか…
English: I see...

Japanese:
そして　軍特殊部隊への
配属辞令が　来ております
English:
...and are now required to participate
as a member of the Special Forces.

Japanese: わかった
English: Understood.

Japanese:
ヒュプノスさまには
なんの責もないというのに…
English: You have done nothing wrong, so why...?

Japanese:
去った者に　罪を問うことはできん
責任の落としどころが
他に　見つからなかったのであろう
English:
Those who are gone can no longer be punished.
It’s most likely that they couldn’t find anyone else
to blame aside from me.

Japanese: もうよい　下がれ
English: Enough of this. Dismissed.

Japanese: はッ！
English: Sir!

Japanese: ヒュプノス
English: Hypnos

Japanese:
死神でなくなった　私に
地上へ降りる機会は　もうあるまい…
兄者よ　二度と会うことはないだろう
English:
I, who have lost my duty as a Reaper,
can no longer descend into Terro.
I’m afraid we’ll never meet again, brother.

Japanese:
私は　天から見守ることにしよう
願わくば　兄者が地上人とともに
どうか　幸せに過ごされんことを…
English:
I shall watch over you from Cielo.
I wish that you live the rest of your
days happily amongst Terrans.

Japanese: ヴリトラ誕生
English: Vritra’s Origin

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
ねえ　エル
龍のヴリトラは　どうやって
生まれてきたの？
English: Say, Hermie, how was Vritra born?

Japanese:
火ぃの中からや
ヴリトラは　火ぃの中から
生まれたらしいわ
English: From fire. Vritra was born from fire.

Japanese:
え…　じゃあ
親代わりになってくれた人とかは？
English: Then what about her foster parents?

Japanese: おらへんかったで
English: Herself.

Japanese:
おらへんって…
じゃあ　ずっと大きくなるまで
ひとりだったの…？
English: “Herself?” Then she grew up alone?

Japanese:
一応　同族はおったで
龍の個体は　少ないから滅多に
会われへんかってんけどな
English:
At the very least she had relatives, but since dragons
are rare ya would be lucky to see ’em.

Japanese:
そやからかなぁ
赤ん坊のアスラを　見つけたときは
思わず　抱き上げてもうた
English:
That’s why, when she found baby Asura, she held ’em
up in her arms.

Japanese:
なんでかしらんけど
この子には絶対　家族が必要やって
ヴリトラは　思たんやな
English:
Ah don’ know why she did it, but Vritra thought that 
child needed parents.

Japanese: 後悔はなかったか聞く
English: Ask if she had any regrets

Japanese: ねぎらう
English: Appreciate

Japanese:
ヴリトラって
アスラを　養子にして
後悔することはなかったのかな？
English: I wonder if Vritra ever regretted adopting Asura.

Japanese:
現代人の感覚かもしれないけど
子どもを　育てるの
すごく大変そうなんだけど…
English:
Maybe it’s just how it’s viewed today, but raising
children must be quite tiresome.

Japanese:
そんなん　子どもが考えんでも
ええねんて
English: It’s fine if ya think of it that way...

Japanese:
子どもには　与えることも多いけど
子どもから　もらうことも
めっちゃ　多いねんから
English:
...but while ye’ll need ta give young’ns lotsa stuff,
young’ns can also return more than what ya gave.

Japanese:
赤ん坊のときの　アスラが笑うとな
そらぁ　ヴリトラは
嬉しかったんやで
English:
The moment baby Asura smiled was one of the
happiest memories Vritra has.

Japanese:
アスラが　無事に育ったのは
ヴリトラのおかげだね
ありがとう　エル
English: Thanks, Hermie, for raising Asura peacefully.

Japanese:
そんなん　子どもが考えんでも
ええねんて
English: It’s fine if ya think of it that way...

Japanese:
子どもには　与えることも多いけど
子どもから　もらうことも
めっちゃ　多いねんから
English:
...but while ye’ll need ta give young’ns lotsa stuff,
young’ns can also return more than what ya gave.

Japanese:
赤ん坊のときの　アスラが笑うとな
そらぁ　ヴリトラは　嬉しかったんやで
もう　いつ死んでもええっちゅうくらいにな
English:
The moment baby Asura smiled was one of the
happiest memories Vritra has.

Japanese: そういうものなの？
English: Was that really the case?

Japanese: 僕には　わかんないな…
English: For me, I can’t really imagine it...

Japanese:
そのうち　わかるんちゃう？
まあ　楽しみにしとったらええわ
English: Ya don’ get it? Well, that’s one thing ta look forward to.

Japanese: ヴリトラの苦悩
English: Vritra’s Distress

Japanese: イナンナ
English: Inanna

Japanese: サクヤ
English: Sakuya

Japanese: ヴリトラ
English: Vritra

Japanese:
あら　サクヤ
こんなところで
なにをしているのかしら？
English:
Oh my!
What brings you here, Sakuya?

Japanese:
あの…　アスラさまに
お召し物を　お届けに…
English:
Um...
I was bringing Lord Asura’s clothes...

Japanese:
そう
なら　それは私が預かるわ
English:
Is that so? Then entrust it to me.
I shall bring them to him, myself.

Japanese:
いえ　これは私が
仰せ付かった　役目ですので
結構です
English:
No, I have been appointed
to this duty. Therefore I must refuse.

Japanese:
アスラさまの　身の回りのことは
私が　すべて請け負うわ
あなたは　もうなにもしなくていいのよ
English:
I take responsibility over Lord Asura’s
daily necessities. You no longer need
to concern yourself with them.

Japanese:
そんな…
私はただ　アスラさまの　ご一助になるべく
お側に置いて　いただいているだけです
English:
Never...
I only wish to be by Lord Asura’s side as much
as possible so I can provide help in any way I can.

Japanese:
差し出がましいようだけど
側にいるだけでは　助けになどなりえない
さあ　お召し物は　私が預かりましょう
English:
I don’t mean to be presumptuous,
but you can help him by just being there.
Now, his clothes...?

Japanese:
…………
敵から寝返った　変節者のくせに
出しゃばらないで…
English:
...Just because you betrayed the enemy 
doesn’t mean that you can meddle 
in our matters.

Japanese:
なんですって？
私はアスラさまと
愛を交わし合った…
English:
I beg your pardon?
Lord Asura and I both love each other!

Japanese:
ふたりとも　そこまで
いい加減におし
アスラが　じき戻る
English:
That’s enough. Both of you,
Asura will be back soon.

Japanese:
ヴリトラさま…
お目汚し　申し訳ありません
English:
Apologies, Lady Vritra, we have
shown you something unsightly...

Japanese:
ときに　ヴリトラさまは　私とサクヤ
どちらが　アスラさまに相応しいと
お考えですか？
English:
By the way, my Lady, between the both of us,
whom do you think befits Lord Asura the most?

Japanese:
ホホホ　愚問じゃのう　イナンナ
それならば　わしがアスラに
一番　相応しいわい
English:
Hohoho, what a foolish question, Inanna.
The one who befits Asura the most is
none other than me.

Japanese:
どうしても　その答えが欲しければ
アスラに　直接問うてみるがよい
では　出迎えの準備を急げ
English:
But if you still seek a proper answer,
why don’t you ask him yourself?
Now, hurry up and prepare for his return!

Japanese: はッ
English: Ma’am.

Japanese: 承知いたしました
English: Yes, my Lady...

Japanese:
やれやれ　イナンナも大人気ないのぅ
義理の娘にするには
少々　鼻持ちならん
English:
Goodness gracious, Inanna’s immaturity is
unbecoming for a daughter-in-law.

Japanese:
かといって　サクヤでは
アスラと対等には　付き合えぬであろうし…
まったく　わしがあと一万歳若ければのぅ
English:
On the other hand, that girl, Sakuya, will
never be able to walk alongside Asura... 
If only I were ten thousand years younger.

Japanese: ヴリトラの子離れ
English: Vritra’s Motherly Love

Japanese: アスラ
English: Asura

Japanese: ヴリトラ
English: Vritra

Japanese:
嬉しきことよのぅ
あの小さき赤子が　センサスを
統べるまでに　育つとは
English:
I’m happy to see my young babe grow
up to become ruler over Sensus.

Japanese: すべて　ばあやのおかげだ
English: It’s all thanks to you, Mummy.

Japanese:
民を率い　そして守る
それが強き者の役目
だが　気をつけねばな
English:
I know it’s your duty as a leader to
watch over and protect Sensus’ 
citizens but, please be careful.

Japanese:
いずれおぬしの座を　狙うものも現れるじゃろ
そして　わしのことは
もう　ばあやと呼んではならぬ
English:
Someday, someone will yearn to take your
place and you will no longer call me “Mummy.”

Japanese: なぜだ？
English: Why?

Japanese:
アスラよ　人には皆　立場がある
おまえのそばに　この老いぼれがいるときは
ヴリトラと呼ぶのだ
English:
My child, everyone has their own place.
And there will be a time when you’ll only 
call me by my name.

Japanese:
これから　わしは育ての親ではなく
配下のひとりとして　おぬしに仕える
少なくとも皆の前ではの　よいな…
English:
From this day forth, I am no longer your foster
parent, but one of your subordinates. At the very
least, in front of everyone...

Japanese: ヴリトラとアスラ
English: Vritra and Asura

Japanese: アスラ
English: Asura

Japanese: ヴリトラ
English: Vritra

Japanese:
ばあや
ラティオの連中が　追い求める
創世力とは　なんなのだ？
English: Mummy, what is a “Genesis?” Why is Ratio after it?

Japanese:
創世力とは
世界を　創り変えることの出来る力
English: The “Genesis” is a power that can rebuild the world.

Japanese:
今　地上があるのは　創世力によるもの
かつて　世界はひとつであり
創世力によって　天と地に分かれた
English:
By this power, Terro was brought to existence. 
Before, both worlds were once united and by
that power it was divided.

Japanese:
そのせいで　バランスを失った天上界は
秩序を維持するため　地上人の信仰を必要とし
それでも足らずに　地上人の魂まで…
English:
And because of that imbalance, Cielo came to rely on 
Terran faith and, when it became insufficient, even 
their souls...

Japanese:
そうじゃ
そして今また　ラティオは創世力を
手に入れようとしておる
English:
Indeed, and now Ratio is trying to get 
its hands upon the Genesis once more.

Japanese:
天地を分ける際
創世力を使ったのは
一体　何者だ？
English:
Then who in the world used such 
power to separate Cielo and Terro?

Japanese:
それは　もはや　わからん
このわしすら　記憶にないほどの
大昔の話だからの
English:
That, I have forgotten. After all, such a thing is older 
than I myself and I possess no memory of it.

Japanese:
では　ラティオが
創世力を狙う　目的は？
English: Then what does Ratio wish to do with the Genesis?

Japanese:
我らセンサスを　この天上界から抹殺し
ラティオのみの楽園を
創るつもりであろう
English:
Ratio most likely wishes to banish us 
from Cielo itself in order to maintain
their “paradise”.

Japanese:
そうやすやすと　ケルベロスが
創世力を　渡すことなどないだろうがの
English:
However, I don’t think Cerberus will
so easily part with the Genesis.

Japanese:
いいだろう
俺が創世力を手に入れる
そして　天と地をひとつにしてみせる！
English:
So be it. I shall claim the Genesis myself and 
unite both Cielo and Terro with my own hands!

Japanese:
ホホホ　頼もしきことよの
おぬしの働き　期待しておるぞ？
ホホホホホ…
English:
Ho ho ho. What an admirable son.
Then I shall hold you to that. Ho ho ho...

Japanese: ヴリトラ転生
English: Vritra’s Reincarnation

Japanese: ヴリトラ
English: Vritra

Japanese:
天上界は滅び　すべての神も死に絶えた
わしひとり　永遠とも思えるときを
生きねばならんとはの
English:
To think that Cielo was destroyed, along with its
gods, and that I shall live out the rest of my days 
here in solitude....

Japanese:
己の強靭な体を
これほど　恨むことになろうとは…
じゃが　いよいよこの身も　朽ちるときが来た
English:
I never imagined I’d grow to detest this nigh
invulnerable body the way I do now. Yet, alas,
the time has come for it to begin its decay.

Japanese:
心残りはアスラ…　我が子よ…
天なき今　転生の場もない
永劫の虚無の中に　その魂も消えたのか
English:
My only regret is Asura... Oh, my child, with Cielo gone
there is no longer a place left for us to be reborn.
His soul might become lost to the eternal void.

Japanese:
これは　赤子の産声！？
この声　この瞬き…
この魂の息吹は　アスラのもの！
English:
This... this cry! This voice... this glimmer of light! 
This breath of a soul is... Asura’s!

Japanese:
地上！？
もしや　アスラの魂は地上に
転生したと…
English: In Terro!? If Asura’s soul got reincarnated into Terro...

Japanese:
ああ　我が魂も　また地上へ…
どうか　我が魂を
あの子の元へと　導き給え…
English:
Oh, my soul, please lead me down unto Terro... 
guide me, lead me back to that child’s side...

Japanese: ヒンメルって？
English: Himmel Is?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
ねえ　アルベールって人の
前世だった　ヒンメルって
あの天空神ヒンメルのこと？
English:
Hey, Albert mentioned something about being
Himmel’s incarnation. Is he really talking about
Himmel the Celestial?

Japanese:
ええ　そうよ
「天上界を支える神」
ラティオの王ね
English:
Yes, the god who rules over Cielo,
Ratio’s King.

Japanese:
天上界を支えるって
偉い人なの？
English: “Over Cielo”... then isn’t he in a high position?

Japanese:
天上界を　維持するために
なくてはならない存在だから
まあ　偉い人ね
English:
His existence is necessary in preserving Cielo itself.
So, yes, he is a very, VERY important person.

Japanese:
そんなに偉くて
ラティオの王さまだったのに
殺されちゃったわけ？
English:
So despite being Ratio’s king,
despite being in a high position,
they killed him?

Japanese:
ヒンメルは　ラティオに対して
謀反の心を　抱いていたから
幽閉されたのよね
English:
He was imprisoned since he held
ideologies that opposed Ratio’s...

Japanese:
その後も　心変わりする気配がなかったから
センサスに　寝返られるくらいならって
処刑されちゃったの
English:
Since he refused to change his mind,
Ratio betrayed him and killed him off.

Japanese:
心変わりを　待つくらいなら
転生させて　最初から教育し直した方が
簡単だと　判断されたのね
English:
They decided that it would be easier to just
re-educate him by forcing him to reincarnate.

Japanese:
結局　ヒンメルが転生する前に
天上界は　崩壊してしまったけれど…
English:
In the end, Cielo got destroyed
before Himmel was able to reincarnate.

Japanese:
育てるのに　失敗したら
やり直せばいいっての？
ひどい話ね
English:
Forcing someone to reincarnate just coz
they failed to raise him right...
That’s pretty horrible.

Japanese:
そう　そんなやり方だから
ヒンメルは　ラティオに対して
謀反の心を持った
English: That is why Himmel rebelled against Ratio.

Japanese:
そして　ヒンメルに
そういう　考えを持たせたのは
オリフィエルだったのよね…
English:
And the reason why he held such an opinion
was because of Orifiel, himself...

Japanese: ヒンメルは天上の光
English: Himmel, Cielo’s Light

Japanese: ヒンメル
English: Himmel

Japanese: オリフィエル
English: Orifiel

Japanese:
ヒンメルさま　あなたは天上界を支える
天空神になられるお方
English:
Lord Himmel, you who sustain Cielo, 
are to become the Celestial.

Japanese:
相応の品位と　教養を身につけて
いただかねばなりませぬ
English:
But in order to become so, you must acquire 
a certain amount of dignity and education.

Japanese: ま～た　お小言だ
English: This again...

Japanese:
ヒンメルさまには
ラティオの王として　臣民たちを
導いていただかねばなりません
English: As king of Ratio, you must lead your subjects.

Japanese:
もういいって　そんな話　聞き飽きたよ
だいたい　そんな決まり
一体　誰が決めたんだ？
English:
I’m already sick of hearing that. 
Who even decided that in the first place?

Japanese: 元老院ですな
English: The Senate did.

Japanese:
僕が王なら
決まりは　僕が作ったって
いいじゃないか！
English:
If I’m a king, then aren’t I supposed 
to be the one who calls the shots?

Japanese:
ヒンメルさまは…
王は　王たる責務を　全うするのが役目です
必要なのは　威厳と風格
English:
Lord Himmel-- A king needs dignity and 
personality in order to fulfill his duties.

Japanese:
政治や法は　元老院が行います
そのような仕事は　下々にお任せください
English:
Politics and laws are for the Senate to deal with. 
No need to trifle yourself with such matters.

Japanese:
なら　僕は
ただの飾りってこと？
English: Then aren’t I nothing but a mere ornament?

Japanese:
いいえ
飾りなどでは　ございません
English: No, you are no mere ornament.

Japanese:
ラティオの実権は
元老院が　握っている
すべてを決めるのは　あいつらだ
English:
Ratio’s true king is the Senate. 
They are the ones who hold the 
power to make decisions.

Japanese:
僕すらも　動かしている
あいつらの　都合のいいように！
English: I am nothing but a pawn for them to move!

Japanese:
ヒンメルさまには　政治や法
元老院についても　もう少し
学んでいただかねばなりませんなぁ
English:
Perhaps you should learn a little more
about the politics, law, and the senate.

Japanese:
…………
僕は　独りぼっちだ…
English: ...I’m alone here...

Japanese:
いいえ　私がおります
決して　独りなどではありませぬ
私が手足となり　目と耳となりましょう
English:
No, you’ll never be alone because I’ll always be here. 
I shall become your hands and feet, and your eyes 
and ears.

Japanese:
そんなものより
僕の友達になってよ
オリフィエル…
English: That aside, why don’t you become my friend, Orifiel?

Japanese:
私は　あくまでも教育係
それ以上でも　それ以下でもありませぬ
English:
I am just your mentor.
Nothing more, nothing less.

Japanese: そんなこと　わかってるよ…
English: I know that...

Japanese:
じゃあ　こうしよう？
僕は　王として生きる
でも　君とは友達だ　それでいいだろう？
English:
Then, how about this?
I shall live as King and you shall be my friend.
Are you fine with that?

Japanese:
頼むよ　オリフィエル
それだけで　僕は…
僕はこの命に　生きる価値が欲しいんだ
English:
Please, Orifiel... That’s the very least you can do to 
give me the will to live.

Japanese: どうしてもダメかい？
English: Or are you not allowed...?

Japanese:
ふむ…　あなたが王として
私の良き生徒として　振る舞われるのであれば
ご褒美を　考えなくもありませぬな
English:
Hmm... If you behave as both my student and my king 
then I’ll reward you.

Japanese:
本当？
じゃあ　僕　頑張るよ！
English: Really? Then, I’ll do my best!

Japanese:
あのヒンメルさまの　心の輝き…
このまま「ラティオの」王として
お育てするべきか？
English:
Lord Himmel’s heart shines so brightly...
At this rate, is it correct to raise him as “Ratio’s” King?

Japanese:
ヒンメルさまなら　センサスをも…　いや
地上をも　あの光で満たすことができよう
元老院などの手には　収まらぬほどの光で…
English:
If it’s him then he might be able to fill Sensus...
no, the world with his light. A light way beyond
the Senate’s grasp.

Japanese: ヒンメルの心
English: Himmel’s Heart

Japanese: ヒンメル
English: Himmel

Japanese: オリフィエル
English: Orifiel

Japanese:
もう　書物には穴が開くほど　目を通した
内容も　そらんじられるほどに
でも　こんな知識がなんになる？
English:
I’ve read so many books that I’ve already burned 
holes through them and memorized them by heart, 
but what use do I have for such knowledge?

Japanese:
知識は　ただ覚えるだけではいけませぬ
書物の意を　理解し
己の考えと　照らし合わせるのです
English:
Merely memorizing the contents of a book 
is not enough. You must also reflect on 
what the book wishes to convey.

Japanese: 僕の考え…　か
English: I must reflect...

Japanese:
王たる者は　賢人であるべし
学ぶことで育まれる　徳がございます
そして徳は　心を養います
English:
A king must be wise, for there are
virtues to be cultivated from lessons,
and such virtues develop the mind.

Japanese:
このオリフィエル　愚かなる身ながら
ヒンメルさまに
「心」を教えとうございます
English:
And this foolish mentor wishes to
teach Lord Himmel about the “heart.”

Japanese:
心なんて！
飾りの王には不要だ
そうだろう？
English:
A “heart?”
But an ornamental king has no
need for such a thing, correct?

Japanese:
あなたは決して　飾りではありませぬ
あなたのそのお心が　ご威光に
さらなる恵みを　もたらすのです
English:
You are not a mere “ornament.”
It is that heart which brings more
blessings to thy majesty.

Japanese:
そうですなぁ
かつて　とある賢人の残した言葉が
ありまして…
English: In fact, a wise man once said...

Japanese:
オリフィエルは　話が長いんだよ
もっとたくさん　本を読めばいいんだろ！
読めば！
English:
Orifiel, you talk too much!
As you said, I just have 
to read more books! So be it!

Japanese:
いえ　ですから
ただ読むのではなく…
English: As I said, reading is not--

Japanese:
いいよ　もう！
同じ話ばっかり！
English:
Enough!
You always say the same things!

Japanese: ヒンメルの決断
English: Himmel’s Determination

Japanese: ヒンメル
English: Himmel

Japanese: オリフィエル
English: Orifiel

Japanese:
ラティオは　迷走している
地上人を排除した上に　今はセンサスを
排除するために　戦を続けているなんて
English:
Ratio has gone too far!
First they banish the Terrans, and now
they’re fighting to eliminate Sensus.

Japanese:
これでは　諸悪の根源は
元老院じゃないか！
English: Is it not the Senate that is the source of all this?!

Japanese:
ヒンメルさま
そのようなお言葉が　元老院の耳に
入りますと　危険です
English:
Lord Himmel, it will be dangerous if your
words happen to reach the Senate’s ears.

Japanese:
和を乱すものは　すべて排除する…　か
僕ならラティオに　違う未来を
もたらすこともできる
English:
To banish all those who disturb the world’s harmony... 
If it’s me, then perhaps I can change Ratio’s future.

Japanese: オリフィエル
English: Orifiel

Japanese:
ねえ　オリフィエル
センサスについて　教えてよ
English: Orifiel, tell me what you know about Sensus.

Japanese: オリフィエル
English: Orifiel

Japanese:
なぜ　黙っているの？
天空神として　センサスのことも
知っておくべきじゃないの？
English:
Why aren’t you saying anything?
As a Celestial, shouldn’t I know about Sensus?

Japanese:
もし　ヒンメルさまが
センサスのことを知れば
お心に迷いを　もたらしましょう
English:
I was afraid... that your heart might waver
once you learn of Sensus.

Japanese:
じゃあ　ラティオの王としてではなく
友人として聞くなら　構わない？
English:
Then, would you not mind if you tell your “friend” 
instead of the “king?”

Japanese:
…はい
ですが　お約束ください
不用意な発言はせぬと
English:
Yes... but you should promise me not to make any 
more careless remarks.

Japanese:
僕は知りたいんだ　本当の知識を…
元老院に　押しつけられる知識じゃない
本当の知識を
English:
I want to know about the truth... not what the Senate 
wants me to know... the actual truth.

Japanese:
いいでしょう
センサスは　我々と思想が違う者どもの
総称でございます
English:
Fine, Sensus is the name of those who think 
differently than the Senate.

Japanese:
性質は皆　享楽的で
社会性も　著しく乏しい
それゆえ統制は　取れておりません
English:
By nature they are hedonistic, socially inept, and most 
of all, uncontrollable.

Japanese:
こと戦においては　我々の敵では
ありません…　でした
English:
However, in warfare, they are not our enemies... 
back then...

Japanese:
…でした？
今は　違うのかい？
English: “Back then”...? Is it different now?

Japanese:
将軍アスラが　指揮を執り
兵を　統率するようになってから
戦況が変わりました
English:
Ever since Lord Asura took command of the army, 
the progress of the battle has changed.

Japanese:
今では　ラティオの領土までも
侵略する勢いです
English:
Even now, they are siezing Ratio land with 
unending vigor.

Japanese:
そのアスラも　やはり僕のように
王として　生まれたの？
English: Is that Asura... Is he born to be a king, like me?

Japanese:
いえ
センサスでは　力があれば
誰でも大衆の上に　立つことができます
English:
No, in Sensus, anyone with enough power can rise 
above the masses.

Japanese:
王に生まれなくても　力があれば
人の上に立てる…　ラティオの習わしも
絶対ではないということか
English:
Despite not being a king, as long as one has enough 
power, one can rise above others... So even Ratio’s 
tradition isn’t absolute.

Japanese:
そのアスラという者に　興味が湧いた
その心に　どんな理念があるのか
聞いてみたいところだ
English:
I’ve grown interested in that man, Asura. 
I wish to know what ideology he holds to his heart.

Japanese: 左様でございますか…
English: Yes, indeed.

Japanese:
僕がセンサスに　興味を持てたのは
オリフィエル
君のおかげだよ
English:
Thank you, Orifiel. Without you, I wouldn’t have grown 
interested in Sensus.

Japanese:
…………
でも　僕に心を教えたことを
後悔はしないで
English: But please... do not regret what you have taught me.

Japanese:
…ヒンメルさま
あなたは　あなたの望むままに
お進みください
English: Lord Himmel... Please, follow your heart.

Japanese: 私は　ただ　あなたに付き従うのみ…
English: And I’ll walk alongside you.

Japanese: オリフィエルのお仕置き
English: Orifiel’s Scolding

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: アルベール
English: Albert

Japanese:
そういや　アンジュ姉ちゃん
お尻ペンペンって　なんやの？
English:
Speakin’ of, what’s up with
the spankin’ stuff, Sis Ange?

Japanese:
オリフィエルが　ヒンメルを
しつけるときに使っていた　口ぐせよ
言うこと聞かない子は　お尻ペンペンってね
English:
It is what Orifiel says whenever
Himmel does not want to listen to him.

Japanese:
私は…　オリフィエルは
アルベールの前世
ヒンメルの　教育係だったから
English:
I was-- Orifiel was Himmel’s
instructor, after all.

Japanese:
ほな　ヒンメルって
悪い子やったん？
English: Was Himmel a bad kid?

Japanese:
子どもは　たいてい　やんちゃなものよ
でも　悪いことをしたら
叱らないといけないでしょう？
English:
Children are mischievous creatures.
You must scold them when they
do something wrong, correct?

Japanese:
だから　オリフィエルは
ヒンメルのお尻を…
English: That’s why Orifiel had to spank--

Japanese:
でも　オリフィエルがいなければ
ヒンメルは　心のない人形のように
育っていただろう
English:
That aside, without Orifiel, Himmel would’ve
grown up as a mindless puppet.

Japanese:
そう
オリフィエルと　ヒンメルの間には
身分を越えた　絆があったんだ
English:
Indeed, there was a bond between
Orifiel and Himmel that exceeded
both of their social status.

Japanese:
そんな相手を　しばくっちゅうのは
よっぽど　ヒンメルは
やんちゃやってんなぁ
English:
Ah don’ think Ah can bring mahself ta
beat up a child. Himmel must’ve
been awfully naughty.

Japanese:
ハハハ　まったくヒンメルは
オリフィエルを　困らせてばかりで
しょっちゅう　お仕置きされてたっけ
English:
Hahaha, tell me about it! Himmel always caused
trouble for Orifiel and was scolded a lot.

Japanese:
一番強烈だったのは
先代の天空神の像を
壊してまわったときだったな
English:
The worst was when Himmel ran
around destroying the portraits of
the previous Celestials.

Japanese:
あのときは　天空神と呼ばれる
ヒンメルでさえ　恐れおののく
鬼の形相で　オリフィエルは…
English:
At that moment, the Celestial Himmel
was shaking in fear from Orifiel’s furious--

Japanese:
…アルベール
そこまでにしないと
また　お尻ペンペンですよ
English:
Albert. Say any more than that and
I shall have to spank you again.

Japanese:
う～ん　殿方の尻を叩くなんて
ある意味　優雅な趣味だね
そういうの　僕　嫌いじゃないよ
English:
While I would normally say that the act of spanking a 
gentleman’s ass, such as mine, is rather an inelegant 
hobby... I can’t bring myself to hate the prospect.

Japanese:
うわ…　自分　スカした顔して
なに言うとんねん…
気持ちわるぅ
English:
Man, ya both should look at yer faces.
Yuck.

Japanese: ケルベロスの孤独
English: Cerberus’ Solitude

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
ケルベロス…
創世力の守護者にして
地獄の番人か…
English:
“Cerberus”... The Guardian of the Genesis
and Hell’s Watchdog...

Japanese:
なぁ　アンジュ姉ちゃん
なんでケルベロスが　地獄の番人って
言われとったんか　知っとる？
English:
Hey, Sis Ange, do ya know why
Cerberus is called “Hell’s Watchdog?”

Japanese:
えっ…？
ケルベロスがいた　洞窟の奥に
地獄があったんじゃないの？
English:
Hm? I believe it is because the cave 
Cerberus resided in was called Hell.

Japanese:
ううん　あの奥は死者が転生を待つ間に
過ごすところやったんやけど
地獄っちゅうのとは　また違うねん
English:
Nah, that place is where spirits wait
until it’s their time ta reincarnate,
but it’s quite different from Hell.

Japanese:
あら　そうなの？
私が知らないこともあるのね
English: Oh, really? I was unaware of that.

Japanese:
地獄っちゅうのんはな
「孤独」のことなんや
English:
Rather than “Hell”,
Ah suppose it’s “solitude.”

Japanese: 孤独？
English: Solitude?

Japanese:
創世力が　やたらめったら
人の手に渡らんよう　ケルベロスは
ずっと洞窟で　守ってたんや
English:
Cerberus was protectin’ the Genesis inside
a cave so that no one could use the Genesis.

Japanese:
それも　たったひとりでな
何べん　生まれ変わっても
その役目からは　逃げられへん
English:
An’ he was always alone... No matter how much
he was reborn, that was always his role.

Japanese:
寂しゅうて寂しゅうて
たとえ誰かが来ても　追い払わんとあかん
それが使命やからな
English:
He always had ta drive away anyone 
who approached on his own. 
Since that was his duty.

Japanese:
孤独であり続けるっちゅうんが
まるで地獄なんや　そんで言われててん
ケルベロスは　地獄の番人やって
English:
Ya can say that eternal loneliness is the same 
as Hell itself. That’s why Cerberus was known 
as Hell’s Watchdog.

Japanese:
永遠の孤独…
それは　確かに地獄かも…
English:
“Eternal loneliness”...
(Indeed, it might as well be hell itself...)

Japanese:
そうか　あのシアンって子は
前世から　人に甘える術を
知らないのね
English:
I see... That child, Sian, never knew how to
rely on others even in his previous life.

Japanese:
だから　マティウスの
見かけだけの優しさに
心を奪われてしまった
English:
That is why even the slightest bit of
kindness was enough to win him
over to Mattheus’ side.

Japanese:
せやから　なんとかしたらんと
地獄なんか見るんは
前世だけで　十分や
English:
That’s why we hafta do sumthin’ ’bout it.
He’s already seen enough hell in his
previous life.

Japanese: ケルベロスの記憶
English: Cerberus’ Memory

Japanese: シアン
English: Sian

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
思い出したぞ
おまえは一度　創世力をくれと
言いに来ただろ！
English:
You-- I remember you!
You came to me for the Genesis before!

Japanese: そ…　そうだった…　かな？
English: Huh...? I... did?

Japanese:
創世力を欲しがるヤツは
みんな　ケルベロスに戦いを挑んできた
そして　みんな　死んだ
English:
Everyone who came to get the Genesis
all fought Cerberus and died.

Japanese:
ケルベロスに
戦いを　仕掛けてこなかったのは
アスラと　オリフィエルだけだった
English:
Asura and Orifiel were the only ones
who came to Cerberus and didn’t
challenge him.

Japanese: そうだったの…
English: Oh... I suppose...

Japanese:
でも　おまえは試練を与えるまでもなく
泣きながら帰った
English:
You didn’t even try and get it,
you just cried and left!

Japanese: あら　そんなの昔の話よ
English: Oh my, that was a long time ago.

Japanese:
でも　あまり　その話は
他でして　欲しくないかも
オリフィエルさんの　名誉のためにね
English:
Can you please not mention that again?
For Orifiel’s sake.

Japanese:
…じゃないと　もう抱っこして
あげないから
English: Otherwise I shall not hug you anymore!

Japanese:
…………
抱…　抱っこなんて
一度もしてくれてないじゃないか！
English:
...
A h-hug!?
But you never hugged me in the first place!

Japanese:
あら　そうだったっけ？
じゃあ　今してあげましょうか？
English:
Hm? Is that so?
Then, how about I give you a hug?

Japanese:
い…　いいよ…
今は　頭なでて　もらうくらいでいい…
English:
It’s fine... you can just...
pat me on the head.

Japanese: じゃ　おいで
English: Now, come here.

Japanese:
…………
ボクの友達にも頼む
English:
...
Can you also pet my friends?

Japanese: え…　あ　うん…
English: Huh...? Oh... okay...

Japanese:
えーっと　ケルとベロ…だっけ？
か…　かわいいワンちゃんね
さあ　おいで～
English:
Now, Cer and uh... Berus?
You are both so cute...
come here～

Japanese: ぎゃひゃああ！！
English: Gyaa～!!

Japanese:
なんだ　イヌが苦手なのは
転生しても　治ってなかったのか…
English:
Seems like even reincarnation
