didn’t cure her of her fear of dogs.

Japanese: ケルベロスとヴリトラ
English: Cerberus and Vritra

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
あの子　そないに
悪いヤツやないと　思うんやけどなぁ
English: Ah didn’t think that kid would be that bad.

Japanese: あの子？
English: That kid?

Japanese:
鍾乳洞で　会うた子
前世のケルベロスも
根は悪いヤツやなかったし
English:
Yeah, the kid we met at the cave back there.
Cerberus wasn’t bad before either.

Japanese:
それは　どうかなぁ
前世と今は　違うと思うな
English:
I wonder... I don’t think our current and past lives are
the same.

Japanese: まあ　そやけど…　なぁ
English: Well that’s right, Ah suppose...

Japanese:
ケルベロスって
前世では　直接関わった
憶えがないんだけど　どんなヤツなの？
English:
I don’t think I met Cerberus in my past life.
What kind of person was he?

Japanese:
創世力の　番人だったとか
言ってたじゃん
English:
He mentioned that he was the guardian of the
Genesis or something.

Japanese:
そうや
せやけど　自分からは絶対
手を出さへんヤツやった
English:
Right, but he was the type of guardian that would never
let anyone have the Genesis.

Japanese:
戦うんは　仕掛けてきた相手だけで
ヴリトラにも
手ぇ出したりは　せえへんかった
English: In a fight, Vritra’s the only one Cerberus can’t touch.

Japanese:
ヴリトラって　ケルベロスに
会ったことがあったの？
English: Has Vritra met Cerberus before?

Japanese:
いっつも　ケルベロスは
独りやったからな
ヴリトラが　ときどき会いに行っとったわ
English:
Cerberus was always alone so Vritra visited him once
in a while.

Japanese:
せやけど　いつでも帰れの一点張り
ツラそうな顔しとったな
English:
But, whenever she did, he’d always force her ta
go home with a painful look in his face.

Japanese:
天上界が滅びて　しばらくヴリトラも
ひとりぼっちやったけど
ケルベロスは　もっと孤独やったはずやで
English:
Vritra was alone when Cielo got destroyed,
but Cerberus must’ve felt even more lonely.

Japanese:
創世力を守るために
好きなところにも　行けへんし
誰が来ても　追い返さんとあかんかったし
English:
He couldn’t leave his spot cause he had ta protect
the Genesis and he always had to chase
people who visited him.

Japanese:
誰かと　一緒に過ごしたっちゅう
思い出すらないねん
English:
He prolly doesn’t have many memories with other
folks.

Japanese:
はぁ…　そんなんじゃ
ひねくれ者にも　なるってもんねぇ
English: Anyone would be a contrarian if they’re like that.

Japanese: 思いを寄せる
English: Express your feelings

Japanese: 厳しい事を言う
English: Say something harsh

Japanese:
…寂しい気持ちは　よくわかるよ
僕も　ひとりぼっちだったから
English:
I understand how he felt quite well.
I was also lonely before too.

Japanese:
ひとりぼっちぃ？
あんたの周りには　人いたじゃん
あんたが勝手に　心閉ざしてただけでしょ
English:
You? Alone? You call yourself “lonely” but you’re
surrounded by a lot of people. You’re just shutting 
yourself off from others coz of your own selfishness!

Japanese:
せやなぁ
一緒にしたら　あかんわぁ
English: Yer right. It’d be bad if he comes with us.

Japanese:
…………
そのとおりかもしれないけど
ふたりとも　冷たいなぁ
English:
You’re right about that, but did you
really have to be so blunt?

Japanese:
でも　だからって
マティウスなんかと　一緒にいるのは
彼にとって　良くないよ！
English:
But the fact that he sided with Mattheus
is inexcusable!

Japanese:
お～
いいこと　言うじゃん！
English: That’s one way of saying it!

Japanese:
ほな　ルカ兄ちゃん
どないしたら　ええんやろ？
English: Then what would ya do if it were you, Ruca Bro?

Japanese:
えーと…？
こういう場合
どうすれば　いいんだろ？
English: Hm...? I wonder what I’d do in that situation?

Japanese:
な～んだ　思いつきで
言ってみただけなのね
このおたんこルカ
English:
Aw, so you just said that in the spur of the
moment? You really are a dummy.

Japanese:
ん～　でも　まあウチは
そういう気持ちが　嬉しいなぁ
な？　ルカ兄ちゃん
English:
But, Ah really am glad ya feel 
that way, Ruca Bro, hear?

Japanese: コーダの前世？
English: Coda’s Past Life?

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
そーいやぁ
コーダって　なんで
言葉しゃべれるんだ？
English: So, why can Coda speak?

Japanese:
コーダは　コーダだぞ？
コーダほどの　コーダなら　しゃべるのは
お手の物だぞ　しかし
English:
Coda is Coda, you know?
If you’re as good as Coda then
you’ll also be good at talking though.

Japanese:
ああ　そういや
この前　思い出したんだけどさぁ
ミュース族って　元々天上界にいたのよね
English:
Oh yeah, I just remembered it earlier,
but apparently the Muse Clan was
also in Cielo before.

Japanese:
こいつが　天上界ぃ？
マジかぁ？
ってことは　こいつにも前世が…
English:
This thing was in Cielo?
Really...?
Then this thing also has a past life--

Japanese:
あ…　いや　そういうことじゃなくて
地上人と同じように
罪人として　地上に隔離されたみたい
English:
Oh no, not that. They used to be Cielans,
same as us, but apparently were exiled
to Terro.

Japanese:
ああん？
じゃあ　こいつらも　元神さまなわけ？
冗談だろぉ
English:
Huh? Then these things used to be gods?
You’ve got to be kidding me.

Japanese: んー？
English: Hm?

Japanese:
確かラティオで　農作物の
倉庫番してたんだけど　お腹がすいたからって
保存食を　食い散らかしたんだって
English:
If I recall correctly, they used to work
in Ratio’s warehouse, but ended up eating
the food within it.

Japanese:
だから　一応　ホントに
元神さまなのよね
English:
So, at the very least, they
were gods at one point.

Japanese:
へぇ～
でも　食い意地が　張ってんのは
昔からだったんだな
English:
Ohh... so they’ve always been big
eaters since way before.

Japanese:
それで　怒った大地母神…って
まあ　イナンナの母親なんだけどさ
English:
What they did made the Great Earth Goddess--
rather, Inanna’s mother angry.

Japanese:
その大地母神に
今のミュース族の姿に
変えさせられたんだってさ
English:
So she placed a curse on them, which turned 
them into these... rat monkeys or whatever.

Japanese:
なるほど
それで　地上送りかぁ
English: I see... Then she banished them to Terro?

Japanese:
ううん　本当なら姿を変えられただけで
罰は　終わりだったんだけど
自分で地上に　降りたみたいなのよ
English:
No, the curse on their appearance was
supposed to be the end of it. They chose
to go down to Terro on their own.

Japanese:
自分から　地上に降りた？
なんで　またそんなことを…
English:
They chose to go down to Terro...?
But why?

Japanese:
「天上界の食い物には　もう飽きた」って
言い残して　出てったんだってさ
English:
Well, they left saying that they already
got sick of the food in Cielo.

Japanese:
食い物のために　天上界を捨てるなんて
食い意地も　そこまで張ってりゃ
たいしたもんだよ　筋金入りだな
English:
Leaving Cielo just because of food...
that gluttony’s pretty impressive.

Japanese:
だろー？
さすが　コーダだな　しかし
どうだ　参ったか！　しかし！
English:
Right～?
As expected of Coda though!
Are you impressed now though?

Japanese: 誰も誉めてないっつーの…
English: No one’s praising you though...

Japanese: シアンとマティウス
English: Sian and Matthues

Japanese: シアン
English: Sian

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
なんだよ
ボクに　なにか用か？
English: Wh-What? What do you want?

Japanese: ねえ　５{fixed}＋{variable}８って　いくつ？
English: Hey, what’s 5 + 8?

Japanese:
…えーっと
１６？

なるほどね
誰も　あんたに勉強とか
教えてくれる人いなかったの？
English:
I see.
Didn’t anyone teach you?

Japanese:
あ…　おまえ
またボクのこと
バカだと思ってるだろ！
English:
Y-You...!
You just think I’m stupid, don’t you!?

Japanese:
マティウスさまは　ボクのことを
バカだなんて　言わなかった！
おまえなんかより　いい人だったよ！
English:
Lady Mattheus never told me I was stupid!
She’s better than you are!

Japanese:
そういうつもりじゃないんだけど
でもホントに　そう思うなら
マティウスについて行けば　良かったのに
English:
I wasn’t calling you stupid, but if you 
really think that way then why don’t 
you go back to Mattheus?

Japanese:
そんなの…　マティウスさまが
世界の滅亡を　望んでたなんて
知らなかったし…　しょうがないじゃないか
English:
But... I didn’t know that Mattheus
wanted to destroy the world!
I couldn’t do anything!

Japanese:
なんで　あんた
マティウスなんかの
仲間になっちゃったのよ？
English: Then why did you become Mattheus’ ally?

Japanese:
マティウスさまは　あの姿のせいで
生まれ故郷を　追い出された
English:
Lady Mattheus was forced to leave her
birthplace because of her appearance.

Japanese:
…あの方は
ボクを　孤独から救ってくれたんだ
ボク以上に　孤独だったのに
English:
And that person saved me from loneliness...
despite being lonelier than I was.

Japanese:
なんだか　マティウスの生い立ちって
あんたの生い立ちに　そっくりね
English:
You know, Mattheus’ past feels
pretty similar to yours.

Japanese:
ボクなんかより　ずっと大変だったと思う
故郷を追い出されてからも
王都軍に　追いかけられて…
English:
I think her upbringing was worse than mine is.
Not only was she chased away from her village,
but she was also chased by the Imperial Army--

Japanese:
はあ？　あいつ　異能者として
追いかけられてたの？
今じゃ　教団の大主天さまだってのに？
English:
Huh? So she was chased by the Army
coz she was a Deviant?
Even though she’s the Church’s Great Cielan now?

Japanese:
マティウスさまの力を　利用しようと
枢密院が　目をつけたんだ
English:
The Privy Council wanted to make
use of Lady Mattheus’ power.

Japanese:
生まれ故郷を　滅ぼすって脅迫されて
マティウスさまは　仕方なく
枢密院に　捕まったのさ
English:
Threatened with the destruction of her homeland,
Mattheus had no choice but to hand herself over
to the Council.

Japanese:
でも結局　マティウスさまの故郷は
滅ぼされちゃったんだ…
English: Yet, in the end, her home got destroyed...

Japanese: ど…　どうして…？
English: But why...?

Japanese:
枢密院が　やったんだ
マティウスさまの過去が
教団以外に広まるのを　防ぐためにね
English:
The Privy Council did it. They did it to
prevent others from knowing of Mattheus’ past.

Japanese:
マティウスに　同情するわけじゃないけど
枢密院のやり方も
許せないわね…
English:
I don’t want to sympathize with Mattheus,
but I can’t forgive the Council for that...

Japanese:
そんな　身の上なのに
マティウスさまは　ボクに優しくしてくれた
…ボクは　あの人が大好きだったんだ！
English:
And because of that,
on top of her kindness,
I liked her a lot.

Japanese:
でも　もう　ボク
どうしていいのか　わかんないや
English:
But now, I don’t know what
I should do anymore.

Japanese:
…………いいじゃん
どうしていいのか　わかんなきゃ
なんにもしなくてさ
English:
...And that’s fine.
If you don’t know what to do,
you don’t have to do anything.

Japanese:
あんたは　ここで待ってなさいな
あたしたちで
キッチリ　片をつけたげるから！
English: You wait here and we’ll bring an end to this!

Japanese:
…うん　おまえたちに任せるよ
ボクは　バカで
もうどうしていいか　わかんないから…
English:
Right, I’ll leave it to you guys.
Since I’m an idiot and I don’t
even know what to do next...

Japanese: 神待ちの園について
English: About the Celestial Garden

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アルベール
English: Albert

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
おや？　どうかされましたか？
そんな悲しげな顔
あなたに　似合いませんね
English:
What’s the matter? That sullen expression
doesn’t suit your face at all.

Japanese:
ほら　神待ちの園ってあったじゃん？
あそこ…　なぜか　すっごい寂しい
気持ちになったのよね
English:
You know we’ve been to the Celestial Garden
and all, right? For some reason, that place gives
me a really lonely feeling.

Japanese: それを　思い出しちゃってさ
English: I don’t really know why...

Japanese:
ああ　あなたの前世は
確か　イナンナでしたね
English:
Ahh... I believe you’re Inanna’s
incarnation, correct?

Japanese:
ならば　神待ちの園は
あなたに縁のある場所と　言えなくもない
English:
Then I’d say that place is a place
that’s connected to you.

Japanese: どういう…　意味？
English: What... do you mean?

Japanese:
イナンナの母は　地上に実りをもたらす
大地母神でしてね
憶えてらっしゃいますか？
English:
Are you aware that Inanna’s mother
was the great earth goddess?

Japanese: んまあ　なんとなく
English: Well, somewhat.

Japanese:
大地母神は　地上人に情けをかけ
幾度となく　地上に降りては
慈悲を恵んで　おられたようなのです
English:
Well, she has shown mercy towards Terrans
a great number of times by occasionally
descending unto Terro.

Japanese:
そして　地上人が
大地母神を　お迎えする場所が
あの「神待ちの園」だったのですよ
English:
And the Celestial Garden was the place
that Terrans used to welcome the Earth 
Goddess unto Terro.

Japanese:
へえ～　じゃあ　あたしの中の
イナンナが　母親を想って
寂しがっていたのね
English:
I must’ve been feeling Inanna’s loneliness
while she was waiting for her mother.

Japanese:
な～んだぁ　イナンナって
スカしたイヤな女だと　思ってたけど
そういう　カワイイところもあるんじゃ～ん
English:
Oh, I thought Inanna was an arrogant jerk, but
apparently she does have a cute side too.

Japanese: …ま　まあ　そうかな
English: Oh... uhh... yeah, you could say that.

Japanese:
なんか　スッキリした！
んじゃあね～
English: That felt nice! Thanks! See ya～

Japanese:
その大地母神が　地上人に
殺害された場所でもあるというのは
私の口から　言うべきじゃないな
English:
It was not my place to tell her that was 
where the Great Earth Goddess 
was murdered by Terrans.

Japanese:
神待ちの園が
神を犠牲にして　豊作を祈願するという
原始宗教の元になった…
English:
The Celestial Garden itself being an altar where 
Cielans were sacrificed for good harvest 
as a part of an ancient Terran religion...

Japanese:
そんな話　興味をもって
聞いてもらえるとも　思えないしね…
English:
Either way, I doubt that subject would 
be of interest to her.

Japanese: アスラへの敬愛
English: Asura’s Love and Affection

Japanese: サクヤ
English: Sakuya

Japanese: アスラ
English: Asura

Japanese:
２番　５番部隊は左側を固めてください！
３番　４番部隊は中央から来る敵の迎撃準備を！
English:
Second and Fifth Units, gather to the left! 
Third and Fourth units, prepare to intercept
the enemy at the center!

Japanese: センサス兵
English: Sensus Soldier

Japanese:
サクヤ様！
１番部隊ほぼ壊滅状態です！
English: Lady Sakuya, Unit 1 has decimated!

Japanese: なら　６番部隊をそちらに回します
English: Then send the Sixth unit there.

Japanese: センサス兵
English: Sensus Soldier

Japanese: 了解しました！
English: Yes, ma’am!

Japanese: それと　怪我人をこちらへ運んで……
English: And make sure to carry the wounded--

Japanese: センサス兵
English: Sensus Soldier

Japanese: ！！　サクヤ様！　後ろから…！
English: My Lady! Behind you!

Japanese: えっ？
English: Huh!?

Japanese: 無事か　サクヤよ
English: Are you all right, Sakuya?

Japanese:
ア　アスラさま！？
どうして…！
English: L-Lord Asura!? Why...

Japanese:
有能な指揮官に
何かあったらことだからな
English:
I’ll be damned if something happens
to one of my commanding officers!

Japanese:
アスラさま…しかし
私なんかのためにお怪我を…！
English: B-But, my Lord! You’re wounded! Because of me...

Japanese:
なに　この程度の傷
かすり傷ともいえぬよ
気にすることはない
English: Tis nothing but a scratch. You needn’t worry about me.

Japanese: アスラさま…
English: My Lord...

Japanese:
それよりも　敵陣の左翼を潰した
次はこちらから攻め込む番だ
English:
That said, the enemy’s left flank is weak. 
It’s now our turn to counter-attack!

Japanese:
サクヤ　お前の部隊は中央から
来る敵を全力で迎え撃て
English:
Sakuya, have all of your troops intercept
the enemy in the center.

Japanese: それ以外の敵は　俺が始末する
English: And I’ll take care of the other ones.

Japanese: かしこまりました　アスラさま
English: Understood, my Lord.

Japanese: それでは　俺は行くぞ
English: Let’s go.

Japanese: お気をつけて…
English: Take care, my Lord.

Japanese: センサス兵
English: Sensus Soldier

Japanese: サクヤ様　いかがいたしますか？
English: My Lady, are you alright?

Japanese:
アスラさまの指示通り
中央の敵を迎え撃ちます
それから…
English:
You heard Lord Asura, intercept the
enemy at the center! And...

Japanese: 先陣は私が切ります
English: I’ll be leading the charge myself!

Japanese: センサス兵
English: Sensus Soldier

Japanese:
サクヤ様自らですか！？
危険です！
English:
Y-You’ll be heading in there!?
It’s dangerous, my lady!

Japanese:
心配はいりません
今頃アスラさまのご活躍で敵陣も
崩れているでしょう
English:
You needn’t worry about me. As of this moment, 
the enemy forces are most likely crumbling by now,
thanks to Lord Asura’s efforts.

Japanese: それに…
English: And...

Japanese: センサス兵
English: Sensus Soldier

Japanese: それに？
English: And...?

Japanese:
アスラさまに傷を負わせた不届き者を
許すわけにはいきません…
English:
I’ll never forgive that bastard that
inflicted that wound on Lord Asura...

Japanese: …私が　この手で裁きます
English: By my own hands, I shall bring his judgement!

Japanese:
全部隊に告げます！
これより中央の敵を殲滅します！
English:
Inform all of the units! At this moment, 
we’ll annihilate the enemy forces at the center!

Japanese:
何も恐れることはありません！
私たちには　軍神アスラさまがいます！
English:
There’s no need to fear anything, 
Lord Asura is fighting alongside us!

Japanese:
あの方がいれば
我が軍が敗れることはありません！
English: As long as he’s there, we’ll never be defeated!

Japanese:
すべては
アスラさまとセンサスの未来のために！！
English: All for Lord Asura and Sensus’ future!

Japanese: サクヤとイナンナ
English: Sakuya and Inanna

Japanese: サクヤ
English: Sakuya

Japanese: イナンナ
English: Inanna

Japanese: アスラ
English: Asura

Japanese:
あら　サクヤ
ちょうど　良いところに
English: Oh my, perfect timing, Sakuya.

Japanese: …なにか御用でしょうか？
English: May I help you?

Japanese:
アスラさまのことで
あなたに伝えておきたいことがあるの
今　いいかしら？
English:
There’s something I’d like talk to you about.
Is now a good time?

Japanese: なんでしょう？
English: What is it?

Japanese:
あなたは　アスラの「ただの」部下
私はあの人の恋人
それを　忘れないでちょうだい
English:
Please don’t forget that I’m Asura’s
“lover” and you’re only his “underling.”

Japanese:
…っ！！
仰っている意味が　わかりませんが…？
English: ...!! I don’t understand...

Japanese:
あの人には　私がいる
アスラを支えるのは　私だけで十分ということよ
English:
I’m saying that only I alone am enough
to be the lady who stands alongside him.

Japanese: そういう訳だから　これからは………
English: That’s why, from now on...

Japanese: あら？　なにか言いたいことでもあるのかしら？
English: Oh my, do you have something to say?

Japanese:
私は…　私は…
アスラさまの部下として　あの方を支えます
これからも　この先も　ずっと
English:
Then, as an underling, I’ll support Lord 
Asura with all my might. From now and
always, forever.

Japanese:
あなたになにを　言われようと　邪魔はさせない
私の力が　ほんの少しでも
アスラさまのためになるのなら　なおさら
English:
You don’t have to say anything, I’ll use 
whatever power I have all for him.

Japanese: …あなた　私の話がわかっていなかったようね
English: ...It seems like you didn’t understand what I meant.

Japanese: …わかっていないのは　あなたの方よ
English: ...The one who didn’t understand anything is you.

Japanese:
…ッ！！
なんですって！？
English: ...!! What did you say!?

Japanese: なにをする…のッ！！
English: What are you doing?!

Japanese:
あなたこそ　なにをするのよ！
手を出すなんて！
私はアスラの……
English:
What are YOU doing! Take. 
Your. Hands. Off. Me. I’m his...

Japanese: 先に手を出したのは　そっちでしょう！
English: You’re the one who started it!

Japanese: なにをしているんだ？
English: What are you both doing?

Japanese: アスラさま…　これはその……
English: L-Lord Asura! We’re...

Japanese: サ…サクヤに身の守り方を教わってたの！
English: S-Sakuya’s teaching me self-defense.

Japanese:
え…ええ
どうしてもと　強い希望がありまして…
English:
Y-Yes... 
No matter what, as long as you have the will...

Japanese:
私はいつも　アスラに守ってもらってばかり…
もしものとき　あなたの重荷に
なりたくなかったから…
English:
Since you’re always the one who
was protecting me, I didn’t want to 
become a burden to you...

Japanese: …そうか
English: I see...

Japanese: イナンナ　お前の気持ちは　よくわかった
English: I know how you feel.

Japanese:
しかし　お前に　もしものことなど訪れん
この俺が　そんなことはさせんさ
だから　安心しろ
English:
But nothing will ever happen to you
since I’ll never let such a thing happen. 
Don’t worry.

Japanese: サクヤも　すまなかったな
English: Thank you, Sakuya.

Japanese: ２人
English: Both

Japanese: フン！！
English: Hmph!

Japanese: 僕とイリア１
English: Illia and I 1

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
ねえ　あんたってさぁ
友達　少なそうよね
English: Hey, you don’t have any friends do you?

Japanese:
う…
ものすごく直球だけど
確かに　その通りかも
English:
Ugh...
That’s... a pretty blunt question, isn’t it?
But yeah, you’re right.

Japanese:
でも　いいんだ
あのアスラが　僕だって
わかっただけで　今は幸せなんだもの
English:
I don’t really mind. Just knowing that I 
was Asura is enough to make me happy.

Japanese: へ？　そうなの？
English: Hmm... Really?

Japanese:
だって　だって
ずっと憧れだった　あのアスラが
僕だったんだよ　夢がかなっちゃった！
English:
Because, you know...
I’ve always looked up to him, right?
It’s like a dream come true!

Japanese: ふ～ん　夢がねぇ
English: “A dream come true”, huh...

Japanese:
だってさ　前世という壮大な縁が
イナンナと僕を　巡り合わせてくれたんだよ
なんてロマンチックなんだろう…
English:
Isn’t it romantic that I got reunited with
Inanna thanks to some grand fate...?

Japanese: あ…　そう
English: Yeah sure.

Japanese:
あ…　そうって…
なんだよ
イナンナなのに反応　冷たいなぁ
English:
“Yeah sure”...?
Isn’t that a bit cold, Inanna?

Japanese: 僕とイリア２
English: Illia and I 2

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
イリアの故郷の　サニア村って
南西部にあるんだよね？
English: Your home town’s in the southwest, right?

Japanese:
そうよ
それが　どうかし…
English: Well, yeah...

Japanese:
僕！　本で読んだことあるよ！
銃を頼りに　荒野で生き抜く
タフな人たちばかりなんでしょ？
English:
I’ve read about it in a book!
It’s filled with tough people who rely on guns to survive
the desert, right?

Japanese:
え…　いや
実際は　そんなハデな生活じゃ…
English: Huh? No... We don’t--

Japanese:
僕　読書が趣味なんだけど
南西部のガンマンが　主人公の小説を
読んだことがあるんだ！
English:
I only read books as a hobby, but there was this novel
that had a gunman protagonist set in the southwest!

Japanese:
まあ　その手の小説のおかげで
偏見が…
English: And thanks to that book, you have a prejud--

Japanese:
やっぱり　本はいいよね
だってさ　行ったことのない土地の人と
その土地の話が　できる…
English:
Books are really cool, aren’t they?
Thanks to them, I can talk about a place I’ve never
been to--

Japanese:
ちょっとストップ！　ストップ！
あんた　人の話も聞きなさいよ！
あたしが　しゃべってる途中でしょ？
English:
HOLD. THE. HELL. UP!
Listen to me!
Can you please let me finish SPEAKING!?

Japanese:
…あ　ご…　ごめん
その…　実は…　緊張して
話さなきゃ話さなきゃって　焦って…
English:
Ahh... oh, sorry... I g-get nervous so often so...
th-there are times when I can’t speak...
yeah...

Japanese:
緊張？
な～に言ってんだか
ホント　ヘンなヤツ…
English:
“Nervous?”
What the hell are you talking about?
Weirdo...

Japanese:
だって　しょうがないだろ
君みたいなカワイイ子と　話なんてした
経験ないんだから
English:
I-I mean, isn’t it natural?
I’ve never talked to someone as... as cute as you...
And she’s gone...

Japanese: …と　本人に言えればいいのに
English: I wish I could let her know...

Japanese: 僕とイリア３
English: Illia and I 3

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
なに　ボーッとしてんのよ！
どうせ　あの女のことでも
考えてたんでしょ？
English:
A penny for your thoughts!
I bet you’re just thinking about her again!

Japanese:
ち…　違うよ！
別に　チトセさんのことなんて…
English: N-No! I wasn’t thinking about Chitose or anything...

Japanese:
あたし　チトセなんて
言ってないじゃん！
やっぱり　あの女のこと考えてたのね！
English:
So you really ARE thinking about her!
I didn’t say anything about Chitose!

Japanese:
誘導尋問なんて　ズルいよ！
第一　僕が　なに考えてようと
僕の勝手だろ！
English:
That’s cheating! Don’t ask me those questions 
then accuse me! It’s none of your business! 
I can think what I want!

Japanese:
ちょっと　からかっただけなのに
なに　そんなに怒ってるのよ
English:
Hey, no need to be so angry,
I was just messing with you.

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
あら…
ちょっと　やりすぎたかな…？
English: Did I go too far...?

Japanese: 僕とイリア４
English: Illia and I 4

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
あのさ　イリア…
…ごめんね？
English: Hey... Sorry.

Japanese:
ん～？　んー…　ごめん
なんで　謝られてんのか
サッパリ　わかんない
English:
Sorry? I don’t get it.
Why are you apologizing?

Japanese:
だって　この前…
僕がチトセさんのこと　考えてるって
からかったでしょ？
English:
I mean, about before... you were just teasing me
about Chitose, right?

Japanese:
えーと…　つまり　あんた
あたしに　からかわれて
怒ったことを　謝ってるの？
English:
Okay, so basically you’re apologizing 
for getting mad at me when I teased you?

Japanese:
うん
あのせいで　イリアの気分を悪くしたと思うと
なんだか　胸のつかえが取れなくてさ
English:
Yeah... I thought that I might’ve put you in 
a bad mood and it made me feel bad...

Japanese:
はぁ～
あんたってホント　なんていうか…
バカ？
English:
Hmm... You’re kinda... well, how do I put it?
An idiot?

Japanese:
謝ってるのに
バカなんて　ヒドいよ…
English:
Hey, isn’t it mean to call me an idiot 
when I’m already apologizing?

Japanese:
あ～～～　もうッ！
そうじゃないってば！
English: Damn it...! I didn’t mean it like that!

Japanese:
あの件に関しては
あんたを　からかった
あたしの方が悪いの！　わかった？
English:
It was MY fault for teasing you in the first place!
Okay? Got it?

Japanese:
よ…　よくわかんないけど
わかったよ
ごめんね　イリア
English:
I... Not really... but I think I do.
Sorry.

Japanese:
この期におよんで　まだ謝るか…
もう！
あんた　わかってないッ！
English:
All this and you’re still apologizing!
You just don’t get it!

Japanese: 僕とイリア５
English: Illia and I 5

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
ねえ　イリア
僕　チトセさんの前で　スゴイこと
言っちゃったよね？
English: Hey, Illia, about earlier...

Japanese: ああ　あたしを守るってヤツ？
English:
Is it about the time when you 
told Chitose you’d protect me?

Japanese:
うん
ごめんね…
English: Yeah... Sorry.

Japanese: どうして　謝るのよ
English: Why are you apologizing?

Japanese:
だって　身の程　知らずでしょ
僕が　イリアを守るなんてさ
君の迷惑も　考えずに…
English:
I mean... I shouldn’t have said such a thing...
It must’ve been troublesome for you...

Japanese:
身の程知らずって　なに？
迷惑って　どういう意味よ？
English:
Okay, but why would you think that?
Why do you think it would trouble me?

Japanese:
だって　大きなこと　言っちゃったからさ
でも　気持ちに　ウソはないよ
それだけは　わかって欲しくて…
English:
I mean, it was a pretty bold declaration...
I just... I just want you to know that I 
wasn’t lying back there...

Japanese: ははは…
English: Haha... Bye.

Japanese:
…………
どうしてアイツ　ああなんだろ！
あたし　嬉しかったのに…
English:
Why is he apologizing...?
I was glad that he said it...

Japanese: 僕とイリア６
English: Illia and I 6

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
ルカ
前から　思ってたけど
あんた　自分を卑下しすぎ
English:
Hey, I’ve been thinking about it lately, but...
You beat yourself up too much.

Japanese:
と…　突然　どうしたのさ
でも　そんなことないと思うよ
僕なんてさ…
English:
Wh-why this all of a sudden?
I... I don’t think I do... Since--

Japanese:
ほら　それよ！　それがダメなの！
あんた　頭良いし　育ちもいいし
顔だって　それなりじゃない？
English:
See! You’re doing it again! Look, 
you’re smart, from a good family, 
and you don’t look ugly at all!

Japanese:
そんなこと　ないよ
僕なんてさ…
English: No, not really... I’m not--

Japanese:
だ・か・ら！　それがダメなんだって！
あんたが　そんな風だと　あたしたち
いつまでたっても　対等になれないでしょ
English:
Aight, stop! STOP! If you keep beating 
yourself up like that then we’ll never
be on the same footing.

Japanese:
対等…？
でも僕なんて　人を困らせるだけだし
とても　対等になんて　なれないよ
English:
“Same footing”...? But I always keep causing 
trouble for others... I can never be on equal 
footing with everyone.

Japanese:
あたしは　なりたいのッ！
あんた　これ以降　卑屈禁止ね！
そーいうのが　友達ってもんよ
English:
But I want you to be! Aight, from now on you’re 
banned from demeaning yourself! That’s what 
being friends is all about.

Japanese:
でも　僕　みんなに
迷惑ばかりかけちゃうし…
English: But I’ll cause trouble for everyone...

Japanese:
そんなの　いくらでもかければいいじゃない
あたしだって　みんなに
迷惑かけるじゃん！
English:
Then cause trouble all you want! I’ve always 
been causing trouble for everyone!

Japanese:
だから！　あんたはあたしの
三分の一ぐらいなら
迷惑かけたっていいの！　わかった？
English:
That’s why you’re allowed to cause at least 
a third of my troubles, got that?

Japanese:
卑屈禁止…　か
友達には　迷惑かけてもいいなんて
考えたことなかったよ
English:
Banned from demeaning myself? It... it never 
even occurred to me that I can bother my friends...

Japanese: 僕とイリア７
English: Illia and I 7

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
ねえねえ　この前　言ってたけど
僕にかける　三分の一ぐらいは
イリアに迷惑かけても　いいんだよね？
English:
Hey, you said that I can cause a third of 
your trouble... are you okay with that?

Japanese:
さあ…
そんなこと言ったかしら？
English: Dunno... did I say something like that?

Japanese:
え～！
僕と対等な関係を　築きたいって
言ってくれたじゃないか！
English:
Huh!? But didn’t you say that you wanted 
to be on equal footing with me?

Japanese: どーだったかなぁ？
English: Did I...?

Japanese:
…ズルい
そんなの…　ヒドいよ…
English:
That’s mean... You’re just 
messing with me, aren’t you?

Japanese:
あわわ！　ウソウソ！　ジョーダンよ！
言った　言った！
言いました！
English:
Hey, hey, hey, I was just kidding!
Just kidding, okay? I totally said it.
Now don’t cry...

Japanese:
…グス　じゃ…
じゃあ　具体的には　どの程度まで
迷惑かけていいの？
English: *sob* Th-then... how much trouble can I cause?

Japanese:
はぁ…　そんなこといちいち
面と向かって　聞くなんて
ホント　おたんこルカねぇ
English:
Huh... Don’t come asking me about stupid stuff like
that. You really are a dummy, aren’t you?

Japanese:
あたしが　かける迷惑の
五分の一程度でしょ？
English: Fine... you can cause a fifth of my trouble.

Japanese:
貸せる額なら　１０ガルド
遅刻は３分までで　約束をドタキャンしたら
死刑って感じかな　わかった？
English:
It’s like getting a death penalty after 
borrowing 10 gald and canceling at 
the last minute... I think?

Japanese:
それって　本当に対等なの　僕？
それに　いつの間にか
分母が増えてるし…
English:
Is that even equal footing? Also, did you 
just increase the denominator?

Japanese: 僕とイリア８
English: Illia and I 8

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
あ　そうだ！
ルカ　あんた
火山で　刺された傷の治りは　どうよ？
English:
Oh yeah!
How was the wound you got back in the volcano?

Japanese:
おかげで痛みは　もうないよ
傷跡は　かなり生々しいけどさ
English:
Well, thanks to you it doesn’t hurt anymore,
but it still has a scar.

Japanese:
その傷跡　見たい！　見たい！
っつーか　見せろ！
English: I wanna see it! Show it to me!

Japanese:
ええっ！
今？　ここで？
English: Huh!? Now?

Japanese: ハイハイ　さっさと脱ぐ！
English: Yes, now! Now take off your clothes!

Japanese: えっ　うわ！　ちょっと！
English: Huh? Hey! Wait...

Japanese:
スゴいじゃん！
へえ～　こうなってんだぁ～
English: Whoa...!

Japanese: も…　もういいだろ！
English: Th-that’s enough! Sheesh!

Japanese:
…でもまあ　あんたと
また一緒に　旅ができるようになって
本当に　良かったわ
English: Still... I’m glad that you’re traveling with us.

Japanese:
…え？
ホントに　そう思ってくれてる？
English: Huh? Do you really think so?

Japanese:
当然でしょ！
だって　いじる相手がいないと
旅に　張り合いがないもん！
English:
Of course I really think so!
There’s no point traveling if there’s no one for me to
tease!

Japanese:
…うう
なんだか　ケガで寝込む以上に
ヒドい目に　合わされそうなんだけど…
English: Ugh... this kind of hurts more than being injured.

Japanese: 僕とイリア９
English: Illia and I 9

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
あんたの夢
なんて　言ってたっけ？
English: What was your dream again?

Japanese:
お医者さんになるか
父さんの跡を　継ぐことだよ
English:
Hmm... It’s either becoming a doctor or
succeeding my dad’s business.

Japanese:
んじゃあ　こうしない？
もしあんたが　医者になったら
あたしの建てる学校の　保健医になってよ
English:
Ohh... then how about this?
If you become a doctor, why don’t 
you work at the school I’m gonna build?

Japanese:
もちろん　保健室は
超ゴージャスに　作ってあげるからさ
English:
I’ll definitely build you a 
super duper gorgeous infirmary.

Japanese:
でも　お医者さんじゃなくて
父さんの跡を　継ぐかもしれないよ？
English:
But I might not become a doctor, you know?
I might end up succeding my dad’s business.

Japanese:
そうなったらさぁ　学校に資金援助してよ
あんたんとこほどの　お金持ちなら
指先ひとつで　大金を動かせるんでしょ？
English:
Then you can help fund building my school!
Once you’ve inherited your father’s business, 
you’ll have as much money as you want!

Japanese:
できないよ　そんなこと！
…でも　イリアへの援助なら
なにかの形で　関わりたいな
English:
I can’t just spend money recklessly!
But... BUT I’ll do all that I can to help you in any way
possible.

Japanese:
嬉しいこと　言ってくれるじゃん！
そーまで言うなら
たっぷりと　援助させてあげるからね
English:
Glad to hear you say that!
If that’s the case, then I’ll take as much “help” as I can!

Japanese:
それで　援助には
どんな見返りがあるのかな？
English: Okay, then what kind of benefits do I get if I help you?

Japanese: じゃ　期待してるから！
English: I’m counting on you!

Japanese:
あの…　見返り…は？
僕　お金を出すだけなの…？
English:
What about my benefits...?
Am I just a wallet to you...?

Japanese: 僕とイリア１０
English: Illia and I 10

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
ねえ　イリア
この戦いが　終わったら
僕たち　どうなっちゃうのかな？
English:
Hey, what do you think will happen to us once all of
this is over...?

Japanese:
また　元通り
みんな　バラバラになっちゃうのかな
English:
I guess everyone will go on their separate paths like
before...

Japanese: なに　言ってんの
English: What the heck are you talking about?

Japanese:
たとえ　バラバラになったとしても
人が一度　結んだ絆は
そう簡単に　なくなりゃしないわよ
English:
Look, we might end up walking along our separate
paths but our bonds won’t just break that easily.

Japanese:
スパーダもアンジュもリカルドも
エルもコーダも　コンウェイもキュキュも
み～んな　あたしの宝物だしね
English:
I will always treasure everyone. And by everyone, I
mean Spada, Ange, Ricardo, Hermie, Coda, QQ, and
even Kongwei. No way I’ll forget this journey.

Japanese:
えと…
僕は？
English: What about me?

Japanese: そうねぇ　あんたは…
English: Good question... you’re...

Japanese:
あたしの　主席宝物にしてあげても
いいかな？
English: My very most super duper ultra friend, maybe?

Japanese:
主席かぁ…
光栄だよ
English:
Your “very most super...”?
I’m honored.

Japanese:
でしょう？
さあ　行きましょ！
English:
I know right?
Let’s get movin’!

Japanese: うん　行こう！
English: Sure!

Japanese: 僕とスパーダ１
English: Spada and I 1

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
ああ～
なんか　カッタりぃよなぁ～
English: Man, it’s kinda irritating...

Japanese: ご…　ごめん
English: S-Sorry...

Japanese:
ああ？
なんで　オレの独り言に
いちいち　おめェが謝るんだよ？
English:
Huh?
Why the heck are you apologizing?
I was just talking to myself.

Japanese: ご…　ごめん
English: S-Sorry...

Japanese:
だから　なんで
おめェが謝るんだよ！
English:
What the heck?
Why are you apologizing!?

Japanese:
とにかく　気に障っちゃいけないかと
思って…
English:
I... I just thought that...
I didn’t want to offend you...

Japanese:
おめェさ　オレのこと
気に入らねえことがあったら
すぐ暴れるような人間だとか　思ってねェ？
English:
What? You think I’d go ballistic
every time something that 
I don’t like happens?

Japanese: うん　少し…
English: Yeah, a bit...

Japanese: ンだとォッ　てめェ！
English: YOU BASTARD!

Japanese:
うわッ！
ご…　ごめん！
English: S-SORRY!

Japanese:
冗談だって！　怒っちゃいねェよ
まあ　おめェみてえな　お坊ちゃん
こんな不良　ビビって　当然かもな
English:
Kidding! Ain’t mad at you or anything, though I kinda
get why you’d be scared of a delinquent like me.

Japanese:
僕　不良っぽい人　苦手で
今まで避けてたから…
English:
I... I’m not really good with delinquent types.
I still try to avoid them...

Japanese:
…………
わーったよ
少しずつ　慣らしていってやる
English:
...A’ight, I’ll just take it easy on you until you’re
used to me.

Japanese:
うん…
お願いします
English:
Right...
Thanks.

Japanese: 僕とスパーダ２
English: Spada and I 2

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
イリアが　こぼしてたけどよォ
おまえ　家の様子を　見に帰ったんだって？
English:
Illia was complaining to me earlier, heard that 
you went to check on your place or something.

Japanese:
ちょっと違うけど…
家の近くを　通っちゃったのは　事実だよ
English: N-Not really... but we did pass by it.

Japanese:
ふうん…
まあ　イリアのヒステリーなんかに
付き合う　必要はねェぜ
English:
Hmm...
Welp, no need for you to play along with her hysterics.
Go at your own pace.

Japanese: スパーダは　怒らないの？
English: You’re not mad at me?

Japanese:
コンウェイから
いきさつは　聞いたからな
English: Heard about it from Kongwei.

Japanese:
僕　スパーダにも
怒られるかと　思ってたよ
English: I thought that you’d be angry or something...

Japanese:
コイントスで　担当が決まったんだ
しょーがねェだろ
オレは　そこまで理不尽じゃねェよ
English:
We decided it by coin toss, it was bound to happen.
I’m not that unreasonable.

Japanese: 僕とスパーダ３
English: Spada and I 3

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
なあ　ルカ
おまえ　イリアのこと
どう思ってんだ？
English: Hey, what do you think about Illia?

Japanese:
え？　え？　なんで？
どうして　そんなこと　いきなり…
English: Huh? Wh-what’s this all of a sudden?

Japanese:
だって　おまえ
しょっちゅう　イリアのこと
見つめてんじゃねーか
English: Aren’t you always staring at her?

Japanese:
そ…　そんなことないよ！
たまたま…　イリアのいる方を
見てただけじゃないかな？
English:
I-I’m not! I might’ve just... been staring at her from
time to time... sometimes...

Japanese:
ああそう　ふ～ん…？
だったら　まあいいけどよォ
English:
That so?
Hmm... Well whatever.

Japanese:
スパーダって
まさか　イリアのこと…
い…　いや　思い過ごしだよね…？
English:
Does Spada... does he...
Nah, I must be overthinking it.

Japanese: 僕とスパーダ４
English: Spada and I 4

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
どうした　ルカ？
なんか　顔が暗いぜ
English: Sup, what’s with the long face?

Japanese:
スパーダと　イリアって
仲良いよね…
English: You sure get along with Illia, don’t you?

Japanese: まあ話してて　おもしれェからな
English: Well, it’s fun talking with her.

Japanese:
ねえ　スパーダって
ひょっとして　イリアのことを…
English: Do you perhaps--

Japanese:
ああ？
おいおい　勘違いすんなよ
ただ　話をしてただけだって
English:
Hey, hey, don’t misunderstand, man.
I just like talking with her.

Japanese:
でも　ふたりとも
すごく　楽しそうだったよ
イリアは　僕にあんな顔してくれないし…
English:
But you both look like you’re having fun...
She doesn’t make that face in front of me...

Japanese:
そんなの　知らねェよ！
おまえの頑張りが　足らねえだけだろ？
English:
As if I’d know that!
Aren’t you already trying hard enough?

Japanese:
そうだよね
どうせ　僕なんて…
English: Y-You’re right... Even I...

Japanese:
お…　おい　待てよ！
なにスネてんだ　あいつ…
English:
H-Hey, wait!
Why’d he go off sulking again...

Japanese: 僕とスパーダ５
English: Spada and I 5

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
あのよ　ルカ　おまえって
他人を怒らせたり　不快に思わせるのを
ビビり過ぎてんじゃねェ？
English:
Hey, uhh... Ruca, aren’t you too worried that you’ll end
up offending someone?

Japanese:
うん　そうかも
でも　そうしないと
みんなに　嫌われるし…
English:
Yeah... I guess I am.
But everyone will hate me if I don’t...

Japanese:
あのな！
おめェに　そこまで影響力ねーって！
English: Look, it’s not like you’re popular or something!

Japanese:
うん　そうだよね
僕なんて　どうせ…
English: You’re right, even I--

Japanese:
あ…　イヤ　間違った！
つまり　おまえの態度ってよ
逆に　人の感情を…　えーっと…
English:
No, no, I’m sorry.
What I meant was, with the way you act it’s not like...
uhh... how do I put it?

Japanese:
まあ　とにかく
細かいことは　気にすんなってことだ！
English: Whatever, my point is, don’t worry about trivial stuff!

Japanese: ……どういうこと？
English: What do you mean?

Japanese:
人間関係なんて　相手あってのモンだろ
不満がありゃ　言やァいいんだよ！
ダチってなぁ　そういうもんだろ
English:
Get this, if you’re troubled about something, don’t
hesitate to say it!
We’ll listen to you, that’s what bros are for.

Japanese:
うん…　わかったよ
ごめんね　スパーダ
English:
Right, I understand.
Sorry...

Japanese:
だから　謝るんじゃねェよ
まったく　ホントにわかってんのか
あいつ
English:
Like I said, no need to apologize, man!
Sheesh, he doesn’t get it at all, does he?

Japanese: 僕とスパーダ６
English: Spada and I 6

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
「ダチ」ってさぁ…
「友達」って　言うより
恥かしくないよね
English: Is saying “bro” less embarrassing than saying “friend?”

Japanese:
なんだそりゃ？
おまえ　「友達」って呼ぶの
恥かしいのか？
English:
What?
You embarrassed about me calling you a “friend”
or something?

Japanese: なんだか　照れ臭くならない？
English: You’re not embarrassed about it?

Japanese: ならねェよ
English: Course I’m not.

Japanese:
じゃあ　どうして「ダチ」って
略して　言うの？
English: Then why are you using “bro” instead of “friend?”

Japanese:
そりゃあ　短い方が
言いやすいからに　決まってんだろ
他に　なにがあるんだよ？
English:
Well, it’s easier to say, for once. So of course I’ll say it.
What? Got another alternative for me or something?

Japanese:
そ…　そうなんだ
ううん　なんでもないよ
English: Ohh... Nevermind then.

Japanese:
ダチに　恥ずかしいもクソもねェだろ
ヘンなヤツ
English:
Course I won’t be embarrassed about my friends.
Weirdo.

Japanese: 僕とスパーダ７
English: Spada and I 7

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
やっぱり　僕と話すときのイリアって
スパーダと　話すときみたいには
楽しそうじゃない気がするんだ
English:
As I thought, Illia looks like she enjoys talking with you
more than with me.

Japanese:
それは　おめェに
ユーモアの精神が
足りないからじゃねェ？
English: I wonder if it’s coz you don’t have a sense of humor...

Japanese:
ユーモアかぁ
確かに僕　苦手かも
English:
Well, you might have a point.
I’m not really good with jokes...

Japanese:
んじゃ　いっちょ練習だ
なにか　言ってみな
English: Then, why not try practicing with me?

Japanese: えーっと　えーっと…
English: Alright, let’s see... hmm...

Japanese:
ある日　王宮に向かって
「王さまのバカ！」と　叫んだ男が
逮捕されました
English:
One day, a man gets captured for shouting
“The King is stupid!” in the palace.

Japanese:
男の罪状は　ふたつ
ひとつは不敬罪
そして　もうひとつは…
English:
The man was charged with two crimes, the first was
tarnishing the King’s name and the second was...

Japanese: 国家機密漏洩罪でした！
English: ...Revealing state secrets!

Japanese:
タハハ…
なるほどねェ…
English: Ohh haha... I get it.

Japanese:
やった！　僕の冗談で笑った！
よぉ～し　さっそく
イリアにも　試して来よう！
English:
Yay! I did it!
I’ll go try telling Illia about it!

Japanese:
やべェ…　ただの愛想笑いだったのに
おかしな自信　つけちまったかな
…まあ　大丈夫か
English:
Crap, I was just smiling out of consideration...
I hope that didn’t give him some weird ideas...
Welp, he should be fine.

Japanese:
なにが　国家機密漏洩罪よ！
王さまが　バカなんじゃなくて
あいつが　バカなんじゃないの！？
English:
What “state secrets!?”
It’s the guy that’s stupid, not the king!

Japanese: 大丈夫じゃなかったみたいだな…
English: ...or not.

Japanese: 僕とスパーダ８
English: Spada and I 8

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
スパーダが　子どもの頃の
ハルトマンさんって　どんな風だったの？
English: What was it like being a kid under Hartman’s care?

Japanese:
いきなり　なんだよ
そんな話　聞いてどうすんだ？
English:
What now?
Why do you want to know such a thing?

Japanese:
ただの興味本位だよ
スパーダのこと
知りたいからね
English:
I was just wondering.
I want to get to know you better...

Japanese:
あ～…　とにかく　口うるさかったな
あれしろ　これしろ
あれはするな　これはするなってよ
English:
Well, he was always nagging at me...
“Do it like this”, “Do it like that”, “That is...”
and so forth.

Japanese:
なにかあると　ふたことめには
騎士たるものはって　感じでさ
English:
Whenever something happens, he’ll always go on and
on about me being a knight. Something like that.

Japanese:
ハルトマンさん　言ってたもんね
「騎士としての　立ち振る舞いが重要」だって
English:
Hartman did say something about your
“demeanor as a knight”...

Japanese:
…でも　その期待には
応えられてねェよな　オレ
English:
I don’t really think I was able to 
meet his expectations though...

Japanese: そんなことないよ！
English: That’s not true!

Japanese:
家柄とか　身分とかじゃない
騎士の本当の生き方を
スパーダは知ってると　僕は思うよ
English:
I don’t think being a knight has anything to do with
your “position” or “lineage”, but with the way you live!

Japanese:
だといいけどな
オレは　オレのやり方でしか
騎士になれねェからよ
English:
I sure hope so. If I’m becoming a knight, 
then I want to do it my own way.

Japanese: 僕とスパーダ９
English: Spada and I 9

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
ねえ　スパーダって
女の子に　告白したことある？
English: Hey, have you ever been confessed to?

Japanese:
ったりめーよ！
なんで　オレが不良っぽい
雰囲気　出してると思ってんだよ！
English:
Course I’ve been confessed to!
Why do you think I’m acting like a delinquent?

Japanese:
モテるからに　決まってんだろ？
結構いるんだよ
「不良っぽい男」がタイプって子がよ
English:
It’s coz it’s trendy, got it?
There’re a lot of ladies out 
there that like the bad boy type.

Japanese:
そ…　そうだったのか…
いいなぁ　モテるなんて
English: Ohhh... It must be nice being popular...

Japanese:
あ…　ああ
じゃあ話は　このへんで…
English: R-Right... then bye--

Japanese:
あ！　待ってよ！
何人ぐらいと　付き合ったの？
English:
W-Wait up!
How many girls have you gone out with?

Japanese:
ああ！？
あ～　そのぅ　な…　なんだ
よ…　４人？
English:
Huh?
Well... hmm... uhh... why?
Four maybe...?

Japanese:
４人も？
すごいね　経験豊富！
English:
Four? Whoa! Amazing!
You must be pretty experienced then!

Japanese:
ああ　いや…
やっぱ　３人だったかな？
English: Ahhh wait... maybe it was three after all...

Japanese: どっちなの　３人？　４人？
English: So, is it three or four?

Japanese:
いや…　正確にはふたり
……
ホントは　ひとりだけだよ！
English:
No, I guess it’s really two...?
...Okay, okay, to be honest with you,
I’ve only been in a relationship once!

Japanese: 見栄　張らなくていいのに…
English: You didn’t have to force yourself...

Japanese: 僕とスパーダ１０
English: Spada and I 10

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
なあ　ルカ
今度　手紙の書き方
教えてくれねェ？
English: Hey, can you teach me how to write a letter next time?

Japanese: いいけど　誰に出すの？
English: Sure, who are you going to write to?

Japanese:
まあ　そのなんだ…　実家だよ
仕事の世話してもらえねえかってよ
English:
Well, I was wondering how I can help out in the house
or something.

Japanese:
ボチボチ　この戦いが
終わった後のこと
考えとこうと思ってな
English:
I’ve been thinking a bit about what I’ll be doing after
all this...

Japanese:
仕事して　出世して　屋敷かまえて
ハルトマンに　オレの子どもの
教育係を頼んだりな　良さそうだろ？
English:
I’m gonna climb up in life, build a mansion, 
then ask Hartman to teach my kids.
How does that sound?

Japanese: へえ　素敵な計画だね
English: That’s an admirable plan.

Japanese: んじゃ　頼んだぜ
English: Right, I’m counting on you.

Japanese:
スパーダが　将来のこと
マジメに考えてたなんて…
僕も　考えておかなくっちゃ
English:
To think that he’s been thinking 
about his future seriously...
I have to think about mine too.

Japanese: 僕とアンジュ１
English: Ange and I 1

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ねえ　ルカくん
あなた　私と話するとき
目を合わせようとしないのね
English:
You avert your eyes whenever we speak, 
do you not, Ruca?

Japanese:
僕　人と目が合うと
なんだか　文句を言われる気がして…
ごめん　クセなんだよ
English:
I... I think people will just complain whenever I look
them in the eyes... I’m sorry, it’s a habit of mine.

Japanese: 私が　そんな風に見える？
English: Do you really think of me that way?

Japanese:
…ううん
優しそうな人だよ
English:
N-No...
You seem nice...

Japanese:
あら　優し「そう」じゃなくて
優しいつもりなんだけどなぁ
English:
Oh my, I believe you meant that 
I “am” nice instead of I “seem” nice...

Japanese:
とにかく　ルカくん
私と　話すときは
きちんと　目を合わせてくれる？
English:
Anyways, can you please look me in the eyes
whenever we talk?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
ずっと　そうやって　下を向いて
人と話をするつもり？
ほら　目を見て話す練習してみようよ
English:
Do you intend to always look down at the ground
whenever you speak to people? Come now, why not
practice getting used to making eye-contact?

Japanese: うん…
English: Okay...

Japanese:
そうそう
そうやって　顔を上げて
ね？　私との約束よ
English:
There we go, promise me that you shall 
always look up whenever you speak to 
others, okay?

Japanese: うん　わかったよ
English: O-Okay...

Japanese: 僕とアンジュ２
English: Ange and I 2

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ふふふ
ルカくんも　お年頃ね
English: *giggle* You have grown, Ruca.

Japanese:
え…　なに？
ど…　どういう意味？
English:
H-Huh? What?
What do you mean?

Japanese:
好きなんでしょ？
イリアのこと
English: You have feelings for Illia, do you not?

Japanese:
そ…　それは！
ただ前世で　恋人だった縁って言うか
なんと言うか　そのぅ　深い意味は…
English:
H-Hey, we w-were just lovers in our past lives,
that’s all...

Japanese:
でも　スパーダくんの話じゃ
そういうことになってるけど？
English:
However according to Spada, there is something
between the two of you, correct?

Japanese:
それは　スパーダの冗談で
そんなんじゃないよ
僕は別に…　その…　あの…
English:
He was just kidding about it...
It’s not like I... uhhh... hmm...

Japanese:
ルカくん　あれで
隠せてるつもりなのかなぁ…
English: I wonder why he is hiding it...

Japanese: 僕とアンジュ３
English: Ange and I 3

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ねえ　アンジュ
僕　イリアと
もっと仲良くなりたいんだ
English:
Ange, do you know a way with which I can get along
with Illia?

Japanese:
あら　ふたりは
とても仲良さそうだけど？
English:
Hmm...?
It seemed that you two were getting along though...

Japanese:
でも僕って　イリアを怒らせてばかりで
どうすれば　気に入ってもらえるのか
さっぱり　わからないんだ
English:
But I always make her angry.
I don’t know what to do...

Japanese:
そうねぇ…　ルカくんはね
自分のことばかりなのよ
自分のことで　もういっぱいいっぱい
English:
I see...
Well, I believe you should have more confidence
in yourself.

Japanese:
他の人に　気を遣って
迷惑にならないよう
心がけてるつもりなんだけど…
English:
B-But I-I’m trying to be more considerate of others so
I don’t trouble them...

Japanese: 「つもり」でしょ？
English: You are “trying”, correct?

Japanese:
「迷惑をかけない」なんてことに
こだわってたら
本当のお友達には　なれないと思うな
English:
I do not believe you will end up being close to them if 
you keep fussing about troubling others.

Japanese:
アンジュの言ってること
僕には　わからないや…
English: I... I don’t understand.

Japanese:
…おかしいなぁ
頭のいい子のはずなのに
どこで　こじらせちゃったのかなぁ
English:
How strange... he is supposed to be smart, but...
Where did he get confused?

Japanese: 僕とアンジュ４
English: Ange and I 4

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ねえ　アンジュ　僕　ガラムで
３日も寝込んじゃって　ごめんね
みんなに　迷惑かけちゃった
English:
Ange, back in Garam...
I’m sorry I was unconscious for three days.
I’ve troubled you all...

Japanese:
そんなの平気よ
それに　みんな　あなたが寝てる間に
適当に遊んでたから
English:
It is fine.
Everyone just had a good time outside while
you were sleeping.

Japanese:
むしろ　寝込んでくれて
感謝してたんじゃないかなぁ
English:
If anything, I believe everyone was grateful that 
you were asleep.

Japanese:
う…
それは　ちょっと
ズルいかも…
English: Hm... that’s a bit mean...

Japanese:
あら　じゃあ　全員で
あなたに　付きっ切りだった方が
嬉しかったかな？
English:
Then, would you be happier if everyone paid attention
to you the whole time?

Japanese:
そ…　そんなことされたら
僕　罪悪感で死んじゃうよ…
English:
N-No!
If they did that, I’d feel bad...

Japanese:
でしょう？
余計な気遣いが
必要のないときだってあるのよ
English:
See?
There are times when you need not worry about
everyone else.

Japanese:
うん…　そうだね
僕　気遣いが足りなくて
みんなに　嫌われるかと思ってた
English:
You’re right...
I thought that everyone would hate me if I wasn’t
considerate enough.

Japanese:
ところで　アンジュは
なにして遊んでたの？
English: By the way, how did you enjoy yourself?

Japanese:
私は温泉
ガラムの温泉って　初めてだったけど
おかげで　お肌ツルツル
English:
I went to the hot springs. It is the first time I have 
been to Garam’s hot springs. Thanks to it, 
my skin is all smooth.

Japanese: ほら　ちょっと見てみる？
English: Would you like to feel it?

Japanese: ええっ！　いいの！？
English: Huh!? I’m fine!!

Japanese:
冗談よ…
ルカくんも　やっぱり男の子なのね
English:
I am just kidding...
You really are a boy.

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: 僕とアンジュ５
English: Ange and I 5

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
あら　ルカくんったら　ほっぺに
朝食のパンくず　つけたままにして…
しょうがないなぁ
English:
Ruca, there are still some breadcrumbs on your cheeks
from breakfast.

Japanese:
はい　ハンカチ
これで　拭いて
English: Here, use my handkerchief.

Japanese: うん　ありがとう…
English: Oh, thanks.

Japanese:
ああ　まだくちびるの下
右側にも　ついてるわよ
私から見て右　ルカくんの左側
English:
You missed a spot.
There is still some on the bottom of your lips.

Japanese:
うん…
ありがとう
新しく　買って返すから
English:
Thank you for the handkerchief, I’ll be sure to get you
a new one.

Japanese:
いいのよ　そんなことしなくて
ハンカチなら
たくさん持ってるから
English:
It is fine, you need not do that.
I have more with me.

Japanese:
なんだか　このハンカチ
いい匂いがするなぁ
アンジュの匂いだ…
English:
It smells kind of nice...
Almost like Ange...

Japanese: 僕とアンジュ６
English: Ange and I 6

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: アイタタタ…
English: Ow...

Japanese:
どうしたの　アンジュ
腰を痛めちゃった？
English:
What’s wrong?
Did you hurt your waist?

Japanese:
激しい接近戦の後は　あちこち筋肉痛で…
腰だけじゃなくて
首と肩と太ももと　ヒザも痛くて…
English:
Just muscle pains from the fighting...
It is not just my waist, but also my neck, 
shoulder, butt, and knee... Ow...

Japanese:
それって
ほとんど全身じゃないか！
大丈夫なの？
English:
That’s almost your whole body!
Are you alright?

Japanese:
今まで　ずっと運動不足だったし
私も　いよいよ歳かなぁ…
English:
I have not been exercising until recently.
I wonder if it is because... I am getting older.

Japanese:
もう！
アンジュは　まだハタチでしょ？
運動不足を　歳のせいにしてるだけだよ
English:
Sheesh! You’re still twenty, right?
You’re just blaming your age for 
your lack of exercise!

Japanese:
うう～　ルカくんが冷たいよぅ
もう　あっち行っちゃうもん！
English:
That was very cold-hearted of you, Ruca!
I am going to go on ahead...

Japanese:
アンジュが　スネちゃった…
珍しいなぁ
English:
Ange sulking... 
Now that’s something you don’t see often.

Japanese: 僕とアンジュ７
English: Ange and I 7

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ねえ　ルカくん
イリアとの関係
最近　どうなの？
English:
Hey, Ruca, how has your relationship 
with Illia been lately?

Japanese:
うーん…　イリアって
僕と話をすると　イライラするみたい
なんだか　怒ってる気がするんだ
English:
Well, she always seems to get irritated whenever
I try to talk to her... I wonder if she’s angry at me?

Japanese:
それって　イリアが
あなただけには本音を
見せてるってことじゃない？
English: Perhaps she is just showing you how she really feels?

Japanese: どういう意味？
English: What do you mean?

Japanese:
近頃のイリアは
みんなへの　気遣いが感じられるもの
English:
Lately, it seems like she has been the one always 
worrying about everyone.

Japanese:
ワガママで　世間知らずな
お嬢さんじゃなくなってきたみたい
English:
It seems that she is not the selfish, naive, little girl we
used to know.

Japanese:
へぇ…
僕　全然　気がつかなかった
English:
Wow...
I never noticed...

Japanese:
気が強くて　ガンコなのは
相変わらずだけど　私の前では素直だもん
English:
She is still the same old stubborn and strong-willed
girl. However, she is meek when she is around me.

Japanese:
エルの面倒は　ちゃんと見るし
リカルドさんや　コンウェイさんとも
それなりに　仲良くしてるみたいだし
English:
She watches over Hermana and seems to get along 
well with Kongwei and Sir Ricardo.

Japanese: じゃあ　どうして僕とだけ…
English: Then why only me...?

Japanese:
私は　うまく接してると
思うけどな
English:
I cannot quite say for certain, however I believe she
treats you well.

Japanese:
…全然　そうは思えないんだけどなぁ
はぁ…　わかんないや
English:
It really doesn’t seem that way though...
Sigh... I don’t get it...

Japanese:
う～ん　もうちょっと背中を
押してあげるべきかなぁ？
English: Perhaps I could have encouraged him a bit more?

Japanese:
でも　余計な手は
出さない方が　いい気もするし…
難しいなぁ
English:
Yet I feel like I should mind my own business...
How strange.

Japanese: 僕とアンジュ８
English: Ange and I 8

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
コホン　ルカくん？
女性の胸元を　そんな風に
見つめちゃ　ダメよ？
English:
Ahem, Ruca?
Please do not stare at women’s chests in that manner.

Japanese:
ち…　違うよ！　首飾りを見てたんだよ！
リカルドに　預けたのと
別のを付けてるなって…
English:
I-I’m not! I’m just looking at your necklace!
It looks different than the one that you gave
to Ricardo...

Japanese:
あら　そう？
この首飾りはね　私が　初めて
もらった物だから　気に入ってるの
English:
Is that so? Are you curious about it?
This is the first necklace that I have received, you see.

Japanese:
安物だけど　ちゃんと聖印も入ってるし
こういう物は
信じる気持ちが　大切だから
English:
It is far cheaper than the necklace I gave to him, but it
also has a holy mark. It is not much, but it is important 
to have faith in things like this.

Japanese:
信じる気持ちか…
うん　そうだね
English: Faith, huh...

Japanese:
ところで　ルカくん
本当に私の胸　見てなかった？
微妙に　口元がゆるんでたんだけど
English:
At any rate, are you sure you were not looking at my 
chest? Your mouth was slightly agape, you know.

Japanese:
実は…　見てました
天に　そしてアンジュに謝罪します
ごめんなさい
English:
To be honest... I was.
I’m sorry, I hope both Cielo 
and you may forgive me.

Japanese:
はい　正直な告白には
天も私も　許しを与えます
English:
Very well, both Cielo and I will forgive you for 
being honest with your confession.

Japanese: 僕とアンジュ９
English: Ange and I 9

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ねえ　アンジュって
どんな子どもだったの？
English: What were you like as a child, Ange?

Japanese:
あら　どうしたの？
いきなり
English: Oh my, why the sudden question?

Japanese:
そういえば　アンジュの
子どもの頃の話
聞いたことがなかったなって
English: Well, I don’t really know much about your childhood.

Japanese:
ん…っと　私の子ども時代は
神学校とともにあったわね
English: Hmm... As a child, I had to attend a seminary.

Japanese:
成績は　中の上だったかなぁ
体育は　万年ビリだったけど…
English:
My grades were above average, 
but my PE grades were rock bottom...

Japanese:
神学校って
堅苦しいイメージがあるよね
English:
Was it hard?
Seminaries always gave off a strict impression.

Japanese:
そんなことないわ
友達も　たくさんいたし
私　毎日を心から楽しんでたと思う
English:
Not really, I made many friends there and I enjoyed
all the days I spent studying.

Japanese:
毎日が楽しい…　か
僕もそうなれるように
頑張らないと
English: Enjoyed, huh... I should try my best too!

Japanese:
頑張る必要なんてないわ
ただ　楽しめばいいの
みんなと　一緒にね
English:
You do not have to work hard to have fun, it will just
come naturally the more you spend time with others.

Japanese:
そ…　そうだね
うん　頑張るよ！
English:
Y-You’re right.
I’ll try my best!

Japanese:
だから
頑張らなくていいってば…
English: Like I said, you do not have to...

Japanese: 僕とアンジュ１０
English: Ange and I 10

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
そろそろ　この旅が終わった後のこと
考えておかなくちゃ
う～ん…
English:
It is about time that I start thinking 
about what I should do after all this...
Hmm...

Japanese:
どうかしたの　アンジュ？
なにか困ってるみたいだけど
English:
What’s wrong, Ange?
You seem troubled.

Japanese:
ナーオスの大聖堂を直すために
予算申請書を　提出しないと
いけないんだけど…
English:
It is just that I should start preparing a budget 
proposal for rebuilding the Cathedral.

Japanese:
？？？
申請書　書けばいいんじゃないの？
English: A proposal? Can’t you just submit one?

Japanese:
でも教団と王都軍が　戦争を始めちゃうし
国の援助は　もう受けられそうにないから…
この後　教団は　どうなっちゃうのかしら？
English:
The Church and the Army are about to start a war, so it
will be hard to get support from the country at this time.
I wonder what will happen to the Church from now on?

Japanese:
この戦いが　終わっても
私は　万事ハッピーエンドってわけには
いかなさそうね
English:
And even when the war ends, there is no guarantee
I shall have a happy ending for myself.

Japanese:
ふふ！
アンジュが　僕にグチるなんて
なんだか　新鮮だな
English:
Haha, it’s the first time you’ve complained to me.
It’s quite refreshing.

Japanese:
あ…　あら！　私ったら…
ごめんなさいね　ルカくん
退屈だった？
English: O-Oh! I am sorry! Did I bother you?

Japanese:
ううん　僕が
アンジュの　心の支えになれるんだったら
逆に嬉しいよ
English:
Not at all, I’m just happy that I get to
support you this time.

Japanese:
ああん　もうルカくんったら　いい子ね
その人徳なら　立派な伝道師になれるわ
ねえ　いっそ教団に　入信しちゃわない？
English:
Oh, Ruca, you are so kind! Would you like to join the
Church some time? With that kindness, you can grow
up to become a splendid evangelist.

Japanese:
…すべてが　終わったら考えるよ
今は　とにかく　創世力を
取り返さなきゃね！
English:
Let’s leave that for later...
For now, we should focus on getting back the Genesis.

Japanese:
そうね
頑張りましょう！
English:
You are correct.
Let us do our best!

Japanese: 僕とリカルド１
English: Ricardo and I 1

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
ルカ
おまえたちと　アンジュの関係を
知っておきたい
English:
Ruca Milda, I want to know what Ange’s 
relationship with everyone else is.

Japanese:
依頼人の周囲を
警戒してるってこと？
English: Are you wary of us?

Japanese:
まあ　そういうことだ
場合によっては　おまえたちから
アンジュを　引き離すのも手だからな
English:
Basically, yes. There might come a time when 
I’ll have to take her away from you guys.

Japanese:
そんなの
アンジュが　納得するかなぁ？
English:
Is Ange aware of this? Do you think 
she’ll agree to such a thing?

Japanese:
しないだろうが　彼女を守るためなら
俺は　どんな方法も厭わん
それで　おまえたちの関係は？
English:
Perhaps not, but I’m prepared to take on her
resentment if it means protecting her. 
That being said, what’s your relationship?

Japanese:
う～ん…　でも答えにくいなぁ
みんな　最近知り合っただけで
まだ説明できるような　人間関係なんて…
English:
Hmm... we just met so it’s pretty hard to 
find an answer to your question.

Japanese:
最近　知り合っただけか…
どうりで　打ち解けていないはずだ
English:
“Just met”, huh...
That explains everyone’s answers.

Japanese: でしょう？
English: Everyone’s answers?

Japanese:
ああ…
特に　おまえがな
English: Yes, especially yours.

Japanese:
え…
僕が　打ち解けてない？
English: Huh...? Me?

Japanese: やっぱり　そうなのかな…
English: Is that really the case?

Japanese: 僕とリカルド２
English: Ricardo and I 2

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
リカルドさんって
ライフルを　使うんだね
English: So you use a rifle?

Japanese:
ああ　自分は傷つかず
敵を無力化できる
便利な武器だ
English:
Indeed, I can incapacitate the enemy without 
getting wounded. It’s quite a handy weapon.

Japanese:
前世で使ってた鎌は
使わないの？
English: Why not a scythe like before?

Japanese:
前世で使っていたからといって
なぜ現世でも　使わねばならんのだ？
English:
Pray tell, why do I have to use a scythe in this 
life just because I used one in the past?

Japanese:
だって　それは…　その…
そういうものじゃないの？
English: Because... uhh... isn’t that how it is?

Japanese:
俺は　これまで一度も
鎌を武器として　扱った経験がない
English:
I’ve never used a scythe before, 
unless you count my memories.

Japanese:
おまえは　前世で大剣を扱っていたから
今も使っているのか？
English:
Are you telling me that you’re using a great sword in
this life because you used to use one before?

Japanese: もちろん　そうだよ！
English: Of course!

Japanese:
フン…
俺は　あんなものを武器として使うのは
ごめんだ
English:
I see... Well, sorry to disappoint you, but I’m 
not going to use a scythe.

Japanese:
なにか　前世で
イヤな思い出でもあったのかな
English: I wonder if it reminds him of something...?

Japanese: 僕とリカルド３
English: Ricardo and I 3

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: はぁ…　イリア…
English: Oh, Illia...

Japanese:
これ見よがしな溜息だな　ルカ
フン　いいだろう
聞いてやるから話せ
English:
That’s quite a sigh. Fine, spill. 
Let me hear what’s troubling you.

Japanese:
え？　いや…
僕は　特に聞いて欲しい話なんて…
English:
Huh? What...? Oh, there’s 
nothing I want to talk about...

Japanese:
そうか
なら　話は終わりだ
English:
Is that so?
Then so be it.

Japanese: あ！　待ってよぉ～！
English: Hey, wait!

Japanese:
せ…　せっかくだから
聞いてもらおうかな…
English:
Since you’re here and all... 
Could you hear me out?

Japanese:
実は僕…
イリアと　仲良くしたいんだけど
うまく行かなくて　悩んでいるんだ
English:
To be honest with you, I’m worried that 
I won’t be able to get along with Illia...
I want to though...

Japanese:
気持ちを　素直に伝えればいい
相手も　おまえの好意に気がつかぬほど
鈍感ではあるまい
English:
Then be honest and tell her outright. I’m sure 
she’s not thick-headed to the extent of being
oblivious to your feelings.

Japanese:
まあ　気がつきながらも
あえて　無視しているのかもしれんがな
English:
Although, there is a chance that she already 
knows and is just ignoring them on purpose.

Japanese:
もし　わざと無視してるんだったら
どうして　そんなイジワルするんだろう…
僕　怒らせたのかな？
English:
If she’s ignoring them, then why does
she keep teasing me? Did I make her 
mad somehow?

Japanese:
ふむ…　違うな
鈍感なのは　イリアではなく
おまえだ　ルカ
English:
Hah... Then, you must have mistaken something.
The thick-headed one is not Illia, but you.

Japanese:
え…？
それって　どういう…
English: Huh? What do you--

Japanese:
自分で考えろ
大人に頼るなぞ　ガキの甘えだ
English: Think for yourself, relying on adults is childish.

Japanese: うん…　わかったよ
English: Alright, I will...

Japanese:
やれやれ
本当に　ただのガキだな…
English: Good grief, I suppose he really is a brat.

Japanese: 僕とリカルド４
English: Ricardo and I 4

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
ねえ　リカルド
前に話を　聞いてもらったでしょ？
その…　イリアのこと
English:
Hey, do you remember the time 
when we talked about Illia?

Japanese:
ああ　結局
おまえが　鈍感なガキだという話に
落ち着いたな
English:
Ahh, yes. I believe we’ve established that 
you were thick-headed that time.

Japanese:
それで　おまえ自身は
どうしたいのだ？
English: So, have you reflected on yourself?

Japanese:
たぶん　なにもしないと思う
余計なことをして
もし　気まずい関係になったら…
English:
I think I might have done something unnecessary 
and made her uncomfortable...

Japanese:
一緒にいるのも　辛くなる
そうなるくらいなら
今のままで　いいと思うんだ
English:
If it will just get harder the more I try, I think 
it would be best if I just leave her alone.

Japanese:
えらく　消極的だな
こんな　ご時世だ
明日　死ぬかもしれんのだぞ？
English:
How pessimistic. If you don’t say it now, you might
end up dying without ever having told her, you know.

Japanese:
そう簡単には　死なないよ
だって　アンジュとの契約があるから
僕たちのこと　守ってくれるんでしょ？
English:
We’re not going to die that easily. After all, it’s
in your contract to protect us, right?

Japanese:
まあな
だが　言ったはずだろう
大人に頼るのは　ガキの証拠だぞ
English:
Pretty much, but let me remind you that your reliance
on me, an adult, is just further proof that you’re still a
child.

Japanese: ガキの特権だよ
English: As a child, it’s my priviledge.

Japanese:
ほう…
言うようになったじゃないか
English: Hah, well said!

Japanese:
僕だって　いつまでも
ガキじゃないってことだよ！
English: Even I won’t be a child forever!

Japanese:
…………
守ってやりたいとは思うが…　な
English: ...I’d like to protect you... but...

Japanese: 僕とリカルド５
English: Ricardo and I 5

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
ねえ　リカルド
リカルドってば！
English:
Ricardo?
Hey, Ricardo!

Japanese:
…………ッ！？
なんだ…　おまえか
一体　なんの用だ？
English:
...!?
What... Oh, it’s you.
What do you want?

Japanese:
リカルドが　ボンヤリしてるなんて
珍しいね
English: It’s quite rare to see you deep in thought.

Japanese:
…ああ　ここが戦場で
おまえが　敵なら
命を落としていたな
English:
Yes...
If this was the battlefield, I would have died.

Japanese:
…どうしたの　リカルド
やっぱり　ヘンだよ？
English:
What’s wrong?
You’re acting weird...

Japanese:
ガキには　ガキの悩みがあるように
大人には　大人の事情があるのさ
English:
Just as how you kids have your problems,
we adults have our own.

Japanese:
僕が　ガキだから
話もできないってこと？
English:
Are you saying that you can’t talk to me about it
because I’m a kid?

Japanese:
そういうことだな
まあ　俺のことは気にするな
English: Yes. Don’t worry about me. I’ll be fine.

Japanese:
本当に　どうしちゃったんだろう
ヘンなリカルド
English:
I wonder what he’s worried about...
Oh Ricardo...

Japanese: 僕とリカルド６
English: Ricardo and I 6

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
ともかく　僕は
またリカルドと
旅ができて　嬉しいよ
English:
I’m happy that I could get to travel with you again,
Ricardo.

Japanese:
前世で　おまえに討ち取られた恨みを
俺が晴らそうとしたとは
考えなかったのか？
English:
Have you not considered that I might’ve been trying to
settle a grudge I had with you in the past?

Japanese:
リカルドは
そんなことする人じゃないよ
English: You’re not that kind of person at all.

Japanese: …そうか
English: I see...

Japanese:
まあ　立場が逆で　僕がリカルドに
討ち取られたんだったら
きっと恨みを晴らそうとしたけどね
English:
Unlike you, I think I would have tried to settle a grudge 
if I was the one who got killed.

Japanese: あはは！
English: Haha!

Japanese:
…ふふ
言うじゃないか
ガキのクセに
English: Hmph... For a brat, you sure have a way with words.

Japanese: 僕とリカルド７
English: Ricardo and I 7

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
ねえ　リカルドって
どんな子どもだったの？
English: What were you like as a kid, Ricardo?

Japanese:
俺は　ガラム地方の山岳民族の　生まれでな
そこは傭兵稼業で　身を立てる者が多く
俺もまた　例に漏れなかった
English:
I was born and raised in Garam.
A lot of people there make a living as mercenaries
and I was no exception.

Japanese:
ガキの頃から　戦闘訓練にあけくれ
最低限の読み書きと　算術は教わったが
学校とやらには　無縁だったな
English:
Received basic military training as a kid and the very
basics of letters and numbers, but I’ve never went to
school or anything like that.

Japanese: じゃあ　友達とか彼女は？
English: What about friends or girlfriends?

Japanese:
…級友を得る　機会はなかった
だが　戦友になら　事欠かない
そして恋愛感情は　戦場では不要だ
English:
I never had any friends among my classmates, but I
had met a lot of comrades on the battlefield. As for
lovers, such feelings are unnecessary while fighting.

Japanese:
恋をしたことがないなんて
ちょっと寂しいね…
English: Isn’t it a bit lonely, never finding someone you love?

Japanese:
恋愛経験なら　腐るほどあるさ
俺の稼業は　明日をも知れぬ傭兵
ただ　長続きしないだけだ
English:
Oh I’ve had countless lovers.
It’s just that the nature of this job and its uncertain
future means that I can’t have long-lasting ones.

Japanese:
また　会おうなどという約束が
守れないことは　身にしみて
知っているからな
English:
The moment when I fail to fulfill a promise 
will haunt me for the rest of my life.

Japanese:
それに　寂しさなど
少々の小金があれば
紛らわせることができるものだ
English:
Besides, loneliness is something that can be washed
away with a bit of money.

Japanese:
え？
それって　どういう意味？
English: Huh? What do you mean?

Japanese:
…ガキには　早い話だ
おまえが　１８になったら
教えてやる
English:
It’s still early for a child like you to know.
I’ll tell you when you’re 18.

Japanese:
？？？
うん　なんだかわかんないけど
楽しみにしてるよ
English:
???
I don’t really get it, but I’ll look forward to it.

Japanese: 僕とリカルド８
English: Ricardo and I 8

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
……プハァ
ふぅ
English:
Pfft...
Phew...

Japanese:
あ～　リカルド
お酒なんか飲んでるの？
English: Have you been drinking?

Japanese:
手軽に　ストレスを解消するには
酒を飲むのが　一番だからな
English: Well, I find it the best way to destress.

Japanese:
どうせ　僕には
飲ませてくれないんでしょ？
English: You’re not going to let me drink any, are you?

Japanese:
当たり前だ
おまえらガキは
砂糖水でも　なめてろ
English:
Of course not.
You can have juice instead.

Japanese: なんだか　悔しいなぁ
English: That’s a bit frustrating.

Japanese:
ガキというものは　その悔しさをバネに
成長するものさ
この恨み　いつか晴らす！　ってな
English:
Children like you will grow up with lots of frustration.
Worry not!
Those regrets will be washed away eventually! Haha!

Japanese:
ぼ…　僕は
そこまでじゃないよ
English: I... I’m not frustrated to that extent.

Japanese:
そうか？
なら　もっと俺を恨んでもらえるよう
みっちり　もんでやらんとな
English:
Is that so?
Then let me give you more reason to hate me!

Japanese:
ちょ…　ちょっとリカルド！
不吉なこと　言い残して
行かないでよぉ！
English: H-Hey, d-don’t just say something like that then leave!

Japanese: 僕とリカルド９
English: Ricardo and I 9

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
どうした　ルカ
なぜ　俺を見つめる？
English:
What’s wrong?
Why are you staring at me?

Japanese:
うん　リカルドは
背が高くて　羨ましいなぁと
思ってさ…
English: Well... I can’t help but feel jealous at how tall you are.

Japanese:
ガキの頃から
傭兵育成の一環として　毎日吐くまで
腹いっぱい　食わされたからな
English:
You see, as a child I went through mercenary training, 
there I was made to eat until I couldn’t take it anymore.

Japanese:
そんなことして
太らないの？
English: Wouldn’t that just make you fat?

Japanese:
太るヒマなどなかった
指一本動かすのも　億劫になるほどの
ハードな訓練の毎日でな
English:
Never had the time.
We were made to undergo harsh training right after.

Japanese:
本ばかり読んで
ゴロゴロしてた僕は
やっぱり　貧弱なままかなぁ…
English:
I wonder if I’m short because I’ve only spent the rest of
my life idling around with a book?

Japanese:
おまえの歳なら　まだ背は伸びる
まずは食え　そして食った分だけ動け
そうすれば　見違えるような体になるさ
English:
There’s still more room to grow at your age, just eat
and exercise a lot, then you’ll eventually get that ideal
body of yours.

Japanese:
リカルドって
ホント　体育会系だね
…僕なんかとは　大違いだ
English: He’s... pretty physically active, unlike me...

Japanese: 僕とリカルド１０
English: Ricardo and I 10

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
間もなく　最後の戦いだ
抜かりがあっては困る
ルカ　体調は万全か？
English:
We’re almost at the end...
How do you feel, Ruca?
A small blunder out there and we’ll be done for.

Japanese: うん　悪くないよ
English: I’m alright.

Japanese:
回復アイテムや
食材は　足りているか？
English:
Are you sure?
Do you have enough recovery items and ingredients?

Japanese:
そ…　そうだね
後で　確認しておくよ
English:
Oh... right.
I’ll check after this.

Japanese:
装備の点検は　どうだ？
剣が　なまくらでは
ここから先は…
English:
How about your equipment?
Carrying a blunt sword is--

Japanese:
ど…　どうしちゃったのさ？
突然　神経質になって
English:
Wh-what’s wrong?
Why are you so fussy all of a sudden?

Japanese:
ガキの面倒を見るのも　大人の責任だ
俺は　責任感が強い方でな
English:
You see, it’s the adult’s responsibility to watch over
children like you. And I’m a VERY responsible adult.

Japanese:
うん　おかげで
僕たち　何度も助けられたよね
English:
Yeah, you’ve saved our lives more times than we can
count.

Japanese:
最後の戦いまで　あと少し
しっかり　僕たちの面倒見てよ
English:
That’s why, since we’re almost at the end, you’ll have
to watch over us.

Japanese:
ああ　任せておけ
では　先を急ぐぞ
English: Right, leave it to me. Let’s head out!

Japanese: 僕とエルマーナ１
English: Hermana and I 1

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
一緒に　旅するようになって
ルカ兄ちゃんのこと
よう見させてもろたけど…
English: Ah’ve been watchin’ ya fer a while now, Ruca Bro.

Japanese:
なんか　オドオドしすぎてへん？
アスラとは
ホンマ　まるで別人やなぁ
English:
Aren’t ya a li’l too nervous?
Almost like yer a different person compared ta Asura.

Japanese:
そ…　そんなの
僕が　一番自覚してるよ…
English: I-I know that... I’m trying...

Japanese:
そうかぁ
ほな　まあ　あんまり
うるさ言わんようにしとくわ
English:
That so?
Guess Ah’ll jus’ try not ta bother ya.

Japanese:
う…　うん
そうしてくれると　嬉しいな
English: Y-Yeah, thanks.

Japanese:
う～ん　なんや　あの貧相な背中…
早いとこ　ウチがなんとかしたらな
あかんなぁ
English:
Hmm... With that scrawny lookin’ back it would be
worse if Ah left ya alone.

Japanese: 僕とエルマーナ２
English: Hermana and I 2

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: はぁ…
English: Sigh...

Japanese:
湿っぽい溜息ついてからに
とりあえず　ウチに言うてみ？
イリア姉ちゃんのことかいな？
English:
What a gloomy sigh, wanna talk ’bout it?
Is it ’bout Sis Illia?

Japanese:
うん
イリアと　仲良くしたいのに
うまくいかなくてさ
English:
Yeah...
I want to get along with Illia but it’s hard...

Japanese:
イナンナは　アスラに
ベタ惚れやったのになぁ
まあ　しゃあないんちゃう？
English:
Well Inanna used ta be deeply in love with Asura,
but Ah guess it can’t be helped this time.

Japanese:
やっぱり　僕
もっと　アスラっぽくならないと
いけないのかなぁ
English: Maybe I should try and be more like Asura?

Japanese: ん～　それはどないやろ？
English: Hmm... Ah wonder...

Japanese:
いや　きっとそうなんだ！
もっともっと　頑張らないと…
English:
Of course, that’s it!
I should try harder!

Japanese:
ウチは　そればっかりが
ええ方法やとは　思わへんけどなぁ
English: Ah don’ think that’s the right way ta do it though...

Japanese:
でもまあ　アスラの方が今の兄ちゃんより
魅力的なんは　確かやし
男磨くんは　ええことかもなぁ
English:
But Ah suppose Asura’s more charmin’ than how Ruca
Bro’s right now. Guess it won’t hurt with lettin’ ’em
learn a thing or two from Asura.

Japanese: 僕とエルマーナ３
English: Hermana and I 3

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: はぁぁぁ～…
English: Sigh...

Japanese:
なんや　また大きな溜息ついて
ウチで　良かったら
話　聞いたんで？
English:
Whoa, that’s another big sigh ya got there.
If yer fine with it, would ya like ta talk ta me ’bout it?

Japanese:
イリアって　やっぱり
アスラみたいな　頼もしい感じの人が
好みなのかなぁ
English: I think people like Asura are really Illia’s type.

Japanese:
そんなん　本人に聞いたら
ええやん
English: Why don’tcha ask her yerself?

Japanese: それができれば　苦労しないよ
English: I wouldn’t be worrying like this if I could.

Japanese:
まあ　そんなん　ウチに言うてる時点で
ルカ兄ちゃんは
頼もしいとは言えんなぁ
English: If ya put it that way, then Ah can’t say Ah trust ya, bro.

Japanese:
そうだよね…
ああ…　イリアの好みが
僕みたいな　貧弱なタイプだったらなぁ
English:
You’re right...
Oh... if only Illia liked timid types like me...

Japanese:
かろうじて　その可能性もゼロとは
言い切れへんこともないかも
しれんこともないなぁ
English:
It’s prolly not like that mighta be the case, ya can’t
jus’ say that ya don’ have any chance.

Japanese: なんだよ　その表現…
English: What’s with that answer...

Japanese:
いいんだいいんだ　どうせ僕なんか
イリアに　見向きもされないんだ…
English:
Fine, I guess it’s foolish to hope 
that she’ll look my way anyway.

Japanese:
可能性はゼロではないと
思うねんけどなぁ
ゼロでは
English:
But Ah don’ think there wasn’t any chance of that not
happenin’.

Japanese: 僕とエルマーナ４
English: Hermana and I 4

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
ルカ兄ちゃん
火山でやられた傷　大丈夫？
なんかあったら　すぐウチに言いや
English:
Is yer wound okay?
If ya feel sumthin’ bad don’ hesitate ta talk ta me.

Japanese:
ありがとう
今のところ　大丈夫だよ
English: Thank you, it’s fine right now.

Japanese: そうかぁ…　そらつまらんなぁ
English: Ohh, that’s lame.

Japanese:
なんか　ウチ　ルカ兄ちゃんの
世話がしとうて　ウズウズすんねん
English:
Fer sum reason, Ah wanted ta get the 
chance ta take care of ya.

Japanese: ヴリトラだった頃の影響かな？
English: I wonder if it’s because of Vritra...

Japanese:
そうやろな
なんかウチ　兄ちゃんのこと
構いとぉて　しゃあないねん
English: Maybe, Ah jus’ can’t help but worry ’bout ya, Ruca Bro.

Japanese:
じゃあ　今度　倒れたら
エルに　付きっ切りで
看病してもらうよ
English: Then, why don’t you watch over me if I fall over again?

Japanese:
よっしゃ！
任しときぃ
English:
Yeah!
Leave it ta me!

Japanese: 僕とエルマーナ５
English: Hermana and I 5

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
うー…　メシの時間が
待ち遠しいなぁ
English: Hmm... Ah wonder when we’ll eat again...

Japanese:
エルは　本当に
食べるのが　好きだね
English: You really like eating don’t you, Hermie?

Japanese:
そら　ウチは食うや食わずの
毎日やってんもん
English: Well, it’s not every day ya get yer hands on food, hear?

Japanese:
ウチにとっては
ハラいっぱい食べて　グーグー寝られるんが
一番の幸せやねん
English:
Gettin’ ta eat until yer full an’ sleep yer heart out is 
like Cielo fer a street urchin like mahself.

Japanese: 趣味とかないの？
English: Don’t you have a hobby?

Japanese:
趣味！？
趣味いうたら　遊びやろ？
English: A “hobby?” Isn’t it like playin’ or sumthin’?

Japanese: 遊ぶような余裕　あらへんかったわ
English: Ah didn’t have time ta play ’round.

Japanese:
…そうかぁ
まだ　こんなに小さいのに
大変だったね…
English:
Ohh... it must’ve been horrible for someone around
your age.

Japanese:
ウチ　そうやって
同情されるん　好きや
優しぃして　もらえるし
English: Ah sure like bein’ pitied an’ treated nicely.

Japanese: そんで？
English: Whatcha got?

Japanese:
え…　「そんで」って
なに　エル？
手なんか出して
English:
What do I got...?
Hermie, why are you holding out your hand?

Japanese:
なんや　同情だけで
なんもくれへんのんかいな
期待させといて　しょうもな～
English:
What?
Yer pityin’ me but don’ have sumthin’ ta give me?
Man, ya sure got mah hopes up.

Japanese:
同情されるのが　好きなんじゃなくて
物を　もらうのが
好きなだけじゃないか…
English:
You don’t want sympathy, 
you just want people to give you stuff!

Japanese: 僕とエルマーナ６
English: Hermana and I 6

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
ねえ　エル
エルのご両親って
どんな人だったの？
English: What were your parents like?

Japanese: ウチの親？
English: Mah parents?

Japanese:
あ～　ウチの親はなぁ
追いはぎに　遭うてしもうて…
English:
Ah, see, mah parents 
once met this bandit an’--

Japanese:
確か
行商人をしてたんだっけ…
English: If I recall correctly they were peddlers, right?

Japanese:
せやねん
ウチは　レグヌムのお屋敷か商家へ
奉公に出されるらしかったわ
English:
Right.
Apparently they were supposed ta be apprenticed ta
sum merchant’s mansion in Regnum.

Japanese:
その奉公先に　行く途中で
おとんとおかん…
English:
Then, on their way ta that apprenticeship, mah Ma
an’ Da...

Japanese:
案外　エルの奉公先は　僕の家か
父さんの会社だったのかもね
English:
Your parents might have been on their way to work for
my father’s company when that happened...

Japanese: ああ　それやったらええなぁ
English: That woulda been nice.

Japanese:
ルカ兄ちゃんのおかん
めっちゃ　優しそうやもん！
English: Yer Ma’s awfully kind!

Japanese:
もし　本当にそうだったら
きっと僕も　エルのこと
メチャクチャ　可愛がっただろうなぁ
English:
If that’s really the case, 
I’m sure I would’ve doted on you.

Japanese:
ホンマ　そうやったら良かったのに
おとんとおかん
なんで　死んでしもぉたんやろ…
English:
True! That woulda been loads better, if only 
Ma an’ Da didn’t die...

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
あかん！　寂しなってきた！
アンジュ姉ちゃんに　抱きついてこよ！
おっぱい成分　補給せな！
English:
Oh no! Ah feel lonely again!
Ah’mma go cuddle with Sis Ange ta replenish
mah booby supply.

Japanese:
エルって　ホントたくましいな
僕も　エルのああいうとこ
見習わなきゃ
English:
Hermie’s really strong...
I should try my best and be like her.

Japanese: 僕とエルマーナ７
English: Hermana and I 7

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
なあなあ　ルカ兄ちゃん
イリア姉ちゃんとは
どないなってんの？
English: Hey, Ruca Bro, how are you an’ Sis Illia like now?

Japanese: な～んにも　進展なしだよ
English: Same as always...

Japanese:
でもね　僕　わかったんだ
イリアに対して　期待し過ぎだったって
English:
But you know what?
I realized that I was expecting too much from her.

Japanese:
僕は　アスラとイナンナのような関係を
期待してたんだけどさ
English:
I expected our relationship to be like how Asura’s and
Inanna’s was.

Japanese:
でも　前世の関係を
現世にまで　持ち越すなんて
バカバカしいよね
English:
But it was stupid of me to think that my current life’s
relationship will be the same as my past life’s.

Japanese:
うんうん
ホンマ　その通りやで
English: Yep, that’s the way it is.

Japanese:
ふふふ…
エルだって　前世がヴリトラだから
僕のこと　気に掛けてるんじゃなかったの？
English:
Hahaha... I thought you cared for me because 
you were Vritra in the past.

Japanese:
あ～　最初は　そうやってん
アスラと違ぉて　頼りないコやなぁて
でも　今はちゃうで
English:
Well, that’s how it was at first.
Ah thought ya were some helpless child much unlike
Asura. But now’s different.

Japanese:
ルカ兄ちゃんには　ええとこいっぱいある
そやからウチ　アスラとは関係なく
今のルカ兄ちゃんが　好きやねん
English:
Ya grown a lot, Ruca Bro.
Right now, it don’ matter if ya we’re Asura in yer past
life, Ah like ya jus’ the way ya are.

Japanese: あはは　照れるなぁ…
English: Hahaha...

Japanese:
そういう素直なところも
ルカ兄ちゃんの
ええとこの　ひとつやな！
English:
An’ the way yer more honest now, 
it’s the thing Ah like most ’bout ya!

Japanese: 僕とエルマーナ８
English: Hermana and I 8

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
あ～　体中イタぁ～…
こんな　か弱い少女が毎日　怪物相手に
ドツキ合いやなんて　ホンマこたえるわ
English:
Ughhh mah body hurts...
Why are ya makin’ this frail young girl fight monsters
all day long?

Japanese:
わかるよ　僕も覚醒した頃
毎日が筋肉痛だったもの
僕も　そうだけど　エルも細いしね
English:
I feel your pain, I always get muscle cramps ever since
I awakened.
Maybe it’s because we’re both thin...?

Japanese:
あ～あ　覚醒が
もうちょい遅かったらなぁ
体も大きぃて　楽やったかもしれんのに
English:
Ohhh, if only mah awakenin’ was slower...
Woulda been easier if mah body was bigger an’ all.

Japanese:
あはは
エルなら食べるのも　好きだし
きっと　すぐ大きくなれるよ
English:
Haha, if you keep eating a lot, I’m sure you’ll end up
growing bigger.

Japanese:
ホンマ　ウチが　もうちょい大きかったら
ルカ兄ちゃんとも
ええ関係になれたかもしれんのになぁ…
English:
Really, if Ah were bigger Ah could have a good
relationship with Ruca Bro...

Japanese:
な～んてこと
言うてみたり～っと！
English: Haha, what am Ah sayin’?

Japanese: 僕とエルマーナ９
English: Hermana and I 9

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
あら　ルカくん
ごきげんいかがかしら？
English: Oh my, how have ya been, Ruca?

Japanese:
ど…　どうしたの　エル？
口調が　ずいぶん違うけど
English:
Wh-wh-what’s the matter, Hermie?
Your accent’s way different than usual.

Japanese:
ウチ…いや　私　思ったの
こういう口調の方が　皆さんから
立派に思われるのではないかしら？
English:
Ah-- I have been thinking, you see.
Maybe everyone will think I am more elegant if I start
speaking this way.

Japanese:
やはり　私　将来のことを
考えると…
English:
As I thought, I should start thinking more about my
future--

Japanese:
って　ああ…
なんや口が　気持ち悪ぅなってきたわ
English: Never mind, that accent feels all sortsa wrong.

Japanese:
言葉遣い直しといたら　なんぞ仕事に
ありつけるかなぁと思て　その練習
ウチのしゃべり　おかしいやろ？
English:
Ah thought that Ah might be able ta get more jobs if Ah
fixed mah accent, so Ah’ve been practicin’.
Ain’t my accent funny?

Japanese:
僕は　カワイイと思うけど…
旅が　終わった後のこと
エルも　考えてるんだね
English:
I think it’s cute, though it seems that you’ve
been thinking about your life after this journey.

Japanese:
せや　ルカ兄ちゃん！
将来のために　読み書き教えてぇや
ウチ　自分の名前も書かれへんねんもん
English:
Oh, Ah know! What if ya teach me 
how ta read an’ write? Ah can’t even 
write mah own name!

Japanese:
うん　じゃあ
みっちり教えてあげる
English: Alright, then I’ll make sure you learn it thoroughly.

Japanese:
よっしゃ～　燃えてきたで！
さっそく　特訓やな
English: Yay! Ah can’t wait! Let’s git!

Japanese:
エルが　勉強…か
僕も　なにか新しいこと
始めた方がいいのかな
English:
Hermie’s been considering studying, huh...
Maybe I should look for something new I can take on.

Japanese: 僕とエルマーナ１０
English: Hermana and I 10

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
ブツブツ　ブツブツ…
ブツブツ　ブツブツ…
English: *muttering*...

Japanese:
どうしたのエル
独り言？
English: What are you muttering to yourself, Hermie?

Japanese:
この前　ルカ兄ちゃんに教わった
「九九」の練習してんねんけどな
７の段で　つっかえんねん
English:
Ah was practicin’ the multiplicayshun tables ya 
taught me earlier, but Ah’m stuck at sevens.

Japanese:
「しちし」と「しちしち」が
ゴッチャになってまうさかいな
English: Ah’ve gotten 7 x 4 an’ 7 x 7 all mixed up.

Japanese:
７{fixed}×{variable}４と７{fixed}×{variable}７を
ずーっと　行ったり来たりして
どうしても終わらへん
English:
An’ Ah’ve been goin’ back an’ forth between the two
ever since. It’s never endin’!

Japanese: ７の段は　難しいからね
English: Yeah, I’m not surprised. The 7 tables is quite hard.

Japanese:
ホンマ　７の段は　手強いでぇ
あと「しち」やのうて「ひち」って
言うてまうねんけど　それやと失格？
English:
Tell me ’bout it, the seventh part is really tough!
Will Ah get punished if Ah keep sayin’ “savin’” 
instead of “seven?”

Japanese:
計算が合ってれば　問題ないと思うよ
こんなときまで　勉強して
エルは　えらいなぁ
English:
It should be fine if all of your calculations are correct.
You’re very admirable for studying even at this time.

Japanese:
へへへ…　ウチ　ほめられて
伸びるコやから　もっとほめたって！
さ～てと　ほな次は　割り算に挑戦や！
English:
Hehe, mah energy’s bein’ replenished the more ya
praise me, so praise me more! Now then～ let’s 
try dividin’ this time!

Japanese: イリアとスパーダ１
English: Illia and Spada 1

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
イリアとスパーダ
ふたりとも　楽しそうだね
なに話してたの？
English:
You two look like you’re enjoying yourselves.
What are you talking about?

Japanese: あら　このカモネギ野郎…！
English: And along comes the sucker--

Japanese: …じゃなかった
English: or not!

Japanese:
ちょうど
あんたのこと　話してたのよ
English: We were just talking about you.

Japanese:
そうそう　ナイスタイミング！
ちょうどオレたち　おまえの
話をしてたとこなんだよ！
English:
Perfect timing, man.
As Illia said, we were just talking about you.

Japanese: へえ～　なんだろ…
English: About me?

Japanese:
あたしたち　退屈でさぁ
んじゃあ　ちょっと
こっちに来てくれる？
English:
We’re a bit bored, okay?
Come here.

Japanese:
うわぁ！　ちょっと！
やめてよ！　やめてよ！
おかしなとこ　触らないでよ！
English:
Ahh! Stop! Please!
Stop touching me in weird places!

Japanese:
おかしなとこって　どこかな？
ここかな？
English:
Which place?
Is it... here?

Japanese:
うひゃあ！　うわわぁああん！
なにするんだよ　ふたりとも！
ヒドいよ～！！
English:
Ahh! Waaaaahh!
Why are you both doing this to me!?
You’re both mean! Waaaah!

Japanese:
ウヒャヒャヒャヒャ！
おまえ　ホント
手加減ねェな～
English:
Hyahahahaha!
You don’t hold back at all!

Japanese:
いひひひひひ…
やっぱ　退屈なときには
ルカいじりが　一番よね！
English:
Hihihihi～
Teasing Ruca’s really the best way to kill time!

Japanese:
次は　どんなことして
おちょくってやろうかしら？
さっそく新ネタ　考えなきゃ！
English:
I wonder how I can tease him next～?
Gotta think of more stuff!

Japanese:
イリアって　ホント容赦ねェなぁ…
あれも　愛情の裏返しってヤツ？
English:
Truly relentless...
I wonder if that’s how she expresses her affection.

Japanese: イリアとスパーダ２
English: Illia and Spada 2

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
大丈夫かイリア　そんなことして？
アンジュに　怒られるぜ
最近あいつ　すぐアンジュに泣きつくからよ
English:
You’re still gonna keep that up, Illia?
You’re just gonna piss Ange off again, 
he’ll definitely run to her if you do something.

Japanese:
ええ～ッ！
あたし　ルカの泣き顔　大好きなのに！
これから　どうすりゃいいのよ？
English:
Huh!?
But I love seeing his crying face!
What am I supposed to do!?

Japanese:
じゃあ　ルカがアンジュじゃなくて
おまえに　泣きつくようにすれば
いいんじゃね？
English:
Alright, what if I make him go crying to you instead
of Ange?

Japanese: あんた　天才？
English: Dude... are you a genius?

Japanese: それで　いきましょ！
English: Let’s do that!

Japanese:
…ってことは　オレがひとりで
ルカのヤツを　いじるのか
さて　どうしたもんかなぁ
English:
Meaning I’ll be the one who has to tease Ruca...
Now, how are we supposed to do this...?

Japanese:
じゃあ　こういうのは　どうかな？
えっとぉ…
English:
Right, how about this?
Hmm...

Japanese:
ねえねえ　なんの話？
僕も　仲間に入れ…
English:
Hey, hey, what are you two talking about?
Tell--

Japanese:
うっさいっての！
あんたは　あっち行ってなさいよ！
English:
Shut up!
Go sit in the corner!

Japanese:
今は
それどころじゃねーんだよッ！
English: Dude, not now, okay?

Japanese:
…ッ！
ふたりとも　そんな言い方…
ヒドい…よ…　グス…
English:
!!
You’re both being mean again...
*sob*

Japanese:
あら　狙ってなかったのに
うまくルカの泣き顔　見られたわね
English:
Huh, we didn’t mean to but... that was a pretty good
expression, wasn’t it?

Japanese:
それにしても
やっぱ　ルカの涙目って
癒されるぅ～
English:
That said... man, looking at 
Ruca’s tears really cures my soul～

Japanese:
イリアって　ホント好きだよな
あれか？　小さな男の子が
好きな子ほど…ってのと　同じなのか？
English:
Wait, so.... Is this similar to how little boys 
like teasing their crushes? Does she actually 
have feelings for Ruca?

Japanese: イリアとスパーダ３
English: Illia and Spada 3

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
そういや　イリア
おまえって　ぶっちゃけ
ルカの気持ち　気付いてんだろ？
English:
Tell me the truth, Illia. You know 
how Ruca feels about you, right?

Japanese:
そりゃ　まあ…
あれだけ
English: Oh, well...

Japanese: あからさまだと流石にね…
English: I guess it’s just natural that--

Japanese: って　なにニヤニヤしてんのよ！
English: Hey, what the hell are you smiling at?

Japanese: べ・つ・にィ～？
English: Nothing～

Japanese:
むぎぃ！　ムカツク！
どうせ　あたしのこと
恋愛ベタだとか　思ってんでしょ！
English:
Gosh dang it! You’re pissing me off!
What, you think I’m bad at 
relationships or something?

Japanese:
そうよ！　そのとおりよ！
だって　あたし　男の子と
付き合ったことなんてないもん！
English:
Yeah, that’s right!
I’ve never been in a relationship with a guy before!

Japanese:
じゃあ　いいじゃねェか
とりあえず　ルカを相手に
経験しとけば？
English:
And isn’t that fine?
What if you get some relationship experience with
Ruca or something?

Japanese:
え…！？
そ…　そんなの　とりあえずとかは…
いくらなんでも　あいつに失礼…
English:
Huh!?
That... uhh... No, it’s not...
It would be rude to...

Japanese:
