あれ　ふたりで　なんの話？
そろそろ　先に行こうよ
English:
What are you two talking about?
We’ll leave you behind.

Japanese:
…ッ！！
うううう…　うるさいっての！
なにグズグズしてんの！　ほら行くんでしょ！
English:
!!
Sh-sh-sh-shut up!!
We’re already going, aight!

Japanese:
なるほどねェ
まあ　あいつもルカのこと　いい加減に
考えてるわけじゃねェってことか…
English:
I see...
Well, looks like she’s not taking Ruca lightly either...

Japanese:
え？　え？
なんの話？
English:
Huh?
What do you mean?

Japanese: ああ？
English: Hm?

Japanese:
いやまあ　おまえも　イリアも
いろいろ大変だなって　話だよ
English:
Nothing, man, was just thinking how both of you have
been through a lot.

Japanese: イリアとアンジュ１
English: Illia and Ange 1

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
思うんだけど　アンジュってさあ
人との付き合い方が　上手よね
English:
Been wondering about this lately... You’re pretty 
good at dealing with people aren’t you, Ange?

Japanese:
教会勤めが長いと　いろんな信者さんの
相手をしないと　いけないからかしら
慣れちゃったのかも
English:
Well, it might be because I have gotten used 
to dealing with a lot of believers and 
long church services...

Japanese:
でも　やっぱり
苦手なタイプとかは　いるんでしょ？
English:
But there’s definitely those kinds of 
people you’re bad with, right?

Japanese: それはまあ…　ね
English: Well... I suppose?

Japanese:
え～　じゃあ　アンジュってば
ニコニコしながら　腹の中では
「ウゼェ」とか　思ったりしてるわけ？
English:
Ohh... So do you ever smile at someone 
even though you think they’re annoying?

Japanese:
イリアったら　そうやって
人の言葉を　悪く取っちゃダメよ
English:
Illia, you should not skew other 
people’s words in a bad light!

Japanese: まあ　否定はしないけど…
English: But I’d be lying if I said I haven’t...

Japanese:
へぇ～　アンジュって
案外　黒いのね～
English: You’re surprisingly wicked, aren’t you～?

Japanese:
そこは「大人」って
言って欲しいんだけど…
English: I would prefer it more if she used the term “mature”...

Japanese:
イリアは私と違って　自分と相手の欠点を
お互い　さらけ出して
付き合うタイプみたいね
English:
However it seems that, unlike me, Illia is the type to 
lay herself and her partner bare in a relationship.

Japanese:
表裏がないから　ルカくんよりは
ずっと　相手がしやすいかな…
English:
Maybe it would be easier for Ruca since she is not 
the type to hide anything.

Japanese:
はぁ…
こんな分析なんてして　私ってホント大人ね
English:
Oh, why am I fretting over
this so much? Perhaps this is a staple of maturity?

Japanese: イリアとアンジュ２
English: Illia and Ange 2

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
うわ　アンジュが…
すっごい　あたしのこと　見てる！
English: Sheesh, Ange’s been staring at me since earlier!

Japanese: どうしたのよ　アンジュ？
English: What’s wrong, Ange?

Japanese:
イリアって　スマートよね
ホントうらやましい…
その体型　どうやって維持してるの？
English:
You are really slender. I am a bit envious of that 
body of yours. How do you maintain that figure?

Japanese:
ええっ？
う～ん　そうねぇ…
とりあえず　たくさん運動してるかな？
English:
Huh?
Good question...
Maybe coz I exercise a lot.

Japanese:
う・う・う～…
やっぱりポイントは　そこよねぇ…
English: Aww... so that really was the case...

Japanese:
そう！　もっとアンジュも運動しなきゃ！
手始めに乗馬しよう！
あたしが　教えてあげるから！
English:
Right! You gotta exercise more!
First step: Horseback riding!
C’mon, I’ll teach you!

Japanese:
でも乗馬って　落ちたら大ケガするし…
それに　お尻とか太ももが
すり傷だらけになるって　話だし…
English:
I heard that you can get heavily injured
if you fall off one and... that your thighs and
butt can get scraped...

Japanese:
大丈夫だって！
あたしが　一緒なら
落馬なんかしないから！
English:
It’ll be fine! Look, if I’m there I won’t let
you fall off.

Japanese:
それに私…　馬の近くにいると
目が　かゆくなって
くしゃみが　出ちゃうのよね
English:
And my eyes get itchy and my nose 
gets sneezy when I get near one...

Japanese:
…じゃあ
乗馬以外なら　なにがいい？
English:
Aight, other than horse riding what else 
would you want to try?

Japanese:
そうね…　疲れなくて　汗が出なくて
寝転がったままできて
翌日　筋肉痛にならないような運動かな
English:
Let me think... maybe an exercise where I will not get
sweaty or have muscle cramps after?

Japanese: そんなもん　あるわけないでしょ！
English: As if there’s one like that!

Japanese: ホント　運動が嫌いなのね…
English: You really hate exercise, don’t you?

Japanese: イリアとアンジュ３
English: Illia and Ange 3

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ねえ　イリア
あなた　ルカくんのこと
嫌いじゃないんでしょ？
English: Illia, do you hate Ruca?

Japanese:
もちろん！
結構　気に入ってるつもりよ
English: Of course I don’t! I like him a lot!

Japanese:
じゃあ　ひとつだけ忠告
どれだけ　大ゲンカしたとしても
後で　あなたから謝りなさい
English:
Then let me give you a piece of advice. 
Always remember to apologize to him 
whenever you both get in a quarrel.

Japanese:
ええ～
あいつの方が　悪くても
あたしから　先に謝るの？
English:
Huh? I have to apologize to him first? 
Even when he’s the one who’s wrong?

Japanese:
そう
あなたの方から
助け船を　出してあげるの
English: Yes, you must be the one to apologize first.

Japanese:
たとえ　ルカくんが悪くても
あなたが先に謝れば　きっとルカくんは
自分を責めて　深く反省するはずだもの
English:
Because even if Ruca is wrong, as long as you are the
one who apologizes first, he shall definitely condemn
himself and reflect on what he has done.

Japanese: なるほど　自分が悪いことを自覚させるのね！
English:
I see! I have to apologize first to make him aware that 
he did something wrong!

Japanese:
さっすがアンジュ！　腹黒～い！
やっぱ　頼りになるわぁ！
English:
Oooh, that’s wicked!
I knew I could count on you!

Japanese:
だから　そこは
大人って　言ってってば…
English: Like I said, just use “mature” instead...

Japanese: イリアとリカルド１
English: Illia and Ricardo 1

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
ちょっとぉ　リカルドったら
なに　あたしのお尻に熱視線　送ってるわけ！？
それって　レディに対して　失礼…
English: Hey, why are staring my at butt, you rude ass geezer?

Japanese:
見ているのは
おまえの　貧弱な尻ではない
おまえの銃だ
English:
I’m not looking at that ironing board you call a butt,
I’m looking at your guns.

Japanese:
貧弱な尻って　なに！？
余計　失礼でしょ！
English:
IRONING BOARD!? Did you just--
Ooooh, now you’ve gone TOO FAR!

Japanese:
イリアの銃は　ダブルアクションだろう
引き金と撃鉄が　連動しているから
そこは　重点的に整備しておけ
English:
Your guns are double-action ones, right?
Then I recommend you focus on the trigger and the
hammer when doing maintenance.

Japanese:
あと　分解して銃口の中も
よくブラシを　かけておけよ
English:
After disassembling it, make sure to thoroughly brush
the inside of the muzzle.

Japanese:
へ？
ダブルアクションって　なに？
English:
Huh?
What’s a double-action?

Japanese:
…おまえは　自分の銃を
よく理解もせずに
命を預けているのか？
English:
...You’re telling me that you trust these two guns that
you don’t even understand?

Japanese:
だって　仕方ないじゃん！
親にもらったのを
そのまま　使ってるだけだもん
English:
Huh? I had no choice, okay?
My parents gave me these and 
I’m just using them at the moment.

Japanese:
しょうがないヤツだな
その様子では　ロクな整備をしていないな…
English:
You troublesome brat... by the looks of it you 
haven’t been giving your guns proper 
maintenance...

Japanese: いいだろう　貸せ
English: Hand them over.

Japanese:
…ふむ　４５口径か
その細腕には　少々重たいだろうが
まあ　訓練次第だな
English:
A .45 Caliber, huh...
Might be a bit heavy with those thin arms, 
but some training should make up for that.

Japanese:
前方照準に　少しヤスリを掛ければ
より早く抜けるだろう
いや　ホルスターを換えれば…　ブツブツ…
English:
It should go faster if we file a bit on that forward sight...
No, what if we change the holster... Hmm...

Japanese:
あんな　楽しそうなリカルド
初めて見た…
銃をいじるのが　ホントに好きなのねぇ
English:
Huh, this is the first time I’ve seen Ricardo look happy.
I guess he really likes playing around with guns.

Japanese: イリアとリカルド２
English: Illia and Ricardo 2

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
ねえ　リカルド
あたし　銃を使った　新しい技が欲しいのよね
戦術に　幅が欲しいっていうか…
English:
Hey, teach me a new arte, Ricardo.
I want to look for other ways to use my gun and
broaden my techniques.

Japanese:
ならば　こういうのは　どうだ？
まず　降伏したフリをして
自分の拳銃を　相手に差し出す
English:
Then how about this, you pretend to surrender and
have your enemy reach for the gun.

Japanese:
こう　グリップを相手に向けてな
イリア　おまえ
銃を奪う側を　やってみろ
English:
Point the grip at them like this, then try and take the
gun away from him.

Japanese:
「ウェーハッハッハ！
　観念したかァ　死神リカルドめェ！
　銃を　取り上げてやるぜェ～」
English:
Wa-ha-ha-ha-ha!
Have you surrendered, Reaper?
Then, hand me your gun!

Japanese: そこまで　なりきらんでいい…
English:
You didn’t have to do that, but whatever.
The moment the enemy takes your gun,

Japanese:
そして　銃を取り上げようとした瞬間
手の中で　回転させて…
English: you flick your wrist like this and...

Japanese:
ありゃ！？
銃口が　こっち向いた！？
English: Huh? The gun’s pointed at me!

Japanese:
そこで　間髪入れず
相手を撃つ
これが「カーリー・ビル・スピン」だ
English:
Then, without hesitation, you shoot at him.
This is called the Curly Bill Spin.

Japanese:
戦闘中に　使える技じゃないけど
カッチョいい～！！
ルカ～！！　ちょっと来て～！！
English:
It doesn’t look like something you would use during a
fight, but it’s super cool!

Japanese:
ルカ　あたし
あんたに　降参する…
はい　これ銃
English:
Hey, Ruca! Come here!
Okay, I surrender.
Here, you can have my gun.

Japanese:
え…？
意味が　よくわからないんだけど…
English:
Huh?
I don’t get it...

Japanese:
いいから！　あんたは悪党なの！
あたしを　脅迫して
銃を奪おうとする役なの！
English:
Look, you’re the villain and you’re trying to take the
gun from me!

Japanese: え～と…　じゃあ…
English: Oh alright...

Japanese:
「ぶ～ひゃひゃひゃ！　観念したか～
　荒野の牝豹イリア～　さあ銃を寄こせ～」
English:
“Wa-ha-ha-ha-ha! Have you surrendered,
Desert Leopardess Illia? Now, give me your gun!”

Japanese:
えい！
カーリーなんとかスピン！
English:
Fine I surrender... Not! Take that!
Curly Whatever Spin!

Japanese:
あれ？
銃口が　こっち向いた…？
English:
Huh?
It’s pointed at me now...

Japanese:
あ…
やっちゃった…
English: I... I did it...

Japanese:
やっちゃったじゃないだろう！
バカ！　本当に撃つヤツがあるか！
早く　手当てを！
English:
You idiot!
You actually shot him!
Hurry and get him some treatment!

Japanese: ファファファ…　ファーストエイド！
English: F-F-F-F-First aid!

Japanese:
ちょ…　ちょっと～！
アンジュ　早く来て～！！
English:
A-Ange!
Hurry!

Japanese:
ど…　どうして
こんな　イヤな役ばっかり…
僕が…
English: Why does this keep happening to me...?

Japanese: イリアとリカルド３
English: Illia and Ricardo 3

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: はぁ～…
English: Sigh...

Japanese:
なにを悩んでいる？
互いに銃を扱う者　人生の先輩として
話を　聞いてやらんでもないぞ
English:
What’s troubling you?
Why don’t you let this senior 
gunman hear your worries?

Japanese:
まあ　そのぉ
あいつとのことなんだけど…
English: Uh... well, it’s about him...

Japanese:
ルカとのことか…　ふん
あいつの相手は　苦労するだろうな
だが　それも必ず時間が　解決するさ
English:
About Ruca, huh... I’m sure you’ll have 
a hard time dealing with him, but
give him some time.

Japanese:
あいつも　いずれ自らの殻を破り
他人との　付き合い方を学ぶだろう
今は人と交わることを　怖がっているだけさ
English:
He’ll come out of his shell eventually, but right now
he’s just afraid of interacting with other people.

Japanese:
あいつが　殻を破る…
じゃあ　あたしは　どうなの？
そんな風に　変われるのかな？
English:
Out of his shell, huh...
Then, how about me?
Do you think I can change too?

Japanese:
ああ　もちろん　おまえも変わる
ガキは　変わるものだからな
そして人は　それを成長と呼ぶ
English:
Of course you’ll change, it’s just natural for brats--
rather, people to change.
It’s what we call “growth.”

Japanese:
そっか…　なんだか安心した！
リカルドもアンジュもコンウェイも
みんな　大人なんだもん
English: Ohh, well that’s a relief!

Japanese:
あたしも　３人みたいに
余裕を持って
あいつと　付き合うようになれるんだ！
English:
If I can be more patient like you, Ange, and Kongwei,
maybe I’d get along with him more.

Japanese:
そんな問いすら　質問せずにいられないのが
ガキというものか
まったく　手のかかる…
English:
You didn’t even have to ask that question.
Good grief, this is why kids are so...

Japanese: いや　うらやましい連中だ
English: Rather, I envy them.

Japanese: イリアとエルマーナ１
English: Illia and Hermana 1

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
イリア姉ちゃんは
ホンマ　背ぇ高ぉて　ええなぁ～
English: Yer awfully tall ain’t ya, Sis Illia? Ah’m so jealous.

Japanese:
あんたは　これから伸びるのよ
ほら　よく言うでしょ？
娘は　父親に似るってさぁ
English:
You know what they say, like father like daughter.
You see, my Papa’s way way taller than Spada is.

Japanese:
あたしのパパなんて
スパーダよりも
背が　高かったくらいだもの
English:
But don’t worry, you still got plenty of time! 
I bet you’re gonna grow even taller.

Japanese:
ほんなら　ウチは絶望的やで
ウチのおとん　小っさかったし…
アンジュ姉ちゃんよりも　小さかってん
English:
There ain’t gonna be any hope fer me then...
See, mah Da’s shorter, way shorter than Sis Ange.

Japanese: ええ！　小っさッ！
English: What the hell, he must’ve been pretty short then!

Japanese:
あ～…　そ…　そんな俗説
信じちゃダメだって！
English: J-Just don’t believe those kinds of sayings!

Japanese:
でもな　おかんはデカかったんやで
リカルドの　おっちゃんくらい
English:
But ya know, mah Ma’s really tall. As tall as Uncle
Ricardo!

Japanese: ええ！　デカッ！
English: Whoa! That’s tall!

Japanese:
なんや　評判の
「ノミの夫婦」やったみたいやねん
English:
After all, they were quite famous fer bein’ a couple with
a big height difference.

Japanese:
その身長差じゃあ
そりゃあ　評判でしょうね…
English: Figures...

Japanese: イリアとエルマーナ２
English: Illia and Hermana 2

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
なあなあ　イリア姉ちゃん
ウチ　銃触ったことないねん
ちょっと　構へん？
English:
Hey, Sis Illia, Ah’ve never held a gun ’fore. 
Can Ah touch it?

Japanese:
いいけど…
危ないから　気を付けてよ？
English:
Sure.
It’s a bit dangerous though, so be careful.

Japanese:
…うわぁ　結構重たいなぁ
クンクン…　これ火薬の匂いか？
胸悪ぅなるなぁ…　ほな返すわ　ほい
English:
Whoa! It’s heavy! *sniff sniff*
Is this how gunpowder smells? Yuck!
Here, ya can have it back.

Japanese:
撃たなくても　いいの？
やっぱ　銃の醍醐味は　撃ってなんぼでしょ
English:
You sure you don’t want to try shooting it?
Shooting a gun feels nice.

Japanese: ほらほら　遠慮しないで
English: C’mon, don’t be shy!

Japanese:
撃つんは　ええって
当たったら　イリア姉ちゃん
死んでまうやん
English: Ah’m fine. If Ah shoot it then Ah might kill ya.

Japanese:
あたしを　狙って撃てなんて
言ってないでしょ！
English: Look, you don’t have to aim it at me!

Japanese:
ほな　誰やったら　ええのん？
コンウェイのおっちゃん？
English:
A’ight then, so who do Ah shoot?
Old man Kongwei?

Japanese: どうして　仲間を撃とうとするのよ！
English:
Okay, why exactly do you think you have to 
shoot it at someone?

Japanese:
適当に　そのへん
撃てばいいのよ！
English:
Look, just shoot at a 
nearby enemy or something.

Japanese:
ふ～ん…
ほな　遠慮のう…
English:
Ohh hmm...
Well, no holdin’ back.

Japanese:
……………
どうして　その会話の流れで
僕に　命中するのさ…
English:
...How did your conversation even 
lead to me being shot at?

Japanese: イリアとエルマーナ３
English: Illia and Hermana 3

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
そういや　イリア姉ちゃんは
ルカ兄ちゃんのこと
どない思てんの？
English: Speakin’ of, whatcha think of Ruca Bro, Sis Illia?

Japanese:
んがッ！
あんた　ド直球ね！
English: What the hell, that question’s too blunt!

Japanese:
ウチ　ルカ兄ちゃんのこと
それなりに　好きやさかい
ふたりのこと　気になんねん
English:
Cause Ah like Ruca Bro an’ Ah was wonderin’
’bout what yer relationship with ’em is.

Japanese:
ええ～　あんた
ああいうのが　タイプなの？
趣味悪ぅ～
English:
Ohhh so that guy’s your type?
You’ve got bad taste...

Japanese:
ウチ　貧乏性やさかい
イリア姉ちゃんがいらん　言うんやったら
ウチが　もろとこかなぁ
English:
Ah’m purty frugal, hear?
An’ if ya don’ want ’em then Ah’ll have ta take ’em fer
mahself.

Japanese:
え～
どうしてもって　言うならまだしも
その程度じゃあ　譲れないかなぁ
English:
Hmm...
If you put it that way then I’m not really sure if I’d give
him to you.

Japanese:
ほな　どうしても言うんやったら
譲ってもらえんのん？
English: But if ya keep denyin’ it then can Ah have ’em instead?

Japanese:
さあ　どうしよっかなぁ
あんたが　態度を
ハッキリさせたら　考えるかなぁ
English:
I don’t know... maybe if you properly tell me why then
I’ll consider it.

Japanese:
態度　ハッキリって
そんなん　イリア姉ちゃんに
言われたないで
English:
Properly tell ya?
Ah don’ need ya ta tell me how ta behave!

Japanese:
ウチ　やきもきしながら
ふたりを　見守っとんのに～
English: After all, Ah’ve been worriedly watchin’ over y’two...

Japanese:
じゃあ「今のところ」
そのまま　見守ってもらうしかないかな
English:
Then how about you keep it up and just watch over us
for now?

Japanese: なんや含みのある　言い方やなぁ
English:
The way ya put it sounds like there’s more ta what it
means,

Japanese:
でも　ふたりの仲
うまいこと行ったら　ええねんけど…
English:
but it sure would be good if their relationship 
gets better.

Japanese:
ホンマ　どないなるんやろ
見守った甲斐があったって
思わせてくれへんかなぁ
English:
Ah wonder... Ah hope it will be worth watchin’ over
those two.

Japanese: スパーダとアンジュ１
English: Spada and Ange 1

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
実はオレ　アンジュに出会うまで
聖女って　クソ真面目で面白味のない
頭の固ェヤツかと　思ってたんだよな
English:
Not gonna lie, I thought that the Saintess was gonna
be some hard-headed humorless woman until I met
you, Ange.

Japanese:
それは　偏見よ
卑劣で残忍で　妖艶な女性でも
教団に貢献さえすれば「聖女」扱いだもの
English:
That is just prejudice, because even the most mean,
brutal, and bewitching women would still be a “saint”
as long as they serve the Church.

Japanese:
マジで？　ってことは　アンジュって
実は妖艶で卑劣で　妖艶で残忍で
しかも　妖艶だってのか！？
English:
Really? Then does that mean that you’re bewitching, 
mean, brutal, and most of all, bewitching!?

Japanese:
案外　そうかもしれないわよ
ウフフフフ…
English:
I might be...
*giggle*

Japanese:
うぉぉおおお！
スゲェエエ！！
English:
WHOA!
Hell yeah!

Japanese:
…とまあ　冗談は　そのくらいにして
私の場合　転生者としての能力で
聖女と呼ばれてたところが　大きいから…
English:
All kidding aside, I was called a “Saintess” mainly
due to my power as a Reincarnator.

Japanese:
でも　その本性は
実は妖艶って　オチなのか…？
English:
But in reality you’re actually very bewitching, aren’t
you?

Japanese: そうなのか！？
English: Right!?

Japanese: さあ　それはどうかしらね？
English: Who knows... am I...?

Japanese: ウフフフフ…
English: *giggle*

Japanese:
ホントのとこは　どうなんだよ！
期待だけさせといて　どっか行くなよ！
ハッキリしてくれよぉ～！
English:
What the hell!?
Quit pulling my leg and just tell it to me!

Japanese: スパーダとアンジュ２
English: Spada and Ange 2

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: アンジュ　なに読んでんだ？
English: Whatcha reading?

Japanese:
これはね　説話集
尼僧たるもの　説教のネタは
常に　仕込んでおかないとね
English:
Oh, I am reading this collection of short stories.
As a nun, I should always have material I could
use in order to teach others.

Japanese: どれどれ…
English: Lemme see...

Japanese:
うっわっ　字ィばっか！
目がチカチカするぜ
English: Oh sheesh, just looking at it is making my eyes flicker!

Japanese:
じゃあ　この彩色写本はどう？
挿し絵が入ってて　キレイよ
English:
Then how about this?
This one has pretty illustrations printed on it.

Japanese: どれどれ…
English: Lemme see...

Japanese:
って　キレイな女の子の絵
ひとつもねぇじゃん！
English: What the hell!? There’s no pretty ladies in here!

Japanese:
あるわけないでしょう
おかしなもの　期待しないで
English:
Of course, and you will not find any.
Please do not expect anything weird such as that...

Japanese:
キレイって　言われりゃ
そりゃ　普通
そういうの期待するって！
English:
Dude, you mentioned “pretty”, of course I’d expect
some pretty ladies in there!

Japanese:
アンジュみたいな　美人の絵が
たくさん描いてあんのかと　思うだろ
期待して　損したぜ
English:
I thought there’d be a lot of drawings of women as
pretty as you are, but noo... my hopes have
been dashed.

Japanese: そういう風に言われると…
English: When you put it like that...

Japanese:
うん…
悪い気はしないわね
English: Nope, I do not feel sorry for you.

Japanese: スパーダとアンジュ３
English: Spada and Ange 3

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ルカとイリアを　見てると
イライラするよな
とっとと　決着つけろってんだ
English:
Ughhh! It’s so irritating seeing those two together...
Just hook up already!

Japanese:
まあ　ふたりとも　奥手だから…
でも私は　わかるなぁ
今の関係が壊れるよりも　現状維持
English:
Well, Illia and Ruca are both shy. I do understand 
your perspective, but it would be better to maintain
the status quo rather than change it.

Japanese:
いやいや　好き合ってる
ふたりが付き合わないで　どうすんだよ！
だって　あれはいいもんだぜ？
English:
No, but they like each other!
What’s going to happen if they don’t end up together?
Wouldn’t it be better if they’re together instead?

Japanese:
あら　じゃあ
スパーダくんは　誰かと
お付き合いしたこと　あるのかしら？
English:
Oh my... Then how about you, Spada?
Do you have someone you are interested in?

Japanese:
へへへ…　そりゃまあ
オレさまぐらいになると
流した浮き名は　数知れず…
English:
Hehe, when you’re a bad boy like me 
you tend to have a long history of love
affairs under your belt.

Japanese:
目が泳いでる
それは　ウソをついてる目よ
English: Liar. I can see your eyes flitting around, you know.

Japanese: ちぇ…　お見通しかよ…
English: Ugh... Nothing gets past you...

Japanese:
でも　たとえ　うまくいかなくても
今の経験は　あのふたりにとって
きっと　人生の役に立つはずよ
English:
You know, even if things do not end well for them, 
that experience will eventually be helpful in the future.

Japanese:
いや　あいつらなら
きっと　うまくいくさ！
English:
Nah, if it’s them then I know for sure that they’ll 
end up together!

Japanese:
そうね
今は　そう願って
ふたりを温かく　見守りましょ
English: You are correct, let us simply watch over them for now.

Japanese: スパーダとリカルド１
English: Spada and Ricardo 1

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
なあ　リカルド
あんた　なかなかのスゴ腕だな
一体　どんだけ修羅場を　くぐってきたんだ？
English:
Man, those some good skills you got there. 
How many fights have you been through?

Japanese:
ふん…　そんなものを
いちいち　数えていられるほど
生易しい　生き方はしちゃいないさ
English:
Hmph... With how I live, I don’t really have the spare
time to bother counting them all.

Japanese:
…ッ！　カッチョええ～！！
そんなセリフ回し
どうすりゃ　身に付くんだよ？
English:
Whoa, cool!
How do you talk like that?
Where can I learn it?

Japanese:
ガキが大人をからかうな
言葉は　その人間の
生き方が　反映される
English:
Don’t make fun of adults, brat.
Words reflect a person’s life experiences.

Japanese:
ガキが　一朝一夕で
マネたところで
軽い言葉しか　吐けんさ
English:
Merely learning how to speak that way won’t convey
the weight brought by years of memories.

Japanese:
ふん…
年寄りのセリフは
分別臭くて　まいるぜ…
English: Hmm... so old people speak from experience, huh...

Japanese:
それで　俺をマネたつもりか？
所詮　ガキの背伸びだな
English:
So, do you still want to copy me?
It’s gonna be impossible for a brat like you.

Japanese:
うぉぉ！　やっぱカッコいい！
男は　あんな風にありたいもんだぜ！
English:
Right on!
That’s definitely how a man should be like!

Japanese: スパーダとリカルド２
English: Spada and Ricardo 2

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
リカルドの身のこなし…
やっぱ　ただ者じゃねェな
English: The way you carry yourself is definitely not normal...

Japanese:
当たり前だ
自分では　白兵戦でも格闘でも
並の兵士以上だと　自負している
English:
Naturally, I take pride in the fact that my close-combat
and grappling skills are above a normal soldier’s.

Japanese:
じゃあ　剣でも
オレより　強いってのか？
English: Then, are you better at sword fighting than I am?

Japanese:
いや…
剣の腕なら　おまえの方が上だろう
English:
No, you’re obviously more skilled when it comes to
sword fighting.

Japanese:
面と向かって　言われると
さすがに照れるぜ
へへへ…
English:
Hearing you say that to my face...
It’s a bit embarrassing.
Heheheh...

Japanese:
だが　剣術大会で優勝することと
戦場で　生き残ることは別だ
戦場では　銃弾一発で人生が終わる
English:
However, survival on the battlefield is a different matter
altogether. One shot from a bullet might as well mean
the end of your life.

Japanese:
な…　なんだよ　それ！
オレは　戦場じゃあ
生き残れねェってのか？
English:
Wh-what the hell... are you saying that I have no
chance of surviving on a real battlefield?

Japanese:
時代は　変わる
これからは　剣の時代ではなく
銃の時代というだけさ
English:
We’re already in different times brat. The era of swords
is no more. We’re in the age of guns now.

Japanese:
…おまえも　薄々は気付いているだろう？
おまえの生きる道は
もう戦場には　ないかもしれん
English:
I’m sure you’ve noticed too.
Your way of life might not end on the battlefield as
you expect.

Japanese: そ…　それは…
English: B-But...

Japanese:
だが　おまえなら…
おまえの剣の腕なら　戦場以外で
生きる道も　見つけられるだろう
English:
But with those swordsmanship skills of yours, you
might find another means of living in the future.

Japanese:
戦場へなど　出ずに済むなら
それに　越したことはない
English: It’s better than having to go to the battlefield itself.

Japanese: スパーダとリカルド３
English: Spada and Ricardo 3

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
…ったくよぉ　ルカとイリア
あいつら見てると　ヤキモキするぜ…
とっとと告って　くっついちまえよな
English:
Damn, seeing Illia and Ruca together is really 
stressing me out. Just confess to each other
damn it!

Japanese:
同感だが
ルカの性格では　あり得んだろう
English:
Agreed, but knowing Ruca, that’s pretty much
impossible.

Japanese:
でも　イリアも　まんざらじゃあ
なさそうなんだからよ
イリアから　告ってもいいんじゃねェ？
English:
Seems like Illia knows though, wouldn’t it be better if
she confesses first?

Japanese:
あの娘のことだ
それも　あり得ないだろうな
English:
As for her... nope.
Probably not.

Japanese:
じゃあ　どうすりゃ
あのふたり　うまくいくんだよォ！
English:
Then what am I supposed to do!?
How the hell can I get them together?

Japanese:
放っておけ
ああして　悩むのもガキの特権だ
そうして悩んで　大人になるのさ
English:
Leave them be.
Go worry on your own, it’s how brats like you can grow.

Japanese:
じゃあ　うまくいかなかったときは
ルカを　どうすりゃいいんだよ！？
English:
Then what should Ruca do when it doesn’t work out
for them!?

Japanese:
そのときには　おまえが
なぐさめに　連れて行ってやれ
English:
That’s when you go comfort him yourself.
Take him out somewhere.

Japanese: 連れて行くって　どこに？
English: Where, exactly?

Japanese:
多少の小金があるなら
今すぐにでも　俺が連れて行ってやるぞ？
English:
I can take you there right now, if you want.
You can go there as long as you have 
some gald on hand.

Japanese:
ええと…
そういうの　オレはいいや
English: Oh... I’ll pass...

Japanese:
ふん…
スパーダも　まだまだガキだな
English: Hmph... still a kid, I see...

Japanese: スパーダとエルマーナ１
English: Spada and Hermana 1

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
こら　エル！
おまえ　オレの隠れ家　使ったんなら
レンタル料　払えよな！
English:
Hoy, Hermie!
If you’re gonna use my hiding spot then you gotta pay
rent.

Japanese:
なに言うてんねんな　逆やで逆！
あのボロ屋を　人が住めるよう維持してた
ウチが　お金欲しいくらいやで
English:
Whatcha talkin’ ’bout!?
We’re the ones who kept that ramshackle liveable,
should be payin’ us instead!

Japanese:
ほな　スパーダ兄ちゃん
もろもろ含めて
しめて５００ガルドで　手ぇ打とか！
English:
C’mon, Spada Bro, considerin’ everythin’ 
ya should at least give me 500 gald.

Japanese:
なんで　住み処を提供した
オレが金を　払わなきゃいけねェんだよ！
English:
Look, I’M the one offering you a place to live, it’s MY
place. Why do I have to pay YOU?

Japanese:
スパーダ兄ちゃんやったら
可愛いエルのために　１万ガルドくらい
スッと出そかて　言うと思うたんやけどなぁ
English:
Ah thought ye’d immediately hand over ten thousand
gald fer purty li’l me...

Japanese:
言わねェよ！
そして　出さねェよ！
English: Uh no. I won’t!

Japanese: そうかぁ…
English: Aww...

Japanese:
ほな　大まけにまけて
４９８ガルド！
English:
A’ight Ah give, Ah’ll give ya a big discount.
498 gald!

Japanese: どんな微妙な　値下げだよ！
English: Heh. Nice discount, let me repeat myself though.

Japanese: つーか　出さねェって言ってんだろ！
English: NO means no!

Japanese:
ほな　なんぼくらいやったら
くれるんやろ？
English: Then how much are ya willin’ ta give me?

Japanese:
拳骨なら１０発くらい
くれてやるぜ？
English: Ten knuckle sandwiches.

Japanese:
そんなんやったら　もうええわ
ほな　さいなら
English:
If it’s gonna be like that then Ah’ll pass.
A’ight, bye.

Japanese: スパーダとエルマーナ２
English: Spada and Hermana 2

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: えい！
English: Hoo!

Japanese: とりゃあ！
English: Hah!

Japanese: と～うぅ！
English: Eat this!

Japanese:
お！　やってんなぁ
ひとりで特訓か　エル？
English:
Whoa! You sure are going at it. 
Doing some special training, Hermie?

Japanese:
ウチ　つい最近まで　普通の女の子やったし
ヒマ見つけて　こうでもせんとなぁ
みんなの足手まといは　イヤやもん
English:
Ah’ve been a normal girl until now, so if Ah have the
time Ah should be spendin’ it trainin’ so that Ah won’t
hold y’all back.

Japanese:
じゃあ　いっちょ
オレが相手してやろうか？
手加減してやっからよ
English:
Then how about you practice with me?
I promise I’ll hold back.

Japanese:
でも　痛い目にあうんは
スパーダ兄ちゃんの方やで？
English:
Are ya sure ya wanna hold back?
Ya might end up bein’ the one havin’ a hard time.

Japanese:
ああん！？
オレが　おまえに負けるとでも
思ってんのかよ？
English:
What?
You think I’ll lose against you?
ME?

Japanese:
せやかて　ウチ
秘密の必殺技があるさかいなぁ
ほな　試してみよか…
English:
Been practicin’ on a special move, hear?
Lemme show ya...

Japanese:
ああ！　ほらほら　兄ちゃん大変や！
アンジュ姉ちゃんの
おっぱいが　ポロリ…！
English:
OH WOW! LOOK Spada Bro!
Ya can almost see Sis Ange’s boobies from here!

Japanese: なにィ！？
English: REALLY!?

Japanese:
隙あり！
とりゃあ！
English:
Yer wide open!
Take that!

Japanese:
スパーダ兄ちゃん
ホンマ　修行が足りんなぁ…
English: Ya really should work on yer self-control, Spada Bro.

Japanese: うう…　不覚…
English: Ugh... Unfair...

Japanese: スパーダとエルマーナ３
English: Spada and Hermana 3

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
なあなあ
ルカ兄ちゃんと　イリア姉ちゃんて
うまいこといく思う？
English:
Hey, hey, think Sis Illia and Ruca Bro will get along
well?

Japanese:
もちろん　うまくいくに
越したこたねェけどよ
こればっかりはなぁ…
English: Course they will, but this situation’s a bit...

Japanese:
ほな　やっぱり
ルカ兄ちゃんが
フラれる可能性もあんのん？
English: So ya really think Ruca Bro will get dumped?

Japanese:
なんだよ　おまえ
ふたりが　うまくいくと
都合が悪いのか？
English:
The way you put it, sounds like you don’t want them to
get together or something.

Japanese:
ん～　ふたりが　うまいこといかんかったら
ウチが　ルカ兄ちゃんと
付き合おうかと…
English:
See, if they don’ get together, then Ah might have a
chance ta end up with Ruca Bro.

Japanese:
イリア姉ちゃんに
持ってかれるんは　しゃあないけど
放っとくんは惜しいやん？
English:
Course Ah don’ mind if they do, but Ah can’t jus’ leave
’em alone as is now, right?

Japanese:
はぁん…　まあ　ルカのヤツが
得体の　知れねェのに
引っかかるよりは　いいかもな
English:
Hmmm... Guess it’s better than Ruca getting together
with someone he can’t deal with.

Japanese:
そうそう　それが心配やねん
イリア姉ちゃんと　あかんかったとき
めっちゃタチの悪いのに　引っかかりそうやろ
English:
Exactly. An’ that’s what Ah’m worried ’bout.
Ya know how bad Sis Illia can get when she has a bad
day, it’s super uncomfortable.

Japanese: うわぁ　ありそうだよなぁ…
English: I can imagine that...

Japanese:
よっし　ルカがイリアに轟沈されたら
おまえがいけ！　オレが許す！
English:
Aight, I’ll let you off if you go 
for him when he gets dumped.

Japanese:
うん　いくいく！
そんときは　スパーダ兄ちゃん
応援したってな？
English:
Okay, Ah’ll do that!
Make sure ta cheer fer me okay, bro?

Japanese: アンジュとリカルド１
English: Ange and Ricardo 1

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
私　リカルドさんを雇えて
本当に良かったと　思ってるんです
English: I am very glad I hired you back then, Sir Ricardo.

Japanese:
ふん…　並の傭兵以上とは
自負しているが　依頼人に
そこまで明言されるのは　やはり光栄だな
English:
Hmph... I already know I’m one of the best, but it’s 
quite flattering to hear my client say it.

Japanese:
ただ　私との契約のせいで
他の契約を　反故にさせたことが
引っかかっていて…
English:
However, I am quite troubled that you had to tear up
a contract in order to undertake mine.

Japanese:
まあ傭兵としては　失格かもしれんがな
俺はおまえたちに　金銭だけではない
別のなにかを　感じたのだ
English:
Indeed, what I’ve done might have tarnished my 
reputation as a mercenary, but something 
compelled me to join you besides money.

Japanese:
それに　違約金の件も込みで契約だ
向こうは　文句もあるだろうが
仕方あるまい
English:
And the penalty’s payment has been paid as per 
within my contract. No doubt that he’d have his 
complaints, but what’s done is done.

Japanese:
え～と…　では私との契約を
違約金で　反故にすることも…？
English: Then... does that mean that our contract also has...

Japanese:
いや　それはない
言っただろう　おまえたちには
なにか　感じるものがあると
English:
No, there’s none. Like I said, 
I’m not here for the money, 
but something else.

Japanese:
俺は俺自身の
そういう勘を　信じている
おかげで　今まで生きてこられたからな
English:
This feeling has saved me countless times and now,
for some reason, it has led me here.

Japanese:
そうですか
では　私もあなたの勘を
信じることにします
English:
I see... then I suppose I should trust that feeling of
yours as well.

Japanese:
これからも
よろしく　お願いしますね
English: Once again, I shall be in your care from now on.

Japanese:
ああ…
引き受けた
English: Right, count on me.

Japanese: アンジュとリカルド２
English: Ange and Ricardo 2

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: えい！
English: Hoo!

Japanese: やぁ！
English: Hah!

Japanese: とぉ～！
English: Eat this!

Japanese:
アンジュ
それは　もしかして
短剣術の訓練か？
English: Ange, are you perhaps training with your dagger?

Japanese:
ええ　敵も強くなってきましたし
せめて　身を守る程度には
鍛えておかないと…
English:
Yes, the monsters that we face have grown
stronger, so I figured I might as well train so
I can at least protect myself.

Japanese: ふむ…　心がけは立派だが
English: Hmph... an admirable attitude,

Japanese: 真剣味は　足りんな
English:
however that alone is 
not enough.

Japanese: ああ…　やっぱり　わかります？
English: So you do understand!

Japanese:
私　体を動かすのが
どうも苦手で…
English: I am not at all versed in the ways of melee combat...

Japanese:
なら　まず基礎体力をつけろ
技の鍛錬は　それからだ
English:
Physical training comes first, practicing your 
technique comes afterward.

Japanese:
うう…　基礎体力ですか…
私の嫌いな言葉ランキングで
かなり　上位の言葉ですね
English:
Awww... Do I have to do physical training?
That is one of my least favorite words in the
dictionary...

Japanese: 甘い物は　好きか？
English: Do you like sweet things?

Japanese:
はい　甘い物は
私の好きな言葉ランキングで
かなり　上位の言葉ですね♪
English:
Yes, Sir! “Sweet” is one of my most favorite
words in the dictionary～

Japanese:
今後は少し…　いや　極力控えろ
そうすれば　体が引き締まる
English:
From now on you’ll have to try-- no, work hard in
abstaining from eating sweet foods.
It will help you shape up.

Japanese:
うう…　一転して
嫌いな言葉ランキングの
１位になっちゃった…
English:
And now physical training became my most
hated word...

Japanese: アンジュとリカルド３
English: Ange and Ricardo 3

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
…アンジュ
あれは　賞賛に値する
English: I must commend you, Ange.

Japanese: なんのお話ですか？
English: Commend me? About what?

Japanese:
おまえが　アルベールの元へ
去ったときの話だ
English: About the time when you left with Albert.

Japanese:
あのとき　おまえの信を問う者は
誰もいなかった
English: At that time, no one accused you of anything,

Japanese: 俺のときとは　大違いだ
English: much unlike my case.

Japanese:
まさしく　アンジュ
おまえの人徳のなせる業
うらやましい限りだな
English: That inherent virtue of yours is what I envy you for.

Japanese: あら　まあ　そんな…
English: Oh...

Japanese:
おまえほど　学ぶべきことの多い
依頼人は　初めてだ
English:
There’s still a lot of things I’ve yet to learn from you.
For a client, this is a first.

Japanese:
ふふふ…　そんなに持ち上げても
なにも　出ませんよ
English: Flattery will get you nowhere, Sir Ricardo,

Japanese: でも　ありがとうございます
English: but thank you.

Japanese:
以前　おまえは俺を雇えて良かったと
言ってくれたが　俺の方こそ
おまえに雇われて　本当に良かった…
English:
You’ve once told me that you were glad that you hired
me, but I must say that I’m also glad to have been hired
by you.

Japanese: アンジュとエルマーナ１
English: Ange and Hermana 1

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
それにしても　アンジュ姉ちゃんの抱っこ
ホンマ　ええもんやなぁ
English: Sis Ange’s hugs really are the best!

Japanese:
あら　エルったら
なんだか　中年のおじさんみたいな
言い方ね
English: Oh, Hermie, you sound like a middle-aged man.

Japanese:
いや～　ウチは「ええもんは　ええ」て
ハッキリ言う主義やねん
「美味いもんは　美味い」とも　言うしな
English:
Nah, it’s jus’ part of mah motto.
“If ya like sumthin’, then say that ya like it.”
Same goes fer food too!

Japanese:
ふふふ…
エルは　面白い子ね～
English:
*giggle*
Silly child～

Japanese: ホンマ？　ウチ　おもろい？
English: Ya really think so?

Japanese:
ほな　おもろいこと言う度に
抱っこしたって！
English:
Then how ’bout every time Ah say sumthin’ funny, 
ya give me a hug?

Japanese:
…そんなに　私の抱っこ
好きなの？
English: Do you really like my hugs that much?

Japanese:
うん…
おかんのこと　思い出せるねんもん
English: Yeah, they remind me of mah Ma.

Japanese: そう…
English: Ohh...

Japanese: エル…　おいで
English: Come here.

Japanese: わ～い！
English: Yay～～!

Japanese:
よし！　見事　作戦成功！
あんな風に言うたら
絶対　抱っこしてくれる思てん！
English:
Ah did it! Strategic success! If Ah jus’ say it like that
then she’ll definitely give me a hug!

Japanese: もう…　エルったら…
English: Oh Hermie...

Japanese: まあいっか
English: Well, whatever.

Japanese: アンジュとエルマーナ２
English: Ange and Hermana 2

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
アンジュ姉ちゃ～ん
へへへ　クッキー手に入れてん
English: Sis Ange～!! Ooooh! Ya have cookies!

Japanese: みんなに内緒で　コッソリ食べへん？
English: Are ya plannin’ on eatin’ them without tellin’ everybody?

Japanese:
まあ！　ふたり占めなんていけないのよ？
シアワセは　リンジンと
わかちあうモノなのに
English:
Well, if we shared two cookies per person, then 
someone would be left out. Have you not heard the 
saying, “Share with your neighbor, not with the world?”

Japanese: …めっちゃ棒読みやん
English: That wasn’t very convincing...

Japanese: 私　ウソが付けないタチだから…
English: I... am not the lying type...

Japanese:
でも　神さまも　たまには
よそ見をしてくれるものよね
English:
However, there are 
times when Cielo turns a blind eye.

Japanese:
そうそう　それ賛成！
ほな　はい！
English: Agreed! Thank ya...

Japanese: あ…　落としてしもた！
English: Oh... it fell...

Japanese: クッキーが泥だらけやん！　ショックぅ！
English: It’s all covered in mud now...

Japanese:
じゃあ　はい
私の分を　どうぞ　エル
English: Here, you can have mine.

Japanese:
ええ？
姉ちゃんは　いらんのん？
English:
Really?
Are ya really sure, Sis Ange?

Japanese: 幸せは隣人と　分かち合う物よ
English: I am simply sharing with my neighbor.

Japanese:
うん…
ほな　半分こしよか！
幸せは分かち合うもんやろ？
English:
Then...
Ya can have half of it!
Ya should share happiness, right?

Japanese:
そうね
ありがとう
それじゃ　いただきましょ
English:
That is true, thank you...
Bon Appetit～

Japanese:
ああ～
クッキーなんだな！　しかし！
English: Ooh! You two have cookies though!

Japanese:
あちゃあ！
一番　見つかったらあかんヤツに
見つかってもうた…
English: Oh no, we got caught, an’ by the worst person too!

Japanese:
ここに　落ちてるヤツが
コーダの分でいいのか　しかし？
English: Can Coda have this cookie on the floor though?

Japanese:
ええ！？
それ泥だらけ…
English:
Huh!?
But that’s all covered in mud...

Japanese:
クッキー分けてくれるなんて
エルは　いいヤツなんだな　しかし！
English:
Hermie’s really nice for sharing 
her cookie with Coda though!

Japanese: いただきま～す！
English: Thank you!

Japanese:
え～と…　結果的に隣人が幸せなら
いいんじゃないかな…
たとえ　泥だらけのクッキーでも…
English:
Uhh... I guess it is fine as long as our neighbors are
happy... even if it is a cookie covered in mud...

Japanese: アンジュとエルマーナ３
English: Ange and Hermana 3

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
ホンマ　アンジュ姉ちゃんて
憧れるわぁ
English: Ah really look up to ya, Sis Ange.

Japanese:
いっつも優しいし
なんや　ええ匂いするし
みんなにも　気配りしてるし
English: Yer kind, carin’, an’ ya smell nice!

Japanese: う…　うん
English: O-Oh...

Japanese: ありがとう　エル
English: Thank you, Hermie.

Japanese:
それに体も
ボンバンボンって　感じやし
English:
An’ yer body is like...
Boing boing! Hear?

Japanese:
え～と…
そういうときの表現は
普通　ボンキュッボンじゃないの…？
English:
Would it not be more proper to just say that I have a
good figure?

Japanese:
せやかて
キュッとはしてないやん
English: Oh nah, Ah do mean boing boing. Look at those--

Japanese:
…ッ！！
この口ね！　そういうことを言うのは
この口ね！
English:
You...! How could you?
I see that you have yet to 
learn your lesson, you--!

Japanese: いてててて！
English: Ow ow ow ow ow!!

Japanese:
エルぅ～…　私に憧れる前に
ひと言　多いところを
早く直しなさいね
English:
Hermie, fix that mouth of yours 
before you start looking up to me.

Japanese: リカルドとエルマーナ１
English: Ricardo and Hermana 1

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
ふわぁあ…　なんや眠たなってきたなぁ
コーダ　眠気覚ましに
そのへん　散歩でもしよか
English:
*yawn* Ah’m awfully sleepy...
Coda, Ah’m gonna go out on a walk so Ah don’ fall
asleep, hear?

Japanese:
コーダは眠くないけどな　しかし
付き合ってもいいぞ　しかし
English:
Coda’s not sleepy though, but Coda doesn’t mind
coming along with you though.

Japanese:
やっぱり　ウチみたいな
可憐な少女には
長旅は　こたえるわぁ
English:
As Ah thought, this long trip can sure take its toll on a
sweet girl such as mahself.

Japanese: どうだ　エル　眠いのはなくなって…
English: How was it, Hermie? Is your sleepiness--

Japanese:
むむ！　そこいるのは誰だ！
誰なんだ　しかし！
English:
Wh-who’s there!?
Show yourself!!

Japanese: 俺だ
English: Calm down, it’s just me.

Japanese:
なんや　リカルドのおっちゃんやん
敵か　思たわぁ
ビックリさせんといてぇや
English:
Ohh so it’s jus’ Uncle Ricardo... ya scared me,
Ah thought ya were an enemy or sumthin’.

Japanese:
ふん…　敵に出くわすような場所で
のんきに　散歩などしている方が悪い
ほら　さっさと　みんなのところへ戻れ
English:
Hmph, you shouldn’t lower your guard while going on
a stroll in a place like this.
Go back...

Japanese:
…ひょっとして
ウチらを　見守ってくれてたん？
English: Are ya... Are ya maybe watchin’ over me?

Japanese: 意外と　優しいとこもあんねんなぁ
English: Yer surprisingly nice, aren’tcha?

Japanese:
「優しさ」からではない
「義務感」からだ
おまえたちを守るのが　俺の仕事だからな
English:
Look, it’s not because I’m “kind”, I’m just doing my job
of protecting you guys.

Japanese:
またまたぁ　照れてからに
構へんやんか
優しい人や思われてた方が　得やのに
English:
Aww look at yerself goin’ shy an’ all, don’ worry if it
makes people think that yer kind, rather consider it an
advantage.

Japanese:
戦場では「優しさ」など
無用の長物だ
ほら　行くぞ
English:
I have no use for this “kindness” on the battlefield.
Now, let’s head out.

Japanese:
「義務感」だけやないもんも
感じるんやけど
それは　言わぬが花っちゅうヤツやろな
English:
It felt like he was doin’ more than jus’ his job though.
But Ah think that’s better left unsaid.

Japanese: リカルドとエルマーナ２
English: Ricardo and Hermana 2

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
リカルドのおっちゃん
ナイフで　木を彫っとるようやけど
なにしてんの？
English:
Uncle Ricardo, ya keep carvin’ yer knife on that piece
of wood.
What’re ya doin’?

Japanese: ナイフで　木を彫っている
English: Wood carving.

Japanese: そのまんまかいな…
なんで　そんなことしてんの？
English: So why’re ya doing that?

Japanese:
指先の感覚を　研ぎ澄ませるため
そして　精神集中のため…　だな
English:
So I can sharpen the senses in my fingertips as well
as hone my concentration...

Japanese:
ほぇええ
そんなもんですか
English: Ohhhhh is that so?

Japanese:
ああ　そんなもんですよ
さあ　彫れたぞ
おまえにやろう
English:
That is so.
Here, you can have it.

Japanese: わあ～　おおきに～
English: Whoa! It’s huge!

Japanese:
…って　これ一体なに？
なんにも見えへんねんけど…
English:
What is this anyway?
It don’ look like anythin’...

Japanese: 知らん
English: No idea.

Japanese:
自分で　彫っといて
「知らん」て　どういうこと？
English: Ya don’ know... but ya carved this!

Japanese:
なにかを作ろうとして　彫ったわけではない
ただ　指先の訓練がしたかっただけだ
おまえには　なにに見える？
English:
I wasn’t carving it because I was making something.
I’m just doing this to hone my concentration.
So, what do you think it looks like?

Japanese: …お茶漬け食べてる馬？
English:
Hmm... Ah think it kinda looks 
like a horse eatin’porridge.

Japanese:
なぜ　そう見えるのかは　わからんが
おまえに　そう見えるのなら
それでいい
English:
No idea what made you think of that,
but as long as you like it then it’s fine by me.

Japanese: リカルドとエルマーナ３
English: Ricardo and Hermana 3

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
なあなあ
リカルドのおっちゃん
English: Hey, hey, old man Ricardo can Ah ask ya sumthin’?

Japanese:
おまえにとっての「おっちゃん」の定義を
一度　問い詰めたいところだが
English: What is an old man to you anyway...

Japanese:
まあいい
なんの用だ　エルの小娘？
English: Well, whatever, go ask your question, small girl.

Japanese:
傭兵って
お金　ぎょうさんもらえる？
English: Do mercenaries earn lotsa money?

Japanese:
…契約の内容次第だな
楽な仕事は安いし　危険な任務は払いがいい
まさか　傭兵になりたいのか？
English:
That heavily depends on the contract.
Easy jobs are cheap whilst hard missions pay well.
Don’t tell me you want to become a mercenary, do you?

Japanese:
せっかく　ウチ　戦い方覚えたんやし
そういうのも
アリかと思うて
English:
Well, Ah figured it might be possible since Ah know
how ta fight an’ all...

Japanese:
素手だけで　やっていけるほど
戦場は甘くないぞ？
English:
Keep in mind that fighting on the battlefield
bare-handed is not going to be easy.

Japanese:
そうかぁ…　結構ツブし利かんなぁ
こうなったら　ノックアウト強盗にでも
なるしかないかぁ
English:
Ohhh, then Ah guess Ah’ll jus’ be a robber who
knocks people out or sumthin’.

Japanese: せっかくの腕を　そんなことに使うな
English: Don’t waste your skills on something like that.

Japanese:
おまえなら　結婚して
子どもを生む　生き方もできるだろう
English:
If it’s you, then you can probably find someone and
raise a family with them.

Japanese:
ああ　な～るほど！
そらええなぁ　そうするわぁ
English:
Ohhh! Ah get it!
Great idea, old man!

Japanese:
適当な男を　ぶちのめしてモノにせぇ
っちゅうことやな！
手始めに　ルカ兄ちゃんから攻めたろ！
English:
Basically Ah jus’ beat up sumbody suitable an’ end
up with ’em!
Ah’mma start with Ruca Bro!

Japanese: え？　いや　違…
English: Huh? That’s not what...

Japanese:
…まあ　あいつの人生だからな
好きなように　生きればいいさ
English: Uhh well, might as well enjoy life when you can.

Japanese: 僕とイリアとスパーダ
English: Illia, Spada, and I

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
ねえねえ　学校ってどんなとこ？
あたしの村には　学校なかったから
行ったことないのよね
English:
Hey, what’s school like?
Never had them back in my hometown so I was
wondering.

Japanese: 学校…　なぁ
English: School, huh...

Japanese: 学校…　ねぇ
English: School...

Japanese:
テンション低ッ！
ふたりとも　学校キライなの？
English:
What the hell’s with that reaction...
Do you both hate school or something?

Japanese:
オレは　レグヌムの王立学院に
通ってたんだけどよ
なんせ　落ちこぼれだったからなぁ…
English:
It’s coz I used to go to Regnum Royal Academy, but
ended up dropping out...

Japanese:
王立学院って　貴族の子どもたち…
国の明日を担う　子どもたちが通う
偉い学校なんだよ
English:
You see, the Royal Academy is a prestigious school
where noble children, those who would lead the
country in the future, go to.

Japanese:
ただ金持ってるだけで　偉くなんかねェよ
なんせ　みんな家庭教師がついてるから
学校で　勉強しねェんだぜ
English:
Look, just coz you’re rich don’t mean that you’re great.
At any rate, everyone there had their own private tutors
and all so they didn’t even study there.

Japanese:
そんな　学校なのに
オレは　オヤジに見放されてたから
家庭教師なんていねェしよ
English:
And since my old man abandoned me and all, I had no
one to help me with my studies there.

Japanese:
学校じゃあ　ロクに授業はしねェのに
テストだけは　しっかりありやがる！
いっつも全力で　０点だったぜ
English:
They don’t teach us anything but gave a crap ton of
tests, so naturally I got a zero on all of them.

Japanese:
…で　あんたの方は
なんで　テンション下げてんのよ？
English: Aight, your turn Ruca. Why were you down?

Japanese:
ほら僕は…　学校じゃ存在感なかったし…
いつも　ひとりでボンヤリしてたから
話せることなんてないし…　ね
English:
Well, no one really paid any attention to me...
I just spent my days alone in a daze so I 
can’t really say much about it...

Japanese:
うっわ　聞かされた
こっちのテンションも下がるわ…
English: Wow that’s depressing...

Japanese:
でも　テストは
いつもトップクラスだったよ？
English: Except for the fact that I aced every exam.

Japanese: なに　その自慢！
English: Can’t you read the room, you dummy!?

Japanese:
そんな話　聞いてねェよ！
イヤミか　てめェ！
English:
Do you hate me or something!?
Do you really think I needed to hear that!?

Japanese:
痛いよ！　痛いよ！
ふたりとも！
English:
Ow ow ow!
Stop it!

Japanese: 僕とイリアとアンジュ
English: Illia, Ange, and I

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ホント　あんたって　ウジウジして！
言いたいことがあんなら
ハッキリ　言いなさいよ！
English:
Can you cut that out!?
If you want to say something then SAY. IT. PROPERLY!

Japanese:
そんな…ウッウッ…
言い方しなくても…
グズ…　いいじゃない…　うっう～…
English:
You... you didn’t have to shout at me... *sob*
Can’t you just let me be...? *sob*

Japanese:
こーらっ　イリア！
いい加減にしなさい
English:
ILLIA!
Can you please stop it?

Japanese:
だ～って　こいつ見てると
イライラするんだもん！
English:
Aww... But looking at him pisses me off!
Fine! Bleh!

Japanese:
ホントは　優しい子のはずなのに
イリアったら　しょうがないわね
English: Oh Illia... You are a good kid, but...

Japanese: ルカくん　大丈夫？
English: Sigh... Are you all right, Ruca?

Japanese:
ウゥ…ヒック…
うん…
English:
Uuuu... hic...
yeah...

Japanese: もう大丈夫だよ！
English: I’m alright now!

Japanese:
…どうしたの？
今の　ウソ泣きだったの？
English:
What is wrong...?
Were those crocodile tears earlier?

Japanese:
ううん…　一応　本気で泣いてたよ
だって　僕が泣かないと
イリアのかんしゃく　終わらないもの
English:
At the very least... yeah.
Because if I don’t cry, then she’ll just continue to get
mad at me...

Japanese:
ふうん…
じゃあ　今の涙は
ルカくんなりの　処世術なのね
English:
Hmmm... then those tears just now were your way of
dealing with her then...

Japanese:
僕が泣いて
丸く収まるんなら　それでいいんだ
English:
If crying can settle it peacefully, 
then I’m fine with that...

Japanese: それにさ…
English: Besides...

Japanese:
それでも　イリアは
僕を　かまってくれるもの
無視されるよりは　ずっといいよ
English:
Having Illia tease me is way
better than getting ignored.

Japanese:
…………なんだか
胸が　張り裂けそうになる言葉ね
English: ...It is quite depressing to hear you say that...

Japanese:
そういう　卑屈なとこが
気に食わないって　言ってんのよ！
English:
Like. I. said.
That attitude of yours is what pisses me off!

Japanese:
あ～　やめてよ！
やめてよ　イリアったら！
English:
Ahhh stop!
Illia, cut it out! Ow!

Japanese:
…もしかして
ルカくん　楽しんで…　る…？
English: Wait... does he enjoy it perhaps...?

Japanese: 僕とスパーダとアンジュ
English: Spada, Ange, and I

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
あら　ルカくん　スパーダくん
ふたりそろって　どうしたの？
English: Oh my, what are you two doing?

Japanese:
いいな　ルカ？
作戦通りに　いくぞ…
English:
Got it, Ruca?
Just as planned.

Japanese:
え～…
やっぱり　やめようよ…
English:
Ehh...
I changed my mind, let’s not--

Japanese:
あのにゃ！　ア…　アンジュ！？
オレたち　ちょいと恋愛に関して
ご意見をたまわりたいと…　にゃあルカ？
English:
H-H-Heya, A-Ange...
We wanted to ask you f-for some love advice...
Right, Ruca?

Japanese:
スパーダくん　あからさまに
声が裏返って…　おかしな感じ
English: Spada, your voice is giving you away...

Japanese: そーれーで？　私になにを聞きたいの？
English: So... what do you want to ask me?

Japanese:
デヘヘヘヘ　そりゃもう…
大人の女性の恋愛について
いろいろと　レクチャーを…
English:
Heheheh, so...
We wanted to ask if you can give us a lecture on how
to make an older woman fall in love with us...

Japanese:
ねえもう　やめようよ
僕　そんな笑い方するスパーダと
同類と思われるなんて　イヤだよ…
English:
Hey, can’t we just not...?
I don’t want to be associated with you like this.

Japanese:
大人の女性としてのレクチャーかぁ
いろいろあるんだけどなぁ…
English:
How to make an older woman fall in love with you...?
Well, there are various ways to do it...

Japanese:
でも　そんな下心丸出しの男の子に
聞かせるのは…　ちょっとね！
またの機会にしましょ
English:
But let us leave it at that for now...
It is still too early to tell boys like you who cannot even
conceal their real intentions. Toodles.

Japanese:
ルカ　てめェ…
うまく　いきそうだったのによ！
English:
Damn it, Ruca!
We were almost getting along!

Japanese:
どこがさ！
最初っから　作戦なんて失敗だったよ！
English:
Uhh, where exactly?
You instantly failed the moment 
you decided to talk to her!

Japanese:
ウッセェ！
てめェ　覚えてろ！
English:
Shut the hell up!
You better remember this!

Japanese:
結局さぁ　こういうとき
僕が悪者になるんだよねぇ…
English:
And in the end I’m the bad guy...
What a pain...

Japanese: 僕とスパーダとリカルド１
English: Spada, Ricardo, and I 1

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
正直な話　オレ　最初はリカルドと
うまくやっていけねェかもと
思ってたんだよな
English:
Not gonna lie, I thought that I wouldn’t be able to get
along with you, Ricardo.

Japanese:
ふん…　それは大人の俺が
おまえたちに　合わせてやっていると
認識してくれ
English:
Hmph... That’s just me being an adult and trying to
tolerate you two.

Japanese:
うん
ホント　そうだよね
English: Oh, I guess that’s true...

Japanese:
ああ…
まあ　そうだろうな
English: Yeah, I guess...

Japanese:
おいおい　ずいぶん素直じゃないか
ガキは　キャンキャン吠えてこそ
可愛がってやれるものだがな
English:
Whoa, that’s a pretty docile response.
Aren’t kids like you supposed to be whiny and loud?

Japanese:
さすが
大人の余裕って　ヤツだねェ
English: As I thought, we reacted too maturely...

Japanese:
じゃあ　僕たち
ホントのガキに戻ろうよ！
English: Then why don’t we act like actual kids, like we are?

Japanese:
だな！　うわ～い！
リカルドのおっちゃん　遊んで～！
English:
Damn right...! Pway with me 
Uncwle Wicardow! Pway with me!

Japanese:
ちょ…　おまえたち
突然　どうしたんだ！
やめんか　やめんか！
English:
Wh-what the--?
Cut that out!
Stop it!

Japanese:
ふたりともッ！！
いい加減にしろッ！！
English: YOU TWO, STOP IT!

Japanese:
…こ～んなの　軽い冗談だろ
なんだよ　大人の余裕ったって
そんなもんか…
English:
Lame! A mature adult wouldn’t get pissed at a joke
like that...

Japanese:
このくらいで　怒るなんて
リカルドも
まだまだ　大人げないと思うな
English:
No adult gets mad at something that small, I guess
you also have a long way to go.

Japanese:
む…　確かに…
俺としたことが…
English:
...He’s right...
I should work on that...

Japanese: 僕とアンジュとリカルド
English: Ange, Ricardo, and I

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
あら　リカルドさん　ちょっと…
先ほど　お食べになったものが
口元に　ついていますよ？
English:
Hold on please, Sir Ricardo. You have some
food left around your mouth.

Japanese:
うん…？
あ…　ああ
English: Hm...? Oh... right.

Japanese: 動かないでくださいね
English: Please do not move...

Japanese:
…ほら　取れましたよ～♪
こんなに　ついてました
English:
There we go～!
Here!

Japanese:
わざわざ
見せんでもいい…
English: You didn’t need to show me...

Japanese:
あはははは！
リカルドが　まるで
子どもみたいだね
English: Hahaha! You looked like a kid, Ricardo!

Japanese:
ふ…　ふん！　これは…！
依頼人と　良好な関係を築くために
スキンシップの　一環としてだな…
English:
Hmph! This... This is just a way of building
our relationship as employer and employee!

Japanese:
プププ！　なに　その言い訳！
普段は　僕たちのこと
ガキガキ　言ってるのに～
English:
Hahaha! What’s with that excuse? It’s pretty funny
because you always called us brats!

Japanese:
あら　でもルカくん
あなたも　笑ってる場合じゃないのよ？
English:
Oh my, but I do not believe you are in 
the position to say that, Ruca.

Japanese:
そうだな　ルカ
おまえは　ズボンのチャックが
全開だ
English: She’s right, you know. Your fly’s open.

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
わざわざ　教えない方が
良かったな
English: Guess it was best not to tell him immediately.

Japanese:
うふふ
リカルドさん
たまに　大人げないですね
English: *giggle* You are so immature sometimes.

Japanese:
調子に乗った　ガキを相手に
スキンシップの　一環というヤツさ
English:
Just another means of building relationships
with over excited brats.

Japanese: 僕とアンジュとエルマーナ１
English: Ange, Hermana, and I 1

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ルカ兄ちゃんって　細いから
全然　戦士っぽぅないなぁ
English:
Yer so thin, Ruca Bro! Ya don’
look like a fighter at all!

Japanese:
そんなに　細いかなぁ
これでも　冒険に出る前よりは
ずっと　筋肉が付いたんだけどね
English:
Am I really? I thought that I’d 
have muscles by now...

Japanese:
あら～　どうしたのかしら？
心の底から　耳障りな言葉が聞こえるけど？
English:
Oh my, am I hearing things? I believe I 
just heard something grating...

Japanese: 「細い」とか「細い」とか「細い」とか…
English: Something about being thin, thin, thin...

Japanese:
そない　気にせんでええやん
アンジュ姉ちゃんは
「そこまで」太ってないって
English:
Don’ worry ’bout it, Sis Ange. 
S’not like yer fat an’ all.

Japanese: ああ～　さらに耳障りな言葉！
English: Ahhh I heard another one again!

Japanese:
エルったらヒドい！
そうやって私を　いぢめるのね…
English:
Oh Hermie, are you teasing me?
That is not very kind of you!

Japanese: 今日の姉ちゃんは　えらいからんで来んなぁ
English: Why’re ya like this today, Sis Ange...?

Japanese:
…あ～　もしかして　アンジュ姉ちゃん
つまみ食いしたんちゃう？
English: Don’ tell me ya been eatin’ in secret.

Japanese:
昨日の夜
「私アンジュは生涯　甘い物は口にしません」
って　ダイエット宣言しとったのに
English:
Didja know that Sis Ange was eatin’ sweets
in secret last night? After all that stuff she 
said ’bout dietin’ an’ all.

Japanese:
だって　だって　だってぇ…
…美味しそうだったん…　だもん…
English: B-But... but it was... tasty...

Japanese:
本当にダイエットしたいなら
甘い物を控えるか　運動するか
どっちかだよ　アンジュ
English:
If you really want to diet, you would have to either
hold back on eating sweet things, exercise, or both.

Japanese:
そ…　それは…
私にとっては　究極の選択ね…
究極の…　選択…
English:
But those are my last resort... yeah... 
my last resort...

Japanese:
結局　どっちも
選ばへんのんかいな！
English: An’ in the end she never chooses anythin’...

Japanese:
とりあえず　保留っていう
選択だね…
English: Let’s just leave it for later...

Japanese: 僕とリカルドとエルマーナ
English: Ricardo, Hermana and I

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
それにしても
僕たちって　不思議な関係だよね
English: We really have a weird relationship, don’t we?

Japanese:
ホンマや　リカルドのおっちゃんなんて
前世では　敵同士やったのに
よぉ仲良う　できたもんやで
English:
Tell me ’bout it. Uncle Ricardo was our enemy
in the past but now he’s travellin’ with us.

Japanese:
まあ　俺の前世　ヒュプノスは
ラティオの上層部に対して
疑問を持って　死んだせいもあるだろうがな
English:
Well, it was probably because Hypnos died
doubting Ratio’s upper brass.

Japanese:
だが　前世をムダに引きずって
生きるよりは　ずっといい
English:
But I’ll always prefer that over living long
and dying pointlessly from old age.

Japanese:
うん
だから　人と人の出会いには
意味があるんだろうからね
English:
Yeah, that’s probably why there’s always some
inherent meaning as to why we meet others.

Japanese:
ふたりとも　ええこと言うわぁ
ウチら　みんな
これからも仲良ぅ　やって行こな！
English:
Well said y’two! Let’s all get
along from now on ta forever!

Japanese: うん！
English: Yeah!

Japanese: イリアとアンジュとエルマーナ１
English: Illia, Ange, and Hermana 1

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
はい！　は～い！
ここで　いきなりだけど
秘密トークターイム♪
English:
Aight, girls! I know it’s sudden and all, but right
now we’re gonna have some girl talk～! ♪

Japanese:
秘密トークタイムぅ？
なんやのん　それ？
English: Girl talk? Wha’s that?

Japanese:
お互いの秘密を　言い合って
結束を高め合うのよ
English:
Well... we talk about ourselves to each other. 
It is supposed to help us get closer.

Japanese: お！　そらぁ　おもしろそうやね！
English: Ohh! That’s interestin’!

Japanese:
ほんで　なんの秘密について
話すのん？
English: So... What’re we talkin’ ’bout?

Japanese:
う～…　え～っと…
そこまでは
特に　考えてなかったんだけど
English:
Oh, uhh... Not gonna lie, I still 
haven’t figured that out.

Japanese:
じゃあ　よくあるパターンで
「男性陣の誰がタイプ？」とか？
English:
Well, how about we go through 
the usual questions? What kind 
of boy is your type?

Japanese: そんな話で　ええのん？
English: Oh, are we allowed ta talk ’bout that?

Japanese: ほな　ウチはルカ兄ちゃんにしとく！
English: Then, Ruca Bro’s mah type!

Japanese:
エル　それだと　すぐ話が
終わっちゃうから
ここは　もったいぶる場面よ？
English:
Hermie... if you answer that way, then the 
conversation will just end immediately. 
You have to draw it out and slowly explain.

Japanese:
ほんなら
どんな風に言うたら　ええのん？
アンジュ姉ちゃんは　誰がタイプ？
English:
Then how should Ah answer? Can ya give me an
example, Sis Ange? What kinda fella is yer type?

Japanese:
その件に関しては
ノーコメントです
English: No comment.

Japanese:
なによ　それ！
あんたも　すぐ話
終わらしてんじゃん！
English: What the hell, Ange! You’re doing it too!

Japanese:
あら　じゃあ
イリアは　どうなのかしら？
だ・れ・がタイプなのかなぁ～？
English:
Oh my, then how about you, Illia?
I wonder who is your type...

Japanese:
ホンマや　ホンマや
正直に言いや　イリア姉ちゃん！
まあ　もう答えは薄々…
English:
Yeah! Tell the truth, Sis! ...Though Ah think
it’s kinda obvious who...

Japanese:
アンジュこそ
正直に　言いなさいよ！
English: You first Ange, come on, don’t be shy!

Japanese: ハァ…ハァ…
English: Huh... huh...

Japanese: ノドが　渇いてきちゃった…
English: Ha... I’m parched...

Japanese:
つ…　つまり…
話を　まとめると…
English: To sum it up...

Japanese:
結婚するならルカ　友達ならスパーダ
お兄さんならコンウェイ
デートの相手なら　リカルド…でＯＫ？
English:
Marry Ruca, befriend Spada, Kongwei’s like 
a big brother, and date Ricardo... that good?

Japanese:
いやぁ　ウチ　疲れたさかい
もうなんでも　ええわ…
English: Ah’m so sick of this... Ah don’ care no more...

Japanese: スパーダとリカルドとエルマーナ
English: Spada, Ricardo, and Hermana

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
リカルドのおっちゃんと
スパーダ兄ちゃんが　ふたり並んどると
なんや　ナイトとジャックっちゅう感じやな
English:
Ya know, if y’two stand together, ya both 
kinda look like a knight an’ a bishop.

Japanese:
なんだよ？
じゃあエルが　ふたりに守られる
クイーンって　オチか？
English:
And what? You’re the queen we’re 
supposed to protect or something?

Japanese:
ふん…　このガキが
甲斐甲斐しく　守られるタイプとは
思えんがな
English:
Hmph, never thought you were the type
of brat that had to be protected.

Japanese:
一応　ウチも女の子やのに
えらい言われようやで…
English: Yer both so mean... Ah’m a girl ya know...

Japanese: ほな　守られるのはイリア姉ちゃん？
English: Then how ’bout protectin’ Sis Illia?

Japanese:
あいつの方が　よっぽど
守られるタイプじゃねェよ
English: Nope. She’s not that type of chick.

Japanese:
ああ　むしろ自分から率先して
敵を倒す　戦士タイプだな
English:
Right, she’s the type to take the initiative
and defeat an enemy before I can.

Japanese: ほな　アンジュ姉ちゃん？
English: How ’bout Sis Ange?

Japanese:
護衛の依頼を受けている
俺からすれば　アンジュは
守るべき対象なのだが…
English:
Well, I’m supposed to protect her since 
that was in the contract between us, but...

Japanese:
まあな　でもよ…
なんだか　当たり前すぎて
面白味がねェ感じがするよな
English: Yeah... but that’s the obvious answer.

Japanese:
ほな　誰やったらええのん？
もしかして…
ルカ兄ちゃん？
English: A’ight, then who is it gonna be... Ruca Bro?

Japanese:
ふむ…　いいんじゃないか？
状況に対して　受動的で悲観的で
体は線が細く　そして知性的だ
English:
...Sure, why not? He’s passive, 
pessimistic, thin, and smart.

Japanese:
ええ感じに　女顔しとるしなぁ
ほな　ルカ兄ちゃんが
クイーン役に決定や！
English:
That’s true! An’ he has a girly face too!
It’s decided then! Ruca Bro’s gonna be 
the queen!

Japanese:
女性陣を差し置いて
守られ役　ナンバーワンかよ…
ある意味すげェな　あいつ
English:
Ruca being the number one candidate to be
protected above all the other girls... 
That’s kinda amazing, in a way.

Japanese: アンジュとリカルドとエルマーナ
English: Ange, Ricardo, and Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
ルカ兄ちゃんは　イリア姉ちゃんに
ひと目惚れして
くっついてきたって　ホンマなん？
English:
Is it true that Ruca Bro fell in love
with Sis Illia the moment they met?

Japanese:
そうらしいわね
家も生活も捨てての　逃亡生活…
ルカくんって　結構情熱的なのかも
English:
Apparently, he abandoned his family and home 
just to live the rest of his life on the run... 
Maybe he is quite the romantic.

Japanese:
俺には　ルカの現実逃避に思える
あいつは　自分の人生に
不満があったようだからな
English:
I believe he was unsatisfied with how 
he lived, so he chose to run away.

Japanese:
あら　リカルドさん
イリアを　見くびってません？
English: Oh my, are you not underestimating Illia a little bit?

Japanese:
私は　ルカくんが
恋に落ちて当然の
魅力的な　女の子だと思いますよ
English:
I believe, with all my heart, that Ruca 
fell in love with Illia’s womanly charm.

Japanese:
俺も　ひと目惚れを否定はしないさ
自分の望んでいた女性に　そのとき偶然
出会えば　そういうこともあるだろう
English:
I’m not denying that. There are moments when
you just meet the right girl at the right time.

Japanese:
でも　まだまだ現在進行形やしなぁ
ふたりの仲が
どうなるかは　わからんで
English:
But Ah guess they still have a long way ta go. 
No idea how their relationship is gonna end 
up like.

Japanese:
だから　私たちで　ふたりを
温かく見守りましょうよ
English: Which is why we both have to watch over them.

Japanese:
せやな　うまいこといったら
前世からの　恋人同士やもんな
そらぁ　ロマンチックっちゅうヤツやで
English:
Right! If they end up together jus’ like 
their past life, Ah think that’d be purty romantic!

Japanese:
ふん…　人のことより
おまえたちは　どうなんだ？
そういう相手が　現れるといいがな
English:
Hmph... What about you two? Would be better
if something like that happened.

Japanese:
最後にチクっと　いらんこと言うなぁ
リカルドのおっちゃんは
なあ　アンジュ姉ちゃん？
English:
That was purty rude of him, sayin’ 
sumthin’ like that. Right, Sis Ange?

Japanese:
わ…　私は信仰に
身を捧げているから　関係ないわよ？
English:
I... I am a nun. In my case,
it does not really matter.

Japanese: 僕とイリアとエルマーナ
English: Illia, Hermana, and I

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ねえ　ルカ　お水ある？
あったら　ちょーだい
English:
Hey, Ruca, got any water? 
If so, can I have some?

Japanese: はい　どうぞ
English: Oh sure, here.

Japanese:
あ…　あとついでに　食べ物も
太らないような　軽めなヤツ
English:
And then some light food... 
I don’t wanna get fat.

Japanese:
えーっと
ピーナッツならあるけど
English: Uhmm... I have some peanuts if that works.

Japanese:
え～？　ピーナッツ？
ちょっと違うなぁ
English:
Peanuts? Uhh... I don’t know if that’s it, 
but ehh...

Japanese: でもいいか　それちょーだい
English: gimme.

Japanese:
なあなあ　ルカ兄ちゃん
ウチにも　なんかしたってぇなぁ
イリア姉ちゃんばっかり　ズルい
English:
Ruca Bro, Ruca Bro, gimme sum too! 
Yer always givin’ stuff ta Sis Illia, it’s so unfair!

Japanese:
え～と　じゃあエルは
なにをして欲しいの？
English: Uhh, then what would you like to have, Hermie?

Japanese:
え…　うーん　改めて聞かれると…
ちょっと　独り占めが
ズルいなぁと　思うただけやし…
English:
Oh... uhh... now that Ah think ’bout it... 
It’s like Ah’m keepin’ him ta mahself... 
It’s kinda unfair...

Japanese:
別に　独り占めなんてしてないじゃん
ルカになんて　遠慮しないで
ドンドン用事　頼めばいいのよ
English:
It’s not like you’re hogging him to yourself
or anything, so don’t hold back about asking
him for favors.

Japanese:
ふたりが　仲良さそうやったさかい
ちょっと　ウチも
かまって欲しかっただけやねん
English:
Ah was jus’ sayin’ that cause y’two look
like yer gettin’ along together... boo...

Japanese: あ…　エル？
English: Hermie?

Japanese:
？？？
なんだか　おかしなエルね
English:
??? 
She’s acting kinda strange...

Japanese:
ん～　エルったらヤキモチかしらね？
でも　ルカくんとイリア
どっちに　焼いたのかしら？
English:
Hmm... I wonder if Hermie is jealous
of those two? If so... I wonder who?

Japanese: 僕とアンジュとエルマーナ２
English: Ange, Hermana, and I 2

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
アンジュ姉ちゃん
イリア姉ちゃんが　ズボンのボタン
取れた言うて　困ってたで
English:
Sis Ange, the button of Illia’s pants came off
so she wanted ya ta take a look at it.

Japanese:
あと　キュキュ姉ちゃんの
服も　ほころびとるって言うてた
English: An’ Sis QQ’s clothes are also fallin’ apart.

Japanese:
あらあら　それは大変
直してあげなきゃ
English: Oh dear, we cannot have that. Let me patch them up.

Japanese:
それから　リカルドとコンウェイが
この先の道のりについて
アンジュの話を　聞きたいって言ってたよ
English:
Ricardo and kongwei also wanted to ask you
about the route that we’re going to take...

Japanese:
ああ　それなら
治安の良さそうなルートを　もう伝えたから
大丈夫よ
English:
If that is the case, then it should be fine. 
I have already given them the safest route.

Japanese:
あとな　あとな　またスパーダ兄ちゃんが
炊事当番サボって
姿くらましよったで
English:
An’ Spada Bro skipped out on cookin’ duty 
an’ ran off sumwhere again.

Japanese: もう　スパーダくんったら…
English: Oh Spada...

Japanese:
でも　この間　しかったばかりだから
怒るのは　また今度にしましょ
English:
I have already scolded him the other day. 
I suppose that I shall have to talk to him 
some other time.

Japanese:
あまり怒り過ぎると　ヘソ曲げちゃうから
さてと　じゃあ　私
イリアとキュキュさんのところへ　行くね？
English:
Always being stressed out is unhealty, you know? 
Now, if you excuse me, I shall be going to fix Illia 
and QQ’s clothes now.

Japanese:
…アンジュ姉ちゃん
みんなに　頼りにされとんなぁ
English: Everybody really relies on Sis Ange...

Japanese:
うん
アンジュがいてくれて
本当に助かるよね
English: Yeah, I’m really glad she’s traveling with us.

Japanese: ホンマやで　ありがたいなぁ
English: Yeah! ...uhhh thank ya, Loreley...

Japanese:
えーっと…
まんなんだぶ　まんなんだぶ…
English:
Hmm...
Inominate, Martle, Wellmax...

Japanese:
エル　それ…
いろいろ　間違ってるよ…
English: Hermie... you got all of that wrong.

Japanese: イリアとアンジュとリカルド
English: Illia, Ange, and Ricardo

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: うひぃぃぃ～　肩こったぁ～
English: Ughhh... my shoulders are stiff...

Japanese:
ああん…
私も　ヒザと腰が痛～い
長く歩くとダメね…
English:
Ugh... Me too... My waist and knees hurt...
I really cannot walk for a long time.

Japanese:
そういうときは
荷物の詰め方や　持ち方を工夫すれば
楽になるぞ
English:
At times like these, I recommend changing the
way you carry your belongings. That should 
lessen the fatigue.

Japanese: ほぇ？　たとえば？
English: Huh? Like how?

Japanese:
バックパックには　重い物が
上になるように　物を詰めろ
その方が　バランスが取れる
English:
For example, placing heavy luggage on the
upper parts of your backpack should relieve
the stress on your shoulders.

Japanese:
そして極力　手で荷物を持つな
ベルトやストラップを　使えば
疲れも　全然違ってくる
English:
If possible, you shouldn’t use your hands to carry 
things. If you use a belt or a strap, you won’t
get tired at all.

Japanese:
へえ　そうなんですか？
やってみますね
English: Ohhh is that so? Let me try it.

Japanese:
まあ　それ以前に
余計な物は　持ち歩かないことだ
English:
Adding to what I was saying earlier, I also
recommend that you leave unnecessary
baggage behind.

Japanese: おまえたちは　荷物が多すぎる
English: You two are carrying too much.

Japanese:
女の子には　いろいろ必要な物が
あるんだから
しょーがないでしょ
English:
Hey, listen here, we women need a 
lot of things, got it? We can’t help it!

Japanese:
なら　俺が本当に必要な物か
チェックしてやろう
English: Then let me check what you have on you.

Japanese: なにすんのよ！
English: Wh-what the hell are you doing!?

Japanese:
あたしのバッグ　勝手に開けたら
殺すわよ！
English:
I’m gonna kick you in the balls if you
do so much as touch my bag!

Japanese:
リカルドさん　マナー違反ですよ
女の子のバッグは　男子禁制です
English:
That is rude, Sir! It is ettiquette that men do not 
rummage though nor even so much as touch a 
woman’s belongings.

Japanese:
旅の負担を減らすためなら
マナーなどと言っては　おれんだろう
English:
I believe ettiquette is unnecessary, 
so long as it makes traveling comfortable.

Japanese:
いいえ
女の子は　そういうものです
English:
Then I am afraid to say that you are wrong. 
That is just how it is.

Japanese:
そうよ！　そうよ！
そういうもんよ！
English: Damn right! Now back off!

Japanese: やれやれ…
English: Good grief...

Japanese: スパーダとアンジュとエルマーナ
English: Spada, Ange, and Hermana

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
スパーダくんって
お兄さんが　多かったのよね？
English: You have many older brothers do you not, Spada?

Japanese:
ええなぁ　たくさん兄弟おって
ウチは　ひとりっ子やったさかいなぁ
English:
That’s purty cool, Ah wish Ah had
lotsa big bros... Ah’m an only child, hear?

Japanese: そんないいもんじゃねえって
English: It ain’t cool at all...

Japanese:
そう言う　アンジュは
どうなんだよ？
English: Why the sudden question?

Japanese:
私は　年の離れた兄がいるの
従軍牧師をしているみたいだから
ほとんど　会うことはないけどね
English:
Well, I have a brother that is a bit older than me. 
He works as a military chaplain, so I rarely see him.

Japanese:
へぇ～　意外だな
てっきり　一番上の姉貴かと
思ってたぜ
English:
Well that’s a surprise... 
I thought you were an older sister type.

Japanese:
ふふふ
それ　よく言われるの
English:
*giggle*
I am often told that.

Japanese:
イリア姉ちゃんは
弟と妹が　何人かおるらしいで
English:
Apparently, Sis Illia also has
a few younger siblin’s.

Japanese:
うげぇ！　あんな姉貴　絶対いらねェ！
死ぬほど理不尽なこと　やらされそう！
English:
Wait, what, really!? Her? A big sister...? 
Whoa... That’s... I’ll eat a sock if that’s true...

Japanese:
そうかいなぁ
イリア姉ちゃん
ウチには　優しいけど…
English: Ah wonder... Sis Illia’s purty nice ta me though...

Japanese:
もうルカったら！
どうして　あたしの荷物
虫干ししといてくれてないのよ！
English: Ruca! Why the hell didn’t you dry my stuff!?

Japanese: そんなこと言われてないよ！
English: You never told me to dry them!

Japanese:
言われてなかったら
あんたの方から
聞いてくればいいでしょ！
English:
Look, I didn’t have to say it! 
You should have figured that out on your own!

Japanese: そんなムチャな！
English: As if I can...

Japanese:
なぁ　エル
あんな風に　扱われるんだぜ？
English:
Hey Hermie.
That’s how they treat you, right?

Japanese:
うん…
めっちゃ理不尽や
English: Yeah... Totally unreasonable...

Japanese: みんな仲良し？
English: Everyone’s Getting Along?

Japanese: イリア
English: Ruca

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
…旅に出て　いろんなことがあったな
イリアを襲う敵を　勇敢に退け
捕まったスパーダとアンジュを　救い出し…
English:
A lot sure has happened since then... I managed to 
muster up my courage and drive away those who are
after Illia and managed to rescue Spada and Ange too...

Japanese:
コンウェイや　リカルドみたいな
大人からも信頼されて　エルを保護した
English:
On top of that, Ricardo and Kongwei trust
me to watch over Hermie now...

Japanese: 僕も　成長したよねぇ～
English: I’ve grown up, haven’t I?

Japanese:
大変だー　みんなー！
ルカが寝言を言ってるぞー　しかし！
English: Oh no, everyone! Ruca’s speaking gibberish though!

Japanese: え？　え？　え？
English: Huh???

Japanese:
はぁ？　あんたのどこが
勇敢だったってのよッ！
へっぴり腰だったでしょ！
English:
You? Brave? How exactly? 
You’re just a string bean, remember?

Japanese: へぇ～～　オレを助け出した　…ねぇ
English: You “saved” me...? Hmm...

Japanese:
おまえが　どんな風に考えてたのか
よーく　わかったぜ
English: So this is how you see yourself, then...

Japanese:
え…　いやごめん
ちょっと僕　調子に乗っ…
English: Oh, uhh... No, I’m sorry... I was caught up in the--

Japanese:
確かに　助けては
いただきましたけど…
English: Well, it is true that he did save me though...

Japanese:
おまえひとりの
手柄というわけでもあるまい
English:
But it’s not a feat that you
accomplished by yourself.

Japanese:
だから…
ちょっと調子に乗っ…
English: Like I said, I was caught up in the--

Japanese:
まあ　ウチは
それでも　ええけどなぁ
English: Ehh... Ah don’ really care, but,

Japanese: でも　ルカ兄ちゃん…
English: Ruca Bro...

Japanese:
口は災いの元だね
身にしみただろ　ルカくん？
English:
Take care and remind yourself
that loose lips sink ships.

Japanese:
ううう…
うっかり　独り言なんて
言うもんじゃないや…
English: I... I should be careful of what I say from now on...

Japanese:
キュキュは　ルカ
よくやてる思う…
English: QQ thinks Ruca’s doing great, though...

Japanese: みんな　ルカに厳しいな
English: Everyone too strict.

Japanese: 閑話休題
English: Back on Topic

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
ねえルカ
あんたってさぁ
どうして　友達いなかったの？
English: Hey, Ruca, why didn’t you have any friends?

Japanese:
おとなしいタイプだとは　思うけど
勉強はできるみたいだし
ちょっと不思議なのよね
English:
I know you’re a quiet type and all, but you do well
in school, y’know? It’s kinda strange,
now that I think about it...

Japanese:
…僕　小さい頃から
アスラの夢を　見てたでしょ
それで夢と現実が　ごっちゃになってさ
English:
Well, remember how I said that I used
to have dreams where I was Asura?

Japanese:
しばらく　アスラみたいに
振る舞ってた時期が　あったんだ
English:
Well, when I was a kid, I didn’t know which was
real or a dream so I ended up acting like him.

Japanese:
うわぁ…
それじゃあ
English: Yikes...

Japanese:
周りの人は
ドン引きでしょ？
English:
And I guess that made everyone 
stay away from you?

Japanese: うん　ホントそう
English: Yep...

Japanese:
今なら　それがおかしいってわかるけど
小さいときの　僕はね…
English:
I mean, I know that what I was doing
is weird now, but... back then...

Japanese: 朝　起きて　母さんに
English:
Whenever I woke up in the morning as a kid,
I would yell:

Japanese: 「食事は　まだか！」
English: “WHERE IS MY FOOD, WOMAN?”

Japanese:
って叫んだときには
父さんに　ものすごく怒られたよ
English: and make my mom angry.

Japanese:
学校でも　そんな風だったから
両親が　呼び出されたりしてさ
そりゃあ　変人扱いもされるよね
English:
That was how I acted even in school, to the 
extent that they ended up calling my parents
and I was seen as a freak.

Japanese: なるほどぉ
English: I see...

Japanese:
さすがに僕も　自分でおかしいって
気がついたから　それ以来
人から距離を　置くようになったんだ
English:
And eventually, I realized that. Ever since, I found it 
hard to approach people... I had no idea what they 
would think of me if I did...

Japanese:
だから僕　イリアがイナンナで
あの夢が　本当だったって
わかったとき　すごく嬉しくてさ
English:
When you told me that you were Inanna and my
dreams were true, you cannot imagine how happy
I was back then...

Japanese:
あのとき　イリアと絶対
一緒に行かなきゃって　思ったんだよ
僕を全部　認めてもらえたように感じたから
English:
At that time, I knew that I definitely had to go 
with you... Because I knew that you would
accept me for who I am.

Japanese: ちょっと…　やめなさいよ
English: Hey, stop it...

Japanese: ホント　恥ずかしいヤツ！
English: You’re making me blush!

Japanese:
でもね　イリア
僕は本当に　そう思ったんだよ…
English: But... I really did think that, Illia.

Japanese: 僕とスパーダとリカルド２
English: Spada, Ricardo, and I 2

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
やっぱ　この格好だと
首元がスースーするぜ
English: These clothes really feel cool on the neck.

Japanese:
おまえは　襟元を開けすぎだ
そんな服では
ホフク前進のときに　スリ傷を作るぞ
English:
Your collar’s too open, your neck will
get scratched if you crawl.

Japanese:
ホフク前進なんて　普通しねェよ
おっさんの方こそ
もっと　くつろいだ格好しろよ
English:
No sane person would do that in the first
place anyway! You gotta wear more comfy
clothes, old man!

Japanese:
それとルカ　おまえは
上品に　まとめすぎ
もっと小物に　こだわれよな
English:
And, Ruca, your style is so fancy that it doesn’t fit
you at all! Add more accessories, make it yours!

Japanese:
でも僕　自分で服なんて選んだことないよ
この服だって　母さんが買った物だし
小物のことなんて　サッパリわからないや
English:
But it isn’t mine, my mom picked these for me. 
I never got to choose my own clothes. I don’t even
know what accessories would go with this.

Japanese:
そんなんだから
おまえ　モテねェんだよ
English: And that’s why you’re lame!

Japanese:
いいか？
男の小物と言やぁ　帽子だ！　帽子！
English:
Listen here, when it 
comes to accessories for us men, it has to be a hat!

Japanese: ちょっと待て　スパーダ
English: Hold on, Spada.

Japanese:
人に　あれこれ言えるほど
おまえの服装は　異性に受けがいいのか？
English:
Don’t tell people what to do. 
Do you really think that women like those 
clothes of yours?

Japanese: ったりめェだろ！
English: Of course they do!

Japanese:
この３人の中じゃ　間違いなく
オレが　ランキング１位だぜ！
English: I’m the most stylish in this group!

Japanese:
…そう断言されると
否定できないよね
English: ...I can’t deny that.

Japanese:
ふん…　服など実用向けが一番だ
スパーダ　あまりルカに
おかしなことを　吹き込むなよ
English:
Hmph... Don’t be foolish, practicality comes first. 
And stop teaching Ruca stupid crap.

Japanese:
実用ばっかじゃ　人生つまんねえっての
ルカ　おまえも　身に付けるもんには
気を使えよ
English:
Look, you’re gonna end up wasting your life if 
you keep thinking that way. Just be careful of 
what you wear, Ruca. Got it?

Japanese:
ん～　母さんが　買ったものだけど
この服　僕は結構
気に入ってるんだけどな…
English:
Okay... To be honest, even though my mom
bought this, I quite like wearing it...

Japanese: イリアとアンジュとエルマーナ２
English: Illia, Ange, and Hermana 2

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
ウチ　最近　ちょっと太ってきたかも…
このままいったら
わき腹が　エラいことになってまうわ
English:
Ah think Ah’ve gotten a bit fat... 
At this rate mah belly’s gonna get big.

Japanese:
っていうか　エル
あんた　露出が多すぎない？
English:
Now that I think of it... Aren’t you exposing 
a bit too much of your skin?

Japanese:
イリアもエルのこと　言えないでしょ
お腹周りに　自信がないと
絶対着られない服よ　それ
English:
I do not believe you are in a good position to say that...
Those clothes are not something someone 
self-conscious about their stomach would dare to wear.

Japanese:
確かに　イリア姉ちゃん
スタイルええもんな
なに着ても　似合うっちゅう話やで
English:
Now that ya menshun it, ya sure have a 
great figure, Sis Illia... Ah’m sure ye’ll look
good in any clothes ya wear.

Japanese:
アンジュ姉ちゃんも
露出多くしたら　ええねん
受けると　思うねんけどなぁ
English:
If Sis Ange wore clothes that showed off 
her skin, Ah’m sure lotsa people would like it.

Japanese:
そうよ　そうよ
アンジュも　もっと肌を出しなさいよ
きっと男が　放っとかないって！
English:
Yeah! If you do that then I’m sure
the guys won’t leave you alone!

Japanese: あら　そう思う？
English: Do you really think so?

Japanese:
もちろんや
絶対　受けるで！
English: Course! Guys will swarm ya!

Japanese: 特定のマニアに
English: Guys who like ’em big, that is...

Japanese: それ　どういう意味よ　エルぅ！？
English: Hermie! What do you mean by that!?

Japanese: みんな仲良し？？
English: Everyone’s Getting Along??

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コ－ダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
アンジュ姉ちゃんと　ルカ兄ちゃんは
なんで料理
できるようになったん？
English: Sis Ange, Ruca Bro, why can ya both cook?

Japanese:
教団では「自分のことは自分で」って
決まってたから
料理も自然にね
English:
The church leaves us to fend for our
own, so it just came naturally to me.

Japanese:
僕は　母さんが料理するのを
よく見てたからかな
見よう見まねで　なんとなくね
English: As for me, I learned from watching my mom cook.

Japanese:
イリア姉ちゃんと　スパーダ兄ちゃんは？
絶対　料理でけへん思てたのに
案外キッチリ　やりよるもんなぁ～
English:
What about you, Sis Illia, Spada Bro? Ah thought
that ya both couldn’t cook, but yer both purty good!

Japanese:
料理なんてな
材料切って　火を通すだけだろ
楽勝だぜ
English:
It’s pretty easy to just cut ingredients, skewer
them, and cook them over the fire, y’know?

Japanese:
あたしの家は　一家総出で働いてたから
家事も　みんなで分担してたの
だから結構　料理の経験あんのよね
English:
Well, everyone in my family works, so we tend to
divide the chores among each other. And that’s 
how I learned how to cook.

Japanese:
おっちゃん　ふたりは
普通に　できそうやもんなぁ
English: An’ both uncles make it look awfully easy...

Japanese:
まあな　戦闘食があるときはいいが
なくなれば　手に入る物を
なんでも調理して　食うことになる
English:
Naturally, there will always be a time when you run
out of rations while out in the field, so you’re gonna
have to learn how to cook anything you can find.

Japanese: 自然と腕も　上がるさ
English: Keep doing that and you’ll naturally improve.

Japanese:
ボクも　それに近いかな
長く旅をしてると
自然に　身に付くものさ
English:
I think that might have been the case for me... 
I just naturally learned the more I travelled.

Japanese:
コーダは？
コーダの話はしないのか　しかし！
English: What about Coda though?

Japanese:
キュキュは？
キュキュの話もしないか？
English: What about QQ? You not gonna ask QQ?

Japanese:
コーダは　食うばっかりで
料理なんかせぇへんやろ！
English: But yer always eatin’, Coda!

Japanese: キュキュ姉ちゃんは　そうやなぁ…
English: As if ya can cook! As for Sis QQ...

Japanese:
コンウェイのおっちゃんと
同じで　旅が長そうやから
自然と身に付いた感じ？　当たりやろ？
English:
Maybe sumthin’ like Uncle Kongwei where ya
jus’ naturally learned how ta cook as ya travelled?
Am Ah right?

Japanese:
おお～　エル
大当たり！
English: Ooh! Hermie right! Hermie really right!

Japanese:
へへへ　こう見えて　ウチ
人を見る目は　あるねんで！
English: Hehe, Ah might be a kid but Ah have a good eye!

Japanese:
だからボクは　おっちゃんなんて
呼ばれるような年齢じゃないと
何度言ったらわかるんだ　あの子は…
English:
When exactly will that child understand that I am
still too young to be called an uncle...

Japanese: みんな仲良し…か？　１
English: Everyone’s Getting Along... Right? 1

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
ルカ　やっぱおまえの剣
デカ過ぎだって
もっと体にあった　武器を選べよ
English:
Ruca, that sword’s really too big for you. 
Why don’t you pick one that fits you better?

Japanese:
まったくだ
体を壊しかねんぞ
English:
He’s right, at this rate you’ll end 
up breaking that body of yours.

Japanese: …って　言われてるけど
English: Or so they say...

Japanese:
ルカくん自身は
どう思ってるの？
English: but what do you think?

Japanese:
やっぱり　僕は憧れてたアスラと
同じ武器を使いたいんだ
みんなは　どうなの？　なにか理由あるの？
English:
Well, I think I’ll still stick with this since it’s 
the same type of weapon that Asura uses. 
What about you, guys?

Japanese:
俺は　便利だからだな
いろいろ格闘術も　かじったが
結局　白兵戦では　ライフルが一番だ
English:
I find it convenient since I dabble in various 
martial arts. And from experience, I find using
a rifle very useful.

Japanese:
ボクは得意なことを　続けてたら
自然に　こうなってたとしか
言えないな
English:
All I can say is that I slowly grew accustomed 
to this weapon the more I used it.

Japanese:
オレは　オヤジと兄貴たちへの反発
身内じゃ　二刀流の使い手がいなかったからよ
オレが　最初に極めてやろうってな
English:
No one in my family really uses dual swords, 
so I decided to fight with these the moment 
I decided to rebel against them.

Japanese:
ふん…　スパーダらしい
バカな理由だな
English:
What a stupid reason... Though that does 
sound like something you’d do.

Japanese:
バカで結構！
オレが　満足してんだから
それで　いいんだよ！
English:
And that’s fine by me!
At least I’m good at what I do!

Japanese:
でも　それでホントに極めちゃうのが
スパーダのスゴいところだよね
English:
But you know, I think it’s that decisiveness
that makes you amazing.

Japanese:
女性陣は　どうなのかな…
今度　聞いてみよっと
English:
You know... I should ask the girls why
they use their weapons next time.

Japanese: みんな仲良し…か？　２
English: Everyone’s Getting Along... Right? 2

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
ねえ　イリアは
どうして武器に　銃を選んだの？
English: Hey, Illia, why do you use guns?

Japanese:
土地柄よ
銃がないと　命にかかわる環境だったから
物心ついた頃に　親から渡されてね
English:
The southwest’s dangerous if you don’t have 
a gun, so my parents gave me ’em when
I was just a kid.

Japanese:
じゃあ　二丁拳銃なのも
親御さんの影響？
English: So is that why you use two guns?

Japanese:
ああ　これは
派手で　カッコいいから
English: Ahh no... I use two guns coz I think it’s cool.

Japanese:
ヘタな鉄砲
数撃ちゃあたる…　かな…？
English:
You will eventually hit a target if
you shoot at it enough...?

Japanese:
ヘタな鉄砲
数撃ちゃあたる…　だよね…？
English:
You’ll eventually hit a target if 
you shoot at it enough... yeah...

Japanese:
ちょっと
なに　ヒソヒソやってんのよ！
English: What the hell are you whispering to each other!?

Japanese:
わ…　私の場合は
教団で　短剣術を教わったのが
きっかけね！
English:
I-In my case!!! I just happened to take self-defense
lessons with a dagger in the church.

Japanese:
体力のある方じゃなかったから
短剣術くらいが
ちょうど良かったの
English:
I lack much physical strength, 
so its lightweighted nature is 
quite suitable for me.

Japanese: ウチはな！　ウチはな！
English: How ’bout me? Ask me! Ask me!

Japanese:
あんたは聞かなくても　わかるから…
どうせ　殴る以外の戦い方
知らなかったってとこでしょ？
English:
We already know though, basically you
didn’t know anything else aside from punching
people, right?

Japanese:
イリア姉ちゃんの意地悪…
わかっとっても
ウチの口から言わせてぇな！　もう！
English:
Sis Illia, ya meanie! Even if ya knew, ya should
jus’ let me say it! Ah wanted ta say it!

Japanese: キュキュさんは？
English: What about you, QQ?

Japanese:
キュキュは他のモノ　使い方知らない
教えて　もらてない
理由　それだけ　わかたか？
English:
QQ not know how use other weapon. 
Never learned. That QQ reason. Understand?

Japanese:
わかた！　わかたよ！
だから　キュキュさん！
くっつこうとしないでよ！
English:
Yes, I understand! I understand! 
So please don’t hug me!

Japanese: みんな多分仲良し１
English: Everyone’s Probably Getting Along 1

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
うっわぁ～　ルカ　あんた
髪の毛サラッサラねぇ
English: Whoa, Ruca, your hair’s really silky, isn’t it?

Japanese:
ホント　うらやましい
私なんて　髪のクセが強いから
クシの通りが　悪くて困ってるのに
English:
I am rather jealous. My hair is quite frizzy, 
so combing it can be an undertaking, 
to put it simply...

Japanese:
あたしも　毛先が
ハネちゃうのよね～
English: Same, my hair tips can get really curly...

Japanese:
でも　僕より　リカルドの方が
サラサラなんじゃない？
English: But isn’t Ricardo’s hair silkier than mine?

Japanese:
そう言われてみれば　サラサラでツヤツヤ…
やっぱり　リカルドさん
髪の手入れには　気を遣ってるんですか？
English:
Now that you mention it, it is... How do you take
care of it, Sir Ricardo? Do you have some 
special technique that we can learn?

Japanese:
手入れなど　特にしてないな
マメに　毛先を揃えて
朝晩にクシを　入れたりするぐらいだ
English:
Nothing special... I just comb it in the morning,
tie it together, and comb it again before bed.

Japanese: 地味に　やってんじゃん！
English: You’re not even trying!

Japanese:
そう言えば　コンウェイも髪キレイだよね
あれで　長く伸ばしてたら
女の人にしか　見えないね！　あはは！
English:
On that topic, Kongwei’s hair is also
pretty, isn’t it? If he lets it grow out he’d
definitely look like a woman! Haha!

Japanese:
…まさか　オレの話じゃないだろうな？
誰が　なににしか見えないって？
English:
You’re not talking about me, are you...? 
Mind repeating that again?

Japanese:
…え？　いや　そのぅ
ちょっと　髪の毛の話をしてただけで…
特に　そのぅ…
English:
Huh? No... uh... We were just talking 
about each other’s hair and... uhh...

Japanese:
ああ　そう…
ふ～ん
English: Oh really...? Then fine...

Japanese:
あ～　怖かった～…
あのコンウェイが　一人称が変わるほど
怒るなんて　どうしたんだろ…
English:
Th-That was scary... I wonder why
that made him so angry...?

Japanese: みんな多分仲良し２
English: Everyone’s Probably Getting Along 2

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
スパーダくんとエルの髪の色って
結構　珍しいよね
まあ　私の髪も人のこと　言えないけど
English:
