Hermie and Spada’s hair colors are quite
uncommon, are they not? Although, I am 
not really in a position to say that.

Japanese:
そ…　そうかな？
緑の髪なんて　ありふれて…
English: Really...? I thought green hair was pretty common...

Japanese:
ないない
兄ちゃんみたいな髪の人
そんなには　おらんて
English:
No way, Ah never seen anybody
with the same color as yers.

Japanese:
ウチは　この髪
気に入っとるんやで
でも目立つねんなぁ　これ
English:
Personally, Ah really like mah hair color,
but it really stands out, don’ it?

Japanese:
可愛い色なんだから
少し目立つくらいで
ちょうどいいんじゃない？
English:
Is it not nice to have hair that stands out?
Especially such a cute color.

Japanese:
でもなぁ　悪さしたら
一発で　特定されんねん
English:
It is nice yeah, but ya know, Ah always end up bein’ the 
one gettin’ blamed whenever sumthin’ bad happens.

Japanese: 「また　あの薄紫や！」
English: They always go:

Japanese: って
English: “It’s that purple-haired brat again!”

Japanese:
せやから
ほっかむりは
欠かせへんかったわ～
English: That’s why Ah always wear this shawl.

Japanese:
…おまえが　悪さしてるときに
ほっかむりなんてやってりゃ
それこそ「まんま」じゃねェか…
English:
That’s coz you’re the one
who’s causing the trouble...

Japanese: みんな仲良しっぽい１
English: Everyone’s Getting Along-ish 1

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
ねえ　エル
その鼻の頭　どうかしちゃったの？
English: Hey, how did your nose get like that, Hermie?

Japanese:
確かに
色　変わってんな…
English:
Now that you mention it, your nose looks really
strange...

Japanese: なんか塗ってんのか？
English: Did you put something on it?

Japanese:
ああ～　これには
ふっか～いわけが
あったり　なかったりでな
English: Oh this...? Ah gotta good an’ a bad reason fer this.

Japanese:
もしかして
前に　ケガでもしたの？
English: Did you hurt your nose before?

Japanese:
いやぁ　古い話になんねんけどなぁ
商売やってた　おとんとおかんが
ため込んだ　お宝があんねん
English:
Nah, Ah got this a long time ago. 
So remember how mah Ma an’ Da were
in the trade business?

Japanese:
その隠し場所を
ウチが生まれたときに
地図にして　この鼻の頭に…
English: When Ah was born, they had a map placed on--

Japanese:
なにぃ！？　つまり　それは宝の地図か！
そういう話は　早く言えよ！
ちょっと　みんなに知らせてくる！
English:
A MAP!? So basically that’s a treasure map!? 
You should’ve mentioned it earlier! I’m gonna 
go tell every one!

Japanese: …そんなわけないよね？
English: That’s not true... right?

Japanese: あるわけないやん
English: Course not.

Japanese:
で　結局その鼻の頭は
どうしたの？
English: So what really happened to your nose?

Japanese:
乙女には　多少の秘密があった方が
ええねんて！
そやからヒ・ミ・ツ！
English:
Yer not supposed ta pry ’bout a lady’s secret.
So, mah lips are sealed.

Japanese: みんな仲良しっぽい２
English: Everyone’s Getting Along-ish 2

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
ねえ　そういや
リカルドの額の傷ってさぁ～
なにが　原因だと思う？
English:
Hey, so... about Ricardo’s scar on his forehead...
How do you think he got it?

Japanese:
戦場での　負傷じゃないの？
それしか　考えられないけど
English:
Is it not a battle scar?
That is the only reason I can think of.

Japanese:
お金とか酒とか女性関係の
トラブルなんて　リカルドには
縁がなさそうだもんねぇ
English:
Yeah... I don’t think money, booze, and
women are his thing...

Japanese: あ…
English: Ah--

Japanese:
…なんだ？
幽霊でも　見るような顔をして
English:
...What?
You look like you’ve seen a ghost.

Japanese:
ああ　いえ
ちょうどリカルドさんの
お話をしてたものですから…
English: Oh, nothing. We were just talking about you.

Japanese:
あんたのね
額の傷の話をしてたのよ
それって　やっぱり戦場での負傷？
English:
Yeah, we were talking about that scar on 
your forehead. Did you really 
get that from the battlefield?

Japanese:
…この傷は
思い出すのも　はばかられる
俺の若き日の　過ちってヤツだな
English:
This wound... it’s something from when
I was nothing but a reckless brat.

Japanese:
う…　なんだか
重そうな話ですね
English: Oh... this seems like quite a heavy topic...

Japanese:
若い頃
居候同然の生活をしていたときに
女に逃げられてな
English:
Lived as something like a freeloader back 
then to the extent that the one I was dating 
left me.

Japanese:
ヤケ酒をあおっていたら
グデングデンに　酔いつぶれて
English:
Ended up an alcoholic trying to drink away 
the sadness, so much so that I almost died 
from an overdose...

Japanese: そのときに…
English: Then...

Japanese:
ああ…　ありがちねぇ
それで　酔っ払い相手にケンカ…
English:
Ohhh that’s pretty typical. Lemme guess, 
you got into a fight while drunk?

Japanese:
いや
便所で転んだ…
English: No. I slipped in a restroom--

Japanese: はぁ…？
English: The WHAT?

Japanese:
あの日ほど　酔ったことはなかった…
顔から便器に　突っ込む経験など
生涯一度で十分だ
English:
If I didn’t get drunk that day, I wouldn’t have ended
up with my face halfway in the toilet bowl... 
Once is more than enough.

Japanese:
それから　俺は自分を戒めたのさ
だからこそ　今の俺がある
English:
Ever since that day, I tempered myself, and here
I am now.

Japanese: ふん…　つまらん話をしてしまったな…
English: It was quite absurd, wasn’t it?

Japanese: 人には　歴史があるものねぇ
English: There are all sorts of people out there...

Japanese: みんな結構仲良し１
English: Everyone Quite Getting Along 1

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
いろんな街や村に　行ったけど
やっぱり　僕は
レグヌムが　好きだなぁ
English:
I know we’ve been through a lot of towns, 
but I still think Regnum’s the best.

Japanese:
ウチも　ええ街やと思うで
露店もぎょうさんあって
にぎやかやったし
English:
Same, Ah think it’s a purty nice town. 
Has lotsa stalls an’ it’s purty lively.

Japanese:
レグヌムは　工場労働者が多いからな
そういう連中にとっちゃあ
露店は　便利なんだろうな
English:
Well, Regnum has a lot of factory workers so I 
bet those stalls are pretty handy for those folk.

Japanese:
そうそう！
ウチも　よう使わせてもろたで
English: Yeah! Ah go ta those stalls too!

Japanese: まあ　主に「あれ」でやけどな
English: But when it comes ta stalls it’s gotta be that one.

Japanese: なんだよ「あれ」って！
English: “That one?” What are you...

Japanese: ああいや…
English: Ahh... nevermind.

Japanese:
言わなくていい
聞きたくねェからな…
English: I don’t wanna know what “that one” is.

Japanese:
でも　スパーダの家って
王宮のあるあたりでしょ？
なのに　下町に詳しいんだね
English:
Spada, you live in the upper district, right? 
But you know so much about the lower district.

Japanese:
家になんて　帰らず
不良仲間んとこ　泊まり歩いてたからな
そりゃあ　詳しくもなるってもんよ
English:
I might live there but I’m always with people from
the lower district, so I just learned from them.

Japanese:
スパーダ兄ちゃんの家かぁ
そらぁ　周りには
お金持ちが　しこたま住んどるんやろなぁ
English:
Spada Bro’s place, huh? If Ah recall correctly, there
were lotsa rich folk livin’ in the neighborhood.

Japanese:
ただ　お金持ってるだけじゃなくて
ホントの上流階級なんだよ
English: They’re not just rich, they’re actual upper class.

Japanese:
はぁ～　そういう場所　行ったら
ウチも　労働意欲が増すやろなぁ
English:
Ohhh... Ah bet if Ah go there Ah’d
get more motivation ta work hard.

Japanese: …労働意欲って
English: “Motivation”...

Japanese: おまえ　なにする気だよッ！
English: What the hell are you planning, you--!

Japanese: ああいや…
English: Ugh...

Japanese: 言わなくていいからな！
English: You don’t have to tell me, okay?

Japanese: みんな結構仲良し２
English: Everyone’s Quite Getting Along 2

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
いろんな街や村に　行ったけど
やっぱり　私は
地方が　好きだなぁ
English:
We have been to many places, however I still prefer
my hometown.

Japanese: えぇ～？
English: Really...?

Japanese:
あたしはレグヌムがいいなぁ
住むなら　マムートも悪くないかな
English:
I guess I’d prefer to live in Regnum...
Marmut’s kinda nice too.

Japanese: ねえ　リカルドは　どこがいい？
English: How about you, Ricardo?

Japanese:
俺は　戦場を転々としてきたから
どこかに　定住することなど
考えたことがないな
English:
Good question. I’ve always been traveling, so the
thought has never crossed my mind...

Japanese:
リカルドさん
ご出身は　どちらでしたっけ？
English: Where were you from, again?

Japanese:
ガラムの山岳地帯だ
代々　傭兵をしている民族の出でな
English:
From the Garam region.
Raised in a tribe of mercenaries.

Japanese:
稼いだ金の一部を　送金する程度で
ほとんど　関わりがないから
故郷という　実感もあまりない
English:
I send them a portion of my pay, but other than
that I don’t really have any affection for that
place.

Japanese:
ふ～ん
じゃあ　ガラムに帰るつもりないの？
English:
Ohh... so you’re not planning on going back to
Garam?

Japanese:
…どうだろうな
ガラムに帰るのも　悪くないが
どうせ住むなら　戦に縁のない方がいい
English:
I wonder... I guess it’s not bad, but I’d rather not
get caught up in war ever again.

Japanese:
じゃあ　ガルポス辺りが
いいんじゃない？
English: Then wouldn’t Galpos be the perfect place?

Japanese: あたしは　マムート取った～♪
English: I call shots on Marmut!

Japanese: え？　それって　早い者勝ちなの？
English: Huh? So it is first come first serve now...?

Japanese:
まあ　私はナーオスで
全然構わないけど…
English:
Well, not that it would matter.
I will still choose Naohs.

Japanese: 地方が　良かったんじゃないの？
English: You’re not gonna choose a country?

Japanese:
私　ナーオスが長かったから
暮らしていくことを　考えたら
やっぱりね
English:
I have lived in Naohs for so long, I suppose it is
just natural.

Japanese:
ふん…　どこかに定住か…
俺も　先のことを考えておく
年齢なのかもしれんな
English:
Settling down somewhere...
I guess it’s about time I start thinking about it...

Japanese: みんな仲良し！
English: Everyone’s Getting Along!

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
んー？
ルカ　なにボーッとしてる
おなかすいたのか　しかし？
English:
What are you dazing about, Ruca?
Are you hungry though?

Japanese:
ちょっと　自分の将来のことをね
この旅が　終わったら
どうするのかって　考えてたんだ
English:
I’ve been thinking... mostly about what I’m
going to do in the future.

Japanese:
ほら　みんなの将来の話を聞いたから
僕も自分のこと
マジメに考えようと思ってさ
English:
I figured that I should start thinking about it
more seriously after hearing what everyone’s
plans are.

Japanese:
父さんの仕事を手伝うのか
本当に　お医者の道を選ぶのか
それとも　もっと別の…
English:
Should I help out and inherit my Dad’s business...?
Or should I be more honest and become a doctor...
and more...

Japanese:
でも　みんなとせっかく仲良くなれたんだし
いつまでも　この旅が
続けばいいな　なんて思ったりもして…
English:
But now that I’ve gotten to know everyone, 
I just hope this journey will never end...

Japanese: ああ…　ごめんごめん
English: Oh sorry...

Japanese: 退屈だった？
English: Were you bored?

Japanese:
…ＺＺＺ
早くおかわり出すんだな　しかし…
ムニャムニャ
English:
zzzzzz...
Hurry and give me seconds...

Japanese: 退屈だったんだね…
English: He was bored...

Japanese: 僕とコンウェイ１
English: Kongwei and I 1

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: え…　え～と　あのぅ
English: Umm...

Japanese:
どうしたの　ルカくん
…………
…もしかして　緊張してる？
English: What is wrong, Ruca?

Japanese:
僕　ひとりっ子だったし
年上の男の人と　どう接していいのか
よくわからなくてさ
English:
I... I’m an only child, you see... So... uhh... I... 
I don’t know how I’m supposed to talk to a 
man older than me.

Japanese:
ふたりきりで　話すのは
やっぱり　すぐには慣れなくて
English:
And I think it’s hard to get used to talking 
to someone when you’re alone with them.

Japanese: そう
English: Is that so...?

Japanese:
でも　コンウェイさんは
一緒に　旅をしてくれてる人だから
仲良くしなきゃと思って　だから…
English:
But since you’re travelling with us from now on,
I thought that I’d have to get along with you.

Japanese:
頑張って　話しかけようと
思ったんだけど
English: And I think I’m trying my best to talk to you, but...

Japanese: 僕　ヘンかな？
English: am I really that weird?

Japanese:
そんなことはないよ
慣れてないのなら　これから慣れればいい
何事も練習さ
English:
Of course not, if you are not used to something,
it is better to start getting used to it. Consider 
it practice.

Japanese:
年上の男が　苦手なら
ボクが　練習台になってあげる
いつでも　話し相手になるよ
English:
If you are not used to talking to older men, 
then feel free to come and talk to me. I can
be your practice partner.

Japanese:
…うん！
ありがとう！
English: Okay! Thank you!

Japanese:
まあ　ルカくんの場合　年齢に関係なく
人との付き合い方を
もっと学んだ方がいいと　思うけどね
English:
In Ruca’s case, he has to get
used to talking to people in general.

Japanese: 僕とコンウェイ２
English: Kongwei and I 2

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
ねえ　ルカくん
人に嫌われるのは
そんなにイヤ？
English:
Ruca, are you really that afraid
of having others hate you?

Japanese:
えと…
どうして　急にそんなこと…
English: Why the sudden question...?

Japanese:
ルカくんを
見ていれば　わかるよ
English: It is just obvious by looking at you.

Japanese:
…だって　人に嫌われて
いいことなんてないでしょ
それに僕　誰も傷つけたくないから…
English:
I mean... It’s bad being hated by others, right?
And... I don’t really want to hurt others too...

Japanese:
でもね　ルカくん
人を傷つけたくないことと
自分が傷つきたくないことは　別だよ
English:
But, Ruca, hurting others is 
different from hurting yourself.

Japanese:
ルカくんは　人を傷つけたくないんじゃなくて
人に嫌われることで
自分が　傷つきたくないんじゃないかな
English:
Its not that you do not want to hurt others, it is that 
you do not want to get hurt by others hating you.

Japanese: ボクには　そんな風に見えるよ
English: Well that is how I see it, at least.

Japanese:
だって　人も僕も…
誰も傷つかないで済むなら
それが　一番いいじゃないか…
English:
Because it’s best if no one gets hurt... 
not me, or anyone.

Japanese: 僕とコンウェイ３
English: Kongwei and I 3

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
どうしたの　ルカくん
考えごとかい？
English:
A penny for your thoughts, Ruca. 
What are you thinking about?

Japanese:
…うん
イリアが僕のこと　どう思ってるのか
わからなくてさ…
English:
Oh... I was just wondering 
about what Illia thinks of me.

Japanese:
そんなこと　彼女以外
誰にも　わからないよ
English: No one other than her would know that.

Japanese:
そうかもしれないけど
身もフタもない　言い方だね
English:
That’s true, but that’s a pretty 
blunt way of putting things.

Japanese:
人の心なんて　そんなもんさ
もしかすると　彼女自身
わかってないのかもしれないしね
English:
That is just the reality of the situation. 
Although, there might also be the possibility 
that she does not know either.

Japanese:
でも　ルカくんは
彼女のことを
大切に　思ってるんだろう？
English: However you care for her, do you not?

Japanese:
う…　うん
それは　まあ…
English: Y-Yes... of course...

Japanese:
なら　その気持ちを　大切にすればいい
大事なのは　キミ自身が
どう思っているかだよ
English:
Then treasure that feeling of yours. 
What is important is not how others 
think, but how you view yourself.

Japanese:
キミはまだ　彼女を
失ってはいないんだから
English: Because you have yet to lose her.

Japanese:
イリアを失う？
それって…
English: Lose her...? What--

Japanese:
人は　失って初めて
自分の気持ちに　気付くものさ
でも　キミは「まだ」そうじゃない
English:
People only realize their feelings once they have let
something go. But that is not yet the case for you.

Japanese:
え～と　ごめん
君がなにを言いたいのか
僕には　よくわからないよ…
English: Umm... sorry, I think you’ve lost me there...

Japanese:
…人は　失って初めて
その存在の大きさに　気付く
English:
It is not until you lose someone that you
realize how important they are to you...

Japanese:
ルカくんが　そうならないことを
ボクは祈るよ
English: I pray that you do not experience such a thing.

Japanese: 僕とコンウェイ４
English: Kongwei and I 4

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
ねえ　イリアとスパーダって
すごく仲がいいと　思わない？
English:
Hey, don’t you think that Illia 
and Spada get along too well?

Japanese:
一緒に　旅をする仲間なら
仲が良くて　当たり前だと思うけど？
English:
I believe that is just natural given 
that we are traveling together.

Japanese:
…でもさ　ふたりでヒソヒソ
話をしてることが　多くてさ
なのに僕が近づくと　急に黙るんだ
English:
But they’re always whispering to each other,
then they’d shut up when I come near them...

Japanese: ああ　それはね…
English: Ohh... that...

Japanese:
あのふたり
好き合ってたりするのかな…
やっぱり　そうなのかな…
English:
I wonder if they both like each other...? 
Maybe that’s really the case...

Japanese:
あのふたりの　ヒソヒソ話なんて
ルカくんを　どうやってからかうか
相談してるだけだと思うけどね
English:
...They are probably just discussing with each 
other how they are going to tease Ruca.

Japanese: 僕とコンウェイ５
English: Kongwei and I 5

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
ねえ　ルカくん
ガラムでキミが　倒れてたときの話だけど
言っておいた方が　いいと思ってさ
English:
About the time when you collapsed back 
in Garam, I believe it is best that I should 
tell you.

Japanese:
うん
なんの話だろ…？
English: Tell me about what?

Japanese:
みんなは　キミが倒れていた間に
遊びに行ってたとか　よく休めたとか
言ったかもしれないけど　全部ウソだよ
English:
All those things that everyone told you 
about playing around while you were 
sleeping, they are all lies.

Japanese:
キミの看病を担当してたメンバーは　もちろん
遊びに行ったメンバーも　心ここにあらず
みんな　キミの身を心配してた
English:
Those who were watching over you--and
naturally those who were playing outside--they
were all distracted, worrying about you.

Japanese: そうだったんだ…
English: Ohh...

Japanese:
ルカくんは　もう少し自分に
自信を持っても　いいんじゃないかな
English:
I think it would be best if you have
some more confidence in yourself.

Japanese:
愛されていない人間は　あんな風に
みんなから　心配されたりしないよ
English:
If no one liked you, they would not be 
worrying about you in the first place.

Japanese:
人が人を心配するのは
その人に　愛情を感じている証だから
English:
It is because worrying about others 
is also proof of their love for them.

Japanese:
う…　うん
ありがとう　コンウェイ
English: O-Okay... thank you, Kongwei.

Japanese: 僕とコンウェイ６
English: Kongwei and I 6

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
ルカくん
キミは　ボクの持っていた印象と
ずいぶん違うね
English:
You were quite different from
the impression I had of you.

Japanese: えと…
English: Umm...

Japanese: 僕の印象？
English: your “impression” of me?

Japanese:
正直な話　キミのことは
キミの言うところの　アスラに
もっと　近い人物なのかと思ってたよ
English:
To tell you the truth, I initially expected
that you would be more like Asura.

Japanese:
僕　アスラに
少しでも　近づきたいんだけど
まだまだなんだね…
English:
Well, that’s who I’d like to be like, but I 
guess I still have a long way to go.

Japanese:
でもさ　キミはルカ・ミルダであって
アスラじゃない
そういうムリは　必要ないんじゃないかな
English:
Just because the “Ruca Milda” that I met 
is not Asura, it does not mean that you 
have to force yourself to act like him.

Japanese:
ボクは　今のキミのこと　嫌いじゃないよ
きっと　みんなだって　そうさ
English:
I do not hate the way you are; I am sure 
the same goes for everyone else.

Japanese: そ…　そうかな？
English: D-Do you really think so?

Japanese:
その証拠に　嫌いだからという理由で
キミのもとを去る人間は　いないだろ？
English: Why would I travel with someone I hated?

Japanese:
人は　嫌いな人間と
旅なんてしないよ
English: People do not just travel with others that they hate.

Japanese:
まあ　だからといって
あまり　調子に乗られても
困るんだけどさ
English:
But, just because I said that does not mean 
that you can get overly-familiar with me.

Japanese: あはは…
English: Haha...

Japanese:
うん
気を付けるよ　コンウェイ
English: Well, I’ll keep that in mind.

Japanese: 僕とコンウェイ７
English: Kongwei and I 7

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
はぁ…
女の子って　どうしてあんなに
かわいいんだろ？
English: Sigh... I wonder why she’s so cute...
Are you...

Japanese: それはイリアのこと？
English: Are you perhaps talking about Illia?

Japanese: えっ？　い…　いや…！
English: Huh? N-No!

Japanese: そ…　そうとは言ってないでしょ！
English: I didn’t say it was Illia...

Japanese:
…うん
まあ「そうとは」言ってないけどね
English: Well, that is true. You did not say it outright.

Japanese:
はぁ…　それにしても
女の子って　どうしてあんなに
かわいいんだろ？
English: That said... I wonder why she’s so cute...

Japanese:
女の子は　みんな
可愛いもんなんじゃないかな？
English: Are not all girls cute?

Japanese:
ええ…　そうかな
でもさ　別にかわいくない
女の子だっているじゃない…
English:
Is that so? But wouldn’t there 
also be uncute girls out there?

Japanese:
…ルカくん　キミさ
あまり　考えなしに物を言うのは
どうかと思うな
English:
Ruca... I do not believe it is wise 
to say things so thoughtlessly.

Japanese:
今　間違いなく　キミ
全人類の半分を　敵に回したと思うよ
English:
You just turned half of humanity against you 
the moment you said that...

Japanese: 僕とコンウェイ８
English: Kongwei and I 8

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
ねえ　コンウェイは
この旅の後のこととか
考えてる？
English:
Hey, have you ever thought about 
what you’re going to do after this?

Japanese:
旅の後のことか…
もし　この旅が終わったら
まずは　とにかく国へ帰るよ
English:
After this... I suppose I will have to go
back to my country afterwards.

Japanese:
そのあとは　そうだな…
本でも書こうかな
ルカくんたちとの旅を　記録として残す
English:
And when I do... maybe I shall write 
a book about your journey.

Japanese:
え…　この旅のこと　本にするの！？
じゃあ　僕のことは
格好良く書いてよ！　ね？
English:
Huh!? Y-You’ll write a book about our journey? 
Th-then, make sure to write about me! Okay?

Japanese:
さあ　それはどうだろうね
ボクはボクが見て　ボクが感じた
ありのままを書くよ
English:
I wonder... 
I will probably just write about my experiences.

Japanese:
申し訳ないけど　それでルカくんが
格好良く見えなかったとしても
それは　仕方ないんじゃないかな
English:
So I apologize if what I end up writing
does not present you in a better light.

Japanese:
そ…　そうだね
そういうズルは　いけないよね…
English: R-Right... I can’t say that that’s unfair...

Japanese:
でも　そんな先のことよりも
今　考えるべきは
まず　目の前のことだよ
English:
However, now is not the time for us to be
thinking about the future. We should first focus
on what lies before us.

Japanese:
じゃあ　ちょっとでもコンウェイの本に
格好良く書いてもらえるよう
僕　頑張るよ！
English:
Right, then from now on I’ll try my
best to look good in the book you’re
going to write.

Japanese: 僕とコンウェイ９
English: Kongwei and I 9

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
コンウェイって
ときどき　そうやって
手のひらを　見つめてるよね？
English:
Can I ask, why do you look at the palm of your 
hands sometimes?

Japanese:
ああ…　自分が　なんのために
ここにいるのか
忘れないようにと　思ってね
English:
Oh... Well, I do this so I will not forget the reason 
I came here.

Japanese:
なんのために　ここにいるのか…？
ねえ　コンウェイ
その手のひらにあるのって…
English:
The “reason” you’re here? Then that thing on 
the palm of your hand is...

Japanese: これはね「魂の檻」
English: This here, is a Soul’s Cage.

Japanese:
たましいの…
おり…？
English: A soul’s... cage?

Japanese:
そうだな
わかりやすく言うと…
English: Oh, right... I should explain it in simpler terms.

Japanese:
ボクの手は　救われない魂を
救うためにある　「魂の救済」
そのために　必要な物ってところかな
English:
My hand contains the means necessary to bring 
salvation to helpless souls. That is why such a thing 
like this is necessary.

Japanese:
え～と…　ちっとも
わかりやすくなかったんだけど…
English: Uhh... But that wasn’t really clear though...

Japanese:
それにしても　手のひらを見つめてるときの
コンウェイって
すごく　寂しそうなんだよな
English:
He looks really lonely whenever he stares at the palm 
of his hand.

Japanese: 僕とコンウェイ１０
English: Kongwei and I 10

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
いよいよ　最後の戦いだね
コンウェイ　今まで旅に付き合ってくれて
本当にありがとう
English:
We’re almost at the final battle... 
Thank you for coming with us, Kongwei.

Japanese: 急に改まって　どうかしたの？
English: Why so formal all of a sudden?

Japanese:
だって　コンウェイは
前世とか関係ないのに
一緒に　旅をしてくれたでしょ
English:
Because, you’re here with us despite not
even being related to our past lives...

Japanese:
だから　ちゃんと
お礼を言っておこうと思って
English:
So I figured that I should at 
least properly thank you.

Japanese:
お礼なんて　必要ないよ
だってボクたち　仲間だろ？
English:
There is no need for you to do that... 
I am your friend, remember?

Japanese:
仲間…　うん　そうだね！
あと少し　マティウスを倒すまで
一緒に　頑張ろう！
English:
My friend... Yeah! That’s true! Let’s try 
our best, at least until we defeat Mattheus!

Japanese:
…ああ　頑張るとも
なにせボクは　そのときのために
苦労を　重ねて来たんだから
English:
Right, let us do our best... 
After all the hardships we have endured, 
we must see it through.

Japanese:
黎明の塔…
ボクの望みが　果たされる
ようやく　そのときが来る
English:
The Tower of Dawn... the moment where my 
mission gets accomplished slowly draws closer...

Japanese: 僕とキュキュ１
English: QQ and I 1

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
ルカは
キュキュの思てたのと
ちょと違うな
English: Ruca quite different from what QQ thought.

Japanese:
えと…
キュキュさんの思ってた　僕？
English: Uhh... what you thought of me?

Japanese:
あ～　キュキュは　ルカのこと
もっと…　こう…
ん～　うまく言えない
English: Yeah, Ruca is... hmm... QQ find hard to say...

Japanese:
でもな　キュキュは
今のルカがいい
いっしょに旅できて　うれしい
English:
But Ruca right now good!
QQ happy traveling with Ruca.

Japanese:
キュキュさんの思ってた　僕か…
どういうことだろ？
English: I wonder what QQ thought of me...?

Japanese:
僕　キュキュさんと
前に　会ったことでもあったっけ？
English: Did she perhaps meet me before?

Japanese: 僕とキュキュ２
English: QQ and I 2

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: なに考えてるか　ルカ？
English: What you thinking, Ruca?

Japanese:
あ～　うんとね　イリアのこと
一緒に旅してきて　最初の頃に比べると
ずっと慣れたけどさ
English:
Oh... I’ve been thinking about Illia. 
We’ve been traveling for a while now
so I’ve gotten used to being with her.

Japanese:
でも　やっぱりまだ僕のこと
どう思ってるのか　よくわからないし
どうすれば　いいのかなって…
English:
But I still don’t know what she thinks of me, 
so I’m not really sure how I’m supposed to talk to her.

Japanese:
ふ～ん
キュキュは　思う
そういうこと考える　意味ない
English: Hmm... QQ thinks, thinking about it not important.

Japanese: だから　イリアに聞くがいいと思う
English: Asking Illia is better.

Japanese: おーい！　イリ…
English: Illi--

Japanese:
わ～！　ちょっと　ちょっと！
やめてよ　キュキュさん！
English: Ahh! W-Wait! Stop! Please don’t, QQ!

Japanese:
え～とね…　今の話はイリアには
ヒミツにして　欲しいというか…
みんなにも　聞かれたくないというか…
English:
I’d like it if you keep this secret
from her or everyone...

Japanese:
あ～　ルカ
むずかしいこと　言う
English: Ruca says difficult thing.

Japanese: え～と…
English: Hmm...

Japanese:
キュキュさんには
人に　知られたくないこととかないの？
English:
How should I put it... Do you have something 
you wouldn’t want others to know?

Japanese:
もちろんある
でもキュキュは　そういうの
人に言わない
English: Of course. But QQ don’t tell others.

Japanese:
人に言う
それ　ヒミツない
わかたか　ルカ？
English: If QQ tell them, it’s not secret. Understand?

Japanese:
でも　それじゃ
誰にも　相談できないっていうか…
English:
But if you keep it secret, you wouldn’t
be able to ask others for help.

Japanese: じゃあ　イリアに聞くがいい
English: Then you ask Illia.

Japanese: おーい！　イリ…
English: Hey, Illia--

Japanese:
わ～わ～！　わかた！　わかたよ！
すごく　よくわかりました！
だから　やめて　キュキュさん！
English: O-Okay! I understand, alright?! So please stop!

Japanese: 僕とキュキュ３
English: QQ and I 3

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
ん～　本当にルカは
キュキュが　思てたのと
違うな…
English:
As QQ thought, Ruca quite different
from what QQ expected...

Japanese:
あれ　キュキュさん
どうかしたの？
English: Hm? What’s the matter?

Japanese: ん～
English: Hmmm...

Japanese: そうだ　あれだ
English: How put this...?

Japanese:
ルカはな　キュキュが思てたより
おとなしい！
English: Ruca is quieter than QQ thought!

Japanese:
キュキュはな
ルカは　もっとエラ…　そう？
エラそう！　イバる人と思てたよ
English:
QQ thought Ruca would be more snob... ish? 
Snobbish! QQ thought Ruca would be more bossy!

Japanese:
うん　ルカは　おとなしい
でも　キュキュは
今のルカが　好き
English: Yeah! Ruca quieter! But QQ likes quiet Ruca.

Japanese: あはは　ありがとう
English: Haha... thank you...

Japanese:
…キュキュさん　少しずつ
ここの言葉　覚えてるんだね
English:
It seems that you’re starting to 
remember more words now.

Japanese:
みんなの話で　ちょとずつ覚えた
あと　みんな　教えてくれる
お祈り　メシ　銃　ボス　あとはなぁ…
English:
QQ slowly starting to remember words from 
everyone, and everyone teach QQ words like
“prayer”, “lunch”, “boss”, and...

Japanese: なんでやねん！
English: “B’why!”

Japanese:
ちょ…
それ教えたの
絶対　エルでしょ
English:
Tha... Hermie’s definitely the one who
taught you that, didn’t she?

Japanese: なんでやねん！
English: “B’why?!”

Japanese:
いやいや…
今のはエルで　いいんだって
English:
No, no... I meant Hermie must’ve been the
one who taught you that.

Japanese: 僕とキュキュ４
English: QQ and I 4

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
ルカは　みんなのボス
違うか？
English: Is Ruca not everyone’s boss?

Japanese:
えっと…　ボス？
それって　リーダーっていう
意味かな？
English: Huh...? “Boss?” Do you perhaps mean “leader?”

Japanese: う～ん…
English: Hmm...

Japanese:
僕とイリアの出会いで　この旅は始まったけど
リーダーとか　ボスっていうのは
違う気がするなぁ
English:
When I met Illia and this journey started... 
I don’t think I felt like a “leader” or a “boss”...

Japanese:
中心人物って　言うのも…
僕　みんなに
支えてもらってばかりだしさ
English:
Perhaps a “central figure?” It always feels
like everyone’s supporting me.

Japanese: ルカ　むずかしいこと言う
English: Ruca says hard word...

Japanese:
それで　ボスが
どうかしたの？
English: So, what’s the matter with this “boss” thing?

Japanese:
次にみんな　どこ行くか
話して決める　命令する人いない
キュキュには　とても不思議
English:
QQ finds it strange that no one
decides where to go and what to do.

Japanese:
ああ…　そう言われてみれば　そうだね
でもイリアが　なにか言い出したら
だいたい　その意見が通るしさ
English:
Ohh, now that you mention it, yeah.
But whenever Illia says something, it’s always
right.

Japanese:
イリアって　みんなの話とか
あんまり聞かないでしょ
English:
Remember how she doesn’t really listen to
others?

Japanese:
だから　どうしてもボスをひとり
挙げろっていうなら
イリアが　そうなんじゃないかな
English:
That’s why, if we’d have to choose a specific 
person to become a boss, I think it’d be her.

Japanese:
お～　なるほど
キュキュ　わかた！
English: Ohhh! I see! QQ understand!

Japanese: お～い！　ボス！
English: Hey, boss!

Japanese:
ちょっと　やめてよ！
こんな話　イリアに聞かれたら
どんな目に　合わされるか！
English:
H-Hey! Wait! Illia’s gonna look at
me weird if she learns of this!

Japanese: 僕とキュキュ５
English: QQ and I 5

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
キュキュさんって
僕たちと　出会う前は
ひとりで旅をしてたの？
English:
Have you always been traveling 
alone until we met?

Japanese:
あ～　仲間たくさんいた
でも　みんな死んだ
English:
Ahh... QQ once had lots of friends. 
They all died.

Japanese: え…　そうなんだ…
English: O-Oh...

Japanese:
ルカ　どして悲しい顔するか？
みんな　国のため　戦って死んだ
キュキュは　うらやましいのに
English:
Why the sad face, Ruca? QQ jealous
that everyone else died for country.

Japanese: で…　でも死んじゃったんだよ？
English: B-But... they died...

Japanese:
……？
国のため　死ぬの当たり前
English: ...? For country, it is natural.

Japanese:
国のためになら　死ぬのが
当たり前なの…
English: Is it really natural to just die for your country...?

Japanese:
じゃ…　じゃあ　もしかして
なにかあったら　キュキュさんも
死ぬつもりなの…？
English:
Then... does that mean you’ll die 
when something happens?

Japanese:
キュキュは死ねない　キュキュ　最後のひとり
だから必ず　生きて帰る
帰って　みんなに会う
English:
QQ will not die! QQ is the only one left,
that’s why QQ has to go back. QQ will 
go back and meet everyone!

Japanese:
うんうん　そうだよ！
それがいいよ
あ～　良かった！
English: Right! Yeah! Th-that’s a relief...!

Japanese: 僕とキュキュ６
English: QQ and I 6

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
キュキュさんって
体が細いのに　すごく強いよね
僕　初めて見たとき　びっくりしちゃったよ
English:
You’re pretty strong despite being so slim... 
I was quite surprised the moment I saw you fight.

Japanese:
体が太い細いと　強い弱い
関係あるか？
English:
Does thick or thin body have
relationship with strength?

Japanese:
え…　でも　やっぱり太いと
力も出せるから　強いんじゃないかな…
English:
Hmm... I suppose the more thick your body is,
the more strength it can muster.

Japanese:
アンジュ太い
でも　力強くない
English: Ange thick but not strong though.

Japanese:
ちょ…
そうかもしれないけど
そんなストレートに…
English: Th-That’s true but... to say it outright is...

Japanese:
武器　速く振る　でも　力使わない
力　うまく使うが大事
速い武器　強いと同じ
English:
She might hit fast, but her hits not strong. 
Important to use power properly, fast weapon
is same as a strong one.

Japanese:
え？　え？
力を使わずに　うまく使うことが大事？
どういうこと？
English:
Hm...? What do you mean by “important
to properly use your power?”

Japanese: ルカ　むずかしいこと聞く…
English: Ruca ask difficult question...

Japanese:
あ～
じゃあ　練習な！
English: Right! Let’s practice!

Japanese:
今から？　い…　いや！
ちょっと　聞いてみただけだから
別に　そこまでしなくてもさ！
English:
N-Now!? I-I was just asking, 
no need to go that far!!

Japanese: 僕とキュキュ７
English: QQ and I 7

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: ルカ　どしたか？
English: What’s wrong, Ruca?

Japanese:
ふぅ…
旅も　もうずいぶん長いからね
少し疲れが　たまってるのかも…
English:
Hm... We’ve been traveling for quite a while now,
so I think I’m slowly growing tired.

Japanese: ルカ　元気ないか
English: Are you not feeling good?

Japanese:
あ～　あれだ　え～と…
そういうのは　ヘンな帽子が言ってた
English:
Then... hmm... what weird
hat said...

Japanese: そうそう！
English: Oh right!

Japanese: ルカ　タマ付いてないか？
English: Is Ruca’s balls sticky?

Japanese: はいぃ？
English: I-I beg your pardon...?

Japanese:
……？
元気ない男の子
タマ付いてない言う　違うか？
English:
Is it not right to say that phrase when talking
about a boy that doesn’t feel well?

Japanese:
いや…　う～ん
ちょっと違うかな？
English: No... hmm... It’s a bit different...

Japanese:
あ～　そうか
キュキュ　間違えた！
English: Ohh... so QQ misunderstood!

Japanese:
スパーダったら
きっと　わざと教えたんだな
まったく　もう！
English:
Sheesh, Spada! He definitely 
taught that to her on purpose!

Japanese: 僕とキュキュ８
English: QQ and I 8

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
キュキュさんと　コンウェイってさ
ときどきふたりで　僕たちの知らない言葉
話してるけど　どんな話をしてるの？
English:
QQ, there are times when you talk to Kongwei
in a weird language... what are you both talking
about?

Japanese:
あ～　ん～　…キュキュ
まだ　むずかしい言葉　わからん
コンウェイ　それ教えてる
English:
Oh, QQ not really used to this language yet, 
so Kongwei is teaching me!

Japanese:
そうかぁ　じゃあ　もし僕の話で
わからない言葉があったら
今度は　僕にも聞いてよ
English:
Ohh... Then, please feel free to ask me if
there’s some words that you don’t know.

Japanese:
極力　わかるように
説明するからさ！
English: I’ll do my best to explain it to you clearly!

Japanese:
慣れないウソをつくのは
疲れるかい？
English: Does it get tiring, telling a lie you are not used to?

Japanese:
どうせ　ボクが悪いんだって
言いたいんだろ？
よ～くわかってるよ
English:
You wish to say I am detestable, do you not?
I know that fully well.

Japanese: 僕とキュキュ９
English: QQ and I 9

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
ねえ　キュキュさんは
この旅が終わった後のこととか
考えてる？
English:
Say, have you ever thought about what
you’re going to do after this journey?

Japanese:
この旅の後…？
ん～　生きて国に帰る
みんなに会う　それだけ
English:
After this journey...? I guess go back to 
country and meet everyone. Only that.

Japanese:
そうか…
キュキュさんは
やりたいことが　決まってるんだね
English: Oh... So you’ve decided on what you want to do...

Japanese: ルカは　考えてないか？
English: Have you not thought about it?

Japanese:
一応　お医者さんか
父さんの仕事を　手伝うかなんだけど…
English:
Well, more or less I’d like to become a 
doctor and help out in my father’s business...

Japanese:
ふたつもあるか！
それはいい
English: Oh! You have two! That’s good!

Japanese: そ…　そうかな？
English: R-Really?

Japanese:
どっちか　ダメでも
もひとつを　やればいい
English:
You can go with the other one
when one doesn’t work!

Japanese: ええ…　そういう意味なの？
English: Oh... is that what you mean...?

Japanese:
う～ん…　そういう言われ方すると
ひとつにしぼった方が　いい気がしてくるなぁ
English:
The way you put it sounds like
I should focus on one thing...

Japanese: 僕とキュキュ１０
English: QQ and I 10

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
キュキュさん
ここまで　旅に付き合ってくれて
ありがとう
English: Thank you for traveling with us, QQ.

Japanese:
ルカ　気にしない
お礼言う　キュキュの方
みんな　旅いっしょしてくれた
English:
Don’t worry about it. I should be
one thanking you and everyone.

Japanese:
キュキュ
とてもとても　うれしかた
ありがと　ありがと
English: Thank you for taking me along! Thank you!

Japanese:
…いよいよ
最後の戦いだね
English: We’re almost at the final battle...

Japanese: そだな
English: That’s true.

Japanese: どうかしたの　キュキュさん？
English: What’s wrong?

Japanese:
なんでもない
ルカ　気にしない
English: Nothing. Don’t worry about it.

Japanese: そう？
English: Is that so...?

Japanese: じゃあ　早く行こうよ！
English: Then, let’s go!

Japanese:
行けば　旅の終わり
お別れも　近くなる…
English:
The journey’s end is near, the time 
for me to say goodbye comes closer...

Japanese: コンウェイとイリア１
English: Kongwei and Illia 1

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
実際のところ　イリアさんって
ルカくんのこと
どう思っているのかな？
English: Now tell me honestly, what do you really think of Ruca?

Japanese:
なんで　そんな話
あんたにしなきゃいけないのよ
English: Why do I have to tell you that?

Japanese:
でも　別にルカくんのこと
嫌いじゃないんでしょ？
English: You do not hate him or anything, do you?

Japanese: そりゃあ　まあ…
English: Of course I don’t...

Japanese:
でも　あいつを見てると
イライラするってのはあるわね
English:
It’s just that looking at him pisses me off for some
reason.

Japanese:
あいつって　ウジウジしてること
多いじゃない？
そういうところが治れば　いいんだけどさ
English:
Like, isn’t he a little TOO timid?
Would be better if he wasn’t.

Japanese:
そんなこと
あいつに　できると思う？
そこんところが　ネックなのよ
English:
Point is, will that kid ever grow a spine and stand up
for himself?

Japanese:
なるほど
ルカくん
なかなか　前途多難だな
English:
I see...
I suppose Ruca has quite a road ahead of him.

Japanese: コンウェイとイリア２
English: Kongwei and Illia 2

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
同じように　記憶を持ってるのに
イリアさんとルカくんは　前世に対する印象が
ずいぶん　違うみたいだね
English:
You and Ruca both share the same memories of your
past lives, yet the way you both act is quite different
from what I expected.

Japanese:
あ～　そりゃそうよ
記憶を持ってるってとこは　同じでも
内容が違うんだもの
English:
Ahh, well naturally. The memories we share might be
the same, but it’s in the small details that differ...

Japanese:
あいつのは　アスラの記憶で
あたしのは　イナンナの記憶でしょ
English:
Ruca has Asura’s memories and I share Inanna’s,
remember?

Japanese:
…なるほどね
前世の記憶を持ってる人ならではの
貴重な意見だな
English:
I see... that is quite valuable insight 
from someone with a previous incarnation.

Japanese:
それにさ　あたし
イナンナみたいな女
嫌いなのよね
English:
And, you know, I’m not really fond of 
women who act like Inanna.

Japanese:
ルカは憧れてるって　言ってるくらいだから
アスラのこと　好きなんでしょ
そりゃ　考え方も違うってもんよ
English:
As for Ruca, he likes Asura coz he looks up to the
big guy. That’s one thing we both differ on.

Japanese:
前世の…　他人の記憶を持つってことは
こういうことなのか
ふむ　とても興味深いな
English:
Interesting... so this is what it’s like to have 
a previous life’s-- a stranger’s memories...

Japanese: コンウェイとイリア３
English: Kongwei and Illia 3

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
どうしたの　イリアさん
…もしかして「あの女」に
言われたこと　気にしてる？
English:
What is the matter, Illia?
Could it be that you are pondering about “that woman?”

Japanese:
…あんたって
なんでも　お見通しって感じで
ときどき　ムカツクわね
English:
You... the way you seem to read my mind kinda pisses
me off sometimes, you know.

Japanese:
そういうの　頭の中を
のぞかれてるみたいで
あんまり　嬉しくないんだけど
English: It feels really disgusting.

Japanese:
心配で　声をかけたんだけど
悪いことしたかな？
English:
I was just asking because I was worried about you.
Did I do something wrong?

Japanese:
あんなこと言われて
気にしないわけないでしょ
チトセのヤツ…
English:
How can I not worry after something like that...
Chitose, she...

Japanese:
でも　コンウェイ
気を遣ってくれて　ありがと
さっきのは　許してあげるわ
English:
Anyways, thank you for worrying about me.
I’ll forgive you this time.

Japanese:
どういたしまして
お互いさまだよ
English: Do not mention it, we are all in this together, after all.

Japanese:
なにせ「彼女」の件については
キミにも少し　手伝ってもらわなくちゃ
いけないからね
English:
You are going to help me out with that girl in the end
anyway...

Japanese: コンウェイとスパーダ１
English: Kongwei and Spada 1

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
はぁッ！　とう！
いやぁあ！
English: Hoo! Hah! Eat this!

Japanese:
スパーダくん
精が出るね
English: My, my, you are quite lively today.

Japanese:
まあな　実戦も大事だけどよ
基本の型のおさらいってヤツも
ちゃんと　やっとかねェとな
English:
Yeah, actual experience is important and all,
but you gotta review the basics from time to time.

Japanese:
前世の力だけに頼らず
努力を惜しまない
キミのそういうところ　尊敬に値するよ
English:
You do not rely on Durandal’s power, but
instead persevere with your own.
For that, I must commend you.

Japanese:
なんだよ　いきなり
照れるじゃねェか
English:
Why the hell are you so sappy all of a sudden?
You’re making me blush.

Japanese:
ふふふ
ジャマして　悪かったね
さあ　続けて続けて
English:
Heheheh, apologies for interrupting your practice.
Now, do not mind me.

Japanese:
あいつ
いけすかねえと思ってたけど
悪いヤツってわけでも　なさそうだな
English:
I thought he was creepy, but he doesn’t seem like a
bad guy...

Japanese: コンウェイとスパーダ２
English: Kongwei and Spada 2

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
スパーダくん　キミは
ルカくんに比べると　あまり前世の影響を
受けていないようだね
English:
Spada, it does not seem as though Durandal 
has much of an influence on you compared 
to Asura’s influence on Ruca.

Japanese:
そりゃ　ルカのヤツに比べりゃな
オレから見れば
あいつが　影響を受けすぎなんだよ
English:
Well, compared to Ruca that is.
Personally, I think he’s been affected too much.

Japanese:
でもなぁ
それはオレの前世が　人じゃなくて
剣だったせいもあるかもな
English:
But y’know, it might be because I was a sword back
then and not a human.

Japanese:
ふむ…
それは　どういうこと？
English: Hmm... what do you mean?

Japanese:
オレの…　デュランダルの記憶って
どんな出来事があったのかってことは
それなりに　覚えてるんだけどよ
English:
I think Durandal remembers things
quite differently compared to how 
a person does.

Japanese:
あんまり　気持ちとか感情みたいなものは
覚えてねェんだよな
そうだなァ…
English:
It didn’t seem like Durandal 
remembered a lot of events 
and what he felt during those...

Japanese:
戦いに勝ったことは　覚えてても
それが　嬉しいことだったかどうかの
記憶はないって感じかな
English:
I remember winning battles, but I don’t remember the
joy of victory from winning them...

Japanese:
ふ～ん
すべての物事に対して
そんな感じなの？
English: Hmm... Does Durandal feel that way for everything?

Japanese:
いや　アスラに対しては
違ったみたいだぜ
English: Nah, apparently not when it comes to Asura.

Japanese:
だから　ルカに初めて会ったとき
なんだか知らねェけど　気に入っちまったのは
デュランダルの影響なんじゃねェ？
English:
So I guess the happiness I felt when I met Ruca for
the first time was probably Durandal’s influence.

Japanese:
まあ　今じゃあ
前世とか関係なく　あいつのこと
気に入ってるけどよ
English:
But now’s pretty different, I like him as I am.
It’s got nothing to do with my past life.

Japanese:
なるほどね
キミたちの話は　本当に興味深いな
English: I see... talking to all of you never fails to amuse me.

Japanese: コンウェイとスパーダ３
English: Kongwei and Spada 3

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
それにしてもよ　コンウェイって
転生者でもねェのに　その強さ
マジすげェよな
English:
It’s still pretty amazing you’re that strong despite not
being a Reincarnator, Kongwei.

Japanese:
ボクの国なら
この程度の人間
そんなに　珍しくないよ
English: It is quite common from where I am from.

Japanese:
へぇ　剣の使い手でも
あんたくらい　強いヤツいるのか？
English:
That so? Reckon there are some swordsmen 
that can match your arte abilities?

Japanese:
もちろんさ
ボクより強い　剣の達人も
きっといると思うよ
English:
Of course. I believe there are 
also masters stronger than I am.

Japanese:
んじゃあ　この旅が終わったら
コンウェイの国へ　武者修行に行くのも
悪くねェかもな！
English:
Then when this journey ends, 
I guess I could travel to your 
country and train there!

Japanese:
う～　なんだか
ウズウズしてくるぜ！
English: Man, I can’t wait!

Japanese: コンウェイとアンジュ１
English: Kongwei and Ange 1

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
コンウェイさんは
どのような　いきさつで　ルカくんたちと
旅をすることになったのですか？
English:
Sir Kongwei, can you tell me how you found yourself
traveling alongside us?

Japanese:
……？
なにか　気になることでもある？
English: Hm...? Is there something wrong?

Japanese:
いえ　コンウェイさんは
転生者ではないそうなので
少し不思議で…
English: Nothing, I just find it strange...

Japanese:
どうして　転生者の私たちと
旅をしてくださるのかと…
English:
Why would you, someone who is not a
Reincarnator, choose to travel with us?

Japanese:
出会いは　ルカくんたちのピンチを
ボクが　助けたことだけど
お願いして　同行させてもらうことにしてね
English:
I just happened to save Ruca, Illia, and Spada while
they were in trouble. It was I who specifically
requested to join them on their journey.

Japanese:
コンウェイさんが
お願いして…　ですか？
English: You...?

Japanese:
そう
ルカくんたちのこと
気に入ったからさ
English:
Indeed, mainly because I have
grown rather fond of them.

Japanese:
どうせ　旅をするのなら
面白そうな人たちと
一緒に　旅をしたかったんだよ
English:
At any rate, since I am already traveling somewhere,
I might as well go with people I like.

Japanese:
そして　そんな人たちの旅を見届けたい
それで　ボクの好奇心は
満たされる
English:
And I want to see their journey through to the end.
That way my curiosity will be satiated.

Japanese:
はぁ…
そうですか
English: I see...

Japanese:
一緒に　旅をする理由なんて
それで十分だと　思うけどね
English:
Just seeing how your journey 
will turn out is enough for me.

Japanese: コンウェイとアンジュ２
English: Kongwei and Ange 2

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
前世と現世で　性別が違うのって
どんな気分なのかな…
English:
I wonder how it feels to be reincarnated in the opposite
sex...

Japanese:
あら
それは　私のことですか？
English: Oh my, are you perhaps talking about me?

Japanese:
あ…　いや
そういうことを　女性に聞くのは
悪いかと思ってたんだけど…
English:
Oh-- uhh, pardon me. I thought it would be rude if I
asked such a question to a lady, but...

Japanese:
別に構いませんよ
私は　気にしませんから
English: It’s fine, I do not mind really.

Japanese:
そうですねぇ　前世と今の違いですか
特別　おかしな感じがしたり
嫌な気分になったりはしませんね
English:
Let us see... personally, I do not feel anything
unpleasant or peculiar from it...

Japanese:
病人や　お年寄りへの奉仕活動で
男の方の体も　見慣れてますから
体の違いも　恥ずかしいと思いませんし
English:
Thanks to these memories, I have grown used to caring 
for male patients and the elderly. I also do not feel 
embarrassed being in a different body either.

Japanese:
私は　覚醒が遅かったせいか
前世の…　オリフィエルの記憶って
なんだか絵本でも　読んでいる感じなんです
English:
Since my awakening was a gradual one, looking 
through my-- Orifiel’s memories feels like
reading a picture book.

Japanese: 絵本…
English: I see...

Japanese:
夢の中で　男の方として
生活するのって
ちょっと　楽しかったりするんですよ
English: It is quite fun, being a man in your dreams...

Japanese:
あ…　すみません
私の体験談だと
あまり　参考にならないかもしれませんね
English: Oh, apologies, my answer might not be very helpful.

Japanese:
いや　そんなことなかったよ
うん　とても興味深い話だった
そうか　絵本か…
English:
No, thank you, you have been very helpful.
Like a “picture book”, huh...

Japanese: コンウェイとアンジュ３
English: Kongwei and Ange 3

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
アンジュ　ひとつ聞いていいかい？
自分自身が　信仰の対象である
神だとわかるのは　どんな気分なのかな？
English:
Ange, can I ask you something? How does it feel 
knowing that you were once an object
of worship in your religion?

Japanese:
あら　それは少し正確ではありませんね
教団が信仰しているのは
天上界であって　個々の神ではありませんよ
English:
Oh my, your question is a bit misleading...
What I worship is not an individual god,
but the whole of Cielo itself.

Japanese: …どういうこと？
English: What do you mean?

Japanese:
言葉にするのは　少し難しいのですが
信仰を続けていれば　救いのある天上界への
道が開ける…　そういうことを信じてるんです
English:
It is difficult to describe it, but as long as you have
faith in this religion, Cielo’s doors will open and your
soul will be saved.

Japanese:
個々の神に　助けを求めているわけではなく
信仰を続けていれば
未来には　希望がある
English:
We do not wish for a specific god to save us.
Rather, we have hope for the future as long as
we hold fast to our faith.

Japanese:
正しい行いや
努力をする者は報われる
そういったことを　信じてるんですよ
English:
We believe that hardworking and kind people will be
rewarded for their deeds.

Japanese:
ですから　前世の記憶があっても
特別　心持ちが変わるようなことは
ありませんでした
English:
So even though I have memories of my past life,
I am not very concerned about how I was an object
of worship.

Japanese:
なるほど
そういうものなんだ
English: I see... so that is how you see things.

Japanese:
もし私が　ガラムのように　神さま個人を
強く信仰している地方の生まれなら
話は変わっていたかも　知れませんけどね
English:
However, my answer might differ if I was born in a
place like Garam which worships individual deities.

Japanese:
でも　コンウェイさんも
こういうお話　興味あったんですね
English:
It is quite surprising to think that you are interested
in these kinds of topics...

Japanese:
では　あちらで　お茶でも飲みながら
天と人の道のあり方について
じっくり　お話しましょうか
English:
Let us speak over there.
I would be happy to discuss the ways of Cielo and
man over tea.

Japanese:
え…　いや
ボクは　そこにはあまり興味が…
English: Oh, uh... I am not really interested in--

Japanese:
さあさあ
遠慮なさらず　さあさあさあ
English:
Now, now, no need to be shy.
Let us go...

Japanese:
いやいや
ちょっと…　ねえ待ってよ！
アンジュさん？
English: Oh, no-- hold on... please, Ange I--

Japanese:
アホやなぁ　コンウェイのおっちゃん
アンジュ姉ちゃんに　そんな話ふったら
そうなるに　決まってるやん…
English:
Dummy, old man Kongwei shoulda known that those
kindsa topics can get Sis Ange goin’...

Japanese: コンウェイとリカルド１
English: Kongwei and Ricardo 1

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
まるで　うさんくさい物を
見るような眼だね
English:
Dear me, that is quite a suspicious 
glare you are giving me...

Japanese:
ふん
文字通り　うさんくさいヤツが
なにを言っている
English: Hmph... What are you talking about, oh shady fellow?

Japanese:
ずいぶん　嫌われたもんだな
やれやれ…
English: Oh dear, I seem to be hated here.

Japanese:
嫌ってなどはいない
ただ　依頼人の身を守るため
警戒しているだけだ
English:
I don’t hate you, I am just being cautious 
for the sake of my client’s safety.

Japanese: 警戒…？
English: Cautious...? Why so?

Japanese:
転生者でもない者が　天術を使い
この旅に　同行している
警戒するのは　当然だ
English:
You are not a Reincarnator, yet you can use Cielan
Artes. On top of that, you are traveling with us.
It’s just natural to be suspicious.

Japanese:
ボクの力は　天術じゃないって言っただろ
それにさ　その警戒は
本当に　依頼人のためなの？
English:
I did mention that my spells are not Cielan Artes.
That said, are you really sure that “caution” is for your
client’s sake?

Japanese:
なに…
どういう意味だ？
English: What are you talking about...?

Japanese:
…………
さあ　どういう意味だろうね
English: ...I wonder about that myself...

Japanese: コンウェイとリカルド２
English: Kongwei and Ricardo 2

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
ボクに対する　不信感は
少しくらい　解けたのかな？
English: I wonder, are you less suspicious of me now...?

Japanese:
いや…　転生者でもないのに
この旅に付いてくる　おまえは
やはり　警戒せざるを得んな
English:
No. No matter how long it’s been, you’re still a
non-Reincarnator who is traveling with us.
I have to be wary of you.

Japanese:
依頼人アンジュを　守るため
これも仕事だ
悪く思わないでくれ
English:
No hard feelings, I’m merely doing this for Ange’s
sake.

Japanese:
ふふ…　あなたの
そういう　率直なところ
ボクは好きだよ
English: Heheh, I love that frankness of yours.

Japanese:
俺は　おまえの方が
俺を嫌っているのかと
思っていたのだがな
English:
I was under the impression that you hated me more
than I do...

Japanese:
ボクはね
己の欲するところを知る人間は
嫌いじゃないんだ　むしろ大好きなくらいさ
English:
You see, I do not hate people who are honest to their
desires. On the contrary, I like them a lot.

Japanese: ふん…
English: Hmm...

Japanese:
たとえウソをついても
自らの目的を　果たそうとするような
人間は　特にね
English:
Specifically those who are willing to lie in order to
accomplish their objective.

Japanese: コンウェイとリカルド３
English: Kongwei and Ricardo 3

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
コンウェイ　ひとつ確認したいのだが
なぜ　あのとき
キュキュの同行を　許した？
English:
There’s one thing I’d like to confirm with you,
why did you let QQ accompany us at that time?

Japanese:
言葉のできない　同郷の人間を
放り出すわけには　いかないだろ
ボクも　そこまで情けのないことはしないよ
English:
I cannot just abandon a fellow countryman who can
barely speak this world’s language. I am not that cruel.

Japanese:
おまえは　ただの親切心で
そんなことをするタイプには
見えないのだがな
English:
I never thought that you’d be one of those kindhearted
types.

Japanese:
ひどい　言いようだなぁ
これでも　ボク　あなたたちの旅に
貢献してるつもりなのに
English:
How cruel, after all the help I 
provided for the team too...

Japanese:
それも　目的があってのことだろう？
繰り返すが　おまえは決して
ただの親切心で　なにかをする人間ではない
English:
Still, there must be some other reason as to why you
let her join. Let me repeat, you’re not someone who
does things out of the kindness of your heart.

Japanese:
親しくなれば　心を許すのが普通なのに
まさか　親しくなって　余計警戒されるなんて
思わなかったよ　やれやれ…
English:
It is quite normal to be kind to those you are close to,
but to think such an action would make you more 
wary... Dear me...

Japanese:
…で　もしボクに
なんらかの　目的があったとして
そんなことを話すように　見えるかい？
English:
Do you even think I would be talking about this if I had
some sort of purpose...?

Japanese:
…ふん　言われてみれば確かにな
そうは　見えん
まったく　見えん
English:
Now that you mention it, no you don’t...
Totally not...

Japanese:
でしょう？
じゃあ　この話は　ここまでだね
English:
See?
Let us leave it at that.

Japanese: コンウェイとエルマーナ１
English: Kongwei and Hermana 1

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
なあなあ
コンウェイのおっちゃん！
English: Hey, hey, old man Kongwei!

Japanese:
…あのさ　ボクは
おっちゃんなんて　呼ばれるような
年齢じゃないんだけど？
English:
Umm... you do realize I am too young to be called an 
“old man”, right...?

Japanese: ほな　おばちゃん？
English: Then how ’bout “Auntie?”
I-I BEG YOUR PARDON!?!?!?

Japanese:
うわ～　なんやいな
その今にも　人でも殺しそうな目ぇは
English: Whoa, if looks could kill Ah’d be dead by now...

Japanese:
オレ…　いや…
ボクのどこが
おばちゃんなんだ…
English: I-In what way do I look like an “Auntie” to you...?

Japanese:
せやせや
おばちゃんには　見えへんしな
English: Yer right... ya don’ look like an Auntie at all...

Japanese:
でも　ウチから見たら
コンウェイのおっちゃんは
もう十分　おっちゃんやって！　諦めや！
English:
But Ah still think yer an old man!
Can’t change mah mind on that!

Japanese:
今のは　ただの冗談なんだ…
あの子はボクを　女性と間違えたわけじゃない
だからキレるなよ　冷静に冷静に…
English:
Oh, she was just kidding... Breathe... It is going 
to be fine, it is not as if she mistook me for a 
woman... I should not have snapped at her...

Japanese: コンウェイとエルマーナ２
English: Kongwei and Hermana 2

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
コンウェイのおっちゃん
なんの本　読んでるん？
ちょっと　ウチにも見せてぇや！
English:
What’re ya readin’, old man Kongwei?
Can Ah see?

Japanese:
いや…
これは　ボクの国の…
English: Nothing... it is not something you can understand--

Japanese: へ～　は～　ふんふん
English: Oooh... Ah see...

Japanese: まさか意味が　わかるのかい？
English: You cannot understand it, correct?

Japanese:
いやぁ
なに　書いてあるんか
さっぱりやわ！
English: Nah, Ah have no idea what it says!

Japanese:
…だろうね
これは　ボクの国の言葉で
書かれた本だから
English:
I figured as much... It is because this book is 
written in my country’s language.

Japanese:
ああ　そうやったんや
なんや　マジメに本読んどったさかい
ちょっと遊んでもらおか　思うただけやねん
English:
Ohhh, Ah figured ah should mess with ya cause ya
looked so serious while readin’.

Japanese:
だいたい　ウチ
学校　行ってへんさかい
ほとんど　字ぃ読まれへんもんな！
English:
Since Ah never went ta school an’ all,
Ah can’t read, hear?

Japanese:
そうか…
じゃあ　ルカくんあたりに　習うといい
本を読めるようになると　世界が広がるよ
English:
I see... Then you should ask Ruca to teach you.
Being able to read will broaden your horizons.

Japanese:
人の持っている　知識や経験を
本を通して　知ることができる
それは　素晴らしいことなんだ
English:
What is wonderful about reading is that you can gain
knowledge and experience from the books you read.

Japanese:
なにせ　行ったことのない
世界についてすら
本を読めば　知ることができるからね
English:
You shall also be able to learn about far 
off lands from reading books.

Japanese:
はぁ～
そないな風に言われたら　説得力あんなぁ
English: Ohhh that’s purty interestin’.

Japanese: ほな　勉強しよかいなぁ
English: Then, Ah should go off an’ study.

Japanese: コンウェイとエルマーナ３
English: Kongwei and Hermana 3

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
ブツブツブツブツ…
ブツブツブツブツ…
English: *muttering*

Japanese: なにか　考えごとかい？
English: What are you thinking about?

Japanese:
ん～　ルカ兄ちゃんに　教えてもろた
「九九」の練習してんねんけどな
７の段が強敵で　なかなか覚えられへんねん
English:
Ah’ve been practicin’ the sevens tables Ruca Bro
taught me, hear? But Ah’ve been havin’ 
trouble try’na memorize it.

Japanese:
ウチ　お金の計算やったら
自信あるんやけどなぁ
English:
Though, Ah’m purty confident when it comes ta
calculatin’ money.

Japanese:
ふ～ん…　じゃあさ
７ガルドのリンゴが６つで　いくらかな？
English:
Hmmm... Then, how much would it cost if you bought
6 apples worth 7 gald each?

Japanese: ４２ガルド？
English: 42 gald?

Japanese:
できるじゃないか…
あのね　リンゴひとつが　７ガルドってことは
その計算は　７の段と同じなんだよ
English:
So you can do it, after all...
See, adding up apples worth 7 gald is just the same
as trying to multiply by sevens.

Japanese: は～　そうなんや
English: Ohhh...

Japanese:
じゃあ　ちょっと
難しくしてみようか
７ガルドのリンゴが２６こで　いくら？
English:
Then, let’s try something harder...
How much would it cost if you bought 26 apples worth
7 gald each?

Japanese: １８２ガルド？
English: Is it 182 gald?

Japanese: できるじゃないか！
English: See? You can do it!

Japanese:
…じゃあ
１７ガルドのバナナが３７本で　いくら？
English: Then, how much would 37 bananas worth 17 gald be?

Japanese: ６２９ガルド？
English: 629 gald?

Japanese: ん～と
あ…　合ってる…
English: C-Correct...

Japanese:
じゃあさ
７{fixed}×{variable}６は？
English: Then what is 7 x 6?

Japanese: さあ　それやで！
English: Here it comes!

Japanese: ７の段は強敵やなぁ　７{fixed}×{variable}６かぁ…
English:
The scary sevens tables! 
Then... 7 x 6 would be... uhh...

Japanese: ３９くらい？　もうちょっと多い？
English: 39? Or maybe that’s a bit too much?

Japanese: ４２だよ！
English: It is 42!

Japanese: リンゴのときは　できただろ！
English:
You managed to answer correctly 
when it was apples back then!

Japanese:
４２ぃやったんかいな
ホンマ　７の段は強敵やで
English:
Ahhh so it was 42...
Man, the sevens tables really are hard...

Japanese: コンウェイとキュキュ１
English: Kongwei and QQ 1

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei
Ah--

Japanese:
先に言っておくけど
極力　ふたりきりのときも
ここの言葉を　使ってくれよ
English:
Let me remind you, please try your best to use this
world’s language whenever we’re alone.

Japanese: おう…
English: Ohh...

Japanese:
まあ　なにごとも練習だよ
少しずつ　学べばいい
English:
Well, consider it practice.
Take it easy and learn at your own pace.

Japanese:
言葉を学んでルカくんたちと　仲良くなれ
ボクのことは　嫌いでも
彼らのことは　嫌いじゃないんだろ？
English:
If you practice, you’ll be able to get along with the
others. Even though you hate me, you don’t hate
everyone else, do you?

Japanese:
ルカたちのことは好き
言葉も　勉強する必要　わかる
それ　当たり前…
English:
QQ like the others.
Of course QQ knows that she needs study...

Japanese:
当たり前　わかてるけど　コンウェイに
そういう言い方されるは　ムカツク
…ホント　ムカツク！
English:
But the way Kongwei put it makes QQ angry!
Really angry...!

Japanese: コンウェイとキュキュ２
English: Kongwei and QQ 2

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
コンウェイは
ここ　なにしに来たか？
English: What did Kongwei come here for?

Japanese:
…あのさ　そんなことを
このボクが　キミに
話すわけないだろ？
English: ...I do not need to tell you that, do I?

Japanese:
後学のために　教えてあげるとね
人に目的を　明かすということは
弱味を　見せるということなんだ
English:
As a fellow scholar, I will teach you as much as 
you want about this world’s language, but I will 
not reveal to you my objective or weakness.

Japanese: コウガク…？
English: Skolar?

Japanese:
後々　役に立つ話ってことさ
とにかく　ボクはキミに
旅の目的なんて　話すつもりはないよ
English:
What I meant is that this knowledge 
might come of use later. Anyways, 
I am not telling you why I am here.

Japanese:
万一　ジャマされちゃ
かなわないからね
English:
If I did, there might come a time when you will use 
it against me and that would lead to my downfall.

Japanese: 本当に　ムカツク…
English: Really annoying!

Japanese:
あのね…　ボクに対して
そういう態度を　取るのは
どうかと思うよ
English:
You know, I do not believe you should be acting that 
way towards me...

Japanese:
命を助けた　恩もあるし
それに　彼らの旅への同行を
取りなしたつもりでもあるんだけどな
English:
I have granted you a favor by saving your life and 
letting you travel alongside them...

Japanese:
まあ　一緒に旅してる間くらい
仲良くやろうよ
たとえ　表面上だけでもね
English:
At the very least on the surface, we should both 
get along while we are traveling as a group.

Japanese: コンウェイとキュキュ３
English: Kongwei and QQ 3

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
コンウェイ
旅　これから
どうなるか？
English: Kongwei, what are you doing from now on?

Japanese:
悪いけど　それは言えない
こればかりは　キミを信用していないとか
そういう話じゃなくてね
English: Apologies, but I do not trust you enough to tell you that.

Japanese:
これから先　キミやルカくんたちにとって
一時的に　不利益なことも
起こるかもしれない
English:
Because in the future, things might happen that can
be detrimental to you and the others.

Japanese: フリエキ…？
English: Detri... mental?

Japanese:
良くないことが　起こるかもってことさ
そういうときに　キミに知識を持って
行動されると　困るんだ
English:
I mean that something bad might happen that might
end up troublesome if you know my reason.

Japanese:
余計なトラブルが　起きる可能性は
極力　つぶしておきたいからね
English:
I am trying to eliminate all possibilities that could get in
the way of my objective.

Japanese:
じゃあ　キュキュ
そういうとき　どすればいいか？
English: Then what should QQ do when that happens?

Japanese:
キミの思うままに　行動すればいい
問題がありそうなときは
ボクが　そう言う
English:
You should act as you see fit, I will tell you if there is a
problem.

Japanese:
いいかい？　指示には従ってくれよ
なにせ　この世界については
キミよりボクの方が　ずっと詳しいんだから
English:
You just have to follow my instructions, understand?
Because I know more about this world than you do.

Japanese: キュキュとイリア１
English: QQ and Illia 1

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
ねえキュキュ　あんたってさ
体中　キズだらけじゃないの
なにをしたら　そんな風になるのよ？
English:
You’re covered head to toe with scars, aren’t you, QQ?
What in the world happened to you?

Japanese:
戦う練習　たくさんした
国を出て　たくさん戦た
それで　たくさんケガした
English:
In QQ’s country, QQ got wounds from fighting practice. 
QQ also got lots from leaving country.

Japanese:
あんた　見た目はカワイイのに
そのキズのせいで
ずいぶん　損してんじゃない？
English:
But you’re so cute without those scars, 
it’s a shame you got so torn up...

Japanese:
このキズ　キュキュの誇り
他の人　どう思ても
キュキュ　気にしない
English:
These scars are QQ’s pride. QQ don’t care 
about what other people think.

Japanese: は～　そんなもんかしら
English: Ohh... is that so?

Japanese:
キュキュには　そんなもん
キュキュの体見て　キュキュ嫌う
だたら　もういい
English:
For QQ, that is so. If people see QQ’s 
body and hate it, that fine.

Japanese:
なるほどねぇ　体のキズなんて
隠せばいいのにと　思ってたんだけど
だから　わざわざ　そんな服を着てるのね
English:
I see... I thought it would be better to wear clothes that
hide those wounds, but it turns out you’re showing them
on purpose.

Japanese: イリアは　キュキュ嫌いか？
English: Does Illia hate QQ?

Japanese:
そんな話　聞かされて　嫌うわけないでしょ
もし　そんなこと言うヤツがいたら
あたしが　ぶっとばしてやるわよ
English:
After talking to you? Of course not.
Heck, if someone tells you that they hate you, 
let me know and I’ll kick their ass!

Japanese: そうか…
English: Ohh...

Japanese: ありがと！
English: Thank you!

Japanese:
ちょ…　ちょっと！
抱きつくのは　いいけど
ヘンなとこ　触らないでよ！
English:
H-Hey, look, you can hug me all you want just don’t
touch me some place weird, okay?!

Japanese: キュキュとイリア２
English: QQ and Illia 2

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: イリアは　体きたえてるな
English: Illia really training her body!

Japanese:
ちょっと！
だから　ヘンなとこ触らないでってば！
English:
H-Hey!
Where the hell are you touching me!?

Japanese:
でも　イリア
肉付き　良くないな
English: But Illia don’t have much meat on you.

Japanese:
そんなこと　あんたには
言われたかないわよ
English: You don’t have to tell me that!

Japanese:
そう…
キュキュも　もうちょと　お肉欲しい
アンジュみたいに
English:
Yes, QQ also want more meat.
Like Ange does.

Japanese:
あんた　それ
アンジュの前じゃ　絶対言っちゃダメよ
大ごとになるんだから
English:
...Don’t say that in front of Ange, okay?
She’s gonna make a big fuss out of it.

Japanese: キュキュとイリア３
English: QQ and Illia 3

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
イリア姉ちゃんと
キュキュ姉ちゃんが　ふたりでおると
なんや　姉妹みたいに見えるなぁ
English:
Seein’ y’two together makes ya both kinda look like
sisters.

Japanese: そうかしらね？
English: That so?
Ohh?

Japanese:
体つきも　似とるし
ほらほら
並んで　並んで
English:
Yeah, ya both have the same kinda body.
C’mon, stand closer, stand closer...

Japanese:
うんうん
姉妹に見える　見える
English: Yeah, ya both totally look like sisters!

Japanese: あら　３人でなんの話？
English: Oh my, what are you three talking about?

Japanese:
んとなぁ
このふたりが　並んどると
姉妹に見えるっちゅう話
English:
Ya see, if ya put Sis Illia and Sis QQ together,
don’ they kinda look like sisters?

Japanese:
あら　私から見れば
エルも　ふたりの妹に見えるわよ
ほら　並んで並んで
English:
Personally, I believe you also look like their sisters.
Come now, Hermie, stand beside them.

Japanese: ほら　まるで３人姉妹みたい！
English: There we go! All of you look like three sisters!

Japanese: 体型だって　みんなスリム…　だし…
English: Everyone is so slim and...

Japanese: みんな　スリムなのに…
English: so... slim...

Japanese: 私だけ…　くすん…
English: Only I am... *sob*

Japanese:
どうして　勝手に墓穴掘って
勝手に　落ち込んでんのよ！
ねえ　ちょっとアンジュ！？
English:
H-Hey, A-Ange?
Wh-Why are you digging a grave!?
Hey, Ange!

Japanese: キュキュとスパーダ１
English: QQ and Spada 1

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
キュキュってよ
そんだけ腕が立つのに
なんかしゃべり方で　損してるよな
English:
Hmm... You’re pretty skilled, but...
I kinda feel like the way you 
speak’s holding you back a bit.

Japanese: なんの話か？
English: On what?

Japanese:
そのしゃべり方じゃ　強そうに見えねェから
もっと　他人には
ガツンと　言えって話だよ
English:
Well, you don’t sound strong if you speak that way.
You gotta have more BAM to give a strong
impression.

Japanese:
おー
ガツン！　ガツン！
English: Ohhh... like BAM! BAM!

Japanese:
文字通りの意味じゃねェよ
他人に　なめられねェようにだな…
English:
Dude, don’t take it literally.
You gotta stand above others more!

Japanese:
なめる？
誰かキュキュ　ぺろぺろするか？
English: Stand above? But you’re taller than me!

Japanese:
違ェよ
もっと強く見えるように　言葉で
ハッタリをきかせろって　言ってんだよ
English:
WRONG!
Like, you gotta use the way you speak so others would
think you’re strong!

Japanese:
……？
キュキュは　ホントに強い
だから強く見せる　必要ない
English:
Hm...?
QQ no need to prove strength, because QQ already
strong.

Japanese:
言葉で強く見せる　それ弱いヤツ　やること
弱いイヌ　うるさいと同じ
そんなこと　キュキュ　しない
English:
People who use words to show strength are weak.
Same as weak dogs. So QQ will not do so.

Japanese:
う…　オレの人生を
全否定されたみたいで
ものすげェ　ヘコむんだけど…
English: (Whoa... Feels like I just lost big time there...)

Japanese: キュキュとスパーダ２
English: QQ and Spada 2

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
キュキュってよ
転生者でもねえし　天術も使わねえのに
その強さ　反則じゃねェ？
English:
You’re not even a Reincarnator, and you can’t use
Cielan arts, but you’re so strong. Isn’t that kinda
unfair?

Japanese:
でもキュキュは　思う
ヘンな帽子　いろいろ力ある
その方が　いい
English:
But QQ think that weird hat has a lot more power.
Better than QQ.

Japanese:
なんだよ　純粋に剣の腕だけじゃねェ
オレの方が　いいってのか？
そんな　なぐさめいらねェよ
English:
What? You telling me that I’m better than you coz I’m
not just purely good with a sword?
I don’t need your pity.

Japanese:
でもキュキュ　そう思う
一番大事は　生きて帰ること
そのための力　なんでもいい
English:
But QQ thinks so.
Important is to get out alive.
Kind of power doesn’t matter.

Japanese:
強いのが　生き残るじゃない
生き残るのが　強い
ヘンな帽子　わかた？
English:
Surviving does not make you strong, but strong is what
makes you survive.
Understand, weird hat?

Japanese:
あ…　ああ…
なんか　こいつの言うことって
妙に　説得力がありやがるよな…
English: Yeah... somehow her words are strangely persuasive...

Japanese: キュキュとスパーダ３
English: QQ and Spada 3

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
キュキュってよ　その細身で　あんな武器
振り回すなんて　たいしたもんだよな
どこに　そんな力あんだ？
English:
Man, it’s pretty impressive being able to fight with such
a thin stick. Where do you even get that power?

Japanese:
大きい武器使う　体の使い方　大事
キュキュ　体　やわらかい
だから　体の使い方　うまい
English:
When using big weapon, way you use your body
important. QQ’s body is flexible so QQ’s good at
using weapon.

Japanese:
あ～　バランス？
それが　とても大事
English:
And uhh... was it “balance?”
Yes. Balance also very important.

Japanese:
オレだって　体は柔らかい方なんだぜ
体を曲げて　ヒザにアゴを
くっつけるくらいは　できるしよ
English:
I’m pretty flexible too!
I can make my chin touch my knees if I bend my body!

Japanese:
キュキュも　それくらいできる
こんなこともできる
English: QQ can do that too. And QQ can also do this!

Japanese:
うお…ッ！！
体をエビぞりにさせて　足のつま先が
後頭部に　くっついてる！
English:
Holy heck!
Your toes... Your toes are touching the back of your
head!

Japanese: こんなこともできる
English: And this too!

Japanese:
うおおッ！！
さらに　エビぞりの体勢で
股の間から頭が！
English: WHOA! Your... your head’s between your legs now!

Japanese:
このくらいできると
力ないも　やわらかいで
なんとかなる
English:
QQ can do this much.
I’m not strong, but I’m flexible!

Japanese:
なんだ　こいつ
タコかなんかの　生まれ変わりかよ…
English:
What the hell, is she a reincarnated octopus or
something?

Japanese: キュキュとアンジュ１
English: QQ and Ange 1

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: はぁ…
English: Sigh...

Japanese: アンジュ　だいじょぶか？
English: Are you okay, Ange?

Japanese:
そうですね　少し疲れが　たまってるのかも…
旅に出る前は　私自身が武器を持って
戦うなんて　想像もしなかったのに…
English:
I... I believe I have grown quite tired...
I never imagined that I would be 
fighting with a weapon...

Japanese: アンジュ　動くの苦手か？
English: Is Ange bad at moving?

Japanese:
キュキュさんと　比べれば
私　身軽じゃないから…
English: Compared to you, I am nowhere near as agile...

Japanese: 体　軽いと　動くの楽
English: QQ’s body is light, so moving very fun!

Japanese: …ズキッ！
English: ...Oof!

Japanese: 体　重いと　動くの大変
English: Moving with heavy body not fun!

Japanese: …グサッ！！

キュキュさん
そんなに　的確に
核心を突かないでください…
English: Miss QQ... please stop saying such hurtful things...
Hm?

Japanese:
疲れとる　アンジュ姉ちゃんに
余計　ダメージ与えとるがな…
English: Ya did more harm than good ta our tired Sis Ange...

Japanese: キュキュとアンジュ２
English: QQ and Ange 2

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
はぁ…
それにしても　キュキュさんの体型
うらやましい
English: Sigh... I am quite jealous of that body of yours, QQ...

Japanese:
お？
キュキュは　アンジュの体
うらやましいのに
English: Hm? But QQ also jealous of Ange’s body.

Japanese:
アンジュは　たくさん食べる　幸せの体
キュキュ　たくさん食べる　あまりなかた
だから　アンジュ　うらやましい
English:
Ange has a happy body cause she eats lots!
QQ didn’t get to eat lots so QQ jealous of Ange!

Japanese:
ちょ…　ちょっとキュキュさん？
だからって　おなかをつまむのは
やめてください…
English:
Uhh... M-Miss QQ?
Can... can you please stop pinching my belly?

Japanese:
たくさん　食べる
アンジュみたいなる　それは幸せ
アンジュ　きといいお母さんなる
English:
Eat lots and be happy like Ange.
QQ knows, Ange gonna be a good mom!

Japanese: そ…　そうかしら？
English: Is that so?

Japanese:
きとそう　キュキュ　そう思う
だから　アンジュ
安心するがいい
English:
That is so.
QQ thinks so, that’s why Ange shouldn’t worry.

Japanese:
…う～ん
でも　それってあんまり
なぐさめになってないような…
English: Hm... but that does not really make me happy...

Japanese: キュキュとアンジュ３
English: QQ and Ange 3

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
ぷはぁ！　やっぱりちょくちょく
アンジュ姉ちゃんの
おっぱい分は　補給しとかんとな！
English:
Puhah! Ah still hafta get mah fill of Sis Ange’s boobies
now an’ then!

Japanese: もう　エルったら！
English: Oh Hermie!

Japanese:
エルの抱っこ
キュキュ　うらやましい…
English: QQ jealous of Hermie’s huggies...

Japanese:
あら
じゃあ　キュキュさんも
どうですか？
English: Oh my, then how about I give you one too?

Japanese:
お！
いいか　アンジュ？
English: Oh! Can I?

Japanese:
こんなに　年齢の近い人を
抱っこすることになるなんて
思いませんでしたけど…
English:
Still, I would never have thought that I would have 
to give a hug to someone as old as I am.

Japanese:
お～　エル　好きなのは
このふにふにか？
キュキュ　わかた！
English:
Oh! So this is the soft boobies that Hermie really likes!
QQ now knows!

Japanese:
せやろ？　わかるやろ？
キュキュ姉ちゃんも
たっぷり堪能すると　ええで
English:
Ya understand it, right?
Ya better get yer fill of Ange while ya can too!

Japanese:
あ…　あん！　ちょっとキュキュさん？
どさくさに　まぎれて
おかしなとこ　触らないでください！
English:
A-Ahn... M-Miss QQ?
Please do not touch me someplace strange...

Japanese:
ちょ…　ちょっと！
あん！
English: H-Hey! Wai-- Ahn!

Japanese:
なんだか　声だけ聞いてると
とても　いけない妄想をしちまうぜ…
English:
Yeesh... I’m getting some very bad fantasies after
hearing that voice...

Japanese: キュキュとリカルド１
English: QQ and Ricardo 1

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
リカルド　みんなのボスじゃない
キュキュ　とても不思議
English: QQ finds strange that Ricardo not everyone’s boss.

Japanese:
そうか？
傭兵は　仕事に見合った金さえもらえば
たいていのことは　引き受けるものだ
English:
Is that so? Mercenaries will deal with 
almost anything in exchange for money.

Japanese:
依頼人が　若い女性であることも
別段　珍しくはないのだがな
English:
It’s also quite common that my clients would be
young women.

Japanese: イライニン…？
English: Client?

Japanese:
わかりやすく言えば
アンジュが　俺のボスということだ
English: In simpler terms, Ange would be my boss.
Ohhh...

Japanese:
元々は　別の人物から
アンジュの　身柄確保を
依頼されていたのだがな
English:
At the very beginning, I was hired by someone to
capture Ange, herself.

Japanese:
彼女の身柄を確保する際　その経緯を伝えると
キャンセル料を含めた
多額の支払いを　提示されてな
English:
Conveying my intentions the moment I found her,
I was presented a hefty sum of money to terminate
my previous contract.

Japanese:
元の依頼を　キャンセルして
新たに　アンジュの護衛を
引き受けることになった
English: Which I did, and so I became Ange’s escort.

Japanese:
それ以来　俺はアンジュの身を守り
彼女の意向には
極力　沿うようにしている
English:
Ever since, I’ve done my best to protect 
Ange and meet her demands.

Japanese:
ギャラの出所であり　意向には沿う
彼女をボスと呼んでも　さしつかえは…
English:
The money comes from her, and goes where I want it
to go. Feel free to call her boss as much as you want,
but--

Japanese:
…って　おい！
人の話は　ちゃんと
最後まで聞かんか！
English: Hey! Let me finish my story!

Japanese:
つまらん話　長い
リカルド　悪い
もと　面白い話するがいい…
English:
Boring talk too long, sorry.
Better if talk more interesting.

Japanese: キュキュとリカルド２
English: QQ and Ricardo 2

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
リカルド
なにしてるか？
English: What are you doing, Ricardo?

Japanese:
ライフルの手入れだ
自分の命を預ける　大切な道具は
まめに　整備しておかんとな
English:
Maintenance.
I must take proper care of this rifle since I owe it my life.

Japanese:
ライフルに限らず　たいていの道具は
手入れを怠らなければ
一生使える物が　ほとんどだ
English:
Most tools, not just rifles, can last a lifetime when
properly taken care of.

Japanese:
おまえも　大切な道具は
きちんと　メンテナンスをしておけよ
English:
I recommend that you also do maintenance on what
you hold important.

Japanese: キュキュの大切な物…　う～ん…
English: What QQ hold important...

Japanese:
体か！　この体！
大事に使えば　一生使える
English:
Oh I see! QQ’s body!
If QQ take care of my body, QQ will last for a lifetime!

Japanese:
ははは
なかなか　うまいこと言うじゃないか
確かに体は大事に使えば　一生使えるな
English:
Hahahaha, well said!
That’s true, if you take good care of your body,
it will last a lifetime!

Japanese:
だが　そう言う割に
おまえの体は　キズだらけのようだな
もう少し　大事に使えよ
English:
That said, your body’s covered with scars.
You should take better care of it.

Japanese:
お～　このキズはキュキュの誇り
…でも　そだな　体　大事にしないとな
リカルド　いいこと言う…
English:
These scars are QQ’s pride...
But Ricardo make good point,
I should take care of body more.

Japanese: キュキュとリカルド３
English: QQ and Ricardo 3

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
キュキュ　おまえの武器の刃先
少しくもりが　見えるぞ
ちょっと　貸してみろ
English:
QQ, you missed a spot. Hand your spear
over to me for a second.

Japanese: お？
English: Oh?

Japanese:
他人になど任せず
自分で　手入れをするべきだと思うが
まあ　いいだろう
English:
I’d prefer it if you don’t just easily hand over your
weapon to someone else. But fine...

Japanese:
ふむ…　くもりの他は
欠けもヒビも　見当たらんな
なら　軽く刃先を研げば…
English:
Hmm... other than the tarnish, 
I don’t see any chips or cracks. 
Let me just sharpen its blade for a bit...

Japanese:
よし　これで良かろう
次からは　自分でやるんだぞ
English:
Here, this should be good.
You should do it yourself next time.

Japanese:
お～！
リカルド　ありがと！
English:
Okay!
Thank you, Ricardo!

Japanese:
うわ！　やめんか！
こっちは　刃物を持っているんだぞ！
危ないだろう　まったく！
English:
Whoa! Stop! We’re handling sharp objects here!
Good grief...

Japanese: キュキュとエルマーナ１
English: QQ and Hermana 1

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
キュキュ姉ちゃんは
もう　みんなの名前とか覚えたん？
English: Do ya remember everybody’s names?

Japanese:
あ～　ちょとずつな
でも
English: Some, but...

Japanese: やぱりむずかしい
English: it’s hard.

Japanese:
そうやんなぁ　言葉も覚えなあかんし
大変やろなぁ…
English:
True, an’ ya hafta remember words too...
Must be hard.

Japanese:
ウチはな　エルマーナ
みんなにはエルって　呼ばれてんねん
ほんで　やせっぽちなんが　ルカ兄ちゃん
English:
Ah’m Hermana.
Everybody calls me Hermie.
That scrawny fella over there’s Ruca Bro.

Japanese:
二丁拳銃が　イリア姉ちゃんで
ヘンな帽子　かぶっとるんが
スパーダ兄ちゃん
English:
The one with two guns is Sis Illia.
An’ the one with a weird hat’s Spada Bro.

Japanese: お～
English: Ohhh...

Japanese:
色白美人が　アンジュ姉ちゃんで
おっちゃんふたりが　リカルドのおっちゃんと
コンウェイのおっちゃん
English:
The purty lady in a white dress is Sis Ange, an’ the
two old men are Uncle Ricardo an’ old man Kongwei.

Japanese: ほんで　こいつが「非常食」
English: An’ this one here’s our emergency food.

Japanese:
コ…　コーダを食うか？　しかし！
おいしくないぞ　しかし！
English:
Y-You’re gonna eat Coda!?
C-Coda’s not delicious, though!

Japanese:
…冗談に決まってるやん
そういうときは
English: Ah’m kiddin’, Ah’m kiddin’.

Japanese: なんでやねん！
English: At times like these, ya gotta exclaim

Japanese:
って
突っ込んでもらわんと…　ノリ悪いなぁ
English: “B’why!” loudly.

Japanese:
今のは　エル
あんまり　ジョーダンに聞こえなかったぞ
しかし！
English: But Coda didn’t hear your joke earlier, Hermie.

Japanese:
お～　やぱり
これは皮を　はいで焼くか？
English: Ohhh... So, can we cook it with skin?

Japanese:
ほら！　ジョーダンだと
伝わってないぞ！　しかし！
食べられる～　ぎゃー！
English:
H-Hermie was joking just now th-though!
No! D-Don’t eat Coda!
Noo!!

Japanese: キュキュとエルマーナ２
English: QQ and Hermana 2

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: まいど　おーきに！
English: Thank ya very much!

Japanese:
…ほら　キュキュ姉ちゃん
マネしてみ
English: Now, ya try it, Sis QQ.

Japanese: まいど　おーきに！
English: Thank ya very much!

Japanese:
そうそう
だんだん　うまなってきとるなぁ
ほな　次はボチボチでんなぁ！
English:
There we go!
See, yer slowly gettin’ the hang of things!
Now try “Goin’ purty well!”

Japanese: ボチボチでんなぁ！
English: Goin’ purty well!

Japanese:
これはな　お金が儲かってたり
調子のええときでも　遠慮して
そこそこやって　言いたいときに使うんやで
English:
Ya use this when yer makin’ a profit an’ somebody
asks ya “how’s business” so that ya won’t look like
yer braggin’.

Japanese:
ほんで　最後は
なんでやねん！
English: An’ last one is “B’why!?”

Japanese: なんでやねん！
English: B’why!?

Japanese:
ついでに　相手の肩とか
軽く叩くとええで　こんな風にな
なんでやねん！
English:
An’ while yer at it, ya should give ’em a light tap on the
shoulder like this!
“B’why!”

Japanese:
お～！
なんでやねん！
English:
Ohhh!!
B’why!

Japanese: うわ～ッ！！
English: Whoa! Ow...

Japanese:
お～
やりすぎた…
English: Oops... hit too hard.

Japanese: キュキュとエルマーナ３
English: QQ and Hermana 3

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
…ほんでな
こいつの名前が「非常食」！
English: An’ this guy is called “emergency food!”

Japanese:
そうそう　コーダは非常食だから
みんなの食べ物が　なくなったときには
皮をはがれて　丸焼きに…
English:
Yes, Coda’s emergency food because when the food’s
all gone everyone will cook--

Japanese:
…って　なんでやねん！
怒るで　しかし！
English:
...B’why!
Coda’s gonna get mad, though!

Japanese:
…なあ？
キュキュ姉ちゃん　わかった？
これがノリツッコミ
English:
Ya get it now, Sis QQ?
This is what a double act is like.

Japanese: お～
English: Ohhh...

Japanese:
普通のツッコミの前に
ボケの言うたことに　一回ノってから
ツッコミすんねん
English:
Ya have ta go along with what the other fella says
before pausin’ an’ then makin’ yer own comeback.

Japanese:
これは　なかなかの高等テクニックやさかい
マスターできたら　キュキュ姉ちゃんも
いっぱしのツッコミ芸人やで！　ほな～
English:
It’s a purty advanced technique, so when ya master it
ye’ll be a master comedian!

Japanese:
お～…
それが　なんの役立つか
さっぱり　わからん…
English:
Ohhh...
QQ still don’t understand how that will be useful.

Japanese: 僕とコンウェイとキュキュ
English: Me, Kongwei, and QQ

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
コンウェイと　キュキュさんって
ときどき　仲悪そうに見えるんだけど
大丈夫なの？
English:
You two don’t always seem to get along. 
Is something wrong?

Japanese: そんなことないよ
English: Everything is fine.

Japanese:
ただ彼女　言葉がわからなくて
少しストレスが　たまるみたいだから
そう見えるだけなんじゃないかな
English:
It is just that she gets frustrated from not 
understanding the language from time to 
time so it might seem like that.

Japanese: ああ　そうだったんだ
English: Ohh, so that’s what it is...

Japanese:
そんなことない
キュキュ
コンウェイ　大嫌い
English:
That’s not true.
QQ really hates Kongwei.
Huh?

Japanese:
ははは…
ねえキュキュ
ちょっと　あっちに行こうか
English:
Hahaha...
Can we both talk for a second?

Japanese:
…こういうときには
口裏を　合わせてくれないか
余計なトラブルは　困るんだよ
English:
Listen here, if you do not go along with me,
it would be pretty troublesome. 
Just read between the lines, got it?
Hm?

Japanese:
ははは　まだ彼女
ここの言葉に　慣れてないからさ
English:
Hahaha... it seems like she is still 
not used to this language.

Japanese:
ときどき　わけのわからないこと言って
困るよね　ははははは
English:
Come now, who knows what you might get yourself
into if you keep saying things you do not understand.
Hahahaha...

Japanese:
そ…　そうなんだ
ホントに　そうなのかな…？
English:
I-Is that so?
Is that really the case...?

Japanese: イリアとコンウェイとキュキュ
English: Illia, Kongwei, and QQ

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
コンウェイと　キュキュってさ
ぶっちゃけ仲悪いわよね？
English: Tell me the truth. You two don’t get along, do you?

Japanese: そんなことないよ
English: That is not true.

Japanese: ウソついても　バレバレだから
English: No use lying, it’s already obvious.

Japanese:
まあ　いろいろ事情があるんだろうし
いちいち　くだらないこと聞かないけど
余計なトラブルは　ごめんだからね
English:
Well, I’m sure you both have your own circumstances.
I don’t really mean to nitpick, but I’m just avoiding any
unnecessary trouble.

Japanese:
まいったな
彼女　意外と人を見てるんだな…
English: Oh dear, she is quite perceptive...

Japanese: おー
English: Ohh...

Japanese:
「おー」じゃないよ
感心してる場合じゃないだろ
English: Do not “Ohh” me! This is no time for admiration!

Japanese: おー？
English: Ohh?

Japanese:
だから「おー」じゃないってば
もう少し　キミも気を付けてくれよ
English:
As I said, stop saying “Ohh”.
At any rate, be careful.

Japanese: おー…
English: Ohh...

Japanese: スパーダとコンウェイとキュキュ
English: Spada, Kongwei, and QQ

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
ヘンな帽子
なにしてるか？
English: What are you doing, weird hat?

Japanese:
ああ　リカルドのおっさんに武器は
まめに手入れしろって　言われてよ
だから　刀の手入れしてんだ
English:
Oh, got told by the old man that I should take care of
my weapon so here I am.

Japanese:
つーか　そのヘンな帽子っての
やめてくれねェか？
English: Anyways, can you stop calling me that?

Japanese:
おい　コンウェイからも
なんとか　言ってくれよ
English: Hey, you say something too, Kongwei.

Japanese:
そう言えば　彼女
キミたちの名前が　覚えにくいとか
言ってたな
English:
Now that I think of it, did she not say that she finds it 
hard to remember your names?

Japanese:
彼女の民族は　体の特徴なんかを
呼び名にすることが　多いから
余計に　覚えにくいみたいだね
English:
Apparently her clan derives names from their most
defining characteristics, so it can be quite hard to
remember unrelated things.

Japanese: は～ん　なるほどねェ…
English: Ohh... I see...

Japanese:
…って　じゃあ　こいつにとっての
オレの特徴は　ヘンな帽子ってことかよ！
English:
Wait, does that mean that, to this chick, weird hat’s
my most defining characteristic!?

Japanese:
全然ヘンじゃねェだろ！
むしろ　カッコイイだろ！
English:
It’s not weird!
It’s cool!

Japanese:
そんなこと　ボクに言われてもさ
彼女の　感性の問題だからねぇ
…もう諦めたら？
English:
No use telling me that.
The problem here is her sensibility, 
so why not just give up?

Japanese:
ヘンな帽子　諦めるか？
それとも　それ脱ぐか？
English:
Is weird hat gonna give up?
Or is weird hat gonna go?

Japanese:
うるせェよ！
諦めねェし　脱ぎもしねェよ！
ホント　失礼なヤツだな！
English:
Shut the hell up!
I’m not gonna give up nor am I gonna 
take off my hat! Get off my case!

Japanese: アンジュとコンウェイとキュキュ
English: Ange, Kongwei, and QQ

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
コンウェイさんと　キュキュさんって
ずいぶん　旅慣れてますよね？
English: It seems that you both have gotten used to traveling...

Japanese:
コンウェイさんは
私と同じ　インドア派のように
見えるのですけど…
English:
Although, Kongwei seems to be an indoor person 
like me.

Japanese:
まあ　ルカくんたちと出会う前から
旅を続けていたからね
English:
Well, I have been traveling ever since I met Ruca and
the others.

Japanese:
キュキュも　そう
旅　長い
English:
QQ same.
Travel long.

Japanese:
私は　いつまでたっても
慣れなくて
English: Even I still find it hard to get used to traveling...

Japanese:
慣れないだたら　慣れなくていい
アンジュ　ムリしない
困たら　キュキュ助ける
English:
It fine not getting used to if you can’t.
Don’t force yourself, if trouble QQ will save you.

Japanese:
そ…　そうですね
ムリをして　私が体を壊したりすると
逆に迷惑になりますよね
English:
Y-You are correct. My body might collapse if I push 
myself, and it will cause everyone trouble.

Japanese:
おかげで　気が楽になりました
キュキュさん
ありがとうございます
English: Thank you, I feel much better now.

Japanese: リカルドとコンウェイとキュキュ
English: Ricardo, Kongwei, and QQ

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
リカルドとコンウェイ
どして　仲良くしないか？
リカルド　コンウェイ嫌いか？
English:
Why Ricardo and Kongwei not get along?
Does Ricardo hate Kongwei?

Japanese:
俺は　嫌ってなどいない
ただ　依頼人の身の安全のため
警戒しているだけだ
English:
No, I don’t hate him.
I’m just being wary of him for my client’s sake.

Japanese:
傭兵として体に
しみついたクセのようなものだな
English: It’s something of a habit, ingrained in my body.

Japanese: ケイカイ？
English: Wary?

Japanese:
用心のために　コンウェイのことを
注意深く　見ているということだ
English:
What I mean is that I’m keeping an eye on Kongwei
as a precaution.

Japanese:
お～　どして　リカルド
コンウェイ　ケイカイするか？
English: Ohh... But why is Ricardo wary of Kongwei?

Japanese:
転生者でもないのに
この旅に　同行する者は
警戒されて　当然だと思うがな
English:
I believe it’s just natural since he’s a non-Reincarnator
accompanying us on this journey.

Japanese:
それ　キュキュも同じ
キュキュも　ケイカイするか？
English:
But QQ is also not Reincarnator.
Are you also wary of QQ?

Japanese:
言われてみれば　確かに…
おまえには　警戒の必要を
それほど　感じないな
English:
Now that you mention it, you aren’t...
However, I never felt the need to keep an eye on you.

Japanese:
ふむ…　どうも俺は　コンウェイの持つ
底の知れなさのようなものを
警戒しているのかもしれん
English:
Hmm... it seems like I’m just worried about Kongwei’s
enigmatic aura...

Japanese:
なるほどね
まあ　今のは誉め言葉と
受け取っておくか…
English: I see... Then, I will take that as a compliment.

Japanese: エルとコンウェイとキュキュ
English: Hermana, Kongwei, and QQ

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
う～ん
キュキュ姉ちゃんと　ウチって
ちょっと　キャラかぶってへん？
English:
Hmm...
Don’tcha think that Sis QQ an’ Ah are a bit alike?

Japanese:
なんや　体型も似とるし
しゃべり方も　みんなと違うし
English:
We both have the same figure an’ our manner of
speakin’s different compared ta everybody.

Japanese: そのふたつだけじゃないか
English:
I believe those are the only two things
that you both share.

Japanese:
でも　キュキュは
エルに似てる　言われる　うれしい
English: But, QQ happy to know that QQ like Hermie.

Japanese:
む…
そないな風に　言われると
English: Hmm...

Japanese: 悪い気はせぇへんな
English: Ah don’ feel so bad when ya put it that way...

Japanese:
ふたりとも　嬉しいのなら
なにも　気にする必要ないんじゃない？
English: Well if you’re both happy, then isn’t that fine?

Japanese:
ホンマや　物は考えようや
しょうもないこと　悩んどったなぁ
ふたりとも　おーきにやで！
English:
Yeah, it was purty dumb worryin’ 
’bout such a small thing.
Thank’s y’two!

Japanese: 初めてのお泊り
English: First Time in an Inn

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
あ～…　疲れたぁ…
もうクッタクタ…
一歩も歩きたくなーい…
English:
Aghhh... my legs...～
I don’t wanna walk anymore...

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: {fixed}（まさか　ここしか空いていないなんて……）
English:
(I didn’t expect that this would be the only place
available...)

Japanese: 窓際いっただき～♪
English: Window side’s mine～♪

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
{fixed}（しかも　女の子と一緒だなんて…
　ど…どうしよう…）
English:
