English: But...

Japanese:
大丈夫だ　ルカ
戦場で生きてきた
俺の言葉が　信じられないのか？
English:
It’s going to be fine, Ruca. I’ve lived my life on 
the battlefield.

Japanese: いいから今はちゃんと寝ておけ
English: So cut that out and get some sleep.

Japanese: う　うん……
English: A-Alright...

Japanese: カマクラで１
English: Igloo 1

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
まさかカマクラを作って
そこで休むことになるなんて
思いもしなかったわね
English: I never thought that we’d create an igloo and sleep in it.

Japanese:
部屋が満室なんだから　仕方ないわ
こうやって　カマクラ用の寝具を
貸してくれたんだから感謝しないと
English:
The inn was full, after all, so we do not have 
a choice. At the very least, we should be grateful 
that they lent us some beddings for the igloo.

Japanese:
こんな寒い中　外に居たら
キュキュたち　朝にはカチンコチン
English:
If we stay outside in cold for long,
we will all be ice tomorrow.

Japanese: それはそうだけどさぁ…
English: That’s true and all, but...

Japanese:
せっかく　暖かいところで
休めると思ったのに
English:
I was honestly looking
forward to staying somewhere warm.

Japanese: う～…確かにちょっと寒いなぁ…
English: That’s true, it’s a bit cold...

Japanese:
ほら　３人ともこっちにおいで
皆で集まった方が暖かいわ
English:
Very well you three, come here. 
It is warmer when we are all together.

Japanese:
あーなんやこういうのええな～
ほっとするわ
English: Ahhh, this is nice～ It’s so relaxin’.

Japanese:
あたかい　楽しい
キュキュ　こういうの好き！
English: Warm, happy! QQ like this!

Japanese:
うふふ
それじゃあ　寝ましょうか
おやすみなさい
English:
*giggle* Then, let us all go to sleep.
Good night.

Japanese: カマクラで２
English: Igloo 2

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: おお～　この雪の家はなんなんだな　しかし
English: Oh! What’s this snow house?

Japanese:
これはカマクラって言うんだよ
今日はここに泊まるんだ
English:
This is called an “igloo.”
We’ll be staying here for the night.

Japanese: 寒ぃけど　部屋がねェんじゃ仕方ないな
English: It’s cold but the inn’s full, so... Sigh...

Japanese: なに　中で暖をとれば暖かいものだ
English:
What are you saying?
It should be warmer inside.

Japanese: 経験があるような口振りだね？
English: You sound like you have stayed in one before.

Japanese: 傭兵をやっていると　色々とあるからな
English:
You tend to experience a lot
of things when you’re a mercenary.

Japanese: 二人とも　早く暖まろうよ
English: Hurry up, you two. Come inside and warm up.

Japanese: なかなか暖かいなー
English: Oh! It’s pretty warm though～

Japanese:
こういうのも悪くねェけど
やっぱり　ちょっと寒ぃな
English: This ain’t bad at all, but it’s still a bit cold.

Japanese:
なんならこっちに来るか？
離れ離れで寝るよりは　暖かくなる
English:
Then why don’t we bunch up together?
It should be warmer compared to sleeping separately.

Japanese:
なにが悲しくて　野郎を横にして
寝なくちゃなんねェんだよ…
English:
It’s kinda sad that I have to
sleep with a man beside me...

Japanese: 同感だよ
English: Agreed.

Japanese:
でも　ひとりで寝るよりかは暖かいと思うよ
……
English: But I think it’s warmer than sleeping alone...

Japanese: くしゅっ！
English: A-Achoo!

Japanese:
風邪ひいちまうよりかは　マシか
仕方ねェ
English: I guess it’s better than getting sick.

Japanese: ちょっと狭いけど　暖かいね！
English: It’s a bit cramped, but it’s definitely warm!

Japanese: まっ　さっきよりかはな
English: Well, compared to earlier, yeah.

Japanese: こういうのは今日だけだよ
English: Only for today though.

Japanese: そろそろ寝るとするか
English: We’re going to sleep soon.

Japanese: 準備は済んだか？
English: Are you ready to turn in for the night?

Japanese: うん　大丈夫
English: Yeah, I’m all set.

Japanese: あれ？　そういえば　コーダは？
English: Oh wait... where’s Coda?

Japanese: ルカー　ここなんだな
English: I’m over here.

Japanese: しかし　コーダ動けない
English: Coda can’t move though...

Japanese: どういうこった？
English: What’s up?

Japanese: これはなんだー？　かなしばりかー？
English: What’s this...? Sleep paralysis...?

Japanese: ……氷にくっついているようだな
English: It appears he got stuck in the ice...

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
お～　見てないで
助けて欲しいんだな　しかし
English: Coda would like it if you get me out of here though...

Japanese: 足跡
English: Footprints

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
テノスって　どこ見ても
雪が積もってて　白銀の世界だね
English:
There sure is a lot of snow in this town.
Almost like a white wonderland.

Japanese:
でも　こんなに雪に覆われてて
みんな　困ったりしないのかな？
English:
But won’t everyone be troubled
with all this snow on the ground?

Japanese:
長く暮らしてれば　知恵くらいつくし
それくらい平気でしょ
あたしの村みたいに
English:
I’m pretty sure they’re used to it by now, seeing 
as they have to deal with this snow every day.
Same goes for my village, but with sand.

Japanese: そっか　人って　すごいね
English: Ohhh... people are really amazing!

Japanese:
もちろんよ
じゃなきゃ　開拓なんてできないっての
English:
Course we are! Otherwise we wouldn’t
be able to keep advancing.

Japanese: あはは　そうだね
English: Hahaha... of course.

Japanese:
あっ　イリア　見て　あそこ
まだ足跡がついてない！
English: Oh, look! There’s no footprints over there yet!

Japanese:
本当　そうだ！
ね　ルカ　今から足跡つけにいかない？
English:
Ooh, you’re right!
Want to walk over it with me?

Japanese:
うん！　一番最初に足跡つけるなんて
面白そうだよね
English:
Of course!
It’ll be fun to be the first ones to make footprints.

Japanese:
じゃあ　どっちが先につけるか　競争よ！
負けたほうは後で　なんかご馳走するの
ということで　スタート！
English:
Okay, let’s make it a race!
First one to make tracks through
it gets treated to lunch! Start～!

Japanese: えぇ！？　ま　待ってよ～～～！！
English: Huh!? W-Wait up～～!

Japanese: この白いものは？
English: What is this White Thing?

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: しかし　この白いのはなんだ？
English: Though... So, what’s with this white thing?

Japanese: 雪を見るのは初めて？
English: Is this your first time seeing snow?

Japanese:
これが雪か！
しかし　食べられるのか？
English: Oh, so this is snow! Though can you eat it?

Japanese: 食べられないこともないけど…
English: It is not inedible, however...

Japanese:
はぐっはぐっ
…味がしないぞ？　しかし
English:
Munch munch...
This doesn’t have any taste though!

Japanese:
凍った水の結晶だもの
言ってしまえば
水を飲んでるのと変わらないわね
English:
It is frozen water, after all.
It is no different from drinking it.

Japanese: しかし　なんだか寒くなってきたぞ
English: Th-Though... B-But why am I cold?

Japanese:
雪なんか食べたりするから…
仕方ないわね　ほら　おいで？
English:
It is only natural if you ate that much snow...
I suppose there’s no other choice. Come here.

Japanese: おお～　あったかいんだな
English: Ooh! Warm!

Japanese:
しかし　寒いところの動物が脂肪を蓄える
意味がわかったんだな
English:
Though Coda knows why animals store
fat in colder regions now!

Japanese:
く…苦しいんだな
強く抱きすぎなんだな…しかし……
English: Y-You’re... hugging me too hard th-though...!

Japanese: 雪合戦
English: Snowball Fight

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: なぁなぁ　みんな　雪合戦せぇへん？
English: Hey, hey, let’s have a snowball fight.

Japanese: 雪合戦？　それって　どんなの？
English: A “snowball fight?” What’s that?

Japanese:
さっき　宿の人から聞いてな
雪を丸めたものを　ぶつけあうんやって
ただし　石は詰めたらアカン言うてたで
English:
Ah heard ’bout it earlier. Apparently, ya take a snow
an’ round it up ta a ball an’ throw it at sumbody.
But ya can’t put stones in it.

Japanese: なんだか　枕投げみたいだね
English: Ohhh it sounds just like a pillow fight!

Japanese:
面白そうじゃねェか
よし　やってみようぜ！
English:
Sounds fun!
Let’s try it out!

Japanese:
キュキュもやりたい！
早く　早く！
English:
QQ wants to try too!
Hurry! Hurry!

Japanese: ルカ～　覚悟しなさい～♪
English: Prepare yourself～, Ruca～♪

Japanese: コーダも頑張るんだな　しかし
English: Coda’s gonna try his best, too, though!

Japanese: えぇっ！？
English: Huh!?

Japanese: あら　それなら援護するわ　ルカくん
English:
Oh my, if that is the case then 
I shall protect you, Ruca.

Japanese: ありがとう　アンジュ…
English: Thank you, Ange!

Japanese:
ねぇ　やるんだったら
チームでわかれたらどう？
English:
Hey, if we are going to do something like this,
then how about we split up into teams?

Japanese:
そっちのほうが　盛り上がると思うよ
もちろん　ボク抜きで
English:
I believe that would be far more exciting,
especially without my involvement.

Japanese:
じゃあ　オレ　イリア　エルにキュキュ
ルカ　アンジュ　コンウェイにおっさんで
どうだ？
English:
Then Illia, Hermie, and QQ will be with me. 
Ange, Kongwei, and Ricardo will be with Ruca.
How’s that?

Japanese: ボク抜きって言ったのになぁ
English:
I thought I made it clear that
I preferred to be uninvolved...

Japanese:
逃がさねェぜ
お前も　参加しろよ
English: I won’t let you get away, you’re joining too!

Japanese: スパーダ　コーダを忘れるな　しかし！
English: Spada, you forgot about Coda though!

Japanese: コーダは好きな方に入れ
English: Alright, you choose what team you want to be on.

Japanese:
おー　わかったんだな
コーダ　みんな　倒すんだな
English:
Oh, okay!
Coda will defeat everyone!

Japanese:
おっ　やる気満々じゃねェか！
こりゃあ　楽しみだぜ
English:
Oh! You’re really going for it, aren’tcha?
This is gonna be fun!

Japanese:
早く行く！
キュキュ　待ちきれない！　わくわく！
English:
Let’s go! We go!
QQ can’t take it anymore! Excited!

Japanese:
そうね
さぁ　みんな　行きましょう
English: Indeed, let us be off.

Japanese: 雪合戦など…ガキの遊びだな
English: A snowball fight, huh...?

Japanese: さて　武器の手入れでもやるか
English: I should go tend to our munitions.

Japanese:
リカルドのおっちゃん～！
なにしてるん～？　はよ　来てぇな～！
終わってまうで！
English:
Hey, Uncle Ricardo! What’re ya doin’?
Come over here! It’s ’bout ta end!

Japanese:
リカルドさん！　急いでください！
負けてしまいます…！
English:
Sir Ricardo, please hurry!
We are about to lose...!

Japanese:
このようなことは
契約には入っていないんだがな…
English: This was not in the contract...

Japanese: まったく…　風邪をひいてもしらんぞ
English: Good grief, don’t blame me if you catch a cold!

Japanese: 叫ぶの禁止
English: Shouting is Prohibited

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
うわぁぁぁ！！
寒い！　寒い！　めっちゃ寒い！！
English:
Ahhhh COLD! COLD!
REALLY COLD!

Japanese:
エル！　そんな叫ばないでよ！
こっちまで寒くなるじゃない！！
English:
Hermie, can you please stop shouting!?
It’ll get colder at this rate!

Japanese:
しゃーないやん！
めちゃめちゃ寒いねんもん！！
English:
It can’t be helped!
It’s really, REALLY COLD!

Japanese:
こっちも我慢してるんだから
あんたも我慢しなさいよ！
English:
Hey! I’m trying my best here,
so you should too!

Japanese:
寒いのは分かるが　あまり叫ぶな
雪崩が起きたらどうする
English:
Look. I know it’s cold, but what will
you do if that shouting of yours
causes an avalanche?

Japanese:
リカルドのおっちゃんは　ええやん！
そないに暖かそうな格好しとるんやし！
English:
Ya say that, but aren’t ya dressed warmly,
Uncle Ricardo?

Japanese:
そうよ！
そのコートを貸してくれるくらいの
優しさはないわけ！？
English:
Yeah! Why don’t you lend us your coat, then?
At least that’d be nice!

Japanese: そーや！　そーや！
English: Yeah! Yeah!

Japanese:
いい加減にしろ！
叫ぶなと言ってるだろう！！
English:
BEHAVE, YOU TWO!
Stop shouting!

Japanese: リカルドさん　しーっ
English: Sir Ricardo, shhh...

Japanese: ……すまん
English: Apologies...

Japanese: 静かなコーダ
English: Quiet Coda

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
コーダ　あんたさっきから黙ってるけど
どうしたのよ？
English:
Aren’t you being a bit too quiet, Coda?
What’s wrong?

Japanese:
なに？　お腹でも減ったの？
ご飯なら　まだないわよ
English:
What? Are you hungry?
It’s not lunchtime yet, though...

Japanese: ……イリア　なんだか眠いんだな
English: Illia... I’m sleepy...

Japanese:
はぁ？　眠い？　言っておくけど
今　眠ったら問答無用で置いてくわよ
English:
Huh? Sleepy? Look, if you fall asleep
here we’re leaving you behind.

Japanese: 待て　イリア　この症状は……
English: Illia, wait, this is...

Japanese: なによ…？
English: What?

Japanese:
まずいな…　このままでは……
どこかで火をおこして
暖を取るしかなさそうだな
English:
This is bad... we need to make a fire
somewhere and keep him warm.

Japanese:
スパーダ　エルマーナ
風の当たらない場所を探してきてくれ
English:
Spada, Hermana, look for a place
where there’s no wind.

Japanese: ああ
English: Gotcha...

Japanese:
な　なに？　コーダ　ヤバイの？
ねぇ　どうなの？
English:
What? Is Coda sick?
Wh-What’s wrong?

Japanese:
このまま眠ってしまったら
二度と起きないだろうね
English:
If he falls asleep now,
he might never wake up again...

Japanese: そんな……
English: No way...

Japanese:
ぬふぅ……　イリアー
なんだか　気持ちいいん……だな……
English: Illia... it feels comfortable... though...

Japanese: こ　こら！　寝ちゃダメ！　寝ちゃダメだって！
English: C-Coda, don’t! Don’t you dare fall asleep, you rat!

Japanese: …イリア…うるさい………だ…な…
English: You’re... Too noisy... Illia...

Japanese:
このまま寝たら　ずーっと
ご飯が食べられなくなっちゃうわ！
それでもいいの！？
English:
Look, if you fall asleep now you
won’t get to eat any more.
Are you fine with that?

Japanese: ………それ…ダメ………だ…な…
English: That’s... not... good... though...

Japanese: コーダ　ご飯！！
English: Coda, food!

Japanese: メシ　どこなんだな！？
English: Food!? Where!?

Japanese:
キュキュ　今日はなんなんだな？
しかし　早く食べたいんだな
English:
QQ, what are we eating today?
Though, Coda wants to eat immediately!

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: 食い意地に助けられたのね
English: It seems that his gluttony saved him this time...

Japanese: でも　よかった…
English: Still... What a relief...

Japanese:
迷惑な生き物だ　まったく…
気を取り直して　先へ進もう
English:
Troublesome rat.
Let’s regroup and then move forward.

Japanese: そういえば　スパーダたちは？
English: By the way... Where’s Spada?

Japanese: みんな
English: Everyone

Speakers:
1 [イリア]
2 [リカルド]
6 [キュキュ]
7 [コンウェイ]
8 [アンジュ]
Japanese: あっ…
English: Oh...

Japanese: 小さな優しさ
English: A Sliver of Happiness

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: 眠れないのか？
English: Can’t sleep?

Japanese: リカルドさん…
English: Oh, Sir Ricardo...

Japanese: …今日は　星が綺麗ですから
English:
It is because the stars are shining so 
brightly tonight.

Japanese:
そんなふうに窓辺に立っていては　体が冷える
これでも飲め
English:
If you stay there for too long you’ll catch a cold.
Here, drink this.

Japanese: これは……ホットミルクですか
English: Is this... hot milk?

Japanese: よく眠れるそうだ
English: It’ll help you sleep better.

Japanese:
お気遣い感謝します
………
English: Thanks for worrying about me...

Japanese: 温かいですね
English: It is warm...

Japanese:
……考え事もいいが
あまり根を詰めると体がもたんぞ
English:
It’s nice to reflect every once in a while,
but don’t forget to rest.

Japanese:
依頼人の体調管理不足で倒れられては
かなわんからな
English:
After all, I don’t want my client collapsing 
because they failed to take care of themselves.

Japanese:
ふふ…　そうですね　すみません
では　もう寝ますね
リカルドさん　ご馳走様です
English:
You are correct, thank you...
Then, I shall go on to bed.

Japanese: おやすみなさい
English: Good night.

Japanese: 揺れるアンジュ
English: Wavering Ange

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: アンジュ　なにしてんの？
English: Ange, what are you--

Japanese: あ……　お祈り中…
English: Oh, you were praying...

Japanese: ジャマしてゴメン
English: Sorry...

Japanese:
もう終わったわ
ねぇイリア　なにかあったの？
English:
I have already finished.
Do you need something, Illia?

Japanese:
特には　アンジュが動かないから
なにしてるのかなって　思ってね
English:
I was wondering why you’ve been 
standing still lately, like you’re 
lost in thought or something.

Japanese:
あら　心配かけちゃったみたいね
ごめんなさい
English:
Oh, you must have been worried.
I am sorry...

Japanese: こっちこそジャマしてゴメン…
English: No, I’m sorry for disturbing...

Japanese:
ところでアンジュ
なにか気になることでもあったの？
English: Are you sure nothing’s bothering you?

Japanese:
アンジュがお祈りしているところを
見るのは　久々だし
English: It’s been a long while since I’ve last seen you pray.

Japanese:
ふふ　私は聖職者よ？
祈るのは　仕事のひとつ
イリアも良かったら一緒にどう？
English:
*giggle* I am a priest, remember?
It is my job to pray for others.
Would you like to join me?

Japanese: 眠くなりそうだし　あたしはやめとく
English: I’m feeling drowsy so I’ll pass.

Japanese:
残念　それじゃあ　もうそろそろ寝ましょう
明日も早いしね
English:
How unfortunate, then let us be be off to bed.
We will be leaving early tomorrow, after all.

Japanese: じゃあ　あたし準備してくる
English: Aight, then I’ll get ready.

Japanese:
…………ヒンメル…
私…私は…………
English: ...Himmel... I...

Japanese: 飛行船の旅
English: Airship Travel

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: ふんふ～～～～ん♪
English: *humming*

Japanese:
イリア　ご機嫌だね
なにかイイコトでもあったの？
English:
You seem to be in a good mood.
Something happen?

Japanese:
もっちろん　飛行船が手に入った今
世界中を行き来できるのよ？
しかも　酔わないときたら　ご機嫌にもなるわよ
English:
Of course I am, we have an airship now!
We can go almost anywhere! ...And no 
more of that damn seasickness, anymore!

Japanese:
は～～～…
今までの旅を振り返ると　ホント大変だったわ
特に船！　船酔い最悪だったもの
English:
Sigh... It’s been really tough up ’til now...
So many boats... Seasickness is the worst.

Japanese: 船の旅も面白いと思うんだけどなぁ
English: I thought going by ship was interesting though.

Japanese:
あんたは楽しくても
あたしは面白くもなんともないの！
English:
For you, maybe!?
Definitely NOT for me!

Japanese: う…　ごめん…
English: Right... sorry...

Japanese:
なにションボリしてんのよ
そんな顔しないでさ
あっちで一緒に景色でも見ない？
English:
And why the heck are you sulking now!?
C’mon, don’t give me that face.

Japanese: さっき　スッゴイ綺麗なところ見つけたのよ♪
English:
Y’know what? I know this really pretty
place, wanna go see it with me?

Japanese:
え？　本当
それは見たいなぁ
English:
Really?
Sure, why not?

Japanese: んじゃ　行くわよ！
English: Let’s go～!

Japanese: 侮れない
English: Don’t Underestimate

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
なぁ　ルカ　あのおっさん
なんか緊張してねェか？
English:
Hey, Ruca, doesn’t the old man
kinda look nervous?

Japanese: なんでそう思うの？
English: What makes you think so?

Japanese:
いつもよりも　空気がこう
張り詰めてるっていうのか？
そんな感じがすんだよ
English:
It kinda feels like, the atmosphere’s...
I don’t know, more tense than usual.

Japanese: うーん　いつもと変わらない気がするけど……
English: Hm... it feels the same though...?

Japanese: 案外　操縦するのに緊張していたりしてな
English:
Like he’s nervous about steering
the airship or something...

Japanese: まさか　リカルドなら　大丈夫だよ
English:
Ricardo? Nervous?
No way, I’m sure he’s fine.

Japanese: それならいいけどよ…
English: Hopefully...

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
ルカ兄ちゃんたち　こっち来てみぃ！
すっごいのが見えるで！
English:
Hey, Ruca Bro! Come check this out!
This is awesome!

Japanese: おっ　行こうぜ　ルカ
English: Let’s go check it out, Ruca.

Japanese: …………スパーダ　侮れないな
English: ...I shouldn’t underestimate Spada.

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: アルベール
English: Albert

Japanese: やっぱ　ガラムに来たら温泉だよな
English: The hot springs here are always a must-see.

Japanese:
そうだね
湯加減もちょうど良いし
僕　すっかりこの温泉　好きになっちゃったよ
English:
That’s true, the spring’s temperature here is just right.
I think I like it now.

Japanese: やぁ　君たち　奇遇だね
English: Oh my, what a coincidence.

Japanese: 何故　貴様がここにいる
English: Why is a noble here?

Japanese: 彼　この国に用があるみたいだよ
English: I think he has something that he has to do in Garam.

Japanese:
ああ　けど時間が空いてしまってね
そんなとき　ここの温泉の話を聞いたのさ
English:
Pretty much, I just happened to hear about the hot 
springs while I was on my free time.

Japanese:
それにしても　温泉とはなかなか良いね
是非　我が国テノスにも欲しい
English:
At any rate, the hot springs here are quite nice. I 
definitely want one in Tenos.

Japanese:
ところで　君たちも居るということは
アンジュたちも温泉に？
English:
That said, since you’re here does that mean Ange
is too...?

Japanese: そうだけど…
English: Yes, why...?

Japanese:
おい
まさか　のぞくつもりじゃねェだろうな？
English:
Hey, don’t tell me you’re planning on peeping on 
them...

Japanese:
まさか
そんな人間性を疑われるようなことはしないよ
English:
As if, I’ll never do such a thing that will make others
doubt me.

Japanese:
それにボクは　さっきあがったところだからね
これ以上入ると　のぼせてしまうよ
English:
On top of it all, I just got out you see. I might drown if
I go back in there.

Japanese: なら　いいけどよ…
English: Okay...

Japanese:
さて　折角だし
アンジュに会って来ようかな
またね
English:
Now, since we’re here and all, I should go and greet
Ange. See ya～

Japanese: あれ？　これ…
English: Huh? What’s this...?

Japanese: 彼　なにか落としていったみたいだね
English: Looks like he dropped it.

Japanese:
おい　それアンジュの写真じゃねェか
あいつ　いつの間に撮りやがったんだ？
English:
Hey, isn’t that Ange’s picture...? Since when did he
take this...?

Japanese: さぁ…？
English: Who knows...?

Japanese: アルベールとリカルド
English: Albert and Ricardo

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: アルベール
English: Albert

Japanese: アルベール
English: Albert

Japanese: アルベール
English: Albert

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ああ　リカルドくん
ちょうど良いところに
折り入って君に　頼みたいことがあるんだ
English:
Oh, Ricardo!
Perfect timing!
I have something I want to ask of you.

Japanese:
悪いが俺は今　仕事中だ
他の依頼は請けかねる
English:
Apologies, but I’m in the middle of work here.
Go ask someone else.

Japanese:
君にとって　悪い話ではないよ
話だけでも聞いていかないかい？
English:
It’s nothing malicious, if that’s what you’re thinking.
Would you at least hear me out?

Japanese:
ふむ…
では　聞こう
English: ...Hmph, fine.

Japanese:
最近のアンジュはどうだい？
聞かせてくれないか？
English: Tell me, how has Ange been recently?
Huh?

Japanese:
世界を旅するのも大変だろう
なにか困ったことはないかと思ってね
English: I mean, traveling must be quite burdensome, is it not?

Japanese:
僕は　国を離れられないから
力になれることがあれば
全力で　サポートしたいんだ
English:
Since I can’t really leave Tenos, I’d like to do what I
can if there’s something I can help with.

Japanese:
そんなものは本人に聞け
何故　俺に聞く
English:
Then why don’t you just ask her directly?
Why me?

Japanese:
なかなか　彼女の口からは
困っていることを聞けないからね
English:
Knowing her, it would be hard to learn what’s
troubling her if I asked her directly.

Japanese:
なるほど
だから　共に旅をしている俺に…か
English: I see, and that’s why you’re asking me.

Japanese:
ああ
それでどうかな？
English: Exactly. So, what do you think?

Japanese: …高いぞ？
English: It’s gonna cost you.

Japanese: それくらい平気さ
English: Fine by me.

Japanese:
リカルドさん　アルベール
話は聞かせてもらいました
なにをしているんですか！
English:
Albert! Ricardo! What do you think you are doing!?
Stop this at once!

Japanese: なに　冗談だ
English: What? It’s just a joke.

Japanese:
ああ　冗談だよ　アンジュ
本気にしないでくれ
English:
Do not worry, as Sir Ricardo said, it is, “just a joke.”
Please do not take it seriously.

Japanese:
もう…
人の情報は　売っちゃダメですよ
English:
Sheesh!
You must not sell other people’s information!

Japanese:
アルベールも　次やったら
おしりペンペンですよ！
English:
And you, Albert! If I catch you getting into these sorts of 
deals again, I... I will have no choice but to spank you!

Japanese:
あ…　ああ　わかった…
覚えておくよ
English:
Oh... Right... I understand.
I-I’ll keep that in mind...

Japanese: 扉の向こうにいるのは？
English: What’s Beyond that Door?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: アルベール
English: Albert

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
今日は　個室なんだね
じゃあ　僕は向こうの部屋を使わせてもらうね
English:
I guess we have a room for ourselves today.
I’ll go take that room over there.

Japanese: 行こうぜ
English: Then I’ll take this one.

Japanese:
残っている部屋は　ここか
ふむ……
English: So this is my room, huh...

Japanese:
やぁ　リカルドくん
僕に用があると　キュキュさんから聞いたけど
なにか……
English:
My, my, good day, Ricardo.
QQ told me that you wanted to see me.
What can I help--

Japanese: キュキュ！　キュキュ！
English: QQ! GET YOUR ASS OVER HERE!

Japanese: リカルド　呼んだか？
English: Ricardo, you want to see me?

Japanese:
あれは　どういうことだ？
何故　俺の部屋にアルベールが居る？
English:
What the hell? Can you please explain why 
on Terro is ALBERT inside my room!?

Japanese:
アルベール　不満か？
そうか　わかた
キュキュ　次はもとがんばる
English:
Oh do you not like Albert?
Okay! QQ will try her best next time!

Japanese:
待て
まだ話は終わってない！
English:
Get back here, young lady!
I’m not finished talking yet!

Japanese:
騒がしいわね
一体　なんの騒ぎ……
English: How noisy, did something--

Japanese: あら　アルベール
English: Oh hello, Albert.

Japanese:
やぁ　アンジュ
奇遇だね
English:
Good day, Ange. What a fortunate coincidence 
meeting you here.

Japanese:
ええ　本当
アルベールが宿に居るなんて
なにかあったの？
English:
Yes, indeed. So, what brought you here?
Why were you in that room?

Japanese:
いいや　特には
そんなことより　これから食事でもどうかな？
とてもおいしい店を見つけたんだ
English:
Nothing much. Anyways, would you like to have 
dinner with me? I found a restaurant selling the 
most exquisite food.

Japanese:
まぁ　それはいいわね
是非　行きましょう
English: A grand idea. I would be glad to come with you.

Japanese:
君と食事が出来るなんて嬉しいよ
ありがとう
English: I’m very pleased to have dinner with you tonight.

Japanese:
ふふっ　私もです
では　行きましょう
English:
I should say the same.
Then, shall we go?

Japanese: くっ…　キュキュ　どこに行ったんだ？
English: Tch... Where the hell is she!?

Japanese: トマト嫌い
English: I Hate Tomatoes

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
なぁ　コンウェイ
おまえ　トマトが嫌いだったんだな
English: Hey Kongwei, you hate tomatoes right?

Japanese: なに？　突然
English: What is this all of a sudden?

Japanese:
いや～　おまえの弱点はトマトかぁ
うひゃひゃひゃひゃ
English:
Oh～ So you’re really weak against them, huh?
Hyahahahaha!

Japanese:
先に言っておくけど
よからぬことを　考えているようなら
やめておいたほうが　賢明だよ
English:
I am just letting you know in advance, but if you are
thinking of doing something stupid, it would be wise to
just leave it be.

Japanese:
ほ～～？
そりゃ　なんでだ？
English: Oh～? And why is that?

Japanese: それはね……
English: That is because...

Japanese: …というわけさ
English: ...That is all.

Japanese:
よからぬことを　考えているようなら
やめておいたほうが　賢明だよ…ね？
English:
Generally speaking... If you are thinking of doing 
something stupid, it would be wise to just leave it be...
Understand?

Japanese: あ…あぁ…
English: Oh... I guess...

Japanese:
期待しているよ
ふふっ
English: I am looking forward to it then.

Japanese: ハルトマンと温泉
English: Hartman and the Hot Springs

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ハルトマン
English: Hartman

Japanese: ガラムに来たら　やっぱり温泉だよな！
English:
You really gotta hit the hot springs
when you’re in Garam!

Japanese: しっかし　みんな付き合い悪ぃぜ
English: But nobody wanted to go with me...

Japanese:
ルカはイリアたちと　外出
おっさんは　姿くらますし
コンウェイは　読書…
English:
Ruca’s outside with Illia, the old 
man went off somewhere, and 
Kongwei’s reading...

Japanese: あ～　ツマンネェ！
English: LAAAME...!

Japanese:
お坊ちゃま…？
もしや　スパーダお坊ちゃまでは
ありませんか？
English:
Young Master...? Are you perhaps, 
Young Master Spada?

Japanese:
ハ…　ハルトマン！？
なぜ　ここに…
English: H-Hartman!? Wh-Why are you here...?

Japanese:
いやはや　ガラムに
体に良いという温泉があると聞きましてな
English:
Oh my, I came because I heard that the 
hot spring here is good for the body.

Japanese:
船を乗り継ぎ
はるばる海を渡って参りました
English:
And so I bought a ticket and rode
a long way through the ocean.

Japanese:
そうか…
確かに　ここの温泉は素晴らしいからな
ゆっくりしていくと良いぜ
English:
Ahh... It’s true, the hot springs here are 
amazing! Take your time and relax here!

Japanese:
はい
ところで　お坊ちゃま
お背中　お流ししましょうか？
English:
I will. Speaking of, would you like
it if I wash your back, Young Master?

Japanese:
い…　いいって
もうガキじゃねェんだし
English: I-I’m fine! I’m not a kid anymore, sheesh.

Japanese:
オレはいいから　その…なんだ…
ハルトマン　そこ座れよ
背中　流すぜ
English:
I’m all good, so you sit over there
and I’ll wash your back instead.

Japanese:
いけません
お坊ちゃまに　そのようなことを…
English:
This cannot be! To make the young
master do such a...

Japanese:
気にすんなって
ハルトマンには　いつも世話になってるしな
だから　今日くらい　いいだろ？
English:
Don’t worry about it! You’ve always been
taking care of me, so why not just this once?

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
{fixed}（ハルトマンの背中…
　こんなに小さかったか？）
English: (Has his back always been this small...?)

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
{fixed}（ガキの頃は
　でかい背中だと思っていたんだけどな…）
English:
(I’ve always thought that his 
back was huge as a kid.)

Japanese: 坊ちゃま…
English: Young Master...

Japanese:
あのお坊ちゃまが　ますます立派になって…
このじい　もう感動で…グス…
English:
The Young Master has grown to be such
a fine young man... This old man’s grateful... 
*sob*...

Japanese:
ははっ　なんだよ
これくらいのことで　泣くなよな
English: Haha, now don’t cry over something like this!

Japanese:
これくらいのことではありませぬ
あの小さかった頃の
お坊ちゃまを思えばこそでございます
English:
It is not just “this”, I was just remembering
the times when you were young.

Japanese:
特に　怖い話を聞かれた後
「風呂に入るのが　怖いから一緒に入ってくれ」
と言われたときは…
English:
Especially those times when you would tell me to 
come in the bath with you after hearing scary things...

Japanese:
お…おいおい
昔の話　持ち出すなよ
恥ずかしいだろ…
English:
H-Hey, hey... D-Don’t bring up something like that... 
You’re embarrassing me...

Japanese:
お坊ちゃまには　恥ずかしくとも
じいには　とても眩しい思い出の
ひとつでございます
English:
It might be embarrassing for you, but, for me,
it is one of my most precious memories.

Japanese: 眩しい…か…
English: “Precious”...

Japanese:
…オレ　ハルトマンが執事で良かったと思ってる
ハルトマンが居たから　今のオレがあるんだ
English:
I... I’m glad that you were my butler. You’re the 
one who made me who I am today.

Japanese:
だから　その……
……ありがとな
English:
That’s why... Uhmm...
Thank you.

Japanese:
って…
面と向かって言うのはなんだか　照れるな…
English:
Well... it’s kind of embarrassing 
to say it in front of you...

Japanese:
そうおっしゃっていただけるとは…
光栄の極みでございます…！　グスグス…
English: I am very honored... to hear you say such a thing.

Japanese:
おいおい…
いつまで　泣いてんだよ　まったく…
English: H-Hey... how long are you gonna cry?

Japanese: いいところのおぼっちゃん
English: A Well-off Young Master

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: お水　お水って…
English: W-Water...

Japanese:
あれ？
ルカ　眠れないの？
English: Oh, Ruca! Can’t sleep?

Japanese: うん　ちょっと　寝付けなくって
English: Yeah, kinda...

Japanese:
そうだとしても　起きてるのは　よくないって
眠れなくても　横になってた方が　いいわ
でないと明日　ツライわよ？
English:
I know it might be hard, but you can’t stay up too long. 
At least try lying down or else you’ll be tired tomorrow.

Japanese:
そうだね　ありがと
じゃあ　おやすみ…
English: You’re right, thank you! Good night...

Japanese:
って　ちょっと待ったー！
ルカ　動かないで
English: Yeah, good n-- Wait! Don’t move!

Japanese: え？　う　うん…
English: Huh? O-Okay...

Japanese:
イ　イリア！？
ち…　近い　近いよ！
English: I-Illia!? Y-Y-You’re t-too c-close!

Japanese:
動かない！　あと　静かに！
みんな　起きちゃうでしょ
English:
Shut up and don’t move!
You’ll wake everyone!

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
{fixed}（ど　ど　ど　どうしよう…
　イリアの顔が　こんなに近くに…）
English:
(Wh-wh-what should I d-do? Illia’s face 
is really close to mine right now...)
...Got it!

Japanese:
ほら　まつげ
もう少しで　目に入るところ
これが目に入っちゃうと　すんごい痛いのよね～
English:
Here, eyelashes. It’s hella painful 
if one ends up in your eye.

Japanese: ま…まつげ…
English: E-Eyelashes...

Japanese:
もう　大丈夫よ　ルカ
じゃあね
English: You’re aight now. See ya～

Japanese: うん　おやすみ
English: Good night...

Japanese: さてと…
English: Right.

Japanese: イリアのパパ
English: Illia’s Papa

Japanese: {fixed}（母さん　母さん　今の見た？）
English: (Hey, Mama, did you see that just now?)

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese:
{fixed}（ええ　イリアったら　大胆ねぇ～
　誰に似たのかしら？）
English: (I did, I wonder who she got that from?)

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese:
{fixed}（それにしても　ヌルイわねぇ
　もう少しだったのに）
English:
(That was a bit lukewarm though.
Perhaps if they interacted a little bit more...)

Japanese: イリアのパパ
English: Illia’s Papa

Japanese:
{fixed}（問題は　そこか？
　母さんは　イリアがお嫁に行くの
　イヤじゃないのか？）
English:
(That’s what you’re worried about? 
Don’t you hate seeing Illia become a maiden?)

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese:
{fixed}（…確か彼　いいところの
　お坊ちゃんなのよね？　ふふっ）
English:
(If I recall correctly he was from
a rich family, correct? Fufu)

Japanese:
……パパ　ママ
そこで　見てるのは　わかってるわ
コソコソしないで　出てきなさい！
English:
Papa, Mama, I know you’re there, so 
can you please get the hell out!

Japanese: イリアのママ
English: Illia’s Mama

Japanese:
{fixed}（バレちゃったみたいね
　逃げるわよ！）
English: (Oh my, looks like we got caught! Time to run!)

Japanese:
……逃げたわね
それにしても　ふたりしてのぞきなんて…
もう　しょうがないんだから！
English:
Tch... they’re gone. I can’t believe 
they were both eavesdropping...

Japanese: コンウェイと温泉
English: Kongwei and the Hot Springs

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: 温泉というのはいいものだね
English: Hot springs sure are nice.

Japanese: そうだね
English: Yeah!

Japanese: このままここに住みたいくらいだよ
English: At this rate, we might start living here.

Japanese: 魅力的だけど……
English: It is tempting, but...

Japanese: いっそ住んじゃおうか
English: Then let’s just live here.

Japanese:
魅力的だけど……僕には
やらなきゃいけないことがあるしね
English: It’s tempting, but... I have other things to do.

Japanese:
うん　ボクも
まだ求めるものを得られていない……
English:
Indeed, same goes for me as well. 
I still have not gotten what I am after.

Japanese:
それじゃあ
名残惜しいけどそろそろ行こうか
English: That said, it is regrettable, but let us make haste.

Japanese: うん
English: Right.

Japanese: いっそ住んじゃおうか
English: Then let’s just live here.

Japanese: それは魅力的だね
English: That is tempting...

Japanese:
けど　ボクらには
やらなきゃならないことがある……
そうでしょ？
English: However we still have something to do, correct?

Japanese:
うん　こんなところで
立ち止まってるわけにはいかないよね
English: Yeah, we can’t just stop here.

Japanese:
それじゃあ
名残惜しいけどそろそろ行こうか
English: That said, it is regrettable, anyway let us make haste.

Japanese: うん
English: Right.

Japanese: アクロバット飛行
English: Acrobatic Flying

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: なんや退屈やなぁ
English: Man, it’s so borin’...

Japanese:
ああ　飛行船ってのも
慣れちまえば大したことねェな
English:
An airship’s not much once 
you’ve gotten used to one.

Japanese:
そうや！　リカルドのおっちゃん
なんかスゴイ技やって～な！
English:
Oh Ah know! Uncle Ricardo, 
try doin’ sum cool move.

Japanese:
おぉ！　そうだぜ　おっさん！
なんかこう　グアーっとなるようなの　頼む！
English:
Yeah, she’s right! Please, old man, try
doing something like WHAM! or BAM!

Japanese: ムリな話だ
English: Not gonna happen.

Japanese: そんなケチなこと言わんで　頼むわ
English: Purty please...?

Japanese:
おっさん　ここがおっさんの腕の見せ所だぜ？
いいのか？　このままで
English:
C’mon, old man, take this as a chance to
show off your skills. You sure you’re just 
gonna let this pass?

Japanese: ………仕方ない
English: ...Fine. Here I go!

Japanese: では　行くぞ！
English: Brace yourselves!

Japanese:
と　やってやりたいが
あいにくと　船体が大きすぎてできん
あと　スピードも足らんな
English:
...is what I’d like to say, but this ship
is too big and too slow for such things.

Japanese: ンだよ…　おっさん…期待持たせんなよな…
English: What the heck, lame...

Japanese:
せやで　おっちゃん
ウチ　楽しみにしてたのに
English: Awww, we were lookin’ forward ta it too.

Japanese: エル　行こうぜ
English: Let’s go, Hermie.

Japanese: ようやく静かになったな
English: It’s finally quiet...

Japanese:
しかし…　何度もコイツには
乗っているが　未だに慣れんな
English:
Still, I’ve been on this thing so long 
and I’m still not used to it.

Japanese:
くそっ…　こんなにも地上が恋しいとはな…
俺もまだまだか…
English: Damn it! I’m still weak!

Japanese: 思い出話
English: A Conversation About the Past

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange.

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: アンジュ　アンジュってば！
English: Ange. Hey, Ange!

Japanese: あら　イリア　どうしたの？
English: Oh, Illia, what is the matter?

Japanese:
どうしたの？　じゃあないでしょ
本に夢中になるのはいいけど
もう少し　まわりに耳を傾けてよね
English:
Don’t you “what is the matter” me! It’s okay to get 
absorbed in a book, but come on, at least pay a little 
attention to what’s happening around you.

Japanese:
ごめんなさい
本を読んでいたら
つい昔のことを思い出しちゃって
English:
I am sorry. While I was reading my book, I started to
remember things from my past.

Japanese:
へぇ～
ね　ね　どんなこと思い出したの？
English: Hm～ So, what kind of things did you remember?

Japanese:
ん～……　特別よ？
みんなにはナイショ　いい？
English:
Hm... Just this once, okay? Keep it a secret from the
others, all right?

Japanese:
もっちろん！
で　どんな話？
English: Of course! So, what was it about?

Japanese:
昔　兄がナーオスの教会にいた頃
よく本を読んでくれたの
English:
In the old days, when my older brother was in Naohs 
church, he would often read books to me.

Japanese:
いいな～　あたしなんて
弟と妹しかいないから　そういうの憧れちゃう
English:
That sounds nice～ I only have younger siblings, so I’m
a bit jealous of people with older ones.

Japanese:
私もそう
弟や妹がいるイリアが　少しうらやましい
English:
The same goes for me. I am a bit jealous that you got 
the chance of having younger siblings.

Japanese:
兄が従軍牧師になってから
毎日が　とても静かだったの
もし　弟や妹がいたら　違ったわ
English:
When my brother became a military chaplain, 
every day was very quiet. It would have been 
different if I had younger siblings.

Japanese:
でも　言うこと聞かないし　スッゴイ大変よ～？
ケンカだってするし　超ムカツクときもあるわ！
English:
But they don’t listen to anything you say, it’s a 
real pain! You always fight and they get on 
your nerves too!

Japanese: ふふっ　楽しそうね
English: That sounds fun!

Japanese: アンジュは　お兄さんに会えなくて寂しい？
English: Ange... Do you miss your older brother?

Japanese:
寂しくない　といったらウソね
でも　今は平気　みんながいるもの
English:
I would be lying if I said that I did not miss him.
However, now I am fine since I have all of you.

Japanese:
ね　アンジュ　今日　一緒に寝ない？
ううん　エルとキュキュと４人で寝るの！
ベッドくっつけてさ！
English:
Hey, Ange, why don’t we have a sleepover tonight?
Me, you, Hermana, and QQ, we’ll put our beds 
together and hang out!

Japanese: いいわね　きっと　楽しいわ
English: That sounds like a lot of fun.

Japanese:
夜中に　イリアやエルに蹴られたりしないか
心配だけど
English:
I’m worried you or Hermie might end up kicking me in
the middle of the night though...

Japanese:
言ってくれるじゃん
それを言ったら　アンジュだって
この前　あたしのこと踏んづけたわよね？
English:
Look who’s talking. Weren’t you the one who stepped
on me last time?

Japanese: それはベッドから落ちたイリアが悪いわ
English:
That is your fault! You were the one who fell from the 
bed!

Japanese: まさか　床で寝てるとは思わなかったもの
English:
How could I possibly know that you were 
sleeping on the floor...

Japanese: ぷっ…！　あはははは…！
English: *Snort*... Bwahahahahhaha!

Japanese: ふふ！
English: Haha!

Japanese: ルカ先生
English: Professor Ruca

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
なぁ　ルカ兄ちゃん
コーダに勉強教えたってくれへん？
English: Hey, Ruca Bro, why don’tcha teach Coda?

Japanese: どうしたの急に？
English: What’s this all of a sudden?

Japanese:
この前　コーダにな
１たす１を聞いたら６って答えたんや
このまんまやと　あかん思てな
English:
Earlier, Ah asked Coda what’s one
plus one an’ he answered six. 
We hafta do sumthin’ ’bout this.

Japanese: 確かにそうだね…
English: Now that you mention it... you might be right.

Japanese:
せやから兄ちゃん
数字の数え方　教えたってぇな
兄ちゃんなら　こういうの得意やろ？
English:
That’s why, bro, ya gotta teach ’em 
how ta count. Ain’t teachin’ yer forte?

Japanese: わかった　やってみるよ
English: Alright, I’ll give it a shot.

Japanese: ほな　コーダ連れてくるわ
English: A’ight, Ah’mma bring Coda.

Japanese: ぬふぬふ　ルカが勉強教えてくれるのかー？
English: Ohhh, is Ruca teaching me today though?

Japanese:
せや　ルカ兄ちゃんやったら
優しいし　手取り足取り教えてくれるで
English: That’s right, Ruca Bro’s a kind an’ patient teacher.

Japanese: それなら安心だ
English: That’s a relief.

Japanese: イリアだと　すごく怒る
English: Illia gets mad at me a lot though.

Japanese: あははは……
English: Haha...

Japanese: それじゃあ　コーダ　はじめるね？
English: Now, shall we start, Coda?

Japanese: おー　コーダ　頑張るんだな
English: Okay! Coda will try his best though!

Japanese: どうなるんか　楽しみやな
English: Ah can’t wait ta see how it’ll turn out!

Japanese: １たす１は？
English: What’s 1 + 1?

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
そういえば　コーダ　ルカ兄ちゃんに
勉強教えてもらってたけど　どうなったん？
English:
Speakin’ of, how’s yer lessons with 
Ruca Bro goin’, Coda?

Japanese: おー　コーダ　頭よくなった
English: Good! Coda’s smarter now!

Japanese: しかし　６以上は数えられないんだな
English: But he hasn’t teach me anything past six.

Japanese: あかんやん…
English: This is bad...

Japanese:
ぬふぬふ
でも　１たす１なら　わかるんだな
English: Fufu, Coda knows what one plus one is now!

Japanese: ほな　１たす１は？
English: A’ight, what’s one plus one?

Japanese:
ニヤリ…
０だ
English: Zero!

Japanese:
なんで！？　なんで０になるん！？
足してんのに！　そっちのほうが　不思議や！
English:
How!? Why is it zero!? Yer addin’ ’em up, 
then why is it less than one!?

Japanese:
食べたら０になる
ルカも言ってたんだな
English: Ruca told me that if I eat it, it will become zero!

Japanese:
……ルカ兄ちゃん　苦労したんやね
慰めたろ
English: Ruca Bro must’ve suffered a lot... Ah’m sorry...

Japanese:
エルもコーダの頭のよさに
びっくりしたんだな　ぬふぬふ！
English:
Hermie must be surprised at how much Coda’s 
gotten smarter now!

Japanese: イリア・ガメツイ
English: Illia Stingy

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

English: Hold on a sec, Ruca.
