さっきの問題だけど　なぁ～～～～んで
あたしの名前がイリア・ガメツイなのよ！！
バカにしてんの！？
English:
Why the hell did you answer “Illia Stingy” in that 
question earlier? Are you making fun of me!?

Japanese:
ご　ごめん
僕も　なんで選んだか　よくわからないんだ…
English: S-Sorry... I don’t know why I chose that either.

Japanese: わからないはずないでしょ！
English: You “don’t” know? Bullcrap!

Japanese:
ルカが　普段からあたしのことを
どう思ってるか　よぉ～～～く　わかったわ！
English: So that’s how you see me, huh? I get it now...

Japanese:
そ　そんな…！　僕はイリアのこと
そんなふうに思ってなんか…！！
English: O-Of course not! I don’t think of you that--

Japanese: じゃあ　どう思ってんのよ？
English: Then what do you think of me?

Japanese: それは……
English: That is...

Japanese: それは…？
English: And that is what?

Japanese: 適当にごまかす
English: Give an appropriate answer

Japanese: 無言で返す
English: Say nothing

Japanese:
そ…それより　あのクイズ難しかったよね！
イリアはどうだった…？
English:
A-At any rate, that quiz sure was difficult! 
How did you do, Illia...?

Japanese:
あんたの気持ち　よぉ～～～く　わかったわ！
じゃあね！　フン！
English: Oh I see now... Bye!

Japanese:
ルカ兄ちゃん　あれはアカンで
いくらなんでも　無理やりすぎるわ
ほら　はよ　フォローせな
English:
Ya done it now, Ruca Bro. 
Ya hafta go after her ’fore it’s too late!

Japanese:
そうね　今ならまだ間に合うわ
早く追いかけないと
English: Indeed, if you go now you can still let her hear you out.

Japanese:
エル…アンジュ…
わかった　行ってくる
English: Ange, Hermie, I understand. Be back later.

Japanese:
ルカ兄ちゃん　ホンマ
この手のことになると　手がかかるなぁ
English: Ruca Bro sure dug himself deep this time, huh?

Japanese:
ルカくんの性格上　仕方ないわ
私たちは　ただ見守るだけよ
English:
With how Ruca is, he just cannot help it. 
All we can do is watch over him.

Japanese: それもそうやな
English: Right.

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
なにも言えないくらいなのね
フ～～ンだ！　ルカなんて　知らない！
English:
So you can’t say it!
Bleh, I don’t know anymore!

Japanese: ま　待って！
English: W-Wait a second!

Japanese: 情けねぇ…
English: How pathetic...

Japanese: 肝心なところで　決められないとはな
English: He can’t make up his mind, can he...?

Japanese:
ホンマや　ルカ兄ちゃん
男見せるチャンスやったのに　もったいないわ
English:
Too true. It was yer chance, Ruca Bro, 
shame ya didn’t take it.

Japanese: そう言っても仕方ないわ
English: Well, no use crying over spilt milk.

Japanese:
でも　このままだと
誤解されたままになるんとちゃうの？
English: So, are we gonna let this misunderstandin’ be?

Japanese:
うーん　あのふたりなら　大丈夫だと思うわ
きっとね
English: It is fine. I am sure they shall both be fine.

Japanese: スパーダの家
English: Spada’s Family

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
おい　ルカ　さっきの問題だけどよぉ
なんで　オレん家が裸族なんだ？
English: Ruca... Did you just call my family “nudists?”

Japanese:
もしかして　お前　貴族が裸で過ごしてるとか
ヘンなイメージ持ってねェよな？
English:
Don’t tell me you have this weird 
preconception of nobles, do you?

Japanese: だ　大丈夫だよ
English: N-Not really.

Japanese:
じゃあ　なんで選んだんだ？
どう考えても　裸族は選ばねぇだろ　普通
English:
Then why the hell did you choose it? No matter how 
you look at it, that’s totally abnormal!

Japanese:
ごめん
僕もなんで選んだか　わからないんだ
English: Sorry, I don’t know why I did it.

Japanese:
わからねェって…
なんだ？　もしかして　疲れてんのか？
それなら　しっかり休めよな
English:
What? Are you tired or something? If that’s so, then 
make sure to get some rest, alright?

Japanese: うん
English: Okay.

Japanese:
それと　メシも食えよ
体調悪いからって　食わねェでいると
余計　バテちまうからな
English:
And make sure you eat some food. Feeling 
sick as well as not eating’s bound to make 
you hella exhausted.

Japanese:
あと　風呂も忘れんなよ
サッパリしてから寝たほうがいいしな
ただ　湯冷めには気をつけろよ
English:
Don’t forget to take a bath before you sleep either. 
Just make sure not to catch a cold.

Japanese:
心配してくれてありがとう
へへっ…　スパーダ　なんだか母さんみたいだね
English:
Spada, you’re just like my mother. 
Although, thanks for worrying about me.

Japanese:
ば…！　こんなの常識だろ
ヘンなこと言うなよな！
English:
T-That’s just common sense! Don’t say some 
weird things.

Japanese: ごめんごめん
English: Haha, sorry!

Japanese: ったくよ…
English: Seriously...

Japanese: んじゃ　次のクイズでは頼んだぜ
English: Then, I’m counting on you on the next quiz.

Japanese: ハスタの愛
English: Hasta’s Love

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
傭兵の面汚しが　愛を持ってだと…？
なにをバカな…
English:
What disgrace of a mercenary would bring “love”, of all
things, to the battlefield?
What sort of stupidity is this...?

Japanese: ど　どうしたの？
English: W-What’s wrong?

Japanese:
いや　先ほどのクイズで
気になることがあってな
English: Oh, nothing, it’s just about the quiz earlier.

Japanese:
西の戦場で出会ったハスタ
彼は何を持って　リカルドを表敬訪問したと
言った？
English: Are you talking about the question:

Japanese: これ？
English:
“What did Hasta bring while visiting Ricardo on the 
Western Front?”

Japanese: そうだ　ルカ　なぜ　愛と答えた？
English: That’s it. Why, of all things, did you answer “love?”

Japanese: そうだったら　面白いかなぁって…！
English: Oh, that? I thought it was an interesting answer!

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
……次から　発言には気をつけろ
俺が言いたいのは　それだけだ
English: I’m warning you, be careful what you choose next...

Japanese: う　うん…
English: O-Okay...

Japanese: いい子ね
English: Kind Child

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: ルカくん　さっきの問題だけど…
English: Ruca, about your answer earlier...

Japanese:
アンジュはナーオスで　なんと呼ばれていた？
これ？
English:
Are you perhaps asking about my answer to what you 
were known as in Naohs?

Japanese:
ええ　その答えが美女だなんて…
ルカくんは　そんなふうに思っててくれたのね
嬉しい
English:
Indeed, I believe you answered that I was a beauty 
back then. I am glad you think of me that way.

Japanese: い　いや…僕は別に……
English: O-Oh, it’s not like...

Japanese:
ほら　ルカくん
こっちにいらっしゃい
English: Ruca, come here.

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
う　うん{fixed}…
（これってまさか　エルにやったのと同じで…）
English:
O-Okay...
(Is this the same as what she does with Hermie...?)

Japanese: ふふ　いい子ね
English: Such a kind child.

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: {fixed}（あ　頭なでられた…）
English: (Oh, she’s patting my head...)

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: {fixed}（だけ…？）
English: (Wait, only that?)

Japanese:
ルカくん？　残念そうな顔してるけど
どうかした？
English: Why do you look so down, Ruca?

Japanese: う　ううん！！　なんでもないよ！
English: O-Oh! It’s nothing!

Japanese: そう？　それなら良いんだけど…
English: Really? Well that is good.

Japanese: それじゃあ　私は先に行くね
English: I shall be going now.

Japanese:
僕　なんとなくだけど
スパーダの気持ちが　わかった気がする…
English: For some reason, I kind of relate with Spada...

Japanese: ごめんなさ～い！
English: I’m Sorry～!

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
キュキュは最初に抱きついた　ルカ違う
なんで　ルカ選んだ？
English:
The first one QQ hugged is not Ruca. 
Why you answer that?

Japanese: ごめん　僕もよくわからないんだ…
English: I’m sorry, I didn’t know what got to me...

Japanese:
それは不思議
もしかして　ルカはキュキュにしてほしいのか？
English: That’s strange! Does Ruca want a hug from QQ?

Japanese: え？　な…なにを…？
English: Huh? W-What?

Japanese: うわっ！！
English: Huh!?

Japanese:
これか？
違うか？
English: Like this? Not like this?

Japanese:
キュ…キュキュさん　待って！
や　やめて！
English: QQ, please wait-- no-- stop!

Japanese:
ルカ　どした？
顔赤い　熱あるか？
English:
Ruca what’s wrong? Your face is red, do you have 
a fever?

Japanese: ご…ご…ごめんなさ～い！！
English: I’m sorryyy～!!

Japanese:
ルカ　逃げる　ヘン
キュキュ　なにか悪いことしたか…？
English: Ruca ran away... did QQ do something wrong?

Japanese: 落し物はまゆげ
English: Dropped Eyebrows

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
ふぅん…　まゆげね{fixed}… 
{variable}ボクは随分と　変わった落し物をしたみたいだね
English:
My “eyebrows”, huh... 
What a weird thing for me to drop.

Japanese: う…ごめん…
English: I-I’m sorry...

Japanese:
ウケを狙うのも良いけど{fixed} 
{variable}ほどほどにしておかないと……
English:
It is fine to entertain someone but
you have to tone it down sometimes...

Japanese: …キミのマユゲが　なくなるかもしれないよ？
English: Or else your eyebrows might disappear...

Japanese: 以後　気をつけます…
English: I-I’ll be more careful...!

Japanese: 小金持ち
English: Moderately Rich

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: あ…
English: Oh...

Japanese: どーしたのよ？
English: What’s up?

Japanese: 所持金が５万ガルドを　超えたんだ
English: We have more than 50,000 Gald!

Japanese: うっそ！
English: No way!

Japanese: すっごいお金持ちじゃん！
English: We’re so rich!

Japanese: お金持ち…ってお前　大したコトねーじゃん
English: Rich... that ain’t a big deal.

Japanese:
個人で持ち歩くには
大きすぎる額だとは思うけどね
English:
I do think it’s too big of an amount to carry around for
one person, though.

Japanese:
仲間の共有財産だからな
武具を買い換えて　グミでも
買い足せば　ほとんど残らねェだろよ
English:
But it’s everybody’s money. If we replace our armors
or buy more gels, there won’t be much left.

Japanese:
ぶ～！
いいじゃん　ガルドが５万枚よ？
English:
Boo! It’s fine, we’ll have plenty
with 50,000 Gald, right?

Japanese:
ベッドに敷き詰めたり
浴槽に入れて　浸かってみたりして
金持ち気分を味わおうよ～
English:
Let’s spread the money over our beds, or even fill the 
bathtub with it and then take a bath. We should really
enjoy ourselves and make the most of all this money.

Japanese:
イリアの金持ちのイメージって
結構　痛いんだな
English: Illia’s image of rich people is pretty... miserable...

Japanese: まったくだね…
English: Honestly...

Japanese:
ええ～？　金持ちって
そうして楽しんでんじゃないの？
English: Huh? Isn’t this how rich people enjoy their money?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
なんで　かわいそうなコを見る目で
あたしを見るのよぉ～！
English:
Hey, why are you both looking at me like I’m some 
pitiful thing?

Japanese: 金持ち気分
English: Very Rich

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: イ　イリア姉ちゃん！
English: I-Illia!

Japanese: エ　エルッ！！
English: H-Hermie!

Japanese:
エラいコトになったで～…
所持金が物凄いコトになっとぉ！
English:
Sumthin’ great jus’ happened～ Sumthin’ incredible
happened with our money!

Japanese:
そ　そうなの！
１０万ガルドを超えちゃった！
正直　重たくてしょうがないぐらい！
English:
I-I know! We have over 100,000 Gald! It’s so heavy, 
it’s almost unbearable!

Japanese: アカンアカン！
English: O-Oh no!

Japanese: な　何？
English: W-What?

Japanese:
そんな金額を口にしたらアカン
誰が聞きつけようかわからん
世の中にはな　悪い人もおんねんで？
English:
Ya can’t say that big of an amount out loud! Ya never
know if sumbody’s listenin’ in on us. Y’know, there’s 
lotsa bad people in this world, hear?

Japanese:
そ　そうね　あたしウッカリしてた…
これから寝る時も枕の下に　銃を置いておこう
English:
R-Right! We’ve been so careless! Starting tonight I’ll 
definitely sleep with my guns under my pillow.

Japanese:
ウチ　今夜から
財布をパンツの中に入れて寝るっ
English:
From tonight on, Ah’ll go to sleep with my purse in
mah underwear!

Japanese: あたしも！
English: Me too!

Japanese: 大金持ち
English: Extremely Rich

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
ルカ　聞いて！
とうとうあたしたち　大金持ちよ！
English: Listen Ruca! We’re finally rich! RICH!

Japanese: むっひょ～♪
English: Yeehaw ♪

Japanese:
えーっと　５０万ガルドかぁ…
僕たち　コレを持ち歩いていたの？
English:
Hmmm 500,000 Gald... Did we really walk around 
carrying around this much?

Japanese: あったり前でしょ！
English: Of course!

Japanese:
…まあいいや
とにかく僕たち　大金持ちだね
English: ...Well, anyhow we’re extremely rich now.

Japanese:
そうそう　専用馬車をしたてて
フワッフワのドレスをオーダーして
んで　デリンジャー銃を隠し持つのよ！
English:
That’s it! I’ll get an exclusive carriage, order a fancy 
princess dress and then I’ll carry my Derringer 
pistol under it.

Japanese:
デリンジャーって　あの手の平に
収まるぐらいの小さい銃だよね
…なんで隠し持たないといけないの？
English:
A Derringer is a gun small enough to fit into the palm
of your hand, right? ...Why do you have to hide it
while carrying it around?

Japanese:
バカねぇ！　西南部においては
ドレスとデリンジャーはセットなのよ？
髭とポンチョと同じぐらいに
English:
You moron! In the southwest, dresses and derringers 
are a pair! Just like having a moustache and a poncho.

Japanese: そ…　そういう物なの？
English: Oh... Oh I see?

Japanese:
ああ　もう
あんたと話してても　時間の無駄ね！
English: Oh. Sheesh. I’m wasting my breath talking to you!

Japanese: さあ　今夜はいい物でも食べようっと！
English: Let’s get something GOOD～ to eat tonight!

Japanese: ステーキ３枚とか～♪　やっぱ４枚～♪
English: I’ll have three steaks ♪  Make it four ♪

Japanese:
貯金するとか　預金するとか
そういう発想がないのは　どうかと思うけど…
English:
Maybe you should think about saving or depositing
money first...

Japanese: 大富豪の心境
English: Tremendously Rich

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
イリア！
とうとう１００万ガルドだよ！
僕たち　大金持ちだね
English: Illia! We finally got to one million Gald! We’re rich!

Japanese: フアァアア…
English: Woaaaaah!

Japanese:
アレ？　イリア　どうしたの？
ほら　お金お金
English: Huh? What’s up Illia? Look, we have money, MONEY!

Japanese:
あ～　もう見飽きちゃった
お金って　かさ張って重いのよね～
English:
Ah～ I’m already tired just looking at it. Money gets
bulky and heavy, right～

Japanese: どうしちゃったの？
English: What happened?

Japanese:
だってさぁ　お金の使い道って
限られてるじゃん？
English:
I mean, there’s a limit to the purpose of 
money, right?

Japanese:
お金が貯まって行く間は
アレ食べようとか　あの服買おうとか
思っちゃうけど　結局買わないし
English:
While I’m saving up money, I constantly think about
eating this or that, or buying new clothes, but in the 
end, I never buy anything anyways.

Japanese:
ま…まあ　武器屋とか道具屋とか
そんなお店しか知らないもんね
僕たち…
English:
W-Well... After all, we only know weapon shops and 
item shops...

Japanese: 持ってるだけのお金って　むなしいなぁ～…
English: Just waiting for more money is so fruitless～

Japanese:
いっそ　国とかに寄付しちゃう？
すっごい感謝されると思うけど
English:
Why don’t you just donate it to the state? I’m sure 
they’d be very grateful.

Japanese:
はぁ？
あんた　ドコのおバカさんデスカ～？
English: Huh! Where you from, stupid town!?

Japanese:
なんでそんなコトしなくちゃ
いけないってのよ！
English: Why would I do something like that!?

Japanese:
もう～　使わないなら
持ってたって　しょうがないじゃないか
English:
Come on～ If you’re not going to use it, then there’s no 
other choice than to carry it around.

Japanese:
いいもん！
村の復興と学校建設費用と…　そんでもって
ステーキ　毎日食べて使い切るもん！
English:
Oh aight! If I use it for the town’s restoration and the
school’s construction costs... And then, if I eat steak
every day, I’ll use it all up!

Japanese: どっっっこいしょっと！
English: Oof!

Japanese:
お金の使い道に不自由するって
贅沢なんだか哀れなんだか　わかんないね
English:
I don’t know whether it’s extravagant or just pathetic
that you’re too lazy to spend your money.

Japanese: ちょっとした仕返し
English: A Petty Revenge

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
クソッ…！
なんなんだ　あの野郎！
English:
DAMMIT!
What the hell’s up with that guy!?

Japanese: スパーダ　落ち着こうよ
English: Spada, you really need to calm down.

Japanese:
おいおい　ルカ
お前　刺されたのを忘れたのか？
English:
What?
Don’t tell me you forgot what that bastard did to you!?

Japanese:
…忘れてなんかいないよ
借りは返すつもりだよ
English:
I haven’t, I’m still planning on paying back what
he did to me.

Japanese: ならよぉ…
English: Then--

Japanese:
ふたりとも　熱くなるのもいいけどさ
あそこで　やめておいたのは正解だよ
町の中だったし　刃傷沙汰はよくない
English:
While I understand what you feel, retreating
was the right decision.

Japanese:
万が一　警備などを呼ばれて
捕まってしまえば　旅に支障をきたしかねん
English:
Had we decided to fight him then and there, the 
villagers might have called the guards on us. ...And 
getting arrested would have been a huge pain.

Japanese:
それなら　騒ぎになる前に
あの頭に何発か　ぶち込んでやれば　よかった
English:
Woulda been better if we sent his head flying before
the villagers noticed, then.

Japanese: イリア　それはそれで　騒ぎになるわ…
English: Illia, that would still cause an uproar.

Japanese:
イリア姉ちゃん　安心しぃ
少しやけど　仕返しはしといたで
English:
Don’tcha worry, sis!
Ah got back at him at least fer a li’l bit.

Japanese:
なに？
あんた　いつの間に蹴り飛ばしたの？
English: Did you kick him? When?

Japanese:
ちゃうちゃう
あのハスタ　砂に埋もれてたやろ？
English:
Nah, Ah didn’t kick him. Rather, ya know how he was
buried in the sand an’ all?

Japanese:
せやから　おっぱいつけてきてん
アンジュ姉ちゃんみたいに　でっかいのをな
English:
Well, Ah gave him big sand boobies that are as big
as Sis Ange’s.

Japanese: はぁ！？
English: You gave him BOOBIES?

Japanese: エル　それどういうことか？
English: Hermie, what do you mean?

Japanese:
砂で　あいつの胸のところに　おっぱい作ってん
どや？　おもろいやろ？
English:
Well, Ah made sand breast at the part where his chest
is. So whatcha think, funny right?

Japanese: お…　面白いには面白いけど…
English: Well it is kind of funny, but...

Japanese: でも　なんでそれが仕返しなんだ？
English: In what way is that getting back at him?

Japanese:
…「町中の笑い者にする」
これが狙い…かな？
English:
I would assume that she meant to make him 
a laughingstock to all the villagers.

Japanese: せや
English: Exactly.

Japanese:
ふふっ…
確かに　想像すると笑えてくるかも…
English: Heh, it is funny in hindsight.

Japanese:
面白いけど　やるならもっと
派手にやりなさいよね！
サンバガールとか！
English:
Don’t get me wrong, it’s funny, but next time you
gotta put more effort into it!

Japanese:
そしたらあいつ　二度と外　歩けないわよ～
イシシシシシ！
English:
You could’ve given him a butt to go alongside the
boobs. Make him fear going outside ever again!

Japanese:
ハッ！　ヌルイな
ブーメランのボディビルダーとかどォよ？
English:
Bah, lame! If we’re talking about peak embarrassment,
you gotta make him super muscle-y. Whatd’ya think?

Japanese:
それはあかんやろ
そこは力士なんかが　ええのんとちゃう？
English:
Nah, that’d jus’ make him cool.
Wouldn’t givin’ him a sumo wrestler body be better?

Japanese: え～～～　それならアレは？
English: Ehhh...♪ Well...

Japanese: ルカ　キュキュ　気になることある
English: Ruca, QQ has question.

Japanese: どうしたの？
English: What’s wrong?

Japanese:
あのヘンなの　首から下　砂の中だた
日に焼けるの首から上
大変じゃないか？
English:
That guy has body under sand and head under sun.
Wouldn’t it be bad for his head?

Japanese:
ヘンなものをつけられるより
こっちの方が悲惨そうだね…
English: I guess that might be worse than the sand breasts.

Japanese: なんだったんだろう？
English: I Wonder What That Was About?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
さっきの教団信者の集まりって
なんだったんだろうね？
English:
There was a group of believers hunched together
earlier. I wonder what that was about?

Japanese:
さぁ？
あの女の名前が　聞こえてきたけど
どーせ　大した話じゃないって
English:
Who knows? I heard that woman’s name but
I don’t think it’s that important anyways.

Japanese:
考えるだけ時間のムダ！
さ　先を急ぎましょ
English:
It’s a waste of time thinking about
it any further, so let’s just hurry up.

Japanese:
…チトセ以外にも　ファンクラブって
言葉が聞こえてきたよね？
English:
I believe I heard them mention that 
they were adherents of "Chitose’s fan club"?

Japanese: あの青いヤツ　会長って呼ばれてたぞ　しかし
English: That blue guy called himself a president though!

Japanese:
他にも女神様や
心の支えなんてのも　聞こえてきたな
English:
I also heard something along the lines
of “no other goddess can bless their hearts”...

Japanese:
もしかしてよォ　教団内に
あの女のファンクラブがあるのか？
English:
Man, could it be that woman has a fanclub inside the
Church?

Japanese: アンジュ　どうなの？
English: What do you think, Ange?

Japanese:
うーん…　わからないけど
彼らの話から考えると　そうなんじゃないかなぁ
English:
Hmm... I am not sure. However, considering what we 
have heard, I do not believe that is the case.

Japanese:
教団内で　特定のファンクラブが
出来ることは　マレにあるしね
English:
It is quite rare for specific fanclubs to
form within the Church, after all.

Japanese: そうなんだ
English: Oh, I see...

Japanese:
それにしても　イリアさんが
ボクたちや　教団員たちの話を
まともに聞いてなくて良かったね
English:
That said, it is a good thing Illia did not
take us and the cultists seriously.

Japanese:
だな　イリアが聞いてたら
「はぁ！？　あの女にファンクラブ！？」
って　絶対　言ってるぜ
English:
Damn right. If Illia ever heard about what
they were talking about, she’d definitely go:
“HUH? That woman has a fanclub!?”

Japanese:
ちょっと　みんな　なにしてんのよ
早く行くわよ！
English:
Hey, what the hell is everyone muttering
to each other about? I’m going on ahead!

Japanese:
さて　俺たちも行くとするか
騒がれるのはご免だからな
English:
Now then, we should wrap this up
before we make a scene.

Japanese: コーダとデザート
English: Coda and Dessert

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
ふぅ…　ショートケーキに　アップルパイ
フルーツパフェにクレープ　ガトーショコラ…
English:
Phew... From shortcake to apple pie, a fruit parfait to
crepes, and lastly Gateau au chocolat...

Japanese:
こうもデザート系のレシピが揃うと
誘惑に　勝てる気がしないわ…
English:
When I see all these dessert recipes gather together,
I feel like I will not be able to resist the temptation...

Japanese:
その通りだぞ
アンジュは　よくわかってるな　しかし！
English: That’s right! You understand well though Ange!

Japanese: あら　この気持ちわかってくれる？
English: Oh, do you understand this feeling?

Japanese:
うまいものに　囲まれる
食べたくなるのは　当然だぞ　しかし
English:
If you’re surrounded by yummy things, it’s natural that 
you end up wanting to eat it though.

Japanese:
そうね　でも　どうせなら
本当にデザートに囲まれてみたい…
English:
True, but if given the choice, I would really love to be
surrounded by dessert...

Japanese:
それなら　全部作るんだな
コーダは　食うぞ　しかし！
English:
In that case, let’s make everything. 
Coda gets to eat though!

Japanese: それは　いいアイデア！
English: That is a splendid idea!

Japanese:
と　言いたいところだけど
勝手に作ったら　みんなに　怒られちゃう
それは　いつかのお楽しみね
English:
Is... what I would like to say, however if we just make 
all of it without asking the others, they will get angry. 
I guess this pleasure will have to wait for another time.

Japanese: んあー　残念なんだな
English: Ahh... how disappointing though.

Japanese: コーダとパン
English: Coda and Bread

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
んあー　聞け　スパーダ
パン系のレシピは　極めたみたいだぞ！
English:
Ahh, Spada, listen! It looks like we’ve managed to 
collect all Bread recipes!

Japanese:
はぁ？
なんで　そんなコトがわかんだよ
English: Huh? How would you know that?

Japanese:
食のことなら
コーダにわからないことはないのだ　しかし
English:
When it comes to food, there’s nothing Coda doesn’t
know though.

Japanese: あー　そーかよ
English: Alright, makes sense.

Japanese: で　それが　どうしたんだ？
English: So, what about it?

Japanese:
嬉しくないのか？
毎日　いろんなパンが食い放題だぞ　しかし
English:
Aren’t you happy? Every day you can eat all kinds of
bread, as much as you want though.

Japanese:
いや　別に…
それに　レシピなら他にもあんだろ？
毎日　パンの必要はねぇって
English:
Hm, not really... Besides, there must be more recipes?
And you don’t need bread every day.

Japanese:
スパーダには　この喜びがわからないか…
コーダ　悲しいぞ　しかし…
English:
Spada, you wouldn’t understand this kind of 
happiness... Coda is sad though...

Japanese: コーダとライス
English: Coda and Rice

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
それにしても　よくもまぁ
ライスのレシピが　これだけ揃ったものだ
English:
Come to think of it, how were we able to 
gather so many rice recipes?

Japanese:
傭兵稼業で各地を転々としたが
この年まで　口にしたことがない料理が
あるとは　食は奥が深い
English:
As a mercenary, I travelled to a lot of places, but I 
never thought that I’d be discovering new flavours 
even to this day. There’s a lot of depth to food.

Japanese:
コーダが　世界のうまいものを
求めたくなる気持ち…　理解できなくもない
English:
I can’t say I don’t understand your desire to look 
for all delicious food in the world, Coda...

Japanese:
んあー　なにを言ってる
うまいものを食いたいと思うのは
当然だぞ　しかし
English:
Hmm, what are you saying? It’s natural to 
want to eat yummy food though.

Japanese:
確かにそうだが　うまいものばかり
食べていると　いつか舌が満足しなくなるぞ？
English:
Certainly, but if you only eat tasty food, your taste buds
will eventually grow insatiable at some point. Got it?

Japanese: どういうことなんだな　しかし？
English: What do you mean though?

Japanese:
一度　食の水準を上げてしまうと
落とすのは　なかなか難しい
そういうことだ
English:
Once you’ve raised your standards for meals,
it’s going to be difficult to lower them. 
That’s what I’m talking about.

Japanese:
リカルドの言ってることは難しいなー
うまいもの食いたいのは　当たり前
それで　良いと思うぞ　しかし？
English:
Ricardo’s talk is complicated. It is obvious that I 
want to eat yummy food. I think that’s perfectly 
okay though?

Japanese: 戦場に出ることのない者は　そうかもしれんな
English:
That might be the case for people who don’t need to 
fight on the battlefield.

Japanese: ふっ…　この話は　忘れてくれ
English: Hmph... Forget about it.

Japanese: コーダと魚
English: Coda and Fish

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
コーダ　どうしたん？
えらい行儀良くして
English:
Coda, what’s up? Ya been awfully well-behaved
recently, so Ah was wonderin’.

Japanese:
エル　コーダは感動したぞ
魚料理は　コーダの
知らないものばかりだ　しかし
English:
Hermie, Coda is deeply moved by that. But there’s so 
many things that Coda doesn’t know about dishes
with fish though.

Japanese:
ああ　いっぱいレシピあるけど
どれもおいしゅうて　嬉しいねんな
わかるで　その気持ち
English:
Oh, right, there’s lotsa recipes, but everythin’s so tasty
it makes me happy jus’ thinkin’ ’bout it. Ah 
understand the feelin’ well.

Japanese:
おぉー　エル　すごいぞ　しかし
コーダの気持ち　なぜ　わかったー？
English:
Oh Hermie, you’re amazing though! 
But how did you understand Coda’s feeling?

Japanese:
そんなんわかるって
顔に書いてあるもん
English:
Ah jus’ know those things. 
It’s written all over yer face.

Japanese:
んあー！
コーダの顔にラクガキしたの　誰だ　しかし！
English: Waaah! Who scribbled on Coda’s face though!?

Japanese:
あちゃー…
そういう意味や　なかったんやけどな
English: Uh... That’s not what Ah was tryin’ta say.

Japanese: コーダと肉
English: Coda and Meat

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
ぬふぬふふ　肉料理のレシピが
こんなにあるとは　コーダ
イリアについてきて　よかったぞ　しかし
English:
Hehehe～ to think that there are so many meat dishes.
It was a good idea that Coda decided to follow 
Illia though!

Japanese:
からあげポテトに　やきとり
ハンバーグ　ステーキ……
毎日どれを　食べるか悩むな　しかし！
English:
From Fried Chicken with Fries to Yakitori, and then 
there’s hamburgers, steak... Every day is a struggle 
to decide which one to eat though!

Japanese:
ねぇ　イリア
コーダがなんか言ってたけど…
English: Hey Illia, Coda is mumbling something...

Japanese:
あー　気にしなくていいわ
どーせ　食べ物のことだし
English:
Oh yeah, don’t mind him. He’s probably 
just raving about food or something.

Japanese:
そんなことより　肉料理のレシピが
こんなにたくさん…
English: More importantly, we have so many meat recipes...

Japanese:
うししししし！
今日は　なににしよう！
English: Hyahahahaha～ I wonder what we’re making today?

Japanese: 言ってることは　コーダと変わんねぇのな…
English: You’re no better than Coda...

Japanese: コーダとスープ
English: Coda and Soup

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: ルカ　なにしてんの？
English: What’cha doing?

Japanese:
レシピの整理だよ
だいぶ　集めたからね
English:
We’ve managed to collect a fair amount of recipes,
so I’m putting them in order.

Japanese:
ふぅん
そういえばさぁ　どんなレシピがあったっけ？
English:
Hmm. Now that you mention it, what kind of recipes 
did you find?

Japanese:
そうだなぁ
スープ系のレシピがたくさんあるよ
ほら
English: Let me see... There are a lot of soup recipes. Look!

Japanese:
うっわ
あたしたち　いつの間にかこんなに集めて…
English: Wow! How long have you been collecting these?

Japanese:
レシピは　うまいものが
たくさん詰まった　お宝なんだな
ルカ　大事にするんだぞ　しかし
English:
Recipes are the treasure trove of goodness. They’re
the real real treasure. Take good care of them Ruca.

Japanese:
あたしたちのご飯は
あんたに掛かってるんだから　頼むわよ！
English:
You’re in charge of our meals, 
so I’m counting you, got it?

Japanese: コーダとパスタ
English: Coda and Pasta

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
おー　コーダたち　麺とパスタを
極めたみたいだぞ　しかし！
これで　いつでもうまいものが食えるなー
English:
Hey!! Coda and everyone gathered all the noodles 
and pasta recipes though! With this, we can eat 
yummy food any time!

Japanese:
おぉ　それはすごい
ここの料理　とてもおいしい
キュキュ　気にいた！
English: Oh, amazing! The food here so good! QQ likes it!

Japanese:
んあー？
キュキュの国の料理は　まずいのか？
コーダ　気になるぞ　しかし
English:
Hm? Does the food in QQ’s country taste bad? 
Coda is intrigued though.

Japanese:
キュキュの国　おいしいものある
でも　ここの料理　比べるの違う
English:
QQ country has delicious food. But the food here 
not same.

Japanese: どういうことなんだな　しかし？
English: What do you mean though?

Japanese:
キュキュの国　料理　おいしい
ここの料理　おいしい
どっち　まずい　それ違う
English:
QQ country cooking delicious. The food here is good.
Which one is better, QQ can’t tell?

Japanese:
どっちもうまいのかー
コーダ　キュキュの国に行ってみたいぞ　しかし
English:
So both are yummy! Coda wants to 
go visit QQ’s country though.

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
{triverse}ARATERAWAMI_NUKON_QQ_EDANNIM
ENOYIISONATO_METOT
NEMOGO_NANIRUMA_WEROSO_MEDa
English:
{triverse}ARATERAWAMI_NUKON_QQ_EDANNIM
ENOYIISONATO_METOT
NEMOGO_NANIRUMA_WEROSO_MEDa

Japanese:
今　なんて言ったんだな？
コーダ　よくわからなかったぞ
English: What did you just say? Coda didn’t understand well.

Japanese:
彼女の国では　ネズミを食べるらしいから
キミが行くのは　オススメしないそうだよ
English:
I heard they eat rats in her country, so I would not 
recommend you go there.

Japanese: ぎゃ～　食われる～～～！　しかし～～～～！
English: Woahhh～ I’ll get eaten～! Though～!

Japanese: コーダと野菜
English: Coda and Vegetables

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
ぬふっ　ぬふふ
ぬふぬふ　ぬふふふふふっ！
English: Mufufufu～ Fufufufufu～

Japanese:
どうしたの　コーダ
なにかヘンな物でも　食べたの？
English:
What is the matter Coda? 
Did you eat something weird?

Japanese:
おー　コンウェイか
見ろ　野菜系レシピがたくさんだぞ　しかし！
English:
Oh it’s Kongwei! Look, there are so many vegetable 
recipes though!

Japanese:
ボクたち　ずいぶんと　集めていたんだね
ああ　もしかして　それでうれしかったの？
English:
We sure collected a fair amount of them. Oh, could it 
be that you are happy because of these?

Japanese:
そーだぞ！
これだけあれば　絞りカスや皮なんか
食べなくても良いんだな
English:
That’s it! If I have these, it’s okay if I don’t eat the 
dregs or the peels.

Japanese: …キミ　見かけによらず　苦労していたんだね
English: ...You seemed to be struggling more than I thought.

Japanese: んあー？　どういう意味だー　しかし？
English: Mmm... What does that mean exactly though?

Japanese:
特に深い意味はないよ
おいしいものが　食べられると良いね
English: It does not mean anything. Just enjoy all the tasty food.

Japanese: おー　もちろんだぞ　しかし！
English: O-Of course!

Japanese: コーダとパスタ(訳)
English: Coda and Pasta

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
おー　コーダたち　麺とパスタを
極めたみたいだぞ　しかし！
これで　いつでもうまいものが食えるなー
English:
Hey!! Coda and everyone gathered all the noodles 
and pasta recipes though! With this, we can eat 
yummy food any time!

Japanese:
おぉ　それはすごい
ここの料理　とてもおいしい
キュキュ　気にいた！
English: Oh, amazing! The food here so good! QQ likes it!

Japanese:
んあー？
キュキュの国の料理は　まずいのか？
コーダ　気になるぞ　しかし
English:
Hm? Does the food in QQ’s country taste bad? 
Coda is intrigued though.

Japanese:
キュキュの国　おいしいものある
でも　ここの料理　比べるの違う
English:
QQ country has delicious food. But the food here 
not same.

Japanese: どういうことなんだな　しかし？
English: What do you mean though?

Japanese:
キュキュの国　料理　おいしい
ここの料理　おいしい
どっち　まずい　それ違う
English:
QQ country cooking delicious. The food here is good.
Which one is better, QQ can’t tell?

Japanese:
どっちもうまいのかー
コーダ　キュキュの国に行ってみたいぞ　しかし
English:
So both are yummy! Coda wants to 
go visit QQ’s country though.

Japanese:
みんなで　キュキュの国まわれたら
とても楽しいよね…
でも　それはムリなの　ごめん…
English:
QQ would be happy to take everyone to
visit her country. But I’m afraid it’s 
impossible, sorry...

Japanese:
今　なんて言ったんだな？
コーダ　よくわからなかったぞ
English: What did you just say? Coda didn’t understand well.

Japanese:
彼女の国では　ネズミを食べるらしいから
キミが行くのは　オススメしないそうだよ
English:
I heard they eat rats in her country, so I would not 
recommend you go there.

Japanese: ぎゃ～　食われる～～～！　しかし～～～～！
English: Woahhh～ I’ll get eaten～! Though～!

Japanese: 最後の食事
English: Last Supper

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: …これが　最後の食事になるかもしれないんだね
English: This may be our last supper...

Japanese:
みんなと顔を合わせるのも
最後かもしれないと思うと　少し寂しいわね
English:
It feels quite lonely to think of this 
as the last time we eat together.

Japanese:
おいおい
なぁ～に　言ってんだよ
English: Hey, what’re you talking about!?

Japanese:
そうそう
最後になんてさせないっての！
English: Yeah! I won’t let this be the last!

Japanese:
そのために　まず
たくさん食べて　元気にならなくっちゃ
English: We have to eat lots and rest lots first!

Japanese:
そんで　マティウスのヤツなんか
ぶっ飛ばしてやんのよ
English:
Then, we’re gonna go in there, kick Mattheus
in the ass and send her flying!

Japanese:
全部　終わったら
みんなで　うまいモン食べようや
ルカ兄ちゃんと　スパーダ兄ちゃんのおごりでな
English:
After she’s gone ta space, we can go out 
an’ eat sumthin’ tasty. ’Course it’s gonna 
be Ruca Bro and Spada Bro’s treat!

Japanese: えぇ！？
English: Huh!?

Japanese: おい！　なに勝手に決めてんだよ
English: Hey, don’t decide that without my permission!

Japanese:
え～　ウチお金ないもん
兄ちゃんたちなら　あるやろ？　コレ
English:
Ah don’ have money, hear?
But Ah bet y’two do, right?

Japanese:
それなら　年長者である
リカルドさんに頼んだら　どうかな？
English:
In that case, how about we leave it to our
oldest member, Ricardo?

Japanese: じゃあ　おっちゃん頼んだで！
English: Then, Ah’m countin’ on ya, Uncle!

Japanese: 頼んだで！
English: Countin’ on ya!

Japanese:
まったく…
人の財布をアテにするなと　習わなかったのか？
English:
Good grief, has no one taught you not
to rely on other people’s wallets?

Japanese:
だが　全員揃って帰ることが出来たら
それもありかもしれんな
ただ　そのときは　各自出し合って…
English:
However, if we do manage to get out of this safe and
sound, then perhaps.
Provided that everyone contributes, that is.

Japanese:
よっしゃ！
おっちゃん　太っ腹～～！　さすがや！
English: Yay! Ah knew ya always been generous!

Japanese:
あなたが　承諾してくれるなんて
言ってみるものだね
English:
I never imagined that you would agree to it.
What a surprise!

Japanese:
おっさん　気前いいな
見直したぜ
English:
Huh, I misjudged you, 
looks like the old man’s pretty generous.

Japanese:
ありがとう　リカルド
僕　楽しみにしてるよ
English:
Thanks, Ricardo!
I’m looking forward to it!

Japanese:
いしし
なぁ～に　食べようかな！
English: Hehe～ I wonder what I’ll get～

Japanese: ご馳走様です　リカルドさん
English: Thank you for the food, Sir Ricardo.

Japanese:
リカルド
アンジュたち　いっぱい食べる
大丈夫か？
English:
Ricardo, everyone gonna end up eating lots.
Is alright?

Japanese:
…まぁな
多少の貯金ならある
English: ...Should be, I have some money saved up.

Japanese:
それならキュキュ　安心
リカルド　ごちそうさま！
English:
Then that’s fine!
Thank you for food!

Japanese:
…暗い食事など　あいつらには合わん
いつもの雰囲気で　食べるのが一番だ
English:
Something as gloomy as a "last supper" doesn’t 
suit us. It’d be best if we could share a meal the 
way we usually do.

Japanese:
その空気を作った代金だと思えば
惜しくはないな
English:
If my money is what it takes to improve the mood,
then I won’t regret spending it.

Japanese: この時間だけでも
English: At Least this Time

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
わぁ
とてもおいしそう
English: This looks utterly delectable!

Japanese:
ホント
あたし　もうお腹ペコペコ
それじゃ　いただきま～す♪
English:
Agreed～
Well let’s dig in, then!
I’m starving!

Japanese:
実にうまかった
では　俺は他の者の食事が終わるまで
向こうで休ませてもらう
English:
Indeed it was.
I’ll be resting over there while you eat, so
feel free to call me when you need something.

Japanese:
早っ！
あんた食べるのちょっと　早すぎじゃない？
English: Aren’t you a little TOO quick?

Japanese: リカルドさん　もう少しゆっくり食べませんか？
English:
Sir Ricardo, why not stay for a while and savor
the food?

Japanese:
戦場ではこれが普通だ
のん気に食べていては
的にしてくれと　言っているようなものだ
English:
Such a thing is normal on the battlefield.
Choosing to savor the food is just asking the enemy
to shoot at you.

Japanese: 言いたいことは　わかります
English: I understand.

Japanese:
でも折角の食事です
ここには　みんなもいますし　楽しみませんか？
English:
However, we have gone great lengths 
to prepare such a meal. We might 
as well enjoy it together while we can.

Japanese:
その油断が命取りなのだが…
……たまにはそういう食事も悪くはない
English:
I have half a mind to tell you how such negligence
might eventually lead to our demise, but I suppose
such a thing isn’t bad once in a while.

Japanese: わかった　次からは出来るだけ心がけよう
English: I understand, I’ll keep it in mind from now on.

Japanese: 気配り上手
English: Thoughtfulness

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: 今日のメシも　うまかったなぁ
English: Today’s lunch was purty tasty!

Japanese: みんな　お茶淹れた
English: Everyone, QQ made tea.

Japanese: ありがとう
English: Thank you.

Japanese: この食後のいっぱいが　おいしいのよねぇ～
English: Mmmm, this is delicious!

Japanese:
そうね
それにこの穏やかな時間　とてもいいわ
English:
Indeed. It is also nice that we are able 
to enjoy this moment of peace.

Japanese:
せやな
食べたモンの味　思い出したり
明日はなに食べよとか　考えてると楽しくなるわ
English:
Yeah! Whenever Ah remember how our meal tasted like,
Ah can’t help but look forward to what we’re
eatin’ tomorrow!

Japanese: メシのことばかりだな
English: All you think about is food.

Japanese:
せやけど　スパーダ兄ちゃん
食い物のこと　考えてると幸せにならへん？
あ　もちろん　食べるともっと幸せになるけどな
English:
Yeah, but don’tcha feel happy while thinkin’ ’bout food?
An’ ’course ya feel even more happier when yer
eatin’ too!

Japanese:
ん～　まぁな
今日のメシはなんだろう？
って考えるだけで　ちょっとはワクワクするぜ
English:
Hmmm, yeah, I guess.
I can’t help but feel a bit excited while thinking
about what we’re having today.

Japanese:
食べることで　心も体も満たされる
そして　想像することで　期待に胸が膨らむ
悪いことではないぞ
English:
It’s not necessarily a bad thing. Food satisfies your
body and soul’s needs, so it’s only natural to be
filled with anticipation while thinking about it.

Japanese:
でも　そればかり考えているのは
ちょっとアレだよね
English: To only think about food is quite... you know...

Japanese: アンジュ姉ちゃん　言われとるで
English: Haha, Sis Ange got told off.

Japanese: もう　エルのことでしょう
English: Is he not talking about you?

Japanese: イリア　おかわりいるか？
English: Would Illia like refill?

Japanese: あ　うん　ちょうだい
English: Ah, yes please. Thank you!

Japanese:
あう　これで最後
キュキュ　淹れる
English: Aww, this gonna be last pot QQ brew.

Japanese:
ねぇ　キュキュさんってさ
いつも　率先してお茶淹れたり
片付けとかしてるよね？
English:
Hey, isn’t QQ always the one volunteering to
prepare tea and tidy up?

Japanese:
ええ
当番じゃなくても　手伝ってくれるわ
English:
Indeed, she helps even if she is not the one on
cooking duty.

Japanese:
そういえば　このお茶も
ほとんどキュキュが　淹れているな
English:
On that note, she’s also the one who made
what we’re drinking today.

Japanese:
彼女　ああ見えて
結構　気配り上手なのかもしれないね
English: Despite how she looks, she is quite thoughtful.

Japanese:
せやなぁ
ウチ　ちょいちょい寝グセ直してもろてるし
English: Yeah, she usually combs my hair every mornin’.

Japanese: あたしは靴紐ほどけてるの　教えてもらったわ
English:
And she once pointed out to me that my shoelaces
were untied.

Japanese: オレは帽子　飛ばされたとき拾ってくれたぞ
English: She picked up my hat when it blew off my head.

Japanese: それは　当たり前やで　スパーダ兄ちゃん
English: Ah mean, anybody would do that.

Japanese: みんな　待った
English: Sorry for making you wait.

Japanese:
キュキュさん　ありがとう
今　ちょうど　貴女の話をしていたところよ
English:
Thank you, QQ.
We were just talking about you.

Japanese:
キュキュの？
なにかあるか？
English:
About QQ?
What is it?

Japanese: キュキュ姉ちゃんが　気配り上手やなーって話や
English: We were talkin’ ’bout how thoughtful ya are.

Japanese:
ねぇ　キュキュさんは
なんで　そんなに気配りが出来るの？
English:
That said, why would you even bother looking
out for us?

Japanese:
そうか？　出来てるか？
キュキュ　わからん
English:
Really, QQ’s thoughtful?
QQ doesn’t really know.

Japanese: 無自覚かいな
English: Waah, she didn’t know...

Japanese: キュキュ姉ちゃんは　ええお嫁さんになれるで
English: Ya know, ya’d make a good wife.

Japanese:
お嫁さん…？
それ　褒める言葉？
English:
Wife?
Is that compliment?

Japanese:
せやで
キュキュ姉ちゃんは　ええ人やってことや
English: Yeah, Ah meant yer a good person.

Japanese:
そうか
エル　ありがと！
English: Ohh, thank you, Hermie!

Japanese: シアンとご飯
English: A Meal with Sian

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: シアン
English: Sian

Japanese: いい匂い…
English: Smells nice...

Japanese:
あっ　今　出来たところなんだ
はい　これ君の分
English:
Oh, great timing!
Have some.

Japanese: ……いらない
English: I don’t need it.

Japanese:
ご…ごめん　余計なことして…
一応　君の友達の分も用意したんだけど
食べるかな…？
English:
S-Sorry...
I-I made some for your friends too, but...
would they eat it?
...Yeah.

Japanese: ケル　ベロ
English: Cer, Berus.

Japanese:
……お前　ボクの分もあるんだよな？
その…もらえる…？
English:
...You still have my portion, right?
Can... I have it?

Japanese:
うん…！
君の口に合うかどうかはわからないけど
はい！
English:
Okay!
I don’t know if you’d find it delicious, but here!

Japanese: いただきます…
English: Bon appetit...

Japanese: おいしい
English: ......Tasty!

Japanese:
よかった！
おかわりあるから　たくさん食べてね
もちろん　君の友達も
English:
I’m glad!
I made a lot so feel free to take seconds.
Cer and Berus too!

Japanese: ……ありがと
English: ...Thank you.
Hm?

Japanese:
聞こえなかったのか？
ありがとって　言ったんだ
２度も言わせるな
English:
Are you deaf?
I said “thank you."
Don’t make me say it twice!

Japanese: ご…ごめん…
English: Oh... S-Sorry...

Japanese: ふん…！
English: Hmph!

Japanese: チーズフォンデュ
English: Cheese Fondue

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
みんなでチーズフォンデュをするのって
すごく楽しいね
English: It’s really fun to have cheese fondue together!

Japanese:
はふはふ…！
ん～～～～！！
チーズのとろっとろ感がたまらないわ！
English:
Foo～ Foo～
This cheese is so savory～
I can’t stop～!

Japanese:
ああ　マジでウマいよな
パンとチーズだけだってのに　スゴイぜ
English:
Yeah! This is really hella tasty!
It’s amazing to think that we’re only having
bread and cheese.

Japanese:
イリアもスパーダくんも
落ち着いて食べないと　火傷するわ
English:
You both have to slow down or else you
might end up burning your tongue!

Japanese:
せやで…はふはふ…！
イリア……はふっはふ…姉ちゃんたち！
English:
Yeah... foo... foo～!
Ya foo... heard her!

Japanese: …エルもね
English: You too, Hermie.

Japanese:
ぬふぬふ～…
チーズがつかないぞ
English: Hnnn... this cheese isn’t coming off!

Japanese:
背伸び　どうか？
ダメなら　ジャンプ
English:
Coda tried standing on toe tips?
If not jump.

Japanese: おー　こーか？
English: Like this?

Japanese: コーダ　そんなふうにしたら　あぶないよ
English: Coda, that’s dangerous.

Japanese: あっ…
English: Oh--

Japanese:
熱いな　しかし
さすがチーズフォンデュだ
English:
It’s hot though!
As expected of cheese fondue!

Japanese: コーダ　大丈夫！？
English: Are you alright!?

Japanese:
あちゃー…
あんたなにやってんの…
English: Sheesh, what do you think you’re doing...?

Japanese:
平気だ
しかし　コーダがフォンデュされた
コーダはうまくないんだな　イリア
English:
Coda’s fine, but Coda’s covered in fondue.
Coda’s not tasty, though, Illia.

Japanese: 誰も食べないっての！
English: No one’s going to eat you!

Japanese:
遊ぶのもその辺にしておけ
早くチーズを洗い流さないと
かたまってしまうぞ
English:
Enough fooling around, let’s get that cheese
washed off of you before it hardens.

Japanese:
そうだった…
コーダ　行くわよ！
English:
Oh right...
Time to get movin’, Coda!

Japanese: やれやれ　騒がしいね
English: Dear me, how boisterous.

Japanese: でも　楽しい食事　いいコト
English: But tasty meal is nice.

Japanese:
それを　このトラブルの原因を作ったキミが
言うのか？
English: Nice words coming from you, troublemaker.

Japanese:
キュキュが原因？
そうか？
English:
So QQ is troublemaker?
Is that it?

Japanese: 無自覚ほど　タチの悪いものはないね
English: Feigning innocence is bad taste, you know.

Japanese:
ふたりとも　その辺にしてね
次チーズフォンデュをやるときは
気をつけましょう
English:
You both should stop that.
From now on, we should be careful whenever
we make cheese fondue.

Japanese: それじゃあ　みんな　片付けましょう
English: Now then, let us clean up.

Japanese: 仁義なき争奪戦
English: Struggle for Supremacy

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
もぐもぐ…ウマい…ウマいんだな
もぐもぐ…
English:
Munch munch munch... this is tasty!
This is tasty though!

Japanese:
ええ　エルの作ったすきやきは最高
いくらでも　おかわりできそう
English:
Hermie’s sukiyaki really is the best!
I feel as if I cannot stop eating!

Japanese: ありがとうな
English: Thanks!

Japanese:
ところで　アンジュ姉ちゃんエエの？
そないに食べたら　後が大変やで？
English:
But speakin’ of, are ya fine with that, Sis Ange?
Ain’t it gonna be bad if ya keep eatin’ more of that?

Japanese: 今日は大丈夫　たくさん動く予定だから
English: It is fine, I shall be moving around today anyway.

Japanese: エル　おかわり！
English: Seconds please!

Japanese: しかし　コーダもおかわりなんだな
English: Though give Coda seconds too!

Japanese: 私も　おかわりをお願いできる？
English: May I also have seconds?

Japanese: 僕もおかわり…いいかな？
English: Can I... have seconds too?

Japanese: キュキュも　おかわり！
English: Seconds too!

Japanese:
あー　あかん　あと一人分しかないわ
ウチも食べたいから　どないしよ
English:
Oh no!
There’s only one portion left, but Ah wanna have
sum too! What now?

Japanese:
ア・ン・ジュ
今日はもうその辺にしておいたら　どうかしら？
そんなに食べたら　アレでしょ？
English:
Ange～
Why don’t you stop for today?
Or else you might get, you know...

Japanese:
せやな
アンジュ姉ちゃん　今日はもうやめとき
English:
Yeah!
Ya had nuff fer today, Sis Ange.

Japanese:
ふたりして　もう…
そんなに気遣わなくても大丈夫よ
English:
Oh you two...
It is all right, you both do not have to worry about me.

Japanese:
さっきも言ったように
後でたくさん運動するわ
English:
As I said earlier, I am planning to have lots of
exercise later today.

Japanese:
それより　ふたりの方こそ
やめておいた方がいいんじゃない？
English: That said, have you both not had enough already?

Japanese:
これで３杯目でしょう？
食べすぎは体に悪いわ
English:
That is already your third portion!
Eating too much is bad for your body!

Japanese:
３人とも　脱落か
キュキュが　おかわりもらう
English: Forget about you three, QQ getting final serving.

Japanese: ちょっと待った！
English: HEY!

Japanese: ちょっと待って！
English: WAIT!

Japanese: ちょお待ちぃや！
English: STOP!

Japanese: もう少しだたのに…
English: Was so close...

Japanese: あんた　抜け駆けは許さないわよ！
English: I won’t forgive you if you go stealing behind my back!

Japanese:
ええ　強行策に出るなんて　ダメよ
ここは話し合いで　平和的に解決しなくちゃ
English:
Indeed, let us talk this out like civilized people
instead of fighting over it.

Japanese:
せやせや
ウチの作ったすきやきは誰にも渡さへんで
English:
Yeah! Ah ain’t gonna let anybody have the final taste
of mah sukiyaki!

Japanese: 望むところ
English: As you wish.

Japanese: え？　えぇ…？
English: Huh? Huh???

Japanese:
ウチの女性陣は　元気があっていいね
見ていて気持ち良いくらいだよ
English: It is quite pleasant seeing our girls so lively.

Japanese: 元気って言っていいのかなぁ…？
English: Should we let them be...?

Japanese:
さて　それじゃあ　ボクたちで
残りをいただこうか
このままだと　冷めてしまうしね
English:
Well, since the four of them seem to be preoccupied
at the moment, we should help ourselves to the
food before it gets cold.

Japanese: その水はどこから？
English: Where’d You Get that Water?

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
アッツイ～…！
ルカ～お水ない？
English:
Hoooot～!
Got some water, Ruca?

Japanese:
ごめん
さっきイリアが飲んだので　最後なんだ
English: Sorry, you just drank the last of it.

Japanese: げっ！　バカみたいに暑いってのに
English: Tch, it’s still so damn hot though...

Japanese: 水がないって　どういうことよ～…
English: Now what do I do...?

Japanese: ごめん…
English: Sorry...

Japanese:
こーら　イリア　ルカくんにあたらない
もとはといえば　イリアがひとりで
飲んじゃったからでしょう
English:
Illia! Stop picking on Ruca, you were the
one who drank it all in the first place!

Japanese: う…　そうでした
English: Oh-- Right...

Japanese:
この火山では難しいと思うが
どこかで水を補給したいものだな
English:
It’s not going to be easy to go through this volcano. 
We should look for a place to 
replenish our water supplies.

Japanese:
ええ…
こう暑いと参ってしまいますから…
English: Indeed, this place is so hot that I feel quite faint.

Japanese:
みんな　オムライスが出来たで！
たんと食べ！
English:
Fellas, Ah made sum Omelette Rice!
Dig in!

Japanese:
うっわ！　超おいしそう！
いっただっきま～す♪
English:
Ooh! It looks so tasty!
Thank you for the food～

Japanese:
んぐんぐ
うまい　うまいぞ　エル
English: Munch munch, this is tasty, really tasty though!

Japanese:
たまごが　ふわふわでとろとろ…
これは見事
English:
The egg is so fluffy and syrupy...
Splendid!

Japanese:
……なぁ　エル
オムライスを作るなら
ライスを炊くのに　水が必要だよな？
English: ......Hey, Hermie, don’t you need water to cook rice?

Japanese: せやなぁ
English: Yeah, why?

Japanese:
どうやって調達したんだ？
この人数分のライスを炊くとなったら
手持ちの水だけじゃ　足りねぇだろ？
English:
Where on Terro did you get water? We don’t even
have enough for ourselves, much less enough
to make eight people’s worth of rice.

Japanese: それはな………
English: Well...

Japanese: ゴニョゴニョ……
English: *whisper whisper*

Japanese:
なん…だとっ…！？
ぷるんぷるんの美女がやってきて
水をくれただと！？
English:
What!? You’re telling me some pretty big-breasted
chick gave you water?

Japanese: って…　ンなわきゃあるか！
English: Stop messing around!

Japanese: あかん　バレてもうたか
English: Ah-- guess the cat’s out of the bag now.

Japanese: バレるってーの！
English: Damn right it’s out!

Japanese:
はぁ～　メシも冷めちまうし
この話は　聞かなかったことにするぜ
English:
Sigh... Let’s just eat before it gets cold, and 
pretend like it never happened.

Japanese: それが一番やな
English: That’s fer the best.

Japanese: 暑いのに鍋
English: Hotpot in a Hotplace

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: 今日は漁師鍋…なんだね…
English: So we’re having fisherman’s hotpot today...

Japanese: あたし　今日はパス
English: No thanks, I’m not hungry.

Japanese: オレも
English: Pass.

Japanese: ウチもあかん
English: Ah can’t either.

Japanese:
みんな　食べないとダメよ
体に悪いわ
English:
No skipping out on meals, everyone!
That is unhealthy for you!

Japanese:
そういうアンジュだって
全然食べてないじゃん
English:
You’re saying that, but you’re not touching
your food either!

Japanese:
あら　私は冷めてから食べるつもりよ
だから　今は待ってるの
English:
Oh mine? I am merely waiting for my food to cool
down before eating it.

Japanese: じゃあ　あたしもそれで
English: Then I’ll do that too.

Japanese: オレもそうするぜ
English: Same.

Japanese:
もぐもぐもぐもぐ
ウマいなー　ウマいなー
English:
Slurp slurp! Tasty!
This is tasty though～!

Japanese: なぁ　コーダ　暑くないん？
English: Hey, Coda, ain’t it hot?

Japanese:
食べるのに　暑い寒いは関係ない
ウマいものはウマいんだな
English:
Heat, cold, it doesn’t matter when it comes to food.
Tasty is tasty.

Japanese: 幸せなヤツやなぁ
English: Happy fella.

Japanese:
しっかし　こんなクソ暑いところで
漁師鍋作ったやつ　誰だ？
普通　こんなところで作らねぇだろ
English:
That said, who the hell decided to make--of all things--
freakin’ fisherman’s hotpot in this damn place!?
You don’t normally cook that crap here!

Japanese:
暑いときに熱いものを食う
このよさは　ガキにはまだわからんか
English:
You’re supposed to eat something hot in a hot place.
To not understand such a simple thing, I suppose you
still have to grow.

Japanese:
……あなただったのか
リクエストしたの？
それとも　作ったの？
English:
...Are you the one who requested it?
Or did you make it yourself?

Japanese: いや　どっちでも良いか
English: No, that does not matter.

Japanese:
リカルドさん
あなた　これからは
暑くても熱いものだけ　口にしてよ
English:
Ricardo, from now on you will only 
have hot food when it is hot.

Japanese:
暑いときに　熱いものを食べる
……さぞ　おいしいんだろうね
English:
Eating hot food on a hot day...
Surely, you’d find that delicious...

Japanese:
ね…ねぇ…　コンウェイ怒ってない…？
さっきまで平気そうだったのに…
English:
H-Hey, doesn’t Kongwei look a bit... angry?
He seemed fine earlier though.

Japanese:
ああ…
涼しい顔してっけど　暑かったんだな…
English:
Yeah... He looked all refreshed, but the heat must
have gotten to him too.

Japanese: やっぱり……
English: I knew it...

Japanese: 暑いときには　冷たいもんやな
English: The cold stuff really does it on a hot day.

Japanese: 暑いときには冷たいもの
English: You Really Gotta Have Cold Stuff When It’s Hot

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

English: Ange

Japanese: スパーダ

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
バニラアイスか
今日みたいな日には　いいな
…少々　甘いのが気になるところだが
English:
Having vanilla ice cream on a day like this sure
is nice, although isn’t this a little too sweet?

Japanese: リカルド　食べないか？
English: Ricardo not eating?

Japanese: ほな　おっちゃんの分はウチがもらうで
English: Then Ah’ll have his portion!

Japanese: 待て　誰も食べないとは言っていない
English: Wait! I never said I wasn’t gonna eat it!

Japanese: えぇ～　おっちゃんケチやなぁ
English: Ehhh～ Stingy!

Japanese:
エル　残念だた
キュキュの分　少し食べる？
English:
What a shame, Hermie...
Want QQ’s portion?

Japanese:
ほんま？
ありがとうなぁ！
English:
Really?
Thanks, Sis QQ!

Japanese: ところで　このアイス　いつもよりおいしいね
English: Speaking of, this ice cream tastes better than usual.

Japanese:
ホント　サイッコー！
暑さが和らぐわ
English:
This is the best!
The heat ain’t so bad now.

Japanese:
イリア　そんなに急いで食べると　お腹壊すわ
もっと落ち着いて
English:
Illia, slow down!
You will get a bellyache if you eat too quickly!

Japanese:
大丈夫　大丈夫
あたし　おなかは結構強いほうだし
おかわり！
English:
My stomach’s pretty strong anyways, so it’s fine～
Seconds please!

Japanese: おー　コーダもおかわりだ！
English: Coda too!

Japanese:
イリア　すごい食べるね
はい　どうぞ
English:
Wow Illia, you sure can eat a lot!
Here you go!

Japanese: ありがと～ルカ！
English: Thank you～

Japanese: イリア？　どうかした…？
English: What’s wrong?

Japanese: お…お腹痛い……
English: My... My stomach hurts...

Japanese:
だ　大丈夫！？
医者…お医者さんを呼ばないと…！
English:
A-Are you alright!?
D-Doctor... We need to find a doctor!

Japanese:
おい　ルカ　落ち着けって
それより　薬があんだろ
English:
Can you calm down for a second?
We have some medicine for that.

Japanese:
あ…そうだった
イリア　はい
English:
Oh, right...
Here you go.

Japanese: イタタタタ…ありがと……
English: Owww... Thanks...

Japanese: 自業自得だな
English: We told you so.

Japanese:
イリア姉ちゃん
あの辺　暖かそうやし
座ったらええんとちゃう？
English:
Hey, Sis Illia, why dont’cha sit over there under
the shade fer a bit?

Japanese: うん…そうする……
English: A-Aight...

Japanese:
暑いところで冷たいものを食べる
贅沢だけど　少し考えものね
English:
While being able to eat cold food in a hot place is a
luxury, it can also be quite troublesome.

Japanese: イタタタタ…
English: Oww....

Japanese: 寒い熱い
English: Cold ’n Hot

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
寒いときに　温かいものを食べる
とても贅沢なことだね
English:
Being able to eat hot food in a cold place 
is quite the luxury.

Japanese:
ああ　まったくだ
しかし　今日のカレー鍋は特にうまい
English:
Indeed it is. 
That said, today’s curry hot pot is delicious!

Japanese:
やた！
今日のはよくできたと思てた
English:
Yay!
QQ did well today!

Japanese: でも……か　辛い…
English: But it’s somehow... spicy...

Japanese:
カレー鍋　辛いの当たり前
でも　体があたまる　違うか？
English:
Natural for curry hot pot to be spicy, but doesn’t it
make your body warmer?

Japanese:
うん
冷めないうちに　がんばって食べるよ
English:
Yes, it does.
I’ll do my best and eat it before it gets cold.

Japanese:
キュキュは　アツアツ食べてほしい
ダメか…？
English:
QQ want you to eat it really hot.
Can you...?

Japanese: そ…それはちょっと…
English: That is...

Japanese:
なんだ　コンウェイ
俺の顔になにか付いているのか？
English:
What is it, Kongwei?
Is there something on my face?

Japanese:
いや　あなたが褒めるなんて
珍しいと思ってね
なにかあったのかい？
English:
Nothing, I was just wondering what happened 
considering that it is so rare for you to give 
out compliments.

Japanese:
なに　食べられることの幸せと
このうまさを心の底から　味わっただけだ
English:
What? I’m merely savoring this blessing of being
able to eat such a delectable cuisine.

Japanese:
そう
ところで　あなた　おかわりはいいの？
エルとコーダが　すごい勢いで食べてるけど？
English:
I see. That said, are you not planning on 
getting another serving? Hermie and Coda 
might end up finishing it soon.

Japanese:
構わん　ガキに食わせておけ
そのほうが静かに食べられる
English:
Let them be. Kids like them deserve to eat as much
as they want. Besides, I can peacefully eat on my own.

Japanese: はは　確かに
English: Indeed...

Japanese: 寒い寒い
English: Cold ’n Cold

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

English: Ricardo

Japanese:
ね　ね　ね　ね　ねぇ……
なんで僕たち……こんな寒い中………
バニラアイスを　た　た　た食べてるのかな…？
English:
H-H-Hey... Wh-who o-on T-Terro d-decided th-that
it’s a gr-great id-dea to m-make v-v-vanilla i-ice
cr-cream in th-this c-cold p-place?

Japanese:
あ　あ　あああ…あたしに聞かないでよ…
誰かがリク…リクエストしたんでしょ…
English:
D-D-Don’t l-look a-a-at me...
Sssssome-one e-else mu-must’ve re-requested it...

Japanese:
こんな寒い中でバニラアイスとは…
あまりこういうことを言いたくはないが
空気は読んでもらいたいものだな
English:
V-Vanilla ice cream in a place like th-this?
I-I don’t say this o-often, but...
Can you please learn to read the room?

Japanese:
この寒さ……
早くなんとかしないと　凍えてしまいそうね…
English:
W-We need... to do something a-about th-this cold
b-before w-we freeze to death...

Japanese: い…い…　一体誰が作ったんや…？
English: Wh-Who made it...?

Japanese:
…この際　犯人探しはおいておいて
どうやって早く暖を取るか
考えることにしない？
English:
H-How a-about w-we l-look for th-them later a-and
f-find sssome p-place t-to warm up-p f-first...?

Japanese: さ　さ　さ…さんせーい…！　クシュ！
English: A-Agreeeed-d-d... A-Achoo!

Japanese:
あ…あかん！
スパーダ兄ちゃんがカッチカチに…！
English:
O-Oh no!
S-Spada Brrro’s h-hard as ice!

Japanese: なってねぇよ！
English: I’m not!

Japanese: バカなコト言ってねぇで　先に進むぞ！
English: Stop messing around, let’s just go on ahead!

Japanese: スパーダ以外
English: Everyone but Spada

Japanese: はーい
English: Okay...

Japanese: うぐっ！？
