Japanese:
みんなお待たせ！
サンドウィッチが　できたわよー！
English:
Thanks for waiting, guys!
Sandwiches are done!

Japanese: おっ　うまそうだな
English: Oh! Looks tasty!

Japanese: 全員
English: Everyone

Speakers:
0 [イリア]
1 [スパーダ]
2 [コーダ]
3 [コンウェイ]
4 [ルカ]
Japanese: いただきます
English: Bon appetit!

Japanese:
もぐもぐもぐ…　ウマい　ウマいぞ
イリアの作るヤツは　最高だ
English:
Hmmmm... this is tasty! Really tasty!
Illia’s the best cook!

Japanese:
コーダ　そんなふうにガッついてると
ノドに詰まらせちゃうよ？
English:
Coda, slow down!
You might end up choking on that!

Japanese:
大丈夫なんだな
もぐもぐもぐもぐもぐ……
English:
It’s fine.
munch munch munch

Japanese: んぐっ！？
コーダ…？
English: Coda?

Japanese: あれ？　もしかして……
English: Oh dear, is he...?
W-Water...

Japanese:
コーダ！　み　水！？　水どこ！？
イリア…！
English:
Coda! W-Water!
Wh-Where’s the water!? Illia...!

Japanese: はい
English: Here.

Japanese: コーダ…！
English: Hurry, drink this!

Japanese: んぐ…んぐ………
English: Gulp, gulp, gulp...

Japanese: ぷはっ！
English: Pwah...

Japanese: ふぅ……
English: Haaah...

Japanese: 死ぬかと思った
English: Coda thought he was gonna die...

Japanese: ルカ　感謝するぞ　しかし
English: Thank you, Ruca.

Japanese:
どういたしまして
コンウェイさんも　ありがとう
English:
No problem!
Thanks, Kongwei!

Japanese:
それにしても　三人ともすごいね
今ので慌てないなんて
English:
That said, you three sure are amazing for staying
so calm while that happened!

Japanese:
こういうときは
落ち着いて対処するのが一番だからね
English: It is best to stay calm during these types of situations.

Japanese:
こいつなら　いつかやると思ってたし
すげェって　言われてもなぁ…
English:
This was bound to happen eventually,
so impressive is a bit...

Japanese:
そうそう
コイツが　食べ物をノドに詰まらせるなんて
いつものコト
English:
Yeah, this guy always chokes on his food so you’re
bound to get used to it.

Japanese:
毎回　慌ててたら
こっちの身がもたないっての
English:
Coda would be dead if I always panicked
whenever something like this happened.

Japanese: そ…　そうなんだ…
English: O-Oh...

Japanese: もぐもぐもぐもぐもぐもぐ…
English: It’s fine. munch munch munch

Japanese: うぐっ！？
み…水！　水だ　しかし～～～！
English: W-Water!!!!

Japanese: ステーキ違い
English: This isn’t Steak!

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
うっわ　すっごいイイ匂い♪
ルカー　今日のご飯なに？
English:
Oooh! What a nice smell!
What’s for dinner, Ruca?

Japanese: ステーキだよ
English: It’s steak.

Japanese:
やった！
あたしステーキ大好きなのよね～
ガンガン食べるから　早くちょうだい！
English:
Yay! I really love steak, so hurry up and 
gimme so I can dig in!

Japanese: うん　はい
English: Alright, here you go.

Japanese: いただきまーす！
English: Bon Appetit!

Japanese:
って……ルカ　なにこれ？
なんか白いんだけど……
English:
...Ruca, what is this?
Why the hell is it white?

Japanese: なにって　トウフのステーキだよ
English: Hm? It’s Tofu Steak.

Japanese: はぁ！？　トウフ！？
English: TOFU!?

Japanese:
あんたねぇ…
ステーキといったら　肉が常識でしょ！！
それなのにトウフ？　ナメてんの！？
English:
Look here, by steak I mean MEAT STEAK, 
not... whatever THIS is!
ARE YOU MAKING FUN OF ME!?

Japanese: そ　そそそそんなことはないよ！
English: N-N-N-N-No I wasn’t!

Japanese:
で…でも肉って言ったら
ダイズは畑の肉って言うし…
English:
B-But as they say... soybeans are the 
meat of the field--

Japanese:
はぁ！？
トウフもダイズも　ビーフじゃないでしょ！
English:
Meat of the field!?
They ain’t MEAT!

Japanese:
いい？　あたしがステーキって言ったら
今後はビーフのことだと思いなさい
いいわね！
English:
Listen, from now on when I say STEAK, I mean
BEEF steak.
Understand!?

Japanese: う…うん…
English: Y-Yeah...

Japanese:
あーあ…　期待して損しちゃった
……もぐ
English: Sigh... you got my hopes up.

Japanese: ……おいしい
English: ...Tasty.

Japanese:
ビーフステーキには劣るけど
これはこれで　おいしいじゃない
English:
Of course beef steak’s still superior,
but this isn’t bad at all.

Japanese: たまにならトウフステーキもいいかも
English: I guess Tofu Steak’s nice once in a while.

Japanese: {fixed}（ほっ…　良かった…）
English: (Sigh... thank Cielo...)

Japanese: 辛いのは苦手！
English: Weak Against Spicy Food

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: いっただっきま～す♪
English: Time to dig in!

Japanese: もぐもぐ…
English: Hmm～

Japanese:
ん～～～　おいしい！
この辛さが　たまらないのよね～
English:
Delicious!
This spiciness is out of this world!

Japanese: あれ？　ルカ　食べないの？
English: ...Hm? Ruca, aren’t you gonna eat?

Japanese: ううん　食べるよ　いただきます
English: I will... bon appetit...
gulp...

Japanese: か…からい…
English: Sp-spicy...

Japanese: …あんた　もしかして　辛いの苦手？
English: Are you... weak against spicy food?

Japanese:
うん…
おいしいのはわかるんだけど
どうしても辛いものは……
English:
Yeah... I know that it can be tasty,
but spicy food is just...

Japanese: ふーん…
English: I see...

Japanese:
あら～？　こんなところに何故か
辛さ１００倍ビックリ{fixed}☆{variable}スパイスが～
English:
Oooh! Look what we have here～!
It’s a spice that is 100 times hotter～!

Japanese: エイっ！
English: Take that!

Japanese: あぁ！　なにするの！？
English: What are you--!? Why?!

Japanese:
もっと辛いの食べたら
平気になるかなって思って♪
English:
I figured that you’d grow used to it if I made you
eat something way spicier～♪

Japanese: ならないよ……
English: It won’t...

Japanese: じゃあ　ルカ　頑張って食べてね
English: Now, now, try and enjoy it, Ruca!

Japanese: うぅ…辛い………
English: Ugh... Spicy...

Japanese: やきそばパンの思い出
English: Memories of Yakisoba Sandwich

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
やきそばパンかぁ
前に　エディとニーノに　罰ゲームで
買いに行かされたことがあったなぁ
English:
A Yakisoba Sandwich, huh...
I remember Eddie and Nino making me buy them
one time as a penalty game.

Japanese:
あぁん？
ルカ　お前　そんなことしてたのか？
English:
Hm?
Did they now?

Japanese:
うん　他にもミルクとか
あんぱんとか　買いに行ったこともあるよ
English:
Yep, and even more.
They made me buy other stuff, like milk and bread rolls.

Japanese:
よく買いに行ってたから
お店の人と　仲良くなっちゃって
オマケしてもらったこともあるんだ♪
English:
They made me buy them stuff from the store so often
that I ended up becoming friends with the shop owner,
to the point that I even got some free stuff from him!

Japanese: まっ　お前って勝負事に弱そうだしな
English: Well, you don’t look like you’re good at games.

Japanese:
ちなみに　オレはその逆だ
買いに行かせたコトしかねェ
English:
By the way, I’m the opposite. I’d never send you off
to buy something for me.

Japanese:
だろうね
僕も１度でいいから　買いにいってもらいたいよ
English:
I guess so. At the very least, I’d want to make
them buy me something at least once.

Japanese:
ンなの　簡単だろ？
ちょっとシメちまえば…
English: Well that’s easy, if we just--

Japanese:
だ…ダメだよ　そんなの…！
勝負で勝たなきゃ…！
English:
N-No, let’s not do that!
I want to win it fairly...!

Japanese: んじゃ　当分はムリだな
English: Then I guess it’s impossible for now.

Japanese: うぅ…　やっぱりそう思うんだね…
English: Awww... I guess it is...

Japanese: なんでサラダ？
English: Why Salad?

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: ねぇ　ルカ　今日のご飯なんだけど…
English: Hey, Ruca, about today’s lunch...

Japanese:
あっ　わかる？
僕　サラダ作るの得意なんだ！
English:
Oh, did you know?
I’m very good at making salad.

Japanese:
違うわよ！
なぁんで　ご飯がサラダだけなのよ？
ショボくない？　しかも　苦いし！
English:
NO! Why are we only having salad today!?
Don’t you think that’s depressing?
It’s bitter to boot!

Japanese: 肉は？　肉はないの？　肉っ！
English: Meat? Is there any meat? MEAT!

Japanese:
今日はサッパリと　サラダがいいかな
って　思って作ってみたんだけど
嫌いだったんだね…　ごめん……
English:
I figured that today would be perfect for some simple
salad, so I decided to make one. I didn’t know you
would hate it, sorry about that...

Japanese: 次からは　ちゃんと頼むわよ？
English: Next time, please do it the right way, aight?

Japanese: でないと　アンタを食べてやるんだから！
English: Or else I’ll eat you instead!

Japanese: えぇ！？
English: M-Me!?

Japanese: なに驚いてんのよ　冗談だってば
English:
What are you being surprised about?
I was just messing with you.

Japanese: それに　アンタがちゃんと作ればいいコトだし♪
English: Besides, I know you’ll make it right next time.

Japanese: 絶品サンドウィッチ
English: Superb Sandwich

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
ぬふぬふ～
イリアのサンドウィッチ　ウマかったぞ！
English:
Mufufufu～!
Illia, your sandwich was really delicious!

Japanese:
ああ　タマゴの味付けが　バツグンだったな
店で売ってるヤツよりも　うまかったぜ
English:
Yeah, it had just the right amount of seasoning.
This is way more tasty than the ones they
sell at a store.

Japanese:
うん
これなら　毎日でも食べられそうだよね！
English: I could eat this forever!

Japanese:
それなら　あたしが作るときは
ずっとサンドウィッチでも良い？
作るのスッゴイ簡単だし！
English:
Then how about I do the cooking from now on? 
I’ll make you guys my special sandwich every day.

Japanese:
サンドウィッチ好きな
オレとしては　嬉しいけどよ
毎日は……　なぁ　ルカ？
English:
Uhh, sure I love sandwiches and all, and offering to
make it is nice, but every day is a bit much...
Right, Ruca?

Japanese:
う…うん…
ずっとサンドウィッチだと　飽きちゃうし……
English:
Y-Yeah... I think I’d get sick if we always had
sandwiches...

Japanese: あっ　でも　おいしいのは本当だよ！
English: but your sandwich really was delicious!

Japanese:
しかし　コーダは食べられれば
なんでも良いんだな
English:
Coda doesn’t care what you cook as long as Coda
can eat it though.

Japanese:
んもう！　どっちなのよ！
さっき毎日でも食べられそうって
言ってたじゃない！
English:
You said you can eat it every day and now you’re
saying you can’t! Which is it!?

Japanese: それは褒め言葉であって……
English: I was just praising you...

Japanese:
なに？　それじゃあ
あたしの料理は　毎日食べられないって？
English:
What, so does that mean? You don’t want to eat my
cooking every day!?

Japanese:
えっと…イリアは　僕が料理するときは
ずっと　おにぎりでも良い？
English:
Let’s put it this way, would you like it if I always
made rice balls every time I cooked?

Japanese: イヤ！　肉なら全然ＯＫだけどね！
English:
NO!
Though, I wouldn’t mind if you always cooked meat.

Japanese: …僕たちも同じ気持ちだよ
English: Well, that’s what we felt.

Japanese:
うーん…　仕方ないわねぇ…
じゃあ　毎日サンドウィッチはやめる
English:
Sigh... Guess that’s just how it is.
Fine, I won’t make you guys sandwiches every time.

Japanese: でも　２回に１回くらいならいいわよね！
English: But maybe once every two times I cook is fine!

Japanese: ご機嫌なイリア
English: Cheery Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: この匂い…
English: This smell...

Japanese: もしかして　今日はステーキ…？
English: Are we having steak today?

Japanese: うん　今　できたところだよ
English: Mhm～ I just finished cooking it.

Japanese:
ラッキー！
あたしこれ大好きなのよ！
いっただっきま～す♪
English:
Yay! You remembered how much I love steak, 
didn’t you? Thank you for the food～♪

Japanese: もぐもぐ………
English: Nom nom nom...

Japanese:
おいしい～～！
焼き加減　スッゴイいいわ
これなら　毎日作ってもらいたいくらいよ
English:
Hmmmm～ Tasty!
It’s cooked just right! 
I wish I could eat this every day!

Japanese: そうかな…　えへへ…
English: Really?

Japanese:
あっ　おかわりちょうだい
もちろん　一番大きいヤツを！
English:
Yeah! Seconds please!
Gimme the biggest one!

Japanese: うん！
English: Here you go!

Japanese: 作るのは得意でも
English: Even if you’re good at it

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: はぁ～……
English: Sigh...

Japanese:
あら　ため息なんて珍しい
どうしたの？
English:
Oh my, that is quite rare coming from you, Illia.
What is the matter?

Japanese:
野菜ジュースを作ったんだけど
正直　あたしコレ好きじゃないのよねー…
English:
Well, I made vegetable juice, but to be honest...
I don’t really like it.

Japanese: でも　作るのは得意じゃ？
English: Despite being so good at making it?

Japanese:
まぁ　絞るだけだし
でも　味はねぇー…
English:
I mean, I strangled it good, but... 
The taste is...

Japanese: そういうこと
English: I see.

Japanese: でも　作ったなら　最後まで食べないとダメよ
English:
However you cannot just leave something you
made uneaten.

Japanese: うげっ…
English: Blegh...

Japanese:
ムリ
アンジュ　あたしの分あげる
English: Ange, I can’t... You can just have mine.

Japanese:
そんなこと言わずに
１口だけ飲んでみましょう？
English: Now do not say that, let us just take a sip, okay?

Japanese:
これ飲んだら　しばらくご飯はないし
今　飲んでおかないと
あとでおなかすいちゃうわ
English:
Best you drink it now. It will be a while before
our next meal. Otherwise, you will be hungry later.

Japanese:
それはヤバイ…
うぅ～……　……わかった
English: Sheesh... Fine, alright...

Japanese: 飲む…
English: Gulp...

Japanese: はい
English: Here.

Japanese: {fixed}（すごい顔…　よっぽど苦手なのね……）
English: (What a face, she must really hate it, huh...)

Japanese: あ～もう！　負けてらんないっての！！
English: DAMMIT! I’m not gonna lose to this...!

Japanese: ゴクゴクゴク…！
English: Gulp, gulp, gulp...!

Japanese: あああ～～～苦っ！！！
English: Puhhaaaaah!!!!

Japanese: 全力拒否
English: Refuse With All Your Might

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: ふぅ…
English: Fuu...

Japanese:
あんた　よくそんなモン飲んで
幸せそうな顔できるわね…
English:
Whoa, how on Terro can you look so happy
after drinking this crap?

Japanese:
そう？　結構　おいしいよ
キミも　もう１杯どう？
English:
Hm? It is quite tasty you know.
Would you like to have another glass?

Japanese:
お断り！
やっと飲み終えたってのに
また飲むとかありえない
English:
PASS! I already finished one, 
no way am I gonna drink another.

Japanese:
全力で拒否しなくても…
この苦いのが良いのに
English:
You did not have to refuse so vehemently;
this bitterness is good for you.

Japanese:
どこがよ
ただ　マズイだけだっての
English:
How?
It’s just disgusting!

Japanese:
でも体に良いよ
そう思ったら　飲める気がしない？
English:
I assure you, it IS beneficial to your health.
knowing that, would you still refuse to drink it?

Japanese: しない
English: Damn right!

Japanese: それは残念
English: What a shame...

Japanese: でも　いずれ　この良さがわかる日が来るよ
English:
I am sure that one day you will come to 
appreciate its benefits.

Japanese: そんな日は来ないと思うわ
English: Yeahhh... No. I won’t.

Japanese:
拒否してばかりだね
ボクの声は　届かないみたいだ
悲しいね
English:
...And yet again, you adamantly refuse.
It’s as if my voice falls on deaf ears.
I am disheartened.

Japanese:
勧められているのが
野菜ジュースじゃなかったら
届いたかもしれないわね
English:
Here’s my advice: Try convincing me with something
other than vegetable juice and I MIGHT hear you out.

Japanese:
キミがどれだけ野菜ジュースが嫌いか
よくわかったよ
English:
I understand exactly how much you hate
vegetable juice.

Japanese: ところで　キミにお願いがあるんだ
English: That said,

Japanese: 聞いてくれる？
English: can you do me a favor?

Japanese:
なによ
飲めって言うんじゃなきゃ　いいわよ
English:
What is it? I’m fine with anything,
as long as it’s not drinking this vomit-water.

Japanese:
キミの作る野菜ジュース　ボクに合うみたいだ
だから　たまにで良いから作ってくれないか？
English:
I have taken a liking to your vegetable juice, so I was 
hoping that you would make it once in a while.

Japanese: うげっ…
English: Blegh...

Japanese:
あんた　さっきあたしが
どんだけ嫌いかわかったって
言ってたのに　そんなこと言う…
English:
You just said earlier that you know 
how much I hate vegetable juice, and now you 
ask me this...

Japanese:
キミが作ると美味しいんだ
他の誰でもない　キミが良いんだ
English:
The vegetable juice you make is delicious.
So I want you specifically to make it, not anyone else.

Japanese: ま…まぁ　そこまで言うなら…
English: W-Well... if you insist...

Japanese: って　乗せたってダメ
English: SIKE-- hell no!

Japanese:
それじゃあ　キミが作っても良い
という日が来るまで　気長に待っているよ
English:
Then I shall wait patiently for that day to come,
no matter how long it takes.

Japanese: 幸せ野菜ジュース
English: Happy Vegetable Juice

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
まさか　本当にこんな日が来るなんてね
ボクは幸せだよ
ありがとう　イリアさん
English:
To think that the day finally came...
Thank you, Illia. I am elated from 
the bottom of my heart.

Japanese:
なんで…　なんで…
あたし　こんなモン作ってんのよ…
English: Why... Why did you ask me to make that...?

Japanese:
こんなモノだなんて…
キミの作る野菜ジュースは　天下一品だよ
ボクが保証しても良い
English:
Why? Well, it is because the vegetable juice that
you make is the best in the world. I guarantee that.

Japanese:
あんたに保証されたって
あたしの前にある　コイツはなくならないのよ！
English:
Your guarantees won’t make this piss-water 
in front of me go away!

Japanese:
まぁまぁ
ほら　これを飲んで落ち着いて
English: Well, well, calm down and drink this.

Japanese: うん…
English: Fine...

Japanese: って　なに飲まそうとしてんのよ！
English: Wait, why the hell are you making me drink this!?

Japanese: バレちゃったか
English: You caught me.

Japanese:
バレちゃったか
じゃないわよ　もう…
English:
Damn right I caught you!
...Crap.

Japanese: あー…　ホント　これどうしよう…
English: Ughh... what do I do with this now?

Japanese: ボクは　もう１杯いただこうかな
English: Hmm... perhaps I should get another glass.

Japanese:
ねぇ～　コンウェイ
あんた　野菜ジュース好きよね？
あたしの分…飲む？
English:
Hey～ You like vegetable juice, right?
Want to have mine?

Japanese:
悪いけど　ボクは
人の分を取るようなマネはしないよ
English:
My apologies, but I am not the type of person
to take another’s portion.

Japanese: チッ…
English: Tch...

Japanese: ゴクゴク…
English: Gulp, gulp...

Japanese: うん　おいしい
English: Hmmm... Tasty～

Japanese:
うーあー…
コレ　どうしよ…
English: Ugh... what do I do...?

Japanese: 絞りカスは
English: Squeezed Pulps

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
たくさん　絞ったぁ
でも　この絞りカス…勿体ないわねぇ
English:
I sure wrung out a lot of juice.
Still, these leftover rind seems like a waste.

Japanese: ぬふぬふ
English: Mufufufu～!

Japanese: イリア　今日のメシはなんだ？
English: What’s for dinner, Illia?

Japanese: コーダ　フルーツ食べる？
English: Coda, do you eat fruits?

Japanese:
おぉ　食べるぞ！
今日はいつになく　優しいな　しかし！
English:
Yes, Coda does!
You’re unexpectedly kind today though.

Japanese:
なに言ってんの
優しいのは　いつものことでしょ
English:
What are you talking about?
I’ve always been kind, remember?

Japanese: はい
English: Here.

Japanese: イリア　これはなんだ？
English: What’s this, Illia?

Japanese: なにって　フルーツ…の絞りカス
English:
What do you mean “what?”
These are fruit... leftover rind... yeah...

Japanese:
ケチくさいぞ
コーダは絞る前のが　食べたいんだな
English:
You’re so stingy!
Coda wants to eat fruit before it’s squeezed.

Japanese:
贅沢
絞りカス　捨てるの勿体ないし
ちゃんと食べてよね
English:
Well since we have a lot left, I figured it’d be a waste
to throw it away.
Make sure to eat it all, okay?

Japanese: イリアのケチ！
English: Illia, you meanie!

Japanese:
ぬふぬふぬふ
苦い　苦いぞ　苦いんだな　しかし！
English:
Boohoo... Bitter...
It’s really bitter though!

Japanese: 大人の特権
English: An Adult’s Privilege

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
コンウェイ　おまえの皿には
パスタしか乗っていないように見えるのは
気のせいか？
English:
Kongwei, am I just imagining things or is your
plate filled with nothing but pasta?

Japanese:
気のせいではないね
あなたの言う通り　パスタしか乗せてないよ
English:
You are certainly not, as you said, my plate only
contains pasta.

Japanese: ほぅ　トマトが苦手か
English: Oho, you hate tomatoes?

Japanese: ん　その通り
English: More or less.

Japanese:
しかし　パスタだけ食べたとしても
トマトと和えているから　少なからず
味がするとは思うが　それは平気なのか？
English:
You’ll still be able to taste the tomatoes
even if you only eat the pasta.
Are you fine with that?

Japanese:
多少はね
あくまでも　許容の範囲さ
English: A miniscule amount, I will simply endure it till the end.

Japanese:
なるほど
だが　好き嫌いするのは良くない
でかくはなれんぞ
English:
I see, but you do know that you won’t grow if
you’re picky with your food, right?

Japanese:
イヤだな
子ども扱いしないでくれよ
English: Dear me, do you take me for some sort of child?

Japanese:
それに　あなただって
嫌いなもの　ひとつくらいあるでしょう？
English: Besides, even you have certain foods you hate, correct?

Japanese:
大人とはそういうものだ
悪く思うな
English:
Don’t think of it too badly, that just comes with
being an adult.

Japanese: ズルいね
English: How unfair.

Japanese:
でも　ボクも大人だからね
大人の特権を使わせてもらうよ
English:
At the very least allow me exercise my adult privileges.
I am one, after all.

Japanese: ズルいな
English: Now that’s unfair.

Japanese:
ふふっ
それが「大人」なんだろ？
English: Hoho, that is just being an adult, is it not?

Japanese: ふっ　これは一本取られた
English: Touche.

Japanese: 奪われた肉
English: Stolen Meat

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
今日はハンバーガーか
いただきま……
English:
So we are having hamburgers today, huh?
Bon appe--

Japanese:
ねぇ　イリアさん
ハンバーガーは好きだよね？
良かったら　トマト　食べてくれない？
English:
Hey Illia, you like hamburgers, right?
If you would like, would you like to have my tomato?

Japanese: いいわよ
English: Sure.

Japanese:
ありがとう
はい
English: Thank you, here.

Japanese: いっただき～♪
English: Time to dig in～♪

Japanese: 待って　イリアさん
English: Wait a moment.

Japanese:
ボク　トマトだけ
お願いしたつもりでいたんだけど
なぜ　肉もなくなっているのかな？
English:
I only told you to take the tomato,
why is my patty also gone?

Japanese:
あら～　そうだったかしら？
オホホホホホ～
English:
Ohhhh, so you only wanted me to take the tomato?
I guess my hand slipped haha～

Japanese: あっ
English: Ah--!

Japanese:
もう　イリアったら…
あとで少し話をしないとダメみたいね
English:
Oh Illia...
I suppose I shall have to give her a good lecture later.

Japanese: イリア用に　多めに肉を用意しておいたのに
English: And I even prepared extra meat for her...

Japanese: どうやら　話は必要なさそうね
English: Perhaps that sermon is no longer necessary.

Japanese: もうしませ～～～ん！！
English: I’m sorry!

Japanese: ホットチョコレートの魔力
English: The Magical Power of Hot Chocolate

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese:
はぁ～～～…　幸せ…
このいっぱいのために生きてる～～
ってカンジだわ
English:
Ahh～ I’m in Cielo～!
I feel like my life’s been leading up this moment.

Japanese: 大げさだな
English: You act like it’s a big deal,

Japanese:
けど　そう言われると
確かにそんな気になってくるな
English:
but yeah, it does kind of
feel like that.

Japanese: 甘いなー　ウマいなー
English: Sweet～ Tasty～!

Japanese:
なんだか　ホットチョコレートって
不思議な飲み物だね
English:
In a way, hot chocolate is a mysterious 
beverage in and of itself.

Japanese:
体だけじゃなく
心まであたためてくれるなんてさ
English: It not only warms your body, but also your heart.

Japanese:
あんた…
今　恥ずかしいことサラっと言ったわね
English:
You... How can you say something 
so embarrassing that easily?

Japanese:
ああ　言ったな
聞いてるコッチが恥ずかしいぜ
まったく
English: Yeah, he did. Gosh, just hearing that makes me cringe.

Japanese: 恥ずかしいぞ　しかし！
English: It’s embarrassing though!

Japanese: えぇ…！？
English: Huh!?

Japanese: そんなに恥ずかしくないと思うけど…
English: But... I don’t think that was embarrassing.

Japanese:
カーッ…
わかってねぇのか
English: ...You don’t get it, do you?

Japanese: まっ　あんたは純粋だしねぇ
English: Well, you’re a pretty innocent guy, aren’t you?

Japanese:
そうだった　そうだった
恥ずかしい言葉も言えちゃう
ルカくんは　純粋だったなぁ～！
English:
Oh sure, there’s NOOOO way our pure, innocent 
Ruca could ever embarrass himself, right～

Japanese:
そ…そんなことより　３人ともおかわりは？
早く飲まないと冷めちゃ…
English:
A-Anyways, do you guys want refills?
It’s going to get cold soon...

Japanese: ３人
English: Three of them

Japanese: いる！！
English: Please!

Japanese: はい
English: Here you go.

Japanese: はぁ～…　おいしい～　生き返る～～
English: Mmmm... so good～ I’m coming back to life.

Japanese: この絶妙な甘さが　たまんねぇ～
English: The sweetness never stops!

Japanese: 鍋ごといけるな　しかし
English: There’s still some in the pot though.

Japanese:
{fixed}（ホッ…
　やっと静かになった）
English: (Ahhh... Finally some peace and quiet.)

Japanese:
{fixed}（それにしても
　ホットチョコレートって
　すごい力を秘めてるなぁ）
English:
(Still, to think that hot chocolate is hiding such
an incredible power within it...)

Japanese:
{fixed}（こんなふうに
　心が穏やかになるなんて久しぶりだよ！）
English: (It’s been a while since I’ve felt so at peace...)

Japanese: リカルドのおにぎり
English: Ricardo’s Rice Balls

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
みんな　ご飯よ
手を洗ったらこっちに来てね
English:
Lunch time!
Wash your hands everyone, and head over here.

Japanese: おっ　今日の当番はアンジュか
English: Oh, looks like it’s Ange’s turn today.

Japanese:
ううん　私は手伝っただけ
今日はリカルドさんが作ったの
English:
Not today, I am merely offering a hand.
Sir Ricardo is the one in charge.

Japanese:
ということは　このおにぎりは
おっさんが握ったってことか……
English: So basically, the old man made these rice balls, huh...?

Japanese: なにか問題でもあるのか？
English: Got a problem with that?

Japanese: いや…
English: No...

Japanese:
安心しろ
直接手には触れないように包んで握っている
無論　手も洗っている
English:
Rest assured, I wrapped it so it didn’t touch my
hands directly. Of course, I also made sure to wash
my hands before preparing it.

Japanese: あ…ああ…　わかった
English: Ahh... okay...

Japanese:
それにしても　お前がそういうところを
気にするとは　意外だな
English:
Still, it’s quite surprising that you’d be worried
about something like that.

Japanese:
ええ
でも　食の安全に気を遣うのは
とても良いことですよ
English:
Indeed, although it is good to be cautious
about what you eat.

Japanese: ああ　旅をする上では特にな
English: Especially when you’re traveling.

Japanese:
{fixed}（スゲェ勘違いされてるみてェだけど…
　まぁいっか）
English:
(Looks like these two misunderstood big time,
but eh, whatever.)

Japanese: 好物はシーフードパスタ
English: My Favorite Food is Seafood Pasta

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ　おかわりくれ
English: Ruca, gimme some more.

Japanese: うん　いいよ
English: Sure, here you go.

Japanese:
それにしても　珍しいね
スパーダが　こんなにおかわりするなんて
English: That’s pretty rare of you to ask for seconds though.

Japanese: いつもなら　もう食べ終わって休んでいるよね
English:
Normally, you would immediately leave when you
finished your plate.

Japanese:
結構好きなんだよ　シーフードパスタ
家に居るときも　おかわりしまくって
兄貴たちの分　食い尽くして　怒られたっけ
English:
Seafood Pasta’s my favorite, you know.
Even back home I’d ask for more, to the extent that
my brothers got pissed at me for eating their portions.

Japanese: あはは…　よっぽど好きなんだね
English: Hahaha, looks like you really like it then.

Japanese:
うらやましい…
そんなに食べても細いなんて…
English:
I am envious. How can you eat that much while
still being so slim...?

Japanese:
食べた分　消費すれば良いだけのことだ
無論　運動でな
English:
It’s obviously because he’s exercising enough 
to burn off the calories he intakes.

Japanese: うぅ……
English: Aww...

Japanese:
なぁルカ　もう少しもらえるか？
まだ　残ってたらで良いんだけどよ…
English:
Hey Ruca, mind giving me more?
Only if there’s still some left though.

Japanese: 俺にも　もらえるか？
English: Can I have some too?

Japanese: うん　はい
English: Okay, here you go.

Japanese: ねぇ　ルカくん　私にも…
English: Ruca, can I have some more too...?

Japanese: うぅ…　そんな目で見ないで…
English: Now do not look at me like that...

Japanese:
まぁ…　今日くらいはいいんじゃね？
こんだけ　うまいんだしな
食いたい気持ちは　よくわかる
English:
Well, why not just for today?
I know how it feels to want to eat something.

Japanese:
そうよね！
ありがとう　スパーダくん
English:
Yes!
Thank you, Spada!

Japanese: じゃあ　ルカくん　おかわりお願い
English: Now, Ruca, can I have some more, please?

Japanese: あっ　少し多めでね
English: Oh, add a little bit more...

Japanese: 勿体ないは魔法の言葉
English: Leftovers is the Magic Word!

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
今日の炊きこみご飯　サイコー！
アンジュ　また作ってよね！
English:
Today’s Mixed Rice sure was delicious!
Hey, Ange, would you mind making some more?

Japanese:
ふふっ　ありがとう
そう言ってもらえると　作った甲斐があったわ
English: Thank you, making it was worthwhile.

Japanese:
あれ？　ご飯が結構あまってるね
どうするの？
English:
Huh, there’s still some leftover rice left.
What should we do with it?

Japanese:
うーん
明日にまわしたいんだけど
傷んじゃうからなぁ…
English:
Hmm... I would like to use it tomorrow, but I wonder 
if it will spoil by then...

Japanese:
だったら　食べちゃったら？
ボクはおなかいっぱいだからムリだけど
English:
Then how about you eat it?
I am already full so I cannot eat more.

Japanese:
そうだね
コーダやスパーダなら　まだいけると……
English:
Yeah, I was thinking that maybe Spada and Coda
might be able to...

Japanese:
そうね
それなら勿体ないし　私がいただくわ
English:
You are correct, I might as well since it would be a
waste otherwise.

Japanese: …アンジュ　確か３杯くらい食べてたよね？
English:
Ange... if I recall correctly, you just ate 3 cups
of rice, right?

Japanese: ハズレ　５杯だよ
English: Wrong, she ate 5.

Japanese: まだいけるんだ…
English: How can you still...

Japanese: まさに底なしの胃袋ね
English: As expected from the lady with the bottomless stomach.

Japanese: プラスマイナスゼロ
English: Coming Out Even

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
今日はからあげポテトなのね
うーん　どうしよう…
English:
So we are having Fried Chicken and Fries today...
What should I do...?

Japanese: ねぇルカくん　半分食べない？
English: Hey, Ruca, can you have half of my plate?

Japanese:
あれ？
からあげポテトは好きじゃなかった？
English:
Huh?
I thought you liked fried chicken and fries?

Japanese: ううん　好きよ　とても
English: Yes, I do. In fact, I like it very much...

Japanese:
でも　油で揚げているし
こんなにたくさん食べたら　あとが大変だもの
English:
But would it not be unhealthy if 
I ate so much deep-fried food?

Japanese: あとが大変…？
English: Unhealthy?

Japanese: もしかして　乙女の問題？
English: Oh, is this what people call a lady’s problem?

Japanese: ええ　そういうこと
English: Yes, it is as you say.

Japanese:
うーん　しっかり食べない方が
体に悪い気がするんだけどなぁ
English: It’s bad for your body if you don’t eat enough.

Japanese: 食べすぎも体に悪いわ
English: Eating too much would be bad too.

Japanese: なんか違う気もするけど　いただくね
English:
I don’t know if we’re talking about the same thing,
sure.

Japanese: ふふ　ありがとう
English: Thank you.

Japanese:
油ものを控えるのも良いけど
食後の甘いものも控えないとね？
English:
While holding back on fried food is good for you,
you should hold back from eating sweets too.

Japanese: 痛いトコつくなぁ
English: That hit harder than I expected...

Japanese:
でも　いつもより
食べる量を抑えてるから大丈夫よ　きっと！
English:
Still! As long as I watch how much I am eating,
everything should be good.

Japanese: それじゃプラスマイナスゼロだよ
English: That’s what people call coming out even.

Japanese: うぅ…
English: Ugh...

Japanese: おかわりするアンジュ
English: Another Helping, Ange!

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ルカくん　おかわりお願いできる？
あっ　出来ればお肉はよけてもらえる？
English:
Ruca, can you give me more? Oh, if you don’t mind, 
can you also leave out the meat?

Japanese: うん　……はい
English: Alright, here you go.

Japanese:
ありがとう
ルカくんの作ったクリームシチュー
本当においしい　何杯でも食べられるわ
English:
Thank you! Your Cream Stew really is the best, Ruca!
I can eat this forever!

Japanese:
アンジュの口に合ったなら　なによりだよ
まだおかわりあるから　欲しくなったら言ってね
English:
I’m glad you liked it!
Feel free to ask for more, since I made a lot.

Japanese:
ええ
それじゃあ　お言葉に甘えて…
English: Well, since you offered...

Japanese: おかわりをいただける？
English: May I have some more?

Japanese: うん　……はい
English: Okay, here.

Japanese:
やっぱりシチューはいいわね
体があたたまるし　野菜もたくさんとれるし
また今度　作ってね
English:
Mmmm, Cream Stew really is the best～
It has plenty of vegetables and also warms 
the body. Can you please make this again?

Japanese: もちろんだよ
English: Of course I will.

Japanese: 楽しみにしているわ
English: I cannot wait!

Japanese: あっ　もう１杯おかわりいただける？
English: Oh, can I have another serving, please?

Japanese:
うん　いいけど…でも　大丈夫？
これで４杯……
English:
Sure you can, but are you sure?
You’ve already had 4 servings...

Japanese: ルカくん　おかわりいただける？
English: Can I have another serving, please?

Japanese: う…うん…
English: O-Okay...

Japanese: ありがとう
English: Thank you.

Japanese: {fixed}（あんなに食べて大丈夫なのかなぁ…？）
English: (Is it alright to let her eat that much...?)

Japanese: リカルドの熱い想い
English: Ricardo’s Passion

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
うまい…
やはり　シンプルなのが一番だな
English: Delicious... In the end, simple is best.

Japanese: リカルドさんって　卵かけご飯が好きなの？
English: Ricardo, do you like egg on rice?

Japanese: ああ　意外か？
English: Yes, is that surprising?

Japanese:
ううん　イリアみたいに
肉が好きかなって　思ってた
English:
Not at all. I just thought that you’d enjoy meat,
the same way Illia does.

Japanese:
肉も悪くないが　こういったものの方が
材料も少なく　手早く食べられるからな
そういう意味では　俺の嗜好に合っている
無論　味もな
English: Naturally the flavor as well.

Japanese:
特にひとくちめは　なにもかけず食し
残りは味をつけて食べるのが良い
ただし　調味料の入れすぎには注意が必要だ
English:
For the first bite, you’ll want to eat it without adding 
anything. For the rest, you add seasonings and eat it 
that way. But be careful not to season it too much.

Japanese:
入れすぎると　タマゴ本来のうまみが
かき消されてしまうからな
English:
Because if you season it too much, the savoriness of
the egg will be erased.

Japanese:
そして　ご飯は炊きたてでないとダメだ
タマゴを入れたとき　半熟状態にならない
English:
And the rice has to be freshly cooked. Otherwise, when
you add the egg, it won’t get that half-cooked texture.

Japanese:
卵かけご飯　ひとつとっても
色々なこだわりがあるんだね
よくわかったよ
English:
I see now that egg on rice is one example of how you 
can be very picky about something.

Japanese:
…すまない
少し　しゃべりすぎたようだな
English: ...I’m sorry, I think I spoke too much.

Japanese:
ううん
話してくれてありがとう
料理するときの参考にするよ
English:
No, no, I’m glad you talked to me about it. I’ll keep it as
a reference for when I’m cooking.

Japanese:
でも　珍しいね
リカルドさんが　そんなにアツくなるなんて
English:
But it’s rare to see you get
this excited about something.

Japanese:
今日のメシが美味しかったからだろう
この卵かけご飯に感謝だな
English:
It must be because today’s meal was so delicious.
I’m thankful for this egg on rice.

Japanese: 繊細な味
English: Delicate Flavor

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
うまい…
五臓六腑に染み渡る
すまないが　おかわりをもらえるか？
English:
So good... I can feel it seeping through my whole body.
Sorry, but can you give me another serving?

Japanese: はい
English: Sure.

Japanese: 悪いな
English: Thanks.

Japanese:
ねぇ　リカルドさん
もしかして　味噌汁が好きなの？
English: Do you like miso soup, Ricardo?

Japanese: …わかるか？
English: ...You can tell?

Japanese: ３杯もおかわりすればね
English: Well, you did just ask me for your third refill just now.

Japanese:
今日の味噌汁は　また一段とうまいからな
お前には　センスがある
English:
Today’s miso soup is even better than usual, you see.
You really have a knack for cooking miso soup.

Japanese: え？　そうかな…？
English: Huh? You think so...?

Japanese:
ああ　ダシの取り方が良い
こんな繊細な味には　滅多に出会えん
English:
Yes, you have a particular take on dashi. I rarely come 
across such a delicate flavor.

Japanese: そこまで褒められると　照れるよ…
English: Please, you’re making me embarrassed...

Japanese:
なに　本当のことだ
照れる必要はない
また気が向いたら　作ってくれ
English:
Embarrassed? But it’s just the truth. No need to feel 
that way. Please make it again sometime, whenever 
you feel like making it.

Japanese: キノコ食べ放題？
English: All-You-Can-Eat Mushrooms?

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
おー　今日はキノコかー
いい匂いなんだな　しかし
English:
Oh～ So we’re having mushrooms today～
What a nice smell though.

Japanese:
待て　それはまだ焼けていない
こっちにしろ
English: Wait, that’s not cooked yet. Have this one.

Japanese:
ウマいな　しかし！
リカルドが焼くキノコはウマいなー
おなかも痛くならないし　すごいなー
English:
Yummy though! The mushrooms you cook are yummy!
My tummy doesn’t even hurt, amazing!

Japanese: ……食用と毒キノコの見分けはつくか？
English:
...Are you able to distinguish between 
edible and poisonous mushrooms?

Japanese:
少しならわかる
しかし　わからないものは食べてみるんだな
English: I only know a little. Though I try the ones I don’t know.

Japanese:
それでは　いつか命を落としかねんぞ
わからないものがあれば　俺に聞け
多少なら　知識はある
English:
If you do that, it might cost you your life one day.
Ask me if you find some you’re not sure about. 
I know a little about mushrooms.

Japanese:
ということは　リカルドと一緒なら
いつでもキノコ食べ放題か！
English:
So you’re saying, as long as I’m with you I can have
All-You-Can-Eat mushrooms!

Japanese: ……そういう意味ではないが　まぁいいだろう
English: ...That’s not what I meant, but whatever.

Japanese: 一番大きいのはどれ？
English: Which One Is Best?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
あれ？　ルカ兄ちゃん
今日のご飯って　もしかしてハンバーグなん？
English: Hm? Ruca Bro, are we havin’ Hamburgers tonight?

Japanese: うん　そうだよ
English: Yes, we are.

Japanese:
うわぁ…！
ウチ　ハンバーグめっちゃ好きやねん！
English: Yay...! Ah really love Hamburgers!

Japanese: 一番大きいのはどれや…？　どれや…？
English: Which one’s the biggest...? Which one is it...?

Japanese:
そんなに興奮しなくても…
みんな　どれも同じくらいだよ
English:
You don’t need to be that excited... They’re all 
the same.

Japanese:
ちゃうねん
おんなじように見えてもな
ほんのちょっと違うねん
English:
That’s not it. Even if they look almost the same, they’re
always a li’l different.

Japanese:
そ　そうなんだ…
ははは…
English: R-Right, okay... Hahahah...

Japanese:
ウチ　これにするわ！
いただきまーす！
English: Ah’ll have this one! Thanks fer the food!

Japanese: おかわりもあるし　たくさん食べてね
English: There’s more if you want, so don’t hold back.

Japanese: もぐもぐ…………
English: Nomnomnom...

Japanese: うまっ！！
English: So tasty!!

Japanese: ルカ兄ちゃん　これ激ウマやん！
English: Ruca Bro, this is suuuper tasty!

Japanese:
さすがや…　さすがやで　ホンマ
ルカ兄ちゃん　いいお嫁さんになれるで
ウチが保障したってもええ！
English:
As Ah thought... Fer real, it’s jus’ what Ah thought! 
Ye’ll make a good bride sumday, Ruca Bro! Ya 
have mah word!

Japanese:
あはははは…
ありがとう　エル
English: Hahaha... Thank you, Hermie.

Japanese: 嫌いなものはないの？
English: There’s Nothing You Dislike?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
ごちそうさま
今日の飯もうまかったなぁ
ルカ兄ちゃん　また作ってくれへん？
English:
Thanks fer this delicious meal. It was awfully tasty!
Can ya cook this fer me again, Ruca Bro?

Japanese: うん　いいよ
English: Of course.

Japanese: ところでエル　いつも残さず食べてるけど
English: By the way, Hermie, you always finish all your food.

Japanese: 嫌いなものってないの？
English: Is there nothing you dislike?

Japanese:
ないなぁ
食べられるもんは　なんでもおいしいで
English: Ah don’ think so. Anything that’s edible is tasty.

Japanese: えらいなぁ　僕もそうなりたいよ
English: So admirable. I want to be like that too.

Japanese:
ちゃうねん　ルカ兄ちゃん
ウチかて嫌いなものの
ひとつやふたつ　あったで？
English:
That’s not what Ah meant Ruca Bro. Even Ah 
probably had one or two things Ah dislike, hear?

Japanese:
せやけど　そんな贅沢
言ってられへん状況やったし
English: But Ah don’t have the luxury to say so.

Japanese:
そういえば　その日の食べ物にも
困ってたんだよね…
English:
Now that you mention it, it must have been difficult 
to have enough food back then...

Japanese:
どんな食べ物かて
感謝して食べないと　バチがあたる
English:
If yer not thankful fer eatin’ the food available t’ya, 
ya gotta pay fer it sumday.

Japanese:
こうして毎日　ご飯が食べられるのは
とても幸せなことなんだね
English:
To be able to eat food like this every day 
sure is a blessing.

Japanese:
せや　ルカ兄ちゃんも
好き嫌いせんとしっかり食べ
English:
That’s right, Ruca Bro. Make sure ta eat up everything.
No matter what, even if ya like or dislike it.

Japanese: う…　努力してみる
English: Yes... I’ll do my best.

Japanese: セルフやきとり
English: Self-Service Yakitori

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: みんな　できたよ
English: Everyone, it is done.

Japanese:
おっ　今日はコンウェイが作ったのか
んじゃ　いただくぜ
English:
Ooh, looks like we’ll be having Kongwei’s cooking 
today. Alright, guys, let’s dig in...

Japanese: って…なんだこりゃ
English: ...Is what I’d like to say, but what the hell is this?

Japanese: 失礼だね　やきとりだよ
English: How rude. It is Yakitori.

Japanese: いや　それは見ればわかるんだけどよ…
English: Well, duh, I can see that, but...

Japanese:
なんで　肉が生なのよ？
このまま食えってんじゃないわよね？
English:
Why is the meat still raw? You’re not telling us to eat
it like this, are you?

Japanese: まさか
English: Of course not.

Japanese:
下準備はしたからね
あとは　各自で焼いてもらおうと思って
向こうに色々　用意してあるんだ
English:
I did the preliminary arrangements, so for the 
remaining parts I thought each person could cook 
their own food. I prepared a few things over there.

Japanese: へー　いいじゃない　面白そう
English: Oh, isn’t that interesting♪

Japanese: 焼きに行こうぜ
English: Alright! Let’s fire it up.

Japanese:
ねぇ　聞いてもいいかな？
なんで　自分で焼く形にしたの？
English:
Hey, may I ask you why you prepared it so everyone
could cook their own food?

Japanese:
キミになら　話しても良いかな
ただし　ナイショだよ？
English:
Since it is you who is asking, I suppose I can 
enlighten you. But keep it to yourself, okay?

Japanese: うん
English: Ok.

Japanese:
みんな　それぞれ好みがあると思うし
ボクが勝手に焼くより
できたてを　おいしく食べられるからね
English:
Everyone has their personal preference, so rather
than having me cook all of it, I thought it might be 
more delicious if you all ate it fresh off the grill.

Japanese: みんなのことを考えてくれてるんだね
English: Oh, so you had everyone’s best interests in mind.

Japanese: 僕もそんな風に　気を遣えたらなぁ…
English: I’d like to be as thorough as you are one day...

Japanese:
うぎゃ！
焦がした～～～！！！！
English: Wahhh! I burnt it～!!!

Japanese:
うげっ！！
まだ生焼けだったか…
English: Eww!! It’s still raw...

Japanese:
向こうは悲惨な状況に
なってるみたいだけど　良いの？
English:
It looks like something tragic is going on over there...
Are you sure this is fine?

Japanese:
構わないよ
これも自分で焼くことの醍醐味のひとつさ
English:
I do not mind. That is also part of the charm of 
cooking it by yourself.

Japanese: ぎゃー！　アツイぞ！
English: Wahh-! So hot!

Japanese: 本当に良いのかなぁ
English: Umm... Is it really alright?

Japanese: 男のプライド
English: A Man’s Pride

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
エル　どうしたの？
さっきから　ルカくんとスパーダくんを
見ているようだけど…
English:
Hermie, what is the matter? You have been staring at 
Ruca and Spada for a while now...

Japanese: 僕の顔になにかついてる？
English: Is there something on my face?

Japanese:
……ルカ兄ちゃんのバナナのほうが
でっかいなぁ
English: ...Ruca Bro’s banana is bigger.

Japanese:
そう？
スパーダのと　そんなに変わらないと思うけど…
English:
You think so? I don’t think it’s much bigger than
Spada’s though...

Japanese:
なに　言ってンだよ
オレの方が　でかいに決まってんだろ
English: What are you saying? It’s clear that mine’s bigger!

Japanese:
そりゃないで
ほら　よく見てみぃ
ルカ兄ちゃんのほうが　少しだけでかいやろ？
English:
That ain’t true. 
Here, look closely. 
Ruca’s is a bit bigger, hear?

Japanese:
………クソッ
ルカに負けるなんて…
English: ...Damn it. To think that I would lose against Ruca...

Japanese:
あっ　スパーダ！
…………行っちゃった…
English: A-Ah, Spada--! And... he’s gone.

Japanese: ねぇ　なんでスパーダ悔しがってんの？
English: Hey, why did Spada leave?

Japanese:
一番大きなバナナを取ったと
思っていたんじゃない？
English: Is it not because Ruca has a bigger banana?

Japanese:
ウチ　ルカ兄ちゃんの
持ってるのにしておけばよかったなぁ
English: Ah should’ve taken Ruca Bro’s banana.

Japanese: こーら　人のものを欲しがらないの
English: Hermie, no wishing for other people’s things.

Japanese:
バナナならたくさんあるし
まだまだいっぱい　食べられるわ
English:
There are plenty more bananas left, so if you want, 
you can have some more.

Japanese:
せやな
ウチ　めいっぱい食ったる！！
English: That’s right. Ah’ll eat as much as Ah can!

Japanese:
ねー　アンジュ
チョコレート　足りないみたい
English: Ange, looks like we don’t have enough chocolate.

Japanese:
それなら　溶かさないとね
ルカくん　手伝ってくれる？
English:
In that case, we will just have to melt more. 
Ruca, will you help me?

Japanese: うん　いいよ
English: Yeah, of course!

Japanese: バナナひとつで大騒ぎとはな
English: All this uproar, because of one banana.

Japanese: それにしても　スパーダは少し勘違いしすぎだ
English: At any rate, Spada got the wrong idea.

Japanese:
大きさだけがすべてじゃないことを
ガキに教えてやるか
English:
I suppose I should teach the kid that 
size isn’t all that matters.

Japanese: ４人でやれば
English: If It’s the Four of Us

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
カッタっ！　なにこれ！
このニンジン　カタすぎだって…ばッ…！？
English:
So hard! What is this?! 
This carrot is way too hard... ugh...!?
Ahh...! OWWWW～!

Japanese:
今　えらい声聞こえたんやけど
イリア姉ちゃん　どうしたん？
English: Ah jus’ heard a scream. Ya a’ight, Sis Illia?

Japanese: エル～…
English: Hermie～...

Japanese:
あー…　指切ってもうたんやな
イリア姉ちゃんは　そこで休んどき
あとは　ウチが切っとくで
English:
Ohh... Ya cut your finger. Ya go rest over there, Sis, 
an’ Ah’ll take over from here.

Japanese:
ん？
なんやこのキャベツ　エライ　カッタイなぁ…
English: Hm? What’s this cabbage’s deal. It’s so hard...

Japanese: トリャ！！
English: Ugh!!
...Nnngg!!!

Japanese:
ア…アカン…
イリア姉ちゃん…　ウチ　もうダメや…
English: Ah... Ah can’t... Illia... Ah’m already at my limit...

Japanese:
最期に…　最期に…
ごっつうまい肉　食いたかった…
ガクッ！！
English:
In the end... Just one last time... Ah really wanted ta
eat real tasty meat...

Japanese: 指切っただけで　大げさ過ぎだって
English: This is a bit of an overreaction.

Japanese: それにしても　今日の野菜　カタすぎるわ…
English: Even so, today’s vegetables are just too hard.

Japanese:
ふたりともダメ
ここは　キュキュに任せる！
English: Both no good. Now leave to QQ!

Japanese: ねぇ　なんだか焦げ臭いけど…
English: It smells a bit burnt here...

Japanese: えーっと…なにがあったのかな？
English: Uhm... Did something happen?

Japanese: そう　そんなことがあったの
English: Oh I see...

Japanese:
野菜炒めは
焦げたところを取れば　まだ大丈夫そうね
English:
If you take out the burnt parts of the vegetable 
stir-fry, it should still be fine to eat.

Japanese:
ほら　いつまでも休んでいないで
続きをしましょう
English:
Now, now, how long are you planning on resting? 
Let us continue.

Japanese:
イリア　みんなに指示を出して
あなたが作り始めたのだから…ね？
English:
Since you are the one in charge today, how about you 
give directions to everyone, Illia?

Japanese:
はーい
じゃあ　みんな始めるわよー
English: Yes～! Aight, let’s start everyone!

Japanese: ヘルシー？
English: Healthy?

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ご馳走様
おいしかったわね
English: Thank you for this delicious meal. It was sublime.

Japanese: ホント　サバみそ絶品！
English: Really, Miso Mackerel is a piece of art!

Japanese: けど　あたしは　やっぱり肉が食べたいなぁ
English: But still, I really wanted to eat meat.

Japanese:
肉ばかりは　体に悪いわ
たまには魚や野菜も食べないとね
English:
Eating only meat is bad for your health. You have to
eat vegetables and fish from time to time.

Japanese:
わかってはいるんだけどねぇ
でも　やっぱ肉はやめられないのよ
English:
I know, I know, but I really can’t stop
eating meat.

Japanese: 同感ね
English: I can emphatize with that.

Japanese:
私も　甘いものを
目の前にしてしまうと　やめられずに
ついつい食べすぎてしまうことがあるもの
English:
If I happen to get my hands on anything sweet, I find 
myself unable to stop and end up overeating.

Japanese:
アンジュは　甘いものだけじゃないでしょ
何回おかわりしたのよ？
English:
You don’t just do that with sweet things though.
You helped yourself to several servings today, right?

Japanese: 秘密
English: That’s a secret.

Japanese: 魚だもの　ヘルシーだから大丈夫
English: It is okay since fish is healthy.

Japanese: でも　食べ過ぎたらダメなんじゃない？
English: But isn’t it bad to eat too much?

Japanese: 痛いところつくなぁ
English: ...And you just touched upon my insecurity.

Japanese: 自制は？
English: What about self-control?

Japanese: 今のところ予定なしね♪
English: For now I have no intention of developing that ♪

Japanese: ダメじゃん！
English: That ain’t good!

Japanese: タマネギにご注意
English: Beware of Onions

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
クソッ…
タマネギが目にしみやがる……
English: Damn it... This onion’s making my eyes tear up...

Japanese:
だらしないな
それくらい　我慢しろ
English: Weak. You should be able to endure that much.

Japanese: あぁ？
English: Huh?

Japanese: グスッ…
English: Sniff...

Japanese:
じゃあ　おっさんがやってみろよ
今日のたまねぎは　また一段とキツイぜ
English:
Then, how about you try it old man?
Today’s onions are on a whole ’nother level.

Japanese: ふむ…
English: Hmph...

Japanese:
ふっ…
これくらい　どうということはない
English: Phew... That should do it. See? No big deal at all.

Japanese:
ンだよ　つまんねぇ
グスッ…
English: Man, you’re no fun. Sniff...

Japanese:
スパーダ　今日のご飯なにか？
キュキュ　おなか減た！
English: Spada, what is today food? QQ hungry!

Japanese:
……なぜ　スパーダだけ涙目か？
まさか……
English: ...Why only Spada crying? Could it be...

Japanese: リカルドさん
English: Mr. Ricardo--

Japanese: ………これは…
English: ......This is!

Japanese:
キュキュ　ふたりの邪魔をしちゃいけない
ボクたちは　向こうへ行こう
English:
QQ, I believe it is best if we not disturb them. 
Let us move over there.

Japanese:
わかた
キュキュ　ご飯　ゆくり待ってる
English: Okay, QQ wait patiently for food!

Japanese:
待てっ！
なにか誤解しているぞ！
English: Wait! This is a misunderstanding! We’re just--

Japanese: くっ…
English: Sigh...

Japanese:
なんだかよくわかんねぇけど
さっさと作っちまうか
English:
I have no idea what’s going on, but we 
should hurry up and finish the food.

Japanese: こうなったら　実力行使だ
English: If that’s how it’s gonna be, I’ll have to resort to force.

Japanese: おっさん　手伝ってくれ
English: Hey, old man, help me out here...

Japanese: って　おっさん？
English: Old man?

Japanese: 手伝わねぇのかよ！
English: Wait, you’re not helping!?

Japanese:
スパーダ　元気出す
キュキュ　応援してる
English: Spada seems more lively now. QQ support.

Japanese: だから　なんの話だよ！
English: What the heck!?

English: Pudding à la Mode

Japanese:
う…うん…
そうだと思うけど…
English: Y-Yes... That’s what I’d like to say, but...

Japanese: もしかして　これプリンアラモード違うか？
English: Maybe this is not Pudding a la Mode?

いいえ
合っているわ
…サイズ以外はね
English: No, it is... Except for the size.

Japanese: 小さかたか？
English: Too small?

違ぇよ

English: No, the other way round. It’s way too huge!

Japanese:
なにをどうしたら
こんな　すごいのができるん？
ウチ　キュキュ姉ちゃんのこと　尊敬するわ
English:
What in the world didja do fer it ta turn out this large?
Ah really respect ya, Sis QQ.

Japanese:
本当
どうやって　スライスしたバナナを

Really, how did you manage to pile up sliced bananas

Japanese:
その上においてあるプリンも

English:
And how did you manage to balance
the pudding on of of that?

Japanese:
プリンアラモード　これじゃなかたか？
キュキュ　見たの　これ
English: Was this not Pudding a la Mode? QQ saw this.

Japanese:
どこで　そんなの見たの？
あたし　こんなの初めてよ
English:
Where did you see this? It’s the first time I’ve ever
seen anything like this.

Japanese: キュキュの国
English: In QQ country.

Japanese:
じゃあ　これはキュキュさんの国の
盛り付け方なんだ
English:
So maybe this is how you arrange food in 
QQ’s country.

Japanese:
なるほど
国が違えば　文化もまた違うからな
English: A different country means a different culture, I suppose.

Japanese:
いつまでしゃべってる気だ
コーダは早く食べたいんだな　しかし
English:
How long do you plan on chattering? Coda wants to
eat quickly though.

Japanese:
だな
そろそろ　食おうぜ
English: Right, let’s just eat.

崩すのが勿体無くて…
English: No. It is just such a waste to destroy this...

Japanese: っていうか　これ崩せんの？
English: Can you even break this?

Japanese:
１箇所　崩したら
間違いなく全部崩れるだろうな
English:
If you break it in one spot, the rest will inevitably come
down too.

Japanese: それ大惨事じゃねェ？

Japanese:
しゃべっていても仕方ないし
崩さないように食べるしかないんじゃない？
English:
We can keep talking about it, but we shall just have 
to eat it without breaking it?

Japanese: せやな
English: That’s right!

Japanese: ほな　行くで！
English: Here Ah go!

Japanese: エ　エル！！

あかん！

Japanese:

アツアツやから　気ぃつけて食べてな
English:
Okonomiyaki’s done! It’s real hot so be careful not 
ta burn yerselves!

Japanese:
いい香りだね
食欲をそそられるよ
English: It smells delightful! It truly makes the mouth water.

Japanese: ああ　このソースの香り　たまらねェ
English: Mmmm... I can’t get enough of this sauce!

Japanese: 早く　早く食べるんだな　しかし！
English: Hurry, hurry, let’s eat though!

Japanese: いただきます
English: Thank you for the food!

Japanese: はふはふはふ！
English: Foo, foo foofoo...

Japanese:
なにこれ！
めちゃくちゃ　おいしいんだけど
English: What is this!? How’s it so good?!♪

Japanese:
ええ　本当
こんなの初めてよ
English: Yes, indeed. I have never had one as delicious as this.

Japanese:
エル　おいしい！
キュキュ　感動！
English: Hermie, yummy! QQ is moved!

Japanese:
ありがとな
そう言われると　ウチも　作った甲斐があるわ
English: Thanks y’all! If y’all say so, it was worth makin’ it.

Japanese:
ねぇ　エル
すごく手馴れているように見えたけど
元々　お好み焼き作るのは　得意だったの？
English:
Say Hermie, you looked really at ease while making 
the food. Could it be that you’re used to making 
Okonomiyaki?

Japanese:
得意やないで
だってウチ　作るの初めてやもん
English: Nah, not at all. Ya see, it’s the first time Ah made it.

Japanese: えぇ！？
English: Really!?

Japanese:
初めて作ったというのに　この味か…
大したものだ
English:
For it to taste this good, even though you say it’s the 
first time you made it... That’s a big deal.

Japanese: とても　素人が作ったとは思えないよ
English: You would not think this was made by an amateur.

Japanese:
みんな褒めすぎやで
ムズムズするわ
English:
Y’all are praisin’ me too much. It’s startin’ ta feel a 
bit creepy.

Japanese:
なに言ってんの
本当においしいんだから　いいじゃん
これなら店開けるって
English:
It’s just soo good that we have to complement you.
You can open a restaurant with this recipe, y’know.

Japanese:
そーだ　そーだ
エルは店開け！
コーダが　毎日行くぞ！
English:
Yes! Yes! Hermie, open a shop though!
Coda’s gonna come every day!

Japanese: 案外　儲かるかもしれんな
English: It could be unexpectedly profitable.

Japanese: この味　町一番いける！
English: This taste can become number one in town!

Japanese:
ホンマ！？
それやったら　ガッポリ儲けて
子どもらに　たらふく食べさせたれるやん！
English:
Really!? If Ah do that, Ah can make some real cash.
An’ Ah’ll be able ta feed the kids to their 
heart’s content!

Japanese:
ええなぁ…
学校にも行かせれるかもしれへんし
English: An’... Ah could even let them go ta school.

Japanese:
決めたで
ウチ　この旅が終わったら
お好み焼き屋やんねん…
English:
Ah’ve decided! When this journey’s over, 
Ah’mma open mah own Okonomiyaki restaurant!

Japanese:
…その言い方　なんだか不吉だね
まるで本の登場人物みたいだよ
English:
With the way you said that, it brings to mind 
something akin to a red flag from a novel.

Japanese: どういうことや？
English: What do ya mean?

Japanese: あっ…　もしかして……
English: Oh... Could it be...

Japanese:
小説でね　よく　主人公や友人が
ささやかな夢を語るシーンが
あったりするんだけど…
English:
You know, in novels there’s often a scene where the
protagonist and his friends talk about their 
hopes and dreams...

Japanese:
そういうのって大抵
後のほうで不幸な出来事に　襲われてしまうんだ
English:
Most of the time, after they do that, something
unfortunate happens to them.

Japanese:
大げさやなぁ
そんなん本の中の話だけやろ？
English:
Y’all are exaggeratin’～ That’s jus’ sum random story
from a book, right?

Japanese: いや　そうとは限らん
English: No, it’s not limited to books.

Japanese:
前に戦場で
「この仕事が終わったら　結婚するんだ」
と言っていたヤツが居たんだが…
English:
Before, there was a guy on the battlefield who said,
“Once this job is done, I’m getting married”...

Japanese: 敵の奇襲にあってしまってな…
English:
Then he was caught in a surprise attack
by the enemy...

Japanese:
そういえば　あたしも
そういうの見たことがあるかも
English:
Now that you mention it, I might have seen something
like that too.

Japanese: ……私もあるわ
English: ...Me too.

Japanese: コーダもあるぞ　しかし
English: Coda too though.

Japanese:
そ　そらアカンな…
ウチ…　もうちょい考えてみることにするわ
English:
Th-That ain’t good... Ah...
Ah’ll think about it a little longer.

Japanese: それが賢明だね
English: That is wise.

Japanese: 生臭い
English: Smells Fishy

English: Illia

English: Spada

English: Ange

English: QQ

English: Coda

ぬふぬふ
うまい　生の魚はうまいぞ　しかし！

肉の方がおいしいけど
魚ってのも　悪くはないわねぇ
English: Meat is better, but fish ain’t so bad.

Japanese: そうか？
English: You think?

オレはどっちかって言うと
こっちの方が　さっぱりしてて好きだな

If I had to choose between the two, 
I’d say I prefer this because it’s 
more refreshing.

Japanese: キュキュ　食わんのか？
English: QQ, are you not eating?

リカルド…
生臭い…
キュキュ　苦手…
English: Ricardo... Smells fishy... QQ not like...

Japanese: 生魚がダメなのか？
English: You can’t eat raw fish?

はい
すごく臭い…
English: No. It stinks a lot...

Japanese:
これは　好みがわかれるからな
仕方あるまい
English:
I guess everybody has different tastes.
There’s nothing you can do about it.

でも　キュキュさん　残すのはいけないわ
きちんと　食べましょうね？
English:
But QQ, it is improper to waste food.

食べ物　大事
粗末にはしない

English:
Food important. I don’t take lightly.

Japanese:
それやったら　焼けばええのとちゃう？
火ぃ通したら　食えるやろ？
English:
In that case, how ’bout we jus’ fry it up?
Can ya eat it if we cook it?

Japanese: エル　いい考え
English: Hermie, good thought!

Japanese:
でも　キュキュはみんなと同じもの食べる
それ　とてもとても大事
だから　がんばる
English:
But QQ eats what everyone eats. That also very 
very important. So, try my best!

Japanese: キュキュ姉ちゃん　エライなぁ
English: Yer so admirable, Sis QQ!

Japanese: あんまムリしたら　あかんで？
English:
But make sure ya don’t 
push yerself too hard, hear?

Japanese: ありがと
English: Thank you.

Japanese: あう…　生臭い…
English: Awww... Smells fishy...

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

English: Ruca

Japanese:
ねぇ　スパーダ
今日のご飯だけど…
English: Hey Spada, about tonight’s dinner...

あっ　準備中だったんだね
僕も手伝うよ
English: Oh, are you already preparing it? I’ll go help you out.

Japanese:
マジか！
いや～～～　助かるぜ
English: For real!? You’re really sparing me a lot of trouble.

Japanese:
なかなか　進まなくてよぉ
困ってたんだよ

I wasn’t really making any progress.

Japanese:

みんなお腹すかせて　「まだかーー！」
って　言ってたよ

Oh, that’s what I thought.
Everyone’s starting to get hungry and complain.

どうも　コロッケは苦手でよ

Sorry. No matter how hard I try, croquettes really

作るのも苦手になるもんだな

As expected, when it comes to things you don’t really

Japanese: それは　仕方ないよ

それじゃあ　急いで作っちゃおう
僕はなにをしたらいい？

Japanese: そっちのジャガイモを　頼めるか？

Japanese: もちろんだよ

Japanese:
なぁ　ルカ
ありがとな
English: Hey, Ruca? Thanks, man.

Japanese:
ううん
困ったときは　お互い様だよ
English:
Don’t worry. It’s important to help each other out when 
in trouble.

English: When in Trouble, Help Each Other 2

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

English: Spada

なにか悩みごとか？

スパーダ
おすしを作ろうと思ってるんだけど
English: Spada, I’m thinking of making sushi.

Japanese: うまく魚がさばけなくてね

Japanese:
ああん？
ンだ　それくらいなら　オレに任せろ
ほら　包丁よこせ

Huh? Oh, in that case leave it to me. 
Here, hand me the kitchen knife.

Japanese: でも…
English: But...

Japanese:
なに遠慮してんだよ
ほら

Why are you hesitating? 
Just give it to me.

Japanese: うん　じゃあお願い
English: Okay, then. If you don’t mind...

Japanese:
ここを　こうして　こうだろ
これでどうだ？

So you do it like this... then this...
and there! What do you think?

Japanese: 厚さがバラバラだね…

Japanese:
ま…まぁ　でもよ
それっぽく出来てりゃいいだろ
English:
Y-Yeah, but look. As long as it tastes right

Japanese:
あはは…
まぁ　そうだね
English: Hahaha... I guess you’re right.

Japanese:
スパーダ
手伝ってくれて　ありがとう
English: Thanks for helping me out, Spada.

Japanese: なーに　困ったときはお互い様だろ？
English:
Fuhgeddaboudit. It’s important to help each 
other out when in trouble, right?

Japanese: 幸せ！
English: Happiness!

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
キュキュさん　どうしたの？
なにか嬉しいことでもあった？

Japanese:
ルカ！
キュキュ　すごく嬉しいの
English: Ruca! QQ very happy!

Japanese: ご飯　キュキュの好きなものだた！
English: This meal QQ’s favourite food!

Japanese:
ご飯…？
へぇ　キュキュさんはチャーシューメンが
好きなんだね
English: The meal...? Oh I see, you like Pork Ramen.

Japanese:
はい
とてもとても　おいしい
English: Yes. Very very yummy.

Japanese:
食べる　あたかい　ホッとする
おなかいっぱい
English: When eat, it’s warm, feeling of relief. Feel full.

Japanese: キュキュ幸せ！
English: QQ happy!

Japanese:
はははっ　よっぽど好きなんだね
また　食べられるといいね
English:
Haha! You really love it, huh? 
I hope you get to eat it again.

Japanese: はい！
English: Yes!

Japanese: これはなに？
English: What Is This?

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

これはなに？

なにって　クレープ
…………

What do you mean “what is this?”
It’s a crepe...

Japanese: ちょっと破れちゃったけど
English: It’s a little broken though...

Japanese: ちょっと　どころじゃないと思うけど？
English:
“Little” might be an understatement, 
do you not agree?

Japanese:
そうだね
ボロボロで　クリームが落ちかけてるし
English:
You’re right. They’re all in pieces and the cream is

Japanese:
お前は　まだマシだぜ
オレのなんて　持ち上げることすらできねェ
English:
Yours is still fine.
Just look at mine, I can’t even lift it up.

Japanese:
ナイフとフォークが　必要だな
…いや　フォークだけで十分か
English:
You need a knife and a fork... No, only a fork should

Japanese:
本当にこれがクレープ？
笑わせてくれるね
English:
Are these suppose to be crepes?
Do not make me laugh.

Japanese:
謎のクレープ
キュキュ　こんなの初めて見た
English:
Mystery crepes.
QQ sees this for the first time.

Japanese:
イリア姉ちゃん
もう少し落ち着いてやらな　アカンで
English: Sis Illia, ya hafta calm down or else this’ll turn bad.

Japanese: あーもう…　悪かったですよぉ
English: Oh come on... Fine, I get it, it’s my fault.

But see～ It should be fine as long as it reaches

Japanese:
ええ　あなたの言う通り
お腹に入れば同じかもしれない
English:
Yes, like you say, once it is in the stomach it will

Japanese:
でも　デザートは…ううん
料理は見た目も大事なの
English:
But for desserts... No, for food in general, the

Japanese:
あなたは　こんなクレープが出てきたら
おいしそうに見える？
English:
If a crepe like this appeared in front of you, would you

Japanese: 見えない…
English: I wouldn’t...

Japanese: 以後　気をつけるように
English: Make sure to be careful from now on.

Japanese: はーい…

Japanese: 今日の彼女　なかなか厳しいね
English: Today’s Ange is fairly strict.

Japanese: まぁ　甘いモンが絡んでるからなぁ
English: Yeah, that’s prolly cause it’s ’bout sweets.

Japanese:
彼女に怒られないよう
ボクらも気をつけないとね
English: Then I better be careful today lest I anger her.

Japanese: 似合わない姿
English: Unsuitable Appearance

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: やはり　甘いな…
English: As expected, it’s sweet...

Japanese: リカルド以外
English: Everyone else

Japanese:
なんだ？
今日はやけに無口だが　どうした？
English:
What’s up? You’re all awfully quiet today.
What happened?
...Pwahaha!!

Japanese: あはははははははっ！
English: Hahahahaha!

Japanese: エル　イリア　ダメよ　笑っちゃ
English: Hermie, Illia, you should not laugh.

Japanese:
せ　せやけど
アンジュ姉ちゃんやって　顔が笑っとるやん
あはははははは！
English:
Y-Yeah, but yer laughin’ too, Sis Ange! 
Hahahahaha!!

Japanese:
我慢なんて　できないって
だって　どう見ても…
ぷっ！　あっはっはっは！
English:
I can’t hold back. I mean, no matter how you look at it...
Pwah! Hahahahaha!

Japanese: リカルド……あっはははははは！
English: Ricardo... Hahahahaha!

Japanese:
わ…笑うなってほうがムリだろ
ははははは！
English:
I-It’s... even more difficult holding it back.
Bwahahah!

Japanese:
でも　みんなリカルドに失礼だよ
…………
English:
But everyone, that’s rude!
...

Japanese: ぷっ…！
English: Pwah...!

Japanese: あの　リカルドさん　これは……
English: To see Sir Ricardo like this...

Japanese:
………察するに
俺のこの姿が滑稽だということか
English:
...I presume that my appearance is 
what’s making you laugh?

Japanese: イリア＆エル
English: Illia & Hermie

Japanese: ぷぷっ！
English: Y-Yeah hahaha!

Japanese: …当たりか
English: I see...

Japanese:
確かに　普段　戦場にいる俺にとって
このような　女が好みそうなものを
食すというのは　かなり違和感があるだろう
English:
Surely, to see a battle hardened veteran like
