Japanese: しかし　お前たちの姿もなかなか愉快だ
English: But, I say, all of you look quite funny to me too.

Japanese:
エルマーナ
頬張るのは良いが　顔がチョコでベタベタだ
気品のかけらもないぞ
English:
Hermana, you can stuff your cheeks all you want, 
but you have chocolate all over your face.
You have not an ounce of refinement.

Japanese: うっ…
English: O-Oh...

Japanese:
イリア
もっと上品に食えんのか？
服にチョコがたれているぞ
English:
Illia, can’t you eat more elegantly? 
Your clothes are stained with chocolate.

Japanese: げッ！
English: Ugh!

Japanese:
スパーダ
腹を満たしたいのは　わかるが落ち着きが足りん
もう少し落ち着いて食え
English:
Spada, I get that you want to satisfy your appetite, but
you don’t have enough composure. Eat a bit slower.

Japanese: チ…
English: Tch...

Japanese:
キュキュ　たくさん食べたいのはわかるが
何個もフォークに刺して　食べるな
いくつか　チョコレートの中に落ちているぞ
English:
QQ, I understand that you want to eat a lot. But don’t 
go sticking several pieces of fruit on your fork. 
Look, a few fell into the chocolate.

Japanese: あう…
English: O-Ok...

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei...

Japanese:
ボクは笑ってないから
ルカくんにパス
English: I did not laugh, so Ruca is next.

Japanese:
ルカ
特に言うことはないが　皆に遅れをとっている
そのままでは　まともに食えんぞ
English:
Ruca, I don’t really have anything to say to you, but
you’re falling behind everyone. If you continue like this,
you won’t get to eat enough.

Japanese: うぅ……
English: Y-Yes, Sir...

Japanese: アンジュは少々食べす……
English: As for you, Ange, you’re eating too m--

Japanese: はい？
English: Yes?

Japanese: …いや　なにも言うまい
English: ...Nothing.

Japanese:
少しばかり大人げなかったな
すまない
English: That was a bit childish. Excuse my behaviour.

Japanese: 次は気をつけてくださいね
English: Please be more careful next time.

Japanese: 努力はしよう
English: I’ll try.

Japanese: 丸ごと一本バナナカレーを食す
English: Whole Banana Curry

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
これが丸ごと一本バナナカレーかー？
いい匂いだなー　しかし！
English:
So this is whole banana curry? It sure smells 
good though!

Japanese:
いい匂いだけど
カレーにバナナって　ホントにおいしいの？
English:
It smells good, but is it really okay to put banana 
in curry?

Japanese:
うわぁ…
匂いで　もう口ん中　辛なったわぁ
English:
Woah... Ah could feel the spice in mah mouth jus’ by
smellin’ it.

Japanese:
なンだよ　エル
辛いもの苦手か？
English: What is it, Hermie? Can’t handle spicy food?

Japanese:
いや　別に
結構イケる口やと思うで
English: Nah, Ah think Ah can handle spice purty well.

Japanese:
それよりも　ルカ兄ちゃんの方が
ヤバイんとちゃう？
English:
More importantly, wasn’t Ruca really bad with 
spicy food?

Japanese:
うぅ…　辛そうだなぁ…
食べなきゃダメだよね…　うぅ…
English:
Y-Yeah... It looks really spicy... I have to eat it though...
H-Hmmm...

Japanese:
とりあえず　食べてみない？
甘いか辛いかなんて
食べてみないとわかんないし
English:
For now, why not give it a taste?
You cannot know if it is sweet
or spicy unless you try it.

Japanese: さんせーい！
English: Agree!

Japanese: これは…
English: This is...

Japanese: ンまっ！　うまいぞ！　しかし！
English: Yum! So yummy though!

Japanese: 想像以上…
English: More than I thought...

Japanese: こんな食べ物があるなんて　さすが幻！
English:
To think that food like this exists.
It really is a fable!

Japanese: この鮮烈な辛さ…すごい後を引く
English:
This vivid spiciness... It really makes you want to 
eat more.

Japanese:
しかし　適度に熟されたバナナの甘さによって
その辛さが和らぎ
絶妙なハーモニーを奏でている…
English:
However, thanks to the moderately ripe bananas’ 
sweetness, the spiciness is softened.
They’re dancing in an exquisite harmony...

Japanese: すごい…
English: Amazing...

Japanese: こんなに食べやすいカレーは　初めてだよ
English:
It’s the first time I’m having curry that is
this easy to eat.

Japanese:
すごくすごく美味しい！
キュキュは感動した！
English: Very very yummy! QQ is moved!

Japanese:
お？　挽肉の味か　こりゃ
甘辛いだけじゃなく
口に美味しい味が　ベットリ残る感じだ
English:
Oh? Is this the taste of minced meat? It’s not just the
sweet and spicy taste, but a very beautiful flavour 
remains at the end.

Japanese:
ええ
それにバナナのフルーティーさが加わって
とても爽やか　やみつきになりそう
English:
Yes. If you add the banana’s fruitiness to that, it is 
really refreshing. It feels like I will become addicted.

Japanese: んあ～　汗が出るぞー？
English: Hm～ I’m sweating?

Japanese: しかしアツイ～
English: It’s really hot though～

Japanese:
汗が吹き出てくるぜ…
体ん中で火が点いたみてェだ
English:
Oh here comes the sweat～ It’s as if a fire was lit inside 
of my body.

Japanese:
なんだよ　エル
無口だな
English: What’s up Hermie? You’re all silent.

Japanese:
や…　止められへん！
けど…
English: St... It ain’t stoppin’! But...

Japanese:
み　水は？
ウチ　今　水のためやったら
少々の悪いコトできるで？
English:
Wh-Where’s the water? Ah-Ah feel like Ah might end
up doin’ sumthin’ bad if Ah don’ get sum water 
right now.

Japanese:
ンまい！　ンまいぞ～！！
コーダ大満足！
English: Yum! So yummy～!! Coda is completely satisfied!

Japanese:
はひぃー…！！
…なんか　身体が落ち着かへん…
English: Hiiii...!! ... Sumhow mah body ain’t calmin’ down...

Japanese: それになんか　力みなぎって来るようやで
English: An’ it’s overflowin’ with energy!!

Japanese:
ヘンな高揚作用でもあんのか？
確かに　血の気が多い
修行中の武芸者向きな食い物だぜ…
English:
Does it have some kind of weird uplifting effect?
It must be food that is suited for fiery
martial arts training.

Japanese: 秘伝野菜汁を飲み干す
English: Secret Vegetable Soup

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
ねぇ　スパーダ
そのハルトマンの秘伝野菜汁って
どんな味なの？
English:
Hey Spada, what did Hartman’s secret vegetable
soup taste like?

Japanese: 聞かないほうがいいと思うぜ？
English: I think it’s best you taste it for yourself.

Japanese: うえ～…
English: What～...

Japanese:
グズグズしてねぇで飲めよ
飲んでないの　お前だけだぞ？
English:
Just stop flapping your gums and drink up.
You’re the only one who hasn’t tried it yet.

But... look at them, they look dead.
Ruca’s crying in corner and Coda looks like he
drank Lemures Marsh water or something!

Japanese:
あんなの見たら
誰だって飲む気にならないってば
English:
Any sane person who saw that wouldn’t want
to touch nor even DRINK that damn soup!

Japanese:
ツライのは最初だけだ
あいつらも　しばらくしたら元気になるぜ
だから　お前も早く腹くくっちまえよな
English:
It’s only bitter in the beginning. Those guys will be fit 
again in no time, so you better quickly get a grip
on yourself.

Japanese:
絶対イヤ
臭いし　ドロドロしてるし
まずそうな色だもん…　ムリ！
English:
No way! It stinks and it’s thick. Even the colour looks
like crap... No hecking way I’m drinking this!

Japanese:
ホント　これのドコが７色に輝く水よ
輝いてすらいないし　泥水じゃない
English:
For real, there’s no way this is the water of 7 
sparkling colours. It’s not even sparkling. Isn’t it just 
muddy water?

Japanese: 飲まなきゃダメよ　イリア
English: You have to drink it Illia.

Japanese: エル　キュキュさん
English: Hermie, QQ.

Japanese:
ちょ　ちょっと　エルにキュキュ！
なにすんのよ！
English: H-Hermie, QQ? Wh-What are you doing?!

Japanese:
イリア姉ちゃん{fixed} 
{variable}ひとりだけ飲まへんのは　ズルいで
English: Illia, it’s unfair if yer the only one not drinkin’ it.

Japanese:
キュキュたち　がんばた
だから今度はイリアが　がんばる番
English:
QQ and everyone did their best. So now it’s Illia’s turn
to do her best.

Japanese:
な…　なに言ってんのよ！
あたしは…飲まないわ！
English: Wh-What are you saying! I-I’m not drinking it!

Japanese:
せっかく作ったものを
捨てるなんてとんでもないわ
天の恵みに感謝しないと
English:
We cannot throw it out, especially since someone took
their time to make this. You have to thank Cielo for 
this blessing.

Japanese: それを　現すには…………
English: And to express that gratitude...

Japanese: …きちんと　飲み干しましょうね？
English: ...We shall all properly finish it, right everyone?

Japanese: うきゃああ！！
English: Waaaaah!!

Japanese: 四人とも～…　後で覚えてなさいよ～…！！
English: I-I’ll remember this～!!

Japanese: ガクッ！！
English: *Collapses*

Japanese: チョコバナナ天を食す
English: A Taste of Deep Fried Chocolate Banana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese:
これが　チョコバナナ天かぁ
甘くてエエ匂いするわ
English:
So this is the Deep Fried Chocolate Banana!
It smells purty nice... an’ sweet!

Japanese:
本当
このチョコレートの香りが　食欲をそそる…
English:
Indeed. This chocolate’s aroma really stimulates
my appetite...

Japanese:
そうかぁ？
油っぽいだけじゃねぇか？
English: You kidding? This is greasy as hell!

Japanese:
それは仕方ないよ
油で揚げてるんだし
English: I mean, naturally, it’s deep fried, after all.

Japanese:
幻のレシピだ
マズイはずはないぞ　しかし
English: It’s a fabled recipe! It can’t taste bad though.

Japanese:
ねぇねぇ　しゃべってないで早く食べよ！
いっただっきまーす！
English:
Hey, just shut the hell up and eat.
Down the hatch～!

Japanese: ふえぇ～～　なんやコレ！
English: Huh～ What’s this!?

Japanese:
ん～～～　甘くってとろっとろ！
あ～～サイッコー！
English: Mmh～ It’s sweet and syrupy! Ah～ this is the best!

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: …アンジュ？
English: ...Ange?

Japanese:
おいしい…
こんなデザート　食べたことない…
English: It is delicious... I have never eaten this sort of dessert...

Japanese:
まさに　天にも昇る気持ち
いくらでも食べられる…
ううん　毎日でも食べたいくらい
English:
It is almost as if I am ascending to Cielo. I could just 
keep on eating... No, I could even eat it every day.

Japanese:
だが　アンジュ
それ以上は…………
English: But Ange, any more than that and...

Japanese:
リカルドさん
感動に水を差さないでください
毎日食べたいは　褒め言葉ですよ
English:
Sir Ricardo, please do not ruin my experience. When I 
said that I could eat this every day, I merely stated it
as praise. I have no intention of actually doing so.

Japanese:
そうか
それは失礼した
English: I see. Pardon my insolence.

Japanese: 一応　聞いておくが　その手はなんだ？
English: I’ll ask this just in case, what are you reaching for?

Japanese: おかわりです♪
English: Another serving ♪

Japanese: 止めるだけ無駄だと思うよ？
English: You think it is futile to try stopping her?

Japanese: そのようだな…
English: It seems that way...

Japanese:
なぁなぁ
最後の一個　貰ってもエエ？
English: Hey hey, can Ah have the last one?

Japanese: ダメ！
English: No!

Japanese: ダメよっ
English: No you cannot!

Japanese: ダメっ！
English: No!

Japanese: かまへんやん
English: Ah don’ care～

Japanese: もーらいっ
English: Ah’m takin’ this one.

Japanese: ああっ！
English: Ahh!

Japanese: …き・さ・ま！
English: HOW. DARE. YOU!!

Japanese: よくも最後の１個を！！
English: How dare you take last one!

Japanese:
…裏切り者め！
その血で購わせてやる！！
English:
...Infidel!
YOU SHALL PAY WITH YOUR BLOOD!

Japanese: ええ～？　うそ～ん…
English: Huh～? Come on girls...

Japanese: 三人ともキャラちゃうやん…
English: All three of ya are goin’ out of character...

Japanese: あ　逃げた！
English: Tsk, she escaped!

Japanese:
追うぞ！
地の果てまで追い詰めてくれるっ
English:
Let’s go after her! We’ll track her down to the 
end of the world!

Japanese: エル　覚悟！
English: Prepare, Hermie!

Japanese: なんだったの{fixed} {variable}あれは…
English: ...What just happened...?

Japanese:
女の戦いってなぁ…
醜いもんなんだな
English: A catfight... Ugly.

Japanese: 食べ物が絡むと余計にね
English: Especially when food is involved.

Japanese:
コーダ…
食べられなかったのが残念だぞ{fixed} {variable}しかし…
English:
Coda... Is disappointed he couldn’t 
eat more though...

Japanese:
それなら　オレの分　少しやるよ
そろそろ限界だしな
English:
You can have mine...
I lost my appetite.

Japanese: おー　スパーダ　お前　いいヤツだ！
English: Oh～ Spada, you’re a good guy!

Japanese:
俺の分も少し食べるか？
少々　飽きてきてな
English:
Take the rest of mine, too. 
I’ve gotten sick of it.

Japanese:
僕も　さっき取った分があるから
半分あげるね
English:
Me too. I still have the one I took earlier, 
so you can half of it.

Japanese:
仕方ないね
ボクの分も　少しだけだけど　はい
English:
I guess it cannot be helped. 
Have the rest of mine too, here.

Japanese:
お前ら　いいヤツだ
コーダ　嬉しいぞ　しかし！
English: All of you, you’re good guys. Coda is happy though!

Japanese: スキあり
English: Wide Open!

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: スキあり！！
English: You’re wide open!

Japanese: ああ！　僕のステーキ…！！
English: Ahh! My steak...!!

Japanese: もぐもぐもぐもぐもぐもぐもぐ…ゴックン！！
English: Nomnomnomnomnom... Gulp!!

Japanese:
ふっふーん
もう食べちゃったから　返せないわよ
English: Phew～ I won’t give it back since I finished eating it.

Japanese:
こーら　イリア　行儀が悪いわ
それに人のものを　盗ってはダメよ
English:
Illia, you cannot just steal other people’s food!
That is bad manners!

Japanese:
だって～…
今日のステーキ　もうおかわりないんだもん
キュキュとコーダが食べちゃったし
English:
Come on～... There’s no more steak! 
QQ and Coda ate it all.

Japanese:
でもイリア　キュキュより
たくさん食べた　満足じゃないか？
English:
But Illia ate more than QQ.
Are you not satisfied?

Japanese: あれだけじゃ　足りないわよ～…
English: That much wasn’t enough～...

Japanese: もう…
English: Jeez...

Japanese: ルカくん　私のステーキを半分あげるわ
English: Here, Ruca, you can have half of my steak.

Japanese: キュキュもルカにあげる
English: QQ also gives her steak to Ruca.

Japanese: あっ　ルカ　ずるい！
English: Hey, that’s unfair!

Japanese: これはルカくんの分
English: That is Ruca’s serving.

Japanese:
本当は　イリアにあげようと
思っていたのだけれど
あなたはもう十分食べたでしょう？
English:
Actually, I was thinking of giving some of mine to you 
Illia, but you have already had enough it seems.

Japanese: ルカのバカ！
English: Ruca, you idiot!
Huh～!? Why me!?

Japanese: リカルドのハンバーグ
English: Ricardo’s Hamburger

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ねぇ　この大きなものはなに…？
English: Hey, what’s this big thing?

Japanese: ハンバーグだが　嫌いか？
English: It’s a hamburger, do you not like it?

Japanese:
ううん
そうじゃなくて……
English: N-No, that’s not it...

Japanese: ルカ　ここはオレに任せろ
English: Leave this to me, Ruca.

Japanese:
おっさんよォ
これのどこが　ハンバーグなんだよ？
English:
Hey, old man, how the hell does this look like
a hamburger to you?

Japanese:
こんなでけぇハンバーグ　見たことねェ
人の顔くらいあるんじゃねぇか？
English:
I’ve never, in all my life, seen a hamburger this big.
Hell, you can fit a whole head in here.

Japanese:
ハンバーグって言えば
大抵　手より小さいくらいのサイズだろ
English:
A hamburger should be, at the very least,
nearly the same size as your hand.

Japanese: うーん　全部　食べられるかなぁ
English: Hmm... I wonder if I will be able to finish all this.

Japanese: アンジュさんなら　余裕だと思うよ
English: I am sure you can, Ange.

Japanese:
こんな大きいの作って　どうするつもりなのよ？
見てるだけで　お腹いっぱいだっての
English:
What were you planning, making something this big?
I already feel full just looking at this.

Japanese: ほら　ルカもなんか言ってやんなさい！
English: Ruca, say something!

Japanese: え…えっと…
English: U-Uhh...

Japanese: おいしそうだね
English: Looks tasty.

Japanese:
違うわよ！
あんた　なに褒めてんの
English:
WRONG!
WHY ARE YOU PRAISING IT!?
Ehhhhh...

Japanese: なぁ　おっちゃん……
English: Hey, Uncle...

Japanese: エル　任せたわよ！
English: Look, leave this to Hermie.

Japanese:
ウチ　こんなでっかいハンバーグ食べんの
夢やってん　ありがとなぁ！！
English:
Am Ah really gonna eat a hamburger this big?
This is like a dream come true! Thanks, Uncle!

Japanese: 褒めてどうすんのよ！
English: WHY ARE YOU PRAISING IT!?

Japanese:
えー　せやけど　こんなにでっかいねんで？
腹いっぱい食べれるんやし　エエやん
English:
Ah mean, it’s really big ya know.
Bein’ able ta eat til yer full’s the best.

Japanese: そりゃ　そうだけど…
English: Yeah,

Japanese:
でも　こんな大きいとありがたみが
全然ないじゃない
English:
but I don’t see the merit in eating something
this big.

Japanese:
適度な大きさのが　ちょこんと
お皿の上に乗ってて　それを何個も
おかわりするのがいいのよ
English:
My point is, it’s better if you just have the right size
on your plate, coz then you can just ask for more!

Japanese:
イリア姉ちゃんの言うことも　わかるけど
食わへんなら　ウチがもらうで？
English:
Ah understand whatcha mean, Sis Illia, but if yer
not gonna eat yer food, then can Ah have it?

Japanese: なに言ってんの　食べるって
English:
What are you talking about?
I’ll eat it, of course!

Japanese: それなら問題ないやん
English: Sounds good.

Japanese: 話は終わったか？
English: Are you all done?

Japanese: 早く食べないと　冷めてまずくなる
English: You guys should eat before your food gets cold.

Japanese: 言われなくとも　わかってますよーだ
English: I know! You don’t have to tell me that.

Japanese:
ガキは黙って食っていろ
そして　食ってでかくなれ
English: You brats should just shut up, eat, then grow big.

Japanese:
あの…リカルドさん
それって　私もですか？
English: Uhhm... are you perhaps talking about me?

Japanese: アンジュに関しては…
English: As for you, Ange...

Japanese: 自己判断に任せる
English: that’s up to your interpretation.

Japanese: では　いただきますね♪
English: Very well, bon appetit～

Japanese: も…　もうダメ……
English: I... I can’t anymore...

Japanese: やっぱお腹いっぱいになるんは　幸せやなぁ
English: As Ah thought. Ah feel full... This is the life～

Japanese: 食べすぎたけど…
English: Ah might’ve eaten too much though.

Japanese:
みんなだらしないなぁ
あれくらい　平気ですよね　リカルドさん
English:
You guys are so sloppy, it was not that much,
right, Sir Ricardo?

Japanese: ああ　まったくだ
English: Yeah, exactly.

Japanese:
ところで　なぜ
あんな大きなハンバーグを　作ったんですか？
English:
Anyways, why on Terro did you make such a big
hamburger patty?

Japanese: ……気が付いたら　大きくなっていた
English:
By the time I noticed, it was already too late...
...So I doubled down.

Japanese: それって……
English: Are you...

Japanese: 作るのが下手なだけやん
English: He’s jus’ bad at makin’ ’em.

Japanese: 面目ない
English: I’m ashamed to admit it, but yes.

Japanese: チキンの丸焼きを食す
English: A Taste of Whole Roast Chicken

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
く～！
たまんねェな　この匂い！
English: Phew～! I really can’t get enough of this smell!

Japanese:
でしょー！
はぁ～　懐かしい香り…♪
English:
I know right! Oh, man～ it really reminds me of home
sweet home...♪

Japanese:
ホントだ
しかし　美味そうだな
English: That’s right! It looks yummy though.

Japanese: それじゃ　いっただっきまーす！
English: Aight, thank you for the food!

Japanese:
これは…
パリっとした香ばしい皮に
ニンニクの風味が　より一層食欲をそそる
English:
This is... The taste of garlic on the well roasted and 
crunchy skin really stimulates my appetite more than
I thought.

Japanese:
ふっくらとした　やわらかい身…
旨みが凝縮された肉汁が
日々の戦いで荒んだ心を潤すようだ
English:
The plump and soft meat... The concentrated chicken 
broth full of umami seems to soothe the heart, which 
was hardened by daily battles.
Mmh～! So delicious～!!

Japanese: さすが　ママのレシピ！
English:
Just as you’d expect from 
mom’s recipe!

Japanese:
うまい　うまいんだな
しかし　この味　久々だ
English:
Yummy, it’s so yummy! But this taste, it’s been a 
long time.

Japanese:
これがイリアのおうちの味なのね
素晴らしいわ
English: So this is what food tastes like at Illia’s. Wonderful～

Japanese: こんな美味しいチキンの丸焼きは初めてだよ
English:
It’s the first time I’ve had a whole roast chicken 
this yummy.

Japanese:
想像以上の味だ
もっと　大雑把な味だと思っていたよ
English:
The taste exceeds my expectations.
I thought the taste would be quite shady.

Japanese:
イリアは毎日　こんな美味しいもの食べてるか？
キュキュはうらやましい
English:
Illia eats yummy things like this every day? 
QQ is jealous!

Japanese: ほんまやなぁ
English: Fer real though!

Japanese:
ウチ　今日から
イリア姉ちゃん家の子になろうかなぁ
English:
How ’bout we all become Illia’s 
siblings as of today?

Japanese:
ふっふ～ん♪
どう？　いいでしょー！
English:
Hihi～♪ How is it?
It’s great, right!?

Japanese:
イリア　また作れ
コーダはたくさん食べたい
English: Illia, make it again! Coda wants to eat a lot.

Japanese: 俺からも是非　頼む
English: I agree, I’ll have it again too.

Japanese: オレもオレも
English: Me too, me too!

Japanese:
そうね
また　食べたくなったら作ろっか
English:
Aight. Let me know when you’re craving it and I’ll
make it again.

Japanese: そのときは　あんたたち手伝いなさいよね！
English:
When that time comes, I’ll have 
everyone help out though!

Japanese: 続チキンの丸焼きを食す
English: Another Taste of Whole Roast Chicken

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ２人
English: Two of them

Japanese: …なぁ　もういいだろ？
English: ...Hey, is it done yet?

Japanese: まだだ
English: Not yet.

Japanese: もう　十分じゃねぇか？
English: Hasn’t it already been there long enough?

Japanese:
スパーダ
お前は多少の我慢というものを　覚えるべきだ
English: Spada, how about you learn some patience.

Japanese: けどよ…
English: But...

Japanese:
お前の気持ちは　わからんでもない
だがしかし　今は耐えるときだ
English:
I’m not saying I don’t understand how you feel, but 
you just have to endure this for now.

Japanese: でも　ちょっとだけならいいだろ？
English: But, only a little bit should be fine, right?

Japanese:
こらー！
なに勝手に　蓋開けようとしてんのよ
English: Hey! Why are you trying to open it?!

Japanese:
そんなことしたら
全部台無しになっちゃうでしょ！
English: If you do that, it’ll all have been for nothing!

Japanese:
だってよ　美味そうな匂いしてたら
誰だって早く食いたくなるだろ？
English:
I mean, when something smells this good,
you’re bound to want to eat it, yeah?

Japanese:
そりゃそうだけど
チキンの丸焼きは　じっくり焼かないとダメよ
English:
That’s true. You have to carefully roast the whole 
chicken or it won’t be good.

Japanese:
生焼けのまま　食べたいというならば
止めはしないが　後でどうなっても知らんぞ
English:
If you say that you want to eat it half-roasted, I won’t
hold you back, but I don’t know what’ll happen after.

Japanese:
そうそう
お腹痛くなったら　どうすんのよ？
English: Oh yeah, what if you get a stomachache?

Japanese:
ちっ…　仕方ねぇ…
大人しく待つか…
English: Damn... Guess, I’ll just have to wait...

Japanese: それにしても　この匂い…
English: Still, that smell’s...

Japanese: たまんないわね…
English: I’m excited too～

Japanese: ２人
English: Spada & Ricardo

Japanese: ああ…
English: Yeah...

Japanese: チーズスープを食す
English: A Taste of Cheese Soup

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
ねぇ　イリア
あのとき　チーズスープのレシピを
聞きに行ってくれてありがとう
English:
Hey, Illia. Thanks for asking the 
cheese soup recipe earlier.

Japanese: なによ　突然
English: Why are you thanking me all of a sudden?

Japanese:
イリアが聞きに行ってくれなかったら
僕はチーズスープを食べられなかった
English:
If you hadn’t asked for the recipe, 
I wouldn’t have been able to try it.

Japanese: そう思ったら　感謝したくなって
English:
It just happened to cross my mind, 
so I wanted to thank you.

Japanese:
別にあれは
あたしも食べたかったから作っただけで…
English:
Don’t worry about that. 
I only made it because I wanted to try it too...

Japanese:
あんたのためにしたわけじゃないってば
誤解しないでよね
English: Don’t get the wrong idea, it’s not like I did it for you!

Japanese:
それに　コーダが幻のレシピだって言ってたから
聞いてきただけだし
English:
Besides, Coda kept saying it was a fabled recipe, so I
simply went and asked.

Japanese: うん　そう　そうよ　それだけ！
English:
Y-Yeah, that’s it! That’s the 
only reason!

Japanese:
う…うん…
その…ごめん…
English: O-Okay... I’m sorry... about that...

Japanese:
こーら　イリア
今の態度はよくないわ
ルカくんの感謝に　きちんと答えてあげなきゃ
English:
Come now, Illia! That attitude of yours won’t do. 
You have to reciprocate Ruca’s gratitude.

Japanese:
アンジュ…
答えるって　なにすればいいのよ？
English: Ange... And how should I?

Japanese:
それは自分で考えないとダメよ
はい
English: Well, you shall have to think of that by yourself.

Japanese: これは…？
English: This is...?

Japanese: ルカくんのお皿　からだったでしょう？
English: Ruca’s plate. It was empty, correct?

Japanese: ほら　おかわり持ってってあげて
English:
Here, bring him a
second serving.

Japanese:
えー…
それならアンジュが行けばいいじゃん…
English: Why me...? Why don’t you do it?

Japanese:
いいのかなぁ？
今　私が行ったら　ルカくん
泣きついてきちゃうかも？
English:
Are you certain? If I do it, then Ruca may
come crying to me instead～

Japanese:
わかった
あたしが行けばいいんでしょ　あたしが
English:
Aight, I’m the one who should go, right?
Fine, I’ll take care of it.

Japanese:
手間のかかる子ね
でも　たまには自分の気持ちを伝えないと
すれ違ったままになっちゃう
English:
You sure are a handful. However, from time to time 
you have to tell people how you feel, or they might
misunderstand you.

Japanese: それは　よくないものね
English: And nobody wants that.

Japanese: さて　私もおかわりしてこよう
English:
Now, then, how about I help myself to another 
serving too.

Japanese: サバみそパスタを食す
English: A Taste of Miso Mackerel Pasta

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: あー　美味かったなぁ
English: Ahh that was yummy!

Japanese:
ここまで　サバみそとパスタが
合うなんて意外だったよ
English:
To think that Miso Mackerel and pasta would come 
together so well was unexpected.

Japanese:
ああ　それに　妙に
懐かしい気持ちにさせてくれる味だった
English:
Yes, and on top of that, the taste strangely made me 
feel nostalgic.

Japanese: もう１度　食べたくなる味でもあったわね
English: It’s also a flavor that you want to taste again sometime.

Japanese:
「異国の饗宴
　彼の王が食し　愛した庶民の味
　だが　すでに失われて遠く久しい」
English:
"A dish that made a foreign king fall in love with the 
land’s local flavors. Yet it is a legend lost to time."

Japanese:
庶民の味でも　これだけおいしいんだもの
王が愛した理由もわかるわね
English:
Even ordinary local flavors can be this delicious. 
I get why the king would fall in love with them.

Japanese:
うん
あのおばさんが言ってたように
チトセがよく食べに来ていたのもわかるよ
English:
Yes, it’s just like that Grandma said. I know that
Chitose often came to eat here.

Japanese:
それにしてもこのレシピ
本当幻っぽくねぇよな
English: At any rate, this recipe isn’t really a fabled one, right?

Japanese:
アシハラの家じゃ
当たり前に食べられてるらしいしよ
English: I heard it’s a common recipe in Ashiharan households.

Japanese:
そんなのなんだって　いいじゃない
おいしいんだし
English: Who cares about that! In any case, it’s yummy!

Japanese:
せやで　スパーダ兄ちゃん
細かいこと　気にしとったらハゲるで
おっちゃんみたいに
English:
That’s right Spada Bro! Y’all are gonna turn bald if ya
worried too much about the details. Like Uncle here.

Japanese: リカルド　ハゲてるのか？
English: Ricardo is bald?

Japanese: 悪いが俺は禿げてなどいない
English: Sorry to disappoint, but I’m not growing bald.

Japanese:
またまた
おっちゃんくらいの年になったら
髪が薄くなって……
English:
Yeah yeah, but if you’re as old as Uncle, yer hair 
becomes thinner--

Japanese: ええい　禿げていないと言っているだろう！
English: Are you deaf, didn’t I just say I’m not balding!

Japanese:
これ以上余計なことを言わないように
その口　ふさいでおいた方がいいな
English:
I ought to sew your lips together so you don’t say any 
further nonsense.

Japanese: アンジュ　針と糸はあるか？
English:
Ange, do you have needle
and thread?

Japanese: じょ　冗談やって！
English: A-Ah’m kiddin’!

Japanese: ふたりとも　その辺にね
English: Both of you, enough!

Japanese: わかった
English: Got it.

Japanese: はーい
English: Yes～!

Japanese: パックまんを食す
English: A Taste of the Pac-Man Bun

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
みんな　パックまんができたわ
あったかいうちに　食べましょう
English:
Everyone, I made a Pac-Man bun. Let us eat it while
it is hot.

Japanese: あっ　熱っ…！
English: H-Hot...!

Japanese: い…いただきます
English: Thank you for the food.

Japanese: ハフハフッ！
English: Hashafashasha!

Japanese: うまっ！　なにこれ！
English: Yum～!♪ What is this!?

Japanese:
うまい　うまいんだな
美味すぎるんだな　しかし
English: Yummy, so yummy. It’s too delicious though!

Japanese:
なんやねん　この美味さ
ウチ　初めてやで
English:
Whoa!? This is mighty tasty!
Ah’ve never had anythin’ like it before!

Japanese:
中に入っているクリームが　格別だ
生地もふっくら　もちもちで最高だな
English:
The cream inside is exceptional. And the dough is 
excellent, its fluffiness and chewiness is incomparable!

Japanese:
それだけじゃなく
クリームの中に入っている　砕いたアーモンドが
またいいアクセントになってやがる
English:
It’s not just that. The crushed almonds in the cream
filling add a nice accent as well.

Japanese: おかわり！
English: One more!

Japanese: あっ　あたしも！
English: M-Me too!

Japanese: キュキュも！
English: QQ too!

Japanese:
騒々しいね
もう少し静かにしてもらいたいものだよ
English:
How very noisy... You could always request another
serving in a more civilized manner.

Japanese:
あはは……
それはムリだと思うよ
English: Hahahaha... I think that’s impossible.

Japanese: 儚い願い…か
English: So my request upon deaf ears...

Japanese: まぁ　このメンバーなら仕方ないか
English:
I suppose that it is
pointless to fret about it, then.

Japanese:
ところで　このレシピ
まさか　あんなところにあるとは思わなかったね
English:
Come to think of it... This recipe... We found 
it in a rather peculiar place, did we not?

Japanese:
「円に魂を込めたものなり
　長きを経て　人から人へと受け継がれん
　探すこと　容易でなし」
English:
“A soul captured within a circle, passed down through
generations over time. For sure, this won’t be easy
to find.”

Japanese: 本当　この言葉の通りだったね
English:
I guess the legend was true...
(< . . . . . .

Japanese:
もしかすると　このレシピは
持ち主を選んでいるのかもしれないね
English:
It might even be possible that this recipe chooses
its owner.

Japanese: そうかな？
English: You think?

Japanese:
探すことが容易ではないレシピが
ボクたちの手元にあるんだ
気に入られたと思ってもいいと思うよ
English:
We have in our possession a fabled recipe. 
I believe it might be permissible to believe as such.

Japanese:
ルカくん　コンウェイさん
おかわりはいります？
English: Ruca, Kongwei, do you want another one?

Japanese: あっ　うん　お願い
English: Ah- yes please.

Japanese: ボクもお願いしようかな
English: I suppose I will as well, thank you.

Japanese:
あー　アンジュ！
それあたしの！
English: A-Ange! That’s MINE!

Japanese:
イリアはまだ食べているでしょう
これは　ルカくんとコンウェイさんの
English:
Illia, you are still eating yours. 
These are Ruca and Kongwei’s.

Japanese:
ルカ　全部とは言わないわ
半分寄越しなさい！
English:
Ruca, you didn’t say you wanted a whole one.
Give me half!

Japanese: えぇぇえーーー！？
English: Eeeehー!?

Japanese: そんなに食べたいのなら　ボクのをあげるよ
English: If you are so hungry, you can have mine.

Japanese: やった！
English: Yay!

Japanese: コンウェイありがと～！
English: Thank you, Kongwei～!

Japanese: コンウェイ　いいの？
English: Are you sure it’s alright, Kongwei?

Japanese: 静かな食事の代償としては　安いものさ
English: It is a small price to pay for peace.

Japanese: それじゃあ　はい
English: Okay, you can have this.

Japanese: これは？
English: What is this?

Japanese:
僕の分を守ってくれたお礼
半分だけどね
English:
It’s your reward for having protected my meal. 
I could only give you half though.

Japanese: ありがとう
English: Thank you.

Japanese: コーダの嫌いなものは？
English: What Does Coda Hate?

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
ぬふぬふ～
うまいんだな
English: Ohohohoh～ so yummy.

Japanese:
ねぇ　コーダ
コーダは　嫌いな食べ物ってないの？
English: Hey Coda. Is there any food that you don’t like?

Japanese:
コーダはなんでも食べる
しかし　噛み切れないものは　ムリだ
English:
Coda eats anything. But things that I 
can’t bite through are no good.

Japanese: うん　それは僕もムリだよ
English: Yes, I also can’t eat those things.

Japanese: 噛み切れないって　例えばどんなもの？
English:
What do you mean by
things you can’t bite through?

Japanese: 石や鍋だな
English: Like stones or pans though.
Eh... What?

Japanese: 他には　でかい木や　口に入らないものだ
English: Other than that, trees that don’t fit in my mouth.

Japanese: そ…そう…
English: I-Is that so...

Japanese: ルカ　もういいか？
English: Ruca, are you full?

Japanese: コーダ　おかわりしたいんだな　しかし
English: Coda wants another serving though.

Japanese: あっ　うん　ありがと…
English: Oh... Right... Thanks... for asking...

Japanese: コーダって…不思議だなぁ
English: Coda... You’re “special.”

Japanese: でも　なんでも食べるって言ってたよね
English: But you did say that you’d eat anything...

Japanese: ……ま…まさかね
English: Surely not...

Japanese: コーダはなぜ太らない？
English: Why Is Coda Not Fat?

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: うまいなー　うまいなー
English: Yummy～ Yummy～

Japanese:
ねぇ　コーダ
今　ちょっといい？
English: Hey Coda, is this a good time to talk?

Japanese:
アンジュ　どうした？
なにか悩みか？
食い物のことなら　相談に乗るぞ
English:
Ange, what’s up? Are you woried about something? 
If it’s about food Coda can give you advice though.

Japanese: あたらずといえども　遠からずね
English: Not exactly, however you are not completely off.

Japanese:
今から話すことは
みんなには内緒にしておいてくれる？
English:
You have to keep what I shall be telling 
you a secret, alright?

Japanese:
任せろ
コーダ　口はカタイんだな
English:
Leave it to Coda though!
Consider Coda’s lips sealed!

Japanese: ありがとう
English: Thank you.

Japanese:
コーダは　いつもたくさんご飯を
食べているけど　どうして太らないの？
なにか太らない秘策や運動があるの？
English:
Coda, you are always eating, yet never gain any weight.
Why is this? Do you play sports or do youhave a secret 
technique to prevent you from getting fat?

Japanese:
ぬふぬふ
そんなものはないんだな
English: Ohohohoh! I have no such thing though.

Japanese: じゃあ…
English: So...

Japanese:
答えは簡単だ
動けばいいんだな
English:
The answer is simple. All you have to do is 
keep moving.

Japanese: うご……
English: Move...

Japanese:
他の方法が知りたいのか？
それなら　みんなに聞いてきてやる
English:
Do you want to know another method? In that case I
can go ask the others.

Japanese: え？　ま　待って！！
English: Eh!? W-Wait a second!

Japanese: 笑顔のオムライス
English: Smiling Omelette Rice

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

English: Kongwei

English: Coda

Japanese:
みんな　ご飯できた
いっぱい食べる
English: Everyone, food ready. Eat up!

Japanese: え？　なにこれ？
English: Huh? What’s this?

Japanese:
まぁ　かわいい
ケチャップで絵を描くなんて
English: That is cute. To think of drawing a heart on it.

Japanese:
ハート　星　太陽　花
ネコ　イヌ　クマ　うさぎ…
English: Heart, Star, Sun, Flower, Cat, Dog, Bear, Rabbit...

Japanese: ひゃあ～　全部　絵が違うで
English: All have different drawings.

Japanese: なんか　すごくね？
English: Isn’t that amazing somehow?

Japanese:
器用だな
しかも　どれもミスした形跡が
一切ないとは驚きだ
English:
You’re really skilled.
Moreover, I’m surprised to see it all look flawless.

Japanese:
これだけ用意するなんて
ずいぶん　大変だったんじゃない？
English:
To go this far to prepare food. 
Is this not an excessive amount of work?

Japanese:
そうか？
キュキュ　描くの楽しい
English: Really? QQ happy when drawing.

Japanese:
みんな　絵　見る
みんな　笑顔になる
English: Everyone look at picture, everyone happy.

Japanese: キュキュ　それ見るの好き！
English: QQ likes to see happy faces.

Japanese:
そうだね
自分が作った料理で　みんなが笑顔になると
ちょっと　嬉しいよね
English:
That’s right. It makes you happy when people are
smiling because of the food you made.

Japanese:
はい
ルカ　話わかる！
English: Yes. Ruca understands!

Japanese: うわっ！？
English: Whoa!?

Japanese:
はしゃぐのも良いけど　そろそろ食べない？
折角の料理が　冷めてしまうよ
English:
I know you are excited, but can we just eat? 
The food is going to get cold.

Japanese:
あ…　そうだね
じゃあ……
English: Oh... I see... So...

Japanese: 全員
English: Everyone

Speakers:

1 [イリア]

Japanese: いただきます
English: Thanks for the food!

Japanese:
あれ　コーダは？
コーダは？　しかし～～～！！
English: And Coda? What about Coda? Codaaaaaa!

Japanese: 見た目で楽しむ
English: Aesthetic Food

English: QQ

Japanese: いただきます
English: Thanks for the food!

Japanese: な…　なんやこのシチュー…！
English: Wh-What’s with this stew...!

Japanese: エル　なにかヘンなもの入ってたか？
English: Hermie, something weird is in your stew?

Japanese:
ちゃうで
ニンジンが…ニンジンが星の形しとる！
English: Nah but, the carrot... the carrots are shaped like stars!

Japanese: これは　どういうことや？
English: What’s the meanin’ of this?

Japanese:
まぁ　本当
素敵ね
English: Yes, it is quite lovely.

Japanese: へぇ～　なんかイイじゃん！
English: Oh～ it’s so nice!

Japanese:
それ　キュキュがやた
エル　ニンジン嫌いか？
English: QQ did that. Does Hermie hate carrots?

Japanese:
嫌いやないで
ちょおビックリしただけや
English: Ah don’ hate ’em. Ah was just a li’l surprised is all.

Japanese: あれ　これハート…？
English: Huh? Is this... a heart?

Japanese:
これは花か
どうやら　他にも形があるようだな
English:
And this is a flower. It looks like there’s other 
shapes too.

Japanese:
はい　いろんな形ある
食べるとき　楽しい
だから　キュキュ　作った
English:
Yes! Lots of shapes. Fun when you eat.
That’s why QQ made it.

Japanese:
へぇ
目で楽しませるとはやるね
English: Huh. It is very pleasant to look at.

Japanese:
実家に居るとき
こんな感じの見たことあるけどよ
これって　すげぇ難しいんだよな？
English:
I saw this kind of detail in food when I was at home,
but isn’t this a lot of work?

Japanese:
最初　大変
でも　慣れる　平気
English: At first, difficult. But used to it, gets okay.

Japanese:
努力が実を結んだ結果だな
ところで　おかわりをもらえるか？
English:
Well, all that hard work has paid off.
By the way, can I get a refill?

Japanese: コーダも欲しいんだな　しかし！
English: Coda wants one too～

Japanese:
コーダはいつものコトとして…
おっさん　今日はヤケにペース早くねェか？
English:
Coda is as devoted as usual...
Hey old man, aren’t you eating
much faster than usual?

Japanese: 何故だか　食が進んでな
English: For some reason, I keep wanting more.

Japanese:
まぁ　こんだけ　キレイなモンが
入ってたら　そうなるよな
English:
I mean, if it’s presented this beautifully,
it’s normal to want some more.

Japanese: ということで　オレもおかわり！
English: Well, I’ll have another one too!

Japanese:
それにしても
キュキュさんの技術は　すごいよね
English: At any rate, QQ’s skill is really impressive.

Japanese:
そうだね
一朝一夕で身に付くものじゃないし
English:
That is right. It is not something you master 
in a short amount of time.

Japanese: それに比べ　他の女性陣は…
English:
Compared to the 
other girls who are just...

Japanese: おかわり！
English: Another one!

Japanese: ウチも！
English: Me too!

Japanese: 私も
English: Me too!

Japanese: はい
English: Okay!

Japanese: ルカ戦闘不能
English: Unconcious Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: ちょっと！！　あんた　大丈夫！
English: H-Hey? A-Are you aight?

Japanese: う…
English: Ugh...

Japanese: いたたた…
English: Oww...

Japanese: よく命があったなー　しかし
English: Looks like he’s still alive though.

Japanese:
もう　しっかりしてよね！
これくらいでやられてちゃ
先が思いやられるってのよ
English:
Sheesh, get a hold of yourself!
If something like this takes you down, I’m worried 
about how you’ll deal with what’s still ahead!

Japanese: そーだ！　そーだ！　だらしないぞっ
English: Yeah! Get a hold of yourself! It’s uncool!

Japanese:
うん…　迷惑かけてごめん…
ちょっと手当てしてくる
English:
I’ll try. Sorry for making you worry.
Uhmm... can you please heal me?

Japanese:
んー　しかし仕方ない
コーダも　手伝ってやるぞー
English:
Hmm... Can’t be helped!
Coda will also help!

Japanese:
よ…　よかった～…
死んじゃったら　どうしようって思ってた…
English:
Th-Thank Cielo...
I-I don’t know what I’d do if you died...

Japanese: イリア戦闘不能
English: Unconcious Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: えっと……　大丈夫？
English: Uhmm... Are you alright?

Japanese: だ…大丈夫に決まってんでしょ！
English: O-OF COURSE I’m al--

Japanese:
！？
うぐぐ…　い…痛い……

大声出すからだよ
少し横になったら？
English:
That’s because you’re shouting.
Why don’t you lie down for a little while?

Japanese: うん…　そうする…
English: Aight...

Japanese: あっ　そうだ
English: Oh, I know!

Japanese: あんた　膝まくらしなさいよ
English: Hey, why don’t I lay down on your lap?

Japanese: え？　ぼ…僕が？
English: M-My lap?

Japanese:
とーぜんでしょ！
怪我人のあたしがして　どーすんのよっ
English:
Of course I’m talking about YOUR lap!
Where else am I supposed to lie down?

Japanese:
僕の足　硬いよ？
多分　気持ちよくないと思うけど…
English:
Well, my legs are quite hard, so I don’t think it’d
be comfortable...

Japanese:
つべこべ言わないのっ！
ハイ　正座してっ
English:
Blah blah blah blah blah, I don’t care,
now shut up and kneel!

Japanese: うん…
English: Okay...

Japanese:
あと　お水ちょうだい
それと　マッサージもお願いね
English:
Make sure to bring me some water later.
Oh! And give my shoulder’s a massage too.

Japanese: う…うん…
English: R-Right...

Japanese: スパーダ戦闘不能
English: Unconcious Spada

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: くそ…
English: Damn it...

Japanese: 大丈夫？　早く治療しないと…
English: Are you alright? We should get you patched--

Japanese: 触るなっ！
English: Don’t touch me!

Japanese:
ちょーっと！
その態度はないでしょ？
English: SPADA!

Japanese: あ　すまねェ…
English: Oh-- sorry...

Japanese:
う　うん…気にして…ないよ…
グスッ
English:
It’s-It’s al.. right...
*sniffle*

Japanese:
あー　ルカが泣いちゃった～！
へっへ～ん♪
ルカの泣き虫～弱虫～♪
English:
Oh! He’s crying～ Hehe～
Crybaby Ruca～♪
Wimpy sissy Ruca～♪

Japanese: うわぁああん
English: Uwaaaaah!

Japanese:
イシシシシッ！
待て待て～
English:
Heeheeheehee～!
Wait up!

Japanese: …あの　オレ　放置？
English: Uhm... what about me?

Japanese: くそ　グ…グミはどこだっ！
English: D-Dammit, where’s the apple gel?

Japanese: 違う！　ライフボトルが先か？
English: Or wait, should I take a life bottle first or...?

Japanese: ああ　もう
English: Gaaah!

Japanese: イテテテ…
English: Dammit-- ow...

Japanese: アンジュ戦闘不能
English: Unconscious Ange

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: 無事か？　アンジュ
English: Are you hurt?

Japanese: は　はい　お蔭様で…
English: N-No, thanks to you I am fine...

Japanese:
皮肉か？
とにかくすまなかったな
English:
Is that sarcasm?
Anyways, I’m sorry.

Japanese: いえ　この通り生きてはいます
English:
No, I am not being sarcastic.
As you can see, I am still alive and breathing.

Japanese:
死にさえしなければ　債務不履行にはしない
ということにいたしましょう
English:
Let us just say that as long as I am alive,
I promise I shall not default on my payment to you.

Japanese: ああ　必ず守る
English: Right. I promise I’ll protect you!

Japanese: では　これからもお願いしますね
English: Then I shall be counting on you from now on.

Japanese: リカルド戦闘不能
English: Unconcious Ricardo

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: 不覚を取ってしまった…
English: Well that was embarrassing...

Japanese:
へっ　なっさけね～なっ！
戦場なら死亡確定間違いなしだぜ
English:
What a loser!
Had that been an actual battlefield,
then you would’ve already been dead!

Japanese:
もう　スパーダ！
怪我人には優しくしてあげようよ
English:
Spada! Can you please not talk to him that way?
He’s wounded, you know!

Japanese:
ヘンだっ！
いい子ぶりやがって
English:
Hmph!
Goody-two-shoes!

Japanese:
いい子ぶってなんていないよ！
怪我人に気を遣うのは
当然のことでしょ？
English:
I-I’m not saying this because I’m one!
It’s just obvious that you have to treat the
wounded with care!

Japanese:
どーせオレは当然のことも出来ない
非常識な不良だよな～
English:
You’re just saying that I can’t do something like that,
aren’t you? Especially since I’m only an 
irrational delinquent～

Japanese: そんなこと言ってないだろっ
English: I DIDN’T SAY ANYTHING LIKE THAT!

Japanese:
やかましい！
人の頭越しに喧嘩をするなっ！
English:
SHUT UP!
Don’t fight in front of me!

Japanese: エルマーナ戦闘不能
English: Unconcious Hermana

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
いたたたた…
あー…　しくじったなぁ～
English:
Oww...
Ah dun screwed up...

Japanese: エル　大丈夫？
English: You aight, Hermie...?

Japanese:
見たらわかるやん
全然大丈夫ちゃうで？
English:
Can’tcha hear?
’Course Ah’m not a’ight.

Japanese: もう…　気をつけなさいよね
English: Sheesh... You should be careful next time.

Japanese:
そんなん言うたかて
ウチ　ついこないだまで
普通の美少女やってんで？
English:
Didn’t Ah tell ya?
Ah was jus’ a normal, purty girl til now.

Japanese: 「美」は　つけんでよろしい！
English: You didn’t have to say “beautiful!”
Really?

Japanese: ほんならウチ　何少女？
English: Then what kinda girl am Ah?

Japanese: 「変」とか「奇」とかじゃない？
English: Hmm... maybe “funny” or “strange?”

Japanese: ウチ　そないに変かなぁ…
English: Ah’m Ah really that strange...?

Japanese:
少なくとも
瀕死の重傷を負ってする内容じゃ
ないと思うけどね　この会話
English:
Dunno. What I know is that this isn’t something you
normally talk about at the brink of death.

Japanese: コンウェイ戦闘不能
English: Unconcious Kongwei

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
まさか　ボクが
みんなの足を引っ張るハメになるとは……
English:
To think that I would end up being a burden to 
you guys...

Japanese:
なに　失敗は誰にでもある
気にするな
English:
Look, everyone makes a mistake every once in a while.
Don’t worry about it.

Japanese:
今日は優しいんだね
どういう風の吹き回し？
English:
You are unexpectedly kind today.
Did something happen?

Japanese:
落ち込まれては　まわりに悪影響が出るからな
チームの生存率を下げられては　困る
English:
Don’t get me wrong, I’m only doing this because it’ll
be troublesome if the team’s morale falls because
of your sulking.

Japanese: なるほどね
English: I see...

Japanese: でも安心して　次はこうはいかない
English: Do not fret, I shall not allow this to happen again.

Japanese:
ほぅ　意気込み十分だな
なら期待させてもらおう
English:
There we go, looks like you’ve perked up a bit!
Don’t disappoint me, alright?

Japanese:
ただ　前衛組が
ボクを守ってくれたらの話だけどね
詠唱中に来られたら　ひとたまりもないよ
English:
Well, that all depends on the front liners.
If the enemy manages to get to me while 
I am chanting, I will not stand a chance.

Japanese:
{fixed}…………… 
{variable}一度　戦術を見直すべきか
English: ...I suppose it’s about time that I review tactics again.

Japanese: キュキュ戦闘不能
English: Unconcious QQ

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese:
あう…　痛い…
あちこち　傷だらけ…
English:
Ow...
Covered in wounds... hurt...

Japanese: キュキュさん　少し見せてくれる？
English: Can you show them to me, if you do not mind?

Japanese: はい…
English: Okay...

Japanese:
…思ったほど　傷が深くないわ
これなら　大丈夫そうよ
English:
...There we go!
It was deeper than I expected,
however it should be good now.

Japanese:
そうか
アンジュ　ありがと…
English: Okay, thank you, Ange...

Japanese:
キュキュさん　どうしたの？
まだ　他に痛いところが……
English:
What is wrong?
Does it still hurt anywhere?

Japanese: 違う…
English: No...

Japanese: じゃあ……
English: What is it?

Japanese:
…アンジュ
キュキュは　とても悔しい
English: QQ really frustrated.

Japanese: あら　それは何故？
English: Oh? Why is that?

Japanese:
キュキュは倒れた
みんなの負担　増やした
みんなの命…　危険　さらした…
English: Became burden... Put everyone in danger...

Japanese:
キュキュは　みんな　大事
みんな　死なす　イヤ
だから　もっともっと強くなる
English:
QQ really loves everyone, don’t want everyone to die.
That’s why QQ will grow stronger!

Japanese:
その気持ちがあれば
あなたは今よりも　もっと強くなれるわ
その思い　忘れないで
English:
Treasure that feeling. As long as you hold it dear 
to your heart, you shall grow stronger than you 
have ever been.

Japanese:
はい…
アンジュ　ありがと！
English:
Alright!
Thank you, Ange!

Japanese: きゃあ！
English: Aah!

Japanese: もう…
English: Sheesh...

Japanese:
でも　元気になって良かったわ
ふふっ
English: Still, I am glad you are feeling better.

Japanese: 遭遇１００回達成！
English: 100 Encounters Achieved!

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
ふう…
もう随分敵と戦った気がするなぁ
English:
Phew...
It feels like we’ve been fighting 
enemies for a while now...

Japanese: そぉ？
English: Have we?

Japanese:
確か　敵と出会ったのは
今ので　１００回目を超えてるはずだよ
English:
If I recall correctly, that was our 100th enemy
we just fought.

Japanese: あんた　数えてんの？
English: You were counting?

Japanese: うん
English: Yeah.

Japanese: いちいち？
English: Every one of those?

Japanese:
う　うん…
変かな？
English: Yeah... Is it... Is it weird?

Japanese: 変だと思う
English: Yeah, it’s pretty weird.

Japanese: ってか　数えてどうすんの？
English: Why are you counting anyway?

Japanese:
えーっと　区切りのいい時に
教えてあげられるよ？
English: Hmm... I’ll tell you when it’s time, alright?

Japanese: それ聞かされて　あたしどうしたらいいの？
English: Okay, so what do I do when the time comes?

Japanese: 一緒にお祝いでも…
English: Then we’ll celebrate it together...?

Japanese:
敵と会った何回目記念パーティ～♪
うっひょ～　た～のすぃぃ～♪
English:
Oh boy～! I’m so excited!
We’re gonna have a number-of-enemies-met party～!

Japanese: …みたいなことになると思ってんの！
English: AS IF!

Japanese: ならない…かな？
English: So... no party?

Japanese: なるワケないでしょ！
English: OF COURSE NOT!

Japanese: 遭遇２５０回達成！
English: 250 Encounters Achieved!

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
あっ　さっきの敵で
戦闘が２５０回目を超えたみたいだよ
English: Oh! Looks like that was our 250th encounter just now.

Japanese:
まーじで？
超歴戦じゃん　オレたち
English:
Whoa, really?
Duuude, we’re totally veterans now, right?

Japanese:
もう～　まだ数えてるの？
どうでもいいじゃん　回数なんてさ！
English:
What the heck, you’re still counting!?
Who the hell cares!

Japanese:
お前　何言ってんだよ！
２５０回超えたっつったら　スゲェ数じゃん
English:
What are you talking about, man?
250 is like, a lot!

Japanese: ハァ…　もうどうでもいいや…
English: Ughh... whatever...

Japanese:
なんだよ　イリアのヤツ
２５０回超えたってのによ
English:
What’s up with Illia?
That was our 250th encounter though.

Japanese:
だよね
せっかくの２５０回超えなのにさ…
English: I know, right?

Japanese: 祝５００回達成！
English: Hooray! 500 Encounters Achieved

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: あっ…　今ので　もしかして…
English: Wait... Could that be... Just now...

Japanese: どうかしたの？　ルカくん
English: What is wrong, Ruca?

Japanese:
すごいよ！　さっきの戦闘で
敵との遭遇回数が　５００回目を超えたよ！
English:
This is amazing!
That enemy just now was our 500th encounter!

Japanese: ほう　それはすごいな
English: That is indeed amazing.

Japanese:
ちょ　ちょっと待って
いちいち数えていたってこと？
English: H-Hold on, you were counting every single one?

Japanese:
うん　数えてるよ
だって　なんだか気になるじゃない
English:
Hm? Yeah, of course!
Isn’t it interesting?

Japanese:
うむ　自分の戦歴はいわば年輪
多ければ多いほど幹は太く
風格が備わってくる
English:
It’s something akin to growing as a person
as you gain experience in the battlefield.

Japanese: い…いえ　そういうことじゃなくて…
English: N-No, that is not what I meant...

Japanese: でも５００回は大した量だよね
English: But 500 is quite a lot of progress, isn’t it?

Japanese:
昔　武術の修行で百人組み手を
させられたことがあったが　死ぬほど辛かった
English:
A long time ago, I once had to fight a hundred men for
martial arts training. It was extremely difficult. 
I feared for my life even.

Japanese: その５倍以上ともなると　感慨深いものがあるな
English:
Having fought that number fivefold...
It must be pretty impactful.

Japanese:
うん　何かをやり遂げたような
そんな清清しい気持ちだよ
English:
Yes! It actually feels refreshing. I feel like I’ve
accomplished something!

Japanese: ああ　まったくだ
English: I know, right!

Japanese: そう…かなぁ
English: I suppose...?

Japanese: 遭遇７５０回達成！
English: 750 Encounters Achieved!

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: あ！
English: Oh!

Japanese: どないしたん？
English: What’s up?

Japanese: 今の敵で　戦闘が７５０回目を超えたよ！
English: That enemy just now was our 750th!

Japanese: ほ～　ソラ大したもんやけど…
English: Whoa... That’s quite a big deal, but...

Japanese:
アレか？　兄ちゃん
いちいちメモでもつけてんの？
English: were ya makin’ a note of every one of ’em?

Japanese:
「きょうは　１０かい　たたかいました{fixed}」 
{variable}とかいうカンジで
English: Sumthin’ like, “today Ah fought 10 battles” an’ so forth.

Japanese:
え？
いや　頭の中で　数えているだけなんだけど？
English: Huh? No, I’ve just been counting them in my head.

Japanese: …ウチ　そっちのがスゴイ思う
English: ...Ah think that’s even more impressive.

Japanese: 祝！　遭遇１０００回達成！
English: Hooray! 1000 Encounters Achieved!

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: あ…　ねぇねぇ　コーダ聞いて！
English: Oh! Listen, Coda!

Japanese: どーした？　ルカ
English: What’s wrong, Ruca?

Japanese:
今　敵との遭遇回数が
１０００回を超えたんだ！
English: That enemy we just fought was our thousandth enemy!

Japanese:
そーか
しかし　ソレで？
English:
Ohh...
So what though?

Japanese:
すごいよね！
１０００回…　１０００回を超えたんだよ！
English:
Isn’t it amazing?! It’s a thousand!
A thousand, you know?

Japanese: 何がすごい？　しかし
English: What’s amazing though?

Japanese:
だって　１０００回って
すごい回数だよ？
English: Isn’t a thousand an amazing number?

Japanese:
コーダは年間１５００回は
食事をするから　コーダの方がすごいな
English:
Coda thinks that cooking 1500 meals in a year is
more amazing though.

Japanese: そ…　それはすごい…
English: It... It is...?

Japanese: んー　今年は年間２０００回を目指すぞー！
English: Mhm! Let’s aim for 2000 meals this year～!

Japanese:
…１０００回か
ホントにすごいのかな？
僕一人が喜んでるだけなのかも
English:
Is a thousand really amazing or not?
Am I just the only one happy about it...?

Japanese: そんなことはないと思うよ
English: Not really. Personally, I believe it is amazing.

Japanese:
傭兵や軍人ならともかく
ボクら一般人が　ここまで戦ったんだ
十分　評価されることだよ
English:
Mercenary and soldiers aside, we are all 
normal people just fighting these monsters.
It is something worth being recognized for.

Japanese:
それに　こうしてきちんと
回数を数えている　ルカ君自身もね
誇っていいと思うよ
English:
And besides, I believe you should be proud for being
able to keep counting up to this point.

Japanese: ありがとう
English: Thank you!

Japanese: コンボ初心者
English: Combo Rookie

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
やった！
コンボが１０ヒットまで　繋がったよ！
English: Yay! I managed to get in 10 hits!

Japanese:
そーね
この調子でバンバン繋げていければ
一億ヒットぐらい行くんじゃないの？
English:
Hey, reckon you’d be able to get to a million hits
if you keep your rhythm?

Japanese:
い…　いちお…く？
そんなにやったら　僕
クタクタで動けなくなっちゃうよ…
English:
A m-million?
If I did that I’d be exhausted afterwards!

Japanese:
ってか　あんたのへっぽこ剣術で
そこまで繋がるワケないでしょ
English:
Yeah, I don’t think you’d be able to do it
with your lame ass swordsmanship.

Japanese: それは…　そうだけど
English: Yeah... you’re right...

Japanese: でも１０ヒットいったんだし
English: But I did manage to do 10 hits!

Japanese: きっと　もっとできるはずだよ
English: I’m sure I’ll be able to do more!

Japanese:
まっ　どこまでいけるか
試してみるのもいいんじゃない？
English: Yeah, I guess you can test your limits!

Japanese: コンボ茶帯
English: Combo Amateur

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
よっし！
コンボが３０ヒットいったよ！
English: Yes! I managed to get 30 hits in!

Japanese: まあまあじゃん？
English: Oooh, not bad!

Japanese:
おいおい
この程度で満足してちゃ　まだまだだな
English: Dunno man, looks like you still have a long way to go.

Japanese:
そうかな
出来る限りのことをしたんだけど…
English:
Do you really think so?
I think I’ve done the most I can.

Japanese:
出来る限り…か
でもよォ　いずれもっと技を覚えるはずだ
English:
Your limits, huh?
But y’know, you might learn more skills later on.

Japanese:
そうね
もっと手数の多い技を会得するかもしれないし
English:
Yeah! You might end up learning skills that can
deal more hits along the way.

Japanese:
ま　そーいうこった
これからもっとコンボ数を
稼いでいこうぜ
English: Pretty much, you’ll get in way more hits from now on.

Japanese:
そうだね
僕　がんばってみるよ
English:
You’re right!
I’ll do my best!

Japanese: コンボ初段
English: Combo Senior

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
随分　コンボが繋がったね
爽快だよ！
English:
I managed to chain quite a lot of hits!
It’s kind of exhilarating!

Japanese: せやな
English: Ah know right?

Japanese: でも頑張ったら　もっと行けんちゃう？
English: But maybe ya can do more if ya try harder.

Japanese:
まさか　もうムリだよ
きっと
English: No way...
I’m sure I won’t be able to do more than this...

Japanese:
フン　諦めたならそれで終わりだ
傭兵をしていれば　色んな腕自慢に
会う機会がある
English:
Hmph. It all ends the moment you give up.
I’ve met all sorts of people during my time as
a mercenary.

Japanese:
もちろんコンボ名人もいた
そいつなら　５０ヒットなど鼻で笑うことだろう
English:
Naturally, I’ve also met numerous combo masters.
To them, 50 hits is a piece of cake.

Japanese: そりゃ　景気エエ話やな
English: That’s purty inspirin’!

Japanese:
けど　ほんならまだまだコンボは
繋がるっちゅうことやな？
English:
Basically ya mean there’s way more combos ya
can connect, right?

Japanese: ああ　間違いないだろう
English: No doubt about it.

Japanese: 奥が深いんだね
English: That’s pretty deep!

Japanese: なら　もうちょっと頑張ってみようっと
English: Then, I should try a little harder!

Japanese: コンボ師範代
English: Combo Expert

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
よぉし！
コンボ７５ヒット達成だ！
English: Yay! I managed to get in 75 hits!

Japanese:
おお～　大したもんじゃねェ？
これだけやりゃあ　充分だろう
English:
Ohh! Ain’t that hella nice?
I reckon 75 should be enough.

Japanese:
いや　まだだよ
僕　思い出したんだ…
English: No, not yet. I remembered something...

Japanese: 何をだよ？
English: Remembered what?

Japanese:
アスラが単独で
何十というコンボを重ねていたことをね
English:
Asura could deal hundreds of consecutive hits
all by himself.

Japanese:
おいおい　ありゃ人じゃねェよ
それにデュランダルっていう
名剣あってのことだぜ？
English:
That guy’s not even human! Besides, he had
Durandal with him.

Japanese:
そうだけど　僕がアスラ並に強く
剣の代わりに　みんなの協力があれば
もっと上を行けると思うんだ
English:
You’re right, but if I’m as strong as Asura and I
had everyone’s help, I believe I can do better!

Japanese:
…やれやれ
お前　コンボに取りつかれちまったようだな
English:
Sheesh, man, you’ve definitely grown
obsessed with this combo thing.

Japanese: かもね…
English: Yeah, maybe...

Japanese: でも　僕は限界を極めるよ
English: But I want to keep pushing my own limits.

Japanese: コンボの達人
English: Combo Master

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese:
やった…
とうとう１００コンボ達成だ…
English: Yes! I managed to land a hundred hit combo!

Japanese: へっ　ヤルじゃねェか
English: Damnnn that’s awesome!

Japanese:
とうとう行き着いたな
お前なら　コンボの達人を名乗るに
相応しいだろう
English:
You’ve finally done it!
You deserve to be called a 
Combo Master from now on.

Japanese:
そんなっ！
だって　まだまだ上があるよ
きっともっと上に行く人が　いくらでも…
English:
No way! I’m sure we can do even better.
There must be plenty of people who have
landed even more hits...

Japanese:
ルカくん　見上げればキリがないよ
そうだろ？
English: The sky is the limit, is that not right?

Japanese:
ああ
今が　ちょうどいいキリの部分だろう
English: Exactly. Right now we’re only at the starting line.

Japanese:
お前　ぜーたくなんだよ
１００以上のコンボを叩き出せる
ヤツなんて　そうはいねェぜ？
English:
I’m just gonna let you know now, man, there’s no
other guy out there that can do more than a
hundred hit combo.

Japanese:
そう…だね
僕は　コンボ道の壁を超えられた気がする
English:
Oh... I guess...
It just feels like I’ve overcome a wall.

Japanese: なんだか爽やかな気分だ
English: If I had to describe it, it feels invigorating.

Japanese:
その境地に辿り着けた者が
一体どれほどいようか？
お前は立派だ
English:
How many people do you think have managed to
reach the place where you’re at now?
You’re already quite splendid.

Japanese:
そーそー
マジ　すげェって
English: Yeah, you’re really really awesome!

Japanese: おめでとう
English: Congratulations!

Japanese:
うん　ありがとう！
本当に　みんなのおかげだよ！
English:
Mhm! Thanks, guys!
I only managed to get this far because of all of you!

Japanese: 全員最強を目指せ
English: All Hands Aim to be the Strongest

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: 僕たち　結構強くなったんじゃない？
English: Hey, haven’t we all grown kind of strong?

Japanese: そーね　そんな気がするかも♪
English: Yeah, it kinda feels that way too.

Japanese:
フン　俺に言わせればまだまだ
尻に卵の殻がくっついた
ヒヨッコにしか見えん
English:
Hmm... If you ask me, we still have a lot farther to go.
In my eyes, we’re nothing but newborn babes still
learning to walk.

Japanese:
え～？
ウチら　ワリと頑張ってんでぇ？
English:
Ya think so?
Ah think we’ve been workin’ really hard.

Japanese: {fixed}（なぜ　エルの口調？）
English: (Why are you using Hermie’s accent?)

Japanese:
そうだよ　僕なんて
今まで剣を握ったことすら　なかったんだ
そう考えれば　すごい成長だと思うけど
English:
I think so too. I’ve never held a sword, until around
the time I met Illia. Looking back, I think I’ve grown
a lot.

Japanese:
俺から見れば　ようやく「強さ」への
初手を打っただけに思えるな
ここで慢心しては　もう伸びない
English:
From what I see, you’ve just started taking your
first step toward strength. The way you are,
you’ll never grow if you give into pride.

Japanese: じゃあ　まだまだ強くなれるってこと？
English: So do you mean we still have some room to grow?

Japanese:
ああ　まだまだ
７倍近くはレベルが上がるはずだ
English: Yeah, I think you can still raise your level sevenfold.

Japanese: …えらく具体的な数字ね
English: That’s a pretty specific assumption...

Japanese: 最強への道のり
English: Journey Towards being the Strongest

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
う～ん
自分が強くなって行くっていうのは
気持ちがいいね
English: Hmm... Seeing yourself grow and improve feels nice.

Japanese:
だろ？
やっぱ男は強くねェとな
English: Yeah, we guys have to be strong, right?

Japanese:
そうね　私も随分タフになったと
自分で思うの
English: Indeed, I feel as if I have grown a bit tougher, myself.

Japanese:
以前は　武器をちょっと素振りしただけで
筋肉痛が二日後に
やって来たりしたものだけどね
English:
Before, my muscles would get cramped for two days
if I just held a weapon and practiced swinging it.

Japanese: 今はどうなの？
English: What about now?

Japanese:
おかげで筋肉が付いたと思う
服が少しきつかったけど　身体が
引き締まって余裕が出来たような…
English:
I believed I have gained some muscle. 
Although my clothes now feel rather tight, 
I also feel more lean and flexible.

Japanese:
その胸のパツンパツンぶりを見てると
そうは思えねェけどな
English:
Doesn’t really seem that way with those bulging
breasts of yours though.

Japanese: 胸は…不思議と痩せないのよねぇ
English: Strangely enough, my breasts have not grown smaller...

Japanese:
そして　スパーダくんは私の胸しか
見てなかったってワケね
ええ　よ～くわかりました
English:
But to think that you were staring at them, 
huh, Spada? I see now...

Japanese: そ　そんなの男なら皆見るって～の！
English: Th-That’s just natural for us men,

Japanese: なあ　ルカ？
English: right, Ruca?

Japanese: え　あ　う…　その　あの…
English: Huh? Uhh... I... Uhh...

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange
*stare*

Japanese:
ああぅ…
そ…　そんな目で見ないで…
English: P-Please don’t look at me that way...

Japanese:
なんでお前が照れンだよォ！
普通　反対だろうが
English:
What are you being embarrassed for!?
You’d normally disagree, right!?

Japanese: 最強の頂点、未だ見えず
English: Unseen Strongest Summit

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: コーダ
English: Coda

Japanese:
なあなあ　ウチなぁ
石を素手で割れるようになったで
English:
Hey look! Ah managed ta break that
stone in half with mah bare hands!

Japanese:
そーだな
エルは強くなったぞー　しかし
English: Oh! You’ve grown strong, Hermie!

Japanese:
ウチもそない思うねん
みんなも同じぐらい強いはずやから
マティウスの一人や二人　簡単やでぇ
English:
That’s what Ah think too! Ah think Ah 
can take on a Mattheus or two alone!

Japanese:
んー？
そいつシメたら　冒険が終わるのか？
English: Hm? Will the adventure end if we kill her though?

Japanese:
コーダ　まだ美味しいもの
食べ足りていないのに
English: Coda still wanted to try more food though...

Japanese:
せやな…
それやったら　もうちょい
強なるまで　鍛えてもエエかぁ
English:
That’s true, guess we’ll still
hafta train a little longer.

Japanese: まだ「強さ」を極めたとは　言われへんしな
English: Ah can’t say Ah’ve mastered mah strength yet.

Japanese:
んー　そーだ
エルはまだ強くなるぞー？
English: Oh... is Hermie still gonna grow stronger?

Japanese:
よっしゃ　ほな
もうちょい頑張ってみよかぁ
English: Yeah! Let’s try a little harder then!

Japanese: 最強の中間地点
English: Halfway towards being the Strongest

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese:
最近　戦ってると　みんながどう動くか
なんとなく　わかるんだけどさぁ…
English: I’ve been feeling more dextrous lately.

Japanese: なんや　イリア姉ちゃんもかいな
English: You too, Sis Illia?

Japanese: ふたりもか？
English: You two, too?

Japanese: 「も」ってことは　キュキュも？
English: So you too?

Japanese:
はい
アンジュはどう？
わかるか？
English:
Yes, me too.
How about you, Ange?

Japanese:
ええ
以前は　わからなかったのに　不思議よね
English:
Indeed. A while ago, my movements were far more
clumsy. It is strange...

Japanese:
ホンマやなぁ
前までは　うっかり　みんなに技を
かけてもうたりもしたしなぁ
English:
Ah know, right?
Before Ah’d jus’ accidentally end up hittin’ everybody
an’ mindlessly throw mah skills.

Japanese: それだけ　キュキュたち強くなた！
English: That’s how strong we’ve grown!

Japanese:
そうね
今でも　十分強いけど
まだまだ強くなれる気がするわ
English:
Agreed. And even as we have grown stronger,
I’m sure that more strength lies ahead.

Japanese:
めっさ強くなったら
世界征服とか　できるんとちゃうか？
English:
Reckon if we’re even more stronger,
we can conquer the world?

Japanese: あっ！　いいじゃんいいじゃん　ソレ！！
English: HAH! Great idea, Hermie!

Japanese:
ゲヒャヒャヒャヒャ！
美味しいものは　すべてこの
聖女アンジュに捧げるのだ～～～！！
English:
Gyahahahaha～!
All will offer all manner of tasty food 
towards the Saintess Ange!

Japanese:
フヒャヒャヒャヒャヒャ！
金目のモノもすべて　アンジュ様に
捧げるのだ～～！
English:
Bwahahahaha～!
Everybody will offer all manner 
of valuables towards Lady Ange!

Japanese:
イヒャヒャヒャヒャ！
この世のもの　すべてアンジュ様のもの～！
English:
Hyahahaha～!
Everything in this world is Lady Ange’s!

Japanese:
もう　三人とも
私たちが征服してどうするの
English:
Sheesh, you three!
What would you even do after you conquer the world?

Japanese: でも　１回くらいはやってみたいわよね！
English: Dunno, I just wanted to try it at least once.

Japanese: エル＆キュキュ
English: Hermie & QQ

Japanese: うんうん
English: Yeah!

Japanese: 仕方ないわね…
English: I suppose I have no choice...

Japanese:
邪心に満ちた三人には
特別なお話をしなくちゃいけないようね
English:
I shall have to prepare you wicked-hearted three
a very special sermon.

Japanese:
三人とも…
今日はじっくりと話しましょうね？
English: Now, take a seat and let us talk.

Japanese: あ…
English: Oh crap...

Japanese: あははは…
English: Hahaha...

Japanese: 冗談　冗談だから！
English: I was kidding! Yeah!

Japanese: ウチも冗談やから堪忍してぇな～～～！
English: Ah was also kiddin’, so please spare me!

Japanese:
もう…
あれで調子に乗らなければいいのになぁ
English:
Sigh...
I should not have gotten carried away back there.

Japanese: 最強集団
English: The Strongest Party

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese:
なんだろ…　僕　誰にも
負ける気がしないんだけど…
気のせいかな？
English:
Strangely enough, I feel like I won’t be able to lose to
anyone. Am I imagining it...?

Japanese:
いや　多分　気のせいじゃねェな
今のオレに斬れぬ物などない
技を極めた　とそう言い切れそうだ
English:
No, that might actually be the case. I feel like I can 
cut through anything. You could say that I’ve 
mastered my own techniques.

Japanese:
体の中から力が湧いてくるようだよ
どんな敵が来ようとも　倒せる自信がある
English:
I can feel power welling from within my body.
As I am now, I can confidently defeat any 
enemy that comes at me on my own.

Japanese:
…まったく物騒なことだ
今の俺たち八人で　王都の一個旅団に
匹敵するほどの武力を持っている
English:
Good grief, what a disturbing idea.
You do know that the eight of us collectively have the
same strength as an Imperial Army brigade, right?

Japanese: それってすごいの？
English: Are we that strong?

Japanese: 大分ね
English: Perhaps.

Japanese:
俺たちにかなう敵など
もはやほとんどいないだろう
English:
I assume that there’s no longer any foe
within this world that can defeat us.

Japanese: ならば　もうやるべきことは一つ
English: That means there’s only one thing left for us to do.

Japanese:
…そうだね
頑張ろう
English: You’re right, let’s do our best.

Japanese: ま　軽～く捻ってやるか
English: Heh, let’s end it quickly.

Japanese:
フン　以前ならその驕慢ぶりを
厳しくたしなめたろうがな…
English:
Hmph, had it been the past, I would’ve chastised
you for that arrogance of yours.

Japanese: 僕このままで…
English: As it is...

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
最近　戦闘をみんなに任せっぱなしだけど
このままで良いのかな…？
English:
I’ve just been letting everyone do the work lately.
Should I let it stay as it is...?

Japanese:
もしかして僕　みんなに迷惑を
かけていたりするのかな……
English: Maybe I’m just causing trouble for everyone...

Japanese:
もしそうなら
僕は控えておいたほうが良いよね…
English:
If that’s the case, maybe it’s best for me not to join
the battle.

Japanese: ルーカ！　なに暗い顔してんの？
English:
Ruca～ What’s up?
What’s with the long face?

Japanese: 最近さ　僕　戦っていないなって思ってね
English: Lately, I think I haven’t been getting the chance to fight.

Japanese:
なに？　それで落ち込んでんの？
あんた贅沢すぎ！
楽できるなら良いじゃない
English:
Huh? You’re feeling sad about that?
You’re too privileged!
Isn’t it better not having to do anything?

Japanese: でも　僕だけ楽するなんて…
English: But I can’t just--

Japanese: なに？　自慢？
English: What? You proud about it or something?

Japanese: ち…　違うよ…！
だったら　黙って見てなさいよね！
English: Then shut the hell up and watch!

Japanese: 本当に良いのかなぁ？
English: Should I really...?

Japanese: 楽だけど
English: It’s Peaceful, But...

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: うーん……
English: Hmm...

Japanese: どうしたの？　なにか悩みごと？
English: What’s wrong? Are you worried about something?

Japanese: なぁーんか最近　暴れ足りないのよねぇ…
English:
For some reason, I feel like I haven’t gone on a 
rampage lately.

Japanese:
そういえば　ここのところ
あまり戦ってなかったような…
English:
Come to think of it, I don’t think you’ve been
fighting much lately...

Japanese:
あー　きっとそれ　それだわ
ということでルカ
ちょっと的になってくれない？
English:
Oh! I bet that’s it! That said, why don’t you act as my 
target for a while, Ruca?

Japanese:
えぇ！？　な…なんで…そんな…
的って　僕に向かって撃つんだよね…
うぅ…
English:
Huh!? Wh-Why do I have to be a target!?
I don’t have a choice, do I...?
Sigh...

Japanese:
冗談だってば　本気にしないでよね
さすがに　そこまではやらないって
English: Nah, I’m kidding, I wouldn’t go that far.

Japanese:
ん～　ちょっと騒いだら
少しスッキリしたかも
English: But y’know... I guess I feel a bit better now.

Japanese: また暴れ足りなくなったら　ヨロシク♪
English: I’ll be counting on you next time ♪

Japanese: ……ハァ…
English: Huh...

Japanese: なまってやがる
English: Getting Rusty

Japanese: スパーダ
English: Spada

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese:
クソッ！
ここんトコ　戦ってなかったせいか
体がなまってやがるぜ…
English:
Dammit! My body’s out of shape since 
I haven’t been fighting recently.

Japanese:
なぁ　ルカ
ちょっとオレと　やり合わねェか？
English: Hey, Ruca, wanna spar for a bit?

Japanese: うん　いいよ
English: Sure.

Japanese: んじゃ　あっち行こうぜ
English: C’mon, let’s move over there.

Japanese:
うっわ
ふたりして　なにしてるかと思えば…
English: Whoa, I was wondering what those two were up to...

Japanese:
げっ　スパーダ本気じゃん
よっぽど　たまってたのねぇ…
English:
Oof, Spada’s really taking this seriously.
He must’ve had a lot bottled up.

Japanese: ルカも頑張っちゃいるけど…
English: Though it seems like Ruca’s keeping up as well...

Japanese:
あっ…バカ！
そっちに逃げたら…！！
English:
--Ahh, you idiot!
Don’t go there--!

Japanese: イテテ…
English: Oww...

Japanese: もー　スパーダ　今の危なかったよ
English: Sheesh, Spada... that was dangerous.

Japanese:
悪ぃ　久々だから　ついな…
大丈夫か？
English:
My bad, been a while since I’ve done this...
You alright?

Japanese: うん　なんとか
English: Yeah, somehow.

Japanese:
それにしても　お前
途中　いい感じだったぜ
English: Still, you were pretty good there.

Japanese:
スパーダこそ
最後の切り返しが　早くてビックリしたよ
おかげで　まともに食らっちゃったけど
English:
You too, your counterattack just now was
so fast that I didn’t see it until it hit me.

Japanese:
お前があまりにも　イイ動きするからな
オレも本気にならざるを得なかったんだ
English:
Dude, you were strong.
I couldn’t afford to hold back.

Japanese: えへへへ…
English: Hahaha...

Japanese:
なぁ　もう１戦やんねぇか？
体もあったまってきたことだしよ
English:
Hey, wanna go another round?
I’m a little warmed up now.

Japanese: うん！
English: Yeah, let’s go!

Japanese:
仲が良いのはいいけど
バテても知ーらないっと
English:
Getting along is fine and all, but you’re on
your own if you get tired.

Japanese: 運動不足
English: Insufficient Exercise

Japanese: アンジュ
English: Ange

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: ふぅ…　なんだか体が重いなぁ
English: Whew... My body feels heavy...

Japanese: もしかしてまた体重が…
English: Could it be that I...

Japanese: ううん…　そんなことは…
English: No...

Japanese:
…この頃　あまり戦っていなかったし
きっと　運動不足なだけ
English:
I have not been fighting lately, so maybe it is due to a
lack of exercise?

Japanese: これからは　もっと戦いに参加しないとダメね
English:
From now on, I should 
start fighting more.

Japanese:
俺としては　待機していてもらうほうが
ありがたいがな
English: Personally, I’d rather you be on standby.

Japanese:
護衛をする上では　そうでしょう
でも　逆の発想もあると思いませんか？
English:
That might be the case, considering you are my escort,
but have you considered another way of thinking
about this?

Japanese:
確かに　目の届くところにいたほうが
いざというとき　守りやすいというのもある
English:
Now that you mention it, it would indeed be easier to
protect and keep an eye on you when you’re nearby.

Japanese: では……
English: Then...

Japanese:
どちらにせよ
俺が依頼人を守ることには変わりない
すべてはアンジュの心のままに　だ
English:
Whichever you choose, I’ll protect you nonetheless.
In the end, you’re the one with the final say in this.

Japanese: ありがとうございます
English: Thank you.

Japanese: カンが鈍る
English: Becoming Dull

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
リカルド　あんた超怖い顔してるけど
なんかあったの？
English: What’s up, Ricardo? What’s with that scary face?

Japanese: 小さい子どもが見たら　間違いなく泣くわよ？
English:
You’re definitely gonna make a kid cry with
that expression.

Japanese: ここ最近　戦うことが少ないと思ってな
English: It just occurred to me that I haven’t been fighting lately.

Japanese:
そういえば　あんたが戦ってるところ
あんまり見てないわね
English: Now that you mention it... Yeah, kinda.

Japanese:
ああ
自己鍛錬は怠ってはいないが
たまには全力を出さないとカンが鈍る
English:
Yeah. While it’s important for me to have some
self-restraint, if I don’t let loose once in a while,
I’ll get dull.

Japanese: だったら　お願いでもしてみたら？
English: Then why don’t you try making a wish?

Japanese: 誰にだ？
English: Making a wish to who, exactly?

Japanese: 流れ星
English: A shooting star.

Japanese:
アンジュから聞いたんだけど
星が流れている間に　３回願いごとを言うと
その願いが叶うんだって
English:
I heard this from Ange, she said that when you wish
three times while there’s a shooting star, that wish
will definitely come true.

Japanese: …当分は我慢するか
English: I’ll just put up with this...

Japanese: 退屈な日々
English: Boring Days

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese: なんやこの頃　ヒマやなぁ
English: Maan, it’s been so boring lately.

Japanese:
なぁなぁ　おっちゃん
なにか面白いことあらへん？
English: Hey, Uncle, got sumthin’ interestin’ fer me ta do?

Japanese: 残念ながら　期待には応えられん
English: Unfortunately, I don’t.

Japanese: 冷たいなぁ
English: Booo...

Japanese:
せやけど　ウチ　なんでこんなにヒマなんや？
体もなまってるし…
English:
Still, Ah wonder why Ah’ve been free lately.
Ah feel mahself gettin’ rusty too...

Japanese: ここ最近　戦っていないからだろうな
English:
I’d assume it’s because you haven’t been
fighting recently.

Japanese: それや！　それそれ！　おっちゃん鋭いな！
English: Oh, that’s it! Uncle, yer sharp!

Japanese:
はー　原因がわかったら
ウチ　刺激が欲しなったわ
English:
Now that Ah know why Ah’ve been so bored lately,
Ah kinda want ta fight sumthin’...

Japanese: おっちゃん　なんかやってーな
English: Hey, Uncle, do sumthin’.

Japanese:
ムリな要望だ
これ以上　ガキのワガママには
付き合ってられん
English: No, I don’t have time to play along with you.

Japanese:
あっ　おっちゃん　逃げる気やな
逃がさへんで！
English:
Oh--! So yer runnin’ away, huh?
Ah won’t letcha!

Japanese:
今日はやたらと絡んでくるな…
仕方ない…
English: ...Sigh... so be it.

Japanese:
あ…あかん…　あれは…あかん…！
おっちゃん
English: Eeek! Th-this is bad! B-Bad!

Japanese: 鬼や…鬼やであれは……
English: U-Uncle’s a... He’s a demon!

Japanese: 平穏
English: Tranquility

Japanese: コンウェイ
English: Kongwei

Japanese: イリア
English: Illia

Japanese: リカルド
English: Ricardo

Japanese:
このところ　穏やかな日々が続いていていいね
ゆっくりと本が読める
English:
Sigh... It has been so nice with all these peaceful days 
as of late. I can simply relax and read a book.

Japanese:
そう？
あたしは　全然　穏やかじゃないけど？
English:
Peaceful, huh?
Haven’t been peaceful for me though.

Japanese:
キミはね
ボクはあまり戦っていないから
そう感じるんだと思うよ
English:
For you, that is.
I think it is my lack of participation in fights recently...

Japanese:
ってことは　あんた超楽してんじゃん
うっわ　うらやましい～
English:
So basically you have it suuper duper easy, huh?
Wow I’m so jealous～

Japanese:
先ほど　あまり戦っていないと
言っていたが　大丈夫か？
English:
You mentioned something about not fighting lately,
are you alright with that?

Japanese:
平気さ
戦いのカンは　鈍っていない
足を引っ張るようなマネはしないつもりだよ
English:
I am fine, I have not lost my fighting sense yet.
Rest assured, I have no intention of dragging you
guys down.

Japanese: なら　良いが…
English: Then that’s fine, but-

Japanese:
気になるんなら　手合わせでもする？
ボクはいつでも良いよ
English:
If you are concerned about it, you can always
challenge me. I will gladly entertain you at any time.

Japanese: 珍しく好戦的だな
English: You’re unusually belligerent today.

Japanese:
あんた　実は体動かしたくて
しょうがないんじゃない？
English:
You know, I think you’re actually looking
for some exercise, aren’t you?

Japanese:
そう言われると　そうかもしれないね
自分で言っておいてなんだけど
出番が来るまで気長に待つよ
English:
Now that you mention it, that might be the case.
Still, I will just patiently wait until it is my turn.

Japanese: えらい、立派、かわいい
English: Tough, Praiseworthy, Cute

Japanese: キュキュ
English: QQ

Japanese: ルカ
English: Ruca

Japanese: エルマーナ
English: Hermana

Japanese: えい！　やっ！　はぁ！
English: Hoo! Hah! Eat this!

Japanese: なんや　キュキュ姉ちゃん　特訓中かいな？
English: Ya doin’ sum special trainin’, Sis QQ?

Japanese:
はい
キュキュの体　なまってる

Japanese: うん…　だからそのあちらって……
English: So, where’s “over there” then...

Japanese: んあー！　なにしてるんだな！
English: What are you doing?

Japanese:
じじいの家なら　町の入口から広場に行って
そこを左に曲がったところの奥で良いんだな！
English:
If you go to the town square from the main entrance, 
just turn left and Gramp’s house 
should be at the end of the street!
